data.md: Rāma, the foremost amongst religious men, being spoken thus, said to his mother, who was greatly disturbed with sorrow, again in the following strain.

data.v: मया चैव भवत्या च कर्तव्यं वचनं पितुः । राजा भर्ता गुरुः श्रेष्ठः सर्वेषामीश्वरः प्रभुः ।।
data.es: You and I should obey father's words. He is the king, supporter, preceptor, the best (among men) and lord and master of all of us.
data.anv: मया चैव by me as well, भवत्या च by you also, पितुः father's, वचनम् words, कर्तव्यम् fit to be carried out, राजा king, भर्ता supporter husband, गुरुः guru, श्रेष्ठः best, सर्वेषाम् for all, ईश्वरः is the lord, प्रभुः master.
data.md: “Proper it is both for you and me to carry out father's words” he is your husband, and my best preceptor and the lord and master of all people.

data.v: इमानि तु महारण्ये विहृत्य नव पञ्च च । वर्षाणि परमप्रीतः स्थास्यामि वचने तव ।।
data.es: Roaming the wild forest for fourteen years I shall abide by your words with supreme pleasure.
data.anv: इमानि these, नव पञ्च च nine plus five (fourteen), वर्षाणि years, महारण्ये in the wild forest, विहृत्य having roamed, परमप्रीतः with supreme pleasure, तव your, वचने words (obeying your word), स्थास्यामि shall abide by.
data.md: With great pleasure shall I abide in your words after passing these nine and five years in the great forest.

data.v: एवमुक्ता प्रियं पुत्रं बाष्पपूर्णानना तदा । उवाच परमार्ता तु कौसल्या पुत्रवत्सला ।।
data.es: Thus addressed by Rama, the affectionate Kausalya, deeply distressed, her eyes filled with tears, said to her beloved son:
data.anv: तदा then, एवम् thus, उक्ता addressed, पुत्रवत्सला affectionate towards (her) son, कौशल्या Kausalya, परमार्ता a greatly distressed, बाष्पपूर्णानना with her face (eyes) filled with tears, प्रियम् beloved, पुत्रम् son, उवाच said.
data.md: Thus addressed, Kausalyā, bearing great affection for her son, sorely pained and having her eyes full of tears, spoke to her beloved son the following words.

data.v: आसां राम सपत्नीनां वस्तुं मध्ये न मे क्षमम् । नय मामपि काकुत्स्थ वनं वन्यं मृगीं यथा । यदि ते गमने बुद्धिः कृता पितुरपेक्षया ।।
data.es: O Rama, I am not able to live in the midst of these cowives. O descendant of Kakutstha, if you have resolved to go to the forest as per the wishes of your father take mea wild deeralong with you into the forest.
data.anv: राम O Rama, मे for me, आसाम् of these, सपत्नीनाम् of cowives, मध्ये in the midst of, वस्तुम्  to live, न क्षमम् not able, काकुत्स्थ scion of the Kakutstha race (Rama), पितुः with regard to your father, अपेक्षया with wish, गमने in going away, ते to you, बुद्धि: decision, कृता यदि if it is made, मामपि also me, वन्याम् relating to the forest (wild), मृगीं यथा like a female deer, वनम् to the forest, नय take me.
data.md: Oh Rāma, I shall not be able to live amongst these co-wives, if are you resolved to go to the forest for the discharge of your father's behest; do you take me with you, Oh Kākutstha, like to a wild hind.

data.v: तां तथा रुदतीं रामो रुदन्वचनमब्रवीत् । जीवन्त्या हि स्त्रिया भर्ता दैवतं प्रभुरेव च । भवत्या मम चैवाद्य राजा प्रभवति प्रभुः ।।
data.es: Adding his tears to his mother's who was wailing Rama said As long as a woman lives, her husband is her god and also her lord (master).
data.anv: रामः Rama, तथा that way, रुदतीम् wailing, ताम् to her, रुदन् while (himself) sobbing, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said, जीवन्त्या for a living lady, स्त्रियाः for a woman, भर्ता husband alone, दैवतम् is god, प्रभुरेव च is also lord (master).
data.md: Rāma, suppressing his feeling, spoke to his mother who was lamenting, thus, saying:, Husband is the deity and master of the wife as long as she lives; so the monarch being the lord can deal with you and me in any way he likes.

data.v: भरतश्चापि धर्मात्मा सर्वभूतप्रियंवदः । भवतीमनुवर्तेत स हि धर्मरतः सदा ।।
data.es: How will this righteous Rama, born to me through Dasaratha, who speaks pleasantly to all, and who has not experienced any sorrow before live on the grains gleaned?
data.anv: धर्मात्मा virtuous, सर्वभूतप्रियंवदः who speaks pleasantly to all beings, भरतश्चापि Bharata also, भवतीम् you, अनुवर्तेत will follow, सः he, सदा always, धर्मरतः हि is attached to righteousness.
data.md: That highly intelligent lord of men living, we should not consider ourselves as without a master. Bharata is also pious and beloved of all people in speech, he, intent on the performance of religious service, shall attend upon you always.

data.v: यथा मयि तु निष्क्रान्ते पुत्रशोकेन पार्थिवः । श्रमं नावाप्नुयात्किंचिदप्रमत्ता तथा कुरु ।।
data.es: After my departure, you must see that the king is not overpowered by grief for his son and struggles as little as possible.
data.anv: मयि me, निष्क्रान्ते having departed to the forest, पार्थिवः king, पुत्रशोकेन with grief for his son, यथा how, किञ्चित् even a little, श्रमम् effort, न अवाप्नुयात् will not obtain, तथा in that way, अप्रमत्ता with attention, कुरु do.
data.md: Do you now take care that on my retiring the monarch does not wear away by the pangs of my separation, that this terrible sorrow may not kill him. Do you look after the welfare of the old king always.

data.v: व्रतोपवासनिरता या नारी परमोत्तमा । भर्तारं नानुवर्तेत सा च पापगतिर्भवेत् ।।
data.es: A woman may be highly pious engaged in vows and fastings, but if she does not follow her husband, she will be condemned to hell.
data.anv: या नारी whichever woman, व्रतोपवासनिरता engaged in vows and fastings, परमोत्तमा highly pious, भर्तारम् husband, नानुवर्तेत does not follow, सा she, पापगतिः hell a, भवेत् will get.
data.md: The woman, who serves not her husband, being engaged in excellent religious rites and fasts, shall fare wretchedly in the life to come; and a woman gets at the excellent abode of the celestials by serving her husband.

data.v: शुश्रूषमेव कुर्वीत भर्तुः प्रियहिते रता । एष धर्मः पुरा दृष्टो लोके वेदे श्रुतः स्मृतः ।।
data.es: A wife who serves her husband and who is engaged in doing good to him is righteous. This dharma exists in this world since ancient times, declared in the Vedas and the smritis.
data.anv: भर्तुः husband's, प्रियहिते wellbeing, रता engaged, शुश्रूषामेव service alone, कुर्वीत shall do, एषः this, पुरा in ancient times, लोके in this world, दृष्टः is seen, वेदे in the Vedas, श्रुतः is heard, स्मृतः declared in Smritis, धर्मः is truth.

data.v: पूज्यास्ते मत्कृते देवि ब्राह्मणाश्चैव सुव्रताः । एवं कालं प्रतीक्षस्व ममागमनकाङ्क्षिणी ।।
प्राप्स्यसे परमं कामं मयि प्रत्यागते सति । यदि धर्मभृतां श्रेष्ठो धारयिष्यति जीवितम् ।।
data.es: If my father, who is the best among the upholders of righteousness, survives till I come back, you will have your highest desires fulfilled.
data.anv: मयि when I, प्रत्यागते सति having returned, धर्मभृताम् of protcetor of dharma, श्रेष्ठः best, जीवितम् life, धारयिष्यति यदि if  he contains, परमम् highest, कामम् desire, प्राप्स्यसे will obtain.
data.md: Engaged in discipline and fasting and devoted to the services of your husband you shall attain your best desire, on my return, if this foremost of pious men lives then.

data.v: एवमुक्ता तु रामेण बाष्पपर्याकुलेक्षणा । कौसल्या पुत्रशोकार्ता रामं वचनमब्रवीत् । गच्छ पुत्र त्वमेकाग्रो भद्रं तेऽस्तु सदा विभो ।।
data.es: To these words of Rama, Kausalya, distressed with grief for her son, replied with her eyes filled with tears:
data.anv: रामेण by Rama, एवम् in this manner, उक्ता having been said, कौशल्या Kausalya, पुत्रशोकार्ता distressed with grief for her son, बाष्पपर्याकुलेक्षणा with her eyes filled with tears, रामम् to Rama, वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Being thus accosted by Rāma, Kausalyā being distressed with the thought of separation from her son, spoke to him with tears in her eyes the following words.

data.v: तथा हि रामं वनवासनिश्चितं; समीक्ष्य देवी परमेण चेतसा । उवाच रामं शुभलक्षणं वचो; बभूव च स्वस्त्ययनाभिकाङ्क्षिणी ।।
data.es: Seeing Rama full of auspicious qualities resolved to go to the forest and having spoken to him with the fullness of her heart, Devi Kausalya now braced herself up to perform ceremonies in the interest of Rama's wellbeing.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे चतुर्विंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyfourth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: देवी Devi (Kausalya), रामम् Rama, तथा like that, वनवासनिश्चितम् determined to go to the forest, समीक्ष्य (ददर्श) seeing, परमेण चेतसा with supreme consciousness, शुभलक्षणम् with auspicious qualities (virtues), रामम् to Rama, वचः words, उवाच said, स्वस्त्ययनाभिकाङ्क्षिणी wishing to perform ceremonies for (his) wellbeing, बभूव became.
data.md: With great earnestness, the worshipful one began to eye Rāma, determined to go as an exile to the forest and spoke to his auspicious words and became desirous of performing benedictory ceremonies.

data.v: सापनीय तमायासमुपस्पृश्य जलं शुचि । चकार माता रामस्य मङ्गलानि मनस्विनी ।।
data.es: Highminded mother Kausalya, her anguish subdued, performed the sipping rite (achamana) and her self rendered pure, performed auspicious ceremonies for Rama.
data.anv: मनस्विनी highminded lady, माता mother, सा she, तम् आयासम् such anguish, अवनीय restraining, जलम् water, उपस्पृश्य having performed the sipping (achamana), शुचिः rite sure, रामस्य of Rama, मङ्गलानि auspicious ceremonies, चकार performed.
data.md: Kausalyā subduing her sorrow, and touching holy water, began to perform auspicious ceremonies for Rāma, and spoke to him saying Do you, Oh best amongst the descendants of Raghu, repair now, as I cannot dissuade you, but do you return speedily and, follow the footsteps of great ones.

data.v: स्वस्ति साध्याश्च विश्वे च मरुतश्च महर्षयः । स्वस्ति धाता विधाता च स्वस्ति पूषा भगोऽर्यमा ।।
data.es: May all gods known as Sadhyas, Visvedevatas, Maruts, great ascetics, the sustainer (Virat Purusha), the preserver of creation (lord Brahma), Sun, Bhaga, Aryama, and all other important guardians of the world headed by Indra bestow their blessings on you
data.anv: साध्याश्च devatas known as 'Sadhyas', विश्वे च viswe devatas, मरुतश्च maruts (windgod), महर्षयः the great ascetics, स्वस्ति expiatory mantras, धाता sustainer (Virat Purusha), विधाता च the preserver of creation (lord Brahma), स्वस्ति bestow blessings to you, पूषा Sun, भगः the Sun known as Bhaga, अर्यमा the Sun known as Aryama, तथा also, वासवप्रमुखाः others headed by Indra, सर्वे all, ते लोकपालाश्च guardians of the world.

data.v: ऋतवश्चैव पक्षाश्च मासाः संवत्सराः क्षपाः । दिनानि च मुहूर्ताश्च स्वस्ति कुर्वन्तु ते सदा ।।
data.es: May the six seasons, years, months, fortnights, nights, days and moments bring good to you
data.anv: ऋतवश्चैव six seasons also, पक्षाश्च two fort nights, मासाः months, संवत्सराः years, क्षपा: nights, दिनानि च days also, मुहूर्ताश्च moments (each 48 minutes), ते to you, सदा always,  स्वस्ति कुर्वन्तु may bring propitiousness to you.

data.v: स्मृतिर्धृतिश्च धर्मश्च पान्तु त्वां पुत्र सर्वतः । स्कन्दश्च भगवान्देवः सोमश्च सबृहस्पतिः ।।
data.es: O my son may Smriti, Dhriti and Dharma always guard you. May divine personages and gods, Skanda, Soma, Brihaspati, the seven rishis and Narada protect you at all times
data.anv: पुत्र O my son, स्मृतिः memory, धृतिश्च resolution(Dhriti), धर्मश्च Dharma, त्वाम् you, सर्वतः always, पातु may guard, भगवान् of divine personages, देवः god, स्कन्दश्च Skanda, सोमश्च Soma, सः that, बृहस्पतिः Brihaspati (preceptor of gods), ते to you, सप्तर्षयः seven rishis,  नारदश्च Narada, त्वाम् you, सर्वतः everywhere, रक्षन्तु protect you.

data.v: सप्तर्षयो नारदश्च ते त्वां रक्षन्तु सर्वतः । नक्षत्राणि च सर्वाणि ग्रहाश्च सहदेवताः । महावनानि चरतो मुनिवेषस्य धीमतः ।।
प्लवगा वृश्चिका दंशा मशकाश्चैव कानने । सरीसृपाश्च कीटाश्च मा भूवन्गहने तव ।।
data.es: May monkeys, scorpions, wild gnats, mosquitoes, reptiles and insects in that inaccessible forest not trouble you
data.anv: गहने in an inaccessible, कानने in the forest, तव to you, प्लवगाः monkeys,  वृश्चिकाः scorpions, दंशाः wild gnats, मशकाश्च mosquitoes also, सरीसृपाश्च reptiles also, कीटाश्च insects too, मा भूवन् may not be there.

data.v: महाद्विपाश्च सिंहाश्च व्याघ्रा ऋक्षाश्च दंष्ट्रिणः । महिषाः शृङ्गिणो रौद्रा न ते द्रुह्यन्तु पुत्रक ।।
data.es: May the mighty elephants, lions with pointed incisors, tigers, bears and fierce, wild, horned buffaloes, do you no harm, O my dear son
data.anv: पुत्रक my dear son, महाद्विपाश्च mighty elephants also, दंष्ट्रिणः with pointed incisors, सिंहाश्च lions, व्याघ्राः tigers, ऋक्षाश्च bears and, शृङ्गिणः with horns, रौद्राः fierce ones, महिषाः wild buffaloes, ते to you, न द्रुह्यन्तु may not harm.
data.md: May the apes, scorpions, wild gnats, reptiles and insects make you no harm; may not the elephants, tigers, terrible looking bears, hogs, buffaloes and other horned animals hurt you.

data.v: नृमांसभोजना रौद्रा ये चान्ये सत्त्वजातयः । मा च त्वां हिंसिषुः पुत्र मया संपूजितास्त्विह ।।
data.es: May the ferocious breed of cernivores I worship not harm you, O my child
data.anv: पुत्र O my child, नृमांसभोजिनः cannibals, रौद्राः frightening ones, ये अन्ये all others, सत्वजातयः ferocious breeds of animals, इह here, मया by me, संपूजिताः have been worshipped, त्वाम् you, मा च हिंसिषुः may not harm.
data.md: Being worshipped by me from here may the ferocious cannibal races of all kind bring you no injury.

data.v: आगमास्ते शिवाः सन्तु सिध्यन्तु च पराक्रमाः । सर्वसंपत्तयो राम स्वस्तिमान्गच्छ पुत्रक ।।
data.es: O Rama may your path be auspecious May your valour be fruitful Go safel and achieve success in everything
data.anv: पुत्रक O my child, राम Rama, ते your, आगमाः paths, शिवाः safe (auspecious), सन्तु be, पराक्रमाश्च valour also, सिध्यन्तु be accomplished, स्वस्तिमान् safe man, सर्वसंपत्तये achieve success in everything, गच्छ go.
data.md: May your course be crowned with auspiciousness and your powers with success.

data.v: स्वस्ति तेऽस्त्वान्तरिक्षेभ्यः पार्थिवेभ्यः पुनः पुनः । सर्वेभ्यश्चैव देवेभ्यो ये च ते परिपन्थिनः ।।
data.es: May gods from the sky, the earth and all other gods protect you and let there be no harm to you from your foes.
data.anv: अन्तरिक्षेभ्यः from the sky, पुनः again, पार्थिवेभ्यः from earthly gods (kings), पुनः again, सर्वेभ्यः from all, देवेभ्यश्चैव from devatas also, ये ते परिपन्थिन from all those who obstruct your path, ते to you, स्वस्ति अस्तु safety be yours.
data.md: Do you, oh my son, repair to the forest, being profusely provided with fruits, roots and other things. May all the creatures of the sky, all those who breathe on this Earth, and all those deities who are hostile to you, contribute to your welfare.

data.v: सर्वलोकप्रभुर्ब्रह्मा भूतभर्ता तथर्षयः । ये च शेषाः सुरास्ते त्वां रक्षन्तु वनवासिनम् ।।
data.es: May Siva, lord of all the worlds, Visnu, supporter of living beings, Brahma, rishis and all the rest of the gods protect you while you dwell in the forest
data.anv: सर्वलोकप्रभुः lord of all the worlds, Siva, ब्रह्मा Brahma, भूतभर्ता supporter of beings, Visnu, तथा also, ऋषयः rishis, शेषाः the remaining, ये सुराः those gods, ते to you,  वनवासिनम् dwelling in the forest, त्वाम् you, रक्षन्तु protect.
data.md: May the lord of creation, Rșis and all the remaining deities defend you when dwelling in the forest.

data.v: इति माल्यैः सुरगणान्गन्धैश्चापि यशस्विनी । स्तुतिभिश्चानुरूपाभिरानर्चायतलोचना ।।
data.es: Thus illustrious, largeeyed Kausalya worshipped hosts of gods by offering them garlands and fragrant substances with appropriate prayers.
data.anv: यशस्विनी illustrious lady, आयतलोचना largeeyed (Kausalya), इति thus, माल्यैः with garlands, गन्धैश्चापि with fragrant susbtances, अनुरूपाभिः by appropriate articles, स्तुतिभिश्च with prayers, सुरगणान् hosts of gods, आनर्च worshipped.

data.v: यन्मङ्गलं सहस्राक्षे सर्वदेवनमस्कृते । वृत्रनाशे समभवत्तत्ते भवतु मङ्गलम् ।।
data.es: May the same blessings bestowed by all the gods on the thousandeyed Indra at the time of killing Vritra be with you
data.anv: वृत्रनाशे at the time of slaying of Vritra, सर्वदेवनमस्कृते salutations bestowed by all gods,  सहस्राक्षे on god of a thousand eyes (Indra), यत् whichever, मङ्गलम् blessings, समभवत् was bestowed, तत् मङ्गलम् that auspiciousness, ते भवतु may happen to you.
data.md: May that blessing crown you, which was attained by the thousand eyed Indra, honoured of all the deities on the occasion of killing the mighty Asura Vſtra.

data.v: यन्मङ्गलं सुपर्णस्य विनताकल्पयत्पुरा । अमृतं प्रार्थयानस्य तत्ते भवतु मङ्गलम् ।।
data.es: May you be conferred with the same blessings which Vinata bestowed on Garuda at the time of bringing nectar
data.anv: पुरा formely, अमृतम् nectar, प्रार्थयानस्य while seeking, सुपर्णस्य for Garuda,  विनता Vinata, यत् मङ्गलम् which blessings, अकल्पयत् created, तत् मङ्गलम् that auspiciousness, ते भवतु happen to you.
data.md: May that blessing attend you, which was invoked in olden times by Vinatā, for that king of birds Garuda, praying for nectar.

data.v: ओषधीं चापि सिद्धार्थां विशल्यकरणीं शुभाम् । चकार रक्षां कौसल्या मन्त्रैरभिजजाप च ।।
data.es: The largeeyed Kausalya placed the remains of the offerings on his (Rama's) head and applied sandal cream to his body. She tied an auspicious medicinal herb known as Vishalyakarani to his arm for attainment of his objectives, repeatedly muttering prayers.
data.anv: आयतलोचना largeeyed lady, भामिनी beautiful lady, कौशल्या Kausalya, इति in this way uttering, पुत्रस्य son's, शिरसि on the head, शेषाश्च the remains (of offerings), कृत्वा having offered, रामम् Rama, गन्धैश्चापि with sandalpaste also, समालभ्य having applied, सिद्धार्थां  for fruitful attainment, शुभाम् auspicious, विशल्यकरणीम् Vishalyakarani, (capable of removing extraneous substances causing great pain in the body), ओषधीम् medicinal herb, रक्षाम् armlet, चकार made, मन्त्रै: with sacred prayers, अभिजजाप च muttered repeatedly in a low tone.
data.md: Saying this Kausalyā, the foremost of all women, having expansive eyes, placed the grains on Rāma's head; sprinkled his body with fragrant substances, and tied to his hands, as amulet, twigs of such auspicious plants as Viśalyakaraṇī, with due mental repetition of mantras.

data.v: आनम्य मूर्ध्नि चाघ्राय परिष्वज्य यशस्विनी । अवदत्पुत्र सिद्धार्थो गच्छ राम यथासुखम् ।।
data.es: Illustrious Kausalya embraced Rama, bending his head down and smelt his forehead. And then said O Rama go in peace and come back after accomplishing the objective.
data.anv: यशस्विनी illustrious lady, आनम्य bending him down, मूर्ध्नि on his forehead, आघ्राय having smelt, परिष्वज्य having embraced, अवदत् spoke, पुत्र O son, राम Rama, सिद्धार्थः having fulfilled your objective, यथा सुखम् in peace and happiness, गच्छ go.

data.v: अरोगं सर्वसिद्धार्थमयोध्यां पुनरागतम् । पश्यामि त्वां सुखं वत्स सुस्थितं राजवेश्मनि ।।
data.es: O my son I shall be happy to behold you back in Ayodhya in sound health successful in your objectives and firmly established in the kingdom.
data.anv: वत्स O my son, अरोगम् without illness, सर्वसिद्धार्थम् accomplishing all objectives, सुखम्  happily (in good health), पुनः again, अयोध्याम् to Ayodhya, आगतम् having reached,  राजवर्त्मनि on the royal path (as king), सुस्थितम् firmly standing, त्वाम् you, पश्यामि I shall behold.

data.v: मयार्चिता देवगणाः शिवादयो; महर्षयो भूतमहासुरोरगाः । अभिप्रयातस्य वनं चिराय ते; हितानि काङ्क्षन्तु दिशश्च राघव ।।
data.es: O son of the Raghu race Lord Siva and other gods, the great rishis, bhutas, great asuras and serpents and four quarters worshipped by me will always promote your welfare when you dwell in the forest.
data.anv: राघव O son of the Raghu race मया by me, अर्चिताः worshipped, शिवादयः Siva and others, देवगणाः gods, महर्षयः the great rishis, भूतमहासुरोरगाः bhutas, great asuras, serpents, दिशश्च four quarters, वनम् to the forest, अभिप्रयातस्य having exiled, ते your, हितानि welfare,  चिराय for a long time, काङ्क्षन्तु may wish for.
data.md: Worshipped have I deities headed by Siva and others, the great ascetics, the Bhūtagaņas and the snakes; may they all and the four cardinal points, Oh Rāghava, contribute to your welfare, who are going to the forest for a long time.

data.v: इतीव चाश्रुप्रतिपूर्णलोचना; समाप्य च स्वस्त्ययनं यथाविधि । प्रदक्षिणं चैव चकार राघवं; पुनः पुनश्चापि निपीड्य सस्वजे ।।
data.es: Thus with her eyes brimming with tears, she duly completed the benedictory rites and circumambulated the scion of the Raghus and embraced him again and again holding him tight.
data.anv: इतीव speaking thus, सा she, अश्रुप्रतिपूर्णलोचना eyes filled with tears, यथाविधि duly, स्वस्त्ययनम् benedictory rites, समाप्य च having completed, राघवम् to the descendant of the Raghu dynasty, प्रदक्षिणं चकार circumambulate, पुनः पुनः च अपि repeatedly, निपीड्य holding him tight, सस्वजे embraced.
data.md: Kausalya, having her eyes full of tears, and performing the benedictory ceremonies with due rites, went round Rāghava with solemnity, and seeing him again and again sighed hot and hard.

data.v: तथा तु देव्या स कृतप्रदक्षिणो; निपीड्य मातुश्चरणौ पुनः पुनः । जगाम सीतानिलयं महायशाः; स राघवः प्रज्वलितः स्वया श्रिया ।।
data.es: Circumambulated by mother Kausalya, the illustrious scion of the Raghu race clasped his mother's feet again and again. And shining in his glory, proceeded to the palace of Sita.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे पञ्चविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyfifth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: देव्या by Devi Kausalya, तथा that way, कृतप्रदक्षिणः having circumambulated, सः Rama,  मातुः his mothers, चरणौ feet, पुनः पुनः again and again, निपीड्य holding fast, महायशाः illustrious, सः राघवः that son of the Raghu race, स्वया by his own, श्रिया with glory, प्रज्वलितः glowing, सीतानिलयम् to the palace of Sita, जगाम went.
data.md: Being gone round by his mother thus, Rāghava, of great lame, and resplendent with the splendour of beauty, proceeded towards the abode of Sītā, after bowing down to the feet of his mother repeatedly.

data.v: अभिवाद्य तु कौसल्यां रामः संप्रस्थितो वनम् । कृतस्वस्त्ययनो मात्रा धर्मिष्ठे वर्त्मनि स्थितः ।।
data.es: After the benedictory rites were performed by his mother Kausalya, Rama paid obeisance to her and staying on the righteous path decided to depart to the forest. He entered the highway thronged with people and illumining it with his lustre and stirred their hearts with (remembrances of) his excellent virtues.
data.anv: राजसुतः prince, रामः Rama, मात्रा by mother, कृतस्वस्त्ययन: having been greeted with benedictory rites, कौशल्याम् to Kausalya, अभिवाद्य च after paying obeisance, धर्मिष्ठे in the righteous, वर्त्मनि on the path, स्थितः fixed, वनम् to the forest, सम्प्रस्थितः set out, नरैः (जनैः) by the people, वृतम् surrounded with, राजमार्गम् highway, विराजयन् illuminating (with his lustre), गुणवत्तया by excellent virtues, जनस्य people's, हृदयानि hearts, अममन्थेव मपहीला् (stirred).
data.md: Rāma, intent on repairing to the forest, and treading in pious tracks, after duly saluting Kausalyā and beautifying the royal road, crowded with people, captivated their hearts by means of his high accomplishments.

data.v: विराजयन्राजसुतो राजमार्गं नरैर्वृतम् । हृदयान्याममन्थेव जनस्य गुणवत्तया ।।
data.es: After the benedictory rites were performed by his mother Kausalya, Rama paid obeisance to her and staying on the righteous path decided to depart to the forest. He entered the highway thronged with people and illumining it with his lustre and stirred their hearts with (remembrances of) his excellent virtues.
data.anv: राजसुतः prince, रामः Rama, मात्रा by mother, कृतस्वस्त्ययन: having been greeted with benedictory rites, कौशल्याम् to Kausalya, अभिवाद्य च after paying obeisance, धर्मिष्ठे in the righteous, वर्त्मनि on the path, स्थितः fixed, वनम् to the forest, सम्प्रस्थितः set out, नरैः (जनैः) by the people, वृतम् surrounded with, राजमार्गम् highway, विराजयन् illuminating (with his lustre), गुणवत्तया by excellent virtues, जनस्य people's, हृदयानि hearts, अममन्थेव मपहीला् (stirred).

data.v: वैदेही चापि तत्सर्वं न शुश्राव तपस्विनी । तदेव हृदि तस्याश्च यौवराज्याभिषेचनम् ।।
data.es: Sita, her mind preoccupied with thoughts about consecration, was engaged in religious austerities and hence could not hear of all this (development).
data.anv: तपस्विनी engaged in religious austerities (for consecration), वैदेही चापि Sita also, तत्सर्वम् all that, न शुश्राव did not hear, तस्याः her, हृदि in heart, तत् that, अभिषेचनम् एव  only consecration (was reflecting).
data.md: Vaidehi, ever engaged in ascetic rites, did not hear of all these affairs; there was in her heart only the thought of Rāma's installation.

data.v: देवकार्यं स्म सा कृत्वा कृतज्ञा हृष्टचेतना । अभिज्ञा राजधर्माणां राजपुत्रं प्रतीक्षते ।।
data.es: Experienced in palace rituals, Sita, grateful (to God) after performing worship of the deities was awaiting in a happy mood the arrival of the prince.
data.anv: कृतज्ञा grateful (to god), राजधर्माणाम् duties of a king (palace rituals), अभिज्ञा experienced in, हृष्टचेतना with pleased mind, स्वयम् herself, देवकार्यम् worship of gods, कृत्वा having made,  राजपुत्रम् prince, प्रतीक्षते was awaiting.
data.md: That daughter of the king, after offering her service to the deities according to the proper royal rites, was eagerly awaiting the approach of Rāma with a grateful and pleased heart.

data.v: प्रविवेशाथ रामस्तु स्ववेश्म सुविभूषितम् । प्रहृष्टजनसंपूर्णं ह्रिया किंचिदवाङ्मुखः ।।
data.es: His head bent down in embarrassment, Rama entered his welldecorated residence thronged with excited people.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, रामस्तु Rama, ह्रिया with embarrassment, किञ्चित् a little, अवाङ्मुखः with his head bent down, प्रहृष्टजनसम्पूर्णम् thronged with excited people, सुविभूषितम् welldecorated, स्वं वेश्म his own residence, प्रविवेश entered.
data.md: Entered Rāma this beautiful abode, excellently furnished and filled with people highly delighted, having his head hanging down a little with shame.

data.v: अथ सीता समुत्पत्य वेपमाना च तं पतिम् । अपश्यच्छोकसंतप्तं चिन्ताव्याकुलितेन्द्रियम् ।।
data.es: Sita got up suddenly, (her limbs) trembling to see her husband distressed with grief and agitated with anxiety.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, सीता Sita, समुत्पत्य entering suddenly, वेपमाना च a trembling, शोकसन्तप्तम् distressed with grief, चिन्ताव्याकुलितेन्द्रियम् senses agitated due to anxiety, तं पतिम् her husband, अपश्यत् beheld.
data.md: Sītā, seeing her husband, racked with sorrow and troubled in mind with anxiety, rose up trembling from her seat.

data.v: विवर्णवदनं दृष्ट्वा तं प्रस्विन्नममर्षणम् । आह दुःखाभिसंतप्ता किमिदानीमिदं प्रभो ।।
data.es: On seeing Rama with a pale face. indignant and heavily perspiring, Sita, consumed with grief said, My Lord, why are you now like this?
data.anv: विवर्णवदनम् pale face, प्रस्विन्नम् heavily perspiring, अमर्षणम् indignant, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा having seen, दुःखाभिसन्तप्ता  consumed with grief, आह uttered, प्रभो O Lord, इदानीम् now, इदम् this, किम् what?
data.md: Finding him with face pale and perspiring, and incapable of containing grief within, Sītā sore distressed with sorrow addressed him, saying, Oh my lord, why do I perceive such a change in you?

data.v: अद्य बार्हस्पतः श्रीमान्युक्तः पुष्यो न राघव । प्रोच्यते ब्राह्मणैः प्राज्ञैः केन त्वमसि दुर्मनाः ।।
data.es: O scion of the Raghu race, today has been declared by learned brahmins a suitable and auspicious day for consecration under Pushya star with Brihaspati as presiding deity. Then why are you dejected?
data.anv: राघव O scion of the Raghu race, अद्य today, श्रीमान् auspicious one, बार्हस्पतः with Brihaspati presiding over, पुष्यः Pushya star, युक्तः as suitable, प्राज्ञैः by learned ones, ब्राह्मणैः by brahmins, प्रोच्यते is declared, त्वम् you, केन for what reason, दुर्मनाः असि are dejected?
data.md: To day the constellation Puşya is in conjunction with the moon, and planet Bịhaspati is presiding over this conjunction, this day has been declared as the most auspicious one by the learned Brahmins, then why do you cherish such a sorrow in the mind?

data.v: न ते शतशलाकेन जलफेननिभेन च । आवृतं वदनं वल्गु छत्रेणाभिविराजते ।।
data.es: How is it that your charming face shines not today under a hundredribbed umbrella (white) like foam in water?
data.anv: वल्गु charming, ते your, वदनम् face, शत शलाकेन with a hundred ribs, जलफेननिभेन (white) like foam in water, छत्रेण by umbrella, आवृतम् having been covered, न विराजते does not shine.
data.md: Why has not your charming face been placed under the shade of an umbrella having hundred ribs and white as a watery foam?

data.v: व्यजनाभ्यां च मुख्याभ्यां शतपत्रनिभेक्षणम् । चन्द्रहंसप्रकाशाभ्यां वीज्यते न तवाननम् ।।
data.es: (How is it that) your face, with its lotuslike eyes is not being fanned by excellent fans of the colour of the Moon or the swan.
data.anv: शतपत्रनिभेक्षणम् eyes resembling lotus, तव आननम् your face, चन्द्रहंस प्रकाशाभ्याम् with the glow of the moon or swan, मुख्याभ्याम् by the excellent, व्यजनाभ्याम् with fans, न वीज्यते is not being fanned.
data.md: Why do not the servants fan you, having eyes like lotus' petals, with chowries white as the moon or a goose?

data.v: वाग्मिनो बन्दिनश्चापि प्रहृष्टास्त्वं नरर्षभ । स्तुवन्तो नाद्य दृश्यन्ते मङ्गलैः सूतमागधाः ।।
data.es: (How is it that) O best among men eloquent panegyrists, charioteers, bards are not seen singing your praise with auspicious words?
data.anv: नरर्षभ O best among men वाग्मिन: eloquent men, वन्दिनश्चापि panegyrists, सूतमागधाः charioteers and bards, प्रहृष्टाः delighted, त्वाम् you, मङ्गलैः with auspicious words, स्तुवन्तः praising, अत्र here, न दृश्यन्ते are not seen.
data.md: I do not see you, Oh best of men, eulogised with auspicious songs by the panegyrists, encomiasts and family bards.

data.v: न ते क्षौद्रं च दधि च ब्राह्मणा वेदपारगाः । मूर्ध्नि मूर्धावसिक्तस्य दधति स्म विधानतः ।।
data.es: How is it that brahmins versed in the Vedas have not duly sprinkled the mixture of honey and curd on your head (prior to your consecration)?
data.anv: वेदपारगाः versed in the Vedas, ब्राह्मणाः brahmins, मूर्धाभिषिक्तस्य having been consecrated,   ते your, मूर्ध्नि on head, विधानतः conforming to rites, क्षौद्रं च honey also, दधि च curds, न ददति स्म did not sprinkle.
data.md: Why do not the Brahmins, versed in the Vedas, observing the formal rites, sprinkle on your head honey and curd, after washing it duly?

data.v: न त्वां प्रकृतयः सर्वा श्रेणीमुख्याश्च भूषिताः । अनुव्रजितुमिच्छन्ति पौरजानपदास्तथा ।।
data.es: How is it that welladorned ministers, citizens from towns and villages, heads of guilds and others do not follow you?
data.anv: सर्वाः all, प्रकृतयः ministers, श्रेणीमुख्याश्च also the heads of guilds, तथा also, पौरजानपदाः citizens of towns and villages, भूषिताः adorned, त्वाम् you, अनुव्रजितुम् to follow, न इच्छन्ति do not seek.
data.md: Why are not your subjects, citizens urbans, and leading members of society dressed and adorned, willing to follow you?

data.v: चतुर्भिर्वेगसंपन्नैर्हयैः काञ्चनभूषणैः । मुख्यः पुष्यरथो युक्तः किं न गच्छति तेऽग्रतः ।।
data.es: How is it that the chief ceremonial chariot, decorated with gold and harnessed by four galloping horses is not preceding you?
data.anv: वेगसम्पन्नैः running swiftly, काञ्चनभूषितैः decorated with gold, चतुर्भिः four, हयैः horses, युक्तः harnessed, मुख्यः important, पुष्यरथः ceremonial chariot, किम् why, ते अग्रतः preceding you, न गच्छति is not going.
data.md: Why does not that excellent sport-chariot go before you, having four fast going steeds, adorned with golden ornaments tied to it?

data.v: न हस्ती चाग्रतः श्रीमांस्तव लक्षणपूजितः । प्रयाणे लक्ष्यते वीर कृष्णमेघगिरि प्रभः ।।
data.es: How is it that the elephant, whose lustre resembles that of a mountain or a dark cloud and endowed with auspicious features is not seen leading your procession, O valiant one
data.anv: वीर O valiant one, तव your, प्रयाणे in your journey, अग्रतः in front, लक्षणपूजितः endowed with good features and revered, कृष्णमेघगिरिप्रभः with the lustre of a dark cloud or a  mountain, श्रीमान् auspicious one, हस्ती an elephant, न लक्ष्यते is not seen.
data.md: Why does not that excellent elephant precede you, Oh great hero, which is gifted with auspicious marks and resembles as mass of dark clouds and a mighty hill?

data.v: न च काञ्चनचित्रं ते पश्यामि प्रियदर्शन । भद्रासनं पुरस्कृत्य यान्तं वीरपुरःसरम् ।।
data.es: O heroic one O handsome one how is it that I do not see your attendants proceeding in front with the throne carved in gold?
data.anv: वीर O heroic one, प्रियदर्शन O one with a pleasant countenance, काञ्चनचित्रम् carved in gold, ते to you, भद्रासनम् throne, पुरस्कृत्य keeping in front of, यान्तम् proceeding, पुरस्कृतम् keeping in front, न च पश्यामि I do not see.
data.md: Why do not the servants run before you, Oh mighty hero, with a pretty looking royal seat embroidered with gold?

data.v: अभिषेको यदा सज्जः किमिदानीमिदं तव । अपूर्वो मुखवर्णश्च न प्रहर्षश्च लक्ष्यते ।।
data.es: How is it that when arrangements are under way now for your consecration, the complexion of your countenance does not look like what it was before? There is no joy on your face.
data.anv: अभिषेकः consecration, यथा as, सज्जः arranged, तव your, मुखवर्णः complexion of your face, अपूर्वः unusual, प्रहर्षश्च delightful, न लक्ष्यते not seen, इदानीम् now, इदम् this, किम् why?
data.md: Why do I perceive your face so pale as never seen before, and why therein is no mark of gladness, when every thing for your installation has been made ready?

data.v: इतीव विलपन्तीं तां प्रोवाच रघुनन्दनः । सीते तत्रभवांस्तातः प्रव्राजयति मां वनम् ।।
data.es: O Sita my venerable father is banishing me to the forest, said Rama, the scion of the Raghus, the joy of the Raghu race, seeing her thus lamenting.
data.anv: इतीव in this way, विलपन्तीम् lamenting, ताम् to her, रघुनन्दनः Rama, प्रोवाच said , सीते O Sita, तत्रभवान् venerable, तातः father, माम् me, वनम् to the forest, प्रव्राजयति  banishing.
data.md: Whereupon spoke to that weeping Sītā, the descendant of Raghu thus:, Oh Sītā, Oh you born of a great family, versed in the knowledge of religion and intent on the performance of religious rites, my father has banished me to the forest! Do you hear, Oh daughter of Janaka, how has this calamity befallen me.

data.v: कुले महति संभूते धर्मज्ञे धर्मचारिणि । शृणु जानकि येनेदं क्रमेणाभ्यागतं मम ।।
data.es: You were born in a noble family. You know and practise dharma. I shall tell you how this banishment has come about. Do listen.
data.anv: महति in a noble, कुले family, सम्भूते born in, धर्मज्ञे knower of righteousness, धर्मचारिणि for an observer of righteousness, जानकि Sita, येन क्रमेण in such course, इदम् this, अभ्यागतम् has befallen, शृण listen.
data.md: Whereupon spoke to that weeping Sītā, the descendant of Raghu thus:, Oh Sītā, Oh you born of a great family, versed in the knowledge of religion and intent on the performance of religious rites, my father has banished me to the forest! Do you hear, Oh daughter of Janaka, how has this calamity befallen me.

data.v: राज्ञा सत्यप्रतिज्ञेन पित्रा दशरथेन मे । कैकेय्यै प्रीतमनसा पुरा दत्तौ महावरौ ।।
data.es: My father, king Dasaratha, true to his promise, had earlier granted two great boons to my mother Kaikeyi.
data.anv: राज्ञा by the king, सत्यप्रतिज्ञेन true to his promise, पित्रा my father, दशरथेन by Dasaratha, पुरा earlier, मम मात्रे to my mother, कैकेय्यै to Kaikeyi, महावरौ two great boons, दत्तौ were given.
data.md: In the days of yore was granted to my mother, Kaikeyi two boons by my father, king Dasaratha of truthful vows.

data.v: तयाद्य मम सज्जेऽस्मिन्नभिषेके नृपोद्यते । प्रचोदितः स समयो धर्मेण प्रतिनिर्जितः ।।
data.es: When the king was preparing for my consecration, she reminded him of the promise and in the name of righteousness he has been cornered.
data.anv: अद्य now, नृपोद्यते the king was getting ready, मम my, अस्मिन् अभिषेके for this consecration, सज्जे in the preparation, तया by her, सः that, समयः promise, प्रचोदितः was urged, धर्मेण in the name of righteousness, प्रतिनिर्जितः has been conquered.
data.md: When every thing was made ready by my father for my installation, Kaikeyi reminded him of his promise and gained over him for this righteousness.

data.v: चतुर्दश हि वर्षाणि वस्तव्यं दण्डके मया । पित्रा मे भरतश्चापि यौवराज्ये नियोजितः । सोऽहं त्वामागतो द्रष्टुं प्रस्थितो विजनं वनम् ।।
data.es: I am to dwell in the Dandaka forest for fourteen years while father has appointed Bharata princeregent.
data.anv: मया by me, चतुर्दश वर्षाणि fourteen years, दण्डके in Dandaka forest, वस्तव्यम् am to dwell, मे पित्रा by my father, भरतश्चापि Bharata also, यौवराज्ये as heirapparent,  नियोजितः has been appointed.
data.md: I shall live in the forest of Dandaka for fourteen years and Bharata shall be installed by my father as the heir apparent of the throne.

data.v: भरतस्य समीपे ते नाहं कथ्यः कदाचन । ऋद्धियुक्ता हि पुरुषा न सहन्ते परस्तवम् । तस्मान्न ते गुणाः कथ्या भरतस्याग्रतो मम ।।
data.es: I have come to see you before departing for the desolate Dandaka forest. You should never praise me in the presence of Bharata because intellectuals cannot tolerate others being praised before them. You should never extol my virtues before him.
data.anv: विजनम् desolate, वनम् forest, प्रस्थितः set to depart, सः अहम् such me, त्वाम् you, द्रष्टुम् to see, आगतः I have come, भरतस्य Bharata's, समीपे in the presence of, कदाचन at any time, अहम् I, न कथ्यः not to be told , बुद्धियुक्ताः intellectuals, पुरुषाः men, परस्तवम् praising others , न सहन्ते हि cannot endure, तस्मात् for that reason, भरतस्य Bharata's, अग्रतः infront of, ते those, मम गुणाः my virtues, न कथ्याः should not be mentioned.
data.md: And myself bound to fly as an exile to the wood, have come here to see you; do you not praise me ever before Bharata. Those who are crowned with prosperity cannot bear another's praise; is it therefore behoves you not to extol my virtues in the presence of Bharata.

data.v: नापि त्वं तेन भर्तव्या विशेषेण कदाचन । अनुकूलतया शक्यं समीपे तस्य वर्तितुम् ।।
data.es: Never expect special treatment from Bharata. You can (continue to) stay with him (here) by conducting yourself in a favourable manner.
data.anv: त्वम् you, तेन by him, कदाचन at any time, विशेषेण with a special treatment, न भर्तव्या  should not be supported, अनुकूलतया तु by being favourable only, अस्य his, समीपे in his vicinity, वर्तितुम् to remain, शक्यम् is possible.
data.md: You should not extol me even in the company of your friends; you shall be then able to live with Bharata as one favourable to his party.

data.v: अहं चापि प्रतिज्ञां तां गुरोः समनुपालयन् । वनमद्यैव यास्यामि स्थिरा भव मनस्विनि ।।
data.es: I am leaving for the forest right away for fulfilling my father's pledge. O highminded Sita be steady.
data.anv: अहं चापि I also, गुरोः father's, तां प्रतिज्ञाम् that promise, समनुपालयन् while fulfilling, अद्यैव now itself, वनम् to the forest, यास्यामि shall go, मनस्विनि highminded, Sita, त्वम् you, स्थिरा भव keep steady.
data.md: To day shall I repair to the forest for redeeming my father's vows; do you, Oh high minded one, live here in undisturbed mind.

data.v: याते च मयि कल्याणि वनं मुनिनिषेवितम् । व्रतोपवासरतया भवितव्यं त्वयानघे ।।
data.es: O sinless, auspicious one engage yourself in vratas and fasting after my departure to the forest inhabited by ascetics.
data.anv: अनघे O sinless one, कल्याणि O auspicious one, मयि me, मुनिनिषेवितम् inhabited by ascetics, वनम् to the forest, याते when I am gone, त्वया by you, व्रतोपवास परया engaged in vratas and fasting, भवितव्यम् should be done.
data.md: Do you, Oh sinless and auspicious one, live here engaged in religious rites and fasts, when I shall wend my way to the forest inhabited by the great ascetics.

data.v: काल्यमुत्थाय देवानां कृत्वा पूजां यथाविधि । वन्दितव्यो दशरथः पिता मम नरेश्वरः ।।
data.es: You must rise in time and with the (household) gods duly worshipped, pay obeisance to my father, king Dasaratha.
data.anv: काल्यम् fimely, उत्थाय rising, यथाविधि according to the prescribed rituals, देवानाम् of the gods, पूजाम् कृत्वा having worshipped, मम पिता my father, नरेश्वरः lord of the people, दशरथः to Dasaratha, वन्दितव्यः is worthy of homage (by you).
data.md: Rising from the bed early in the morning, adore the deities, every day, and then bow down to the feet of my father Dasaratha, the lord of men.

data.v: माता च मम कौसल्या वृद्धा संतापकर्शिता । धर्ममेवाग्रतः कृत्वा त्वत्तः संमानमर्हति ।।
data.anv: सन्तापकर्शिता emaciated due to grief, वृद्धा aged, मम माता च my mother, कौशल्या Kausalya, धर्ममेव duty only, अग्रतः कृत्वा placing ahead, त्वत्तः by you, सम्मानम् respect, अर्हति  deserves.
data.md: My mother Kausalyā is old and much pressed down with sorrow; do you show proper respects to her, considering it to be a pious deed.

data.v: वन्दितव्याश्च ते नित्यं याः शेषा मम मातरः । स्नेहप्रणयसंभोगैः समा हि मम मातरः ।।
data.es: In terms of love, affection and service, the rest of my mothers are all equal. Therefore, you must pay them due respect regularly.
data.anv: शेषाः the rest of them, या मम मातरः my mothers, ते to you also, नित्यम् always, वन्दितव्याः should be respected, मम my, मातरः mothers, स्नेहप्रणय सम्भोगैः with love, affection and service, समाः हि are equal.
data.md: You should then bow down to my other mothers who all minister to me, with equal love and affection.

data.v: भ्रातृपुत्रसमौ चापि द्रष्टव्यौ च विशेषतः । त्वया लक्ष्मणशत्रुघ्नौ प्राणैः प्रियतरौ मम ।।
data.es: What is more important is that you should look on Bharata as your brother and Satrughna as your son. They are dearer to me than my life.
data.anv: मम to me, प्राणैः  more than life , प्रियतरौ dearer, भरतशत्रुघ्नौ Bharata and Satrughna, विशेषतः specially, त्वया by you, भ्रातृपुत्रसमौ as your brother and your sons, द्रष्टव्यौ च are to be looked after.
data.md: Should you specially regard Bharata and Śatrughna like to your sons or brothers, who are dearer to me than my life itself.

data.v: विप्रियं न च कर्तव्यं भरतस्य कदाचन । स हि राजा प्रभुश्चैव देशस्य च कुलस्य च ।।
data.es: Now Bharata is the king of the country and head of the family. Therefore, you should never do anything disagreeable to him.
data.anv: कदाचन at any time, भरतस्य of Bharata, विप्रियम् disagreeable, न कर्तव्यम् should not be done, सः he, देशस्य च of the country, कुलस्य च of the family also, राजा king, प्रभुश्चैव  also the lord.
data.md: You should not do, Oh Vaidehī, any such thing as might be unpleasant to Bharata, for he is the king of the land as well as of the family.

data.v: आराधिता हि शीलेन प्रयत्नैश्चोपसेविताः । राजानः संप्रसीदन्ति प्रकुप्यन्ति विपर्यये ।।
data.es: Kings are gratified if they are served with zeal and good conduct. If the contrary happens, they get provoked.
data.anv: राजान: kings, शीलेन with good conduct, आराधिताः are gratified, प्रयत्नैः with endeavours, उपसेविताः having been served, सम्प्रसीदन्ति are satisfied, विपर्यये in contrary to that, कुप्यन्तिच are also enraged.
data.md: The monarchs are always propitiated by being served with assiduity and good temper; they are offended when any thing contrary to it happens.

data.v: औरसानपि पुत्रान्हि त्यजन्त्यहितकारिणः । समर्थान्संप्रगृह्णन्ति जनानपि नराधिपाः ।।
data.es: Kings abandon (even) their own sons if they are harmful and receive capable people even if they are strangers.
data.anv: नराधिपाः kings, अहितकारिणः harmful men, औरसान् पुत्रानपि even their own sons, त्यजन्ति will abandon, समर्थान् capable men, जनानपि even other people, सम्प्रगृह्णन्ति accept.
data.md: They renounce even their own son, born of their lions, when they find him bringing about their mischief, and admit into their favour persons devoted to their welfare bearing no relationship whatever.

data.v: अहं गमिष्यामि महावनं प्रिये; त्वया हि वस्तव्यमिहैव भामिनि । यथा व्यलीकं कुरुषे न कस्यचि;त्तथा त्वया कार्यमिदं वचो मम ।।
data.es: O my beloved Sita I am going to the wild forest. Stay here and never cause displeasure to any one in any way. Could you carry out these words of mine?इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे षड्विंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentysixth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: प्रिये O beloved one, भामिनि beauty (Sita), अहम् I, महावनम् to the great forest, गमिष्यामि I am going, त्वया by you, इहैव here itself, कस्यचित् to any one, यथा in any way, व्यलीकम् harm, न कुरुषे would not do, तथा in that way, वस्तव्यम् you shall live here, मम my, इदं वचः these words, कार्यम् should be done.
data.md: I am going to the forest, Oh my darling, and you shall live here. Oh excellent lady, abide by my word as did you never formerly falsify it.

data.v: एवमुक्ता तु वैदेही प्रियार्हा प्रियवादिनी । प्रणयादेव संक्रुद्धा भर्तारमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: When the sweettongued daughter of Videha (Sita) who deserved affection, heard this she was very angry out of her love (for Rama). She said these wordsto her husband (in reply):
data.anv: प्रियवादिनी speaking pleasant words, प्रियार्हा deserving affection, वैदेही Sita, एवम् thus, उक्ता spoken to, प्रणयादेव out of love, संक्रुद्धा mighty angry, भर्तारम् to her husband, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Being addressed thus, Vaidehi, beloved and sweet speeched, spoke to her husband the following words, offended as it were on account of her great affection.

data.v: आर्यपुत्र पिता माता भ्राता पुत्रस्तथा स्नुषा । स्वानि पुण्यानि भुञ्जानाः स्वं स्वं भाग्यमुपासते ।।
data.es: O son of a noble monarch father, mother, brother, son or daughterinlaw (everybody) experiences the merit (of their past deeds) and receives what is due from destiny.
data.anv: आर्यपुत्र O son of a noble monarch, पिता father, माता mother, भ्राता brother, पुत्रः son, तथा also, स्नुषा daughterinlaw, स्वानि their own, पुण्यानि merits, भुञ्जानाः while enjoying, स्वं स्वम् due to each of them, भाग्यम् destiny, उपासते are receiving.
data.md: Oh dear husband, father, mother, son, brother, daughter-in-law, all of them abide by the consequences of their own actions, it is the wife alone, Oh best of men, that shares the fate of her husband; it is therefore that ever along with you I have been ordered to live in the forest.

data.v: भर्तुर्भाग्यं तु भार्यैका प्राप्नोति पुरुषर्षभ । अतश्चैवाहमादिष्टा वने वस्तव्यमित्यपि ।।
data.es: A wife alone, O best of men shares the destiny of her husband. I am also therefore, ordered to dwell in the forest. ( a command to you is a command to me).
data.anv: पुरुषर्षभ O best of men, (Rama), भर्तुर्भाग्यं the destiny of husband, एका only, भार्या wife, प्राप्नोति receives, अतश्च therefore, अहमपि I also, वने in the forest, वस्तव्यमिति should dwell, अदिष्टा एव ordered.
data.md: Oh dear husband, father, mother, son, brother, daughter-in-law, all of them abide by the consequences of their own actions, it is the wife alone, Oh best of men, that shares the fate of her husband; it is therefore that ever along with you I have been ordered to live in the forest.

data.v: न पिता नात्मजो नात्मा न माता न सखीजनः । इह प्रेत्य च नारीणां पतिरेको गतिः सदा ।।
data.es: It is not her father or mother, nor her son or herself, nor her friends but her husband alone gives a woman the permanent refuge in this or in the next world.
data.anv: पिता father, न not, आत्मजः son, न not, आत्मा own self, न not, माता mother, न not, सखीजनः friends, न not, नारीणाम् for women, इह here, प्रेत्य च in the next world also, सदा always, एकः alone, पतिः husband, गतिः is the ultimate refuge.
data.md: Neither father, mother, son, friends, nor her ownself is the stay of a woman in this or in after life, it is the husband along that is her only support.

data.v: यदि त्वं प्रस्थितो दुर्गं वनमद्यैव राघव । अग्रतस्ते गमिष्यामि मृद्नन्ती कुशकण्टकान् ।।
data.es: O son of the Raghus if you set out for the impenetrable forest now itself, I shall also go, walking ahead of you and crushing the thorns and (spiky) kusa grass (rendering the path comfortable for you to walk).
data.anv: राघव son of the Raghus (Rama), अद्यैव now itself, त्वम् you, दुर्गम् impenetrable, वनम् forest, प्रस्थितः यदि if you set out, कुशकण्टकान् on thorns and on Kusa grass, मृद्नन्ती crushing, ते अग्रतः in front of you, गमिष्यामि I shall go.
data.md: If do you repair today to the forest impregnable, I shall go before you, oh Rāghava, treading upon the thorns and prickly grass.

data.v: ईर्ष्यारोषौ बहिष्कृत्य भुक्तशेषमिवोदकम् । नय मां वीर विश्रब्धः पापं मयि न विद्यते ।।
data.es: Do take me with you, O valiant one without hesitation. Dismiss all anger and envy (from your mind) like the leftover water after drinking (anger because she disobeys and envy because she, too, like Rama, is willing to brave the hazards of forest life). There is no fault on my part.
data.anv: वीर O Valiant one, ईर्ष्यारोषौ anger and jealousy, भुक्तशेषम् leftover after drinking, उदकम् इव like water, बहिष्कृत्य dismissing, विस्रब्ध: without hesitation, माम् me, नय take me, मयि in me, पापम् fault, न विद्यते does not exist.
data.md: Confident do you take me with you, Oh great hero, renouncing jealousy and indignation, like to water left after drinking; there exists no sin in me that could justify forsaking.

data.v: प्रासादाग्रैर्विमानैर्वा वैहायसगतेन वा । सर्वावस्थागता भर्तुः पादच्छाया विशिष्यते ।।
data.es: Every woman, everywhere be it on the top of mansions or in lovely palaces or flying in the sky should take shelter at his (her husband's) feet (or follow his footsteps).
data.anv: प्रासादाग्रैः on top of mansions, विमानैर्वा or in lovely palaces, वैहायसगतेन वा moving in air, सर्वावस्थागता in all stages of  life, भर्तुः husband's, पादच्छाया shelter at his feet, विशिष्यते is preferable.
data.md: To woman is preferable under all circumstances the shade of her husband's feet to the tops of a palace, the celestial car or excursion in the airy path.* *It was generally believed that by certain processes of Yoga one acquired power to fly in the air.

data.v: अनुशिष्टास्मि मात्रा च पित्रा च विविधाश्रयम् । नास्मि संप्रति वक्तव्या वर्तितव्यं यथा मया ।।
data.es: I have been so instructed by my parents about diverse duties in all stages of life that I need not be told anything (about my duties) now.
data.anv: मात्रा च by mother, पित्रा च by father, विविधाश्रयम् with regard to diverse duties,  अनुशिष्टाअस्मि I have been instructed, मया by myself, यथा in such a way, वर्तितव्यम् to abide, संप्रति now, वक्तव्या नास्मि need not be told to me.
data.md: I have been taught by my father and mother to follow my husband in all conditions of life; and I shall carry out now what I have been taught; I shall not abide by any other counsel.

data.v: सुखं वने निवत्स्यामि यथैव भवने पितुः । अचिन्तयन्ती त्रीँल्लोकांश्चिन्तयन्ती पतिव्रतम् ।।
data.es: Free from any anxiety about the three worlds, my only concern will be my duties towards my husband. I shall dwell as happily in the forest as I did in my father's abode.
data.anv: त्रीन् लोकान् the three worlds, अचिन्तयन्ती without thinking, पतिव्रतम् duties to the husband, चिन्तयन्ती while thinking, वने in the forest, पितुः father's, भवने in the palace, यथैव the same way, सुखम् happily, निवत्स्यामि I shall dwell.
data.md: Happily shall I live there as if in my paternal house, giving no thought upon the prosperity of the three worlds, thinking only of the services that are to be rendered to my husband.

data.v: शुश्रूषमाणा ते नित्यं नियता ब्रह्मचारिणी । सह रंस्ये त्वया वीर वनेषु मधुगन्धिषु ।।
data.es: I shall wander with you, O heroic Rama in the honeyscented forest remaining selfpossessed, always doing your service, and observing the vow of celibacy.
data.anv: वीर O hero , नित्यम् always, ते to you, शुश्रूषमाणा doing service, नियता self possessed, ब्रह्मचारिणी observing vow of celibacy, मधुगन्धिषु honeyscented, वनेषु in forests, त्वया सह with you, रंस्ये I shall sport.
data.md: I shall sport with you, O great hero, in that forest impregnated with the fragrance of flowers, tending you constantly, having my senses subdued, and being engaged in austere performances.

data.v: त्वं हि कर्तुं वने शक्तो राम संपरिपालनम् । अन्यस्यापि जनस्येह किं पुनर्मम मानद ।।
data.es: O respector of individuals when you are capable of protecting other people in the forest, what of me?
data.anv: मानद O bestower of honour, राम Rama, त्वम् you, इह here, वने in the forest, अन्यस्य of others, जनस्य man's, सम्परिपालनमपि protection also, कर्तुम् to do, शक्त: हि is capable, मम about my protection, किं पुनः why again say?
data.md: Oh great hero, capable are you to maintain many thousand others in the forest, what of me.

data.v: फलमूलाशना नित्यं भविष्यामि न संशयः । न ते दुःखं करिष्यामि निवसन्ती सह त्वया ।।
data.es: Do not doubt that I shall not be able to live on fruits and roots or that I will create difficulty for you while living with you.
data.anv: नित्यम् always, फलमूलाशना living on fruits and roots, भविष्यामि I will become, संशयः  न no doubt, त्वया सह with you, निवसन्ती while living, ते to you, दुःखम् hardship, न करिष्यामि  will not do.
data.md: Undoubtedly I shall always live upon roots and fruits, living with you always I shall not bring about your affliction.

data.v: इच्छामि सरितः शैलान्पल्वलानि वनानि च । द्रष्टुं सर्वत्र निर्भीता त्वया नाथेन धीमता ।।
data.es: Living with you sans fear, O my sagacious husband, I wish to see the rivers, mountains, lakes and forests here and there.
data.anv: धीमता with the sagacious, नाथेन by my lord, त्वया along with you, सर्वत्र everywhere, निर्भीता  without fear, सरितः rivers, शैलान् mountains, पल्वलानि lakes and, वनानि च and the forests, द्रष्टुम् to see, इच्छामि I wish.

data.v: हंसकारण्डवाकीर्णाः पद्मिनीः साधुपुष्पिताः । इच्छेयं सुखिनी द्रष्टुं त्वया वीरेण संगता ।।
data.es: I wish to enjoy the lotus lakes in full bloom, abounding in swans and ducks in the company of a brave husband like you.
data.anv: वीरेण by a warrior (like you), त्वया with you, सङ्गता in company of, सुखिनी happy, हंसकारण्डवाकीर्णाः abounding in swans and ducks, साधु पुष्पिताः fully bloomed, पद्मिनी: lotus ponds, द्रष्टुम् to see, इच्छेयम् I wish.

data.v: सह त्वया विशालाक्ष रंस्ये परमनन्दिनी । एवं वर्षसहस्राणां शतं वाहं त्वया सह ।।
स्वर्गेऽपि च विना वासो भविता यदि राघव । त्वया मम नरव्याघ्र नाहं तमपि रोचये ।।
data.es: O Raghava, tiger among men, if I were given heaven to live in without you, even that I shall not covet.
data.anv: नरव्याघ्र O best of men, राघव Rama, त्वया विना without you, मम to me, स्वर्गेऽपि even in heaven, वासः living, भविता यदि if it were to happen, अहम् I, तमपि that one also, न रोचये I do not like.

data.v: अहं गमिष्यामि वनं सुदुर्गमं; मृगायुतं वानरवारणैर्युतम् । वने निवत्स्यामि यथा पितुर्गृहे; तवैव पादावुपगृह्य संमता ।।
data.es: I shall go (along with you) to the highly impenetrable forest infested with animals like monkeys and elephants. I shall live in the forest in (full) discipline as in my father's abode, taking shelter at your feet.
data.anv: अहम् I, सुदुर्गमम् highly impenetrable, मृगायुतम् full of animals, वानरवारणैः with monkeys and elephants, वनम् to the forest, गमिष्यामि shall go, तव your, पादावेव feet alone, उपगृह्य taking refuge, संयता restraining myself, वने in the forest, पितुः father's, गृहे यथा like in his house, निवत्स्यामि I shall reside.
data.md: I shall go there in that dense forest full of deers, monkeys and elephants and live there as if under my paternal roof cleaving to your feet and abiding in your pleasure.

data.v: अनन्यभावामनुरक्तचेतसं; त्वया वियुक्तां मरणाय निश्चिताम् । नयस्व मां साधु कुरुष्व याचनां; न ते मयातो गुरुता भविष्यति ।।
data.es: Since I have no thought other than you and my heart is (irretrievably) attached to you I have resolved to die if separated from you. Pray, be favourably disposed to take me. I shall not be a burden to you.
data.anv: अनन्यभावाम् without any other thought, अनुरक्तचेतसम् with heart deeply attached, त्वया by you, वियुक्ताम् separated (from you), मरणाय for death, निश्चिताम् resolved, माम् me, नयस्व take, याचनाम् my prayer, साधु be welldisposed, कुरुष्व do, अतः for that, ते for you, मया by me, गुरुता burden, न भविष्यति will not be.
data.md: Do you accept my entreaty whose heart is entirely yours, knows none else, and is ever attached to you, and who am resolved to die if forsaken by you; thus repairing I shall be in no way a burden to you.

data.v: तथा ब्रुवाणामपि धर्मवत्सलो; न च स्म सीतां नृवरो निनीषति । उवाच चैनां बहु संनिवर्तने; वने निवासस्य च दुःखितां प्रति ।।
data.es: Although Sita was thus appealing, Rama, devoted to righteousness, was (still) unwilling to take her. In order to dissuade her, he began to describe to the mournful Sita the many hardships of forest life.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे सप्तविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyseventh sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: धर्मवत्सलः devoted to righteousness, नृवरः best of men, तथा that way, ब्रूवाणामपि though speaking, सीताम् tp Sita, न निनीषति स्म was unwilling to take, सन्निवर्तने  to dissuade her, एनाम् to her, वने in the forest, निवासस्य of stay, दुःखितां प्रति to the grieved, बहु in many ways, उवाच च said.
data.md: That best of men, reluctant to take Sītā with him, who had spoken thus and who was greatly attached to virtue, related to her about the many miseries consequent upon dwelling in the forest, with a view to prevent her from following him.

data.v: स एवं ब्रुवतीं सीतां धर्मज्ञो धर्मवत्सलः । निवर्तनार्थे धर्मात्मा वाक्यमेतदुवाच ह ।।
data.es: Rama, who knew his duties and was devoted to righteousness, reflected on the difficulties of forest (life) and did not agree to take Sita even though she was pleading the way she did.
data.anv: धर्मज्ञः knower of righteousness, धर्मवत्सलः devoted to righteousness, सः he, एवम् thus, ब्रुवतीम् speaking, सीताम् to Sita, नेतुम् to take, बुद्धिम् decision, वने in the forest, दुःखानि difficulties, चिन्तयन् while reflecting so, न कुरुते did not make.
data.md: And consoling her whose eyes were stained with tears, that virtuous-souled one spoke to her the following words with a view to prevent her from going.

data.v: सीते महाकुलीनासि धर्मे च निरता सदा । इहाचर स्वधर्मं त्वं मा यथा मनसः सुखम् ।।
data.es: Born in a noble race, O Sita, you are always devoted to duty. Follow your duty, here. It will make me happy.
data.anv: सीते O Sita, महाकुलीना born in a noble race, सदा always, धर्मे to duty ,निरता असि you are devoted, इह here, यथा as, मे मनसः to my mind, सुखम् brings happiness, त्वम् you, स्वधर्मम् your duty, आचर practise.
data.md: Oh Sītā, you are born of an illustrious family and ever intent on the performance of religious deeds; do you practise virtue here as it may conduce to the happiness of my mind.

data.v: सीते यथा त्वां वक्ष्यामि तथा कार्यं त्वयाबले । वने दोषा हि बहवो वदतस्तान्निबोध मे ।।
data.es: Do as I tell you, O delicate Sita. There are, indeed, many hardships in the forest. I shall tell you all about them. Listen to me.
data.anv: अबले O frail one, सीते O Sita, त्वाम् you, यथा as, वक्ष्यामि I shall tell you, तथा like that, त्वया by you, कार्यम् should be done, वने in the forest, बहवः many, दोषाः हि hardships are there indeed, वदतः being told, मे by me, तान् about them, निबोध pray attention.
data.md: Oh Sītā, Oh you of the weaker sex, Do you act up to my counsels; there are evils enough in the forest, do you learn them from me who am about to dwell in it.

data.v: सीते विमुच्यतामेषा वनवासकृता मतिः । बहुदोषं हि कान्तारं वनमित्यभिधीयते ।।
data.es: Give up the desire to live in the forest, O Sita Living in the dreary jungle, it is said, has many hardships.
data.anv: सीते O Sita, वनवासकृता to live in the forest, एषा this, मति: mind, विमुच्यताम् give up, कान्तारम् a dreary forest, वनम् forest, बहुदोषं (बहुदोषयुतं) has many hardships, अभिधीयते हि is being said.
data.md: Renounce therefore, Oh Sītă, your intention of flying as an exile to the forest, which for its impenetrableness is said to abound in evils.

data.v: हितबुद्ध्या खलु वचो मयैतदभिधीयते । सदा सुखं न जानामि दुःखमेव सदा वनम् ।।
data.es: I am saying all this in your interest. The forest is a haven of hardships. I know of no happiness in the forest.
data.anv: मया by me, एतत् वचः these words, हितबुद्ध्या with prudence, अभिधीयते हि is being said, वनम् forest, सदा always, सुखम् as happy, न जानामि I do not know, सदा always, दुःखमेव grief only.
data.md: It is for your welfare that I give utterance to these words; happiness there is none, it is always covered with miseries.

data.v: गिरिनिर्झरसंभूता गिरिकन्दरवासिनाम् । सिंहानां निनदा दुःखाः श्रोतुं दुःखमतो वनम् ।।
data.es: It is frightening to hear the sounds of waterfalls and the roar of lions living in the mountain caves. Therefore forest life is painful (fearful).
data.anv: गिरिनिर्झरसम्भूताः arising from the falling waters from mountains, निनदाः sounds, गिरिकन्दर वासिनाम् living in the mountain caves, सिंहानाम् of lions, श्रोतुम् to hear, दुःखाः fearful, अतः therefore, वनम् forest, दुःखम् source of  pain, दुःखमतो painful.
data.md: The roarings of the lions living in the caves of mountains, swelling with the sounds of the water-falls, produce a very painful impression upon the ears; so the wood is full of misery.

data.v: सुप्यते पर्णशय्यासु स्वयं भग्नासु भूतले । रात्रिषु श्रमखिन्नेन तस्माद्दुःखतरं वनम् ।।
data.anv: स्वयम् on their own, भग्नासु broken (fallen), पर्णशय्यासु bed of leaves, भूतले on the ground, श्रमखिन्नेन exhausted with struggles, रात्रिषु at night, सुप्यते will have to sleep, तस्मात्  therefore, वनम् forest life, दुःखतरम् is extremely painful.
data.md: Being exhausted with the toil of the day, the dwellers of the wood have to sleep in night on the bed made of leaves fallen from the trees on the surface of the ground; so the wood is full of misery.

data.v: उपवासश्च कर्तव्या यथाप्राणेन मैथिलि । जटाभारश्च कर्तव्यो वल्कलाम्बरधारिणा ।।
data.es: One has to wear robes of bark and matted hair and take to fasting as long as one can, O daughter of Mithila
data.anv: मैथिलि O Daughter of Mithila, यथाप्राणेन according to one's ability, उपवासश्च fasting also, कर्तव्यः has to be undertaken, वल्कलाम्बरधारिणा wearing robes of bark, जटाभारश्च also burden of matted hair, कर्तव्यः has to be borne.

data.v: अतीव वातस्तिमिरं बुभुक्षा चात्र नित्यशः । भयानि च महान्त्यत्र ततो दुःखतरं वनम् ।।
data.es: There is extreme wind and darkness, hunger and fear. Therefore forest (life) is difficult.
data.anv: अत्र there (in the forest), वाताः wind, तिमिरम् darkness, अतीव is extreme, नित्यशः always, बुभुक्षा hunger, महान्ति great, भयानि च fears also, ततः therefore, वनम् forest life, दुःखतरम् is extremely difficult.
data.md: There are always violent winds, darkness hunger, and great fear; so the wood is full of misery.

data.v: सरीसृपाश्च बहवो बहुरूपाश्च भामिनि । चरन्ति पृथिवीं दर्पादतो दुखतरं वनम् ।।
data.es: There are various forms of fierce reptiles fearlessly crawling on the ground. So (living in the) forest is extremely dangerous.
data.anv: भामिनि O Beautiful lady, बहुरूपाः च of various forms too, बहवः many, सरीसृपाः च reptiles also, दर्पात् fiercely, पृथिवीम् on the ground, चरन्ति move about, ततः therefore, वनम् to live in the forest, दुःखतरं is extremely dangerous.
data.md: Reptiles, many and of various kinds, creep there on the path, O excellent lady, with haughtiness; so the wood is full of misery.

data.v: नदीनिलयनाः सर्पा नदीकुटिलगामिनः । तिष्ठन्त्यावृत्य पन्थानमतो दुःखतरं वनम् ।।
data.es: The serpents that live in and move like meandering rivers always obstruct the paths. Therefore, living in the forest is tremendously difficult.
data.anv: नदी निलयनाः live in rivers, नदीकुटिलगामिनः meandering like rivers, सर्पाः serpents, पन्थानम् the path, आवृत्य having obstructed, तिष्ठन्ति stay, ततः therefore, वनम् life in the forest, दुःखतरम् is full of sufferings.
data.md: And snakes living in the rivers and of crooked course like them, always await the wayfarers, hindering the passers-by: so the wood is full of misery.

data.v: पतंगा वृश्चिकाः कीटा दंशाश्च मशकैः सह । बाधन्ते नित्यमबले सर्वं दुःखमतो वनम् ।।
data.es: Birds, scorpions, insects, gnats and mosquitoes always create trouble. Therefore, life in the forest is all suffering.
data.anv: पतङ्गा: birds, वृश्चिकाः scorpions, कीटाः insects, मशकैः सह with mosquitoes, दंशाश्च gnats, नित्यम् always, सर्वम् everyone, बाधन्ते trouble,  अतः therefore, वनम् the life in forest, दुःखम् is a source of suffering.
data.md: Birds, scorpions, insects mosquito's and wild gnats, always disturb the dwellers, O fair one' of the weaker sex; so the wood is full misery.

data.v: द्रुमाः कण्टकिनश्चैव कुशकाशाश्च भामिनि । वने व्याकुलशाखाग्रास्तेन दुःखतरं वनम् ।।
data.es: O lovely Sita there are thorny trees with branches on the top interlaced with one another. There are kusa grass and reeds. So forest life is very hard.
data.anv: भामिनि O lovely Sita, वने in the forest, द्रुमाः trees, कुशा काशाः च kusa grass and reeds,  कण्टकिनश्चैव thorny ones, व्याकुलशाखाग्राः with tops of branches interlaced with each other, तेन therefore, वनम् forest life, दुःखतरम् is full of difficulties.
data.md: There are trees full of thorns, having their branches moving to and fro, and the kusa and kāsa grasses with thorny blades constantly undulating; so the wood is full misery.

data.v: तदलं ते वनं गत्वा क्षमं न हि वनं तव । विमृशन्निह पश्यामि बहुदोषतरं वनम् ।।
data.es: Thus forest life is not suitable for you. On reconsideration, I see that there are many dangers in forest life.
data.anv: तत् for that reason, ते to you, वनम् to the forest, गत्वा going, अलम् is not desirable, तव for you, वनम् forest life, क्षमम् न हि is not fit, इह now, विमृशन् while reconsidering, वनम् forest life, बहुदोषतरम् is full of great dangers, पश्यामि I see.
data.md: You should not therefore go to the forest, it forebodes no good to you. Weighing well, have I concluded that the forest abounds in innumerable evils.

data.v: वनं तु नेतुं न कृता मतिस्तदा; बभूव रामेण यदा महात्मना । न तस्य सीता वचनं चकार त;त्ततोऽब्रवीद्राममिदं सुदुःखिता ।।
data.es: When the great Rama decided not to take her along with him to the forest, Sita, deeply grieved said these words.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे अष्टाविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyeighth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: महात्मना by the great, रामेण by Rama, यदा when, वनम् to the forest, नेतुम् to take, मतिः mind (decision), कृता has been made, न बभूव did not happen, तदा then, सीता Sita, तस्य his, तत्  that, वचनं words, न चकार did not follow, ततः threafter, सुदुःखिता deeply grieved, रामम् to Rama, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: While the high-souled Rāma, resolved thus not to take Sītā with him to the forest, she, greatly sorry, did not accept his words and spoke to him in the following way.

data.v: एतत्तु वचनं श्रुत्वा सीता रामस्य दुःखिता । प्रसक्ताश्रुमुखी मन्दमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having heard them king Dasaratha, pretending as though he was not aware of their heart's desire but was now wishing to ascertain it, spoke these words:
data.anv: सीता Sita, रामस्य Rama's, एतत् these, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा तु having heard, दुःखिता sad, प्रसक्ताश्रुमुखी with tears flowing incessantly from her face, मन्दम् in a faint  voice, इदं वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Hearing these words of Rāma, Sītā greatly sorry, with tears in her eyes, spoke gently to him the following words.

data.v: ये त्वया कीर्तिता दोषा वने वस्तव्यतां प्रति । गुणानित्येव तान्विद्धि तव स्नेहपुरस्कृतान् ।।
data.es: Understand that the difficulties of forest life described by you will be turned into advantages if they are accompanied by your affection.
data.anv: वने in the forest, वस्तव्यतां प्रति about dwelling in the forest, त्वया by you, ये those, दोषाः difficulties, कीर्तिताः described, तव your, स्नेहपुरस्कृतान् accompanied by your affection, तान् them, गुणानित्येव as virtues only, विद्धि understand.
data.md: The evils, thus enumerated by you of living in the forest, do you know, appear as so many good qualities to me, who have been made forward by your affection.

data.v: त्वया च सह गन्तव्यं मया गुरुजनाज्ञया । त्वद्वियोगेन मे राम त्यक्तव्यमिह जीवितम् ।।
data.es: In accordance with the command of the elders, I must accompany you to the forest. If I am separated from you, I will give up my life here itself.
data.anv: गुरुजनाज्ञया with the command of elders, त्वया सह along with you, मया च गन्तव्यम् I should follow, राम Rama, त्वद्वियोगेन if separated from you, मे my, जीवितम् life, इह here, त्यक्तव्यम् will have to be given up.
data.md: I shall follow you, taking the permission of the respected ones, without you, O, Rāma, I will renounce my life.

data.v: न च मां त्वत्समीपस्थमपि शक्नोति राघव । सुराणामीश्वरः शक्रः प्रधर्षयितुमोजसा ।।
data.es: If I am in your company, O Rama even the lord of the gods, Indra with all his might will not be able to hurt me.
data.anv: राघव O Rama, त्वत्समीवस्थाम् in your company, माम् me, सुराणाम् for gods, ईश्वरः lord, शक्र:  अपि even Indra, ओजसा with his might, प्रधर्षयितुम् to injure, न शक्नोति will not be able
data.md: If I live by you, O Rāghava, Sakra, the lord of celestials, shall not be able with his mighty power to defeat me.

data.v: पतिहीना तु या नारी न सा शक्ष्यति जीवितुम् । काममेवंविधं राम त्वया मम विदर्शितम् ।।
data.es: Your salutary instruction to me, O Rama, is 'A woman cannot live without her husband'. This truth is greatly applicable to me.
data.anv: या नारी a woman, पतिहीना without her husband, सा she, जीवितुम् to live, न शक्ष्यति cannot live, राम Rama, त्वया by you, कामम् greatly, एवं विधम् in this manner, मम to me, निदर्शितम्  has been illustrated.
data.md: 'A woman, without her husband, cannot live' this truth has been pointed out by you. O Rāma, to me.

data.v: अथ चापि महाप्राज्ञ ब्राह्मणानां मया श्रुतम् । पुरा पितृगृहे सत्यं वस्तव्यं किल मे वने ।।
data.es: O highly sagacious Rama I had also heard in my father's house long ago, from brahmins prophesing that some day I shall have certainly to dwell in the forest.
data.anv: महाप्राज्ञ O Sagacious one, अथ चापि moreover, पुरा formerly, पितृगृहे at my father's  house, मया by me, ब्राह्माणानाम् brahmins' (word), श्रुतम् has been heard, मे about me, सत्यम् in sooth, वने in the forest, वस्तव्यं किल to dwell certainly.
data.md: Besides, I heard before, O you of great intelligence, in my paternal house from the Brāhmaṇas that I should live in the forest.

data.v: लक्षणिभ्यो द्विजातिभ्यः श्रुत्वाहं वचनं गृहे । वनवासकृतोत्साहा नित्यमेव महाबल ।।
data.es: O mighty hero ever since I heard the prophesies from the brahmin palmists I am yearning to dwell in the forest.
data.anv: महाबल O mighty one, अहम् I, पुरा long ago, लक्षणिभ्यः from palmist, द्विजातिभ्यः from brahmins, वचनम् words, शृत्वा having heard, नित्यमेव always, वनवासकृतोत्साहा I have become eager to dwell in the forest.
data.md: I have heard this from the Brāhmaṇas versed in palmistry, and I have all along been anxious.

data.v: आदेशो वनवासस्य प्राप्तव्यः स मया किल । सा त्वया सह तत्राहं यास्यामि प्रिय नान्यथा ।।
data.es: Therefore, O my beloved I must certainly obtain such a command to dwell in the forest. I must accompany you to the forest and it cannot be otherwise.
data.anv: प्रिय O beloved Rama, मया by me, वनवासस्य to dwell in the forest, सः आदेशः such orders, प्राप्तव्यः किल certainly needs to be obtained, सा अहम् such I am, त्वया सह along with you, तत्र there, यास्यामि I shall accompany, अन्यथा न not otherwise.
data.md: O mighty hero, to go to the forest; I shall therefore obtain permission and go, O dearly beloved to the forest with you; nothing can make it otherwise.

data.v: कृतादेशा भविष्यामि गमिष्यामि सह त्वया । कालश्चायं समुत्पन्नः सत्यवाग्भवतु द्विजः ।।
data.es: I will go with you, true to the prediction of the brahmin. That time has come and let his prediction come to pass.
data.anv: कृतादेशा carrying out the orders, भविष्यामि I shall become, त्वया सह along with you, गमिष्यामि shall go, अयम् this, कालश्च time, समुत्पन्नः has come, द्विज: brahmin, सत्यवाक् true to his words, भवतु let him be.
data.md: I shall secure permission and follow you; the time has arrived; may the Brāhmaṇas be of truthful words.

data.v: वनवासे हि जानामि दुःखानि बहुधा किल । प्राप्यन्ते नियतं वीर पुरुषैरकृतात्मभिः ।।
data.es: I am aware, O valiant one, that there are hardships of every kind in forest life. But they befall those whose senses are not under their control.
data.anv: वीर O valiant one, वनवासे while residing in the forest, दुःखानि hardships, बहुथा किल  certainly of every kind, अभिजानामि I am aware, अकृतात्मभिः by those whose senses are not under their control, पुरुषैः by men, नियतम् definitely, प्राप्यन्ते will be experienced.
data.md: I know, O great hero, that there are many evils incident to living in the forest; but they generally befall those men who have not their senses subdued.

data.v: कन्यया च पितुर्गेहे वनवासः श्रुतो मया । भिक्षिण्याः साधुवृत्ताया मम मातुरिहाग्रतः ।।
data.es: When I was young in my father's house, a holy female mendicant foretold in the presence of my mother that I would dwell in the forest (in this life).
data.anv: पितुः father's, गेहे in the house, कन्यया when I was young, मया by me, मम मातुः my mother's, अग्रतः in the presence, साधुवृत्तायाः a saint, भिक्षिण्या a female mendicant, इह  in this world, वनवासः forest life, श्रुतः heard.
data.md: I heard, when I was a girl, that an ascetic woman of well-disciplined character, came to my mother and apprised her of my future abode in the forest.

data.v: प्रसादितश्च वै पूर्वं त्वं वै बहुविधं प्रभो । गमनं वनवासस्य काङ्क्षितं हि सह त्वया ।।
data.es: Pleased with my long entreaties in the past to dwell with you in the forest, O lord, you had granted my desire.
data.anv: प्रभो O Lord, पूर्वम् in the past, त्वम् you, बहुतिथम् for a long time, मे for me, प्रसादितश्च वै  favoured, त्वया सह along with you, वनवासस्य गमनम् to go to the forest, काङ्क्षितं हि is wished for.
data.md: I had requested you, O my lord, many times before in this house to take me to the forest with you for enjoyment, and you ware pleased to agree.

data.v: कृतक्षणाहं भद्रं ते गमनं प्रति राघव । वनवासस्य शूरस्य चर्या हि मम रोचते ।।
data.es: Since then I have been counting time for this forest life. It pleases me to follow my valiant hero as he lives in the forest. Rama, prosperity to you
data.anv: राघव Rama, ते to you, वनवासस्य of forest life, गमनं प्रति about departure, अहम् I, कृतक्षणा counting time, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you, शूरस्य of a valiant one,  चर्या movement, मम to me, रोचते हि is pleasing.
data.md: For your welfare, O Raghava, having received your permission to follow you, I like to serve you, O great hero, while living in the forest.

data.v: शुद्धात्मन्प्रेमभावाद्धि भविष्यामि विकल्मषा । भर्तारमनुगच्छन्ती भर्ता हि मम दैवतम् ।।
data.es: O my purehearted one by following my husband with love I shall become sinless, because my husband is my god.
data.anv: शुद्धात्मन् O purehearted one, प्रेमभावात् with feeling of love, भर्तारम् husband, अनुगच्छन्ती following, विकल्मषा sinless, भविष्यामि I shall become, भर्ता husband, मम to me, दैवतं हि is a god.
data.md: O you, pure-hearted one, surely shall I become sinless if I follow my husband, out of affection; for my husband is my Divinity.

data.v: प्रेत्यभावेऽपि कल्याणः संगमो मे सह त्वया । श्रुतिर्हि श्रूयते पुण्या ब्राह्मणानां यशस्विनाम् ।।
data.es: My union with you, O highminded one, is auspicious even beyond death. A woman, given away by her parents in accordance with traditional offerings of water belongs to him even after death and lives with him. This is a statement from the Vedas quoted by famous brahmins.
data.anv: प्रेत्यभावेऽपि even after death, त्वया सह with you, मे to me, कल्याणः auspiciousness, सङ्गमः union, यशस्विनाम् by the famous, ब्राह्मणानाम् brahmins', पुण्या pious, श्रुतिः statement from the Vedas, श्रूयते is heard, महामते O highminded one, या स्त्री that woman, इह लोके in this world, पितृभिः by parents, यस्य to whom, स्वधर्मेण in accordance with one's own tradition, अद्भि: with waters, दत्ता is given, प्रेत्यभावेऽपि even after death, सा she, तस्य belongs to him.
data.md: I have heard this pious report from the Brāhmaṇas of great fame that even in after life your company is greatly beneficial to me.

data.v: इह लोके च पितृभिर्या स्त्री यस्य महामते । अद्भिर्दत्ता स्वधर्मेण प्रेत्यभावेऽपि तस्य सा ।।
data.es: My union with you, O highminded one, is auspicious even beyond death. A woman, given away by her parents in accordance with traditional offerings of water belongs to him even after death and lives with him. This is a statement from the Vedas quoted by famous brahmins.
data.anv: प्रेत्यभावेऽपि even after death, त्वया सह with you, मे to me, कल्याणः auspiciousness, सङ्गमः union, यशस्विनाम् by the famous, ब्राह्मणानाम् brahmins', पुण्या pious, श्रुतिः statement from the Vedas, श्रूयते is heard, महामते O highminded one, या स्त्री that woman, इह लोके in this world, पितृभिः by parents, यस्य to whom, स्वधर्मेण in accordance with one's own tradition, अद्भि: with waters, दत्ता is given, प्रेत्यभावेऽपि even after death, सा she, तस्य belongs to him.
data.md: She, who has been given away as wife by her father to one, with due rites of gift peculiar to each class, touching holy water, shall be his, even in her after life.

data.v: एवमस्मात्स्वकां नारीं सुवृत्तां हि पतिव्रताम् । नाभिरोचयसे नेतुं त्वं मां केनेह हेतुना ।।
data.es: Why don't you want to take to the forest your own wife who is loyal and devoted, and is of good conduct.
data.anv: त्वम् you, केन हेतुना for what reason, इह now, एवम् this way, सुवृत्ताम् a woman of good conduct, पतिव्रताम् faithful and loyal wife, स्वकां नारीम् your own woman, माम् me, अस्मात्  from this place, नेतुम् to take, नाभिरोचयसे you are not willing.
data.md: For what reason then did you not wish to take your wife with you who is of good character and devoted to her husband? Do you take me.

data.v: भक्तां पतिव्रतां दीनां मां समां सुखदुःखयोः । नेतुमर्हसि काकुत्स्थ समानसुखदुःखिनीम् ।।
data.es: O Rama, I am faithful and devoted to you. I have equal disposition to happiness and sorrow. I equally share your prosperity and adversity. Therefore, you should take your wife (to the forest). In this time of distress.
data.anv: काकुत्थ्स O descendant of Kakutstha, भक्ताम् devotee, पतिव्रताम् faithful to the husband, दीनां distressed, सुखदुःखयोः in happines and sorrow, समाम् having equal disposition, समान सुख दुःखिनीम् equally share your prosperity and adversity, माम् me, नेतुम् अर्हसि should take.
data.md: O Kākutstha, who am poor in spirit, devoted to my husband, ever given to your service, and participating equally in your joy and sorrow.

data.v: यदि मां दुःखितामेवं वनं नेतुं न चेच्छसि । विषमग्निं जलं वाहमास्थास्ये मृत्युकारणात् ।।
data.es: If you do not wish to take your wife in this time of distress to the forest I shall die by consuming poison or throwing myself into fire or drowning in water.
data.anv: एवम् in this, दुःखिताम् distressed, माम् me, वनम् to the forest, नेतुम् to take, न च इच्छसि यदि if you do not wish, मृत्युकारणात् to seek death, विषम् poison, अग्निम् fire, जलं वा or water, आस्थास्ये I shall take refuge.
data.md: If you do not purpose to take me with you, surely will I do away with my life by drinking poison, entering into fire, or drowning myself in water.

data.v: एवं बहुविधं तं सा याचते गमनं प्रति । नानुमेने महाबाहुस्तां नेतुं विजनं वनम् ।।
data.es: Despite Sita's pleadings with him in various ways the mightyarmed Rama would not consent to take her to the desolate forest.
data.anv: एवम् in this way, सा she, गमनं प्रति about her departure, बहुविधम् in several ways, तम् him, याचते requested, महाबाहुः mightyarmed Rama, ताम् her, विजनम् desolate, वनम् forest, नेतुम्  to take, नानुमेने did not consent.
data.md: She begged Rāma in these and various other means to take her with him, but that mighty hero did not consent to lead her into the lonely forest.

data.v: एवमुक्ता तु सा चिन्तां मैथिली समुपागता । स्नापयन्तीव गामुष्णैरश्रुभिर्नयनच्युतैः ।।
data.es: Thus spoken to (prevented), Sita was filled with grief and cried, drenching the ground with warm tears that fell from her eyes.
data.anv: एवम् in this way, उक्ता spoken, सा मैथिली that daughter from Mithila, नयनच्युतैः fallen from her eyes, उष्णैः by warm, अश्रुभिः tears, गाम् the ground, स्नापयन्तीव as if drenching, चिन्ताम् grief, समुपागता obtained.
data.md: Being accosted thus, Maithili was wrapt up in thought and bathed her breast with tears trickling down from her eyes.
