data.v: चिन्तयन्तीं तथा तां तु निवर्तयितुमात्मवान् । क्रोधाविष्टां तु वैदेहीं काकुत्स्थो बह्वसान्त्वयत् ।।
data.es: That selfpossessed scion of the Kakutstha dynasty consoled the copperredlipped Sita in several ways to dissuade her (from going to the forest).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकोनत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyninth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: आत्मवान् selfpossessed, सः काकुत्स्थ: that scion of the Kakutstha dynasty, तथा that way, चिन्तयन्तीम् grieving, ताम्रोष्ठीम् to the lady with copperred lips, तां सीताम् to that Sita, तदा then, निवर्तयितम् to dissuade her (from going to the forest), बहु many ways, असान्त्वयत् consoled.
data.md: And Kākutstha having control over his ownself, with a view to dissuade her who was angry and engrossed in anxious thoughts, began to console her in divers way.

data.v: सान्त्व्यमाना तु रामेण मैथिली जनकात्मजा । वनवासनिमित्ताय भर्तारमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: In response to Rama's consolation with regard to her stay in the forest, the daughter of Janaka, Maithili (Sita) said:
data.anv: वनवासनिमित्ताय for stay in forest, रामेण by Rama, सान्त्व्यमाना consoled, जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, मैथिली Maithili, भर्तारम्   to husband, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Being consoled thus by Rāma, Maithilī, the daughter of Janaka, fearing separation, lovingly and haughtily laughed at Rāghava of spacious breast, and spoke to him, her husband, the following words with a view to follow him to the forest.

data.v: सा तमुत्तमसंविग्ना सीता विपुलवक्षसम् । प्रणयाच्चाभिमानाच्च परिचिक्षेप राघवम् ।।
data.es: Sita agitated over a supreme cause upbraided the broadchested scion of the Raghu race out of love and injured selfrespect.
data.anv: उत्तमसंविग्ना agitated for  a supreme cause, सा सीता that Sita, विपुल वक्षसम् man of broadchested, राघवम् scion of the Raghu dynasty, प्रणयात् out of love, अभिमानाच्च injured selfrespect, परिचिक्षेप blamed.
data.md: Being consoled thus by Rāma, Maithilī, the daughter of Janaka, fearing separation, lovingly and haughtily laughed at Rāghava of spacious breast, and spoke to him, her husband, the following words with a view to follow him to the forest.

data.v: किं त्वामन्यत वैदेहः पिता मे मिथिलाधिपः । राम जामातरं प्राप्य स्त्रियं पुरुषविग्रहम् ।।
data.es: O Rama while accepting you as soninlaw did my father, king of Mithila and lord of Videha ever think that you are a woman in the guise of a man?
data.anv: राम O Rama, पुरुषविग्रहम् in the form of a man, स्त्रियम् a woman, त्वा you, जामातरम् as  soninlaw, प्राप्य having obtained, मिथिलाधिपः king of Mithila, वैदेहः lord of Videha, मे पिता my father, किम् what, अमन्यत thought of.
data.md: What thought of you, O Rāma, my father, the king of Mithilā, accepting you as his son-in-law, who was a man if form but (in deeds)a woman?

data.v: अनृतं बललोकोऽयमज्ञानाद्यद्धि वक्ष्यति । तेजो नास्ति परं रामे तपतीव दिवाकरे ।।
data.es: Alas that will be a falschood if people out of ignorance say that there is no supreme splendour in Rama like the shining Sun.
data.anv: तपति in a blazing, दिवाकरे इव like in the Sun, रामे in Rama, परम् great, तेजः splendour, नास्ति is not  to be found, अयं लोकः this world, अज्ञानात् out of ignorance, वक्ष्यति यदि if they say so, then that one, अनृतम् is a falsehood, बत alas
data.md: Henceforth, if people through ignorance say that the sun has not that burning flood of light which in Rāma does shine forth, woe is them, it is falsehood.

data.v: किं हि कृत्वा विषण्णस्त्वं कुतो वा भयमस्ति ते । यत्परित्यक्तुकामस्त्वं मामनन्यपरायणाम् ।।
data.es: What may be the cause for your fear and depression behind your desire to desert one who is so exclusively devoted to you?
data.anv: त्वम् you, अनन्यपरायणाम् with none else as her refuge, माम् me, परित्यक्तुकामः (इति) यत् that you want to desert, त्वम् you, किं हि कृत्वा for what reason, विषण्णः depressed,  ते to you, कुतः वा from where, भयम् fear, अस्ति exists.
data.md: Why are you so dejected and whence is your fear that you are willing to leave behind your wife who has none else but you?

data.v: द्युमत्सेनसुतं वीर सत्यवन्तमनुव्रताम् । सावित्रीमिव मां विद्धि त्वमात्मवशवर्तिनीम् ।।
data.es: Know, O valiant one, that by remaining subordinate to you, I am as faithful to you as Savitri was to her husband, Satyavanta, son of Dyumatsena.
data.anv: वीर O valiant one, माम् me, द्युमत्सेन सुतम् son of Dyumatsena, सत्यवन्तम् Satyavanta, अनुव्रताम् faithfully following, सावित्रीमिव like Savitri, आत्मवशवर्तिनीम् remaining under your subordination, विद्धि know.
data.md: Know me to be perfectly under your influence like to Sāvitri, following her husband Satyavān, the son of Dyumatsen.

data.v: न त्वहं मनसाप्यन्यं द्रष्टास्मि त्वदृतेऽनघ । त्वया राघव गच्छेयं यथान्या कुलपांसनी ।।
data.es: O sinless son of the Raghus I am not like other women who bring disgreace to the family. I have not looked at any one except you, even with my mind's eye. I will go (to the forest) along with you.
data.anv: अनघ O sinless one, राघव Rama, कुलपांसनी a woman who bring disgrace to the family, अन्या यथा like any other ordinary woman, अहम् I, त्वदृते except you, अन्यम् other one, मनसापि even in mind, न द्रष्टास्मि not see, त्वया with you, गच्चेयम् I shall go to the forest.
data.md: I have not, like one bringing stigma on her line, ever in my life thought of a second person, but of you whom I must follow into the forest.

data.v: स्वयं तु भार्यां कौमारीं चिरमध्युषितां सतीम् । शैलूष इव मां राम परेभ्यो दातुमिच्छसि ।।
data.es: I have been living with you for a long time, O Rama I am young and chaste. Why do you, like an actor, wish to hand me over to others.
data.anv: राम O Rama कौमारीम् young, चिरम् for a long time, अध्युषिताम् living with you, सतीम् chaste, भार्याम् wife, माम् me, शैलूषः इव like an actor, स्वयम् on your own accord, परेभ्यः to others, दातुम् to give, इच्छसि wish.
data.md: Do you, like to an ordinary actor, wish to hand me over to others, who am chaste, pure as a virgin, and long held in conjugal affection?

data.v: स मामनादाय वनं न त्वं प्रस्थातुमर्हसि । तपो वा यदि वारण्यं स्वर्गो वा स्यात्सह त्वया ।।
data.es: You should not depart for the forest without taking me. Be it for penance or for the forest or for heaven, I wish to be with you.
data.anv: सः त्वम् such as you, माम् me, अनादाय without taking me, वनम् to the forest, प्रस्थातुम् to set forth, नार्हसि it does not behove you, तपो वा either for penance, यदि वा or, अरण्यम् to forest, स्वर्गो वा or to heaven, मे me, त्वया सह स्यात् to be with you.
data.md: It does not behove you to repair to the forest without taking me along with you. Be it the austerity of an ascetic, the forest or heaven, with you will I be everywhere.

data.v: न च मे भविता तत्र कश्चित्पथि परिश्रमः । पृष्ठतस्तव गच्छन्त्या विहारशयनेष्वपि ।।
data.es: While following you, I will feel no fatigue there on the way as if I am going on a pleasurestroll or in a comfortable couch.
data.anv: तव your, पृष्ठतः behind, गच्छन्त्याः going, मे to me, तत्र there, पथि on the way, विहारशयनेष्विव on a pleasure stroll or in a (luxurious) couch, कश्चित् even a little, परिश्रमः strain, न भविता will not be.
data.md: No toil shall I suffer on the way, as if lying on a bed of luxury, while following you in they footstep.

data.v: कुशकाशशरेषीका ये च कण्टकिनो द्रुमाः । तूलाजिनसमस्पर्शा मार्गे मम सह त्वया ।।
data.es: The white reeds, the kusha, the sara and the ishika grasses and thorny trees on the way will feel as soft as cotton or as the skin of a black antelope.
data.anv: त्वया सह along with you, मार्गे on the way, कुशकाशशरेषीकाः Kusha, white reeds, Sara and  Ishika grasses, कण्टकिनः thorny, ये द्रुमाः च other trees, तूलाजिन समस्पर्शाः shall feel like the touch of cotton and the skin of a black antelope.
data.md: When with you, the various thorny grasses, the Kuśa, the Käsa, the Sara, and the Işika, and the thistles and brambles on the way, shall be to me in touch like to linen and deer-skin.

data.v: महावातसमुद्धूतं यन्मामवकरिष्यति । रजो रमण तन्मन्ये परार्ध्यमिव चन्दनम् ।।
data.es: I shall regard, O charming Rama, the harmful dust raised by the stormy wind and settled on me as the most excellent sandal powder.
data.anv: रमण O Charming one महावातसमुद्धूतम् raised by the stormy wind, यत् which, रजः dust, माम् me, अपकरिष्यति will harm, तत् that one, परार्थ्यम् most excellent, चन्दनम् इव like sandal powder, मन्ये shall consider.
data.md: The dust that will cover me, thrown up by the gush of wind shall be, O ravisher of my heart regarded by me as the finest sandal dust.

data.v: शाद्वलेषु यदासिष्ये वनान्ते वनगोचरा । कुथास्तरणतल्पेषु किं स्यात्सुखतरं ततः ।।
data.es: O rover of the forest I will feel happier when I sleep on the meadows (of tender green grass) on the outskirts of the forest than when I sleep on the couch spread with carpets.
data.anv: वनगोचर Rover of the forest, वनान्ते on the outskirts of the forest,  शाद्वलेषु on the meadows (of tender green grass), यथा as, शिश्ये I will lie down, ततः more than that, कुथास्तरणतल्पेषु in the couch spread with carpets, सुखतरम् more comfortable, स्यात्किम् what shall be?
data.md: When I shall lie down on the bed of green grass in the forest, it shall appear to me more pleasant than one covered with a coloured blanket.

data.v: पत्रं मूलं फलं यत्त्वमल्पं वा यदि वा बहु । दास्यसि स्वयमाहृत्य तन्मेऽमृतरसोपमम् ।।
data.es: Whatever leaves or roots or fruits you collect with your own hands for me little or much, they will be nectar to me.
data.anv: त्वम् you, यत् whichever, पत्रम् leaf, मूलम् root, फलम् fruit, अल्पं वा even a little, यदि वा or,  बहु much, स्वयम् on your own, आहृत्य having collected, दास्यसि you will give me, तत् that one, मे to me, अमृतरसोपमम् like nectar, (भवेत् shall become).
data.md: Fruits, roots and leaves which you will bring yourself and give me, be they great or small in quantity, shall be to me like to the ambrosiajuice.

data.v: न मातुर्न पितुस्तत्र स्मरिष्यामि न वेश्मनः । आर्तवान्युपभुञ्जाना पुष्पाणि च फलानि च ।।
data.es: Enjoying the seasonal flowers and fruits in the forest, I will not remember my mother or father or home.
data.anv: तत्र there, आर्तवानि seasonal, पुष्पाणि flowers, फलानि च also fruits, उपभुञ्जाना while enjoying, मातुः mother, न स्मरिष्यामि will not remember, पितुः न not about father, वेश्मनः  about home, न will not.
data.md: I shall never think of my father, mother, or my abode; I shall enjoy fruits and flowers growing in various seasons.

data.v: न च तत्र गतः किंचिद्द्रष्टुमर्हसि विप्रियम् । मत्कृते न च ते शोको न भविष्यामि दुर्भरा ।।
data.es: Therefore, you should not anticipate any problem from me in the forest. Neither shall I be burdensome to you nor shall I make you experience any sorrow on my account.
data.anv: ततः for that reason, तत्र there, किञ्चित् even a little, विप्रियम् unpleasant, द्रष्टुम् to see, नार्हसि does not behove you, मत्कृते on my account, ते to you, शोकः sorrow, न will not come, दुर्भरा burden, न भविष्यामि I will not be.
data.md: You shall not witness any thing disagreeable there; for me you shall not experience any sorrow, no shall I be a burden to you; do you take me with you.

data.v: यस्त्वया सह स स्वर्गो निरयो यस्त्वया विना । इति जानन्परां प्रीतिं गच्छ राम मया सह ।।
data.es: Wherever I be with you is heaven and without, hell. O Rama, recognise this truth, and derive great pleasure in my company.
data.anv: त्वया सह in your company, यः that  which is obtained, सः that alone, स्वर्गः is heaven, त्वया विना without you, निरयः is hell, इति thus, जानन् while being aware, राम Rama, मया सह along with me, पराम् great, प्रीतिम् pleasure, गच्छ obtain.
data.md: O, Rāma, conceiving with pleasure that your company is a heaven to me and your absence a hell. If you do not take me to the forest which I count freed from all evils, surely I shall drink poison and never come under the influence of my enemies.

data.v: अथ मामेवमव्यग्रां वनं नैव नयिष्यसि । विषमद्यैव पास्यामि मा विशं द्विषतां वशम् ।।
data.es: If you do not take me to the forest without the least hesitation I shall consume poison right now, but not live under the control of enemies (at Ayodhya).
data.anv: अथ otherwise, एवम् in this way, अव्यग्राम् with unhesitant disposition, माम् me, वनम् to the forest, नैव नयिष्यति यदि if you do not at all take, अद्यैव rightaway, विषम् poison, पास्यामि will drink, द्विषताम् enemies', वशम् in the company of, मा गमम् not go.
data.md: O, Rāma, conceiving with pleasure that your company is a heaven to me and your absence a hell. If you do not take me to the forest which I count freed from all evils, surely I shall drink poison and never come under the influence of my enemies.

data.v: पश्चादपि हि दुःखेन मम नैवास्ति जीवितम् । उज्झितायास्त्वया नाथ तदैव मरणं वरम् ।।
data.es: If forsaken, O Lord I shall not live a life of sorrow. Instant death is better (than abandoned existence).
data.anv: नाथ O Lord, त्वया by you, उज्झितायाः of an abandoned lady, मम to me, पश्चादपि even afterwards, दुःखेन through grief, जीवितम् life, नैवास्ति will not be there, तदैव than abandonment, मरणम् death, वरम् is better.
data.md: When through affliction I shall not live after separation, better it is, O Lord, that I die immediately at the time of my being forsaken by you; I cannot bear this grief even for a moment. How shall I be able to live without you for fourteen years?

data.v: इदं हि सहितुं शोकं मुहूर्तमपि नोत्सहे । किं पुनर्दशवर्षाणि त्रीणि चैकं च दुःखिता ।।
data.es: I cannot bear this grief even for a moment, what to speak of fourteen (ten and three and one) years of grieving.
data.anv: इमम् this, शोकम् grief, मुहूर्तमपि even for a moment, सहितुम् to endure, नोत्सहे will not agree, दश ten, त्रीणि three, एकं च one, वर्षाणि years, दुःखिता a grieving woman, किं पुनः what to say again?
data.md: When through affliction I shall not live after separation, better it is, O Lord, that I die immediately at the time of my being forsaken by you; I cannot bear this grief even for a moment. How shall I be able to live without you for fourteen years?

data.v: इति सा शोकसंतप्ता विलप्य करुणं बहु । चुक्रोश पतिमायस्ता भृशमालिङ्ग्य सस्वरम् ।।
data.es: Tormented with grief, Sita piteously and profusely lamented, and then exhausted, embraced her husband tightly and cried bitterly.
data.anv: सा that Sita, शोकसन्तप्ता tormented with grief, आयस्ता exhausted, इति thus, करुणम्  piteously, बहु profusely, विलप्य lamenting, पतिम् husband, आलिङ्ग्य embracing, सस्वरम् with loud voice, भृशम् tightly, चुक्रोश cried.
data.md: Thus lamenting, Sītā, racked with sorrow, embraced her husband and began to cry aloud.

data.v: सा विद्धा बहुभिर्वाक्यैर्दिग्धैरिव गजाङ्गना । चिर संनियतं बाष्पं मुमोचाग्निमिवारणिः ।।
data.es: Pierced by so many words (of objection from Rama), Sita felt like a cowelephant penetrated by poisonsmeared arrrows. And shed her longsuppressed tears like arani (a firekindling stick) kindling fire.
data.anv: दिग्धै: arrows smeared with poison, गजाङ्गना इव like a cowelephant, सा she, बहुभिः many, वाक्यैः with words, विद्धा was pierled, चिरसन्नियतम् longsuppressed, बाष्पम् tears, आरणिः अग्निमिव like fire produced by arani (a firekindling stick), मुमोच released.
data.md: Like to a she-elephant, she being pierced by the poisonous shafts of Rāma's words, began to shed tears, long kept off, as an Araņi wood emits fire continually.

data.v: तस्याः स्फटिकसंकाशं वारि संतापसंभवम् । नेत्राभ्यां परिसुस्राव पङ्कजाभ्यामिवोदकम् ।।
data.es: Crystallike tears arising out of distress flowed from her eyes like water trickling from two lotuses.
data.anv: तस्याः her, नेत्राभ्याम् from the eyes, सन्तापसम्भवम् arising out of distress, स्फटिक सङ्काशम्  like crystal, वारि water, पङ्कजाभ्याम् from two lotuses, उदकमिव like water, परिसुस्राव flowed.
data.md: Tears caused by her sorrow and white as the crystal began to trickle down from her eyes, like to water falling in drops from lotus petals.

data.v: तां परिष्वज्य बाहुभ्यां विसंज्ञामिव दुःखिताम् । उवाच वचनं रामः परिविश्वासयंस्तदा ।।
data.es: With his arms Rama embraced Sita who had almost fainted in grief. And in order to create confidence in her he said these words:
data.anv: तदा then, रामः Rama, दुःखिताम् in grief, विसंज्ञामिव as if fainted, ताम् her, बाहुभ्याम् with arms,  परिष्वज्य having embraced, परिविश्वासयन् creating her confidence, वचनम् words, उवाच said.
data.md: Finding her almost insensible with sorrow, Rāma flung his arms round her and reviving her (with consolation) spoke the following words to her.

data.v: न देवि तव दुःखेन स्वर्गमप्यभिरोचये । न हि मेऽस्ति भयं किंचित्स्वयम्भोरिव सर्वतः ।।
data.es: When you are in grief O Devi I do not desire even heaven. Like the selfcreated Brahma, I have no fear for any one.
data.anv: देवि O Devi, तव your, दुःखेन with grief, स्वर्गमपि even heaven, न अभिरोचये I do not desire, मे to me, स्वयम्भोरिव like selfcreated Brahma, सर्वतः from everything, किञ्चित् even a little, भयम् fear, नास्ति हि is not there.
data.md: I do not long for, Oh worshipful one, even the abode of celestials gained through your affliction; fear there is none for me like to the self-create Brahma.

data.v: तव सर्वमभिप्रायमविज्ञाय शुभानने । वासं न रोचयेऽरण्ये शक्तिमानपि रक्षणे ।।
data.es: O Sita of auspicious countenance even though I am capable of protecting you I did not like your stay in the forest as I did not know your intentions.
data.anv: शुभानने O one possessing auspicious countenance, रक्षणे in protecting you, शक्तिमानपि even though powerful, तव your, सर्वम् fully, अभिप्रायम् intention, अविज्ञाय without  knowing, अरण्ये in the forest, वासम् your residing, न रोचये do not like.
data.md: Not apprised of your full intention, O you of beautiful countenance, I could not, though capable of escorting you, desire your abode in the forest.

data.v: यत्सृष्टासि मया सार्धं वनवासाय मैथिलि । न विहातुं मया शक्या कीर्तिरात्मवता यथा ।।
data.es: Since you, O daughter of Mithila, were born to go along with me to the forest, I cannot abandon you just as a selfrespecting man cannot forsake his reputation.
data.anv: मैथिलि O daughter of Mithila (Sita), यत् since, मयासार्धम् along with me, वनवासाय for living in the forest, सृष्टासि created, आत्मवता by selfrespecting, कीर्तिर्यथा like reputation, मया by me, विहातुम् to abandon, न शक्या is not possible.
data.md: When you are determined O Maithili, repair to the forest with me, I cannot leave you behind, as one possessing self-knowledge cannot renounce munificence.

data.v: धर्मस्तु गजनासोरु सद्भिराचरितः पुरा । तं चाहमनुवर्तेऽद्य यथा सूर्यं सुवर्चला ।।
data.es: O one with (shapely) thighs like the trunk of an elephant follow only the path of righteousness practised earlier by the virtuous as Suvarchala follows the Sun.
data.anv: गजनासोरु O Lady with thighs like the trunk of an elephant, धर्मः righteousness, पुरा formerly, सद्भिः by virtuous men, आचरितः is practised, सुवर्चला wife of Sun (Suvarchala), सूर्यं यथा like Sun, तम् that righteousness, अहम् I, अद्य now, अनुवर्ते shall follow.
data.md: O you, having thighs resembling the trunks of an elephant, I shall resort to that virtue which was exercised by great and good men going before, do you follow me therefore like Suvarcalā following the Sun.

data.v: एष धर्मस्तु सुश्रोणि पितुर्मातुश्च वश्यता । अतश्चाज्ञां व्यतिक्रम्य नाहं जीवितुमुत्सहे ।।
data.es: Obedience to parents is a righteous act. Therefore, O one with fair hips I cannot live and disobey the word of truth.
data.anv: सुश्रोणि O one with beautiful posteriors, पितुः of father, मातुश्च of mother, वश्यता in obedience, एषः this one, धर्मस्तु is a righteous act, अतश्च for that reason, तम् that (word of truth), व्यतिक्रम्य disobeying, अहम् I, जीवितुम् to live, न उत्सहे do not wish.
data.md: Obedience to his parents is the virtue of a son. Disobeying the command of my father I am not eager to live. we

data.v: स मां पिता यथा शास्ति सत्यधर्मपथे स्थितः । तथा वर्तितुमिच्छामि स हि धर्मः सनातनः । अनुगच्छस्व मां भीरु सहधर्मचरी भव ।।
data.es: My father who follows the path of truth and dharma whatever be his commands, I wish to obey. He is, indeed, dharma eternal.
data.anv: सत्यधर्मपथे On the path of truth and dharma, स्थितः firmly fixed, सः पिता such father, माम्   me, यथा as, शास्ति commands, तथा accordingly, वर्तितुम् to abide by, इच्छामि wish सः that one, सनातनः eternal, धर्मः हि is truth indeed.
data.md: Therefore do I desire to follow what my father commands me, treading in the path of truth, and this is the virtue eternal.

data.v: ब्राह्मणेभ्यश्च रत्नानि भिक्षुकेभ्यश्च भोजनम् । देहि चाशंसमानेभ्यः संत्वरस्व च माचिरम् ।।
data.es: Give away your jewels to brahmins who need them and food to religious mendicants. Hurry up Do not delay.
data.anv: आशंसमानेभ्यः for the needy, ब्राह्मणेभ्यः to brahmins, रत्नानि च jewels, भिक्षुकेभ्यः to mendicants, भोजनं च food also, देहि you may bestow, सन्त्वरस्व च hasten, मा चिरम् do not delay.
data.md: Do you give away jewels to the Brāhmaṇas and edibles to the beggars longing for them, and make haste without delay.

data.v: अनुकूलं तु सा भर्तुर्ज्ञात्वा गमनमात्मनः । क्षिप्रं प्रमुदिता देवी दातुमेवोपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: Having come to know that her departure to the forest is acceptable to her husband, Sita, highly delighted, quickly got ready to give away (things).
data.anv: सा देवी Devi, आत्मनः her own, गमनम् departure, भर्तुः with her husband, अनुकूलम् is favourable, ज्ञात्वा having come to know, प्रमुदिता happy, क्षिप्रम् quickly, दातुमेव to gift away, उपचक्रमे began.

data.v: ततः प्रहृष्टा परिपूर्णमानसा; यशस्विनी भर्तुरवेक्ष्य भाषितम् । धनानि रत्नानि च दातुमङ्गना; प्रचक्रमे धर्मभृतां मनस्विनी ।।
data.es: Having heard her husband, the glorious and broadminded Sita was delighted with her desires fulfiled. She made preparations to gift away her wealth including jewels to the virtuous.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtieth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.md: Convinced that her going to the forest was desired by her husband, Sītā began to distribute them speedily with a delighted heart.

data.v: ततोऽब्रवीन्महातेजा रामो लक्ष्मणमग्रतः । स्थितं प्राग्गामिनं वीरं याचमानं कृताञ्जलिम् ।।
data.es: Addressing the heroic Lakshmana in front of him imploring with folded hands to take him to the forest so that he may walk ahead (and guard them), the effulgent Rama said:
data.anv: ततः after that, महातेजाः brilliant, रामः Rama, अग्रतः in front of him, स्थितम् standing, प्राग्गामिनम् ready to walk ahead of, वीरम् heroic one, याचमानम् imploring, कृताञ्जलिम् with folded palms, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् said.

data.v: मयाद्य सह सौमित्रे त्वयि गच्छति तद्वनम् । को भरिष्यति कौसल्यां सुमित्रां वा यशस्विनीम् ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana, if you also accompany me to the forest, who will take care of mother Kausalya and the illustrious Sumitra?
data.anv: सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, त्वयि if you, अद्य today, मया सह along with me, तत् वनम् to the forest, गच्छति go, कौशल्याम् to Kausalya, यशस्विनीम् illustrious, सुमित्रां च Sumitra, कः who, भरिष्यति will take care?

data.v: अभिवर्षति कामैर्यः पर्जन्यः पृथिवीमिव । स कामपाशपर्यस्तो महातेजा महीपतिः ।।
data.es: Dasaratha, the mighty king like Parjanya (the raingod), lord of the earth used to shower favours on earth. But now he is bound by the noose of passion.
data.anv: महातेजाः mighty one, यः that, महीपतिः lord of the earth, पृथिवीम् the earth, पर्जन्यः इव like Parjanya (Indra), कामैः favours (desires), अभिवर्षति showers, सः he, कामपाशपर्यस्तः he is bound by cords of passion.

data.v: सा हि राज्यमिदं प्राप्य नृपस्याश्वपतेः सुता । दुःखितानां सपत्नीनां न करिष्यति शोभनम् ।।
data.es: Once the daughter of king Aswapati (Kaikeyi) gains control over the kingdom, she will do nothing to help her afflicted cowives (Kausalya and Sumitra).
data.anv: नृपस्य king, अश्वपतेः Aswapati's, सुता daughter, सा that (Kaikeyi), इदं राज्यम् this kingdom, प्राप्य having obtained, दुःखितानाम् afflicted ladies, सपत्नीनाम् of her cowives, शोभनम् welfare, न करिष्यति हि will not extend.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण लक्ष्मणः श्लक्ष्णया गिरा । प्रत्युवाच तदा रामं वाक्यज्ञो वाक्यकोविदम् ।।
data.es: At these words of Rama, unshakable in action, auspiciouslooking Kausalya, exceedingly pleased said 'Be it so'.
data.anv: रामेण by Rama, एवम् in this way, उक्तः addressed, वाक्यज्ञः eloquent, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, तदा then, वाक्यकोविदम् proficient in the use of words, रामम् Rama, श्लक्ष्णया in gentle voice, गिरा in words, प्रत्युवाच replied.

data.v: तवैव तेजसा वीर भरतः पूजयिष्यति । कौसल्यां च सुमित्रां च प्रयतो नात्र संशयः ।।
data.es: Aware of your power O valiant one, Bharata will undoubtedly pay respect to Kausalya and Sumitra with all humility.
data.anv: वीर O heroic one, भरतः Bharata, तव your, तेजसैव with your power, प्रयतः in humble manner, कौसल्यां च Kausalya and, सुमित्रा च also Sumitra, पूजयिष्यति he will honour, अत्र here, संशयः doubt, न not.

data.v: कौसल्या बिभृयादार्या सहस्रमपि मद्विधान् । यस्याः सहस्रं ग्रामाणां संप्राप्तमुपजीवनम् ।।
data.es: Noble Kausalya has under her charge a thousand villages for her sustenance. She can support a thousand men like me.
data.anv: यस्याः for (Kausalya), उपजीवनम् sustenance, ग्रामाणाम् of villages, सहस्रम् one thousand, सम्प्राप्तम् has been obtained, आर्या noble lady, कौशल्या Kausalya, मद्विधान् men like me, सहस्रमपि even one thousand, बिभृयात् she can support.

data.v: धनुरादाय सशरं खनित्रपिटकाधरः । अग्रतस्ते गमिष्यामि पन्थानमनुदर्शयन् ।।
data.es: Holding the bow and arrows and carrying a crowbar and a basket, I shall go in front of you leading the way.
data.anv: सशरम् (stringed) with arrows, धनुः bow, आदाय holding, खनित्रपिटकाधरः holding a basket and a crowbar, ते your, अग्रतः in front of, पन्थानम् the way, अनुदर्शयन् indicating, गमिष्यामि I shall go.

data.v: आहरिष्यामि ते नित्यं मूलानि च फलानि च । वन्यानि यानि चान्यानि स्वाहाराणि तपस्विनाम् ।।
data.es: I shall daily collect roots, fruits and other forest products fit for ascetics.
data.anv: मूलानि roots, फलानि च fruits also, तपस्विनाम् for ascetics, स्वाहाराणि eatables, वन्यानि available in the forest, यानि those, अन्यानि च other products, नित्यम् daily, ते to you, आहरिष्यामि shall collect.

data.v: भवांस्तु सह वैदेह्या गिरिसानुषु रंस्यते । अहं सर्वं करिष्यामि जाग्रतः स्वपतश्च ते ।।
data.es: When you go about for pleasure on mountain slopes along with Sita, I shall do everything for you, whether you are awake or asleep.
data.anv: भवांस्तु you, वैदेह्या सह with Sita, गिरिसानुषु on mountain slopes, रंस्यते you will go sporting, ते you, जाग्रतः while you are awake, स्ववतश्च while you are asleep, अहम् I,सर्वम् all tasks, करिष्यामि I will do.

data.v: रामस्त्वनेन वाक्येन सुप्रीतः प्रत्युवाच तम् । व्रजापृच्छस्व सौमित्रे सर्वमेव सुहृज्जनम् ।।
data.es: Pleased with his words Rama said, O Lakshmana go and take leave of all your friends.
data.anv: रामस्तु Rama also, अनेन वाक्येन with these words, सुप्रीतः immensely pleased man, तम् to him, प्रत्युवाच replied, सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, व्रज go forth, सर्वमेव all, सुहृज्जनम् friends, आपृच्छस्व ask leave of them.

data.v: ये च राज्ञो ददौ दिव्ये महात्मा वरुणः स्वयम् । जनकस्य महायज्ञे धनुषी रौद्रदर्शने ।।
अभेद्यकवचे दिव्ये तूणी चाक्षयसायकौ । आदित्यविमलौ चोभौ खड्गौ हेमपरिष्कृतौ ।।
सत्कृत्य निहितं सर्वमेतदाचार्यसद्मनि । स त्वमायुधमादाय क्षिप्रमाव्रज लक्ष्मण ।।
स सुहृज्जनमामन्त्र्य वनवासाय निश्चितः । इक्ष्वाकुगुरुमामन्त्र्य जग्राहायुधमुत्तमम् ।।
data.es: Lakshmana, who was resolved to go to the forest, took leave of his friends, and collected from the house of Vasistha, preceptor of the Ikshvaku race, the powerful weapons deposited with him.
data.anv: वनवासाय to live in the forest, निश्चित: one who was determined, सः Lakshmana, सुहृज्जनम् friends, आमन्त्र्य taking leave of, इक्ष्वाकुगुरुम् preceptor of the Ikshvakus, Vasistha, आगम्य having reached, उत्तमम् powerful, आयुधम् weapons, जग्राह received.

data.v: तद्दिव्यं राजशार्दूलः सत्कृतं माल्यभूषितम् । रामाय दर्शयामास सौमित्रिः सर्वमायुधम् ।।
data.es: Lakshmana, tiger among princes, brought all those divine weapons sanctified and decorated with garlands and showed them to Rama.
data.anv: राजशार्दूलः tiger among princes, सौमित्रिः Lakshmana, दिव्यम् divine, सत्कृतम् sanctified, माल्यभूषितम् decorated with garlands, सर्वम् all, तत् आयुधम् those weapons, रामाय to Rama, दर्शयामास showed.

data.v: तमुवाचात्मवान्रामः प्रीत्या लक्ष्मणमागतम् । काले त्वमागतः सौम्य काङ्क्षिते मम लक्ष्मण ।।
data.es: O handsome Lakshmana, you have come at the expected time, said the selfpossessed Rama affectionately when he saw him arrive.
data.anv: आत्मवान् selfpossessed, रामः Rama, आगतम् having arrived, तं लक्ष्मणम् to that Lakshmana, प्रीत्या affectionately, उवाच said, सौम्य O handsome, लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, त्वम् you, मम to me, काङ्क्षिते काले at the desired moment, आगतः have come.

data.v: अहं प्रदातुमिच्छामि यदिदं मामकं धनम् । ब्राह्मणेभ्यस्तपस्विभ्यस्त्वया सह परंतप ।।
data.es: Let us give away, O tormentor of enemies (Lakshmana) my belogings to the ascetic brahmins.
data.anv: परन्तप O tormentor of enemies, अहम् I, त्वया सह with you, यत् all that, इदम् this, मामकम् my belonging, धनम् wealth, तपस्विभ्यः to ascetics, ब्राह्मणेभ्यः to brahmins, प्रदातुम् to give away, इच्छामि I wish.

data.v: वसन्तीह दृढं भक्त्या गुरुषु द्विजसत्तमाः । तेषामपि च मे भूयः सर्वेषां चोपजीविनाम् ।।
data.es: Here live the best of brahmins who are deeply devoted to their teachers along with those who are dependent on me for their livelihood.
data.anv: इह here, गुरुषु among teachers, दृढम् deep, भक्त्या with devotion, द्विजसत्तमाः best of  brahmins, वसन्ति are living, तेषामपि च for them, भूयः also, सर्वेषाम् for all, मे my, उपजीविनां च to my dependents.

data.v: वसिष्ठपुत्रं तु सुयज्ञमार्यं; त्वमानयाशु प्रवरं द्विजानाम् । अभिप्रयास्यामि वनं समस्ता;नभ्यर्च्य शिष्टानपरान्द्विजातीन् ।।
data.es: Fetch Suyajna, son of Vasistha, best among the brahmins along with all other distinguished brahmins to whom I will pay my homage and leave for the forest.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyfirst sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: त्वम् you, द्विजानाम् among the brahmins, प्रवरम् best, वशिष्ठपुत्रम् son of Vasistha, आर्यम्  venerable, सुयज्ञम् Suyajna, आशु swiftly, आनय bring, शिष्टान् distinguished, अपरान् other, समस्तान् all, द्विजातीन् brahmins, अभ्यर्च्य having paid homage, वनम् to the forest, अभिप्रयास्यामि I shall go.

data.v: ततः शासनमाज्ञाय भ्रातुः शुभतरं प्रियम् । गत्वा स प्रविवेशाशु सुयज्ञस्य निवेशनम् ।।
data.es: Lakshmana having understood the very auspicious and welcome order (of Rama) immediately proceeded to the house of Suyajna.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, सः he, भ्रातुः brother's, शुभतरम् very much auspicious, प्रियम् pleasing, शासनम् command, आज्ञाय having understood, आशु immediately, गत्वा having gone, सुयज्ञस्य Suyajna's, निवेशनम् house, प्रविवेश entered.

data.v: तं विप्रमग्न्यगारस्थं वन्दित्वा लक्ष्मणोऽब्रवीत् । सखेऽभ्यागच्छ पश्य त्वं वेश्म दुष्करकारिणः ।।
data.es: Lakshmana paid homage to him who was in the firesanctuary, and said O friend, come and see the palace of Rama who is the accomplisher of all difficult tasks.
data.anv: लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, अग्न्यगारस्थम् staying in the firesanctuary, तं विप्रम् that brahmin, वन्दित्वा after saluting, अब्रवीत् said, सखे O friend, अभ्यागच्छ come, त्वम् you, दुष्करकारिणः  accomplisher of all difficult tasks , वेश्म palace of Rama, पश्य behold.

data.v: ततः संध्यामुपास्याशु गत्वा सौमित्रिणा सह । जुष्टं तत्प्राविशल्लक्ष्म्या रम्यं रामनिवेशनम् ।।
data.es: After performing the twilight prayers, Suyajna along with Lakshmana went straight away and entered the beautiful and prosperous palace of Rama.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, सन्ध्याम् the twilight prayers, उपास्य having performed, सौमित्रिणा सह along with Lakshmana, आशु swiftly, गत्वा went, लक्ष्म्या with prosperity, जुष्टम् endowed with, रम्यम् beautiful, तत् that, रामनिवेशनम् Rama's palace, प्राविशत् he entered.

data.v: तमागतं वेदविदं प्राञ्जलिः सीतया सह । सुयज्ञमभिचक्राम राघवोऽग्निमिवार्चितम् ।।
data.es: On the arrival of sage Suyajna wellversed in the Vedas, both Rama and Sita offered obeisance to him as to firegod and circumambulated him.
data.anv: राघवः Rama, प्राञ्जलिः folded hands, आगतम् who has come, वेदविदम् versed in Vedas, तं सुयज्ञम् that Suyajna, अर्चितम् worshipped, अग्निम् इव like fire, सीतया सह with Sita, अभिचक्राम circumambulated.

data.v: जातरूपमयैर्मुख्यैरङ्गदैः कुण्डलैः शुभैः । सहेम सूत्रैर्मणिभिः केयूरैर्वलयैरपि ।।
data.es: Rama, scion of the Kakutstha dynasty, worshipped Suyajna with a collection of golden ornaments such as earrings, anklets, armlets, bracelets and many other ornaments of precious stones. Then urged by Sita, Rama said to him:
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ: scion of the Kakutstha dynasty, जातरूपमयैः by golden, मुख्यैः with excellent, अङ्गदैः anklets, शुभैः auspicious, कुण्डलैः with earrings, सहेमसूत्रैः with golden strings, मणिभिः gems, केयूरैः bracelets, वलयैरपि armlets also, अन्यैः others, बहुभिः many, रत्नैश्च jewels, सुयज्ञम् to Suyajna, प्रत्यपूजयत् worshipped, तदा then, सः रामः that Rama, सीताप्रचोदितः urged by Sita, उवाच said.

data.v: अन्यैश्च रत्नैर्बहुभिः काकुत्स्थः प्रत्यपूजयत् । सुयज्ञं स तदोवाच रामः सीताप्रचोदितः ।।
data.es: Rama, scion of the Kakutstha dynasty, worshipped Suyajna with a collection of golden ornaments such as earrings, anklets, armlets, bracelets and many other ornaments of precious stones. Then urged by Sita, Rama said to him:
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ: scion of the Kakutstha dynasty, जातरूपमयैः by golden, मुख्यैः with excellent, अङ्गदैः anklets, शुभैः auspicious, कुण्डलैः with earrings, सहेमसूत्रैः with golden strings, मणिभिः gems, केयूरैः bracelets, वलयैरपि armlets also, अन्यैः others, बहुभिः many, रत्नैश्च jewels, सुयज्ञम् to Suyajna, प्रत्यपूजयत् worshipped, तदा then, सः रामः that Rama, सीताप्रचोदितः urged by Sita, उवाच said.

data.v: हारं च हेमसूत्रं च भार्यायै सौम्य हारय । रशनां चाधुना सीता दातुमिच्छति ते सखे ।।
data.es: O handsome friend now Sita intends to give away to your wife her necklace, her golden chain and girdle. Could you accept them?
data.anv: सौम्य O handsome, सखे friend, सीता Sita, अधुना at this time, हारं च necklace also, हेमसूत्रं च golden chain, रशनां च also girdle, ते to you, दातुम् to give,  इच्छति wishes, भार्यायै to your wife, हारय take them.

data.v: पर्यङ्कमग्र्यास्तरणं नानारत्नविभूषितम् । तमपीच्छति वैदेही प्रतिष्ठापयितुं त्वयि ।।
data.es: Sita also wishes to give away a couch with an exquisite cover, encrusted with a variety of precious stones.
data.anv: वैदेही Sita, अग्य्रास्तरणम् exquisite bed cover, नानारत्नविभूषितम् encrusted with various gems, तं पर्यङ्कम् that couch, अपि also, त्वयि in you, प्रतिष्ठापयितुम् to place (in your house), इच्छति wishes.

data.v: नागः शत्रुं जयो नाम मातुलो यं ददौ मम । तं ते गजसहस्रेण ददामि द्विजपुंगव ।।
data.es: I am gifting you, O best among brahmins a thousand elephants including Satrunjaya an elephant my maternal uncle had given me.
data.anv: द्विजसत्तम O best among brahmins, अयम् this one, शत्रुञ्जयो नाम by name Satrunjaya, नागः an elephant, मातुलः my maternal uncle, मम to me, ददौ gave, तम् to that (elephant), गजसहस्रेण along with a thousand elephants, ते to you, ददामि I am giving.

data.v: इत्युक्तः स हि रामेण सुयज्ञः प्रतिगृह्य तत् । रामलक्ष्मणसीतानां प्रयुयोजाशिषः शिवाः ।।
data.es: Thus addressed by Rama, Suyajna accepted the gifts and conferred auspicious blessings on Rama, Lakshmana and Sita.
data.anv: रामेण by Rama, इति thus, उक्तः spoken, सः सुयज्ञः that Suyajna, तत् that, प्रतिगृह्य having accepted, रामलक्ष्मणसीतानाम् to Rama, Lakshmana and Sita, शुभाः auspicious, आशिषः blessings, प्रयुयोज bestowed.

data.v: अथ भ्रातरमव्यग्रं प्रियं रामः प्रियंवदः । सौमित्रिं तमुवाचेदं ब्रह्मेव त्रिदशेश्वरम् ।।
data.es: Sweettongued Rama calmly said to his brother (Lakshmana) like Brahma addressing Indra:
data.anv: अथ thereafter, प्रियंवद: sweettongued, रामः Rama, प्रियम् to his beloved, भ्रातरम् to his brother, तं सौमित्रिम् to Lakshmana, ब्रह्मा creator, त्रिदशेश्वरम् इव like lord of heaven, Indra, अव्यग्रम् without haste, इदम् this word, उवाच said.

data.v: अगस्त्यं कौशिकं चैव तावुभौ ब्राह्मणोत्तमौ । अर्चयाहूय सौमित्रे रत्नैः सस्यमिवाम्बुभिः ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana invite Agastya and Kausika, the two celebrated brahmins, and bestow on them with reverence plenty of precious gems like showers of rain on standing crops.
data.anv: सौमित्रे Lakshmana, अगस्त्यम् sage Agasthya, कौशिकं चैव to sage Kausika, उभौ both, तौ ब्राह्मणोत्तमौ two eminent brahmins, आहूय having invited, रत्नैः gems, सस्यं crops, अम्बुभिः इव like rain waters, अर्चय worship.

data.v: कौसल्यां च य आशीर्भिर्भक्तः पर्युपतिष्ठति । आचार्यस्तैत्तिरीयाणामभिरूपश्च वेदवित् ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana, give away chariots, maidservants, silk clothes to learned brahmins of Taittiriya branch and wellversed in the Vedas, to agreeable and faithful brahmins attending on Kausalya with their blessings till they are fully satisfied.
data.anv: सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, तैत्तिरीयाणाम् of the Taittiriya branch of the Vedas, आचार्यः learned preceptor, अभिरूपश्च agreeable man, वेदवित् versed in the Vedas, यः who, भक्तः devotee, आशीर्भिः with blessings, कौशल्याम् of  Kausalya, पर्युपतिष्ठति attends on her, तस्य to him, सः द्विजः that brahmin, यावत् till such time, तुष्यति is fully satisfied, यानं च chariots, दासीश्च  maidservants, कौशेयानि वस्त्राणि च silk clothes also, संप्रदापय arrange to give away.

data.v: तस्य यानं च दासीश्च सौमित्रे संप्रदापय । कौशेयानि च वस्त्राणि यावत्तुष्यति स द्विजः ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana, give away chariots, maidservants, silk clothes to learned brahmins of Taittiriya branch and wellversed in the Vedas, to agreeable and faithful brahmins attending on Kausalya with their blessings till they are fully satisfied.
data.anv: सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, तैत्तिरीयाणाम् of the Taittiriya branch of the Vedas, आचार्यः learned preceptor, अभिरूपश्च agreeable man, वेदवित् versed in the Vedas, यः who, भक्तः devotee, आशीर्भिः with blessings, कौशल्याम् of  Kausalya, पर्युपतिष्ठति attends on her, तस्य to him, सः द्विजः that brahmin, यावत् till such time, तुष्यति is fully satisfied, यानं च chariots, दासीश्च  maidservants, कौशेयानि वस्त्राणि च silk clothes also, संप्रदापय arrange to give away.

data.v: सूतश्चित्ररथश्चार्यः सचिवः सुचिरोषितः । तोषयैनं महार्हैश्च रत्नैर्वस्त्रैर्धनैस्तथा ।।
data.es: Noble counsellor (of our father) and charioteer Chitraratha has been in our service for many years. Gratify him with invaluable jewels, clothes, wealth, with young female calves and a thousand cows.
data.anv: आर्यसचिवः noble counsellor (of our father), चित्ररथः Chitraratha, सूतः charioteer, सुचिरोषितः lived with us for many years, एनम् him, महार्है: with invaluable, रत्नैश्च with jewels, वस्त्रै: clothes, तथा similarly, धनैः with wealth,सर्वाभिः with all ,पशुकाभिः च with young female calves, गवाम् cows, दशशतेन च by (a thousand) ten hundreds, तोषय you may gratify him.

data.v: शालिवाहसहस्रं च द्वे शते भद्रकांस्तथा । व्यञ्जनार्थं च सौमित्रे गोसहस्रमुपाकुरु ।।
ततः स पुरुषव्याघ्रस्तद्धनं लक्ष्मणः स्वयम् । यथोक्तं ब्राह्मणेन्द्राणामददाद्धनदो यथा ।।
data.es: Thereupon Lakshmana, a tiger among men, personally distributed like Kubera, gifts of riches to all those Indras among brahmins (best of brahmins) in accordance with the instructions of Rama.
data.anv: ततः thereupon, पुरुषव्याघ्रः tiger among men (best of men), सः लक्ष्मणः that Lakshmana, धनदो यथा like Kubera, bestower of wealth, तत् धनम् that wealth, यथोक्तम् as told (by Rama), स्वयम् personally, ब्राह्मणेन्द्राणाम् to the Indras among brahmins (best brahmins), अददात् gave.

data.v: अथाब्रवीद्बाष्पकलांस्तिष्ठतश्चोपजीविनः । संप्रदाय बहु द्रव्यमेकैकस्योपजीविनः ।।
data.es: Rama then bestowed abundant wealth on each of the dependents as they stood with their throats choked with tears, saying:
data.anv: अथ thereafter, बाष्पकलान् men with their throats choked with tears, तिष्ठतः remaining, उपजीविनः dependents, एकैकस्य for each one of them, बहु abundance of, द्रव्यम् wealth, उपजीवनम् as subsistence, सम्प्रदाय having bestowed, अब्रवीत् said.

data.v: लक्ष्मणस्य च यद्वेश्म गृहं च यदिदं मम । अशून्यं कार्यमेकैकं यावदागमनं मम ।।
data.es: Till I come back, guard each of the palaces of Lakshmana and mine and ensure that they are not left unattended.
data.anv: लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, यत् which, वेश्म palace, मम my, इदम् this, यत् which, गृहं च palace also, एकैकम् each one, मम my, यावदागमनम् till I return, अशून्यम् without being unattended, कार्यम् fit to be done.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा दुःखितं सर्वं जनं तमुपजीविनम् । उवाचेदं धनध्यक्षं धनमानीयतामिति । ततोऽस्य धनमाजह्रुः सर्वमेवोपजीविनः ।।
data.es: Having spoken thus to all dependents who were overcome with grief, Rama ordered the treasury officer to bring the entire treasure.
data.anv: दुःखितम् filled with grief, उपजीविनम् dependents, सर्वम् all, तं जनम् to that group, इति thus, उक्त्वा having said, धनम् treasure, आनीयताम् bring, इति thus, इदम् this word, धनाध्यक्षम् to treasury officer, उवाच said.

data.v: ततः स पुरुषव्याघ्रस्तद्धनं सहलक्ष्मणः । द्विजेभ्यो बालवृद्धेभ्यः कृपणेभ्योऽभ्यदापयत् ।।
data.es: Rama, best among men, got the entire wealth distributed among indigent brahmins, and young and old alike with the help of Lakshmana.
data.anv: ततः then, पुरुषव्याघ्रः tiger among men (best of men), सः that Rama, सहलक्ष्मणः along with Lakshmana, तत् धनम् that wealth, द्विजेभ्यः to brahmins, बालवृद्धेभ्यः to the young and old, कृपणेभ्यः to the poor, अदापयत् got it distributed.

data.v: तत्रासीत्पिङ्गलो गार्ग्यस्त्रिजटो नाम वै द्विजः । आ पञ्चमायाः कक्ष्याया नैनं कश्चिदवारयत् ।।
data.es: A brahmin by name, Trijata, a descendant of sage Garga and of reddishbrown colour used to live in that region earning his livelihood in the forest by digging the earth with an ironspade and a plough.
data.anv: तत्र there, नित्यम् always, फालकुद्दाललाङ्गली with an ironspade and a plough, वने in the forest, क्षतवृत्ति: digging the earth as profession, पिङ्गलः a man of reddishbrown colour, गार्ग्यः descendant of sage Gargya, त्रिजटो नाम by name Trijata, द्विजः brahmin, आसीत् lived.

data.v: स राजपुत्रमासाद्य त्रिजटो वाक्यमब्रवीत् । निर्धनो बहुपुत्रोऽस्मि राजपुत्र महायशः । उञ्छवृत्तिर्वने नित्यं प्रत्यवेक्षस्व मामिति ।।
data.es: Trijata approached Rama and said O illustrious prince I am a destitute and have many children. I am living in the forest by collecting leftover grains. Look at me.
data.anv: सः त्रिजटः that Trijata, राजपुत्रम् prince Rama, आसाद्य having approached, वाक्यम् these  words, अब्रवीत् uttered, महायशः O illustrious one, राजपुत्र O Prince, निर्धनः I am a destitute, बहुपुत्रः father of many children, नित्यम् daily, वने in the forest, उञ्छवृत्ति: अस्मि living on collecting the leftover grain of the field, माम् me, प्रत्यवेक्षस्व look at, इति thus.

data.v: तमुवाच ततो रामः परिहाससमन्वितम् । गवां सहस्रमप्येकं न तु विश्राणितं मया । परिक्षिपसि दण्डेन यावत्तावदवाप्स्यसि ।।
data.es: Rama jokingly replied to him, I have not yet gifted one thousand cows. Throw your staff and the cows on the space your staff covers will be yours.
data.anv: ततः then, रामः Rama, परिहाससमन्वितम् jokingly, तम् him, उवाच said, मया by me, एकम् one, गवां सहस्रमपि thousand cows, न च विश्राणितम् not yet given away, दण्डेन with staff, यावत् as far as, परिक्षिपसि you will hurl, तावत् till such place, अवाप्स्यसि you will obtain.

data.v: स शाटीं त्वरितः कट्यां संभ्रान्तः परिवेष्ट्य ताम् । आविध्य दण्डं चिक्षेप सर्वप्राणेन वेगितः ।।
data.es: Bewildered Trijata swiftly tightened up his upper garment around his waist, set the direction for his staff and hurled it with all his might.
data.anv: सः Trijata, सम्भ्रान्तः bewildered, त्वरितः swiftly, तां शाटीम् his upper garment, कट्याम् on his waist, परिवेष्ट्य after throwing round, दण्डम् staff, आविद्ध्य after setting the direction, वेगितः swiftly, सर्वप्राणेन with all his might, चिक्षेप hurled.

data.v: उवाच च ततो रामस्तं गार्ग्यमभिसान्त्वयन् । मन्युर्न खलु कर्तव्यः परिहासो ह्ययं मम ।।
data.es: Afterwards Rama sought to placate Trijata, that descendant of Ganga, saying: This was a joke. Do not be angry.
data.anv: ततः afterwards, रामः Rama, तं गार्ग्यम् that Gargya, अभिसान्त्वयन् consoling (him), उवाच said, मन्युः anger, न खलु कर्तव्यः should not be made, अयम् this, मम my, परिहासः a joke.

data.v: ततः सभार्यस्त्रिजटो महामुनि;र्गवामनीकं प्रतिगृह्य मोदितः । यशोबलप्रीतिसुखोपबृंहिणी;स्तदाशिषः प्रत्यवदन्महात्मनः ।।
data.es: Thereafter that great sage Trijata along with his wife, immensely happy to receive multitudes of cows, pronounced blessings on the magnanimous Rama for glory, power, pleasure and prosperity.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, सभार्यः along with his wife, महामुनिः great sage, त्रिजटः Trijata, गवाम् cows, अनीकम् multitude, प्रतिगृह्य having accepted, मोदितः delighted, तदा then, महात्मनः magnanimous (Rama), यशोबलप्रीतिसुखोपबृंहणीः enhancing glory, power, pleasure and prosperity, आशिषः blessings, प्रत्यवदत् gave in reply.

data.v: दत्त्वा तु सह वैदेह्या ब्राह्मणेभ्यो धनं बहु । जग्मतुः पितरं द्रष्टुं सीतया सह राघवौ ।।
data.es: After giving away plenty of wealth to brahmins in charity, Rama and Lakshmana along with Sita set out to see their father, king Dasaratha.
data.anv: राघवौ Rama and Lakshmana, वैदेह्या सह along with Sita, ब्राह्मणेभ्यः to brahmins, बहु plenty, धनम् wealth, दत्वा having given (in charity), पितरम् to father, द्रष्टुम् to see, सीतया सह along with Sita, जग्मतुः both of them set out.

data.v: ततो गृहीते दुष्प्रेक्ष्ये अशोभेतां तदायुधे । मालादामभिरासक्ते सीतया समलंकृते ।।
data.es: The pair of dazzling weapons held (by Rama and Lakshmana) looked splendid decorated with flower garlands by Sita.
data.anv: ततः then, दुष्प्रेक्षे dazzling, गृहीते held, सीतया by Sita, मालादामभिः with garlands, अबद्धे bound, समलङ्कृते decorated, तदायुथे pair of weapons of Rama and Lakshmana, अशोभेताम् shone.

data.v: ततः प्रासादहर्म्याणि विमानशिखराणि च । अधिरुह्य जनः श्रीमानुदासीनो व्यलोकयत् ।।
data.es: The rich climbed their palaces and mansions, terraces of sevenstoried buildings and watched them sadly.
data.anv: ततः then, श्रीमान् prosperous, जनः people, प्रासादहर्म्याणि palaces and mansions, विमानशिखराणि च terraces of sevenstoried buildings, अधिरुह्य having climbed, उदासीनः sad, व्यलोकयत् looked.

data.v: न हि रथ्याः स्म शक्यन्ते गन्तुं बहुजनाकुलाः । आरुह्य तस्मात्प्रासादान्दीनाः पश्यन्ति राघवम् ।।
data.es: The streets were so thronged with multitudes of citizens that they were impassable. Therefore, people felt miserable and ascended their mansions and gazed at Rama.
data.anv: बहुजनाकुलाः thronged with multitudes of citizens, रथ्याः streets, गन्तुम् to walk, न शक्यन्ते स्म हि indeed were unable, तस्मात् for that reason, दीनाः miserable,  प्रासादन् the palace, आरुह्य having ascended, राघवम् Rama, पश्यन्ति were looking.

data.v: पदातिं वर्जितच्छत्रं रामं दृष्ट्वा तदा जनाः । ऊचुर्बहुविधा वाचः शोकोपहतचेतसः ।।
data.es: Seeing Rama walking without the royal umbrella, people were very much shocked. They expressed their reaction in so many words:
data.anv: तदा then, जनाः people, पदातिम् pedestrian, वर्जितच्छत्रम् without the (royal) umbrella, रामम् to Rama, दृष्ट्वा having seen, शोकोपहतचेतसः griefstricken, बहुविधाः in many ways, वाचः words, ऊचुः uttered.

data.v: यं यान्तमनुयाति स्म चतुरङ्गबलं महत् । तमेकं सीतया सार्धमनुयाति स्म लक्ष्मणः ।।
data.es: Whenever Rama went out, powerful army of four divisions used to follow him. Today he is walking alone followed by Lakshmana and Sita.
data.anv: यान्तम् while going, यम् whom, महत् powerful, चतुरङ्गबलम् army of four divisions, अनुयाति स्म used to follow, तम् such, एकम् alone, सीतया सार्धम् along with Sita, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, अनुयाति स्म followed.

data.v: ऐश्वर्यस्य रसज्ञः सन्कामिनां चैव कामदः । नेच्छत्येवानृतं कर्तुं पितरं धर्मगौरवात् ।।
data.es: Rama who enjoyed the comforts of affluence gratifies those who have desires. Out of veneration for righteousness, he does not want to prove his father false (to his promise).
data.anv: ऐश्वर्यस्य of affluence, रसज्ञः सन् while enjoying, कामिनाम् for those who have desires, कामदः चैव fulfiller of desires (Rama), धर्मगौरवात्  out of veneration for righteousness, पितरं to father, अनृतम् false, कर्तुम् to make, नेच्छत्येव does not wish.

data.v: या न शक्या पुरा द्रष्टुं भूतैराकाशगैरपि । तामद्य सीतां पश्यन्ति राजमार्गगता जनाः ।।
data.es: It was not possible even for the creatures wandering in the sky (birds) to have a glimpse of Sita before. Now passersby walking the highway can behold her.
data.anv: पुरा earlier, या Sita, आकाशगैः by those wandering in the sky (birds), भूतैरपि creatures, द्रष्टुम् to see, न शक्या not possible, तां सीताम् to that Sita, अद्य now, राजमार्गगताः those walking on the highway, जनाः passersby, पश्यन्ति are beholding.

data.v: अङ्गरागोचितां सीतां रक्तचन्दन सेविनीम् । वर्षमुष्णं च शीतं च नेष्यत्याशु विवर्णताम् ।।
data.es: Sita who used to apply fragrant unguents and smear the body with redsandal cream will now be exposed to the rain, the heat and the cold which will quickly discolour her body.
data.anv: अङ्गरागोचिताम् used to fragrant unguents, रक्तचन्दन सेविनीम् smeared with red sandalpaste, सीताम् Sita, वर्षम् rain, उष्णं च heat, शीतं च cold, आशु quickly, विवर्णताम्  discoloured, नेष्यन्ति will render.

data.v: अद्य नूनं दशरथः सत्त्वमाविश्य भाषते । न हि राजा प्रियं पुत्रं विवासयितुमर्हति ।।
data.es: Surely king Dasaratha possessed of an evil spirit spoke the way he did today. Otherwise, should a king banish his beloved son?
data.anv: अद्य today, नूनम् surely, दशरथः Dasaratha, सत्त्वम् by evil spirit, आविश्य after being  possessed by, भाषते is speaking, राजा king, प्रियम् beloved, पुत्रम् son, विवासयितुम् to banish, न अर्हति हि is not fit enough.

data.v: निर्गुणस्यापि पुत्रस्या काथं स्याद्विप्रवासनम् । किं पुनर्यस्य लोकोऽयं जितो वृत्तेन केवलम् ।।
data.es: Even a son who is bereft of virtues cannot be banished, what to say about Rama, who by good conduct alone has conquered the world.
data.anv: निर्गुणस्यापि even one bereft of virtues, पुत्रस्य of a son, विप्रवासनम् banishment, कथम् how, स्यात् can it be, यस्य whose, वृत्तेन केवलम् by good conduct alone, अयं लोकः this world, जितः conquered, किं पुनः why to say again?

data.v: आनृशंस्यमनुक्रोशः श्रुतं शीलं दमः शमः । राघवं शोभयन्त्येते षड्गुणाः पुरुषोत्तमम् ।।
data.es: Harmlessness, compassion, learning, good conduct, restraint of senses and selfcontrol, all these six qualities adorn Rama, the greatest among men.
data.anv: आनृशंस्यम् harmlessness, अनुक्रोशः compassion, श्रुतम् learning, शीलम् good conduct, दमः restraint of senses, शमः self control, एते all these, षट् six, गुणाः qualities, पुरुषोत्तमम् greatest among men, राघवम् Rama, शोभयन्ति adorn.

data.v: तस्मात्तस्योपघातेन प्रजाः परमपीडिताः । औदकानीव सत्त्वानि ग्रीष्मे सलिलसंक्षयात् ।।
data.es: Therefore, people are deeply pained to see Rama afflicted. They look like aquatic creatures in summer when the water dries up.
data.anv: तस्मात् for that reason, तस्य Rama's, उपघातेन by hurting, ग्रीष्मे in summer, सलिलसङ्क्षयात्  due to drying up of water, औदकानि aquatic, सत्त्वानीव like creatures, प्रजाः people, परमपीडिताः were highly tormented.

data.v: पीडया पीडितं सर्वं जगदस्य जगत्पतेः । मूलस्येवोपघातेन वृक्षः पुष्पफलोपगः ।।
data.es: Just as severed at the root, an entire tree along with its fruits and flowers is destroyed, similarly the whole world gets afflicted when Rama, the ruler of the world, comes to harm.
data.anv: जगत्पतेः of the ruler of the earth, अस्य this Rama's, पीडया on account of his suffering, सर्वम् entire, जगत् earth, मूलस्य at the root, उपघातेन by destruction, पुष्पफलोपगः bearing flowers and fruits, वृक्षः इव like a tree, पीडितम् is distressed.

data.v: ते लक्ष्मण इव क्षिप्रं सपत्न्यः सहबान्धवाः । गच्छन्तमनुगच्छामो येन गच्छति राघवः ।।
data.es: Let all of us without delay along with our wives and relations follow Rama, like Lakshmana, wherever he goes.
data.anv: ते such men as we are, सपत्न्यः with (our) wives, सहबान्धवाः together with (our) relations, राघवः Rama, येन on which (way), गच्छति is going, गच्छन्तम् departing, लक्ष्मण इव like Lakshmana, क्षिप्रम् without delay, अनुगच्छामः we will follow.

data.v: उद्यानानि परित्यज्य क्षेत्राणि च गृहाणि च । एकदुःखसुखा राममनुगच्छाम धार्मिकम् ।।
data.es: Deserting our gardens, fields and houses and experiencing the same joy and sorrow of the virtuous Rama, we shall follow him.
data.anv: उद्यानानि gardens, क्षेत्राणि fields, गृहाणि च houses also, परित्यज्य deserting, एक दुःखसुखाः experiencing the same joy and sorrow (as Rama), धार्मिकम् virtuous, रामम् Rama, अनुगच्छामः shall follow.

data.v: समुद्धृतनिधानानि परिध्वस्ताजिराणि च । उपात्तधनधान्यानि हृतसाराणि सर्वशः ।।
रजसाभ्यवकीर्णानि परित्यक्तानि दैवतैः । अस्मत्त्यक्तानि वेश्मानि कैकेयी प्रतिपद्यताम् ।।
वनं नगरमेवास्तु येन गच्छति राघवः । अस्माभिश्च परित्यक्तं पुरं संपद्यतां वनम् ।।
data.es: Since the scion of the Raghu race is going to the forest, let that forest itself be our city and let the city deserted by us become the forest.
data.anv: राघवः scion of the Raghus, येन wherever, गच्छति is going, वनमेव forest itself, नगरम् as city, अस्तु shall be, अस्माभिः by us, परित्यक्तम् deserted, पुरं च the city also, वनम् as forest, सम्पद्यताम् may become.

data.v: बिलानि दंष्ट्रिणः सर्वे सानूनि मृगपक्षिणः । अस्मत्त्यक्तं प्रपद्यन्तां सेव्यमानं त्यजन्तु च ।।
data.es: Let all the fanged creatures leave their lairs, birds and animals the mountain slopes, lions and elephants, their haunts due to the fear caused by our presence and occupy the city left by us (on seeing us deserting).
data.anv: सर्वे all, दंष्ट्रिणः fanged creatures, बिलानि lairs, मृगपक्षिणः animals and birds, सानूनि slopes of mountain, गजाः elephants, सिंहाः lions, वनानि च the forests, अस्मद्भयात् due to the fear caused by our presence, भीताः having been frightened, त्यजस्तु let them leave, अस्मत्त्यक्तम् left by us, प्रपद्यन्ताम् shall reach, सेव्यमानम् the place occupied by us, त्यजन्तु च desert.

data.v: इत्येवं विविधा वाचो नानाजनसमीरिताः । शुश्राव रामः श्रुत्वा च न विचक्रेऽस्य मानसम् ।।
data.es: Such were the various words uttered by the people. Even after hearing them his (Rama's) mind remained unmoved (from his resolve).
data.anv: रामः Rama, इत्येवम् this way, नानाजनसमीरिताः uttered by various people, विविधाः different, वाचः words, शुश्राव heard, श्रुत्वा च also having, अस्य his, मानसम् mind, न विचक्रे did not deviate.

data.v: प्रतीक्षमाणोऽभिजनं तदार्त;मनार्तरूपः प्रहसन्निवाथ । जगाम रामः पितरं दिदृक्षुः; पितुर्निदेशं विधिवच्चिकीर्षुः ।।
data.es: Even after observing the people in grief, Rama did not reveal his sorrowful feelings. Bound by duty he went in as if with a smile to see his father.
data.anv: रामः Rama, तदा then, आर्तम् distressed, जनम् people, प्रतीक्षमाणोऽपि even though observing, अनार्तरूपः without revealing his sorrowful feelings, अथ also, प्रहसन्निव looking as if smiling, पितुः father's, निदेशम् palace, विधिवत् in accordance with duty, चिकीर्षुः intent on carrying out, पितरम् father, दिदृक्षुः intent to see, जगाम went.

data.v: तत्पूर्वमैक्ष्वाकसुतो महात्मा; रामो गमिष्यन्वनमार्तरूपम् । व्यतिष्ठत प्रेक्ष्य तदा सुमन्त्रं; पितुर्महात्मा प्रतिहारणार्थम् ।।
data.es: Seeing Sumantra stricken with grief for the first time the magnanimous Rama, scion of the Ikshvaku dynasty, on the way to the forest waited there for his father to be informed of his arrival.
data.anv: ऐक्ष्वाकसुतः son of the Ikshvaku race, महात्मा great intellectual, महात्मा highly courageous, रामः Rama, तत् पूर्वम् for the first time, वनम् to the forest, गमिष्यन्  while departing, तदा then, आर्तरूपम् sad appearance, सुमन्त्रम् Sumantra, प्रेक्ष्य having seen, पितुः to father, प्रतिहारणार्थम् to inform, व्यतिष्ठत stood.

data.v: पितुर्निदेशेन तु धर्मवत्सलो; वनप्रवेशे कृतबुद्धिनिश्चयः । स राघवः प्रेक्ष्य सुमन्त्रमब्रवी;न्निवेदयस्वागमनं नृपाय मे ।।
data.es: Rama, lover of righteousness, determined to go to the forest in obedience to his father's command said to Sumantra, Inform the king of my arrival.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे त्रयस्त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtythird sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: धर्मवत्सलः lover of righteousness, सः राघवः that son of the Raghus, पितुः father's, र्निदेशेन by command, वनप्रवेशे to enter forest, कृतबुद्धिनिश्चय: having made the decision, सुमन्त्रम् to Sumantra, प्रेक्ष्य having seen, अब्रवीत् said, नृपाय to king, मे my, आगमनम् arrival, निवेदयस्व inform

data.v: स रामप्रेषितः क्षिप्रं संतापकलुषेन्द्रियः । प्रविश्य नृपतिं सूतो निःश्वसन्तं ददर्श ह ।।
data.es: At the command of Rama, charioteer Sumantra whose senses were overwhelmed with grief quickly entered the apartment of the king and found him heaving sighs.
data.anv: सन्तापकलुषेन्द्रिय: senses overwhelmed with grief, सः सूतः that charioteer (Sumantra), रामप्रेषितः sent forth by Rama, क्षिप्रम् quickly, प्रविश्य having entered, निःश्वसन्तम् sighing, नृपतिम् to king Dasaratha, ददर्श saw.

data.v: आलोक्य तु महाप्राज्ञः परमाकुल चेतसम् । राममेवानुशोचन्तं सूतः प्राञ्जलिरासदत् ।।
data.es: Seeing the king brooding over Rama, in an extremely agitated state, the sagacious charioteer approached him with folded hands.
data.anv: महाप्राज्ञः sagacious one, सूतः charioteer, राममेव to Rama only, अनुशोचन्तम् grieving,  परमाकुल चेतनम् extremely agitated mind, आलोक्य तु having seen, प्राञ्जलिः with folded palms, आसदत् approached.

data.v: अयं स पुरुषव्याघ्र द्वारि तिष्ठति ते सुतः । ब्राह्मणेभ्यो धनं दत्त्वा सर्वं चैवोपजीविनाम् ।।
data.es: Your son Rama, the best of men, having given away his entire wealth in charity to brahmins and to all the dependents is waiting at the entrance.
data.anv: पुरुषव्याघ्रः a tiger among men (best of men), सः अयम् ते सुतः this son of yours, (Rama), ब्राह्मणेभ्यः to brahmins, उपजीविनां चैव to all the dependents, सर्वम् entire, धनम् wealth, दत्त्वा having given away (in charity), द्वारि at the entrance, तिष्ठति is waiting.

data.v: स त्वा पश्यतु भद्रं ते रामः सत्यपराक्रमः । सर्वान्सुहृद आपृच्छ्य त्वामिदानीं दिदृक्षते ।।
data.anv: ते to you, भद्रम् may you prosper, सत्यपराक्रमः possessing proven prowess, सः रामः that Rama, त्वा you, पश्यतु let him see, सर्वान् all, सुहृदः friends, आपृच्छय after taking leave, इदानीम् now, त्वाम् you, दिदृक्षते desirous of seeing you.

data.v: गमिष्यति महारण्यं तं पश्य जगतीपते । वृतं राजगुणैः सर्वैरादित्यमिव रश्मिभिः ।।
data.es: O Lord of the world behold him embellished with all princely virtues like the Sun encircled with its rays, (now) leaving for the forest.
data.anv: महारण्यम् to wild forest, गमिष्यति he will go, जगतीपते O Lord of the world, सर्वैः by all, राजगुणैः princely virtues, वृतम् embellisted with, तम् he, रश्मिभिः (encircled) by rays, आदित्यमिव like the Sun, पश्य see.

data.v: स सत्यवादी धर्मात्मा गाम्भीर्यात्सागरोपमः । आकाश इव निष्पङ्को नरेन्द्रः प्रत्युवाच तम् ।।
data.es: That truthful and virtuous king (Dasaratha) who was deep like the ocean and free from mud (pure) like the sky replied:
data.anv: सत्यवादी truthful, धर्मात्मा virtuous, गाम्भीर्यात् in depth, सागरोपमः like the ocean, आकाश इव like the sky, निष्पङ्क: free from mud (clean), सः नरेन्द्रः that king, तम् to him (Sumantra), प्रत्युवाच replied.

data.v: सुमन्त्रानय मे दारान्ये केचिदिह मामकाः । दारैः परिवृतः सर्वैर्द्रष्टुमिच्छामि राघवम् ।।
data.es: O Sumantra bring all my consorts who are here. In the company of all my wives, I desire to give audience to virtuous Rama.
data.anv: सुमन्त्र: Sumantra, मामकाः all my (consorts), ये केचित् whosoever, इह are here, मे दारान् my wives, आनय bring them, सर्वैः by all, दारैः with wives, परिवृतः surrounded by, धार्मिकम् virtuous Rama, द्रष्टुम् to see, इच्छामि I want.

data.v: सोऽन्तःपुरमतीत्यैव स्त्रियस्ता वाक्यमब्रवीत् । आर्यो ह्वयति वो राजा गम्यतां तत्र माचिरम् ।।
data.es: O venerable ones, king Dasaratha summons you. Go there without delay, said Sumantra to the king's consorts after crossing the inner apartment.
data.anv: सः Sumantra, अन्तःपुरम् inner apartment, अतीत्यैव having crossed, ताः those, स्त्रियः to the ladies, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said, आर्याः venerable ones,  वः you, राजा king, आह्वयति  summons, तत्र there, गम्यताम् please go, चिरम् मा do not delay.

data.v: एवमुक्ताः स्त्रियः सर्वाः सुमन्त्रेण नृपाज्ञया । प्रचक्रमुस्तद्भवनं भर्तुराज्ञाय शासनम् ।।
data.es: Thus addressed by Sumantra in accordance with the king's order, all the women went to their husband's palace.
data.anv: नृपाज्ञया by king's order, सुमन्त्रेण by Sumantra, एवम् in this way, उक्ताः spoken, सर्वाः all, स्त्रियः ladies, भर्तुः husband's, शासनम् command, आज्ञाय having known, तद्भवनम् to the palace, प्रचक्रमुः went.

data.v: अर्धसप्तशतास्तास्तु प्रमदास्ताम्रलोचनाः । कौसल्यां परिवार्याथ शनैर्जग्मुर्धृतव्रताः ।।
data.es: Thereafter, Kausalya surrounded by three hundred and fifty ladies who were faithful to their vows, reached there slowly with their eyes turned copperred (in grief).
data.anv: अथ thereafter, धृतव्रताः faithful to their vows, ताम्रलोचनाः women with copperred eyes, ताः those, अर्धसप्तशताः half of seven hundred (three hundred and fifty), प्रमदाः women, कौशल्याम् to Kausalya, परिवार्य surrounding, शनैः slowly, जग्मुः reached.

data.v: आगतेषु च दारेषु समवेक्ष्य महीपतिः । उवाच राजा तं सूतं सुमन्त्रानय मे सुतम् ।।
data.es: Usher in my son (Rama), O Sumantra, said the lord of the world (king Dasaratha) to the charioteer on seeing his wives arrive.
data.anv: दारेषु the wives  आगतेषु having arrived, महीपतिः lord of the world (Dasaratha), राजा king, समवेक्ष्य having seen, तं सूतम् to that charioteer, उवाच said, सुमन्त्र Sumantra, मे सुतम् my son (Rama), आनय usher in

data.v: स सूतो राममादाय लक्ष्मणं मैथिलीं तदा । जगामाभिमुखस्तूर्णं सकाशं जगतीपतेः ।।
data.es: Then the charioteer fetched Rama, Lakshmana and Sita and advanced towards the king without delay.
data.anv: सः सूतः that charioteer, तदा then, रामम् to Rama, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, मैथिलीम् to Sita, आदाय having brought, तूर्णम् without delay, जगतीपतेः the king's, सकाशम् presence, अभिमुखः facing, जगाम went.

data.v: स राजा पुत्रमायान्तं दृष्ट्वा दूरात्कृताञ्जलिम् । उत्पपातासनात्तूर्णमार्तः स्त्रीजनसंवृतः ।।
data.es: When the king saw from a distance his son coming with folded hands, he, surrounded by the ladies and tormented with grief, stood up.
data.anv: स्त्रीजनसंवृतः surrounded by women, सः राजा that king, कृताञ्जलिम् with folded hands, आयान्तम् coming, पुत्रम् son, दूरात् at distance, दृष्ट्वा having seen, आर्तः with grief, तूर्णम् suddenly, आसनात् from the throne, उत्पपात stood up.

data.v: सोऽभिदुद्राव वेगेन रामं दृष्ट्वा विशां पतिः । तमसंप्राप्य दुःखार्तः पपात भुवि मूर्छितः ।।
data.es: At the sight of Rama, the lord of men (king Dasaratha), tortured with grief, immediately ran towards him but before he could reach him, fell unconscious on the floor.
data.anv: विशाम् पतिः lord of men, रामम् to Rama, दृष्ट्वा having seen, वेगेन quickly, अभिदुद्राव ran forward, असम्प्राप्य unable to reach, दुःखार्तः tormented with grief, मूर्च्छितः unconscious, भुवि on the ground, पपात he fell.

data.v: तं रामोऽभ्यपातत्क्षिप्रं लक्ष्मणश्च महारथः । विसंज्ञमिव दुःखेन सशोकं नृपतिं तदा ।।
data.es: Rama and the mighty warrior Lakshmana, quickly reached the king who lay as though he had lost his senses due to grief.
data.anv: तदा then, दुःखेन due to agony, विसंज्ञम् इव like one who had lost his senses, सशोकम् with grief, तं नृपतिम् to that king, रामः Rama, महारथः a mighty warrior, लक्ष्मणश्च Lakshmana also, क्षिप्रम् quickly, अभ्यपतत् reached.

data.v: स्त्रीसहस्रनिनादश्च संजज्ञे राजवेश्मनि । हाहा रामेति सहसा भूषणध्वनिमूर्छितः ।।
data.es: All on a sudden there arose from (the mouths of) a thousand women of the palace cries of 'alas, alas, Rama' mingled with the tinkling sounds of their ornaments.
data.anv: सहसा suddenly, राजवेश्मनि in the palace, भूषणध्वनिमूर्छितः mingled with the (tinkling) sounds of ornaments, हा हा राम इति alas, alas, Rama, स्त्री सहस्रनिनादश्च wailing of a thousand women, संजज्ञे was produced.

data.v: तं परिष्वज्य बाहुभ्यां तावुभौ रामलक्ष्मणौ । पर्यङ्के सीतया सार्धं रुदन्तः समवेशयन् ।।
data.es: Thereafter Rama and Lakshmana assisted by Sita, lifted him wailing in their arms and laid him on a couch.
data.anv: तौ those, उभौ two, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, सीतया सार्धम् along with Sita, तम् him (Dasaratha), बाहुभ्याम् with their arms, परिष्वज्य having embraced, रुदन्तः while wailing, पर्यङ्के on the couch, समवेशयन् seated.

data.v: अथ रामो मुहूर्तेन लब्धसंज्ञं महीपतिम् । उवाच प्राञ्जलिर्भूत्वा शोकार्णवपरिप्लुतम् ।।
data.es: After the king regained his consciousness in a moment, Rama with folded hands said to him, who was immersed in a sea of sorrow:
data.anv: अथ thereafter, रामः Rama, प्राञ्जलिः with folded palms, भूत्वा being, मुहूर्तेन in a moment , लब्धसंज्ञम् who regained consciousness, शोकार्णवपरिप्लुतम् immersed in the sea of sorrow, महीपतिम् to the king, उवाच said.

data.v: आपृच्छे त्वां महाराज सर्वेषामीश्वरोऽसि नः । प्रस्थितं दण्डकारण्यं पश्य त्वं कुशलेन माम् ।।
data.es: O great king, I am asking leave of you, for you are lord of all of us. I am set to depart for the Dandaka forest. See me (off) in a cheerful mood.
data.anv: महाराज O great king, त्वाम् you, अपृच्छे I am seeking leave, सर्वेषाम् of all, न: of us, ईश्वरः असि  you are the Lord, त्वम् you, कुशलेन cheerfully, दण्डकारण्यम् to Dandaka forest, प्रस्थितम् departing, माम् me, पश्य you may see.

data.v: लक्ष्मणं चानुजानीहि सीता चान्वेति मां वनम् । कारणैर्बहुभिस्तथ्यैर्वार्यमाणौ न चेच्छतः ।।
data.es: Allow Lakshmana and Sita to follow me into the forest. I tried to dissuade them with a number of reasons but they did not agree.
data.anv: लक्ष्मणं च (to) Lakshmana also, अनुजानीहि may allow, सीता च Sita also, माम्  me, वनम् to the forest, अन्वेति will be following, तथ्यैः by genuine, बहुभिः many, कारणैः with  reasons, वार्यमाणौ dissuaded, न च इच्छतः both do not agree.

data.v: अनुजानीहि सर्वान्नः शोकमुत्सृज्य मानद । लक्ष्मणं मां च सीतां च प्रजापतिरिव प्रजाः ।।
data.es: Discard your grief and, like Brahma, the creator, allow Lakshmana, Sita and me all of us, your subjects, O respector of men
data.anv: मानद O respector of men, शोकम् grief, उत्सृज्य discarding, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, मां च  also me, सीतां च to Sita too, सर्वान् all, नः us, प्रजापतिः creator Bramha, प्रजाः इव like subjects, अनुजानीहि permit.

data.v: प्रतीक्षमाणमव्यग्रमनुज्ञां जगतीपतेः । उवाच रर्जा संप्रेक्ष्य वनवासाय राघवम् ।।
data.es: On seeing Rama, unruffled, waiting for his permission to proceed to the forest, the lord of the earth, king Dasaratha said:
data.anv: राजा king, वनवासाय to dwell in the forest, जगतीपतेः king's (his), अनुज्ञाम् permission, प्रतीक्षमाणम् awaiting, अव्यग्रम् to the unruffled, राघवम् to Rama, सम्प्रेक्ष्य having seen, उवाच said.

data.v: अहं राघव कैकेय्या वरदानेन मोहितः । अयोध्यायास्त्वमेवाद्य भव राजा निगृह्य माम् ।।
data.es: I have been deluded by Kaikeyi into bestowing boons. Imprison me and be now king of Ayodhya, O scion of the Raghu dynasty
data.anv: राघव O Son of the Raghu dynasty, अहम् I, कैकेय्या Kaikeyi's, वरदानेन by bestowing boons, मोहितः have been deluded, अद्य now, माम् me, निगृह्य by confining, त्वमेव yourself, अयोध्यायाः of Ayodhya, राजा  भव be king.

data.v: एवमुक्तो नृपतिना रामो धर्मभृतां वरः । प्रत्युवाचाञ्जलिं कृत्वा पितरं वाक्यकोविदः ।।
data.es: Thus spoken to by the king, Rama, skilled in speech and upholder of righteousness, replied to his father with folded palms:
data.anv: धर्मभृताम् among upholders of righteousness, वरः best, वाक्यकोविदः skilled in speech, रामः Rama, नृपतिना by the king, एवम् in this way, उक्तः spoken, अञ्जलिं कृत्वा with folded palms, पितरम् to his father, प्रत्युवाच replied.

data.v: भवान्वर्षसहस्राय पृथिव्या नृपते पतिः । अहं त्वरण्ये वत्स्यामि न मे कार्यं त्वयानृतम् ।।
data.es: You will remain the lord of this earth for a thousand years to come, O king As for me, I will dwell in the forest. Do not deviate from truth on my account.
data.anv: नृपते O king, वर्षसहस्राय for a thousand years, भवान् you alone, पृथिव्याः of this earth, पतिः are the lord, अहं तु as for me, अरण्ये in the forest, वत्स्यामि I will dwell, त्वया by you, मे to me, अनृतम् untruth, न कार्यम् should not be done.

data.v: श्रेयसे वृद्धये तात पुनरागमनाय च । गच्छस्वारिष्टमव्यग्रः पन्थानमकुतोभयम् ।।
data.es: Go, my dear child, wish you wellMay your path be auspicious, free from obstacles and fear (from any quarters). Come back (after fulfilment of the pledge)
data.anv: तात dear child, Rama, अरिष्टम् auspicious, अव्यग्रम् without sorrows, अकुतोभयम् without threat (from any quarter), पन्थानम् path, श्रेयसे for your welfare, वृद्धये for prosperity, पुनः आगमनाय च and to return, गच्छस्व go.

data.v: अद्य त्विदानीं रजनीं पुत्र मा गच्छ सर्वथा । मातरं मां च संपश्यन्वसेमामद्य शर्वरीम् । तर्पितः सर्वकामैस्त्वं श्वःकाले साधयिष्यसि ।।
data.es: Stay tonight in the company of your mother and me. With all our desire satisfied, you can set out tomorrow at the appropriate time.
data.anv: मातरम् mother, मां च me also, सम्पश्यन् seeing, अद्य today, इमाम् this, शर्वरीम् night, वस stay, सर्वकामैः with all desires, तर्पितः satisfied, त्वम् you, श्वः tomorrow, काले in proper time, साधयिष्यसि set out.

data.v: अथ रामस्तथा श्रुत्वा पितुरार्तस्य भाषितम् । लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा दीनो वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Rama and Lakshmana were sad to hear the words of their anguished father. Rama replies:
data.anv: अथ thereafter, रामः Rama, तथा in that way, आर्तस्य of the distressed one, पितुः father's, भाषितम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, भ्रात्रा with brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह along with Lakshmana,  दीनः distressed, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

data.v: प्राप्स्यामि यानद्य गुणान्को मे श्वस्तान्प्रदास्यति । अपक्रमणमेवातः सर्वकामैरहं वृणे ।।
data.es: Who will give me the merit (of propriety) I earn today? Therefore, I want to depart (today), discarding all my desires.
data.anv: अद्य today, यान् गुणान् merit, प्राप्स्यामि obtain, तान् those, श्वः tomorrow, मे to me, कः who, प्रदास्यति will give, अतः therefore, सर्वकामैः with all desires, अपक्रमणमेव departing, अहम् I, वृणे am seeking.

data.v: इयं सराष्ट्रा सजना धनधान्यसमाकुला । मया विसृष्टा वसुधा भरताय प्रदीयताम् ।।
data.es: The kingdom abdicated by me with all its people, its wealth and foodgrains may be bestowed on Bharata.
data.anv: मया by me, विसृष्टा abdicated, सराष्ट्रा with kingdom, सजना its inhabitants, धनधान्यसमाकुला abounding in wealth and foodgrains, इयं वसुधा this earth, भरताय to Bharata, प्रदीयताम्  may be given.

data.v: अपगच्छतु ते दुःखं मा भूर्बाष्पपरिप्लुतः । न हि क्षुभ्यति दुर्धर्षः समुद्रः सरितां पतिः ।।
data.es: Let your grief go. Do not shed tears. The indomitable ocean, Lord of rivers, is never perturbed.
data.anv: ते your, दुःखम् grief, अपगच्छतु may go away, बाष्पपरिप्लुतः filled with tears, मा भूः do not become, सरिताम् of rivers, पतिः lord, दुर्धर्ष: an indomitable one, समुद्रः ocean, न क्षुभ्यति is never perturbed.

data.v: नैवाहं राज्यमिच्छामि न सुखं न च मैथिलीम् । त्वामहं सत्यमिच्छामि नानृतं पुरुषर्षभ ।।
data.es: I desire no kingdom, no comfort, not this earth nor any pleasure nor heaven nor even life.
data.anv: अहम् I, राज्यम् kingdom, नैव इच्छामि do not desire, सुखम् comfort, न not, मेदिनीम् च dominion, न not, सर्वान् all, इमान् these, कामान् pleasures, नैव not, स्वर्गम् heaven, न not at all, जीवितम् life, नैव not.

data.v: पुरं च राष्ट्रं च मही च केवला; मया निसृष्टा भरताय दीयताम् । अहं निदेशं भवतोऽनुपालय;न्वनं गमिष्यामि चिराय सेवितुम् ।।
data.es: I am renouncing this city, kingdom and this entire earth, and let all this be conferred on Bharata. In obedience to your order, I shall go and live in the forest for a long time.
data.anv: पुरं च city, राष्ट्रं च kingdom also, मया by me, निसृष्टा delivered, केवला मही च this entire earth, भरताय for Bharata, दीयताम् may be given, अहम् I, भवतः your, निदेशम् order, अनुपालयन् obeying, वनम् to the forest, चिराय for a long time, सेवितुम् to serve, गमिष्यामि shall go.

data.v: मया निसृष्टां भरतो महीमिमां; सशैलखण्डां सपुरां सकाननाम् । शिवां सुसीमामनुशास्तु केवलं; त्वया यदुक्तं नृपते यथास्तु तत् ।।
data.es: I am leaving behind, O king this (auspicious) land with its welllaid boundaries, mountain ranges, cities and forests, which Bharata alone should rule. Let it happen the way you have said.
data.anv: नृपते O king, सशैलषण्डाम् along with mountain ranges, सपुराम् with cities, सकाननाम् with forests, शिवाम् auspicious, सुसीमाम् with welllaid frontiers, मया by me, निसृष्टाम् given away, इमां महीम् this land, भरतः Bharata, केवलम् alone, अनुशास्तु may rule, त्वया by you, यत्  which, उक्तम् was said, तत् that one, तथा अस्तु may happen.

data.v: न मे तथा पार्थिव धीयते मनो; महत्सु कामेषु न चात्मनः प्रिये । यथा निदेशे तव शिष्टसंमते; व्यपैतु दुःखं तव मत्कृतेऽनघ ।।
data.es: O king my mind derives no happiness from great enjoyment or personal comfort as it does from carrying out your order. This is corroborated by the wise. Your grief (relating to filfilment of the vow) on mt account will be dispelled, O sinless one
data.anv: अनघ O sinless, पार्थिव O king, मे मनः my mind, शिष्टसम्मते acceptable to the disciplined (wise), तव निदेशे by your order, यथा as, धीयते is contained, तथा in that way, महत्सु great, कामेषु pleasures, न not, आत्मनः mine, प्रिये dear, न not, मत्कृते on my account, तव your, दुःखम् grief, व्यपैतु shall be expelled.

data.v: तदद्य नैवानघ राज्यमव्ययं; न सर्वकामान्न सुखं न मैथिलीम् । न जीवितं त्वामनृतेन योजय;न्वृणीय सत्यं व्रतमस्तु ते तथा ।।
data.es: O sinless one by associating you with falsehood I will neither seek this eternal kingdom nor objects of desires nor objects of happiness nor Maithili nor even my life. I only wish that your vow comes true.
data.anv: अनघ O sinless one, तत् for that, अद्य now, त्वाम् you, अनृतेन with untruth, योजयन्  associating, अव्ययम् eternal, राज्यम् kingdom, नैव वृणीय will not seek, सर्वकामान् all desires, न not, सुखम् happiness, न not, मैथिलीम् Sita, न not, जीवितम् life, न not, ते to you, व्रतम् vow, तथा in that way, सत्यम् अस्तु let it become true.

data.v: फलानि मूलानि च भक्षयन्वने; गिरींश्च पश्यन्सरितः सरांसि च । वनं प्रविश्यैव विचित्रपादपं; सुखी भविष्यामि तवास्तु निर्वृतिः ।।
data.es: Entering the forest full of various kinds of trees I shall be happy to view the mountains, rivers and the lakes and to eat fruits and roots. (Hence) do not grieve.
data.anv: विचित्रपादपम् with various kinds of trees, वनम् the forest, प्रविश्यैव having entered, फलानि fruits, मूलानि च roots also, भक्षयन् eating, वने in the forest, गिरींश्च mountains as well, सरितः rivers, सरांसि च lakes, पश्यन् seeing, सुखी भविष्यामि shall be happy, तव you, निर्वृतिः  अस्तु shall cease (to lament).

data.v: ततः सुमन्त्रमैक्ष्वाकः पीडितोऽत्र प्रतिज्ञया । सबाष्पमतिनिःश्वस्य जगादेदं पुनः पुनः ।।
data.es: Afflicted on account of the promise he had made, Dasaratha, descendant of the Ikshvakus heaved deep sighs again and again and with his eyes full of tears uttered these words to Sumantra:
data.anv: ततः then, अत्र in this matter, प्रतिज्ञया by the promise, पीडितः afflicted, ऐक्ष्वाकः descendant of Ikshvaku, Dasaratha, सबाष्पं with tears, अतिनिश्श्वस्य sighing deeply, सुमन्त्रम् to Sumantra, पुनः पुनः again and again, इदम् these words, जगाद  uttered.

data.v: सूत रत्नसुसंपूर्णा चतुर्विधबला चमूः । रागवस्यानुयात्रार्थं क्षिप्रं प्रतिविधीयताम् ।।
data.es: O Sumantra arrange immediately four divisions of the army, wellequipped with precious stones to escort Rama in his journey to (the forest).
data.anv: सूत O charioteer, राघवस्य Rama's, अनुयात्रार्थम् to follow him in his journey, रत्नसुसम्पूर्णा  including gems, चतुर्विधबला four divisions of, चमूः the army, क्षिप्रम् immediately, प्रतिविधीयताम् be arranged.

data.v: रूपाजीवा च शालिन्यो वणिजश्च महाधनाः । शोभयन्तु कुमारस्य वाहिनीं सुप्रसारिताः ।।
data.es: Let the sweettongued courtesans, opulent merchants with well spreadout merchandise make the army of my son graceful.
data.anv: वादिन्यः sweettongued, रूपाजीवाश्च beautiful courtesans, महाधनाः affluent, वणिजश्च merchants, सुप्रसारिताः with wellspread merchandise, कुमारस्य son's,  वाहिनीम् army, शोभयन्तु make it graceful.

data.v: ये चैनमुपजीवन्ति रमते यैश्च वीर्यतः । तेषां बहुविधं दत्त्वा तानप्यत्र नियोजय ।।
data.anv: ये च whoever, एनम् this (Rama), उपजीवन्ति depend for living, वीर्यतः gallantry, यैश्च with whom, रमते used to sport, तेषाम् of all of them, बहुविधम् several kinds (of wealth), दत्त्वा having given (incentives), तान् all of them, अत्र in this entourage, नियोजय employ.

data.v: निघ्नन्मृगान्कुञ्जरांश्च पिबंश्चारण्यकं मधु । नदीश्च विविधाः पश्यन्न राज्यं संस्मरिष्यति ।।
data.es: Hunting the elephants and antelopes, drinking forest honey, beholding several rivers on the way, Rama will not recollect the kingdom.
data.anv: मृगान् antelopes, कुञ्जरांश्च elephants, निघ्नन् while slaying, आरण्यकम् available in the forest, मधु honey, पिबंश्च while drinking, विविधाः several, नदीश्च rivers, पश्यन् while beholding, राज्यस्य of kingdom, न स्मरिष्यति he will not recollect.

data.v: धान्यकोशश्च यः कश्चिद्धनकोशश्च मामकः । तौ राममनुगच्छेतां वसन्तं निर्जने वने ।।
data.es: Let the entire contents of my granary and treasury follow Rama wherever he lives in the desolate forest.
data.anv: यः whichever, मामकः mine, धान्यकोशः च granary, धनकोशः च the treasury, तौ those, निर्जने in the desolate, वने in forest, वसन्तं living, रामम् Rama, अनुगच्छेताम् both may follow.

data.v: यजन्पुण्येषु देशेषु विसृजंश्चाप्तदक्षिणाः । ऋषिभिश्च समागम्य प्रवत्स्यति सुखं वने ।।
data.es: Performing sacrifices in the holy places and liberally giving appropriate gifts, Rama will live happily in the forest in the company of sages.
data.anv: पुण्येषु holy, देशेषु places, यजन् while performing sacrifices, आप्तदक्षिणाः appropriate gifts,  विसृजंश्च liberally givng, ऋषिभिः with sages, समागम्य meeting, वने in the forest, सुखम् happily, प्रवत्स्यति he will live.

data.v: भरतश्च महाबाहुरयोध्यां पालयिष्यति । सर्वकामैः पुनः श्रीमान्रामः संसाध्यतामिति ।।
data.es: (While) mightyarmed Bharata will rule Ayodhya, Rama be furnished with all objects of enjoyment.
data.anv: महाबाहुः mightyarmed, भरतश्च Bharata also, अयोध्याम् to Ayodhya, पालयिष्यति will rule, श्रीमान्  auspicious, रामः Rama, सर्वकामैः सह with all objects of enjoyment, संसाध्यताम् furnish, इति thus spoke.

data.v: एवं ब्रुवति काकुत्स्थे कैकेय्या भयमागतम् । मुखं चाप्यगमाच्छोषं स्वरश्चापि न्यरुध्यत ।।
data.es: While Dasaratha was saying these words, Kaikeyi was gripped by fear and her face looked pale. Even her voice got choked.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थे scion of the Kakutsthas (Dasaratha), एवम् in this way, ब्रुवति while saying, कैकेय्याः Kaikeyi, भयम् fear, आगतम् entered, मुखं चापि her face also, शोषम् dryness, आगमत् obtained, स्वरश्चापि even her voice, न्यरुध्यत choked.

data.v: सा विषण्णा च संत्रस्ता कैकेयी वाक्यमब्रवीत् । राज्यं गतजनं साधो पीतमण्डां सुरामिव । निरास्वाद्यतमं शून्यं भरतो नाभिपत्स्यते ।।
data.es: O virtuous king Bharata will not take charge of the kingdom abandoned by men, drained of wealth and incapable of being enjoyed, like wine with its essence evaporated.
data.anv: साधो O virtuous one, गतजनम् abandoned by men, शून्यम् empty (of wealth), निरास्वाद्यतमम्  incapable of being tasted (enjoyed), राज्यम् kingdom, पीतमण्डाम् essence evaporated, सुराम् इव like wine, भरतः Bharata, नाभिपत्स्यते will not receive.

data.v: कैकेय्यां मुक्तलज्जायां वदन्त्यामतिदारुणम् । राजा दशरथो वाक्यमुवाचायतलोचनाम् । वहन्तं किं तुदसि मां नियुज्य धुरि माहिते ।।
data.es: King Dasaratha heard the terribly cruel and shameless words of that largeeyed Kaikeyi, and said:
data.anv: कैकेय्याम् when Kaikeyi, मुक्तलज्जायाम् shameless, अतिदारुणम् terribly cruel, वदन्त्याम्  speaking, राजा king, दशरथः Dasaratha, आयतलोचनाम् largeeyed woman, वाक्यम् these words, उवाच said.

data.v: कैकेयी द्विगुणं क्रुद्धा राजानमिदमब्रवीत् । तवैव वंशे सगरो ज्येष्ठं पुत्रमुपारुधत् । असमञ्ज इति ख्यातं तथायं गन्तुमर्हति ।।
data.es: In your own dynasty king Sagara prevented his wellknown eldest son Asamanjasa (from enjoying the kingdom). Rama also should depart in the same manner.
data.anv: तव in your, वंशे एव dynasty itself, सगरः Sagara, असमञ्जः इति as Asamanjasa, ख्यातम्  wellknown, ज्येष्ठपुत्रम् eldest son, उपारुधत् was prevented (from assuming the kingdom),  अयम् this Rama also, तथा in the same way, गन्तुम् to go, अर्हति is worthy of.

data.v: एवमुक्तो धिगित्येव राजा दशरथोऽब्रवीत् । व्रीडितश्च जनः सर्वः सा च तन्नावबुध्यत ।।
data.es: Hearing the words of Kaikeyi, Dasaratha could say only 'shame'. All the people felt ashamed, but Kaikeyi could not understand this.
