data.anv: एवम् in this way, उक्तः having been told, राजा king, दशरथः Dasaratha, धिक् इत्येव             'shame' only, अब्रवीत् said, सर्वः all, जनः people, व्रीडितः were ashamed, सा च Kaikeyi, तम् that one, नावबुध्यत did not perceive.

data.v: तत्र वृद्धो महामात्रः सिद्धार्थो नाम नामतः । शुचिर्बहुमतो राज्ञः कैकेयीमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.anv: तत्र present there, वृद्धः the aged, नामतः by name, सिद्धार्थो नाम named Siddartha, शुचिः holy, राज्ञः king, बहुमतः favourite, महामात्रः minister, कैकेयीम् to Kaikeyi, इदम् this, अब्रवीत् spoke.

data.v: असमञ्जो गृहीत्वा तु क्रीडितः पथि दारकान् । सरय्वाः प्रक्षिपन्नप्सु रमते तेन दुर्मतिः ।।
data.es: That wickedminded Asamanjasa used to seize the children playing on the street and amuse himself by hurling them in the waters of river Sarayu.
data.anv: दुर्मतिः wickedminded, असमञ्जः तु as for Asamanjasa, पथि on the street, क्रीडतः playing, बालकान् children, गृहीत्वा seizing, सरय्वा: Sarayu's, अप्सु in waters, प्रक्षिपन् while hurling, तेन with that, रमते amused.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा नागरः सर्वे क्रुद्धा राजानमब्रुवन् । असमञ्जं वृषीण्वैकमस्मान्वा राष्ट्रवर्धन ।।
data.es: Watching it, all the enraged citizens said to the king, 'O enhancer of the prosperity of the kingdom, either you choose Asamanjasa or us'.
data.anv: तम् them, दृष्ट्वा on watching, सर्वे all, नागराः people of the city, कृद्धाः enraged, राजानम् to the king, अब्रुवन् spoke, राष्ट्रवर्धन O enhancer of (prosperity of) the kingdom, एकम् one, असमञ्जम् Asamanjasa, अस्मान् वा or us, वृणीष्व choose.

data.v: तानुवाच ततो राजा किंनिमित्तमिदं भयम् । ताश्चापि राज्ञा संपृष्टा वाक्यं प्रकृतयोऽब्रुवन् ।।
data.es: The king then asked them, 'Why this fear?'. And the citizens responded:
data.anv: ततः then, राजा king, तान् to them, उवाच said, इदं भयम् this fear, किन्निमित्तम्  why?, राज्ञा by the king, सम्पृष्टाः having been asked, ताः those, प्रकृतयश्चापि subjects also, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रुवन् said.

data.v: क्रीडितस्त्वेष नः पुत्रान्बालानुद्भ्रान्तचेतनः । सरय्वां प्रक्षिपन्मौर्ख्यादतुलां प्रीतिमश्नुते ।।
data.es: That insane (Asamanjasa) while throwing our children who were playing around into Sarayu river in his insanity derived incomparable pleasure'.
data.anv: उद्भ्रान्तचेतनः with an insane mind, एषः this one, क्रीडतः while playing, बालान् young ones, नः our, पुत्रान् sons, सरय्वाम् in Sarayu river, प्रक्षिपन् while throwing, मौर्ख्यात् in his insanity, अतुलाम्  incomparable, प्रीतिम् pleasure, अश्नुते deriving.

data.v: स तासां वचनं श्रुत्वा प्रकृतीनां नराधिप । तं तत्याजाहितं पुत्रं तासां प्रियचिकीर्षया ।।
data.es: That king (Sagara) heard the words of the citizens and with the intention of doing good to them, banished that malevolent son.
data.anv: सः नराधिपः that  king, तेषां प्रकृतीनाम् of those subjects, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard,  तासाम् to all of them, प्रियचिकीर्षया with the intention of pleasing them, अहितम् malevolent, तं पुत्रम् that son, तत्याज banished.

data.v: इत्येवमत्यजद्राजा सगरो वै सुधार्मिकः । रामः किमकरोत्पापं येनैवमुपरुध्यते ।।
data.es: Highly righteous king Sagara thus banished his son. What sin has Rama committed to secure a similar banishment?
data.anv: सुधार्मिकः highly righteous, सगरः राजा king Sagara, इति thus, एनम् him, अत्यजत् abandoned, रामः Rama, किं पापम् what sin, अकरोत् has committed, येन by which, एवम् this way,  उपरुध्यते should be banished.

data.v: श्रुत्वा तु सिद्धार्थवचो राजा श्रान्ततरस्वनः । शोकोपहतया वाचा कैकेयीमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having heard Siddhartha, the king, stricken with grief, said to Kaikeyi in a gradually feeble voice.
data.anv: सिद्धार्थवचः Siddhartha's words, श्रुत्वा having heard, राजा king, श्रान्ततरस्वनः in progressively failing voice, शोकोपहतया griefstricken, वाचा words, कैकेयीम् to Kaikeyi, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

data.v: अनुव्रजिष्याम्यहमद्य रामं; राज्यं परित्यज्य सुखं धनं च । सहैव राज्ञा भरतेन च त्वं; यथा सुखं भुङ्क्ष्व चिराय राज्यम् ।।
data.es: Abandoning this kingdom, these comforts and this wealth, I shall follow Rama. Enjoy the kingdom for a long time happily along with king Bharata.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे षट्त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtysixth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: अहम् I, राज्यम् kingdom, सुखम् comfort, धनं च wealth, परित्यज्य forsaking, अद्य today, रामम् Rama, अनुव्रजिष्यामि shall follow, त्वम् you, राज्ञा with the king, भरतेन सहैव along with Bharata, यथासुखम् happily, चिराय for a long time, राज्यम् kingdom, भुङ्क्ष्व enjoy.

data.v: महामात्रवचः श्रुत्वा रामो दशरथं तदा । अन्वभाषत वाक्यं तु विनयज्ञो विनीतवत् ।।
data.es: On hearing the minister, Rama who knew how to be polite spoke these words to Dasaratha humbly:
data.anv: विनयज्ञः knower of politeness, रामः Rama, महामात्रवचः minister's words, श्रुत्वा having heard, तदा then, दशरथम् Dasaratha, विनीतवत् humbly, वाक्यम् words, अभ्यभाषत spoke.

data.v: त्यक्तभोगस्य मे राजन्वने वन्येन जीवतः । किं कार्यमनुयात्रेण त्यक्तसङ्गस्य सर्वतः ।।
data.es: O king giving up pleasures and attachments altogether I am going to live on whatever is available in the forest. What is the use of followers?
data.anv: राजन् O king, त्यक्तभोगस्य of forsaker of pleasures, सर्वतः  entirely, त्यक्तसङ्गस्य of one who has given up attachments, वने in the forest, वन्येन available in the forest, जीवतः subsisting, मे for me, अनुयात्रेण followers, किं कार्यम् what is the use?

data.v: यो हि दत्त्वा द्विपश्रेष्ठं कक्ष्यायां कुरुते मनः । रज्जुस्नेहेन किं तस्य त्यजतः कुञ्जरोत्तमम् ।।
data.es: Having given away the best of elephants, will any one be interested in the rope tied to its girth? Why should one have any attachment for the rope after he has given up the elephant?
data.anv: यः such a man, द्विपश्रेष्ठम् best of elephants, दत्त्वा having given away, कक्ष्यायाम् rope tied to its girth, मनः mind, कुरुते will do, कुञ्जरोत्तमम् best elephant, त्यजतः of a man while  giving up, तस्य his, रज्जुस्नेहेन for attachment for the rope, किम् why?

data.v: तथा मम सतां श्रेष्ठ किं ध्वजिन्या जगत्पते । सर्वाण्येवानुजानामि चीराण्येवानयन्तु मे ।।
data.es: O best among the virtuous O lord of the world, I do not have any use for this army. I am giving away everything (to Bharata). Bring the bark only.
data.anv: सताम् among the virtuous, श्रेष्ठ best, जगत्पते lord of the universe, तथा in that way, मम to me, ध्वजिन्या with the army, किम् what use?, सर्वाण्येव all things, अनुजानामि am giving away, मे to me, चीराण्येव tattered clothes only, आनयन्तु bring.

data.v: खनित्रपिटके चोभे ममानयत गच्छतः । चतुर्दश वने वासं वर्षाणि वसतो मम ।।
data.es: I am going to the forest to live there for fourteen years. Bring me two things: a basket and a crowbar.
data.anv: गच्छतः going away, चतुर्दश fourteen, वर्षाणि years, वने in the forest, वासम् dwelling, वसतः residing , मम to me, उभे two things, खनित्रपिटके a basket and a crowbar, समानयत bring.

data.v: अथ चीराणि कैकेयी स्वयमाहृत्य राघवम् । उवाच परिधत्स्वेति जनौघे निरपत्रपा ।।
data.es: Thereupon in the assembly of people, without any sense of shame Kaikeyi herself brought the bark robes and said to the son of the Raghus (Rama), Wear it.
data.anv: अथ thereupon, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, जनौघे in the presence of the assembly of people, निरपत्रपा without any sense of shame, स्वयम् herself, चीराणि bark robes, अहृत्य having brought, परिथत्स्व  'wear', इति saying so, राघवम् to Rama, उवाच said.

data.v: स चीरे पुरुषव्याघ्रः कैकेय्याः प्रतिगृह्य ते । सूक्ष्मवस्त्रमवक्षिप्य मुनिवस्त्राण्यवस्त ह ।।
data.es: The tiger among men (Rama) received the bark robes from Kaikeyi and putting off the fine apparel wore the robes of an ascetic.
data.anv: पुरुषव्याघ्रः tiger (best) among men, सः he, कैकेय्याः from Kaikeyi, ते those, चीरे bark robes, प्रतिगृह्य having received, सूक्ष्मवस्त्रम् fine apparel, अपक्षिप्य after removing,  मुनिवस्त्राणि ascetic robes, अवस्त ह put on

data.v: लक्ष्मणश्चापि तत्रैव विहाय वसने शुभे । तापसाच्छादने चैव जग्राह पितुरग्रतः ।।
data.es: Lakshmana also removed his auspicious raiment in front (presence) of his father and accepted (put on) the robes of an ascetic.
data.anv: लक्ष्मणश्चापि Lakshmana also, तत्रैव there only, पितुः father's, अग्रतः in front (presence), शुभे auspicious, वसने raiment, विहाय having discarded, तपसाच्छादने चैव the clothing of an ascetic, जग्राह accepted.

data.v: अथात्मपरिधानार्थं सीता कौशेयवासिनी । समीक्ष्य चीरं संत्रस्ता पृषती वागुरामिव ।।
data.es: Then Sita in silk clothes glanced at the bark robes meant for her to wear and was frightened like a doe seeing a (fowler's) snare.
data.anv: अथ then, कौशेयवासिनी wearing silk clothes, सीता Sita, आत्मपरिधानार्थम् meant for her to wear, चीरम् bark robes, समीक्ष्य having seen, पृषती doe, वागुरामिव like a (fowler's) snare, सन्त्रस्ता was frightened.

data.v: सा व्यपत्रपमाणेव प्रतिगृह्य च दुर्मनाः । गन्धर्वराजप्रतिमं भर्तारमिदमब्रवीत् । कथं नु चीरं बध्नन्ति मुनयो वनवासिनः ।।
data.anv: सुदुर्मनाः with a deeply distressed mind, शुभलक्षणा of auspicious nature, धर्मज्ञा knows her duties, धर्मदर्शिनी perceives righteousness, सा जानकी that Sita, व्यपत्रपमाणेव as though feeling ashamed, कैकेयी from Kaikeyi, ते those, कुशचीरे garments made of kusa grass, प्रगृह्य having received, अशृसम्पूर्णनेत्रा with her eyes suffused with tears, गन्धर्वराजप्रतिमम् the very image of king of gandharvas, भर्तारम् to her husband, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

data.v: कृत्वा कण्ठे च सा चीरमेकमादाय पाणिना । तस्थौ ह्यकुषला तत्र व्रीडिता जनकात्मज ।।
data.es: The daughter of Janaka, placed one end of the garment round her neck and held the other in her hand, and stood ashamed as she did not know what to do next.
data.anv: सा जनकात्मजा that daughter of Janaka, (Sita), एकम् one end, चीरम् of garment, कण्ठे on the neck, कृत्वा having placed, पाणिना with hand, आदाय held, तत्र thereafter, अकुशला unskilled (unhabituated), व्रीडिता  feeling ashamed, तस्थौ stood.

data.v: तस्यास्तत्क्षिप्रमागम्य रामो धर्मभृतां वरः । चीरं बबन्ध सीतायाः कौशेयस्योपरि स्वयम् ।।
data.es: Rama, foremost among protectors of righteousness, came forward quickly and fastened the bark himself over her silk garment.
data.anv: धर्मभृताम् among protectors of righteousness, वरः foremost, रामः Rama, क्षिप्रम् quickly, आगम्य having come forward, तत् चीरम् that bark garment, तस्याः सीतायाः Sita's, कौशेयस्य silk garment's, उपरि upon, स्वयम् himself, बबन्ध fastened.

data.v: तस्यां चीरं वसानायां नाथवत्यामनाथवत् । प्रचुक्रोश जनः सर्वो धिक्त्वां दशरथं त्विति ।।
data.es: Beholding Sita who was wearing a bark garment, like one without a support, though having a husband, all the people cried bitterly exclaiming O Dasaratha, fie on you.
data.anv: नाथवत्याम् having her husband, तस्याम् that Sita, अनाथवत् like one without a support, चीरम् tattered (bark) garment, वसानायाम् while wearing, सर्वः जनः all the people, त्वाम् about you, धिक् इति 'fie on you', दशरथम् to Dasaratha, प्रचुक्रोश shouted.

data.v: स निःश्वस्योष्णमैक्ष्वाकस्तां भार्यामिदमब्रवीत् । कैकेयि कुशचीरेण न सीता गन्तुमर्हति ।।
data.es: The descendant of the Ikshvakus (Dasaratha), heaving hot sighs, said to his wife O Kaikeyi, Sita does not deserve to go (to the forest) in garment of kusa grass.
data.anv: सः ऐक्ष्वाकः that descendant of the Ikshvakus (Dasaratha), उष्णम् निःश्वस्य heaving hot sighs, भार्याम् to his wife (Kaikeyi), इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् he spoke, कैकेयी O Kaikeyi, सीता Sita, कुशचीरेण with kusa garment, गन्तुम् to go, नार्हति is not worthy of.

data.v: ननु पर्याप्तमेतत्ते पापे रामविवासनम् । किमेभिः कृपणैर्भूयः पातकैरपि ते कृतैः ।।
data.es: Rama's exile, O wicked woman, is enough for you. What are you committing further heinous crimes for?
data.anv: पापे O wicked woman, एतत् this, रामविवासनम् the exile of Rama, ते to you, पर्याप्तं ननु is not enough, भूयः still, कृतैः by those committed, कृपणैः by the wretched, एभिः by these, पातकैरपि sins also, ते to you, किम् why?

data.v: एवं ब्रुवन्तं पितरं रामः संप्रस्थितो वनम् । अवाक्शिरसमासीनमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having heard the words of Rama, thus spoke Sita in a faint voice in sadness, with tears flowing incessantly from her eyes:
data.anv: वनम् to the forest, सम्प्रस्थितः set out to forest, रामः Rama, एवम् in this way, ब्रुवन्तम्  speaking, अवाक्छिरसमम् with bowed head, आसीनम् sitting, पितरम् addressing his father,  इदं वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

data.v: इयं धार्मिक कौसल्या मम माता यशस्विनी । वृद्धा चाक्षुद्रशीला च न च त्वां देवगर्हिते ।।
data.es: O righteous father O king my aged and illustrious mother, Kausalya possesses neither a mean character nor does she blame you.
data.anv: धार्मिक O righteous one, देव O lord, यशस्विनी illustrious, मम माता my mother, इयम् कौशल्या Kausalya, वृद्धा aged, अक्षुद्रशीला च does not possess meanness of character, त्वाम् you, न च गर्हते does not reproach.

data.v: मया विहीनां वरद प्रपन्नां शोकसागरम् । अदृष्टपूर्वव्यसनां भूयः संमन्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: O bestower of boons, separated from me and unaccustomed to suffering, she will be plunged into an unforeseen ocean of sorrow. You should pay her greater attention.
data.anv: वरद O bestower of boons, मया with me, विहीनाम् separated, शोकसागरम् ocean of sorrow,  प्रपन्नाम् enter into, अदृष्टपूर्वव्यसनाम् experiencing such unforeseen suffering, भूयः in a greater measure, सम्मन्तुम् to care for her, अर्हसि should.

data.v: इमां महेन्द्रोपमजातगर्भिणीं; तथा विधातुं जनमीं ममार्हसि । यथा वनस्थे मयि शोककर्शिता; न जीवितं न्यस्य यमक्षयं व्रजेत् ।।
data.es: You are powerful like Indra.You should act accordingly so that my mother who has a possesive feeling towards her son should not, due to emaciation go to the abode of Yama after my departure for the forest. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे अष्टत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyeighth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: महेन्द्रोपम equal to Indra, मयि me, वनस्थे staying in the forest, शोककर्शिता emaciated by sorrow, जीवितम् life, न्यस्य having yielded, यथा how, यमक्षयम् abode of Yama, न व्रजेत् will not go, तथा in that way, जातगर्धिनीम् a woman with a possesive feeling,   इमाम् this, मम जननीम् my mother, विधातुम् अर्हसि should do.

data.v: रामस्य तु वचः श्रुत्वा मुनिवेषधरं च तम् । समीक्ष्य सह भार्याभी राजा विगतचेतनः ।।
data.es: After hearing Rama and beholding him in the robes of an ascetic, Dasaratha and his wives fell unconscious. With his body and mind afflicted with grief, Dasaratha could not look Rama in the face nor could he make a reply.
data.anv: भार्याभिः सह with his wives, राजा king, रामस्य Rama's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा having heard, मुनिवेशधरम् dressed like an ascetic, तम् him, समीक्ष्य च beholding, विगतचेतन unconscious, दुःखेन with grief, सन्तप्तः tormented, एनम् this, राघवम् Rama, न प्रत्यवैक्षत could not look at, दुर्मनाः dejected mind, एनम् him, अभिसम्प्रेक्ष्य having looked at,  न प्रत्यभाषत च did not reply.

data.v: नैनं दुःखेन संतप्तः प्रत्यवैक्षत राघवम् । न चैनमभिसंप्रेक्ष्य प्रत्यभाषत दुर्मनाः ।।
data.es: After hearing Rama and beholding him in the robes of an ascetic, Dasaratha and his wives fell unconscious. With his body and mind afflicted with grief, Dasaratha could not look Rama in the face nor could he make a reply.
data.anv: भार्याभिः सह with his wives, राजा king, रामस्य Rama's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा having heard, मुनिवेशधरम् dressed like an ascetic, तम् him, समीक्ष्य च beholding, विगतचेतन unconscious, दुःखेन with grief, सन्तप्तः tormented, एनम् this, राघवम् Rama, न प्रत्यवैक्षत could not look at, दुर्मनाः dejected mind, एनम् him, अभिसम्प्रेक्ष्य having looked at,  न प्रत्यभाषत च did not reply.

data.v: स मुहूर्तमिवासंज्ञो दुःखितश्च महीपतिः । विललाप महाबाहू राममेवानुचिन्तयन् ।।
data.es: The mightyarmed king lost consciousness for a moment and in grief lamented, brooding only over Rama.
data.anv: महाबाहुः mightyarmed, सः महीपतिः that Lord of the world (king), मुहूर्तम् for a moment, असंज्ञः इव almost unconscious, दुःखितश्च grieved, रामम् एव Rama alone, अनुचिन्तयन् while  brooding, विललाप lamented.

data.v: मन्ये खलु मया पूर्वं विवत्सा बहवः कृताः । प्राणिनो हिंसिता वापि तस्मादिदमुपस्थितम् ।।
data.es: 'In the past I must have separated many from their children or harmed many living beings. That is why I think this calamity has befallen me.
data.anv: मया by me, पूर्वम् in the past, बहवः many, विवत्साः deprived of children, कृताः have been reduced, वापि or, प्राणिनः living beings, हिंसिताः are harmed, तस्मात् therefore, इदम् this, उपस्थितम् has befallen, मन्ये खलु I deem.

data.v: न त्वेवानागते काले देहाच्च्यवति जीवितम् । कैकेय्या क्लिश्यमानस्य मृत्युर्मम न विद्यते ।।
data.es: Unless the destined hour arrives, life does not leave the body. Therefore, even though I am tormented by Kaikeyi and even after seeing my son, standing before me, (bright) like fire, taking off his fine clothes and wearing the robes of an ascetic my end does not come.
data.anv: काले when the time, अनागते has not come yet, देहात् from body, जीवितम् life, न च्यवति  does not leave, यः अहम् such as I am, सूक्ष्मे fine, वसने clothes, विहाय having removed, तापसाच्छादम् wearing the robes of an ascetic, पावकसङ्काशम् like fire, आत्मजम् son, पुरतः स्थितम् standing before me, पश्यामि I, कैकेय्या by Kaikeyi, क्लिश्यमानस्य while being tormented, मम to me, मृत्युः death, न विद्यते does not come.

data.v: योऽहं पावकसंकाशं पश्यामि पुरतः स्थितम् । विहाय वसने सूक्ष्मे तापसाच्छादमात्मजम् ।।
data.es: Unless the destined hour arrives, life does not leave the body. Therefore, even though I am tormented by Kaikeyi and even after seeing my son, standing before me, (bright) like fire, taking off his fine clothes and wearing the robes of an ascetic my end does not come.
data.anv: काले when the time, अनागते has not come yet, देहात् from body, जीवितम् life, न च्यवति  does not leave, यः अहम् such as I am, सूक्ष्मे fine, वसने clothes, विहाय having removed, तापसाच्छादम् wearing the robes of an ascetic, पावकसङ्काशम् like fire, आत्मजम् son, पुरतः स्थितम् standing before me, पश्यामि I, कैकेय्या by Kaikeyi, क्लिश्यमानस्य while being tormented, मम to me, मृत्युः death, न विद्यते does not come.

data.v: एकस्याः खलु कैकेय्याः कृतेऽयं क्लिश्यते जनः । स्वार्थे प्रयतमानायाः संश्रित्य निकृतिं त्विमाम् ।।
data.es: Only because of Kaikeyi who resorted to this deception in pursuit of selfish ends so many people are made to suffer.
data.anv: इमाम् this, निकृतिम् deception, संश्रित्य resorting to, स्वार्थे for selfish ends, प्रयतमानायाः in pursuit of, एकस्याः only one, कैकेय्याः कृतेः for Kaikeyi, अयं जनः these people, क्लिश्यते are suffering.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा तु वचनं बाष्पेण पिहितेक्ष्णह । रामेति सकृदेवोक्त्वा व्याहर्तुं न शशाक ह ।।
data.es: Having uttered these words and muttering, 'O Rama' only once, his vision blurred by tears, he could speak no more.
data.anv: एवम् in this manner, वचनम् words, उक्त्वा having uttered, बाष्पेण with tears, पिहितेन्द्रियः with  blurred vision, रामेति saying 'O Rama', सकृदेव only once, उक्त्वा having said, व्याहर्तुम् to speak, न शशाक ह was not able.

data.v: संज्ञां तु प्रतिलभ्यैव मुहूर्तात्स महीपतिः । नेत्राभ्यामश्रुपूर्णाभ्यां सुमन्त्रमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Regaining his senses in a moment, the king, with eyes filled with tears, said to Sumantra:
data.anv: सः महीपतिः that Lord of the world (king), मुहूर्तात् after a moment, संज्ञाम् senses, प्रतिलभ्यैव having regained, अश्रुपूर्णाभ्याम् filled with tears, नेत्राभ्याम् with eyes, सुमन्त्रम् to Sumanatra, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

data.v: औपवाह्यं रथं युक्त्वा त्वमायाहि हयोत्तमैः । प्रापयैनं महाभागमितो जनपदात्परम् ।।
data.es: Harness the finest horses to the chariot suitable for the journey, drive this magnanimous Rama to a place outside the city, and come back.
data.anv: त्वम् you, औपवाह्यम् suitable for the journey, रथम् chariot, हयोत्तमैः with finest horses, युक्त्वा having harnessed, आयाहि you shall come, एनम् this, महाभागम् magnanimous, इतः from here, जनपदात् this city, परम् place situated outside, प्रापय reach.

data.v: एवं मन्ये गुणवतां गुणानां फलमुच्यते । पित्रा मात्रा च यत्साधुर्वीरो निर्वास्यते वनम् ।।
data.es: That the pious and heroic son is banished by his parents to the forest is, I think, the reward to the virtuous for his virtues.
data.anv: गुणवताम् of virtuous men, गुणानाम् of virtues, फलम् reward, एवम् this only, उच्यते is said, मन्ये I think, यत् since, साधुः pious man, वीरः heroic, पित्रा by father, मात्रा च by mother, वनम् to the forest, निर्वास्यते is being banished.

data.v: राज्ञो वचनमाज्ञाय सुमन्त्रः शीघ्रविक्रमः । योजयित्वाययौ तत्र रथमश्वैरलंकृतम् ।।
data.es: In obedience to the words of the king, Sumantra promptly harnessed the horses to a welldecorated chariot and brought it there.
data.anv: राज्ञः the king's, वचनम् words, आज्ञाय having known, सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, शीघ्रविक्रमः of swift steps, अलङ्कृतम् decorated, रथम् chariot, अश्वैः with horses, योजयित्वा yoked, तत्र there, आययौ came.

data.v: तं रथं राजपुत्राय सूतः कनकभूषितम् । आचचक्षेऽञ्जलिं कृत्वा युक्तं परमवाजिभिः ।।
data.es: With folded palms Sumantra informed the prince that a chariot, decked in gold and harnessed with excellent horses, is ready.
data.anv: सूतः the charioteer (Sumantra), अञ्जलिं कृत्वा with folded palms, राजपुत्राय the king's son, कनकभूषितम् decked in gold, परमवाजिभिः with excellent horses, युक्तम् harnessed, तं रथम् that chariot, आचचक्षे informed.

data.v: राजा सत्वरमाहूय व्यापृतं वित्तसंचये । उवाच देशकालज्ञो निश्चितं सर्वतः शुचि ।।
data.es: The king who was aware of the right place and time summoned hurriedly the treaury officer, who was firm and honest and said to him:
data.anv: राजा the king, देशकालज्ञो aware of (the right) place and time, निश्चितम् firm, सर्वतः in every way, शुचिम् honest, वित्तसञ्चये in the treasury, व्यापृतम् working as officer, सत्वरम् hurriedly, आहूय having summoned, उवाच said.

data.v: वासांसि च महार्हाणि भूषणानि वराणि च । वर्षाण्येतानि संख्याय वैदेह्याः क्षिप्रमानय ।।
data.es: Assess the (needs for) number of years the princess of Videha (Sita) is going to be in the forest, and fetch her quickly highly valuable garments and excellent ornaments.
data.anv: एतानि these, वर्षाणि years, सङ्ख्याय calculating, वैदेह्याः for the princess of Videha (Sita), महार्हाणि highly valuable, वासांसि च garments, वराणि excellent, भूषणानि च ornaments, क्षिप्रम् quickly, आनय fetch.

data.v: नरेन्द्रेणैवमुक्तस्तु गत्वा कोशगृहं ततः । प्रायच्छत्सर्वमाहृत्य सीतायै क्षिप्रमेव तत् ।।
data.es: Ordered thus by the king, the officer went to the treasury, collected all the things and presented them to Sita.
data.anv: नरेन्द्रेण by the king, एवम् thus, उक्तः spoken to, ततः then, कोशगृहम् to the treasury, गत्वा having gone, सर्वम् all those things, आहृत्य having brought, तत् that, सममेव wholly, सीतायै for Sita, प्रायच्छत् gave.

data.v: सा सुजाता सुजातानि वैदेही प्रस्थिता वनम् । भूषयामास गात्राणि तैर्विचित्रैर्विभूषणैः ।।
data.es: That princess of noble birth from Videha adorned her beautiful limbs with the sparkling ornaments and got ready to depart for the forest.
data.anv: वनम् to the forest, प्रस्थिता ready to depart, सुजाता of noble birth, सा वैदेहि that princess from Videha (Sita), सुजातानि beautiful, गात्राणि limbs, विचित्रैः sparkling, तैः विभूषणैः those ornaments, भूषयामास adorned.

data.v: व्यराजयत वैदेही वेश्म तत्सुविभूषिता । उद्यतोंऽशुमतः काले खं प्रभेव विवस्वतः ।।
data.es: Welladorned Sita illumined the palace like the rising Sun lighting up the sky at dawn.
data.anv: सुविभूषिता well adorned, वैदेही Sita, तत् वेश्म that palace, काले at dawn, उद्यतः rising, विवस्वतः Sun's, प्रभा light, खमिव like sky, व्यराजयत got illumined.

data.v: तां भुजाभ्यां परिष्वज्य श्वश्रूर्वचनमब्रवीत् । अनाचरन्तीं कृपणं मूध्न्युपाघ्राय मैथिलीम् ।।
data.es: Kausalya, Sita's motherinlaw, took her in her arms, embraced her, kissed her on the forehead, and said to her who conducted herself without evoking any pity.
data.anv: श्वश्रूः motherinlaw ( Kausalya), कृपणम् compassionately, अनाचरन्तीम् not acting, तां मैथिलीम् that princess from Mithila (Sita), भुजाभ्याम् with arms, परिष्वज्य having embraced, मूर्ध्नि on the forehead, उपाघ्राय after kissing, अब्रवीत् said.

data.v: असत्यः सर्वलोकेऽस्मिन्सततं सत्कृताः प्रियैः । भर्तारं नानुमन्यन्ते विनिपातगतं स्त्रियः ।।
data.es: Those women who, although always gratified, do not follow their husband when they fall into misfortune, are regarded as unfaithful.
data.anv: अस्मिन् in this, सर्वलोके in all the worlds, असत्यः untrue, स्त्रियः women, प्रियैः by husbands, सततम् at all times, सत्कृताः though honoured, विनिपातगतम् fallen into misfortunes, भर्तारम् husband, नानुमन्यन्ते do not agree (follow).

data.v: स त्वया नावमन्तव्यः पुत्रः प्रव्राजितो मम । तव दैवतमस्त्वेष निर्धनः सधनोऽपि वा ।।
data.es: You must not underestimate my son in his exile. You must treat him as your god whether he is wealthy or not.
data.anv: प्रव्राजितः exiled, मम my, सः पुत्रः son, त्वया by you, नावमन्तव्यः is not to be underestimated, निर्धनः without wealth, सधनोऽपि वा or with wealth, एषः he, तव your, दैवम् अस्तु be your god.

data.v: विज्ञाय वचनं सीता तस्या धर्मार्थसंहितम् । कृताञ्जलिरुवाचेदं श्वश्रूमभिमुखे स्थिता ।।
data.es: Sita who understood the import of these words which were in conformity with dharma and artha, repiled to her motherinlaw facing her with folded palms:
data.anv: सीता Sita, तस्याः her, धर्मार्थसंहितम् in conformity with dharma and artha, वचनम् words, विज्ञाय having understood, कृताञ्जलिः with folded palms, अभिमुखे facing her, स्थिताम् standing, श्वश्रूम् to her motherinlaw, इदम् this word, उवाच said.

data.v: करिष्ये सर्वमेवाहमार्या यदनुशास्ति माम् । अभिज्ञास्मि यथा भर्तुर्वर्तितव्यं श्रुतं च मे ।।
data.es: I shall do exactly all that the venerable motherinlaw instructs me. I have heard it earlier and have fully understood as to how I should conduct myself towards my husband.
data.anv: आर्या venerable one, यथा as, माम् me, अनुशास्ति instructing, सर्वमेव all that, अहम् I, करिष्ये shall do, भर्तुः in relation to my husband, यथा how, वर्तितव्यम् should conductmyself, अभिज्ञा अस्मि I am aware, मे श्रुतं च I have heard it earlier.

data.v: न मामसज्जनेनार्या समानयितुमर्हति । धर्माद्विचलितुं नाहमलं चन्द्रादिव प्रभा ।।
data.es: My worshipful motherinlaw should not equate me with wicked people (women). I cannot swerve from the path of virtue like radiance which never leaves the Moon.
data.anv: आर्या the worshipful lady, माम् me, असज्जनेन with wicked people, समानयितुम् to equate, न अर्हति not fit for, अहम् I, प्रभा radiance, चन्द्रादिव like from the Moon, धर्मात् from virtue, विचलितुम् to swerve, नालम् I cannot.

data.v: नातन्त्री वाद्यते वीणा नाचक्रो वर्तते रथः । नापतिः सुखमेधते या स्यादपि शतात्मजा ।।
data.es: A veena (lute) sans strings cannot be played. A chariot without wheels cannot move. Similarly, a woman without her husband finds no happiness even though she has one hundred sons.
data.anv: अतन्त्री without strings, वीणा veena (lute), न वाद्यते cannot be played, अचक्रः without wheels, रथ: a chariot, न वर्तते does not move, अपतिः without husband, शतात्मजा a hundred sons, स्यादपि even if she has, सुखम् happiness, न एधेत one does not flourish.

data.v: मितं ददाति हि पिता मितं माता मितं सुतः । अमितस्य हि दातारं भर्तारं का न पूजयेत् ।।
data.es: While the happiness that the father, mother and son give is limited, a husband gives unlimited happiness. Which wife will not worship such a husband?
data.anv: पिता father, मितम् to a limited extent, ददाति हि gives, माता mother, सुतः son, अमितस्य unlimited extent, दातारम् giver, भर्तारम् husband, न पूजयेत् who will not worship?

data.v: साहमेवंगता श्रेष्ठा श्रुतधर्मपरावरा । आर्ये किमवमन्येयं स्त्रीणां भर्ता हि दैवतम् ।।
data.es: Instructed about my obligations by an eminent lady (her mother?), imbued with these ideals, how can I, O exalted one, underestimate him (my husband)? For a woman the husband is a god indeed
data.anv: आर्ये O exalted lady, एवं गता one with these (ideals), श्रेष्ठा an eminent woman, श्रुतधर्मपरावरा having been instructed in ordinary and special obligations, सा अहम् I, किम् why, अवमन्येयम् understimate him, स्त्रीणाम् for women, भर्ता husband, दैवतं हि is god indeed.

data.v: सीताया वचनं श्रुत्वा कौसल्या हृदयंगमम् । शुद्धसत्त्वा मुमोचाश्रु सहसा दुःखहर्षजम् ।।
data.es: Listening to the heartstirring words of Sita, Kausalya with her heart so pure burst instantaneously into tears of joy and grief.
data.anv: कौशल्या Kausalya, हृदयङ्गमम् heartstirring, सीतायाः Sita's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, शुद्धसत्त्वा with purified mind, सहसा instantaneously, दुःखहर्षजम् produced out of joy and grief, अश्रु tears, मुमोच shed.

data.v: तां प्राञ्जलिरभिक्रम्य मातृमध्येऽतिसत्कृताम् । रामः परमधर्मज्ञो मातरं वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Most virtuous Rama approached his mother, that highly revered lady among all his mothers, and with folded hands said:
data.anv: परमधर्मात्मा extremely virtuous, रामः Rama, मातृमध्ये in the midst of his mothers, अतिसत्कृताम् highly revered lady, ताम् that, मातरम् to mother (Kausalya), प्राञ्जलिः with folded hands, अभिक्रम्य having approached, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

data.v: अम्ब मा दुःखिता भूस्त्वं पश्य त्वं पितरं मम । क्षयो हि वनवासस्य क्षिप्रमेव भविष्यति ।।
data.es: O mother, do not grieve. Look after my father. My stay in the forest will soon come to an end.
data.anv: अम्ब O mother, त्वम् you, दुःखिता मा भूः do not grieve, त्वम् you, मम पितरम् my father, पश्य look after, वनवासस्य of my exile in the forest, क्षयः end, क्षिप्रमेव quickly, भविष्यति will come.

data.v: सुप्तायास्ते गमिष्यन्ति नववर्षाणि पञ्च च । सा समग्रमिह प्राप्तं मां द्रक्ष्यसि सुहृद्वृतम् ।।
data.es: Fourteen years will pass off like a night's sleep. You will see me come home safe and sound, surrounded by my friends.
data.anv: ते you, सुप्तायाः while asleep, नव पञ्च च nine plus five (fourteen), वर्षाणि years, गमिष्यन्ति will pass off, सा you, इह here, (सम्) प्राप्तम् have arrived, सुहृद्वृतम् surrounded by my friends, समग्रम्  completely, माम् me, द्रक्ष्यसि will see.

data.v: एतावदभिनीतार्थमुक्त्वा स जननीं वचः । त्रयः शतशतार्धा हि ददर्शावेक्ष्य मातरः ।।
data.es: Speaking thus to his mother with highly polished words, he then turned his gaze at his other three hundred and fifty mothers.
data.anv: सः he, अभिनीतार्थम् with highly polished meaning, एतावत् up to this extent, वचः words, उक्त्वा  having spoken, आवेक्ष्य after looking at them, त्रयः three, त्रयश्शतशतार्धा: three hundred and fifty, मातरः च mothers, ददर्श he saw.

data.v: ताश्चापि स तथैवार्ता मातॄर्दशरथात्मजः । धर्मयुक्तमिदं वाक्यं निजगाद कृताञ्जलिः ।।
data.es: To all the mothers who stood deeply distressed with grief the son of Dasaratha spoke with folded hands these words suffused with virtue:
data.anv: सः that, दशरथात्मजः Son of Dasaratha (Rama), तथैव similarly, आर्ताः distressed, ताः those, मातृरपि mothers also, कृताञ्जलिः with folded palms, धर्मयुक्तम् steeped in virtue, इदं वाक्यम् these words, निजगाद uttered.

data.v: संवासात्परुषं किंचिदज्ञानाद्वापि यत्कृतम् । तन्मे समनुजानीत सर्वाश्चामन्त्रयामि वः ।।
data.es: If I have been harsh towards you, on account of our living together or through ignorance may you forgive me. I (now) seek leave of you all.
data.anv: संवासात् by virtue of our living together, अज्ञानाद्वा or through ignorance, किञ्चित् even a little, यत् any, परुषम् harsh gesture, कृतम् has been done, मे to me, तत् that, समनुजानीत forgive, वः you, सर्वाः all, आमन्त्रयामि I am seeking leave of you.

data.v: जज्ञेऽथ तासां संनादः क्रौञ्चीनामिव निःस्वनः । मानवेन्द्रस्य भार्याणामेवं वदति राघवे ।।
data.es: While Rama said so, there arose a loud cry of the wives of the king like the cry of the female herons.
data.anv: राघवे when Rama, एवम् in this way, वदति while he was saying, अथ thereafter, तासाम् of  those women, भार्याणाम् of wives, सन्नादः cry, क्रौञ्चीनाम् of female geese (or herons), निस्वन: इव like sound, जज्ञे arose.

data.v: मुरजपणवमेघघोषव;द्दशरथवेश्म बभूव यत्पुरा । विलपित परिदेवनाकुलं; व्यसनगतं तदभूत्सुदुःखितम् ।।
data.es: Dasaratha's palace which reverberated, like the rumblings of the cloud, with the sounds of drums and other musical instruments earlier, now immensely griefsticken and trapped in calamity, is filled with wailings and lamentations. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकोनचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyninth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: यत् दशरथवेश्म Dasaratha's palace, पुरा earlier, मुरजपणवमेघघोषवत् reechoed with the sounds of drums and other musical instruments like rumbling of the cloud, तत् that one, विलपितपरिदेवनाकुलम् filled with wailings and lamentations, व्यसनगतम् trapped in calamity, सुदुःखितम् अभूत् was filled with sorrow.

data.v: अथ रामश्च सीता च लक्ष्मणश्च कृताञ्जलिः । उपसंगृह्य राजानं चक्रुर्दीनाः प्रदक्षिणम् ।।
data.es: Thereafter, Sita, Rama and Lakshmana with folded palms in a forlom state touched (the feet of) the king and circumambulated him.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, कृताज्ञलिः folded hands, रामश्च Rama also, सीता च  Sita also, लक्ष्मणश्च Lakshmana also, राजानम् king, उपसङ्गृह्य holding, दीनाः forlom, प्रदक्षिणं चक्रुः circumambulated him.

data.v: तं चापि समनुज्ञाप्य धर्मज्ञः सीतया सह । राघवः शोकसंमूढो जननीमभ्यवादयत् ।।
data.es: Taking leave of Dasaratha, the righteous descendant of the Raghus (Rama) along with Sita paid obeisance to his mother Kausalya who was afflicted with deep grief.
data.anv: धर्मज्ञः knower of duty, राघवः Rama, सीतया सह along with Sita, तम् (to him), समनुज्ञाप्य after taking leave of, शोकसम्मूढः griefstricken, जननीम् to mother, अभ्यवादयत् paid obeisance.

data.v: अन्वक्षं लक्ष्मणो भ्रातुः कौसल्यामभ्यवादयत् । अथ मातुः सुमित्राया जग्राह चरणौ पुनः ।।
data.es: Immediately following Rama, his brother, Lakshmana also paid obeisance to Kausalya and, thereafter, held the feet of his own mother Sumitra.
data.anv: लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, भ्रातुः to his brother, अन्वक्षम् following immediately, कौशल्याम् of Kausalya, अभ्यवादयत् paid obeisance, अथ thereafter, मातुः of his mother, सुमित्रायाः Sumitra's, चरणौ feet, पुनः again, जग्राह held.

data.v: तं वन्दमानं रुदती माता सौमित्रिमब्रवीत् । हितकामा महाबाहुं मूर्ध्न्युपाघ्राय लक्ष्मणम् ।।
data.es: While the mightyarmed Lakshmana paid her homage, Sumitra wailed, kissed him on his forehead, wished him well and said:
data.anv: माता mother, वन्दमानम् who was paying homage, सौमित्रिम् her son, महाबाहुम्   mightyarmed, लक्ष्मणम् of Lakshmana, मूर्ध्नि on his forehead, उपाघ्राय having smelt, रुदती  wailing, हितकामा wellwisher, अब्रवीत् said.

data.v: सृष्टस्त्वं वनवासाय स्वनुरक्तः सुहृज्जने । रामे प्रमादं मा कार्षीः पुत्र भ्रातरि गच्छति ।।
data.es: Although deeply attached to your beloved ones, O Son, you are born to dwell in the forest. Never be inattentive towards your brother Rama who is on his way (to the forest).
data.anv: पुत्र O son, सुहृज्जने in beloved ones, स्वनुरक्तः deeply attached, वनवासाय to dwell in the forest,  सृष्टः born , गच्छति leaving for the forest, भ्रातरि with regard to your brother, रामे of Rama, प्रमादम् inattention, मा कार्षीः never do.

data.v: व्यसनी वा समृद्धो वा गतिरेष तवानघ । एष लोके सतां धर्मो यज्ज्येष्ठवशगो भवेत् ।।
data.es: Rama is your refuge in times of adversity or prosperity, O sinless one To be obedient to the eldest (brother) is the duty of virtuous men in this world.
data.anv: अनघ O sinless one, व्यसनी वा in adversity, समृद्धो वा or in prosperity, एषः this one,  तव your, गतिः is refuge, ज्येष्ठवशगः following the eldest brother, भवेत् इति यत् if it happens,  एषः this, लोके in this world, सताम् of virtuous men, धर्मः is the duty.

data.v: इदं हि वृत्तमुचितं कुलस्यास्य सनातनम् । दानं दीक्षा च यज्ञेषु तनुत्यागो मृधेषु च ।।
data.es: Charity, initiation at sacrifices and yielding life in battles are the befitting ancient traditions prevailing in your race.
data.anv: दानम् charity, यज्ञेषु in sacrifices, दीक्षा च initiation, मृधेषु in battles, तनुत्यागः च giving one's  body, इदम् this one, अस्य कुलस्य of this race, उचितम् befitting, सनातनम् ancient, वृत्तं हि is the tradition.

data.v: रामं दशरथं विद्धि मां विद्धि जनकात्मजाम् । अयोध्यामटवीं विद्धि गच्छ तात यथासुखम् ।।
data.es: (To Lakshmana she said) Regard Rama as Dasaratha, Sita as me and the forest as Ayodhya. My child, go in peace.
data.anv: रामम् to Rama, दशरथम् as Dasaratha, विद्धि know, जनकात्मजाम् Sita, माम् as me, विद्धि know, अटवीम् forest, अयोध्याम् as Ayodhya, विद्धि know, तात child, यथासुखम् in peace, गच्छ go.

data.v: ततः सुमन्त्रः काकुत्स्थं प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यमब्रवीत् । विनीतो विनयज्ञश्च मातलिर्वासवं यथा ।।
data.es: Then Sumantra who knows the ways of politeness and humility spoke to Rama, with folded hands as Matali did to Indra.
data.anv: ततः then, विनीतः humble, विनयज्ञश्च knower of politeness, सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, प्राञ्जलिः with folded palms, मातलिः Matali, वासवं यथा as Indra, काकुत्स्थम् to the scion of the Kakutstha race, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

data.v: रथमारोह भद्रं ते राजपुत्र महायशः । क्षिप्रं त्वां प्रापयिष्यामि यत्र मां राम वक्ष्यसि ।।
data.es: O Illustrious prince, wish you well Mount the chariot. I shall convey you speedily whereever you want.
data.anv: राजपुत्र O Prince, महायशः O illustrious one, रथं chariot, आरोह mount, ते to you, भद्रम् wish you well, यत्र whereever, वक्ष्यसि you guide (one), त्वाम् you, क्षिप्रम् speedily, प्रापयिष्यामि I will take.

data.v: चतुर्दश हि वर्षाणि वस्तव्यानि वने त्वया । तान्युपक्रमितव्यानि यानि देव्यासि चोदितः ।।
data.es: I am to dwell in the Dandaka forest for fourteen years while father has appointed Bharata princeregent.
data.anv: चतुर्दश fourteen, वर्षाणि years, त्वया by you, वने in the forest,  वस्तव्यानिव you will dwell, यानि those, देव्या by queen Kaikeyi, चोदितः असि you have been directed, तानि those,  उपक्रमितव्यानि should be commenced.

data.v: तं रथं सूर्यसंकाशं सीता हृष्टेन चेतसा । आरुरोह वरारोहा कृत्वालंकारमात्मनः ।।
data.es: Sita of lovely limbs decorated herself and with a cheerful mind boarded the chariot which was shining like the Sun.
data.anv: वरारोहा lovely limbs, सीता Sita, आत्मनः her person, अलङ्कारम् decoration, कृत्वा having made, हृष्टेन with pleased, चेतसा mind, सूर्यसङ्काशम् resembling the Sun, तं रथम् that chariot,  आरुरोह boarded.

data.v: तथैवायुधजातानि भ्रातृभ्यां कवचानि च । रथोपस्थे प्रतिन्यस्य सचर्मकठिनं च तत् ।।
data.es: So also Dasaratha secured a multitude of weapons, shields and protective leathercoverings for hands and placed them at the centre of the chariot, for use by the brothers. When Sumantra ensured that Sita, Rama and Lakshmana boarded the chariot, he briskly hastened the horses which were as speedy as the wind.
data.anv: तथैव similarly, भ्रातृभ्याम् for brothers, आयुधजालानि multitude of weapons, कवचानि armours, सचर्म along with shield, तत् कठिनं च protective leather covering the hand,  रथोपस्थे in the centre of the chariot,  प्रतिन्यस्य placing, सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, सीतातृतीयान् Rama and Lakshmana with Sita as third person, आरूढान् ascended, दृष्ट्वा having seen, सम्मतान् honoured, जवे in speed, वायुवेग समान् like the speed of the wind, अश्वान् horses, धृष्टम् briskly, अचोदयत् drove them.

data.v: सीतातृतीयानारूढान्दृष्ट्वा धृष्टमचोदयत् । सुमन्त्रः संमतानश्वान्वायुवेगसमाञ्जवे ।।
data.es: So also Dasaratha secured a multitude of weapons, shields and protective leathercoverings for hands and placed them at the centre of the chariot, for use by the brothers. When Sumantra ensured that Sita, Rama and Lakshmana boarded the chariot, he briskly hastened the horses which were as speedy as the wind.
data.anv: तथैव similarly, भ्रातृभ्याम् for brothers, आयुधजालानि multitude of weapons, कवचानि armours, सचर्म along with shield, तत् कठिनं च protective leather covering the hand,  रथोपस्थे in the centre of the chariot,  प्रतिन्यस्य placing, सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, सीतातृतीयान् Rama and Lakshmana with Sita as third person, आरूढान् ascended, दृष्ट्वा having seen, सम्मतान् honoured, जवे in speed, वायुवेग समान् like the speed of the wind, अश्वान् horses, धृष्टम् briskly, अचोदयत् drove them.

data.v: प्रयाते तु महारण्यं चिररात्राय राघवे । बभूव नगरे मूर्च्छा बलमूर्च्छा जनस्य च ।।
data.es: Having seen Rama set out for the great forest for a long period, the city was stilled and men were enervated.
data.anv: राघवे Rama, चिररात्राय for a long period, महारण्यम् to the great forest, प्रतियाते having set out, नगरे  in the city, मूर्छा बभूव was deprived of  senses, जनस्य for men, बलमूर्छा च were deprived of their strength.

data.v: तत्समाकुलसंभ्रान्तं मत्तसंकुपित द्विपम् । हयशिञ्जितनिर्घोषं पुरमासीन्महास्वनम् ।।
data.es: The city was distressed and flurried by the intoxicated elephants, provoked by the mighty sound of the tinkling of bells and the neighing of the horses.
data.anv: तत् पुरम् that city, मत्तसङ्कुपितद्विपम् with elephants intoxicated and provoked (by sounds), हयशिञ्जितनिर्घोषम्  the tinkling of bells and the neighing of the horses, महास्वनम् mighty roar, आकुलसम्भ्रान्तम् आसीत् became flurried and distressed.

data.v: ततः सबालवृद्धा सा पुरी परमपीडिता । राममेवाभिदुद्राव घर्मार्तः सलिलं यथा ।।
data.es: Thereafter the extremely afflicted people of the city, including young and old alike, ran towards Rama like men oppressed with heat running for water.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, बालवृद्धा including young and old, सा पुरी that city, परमपीडिता extremely afflicted, घर्मार्तः oppressed with heat, सलिलं यथा like water, रामम् एव towards Rama only,  अभिदुद्राव ran.

data.v: पार्श्वतः पृष्ठतश्चापि लम्बमानास्तदुन्मुखाः । बाष्पपूर्णमुखाः सर्वे तमूचुर्भृशदुःखिताः ।।
data.es: All the people hanging from the chariot from behind and by the sides, heaving deeply, their faces covered with tears, thus addressed to Sumantra:
data.anv: सर्वे all, पार्श्वतः by his side, पृष्ठतश्चैव behind, लम्बमानाः hanging upon, तदुन्मुखाः facing him, बाष्पपूर्णमुखाः faces covered with tears, भृशनिस्वनाः heaving deeply, तम् addressing that Sumantra, ऊचुः said.

data.v: संयच्छ वाजिनां रश्मीन्सूत याहि शनैः शनैः । मुखं द्रक्ष्यामि रामस्य दुर्दर्शं नो भविष्यति ।।
data.es: O charioteer, control the reins of the horses and go slow so that we may look at the face of Rama, for soon we will not be able to see him.
data.anv: सूत O charioteer, वाजिनाम् horses, रश्मीन् reins, संयच्छ control, शनैः शनैः slowly, slowly,  याहि go, रामस्य Rama's, मुखम् face, द्रक्ष्यामः we will see,  नः for us, दुर्दर्शम् difficult to see,  भविष्यति will become.

data.v: आयसं हृदयं नूनं राममातुरसंशयम् । यद्देवगर्भप्रतिमे वनं याति न भिद्यते ।।
data.es: Alas, the heart of Kausalya whose son, Rama, resembles the offspring of the gods, does not break even though he is going to the forest Undoubtedly it must be made of iron.
data.anv: देवगर्भप्रतिमे resembling the offspring of gods, वनम् to the forest, याति while going, यत् for what reason, न भिद्यते does not break, नूनम् certainly, राममातुः of the mother of Rama (Kausalya's),  हृदयम् heart, आयसम् is made of iron, असंशयम् no doubt.

data.v: कृतकृत्या हि वैदेही छायेवानुगता पतिम् । न जहाति रता धर्मे मेरुमर्कप्रभा यथा ।।
data.es: Sita, deeply attached to her duty, and with her desire fulfilled is following her husband like a shadow just as the sunlight which never leaves mount Meru.
data.anv: धर्मे in duty, रता attached, छायेव like shadow, अनुगता following, वैदेहि Sita, अर्कप्रभा sunlight, मेरुम् यथा like mount Meru, पतिम् her husband, न जहाति does not leave,   कृतकृत्या हि accomplished her purpose.

data.v: अहो लक्ष्मण सिद्धार्थः सततां प्रियवादिनम् । भ्रातरं देवसंकाशं यस्त्वं परिचरिष्यसि ।।
data.es: With your desires fulfilled, O Lakshmana, you will attend to your godlike brother who always speaks pleasant words.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, यः त्वम् such as you, प्रियवादिनम् who speaks pleasant words, देवसङ्काशम् godlike, भ्रातरम् to brother, सततम् always, परिचरिष्यसि attend, सिद्धार्थः fulfilled the purpose, अहो oh.

data.v: महत्येषा हि ते सिद्धिरेष चाभ्युदयो महान् । एष स्वर्गस्य मार्गश्च यदेनमनुगच्छसि । एवं वदन्तस्ते सोढुं न शेकुर्बाष्पमागतम् ।।
data.es: The very fact that you are following Rama is a great achievement and a great fortune for you. This, in fact, is the way to heaven.
data.anv: एनम् this Rama, अनुगच्छसि (इति) यत् the fact that you are following him,  एषा that one, ते for you, महती great, सिध्दि: achievement, एषः this, महान् great, अभ्युदयः prosperity, एषः this one, स्वर्गस्य to heaven, मार्गश्च way.

data.v: अथ राजा वृतः स्त्रीभिर्दीनाभिर्दीनचेतनः । निर्जगाम प्रियं पुत्रं द्रक्ष्यामीति ब्रुवन्गृहात् ।।
data.es: I wish to see my beloved son said the king with a sense of desolation and emerged, surrounded by forlorn women, from the palace.
data.anv: अथ then, दीनचेतनः in desolation, राजा king, प्रियम् beloved, पुत्रम् son, द्रक्ष्यामीति I wish to see him, ब्रुवन् saying, दीनाभिः distressed, स्त्रीभिः by ladies, वृतः surrounded, गृहात् from the palace, निर्जगाम emerged.

data.v: शुश्रुवे चाग्रतः स्त्रीणां रुदन्तीनां महास्वनः । यथा नादः करेणूनां बद्धे महति कुञ्जरे ।।
data.es: He heard the women crying loudly in front like wailings of cowelephants when their bull elephant is captured.
data.anv: अग्रतः in front of, रुदन्तीनाम् crying, स्त्रीणाम् of women, महास्वनः loud sound, महति when great,  कुञ्जरे elephant, बद्धे when fastened, करेणूनाम् of female elephants, नादः यथा like a sound,  शुश्रुवे heard.

data.v: पिता च राजा काकुत्स्थः श्रीमान्सन्नस्तदा बभौ । परिपूर्णः शशी काले ग्रहेणोपप्लुतो यथा ।।
data.es: The king born in the race of Kakutstha, though bright, looked dull then like the full Moon eclipsed (by Rahu).
data.anv: श्रीमान् one of great prosperity, काकुत्स्थ: born in the race of Kakutstha (Dasaratha), पिता father, राजा king, तदा then, काले at that time, ग्रहेण by Rahu, उपप्लुतः eclipsed, पूर्णशशी यथा like the full Moon, सन्नः अभवत् was shrunk.

data.v: ततो हलहलाशब्दो जज्ञे रामस्य पृष्ठतः । नराणां प्रेक्ष्य राजानं सीदन्तं भृशदुःखितम् ।।
data.es: When the people saw the king enfeebled by deep grief, they raised an uproar behind Rama's (chariot).
data.anv: ततः then, भृश दुःखितम् intensely grieved, सीदन्तम् enfeebled, राजानम् king, प्रेक्ष्य having seen, नराणाम् men's, हलहलाशब्दः a tumultous roar, रामस्य Rama's, पृष्ठतः behind, जज्ञे emanated.

data.v: हा रामेति जनाः केचिद्राममातेति चापरे । अन्तःपुरं समृद्धं च क्रोशन्तं पर्यदेवयन् ।।
data.es: Some among them wailed 'Oh Rama', while some others cried 'Oh mother of Rama' By crying loudly, they made the women in the inner apartment cry too.
data.anv: केचित् some, जनाः people, हा रामेति O Rama, अपरे some others, राममातेति O mother of Rama, क्रोशन्तः while crying, समृद्धम् loudly, अन्तःपुरं च inner apartment, पर्यदेवयन् made them weep.

data.v: अन्वीक्षमाणो रामस्तु विषण्णं भ्रान्तचेतसम् । राजानं मातरं चैव ददर्शानुगतौ पथि । धर्मपाशेन संक्षिप्तः प्रकाशं नाभ्युदैक्षत ।।
data.es: When Rama glanced back, he saw his mother and father trailing behind him on the highway, with an agitated and dejected mind.
data.anv: रामस्तु Rama, अन्वीक्षमाणः glanced back, विषण्णम् dejected, भ्रान्तचेतसम् with a disturbed mind, राजानम् king, मातरं चैव mother also, पथि on the highway, अनुगतौ following, ददर्श  beheld.

data.v: पदातिनौ च यानार्हावदुःखार्हौ सुखोचितौ । दृष्ट्वा संचोदयामास शीघ्रं याहीति सारथिम् ।।
data.es: Seeing his parents, who were worthy of riding a chariot now going on foot, who were accustomed to comforts and did not deserve any suffering, Rama urged his charioteer to drive fast.
data.anv: यानार्हौ worthy of going on chariot, पदातिनौ (now) going on foot, सुखोचितौ accustomed to comforts, अदु:खार्हौ unworthy of experiencing sorrow, दृष्ट्वा having seen, शीघ्रम् swiftly,  याहि इति 'go' thus, सारथिम् of charioteer, सञ्चोदयामास urged.

data.v: न हि तत्पुरुषव्याघ्रो दुःखदं दर्शनं पितुः । मातुश्च सहितुं शक्तस्तोत्रार्दित इव द्विपः ।।
data.es: Rama the best among men, could not, like an elephant tormented by the goad, endure that pitiful sight of his father and mother.
data.anv: पुरुषव्याघ्रः tiger (best) among men, तोत्रार्दितः tormented by the goads, द्विपः इव like an elephant, दुःखदम् causing agony, पितुः father's, मातुश्च mother's, तत् दर्शनम् that sight, सहितुम् to endure, न शक्तः हि was not able.

data.v: तथा रुदन्तीं कौसल्यां रथं तमनुधावतीम् । क्रोशन्तीं राम रामेति हा सीते लक्ष्मणेति च । असकृत्प्रैक्षत तदा नृत्यन्तीमिव मातरम् ।।
data.es: While Kausalya was weeping and running after the chariot, crying O 'Rama, O Sita, O Lakshmana, shedding tears for them, Rama repeatedly glanced at her who was twisting and bending as if in a dancing pose.
data.anv: (सः Rama), तथा thus, रुदन्तीम् weeping, राम रामेति O Rama, O Rama, हा सीते O Sita, लक्ष्मणेति च O Lakshmana, क्रोशन्तीम् crying, रामलक्ष्मणसीतार्थम् for Rama, Lakshmana and Sita, नेत्रजम् born of eyes, वारि tears, स्रवन्तीम् shedding, नृत्यन्तीम् इव like a dancer, मातरम् mother, तां कौशल्याम् that Kausalya, असकृत् repeatedly, प्रैक्षत saw.

data.v: तिष्ठेति राजा चुक्रोष याहि याहीति राघवः । सुमन्त्रस्य बभूवात्मा चक्रयोरिव चान्तरा ।।
data.es: The king cried, 'Stay, Stay', while Rama said 'Go on, Go on'. Sumantra's mind was caught as if in between two wheels.
data.anv: राजा king, तिष्ठेति 'stay, stay', चुक्रोश cried, राघवः Rama, याहि इति 'go, go', सुमन्त्रस्य Sumantra's, आत्मा mind, चक्रयो: two wheels, अन्तरा इव like in between, बभूव became.

data.v: नाश्रौषमिति राजानमुपालब्धोऽपि वक्ष्यसि । चिरं दुःखस्य पापिष्ठमिति रामस्तमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: When the king reproaches you for not stopping the chariot, you can say 'I could not hear'.Prolonging agony is sinful, said Rama to Sumantra.
data.anv: उपालब्धोऽपि even when reproached, नाश्रौषमिति 'I did not hear', राजानम् to the king, वक्ष्यसि you will tell, दुःखस्य agony, चिरम् for long time, पापिष्ठम् cannot be endured, इति thus, रामः  Rama, तम् to him, अब्रवीत् said.

data.v: रामस्य स वचः कुर्वन्ननुज्ञाप्य च तं जनम् । व्रजतोऽपि हयाञ्शीघ्रं चोदयामास सारथिः ।।
data.es: Obeying the command of Rama and after taking leave of the people, Sumantra hastened the horses although they were galloping.
data.anv: स सारथिः charioteer, रामस्य Rama's, वचः words, कुर्वन् obeying, तम् जनम् that multitude of people, अनुज्ञाप्य having given permision (taking leave), व्रजतोऽपि even though moving, हयान् horses, शीघ्रम् with greater speed, चोदयामास hastened.

data.v: न्यवर्तत जनो राज्ञो रामं कृत्वा प्रदक्षिणम् । मनसाप्यश्रुवेगैश्च न न्यवर्तत मानुषम् ।।
data.es: The king's men returned, with Rama circumambulated (on the plane of their minds). But from their minds they could not hold back their tears (grief).
data.anv: राज्ञः king's, जनः people, रामम् of Rama, प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा circumanbulating him in imaginataion, न्यवर्तत returned, मानुषम् people, मनसा अपि even mentally, अश्रुवेगैश्च flow of their tears, न न्यवर्तत did not stop.

data.v: यमिच्छेत्पुनरायान्तं नैनं दूरमनुव्रजेत् । इत्यमात्या महाराजमूचुर्दशरथं वचः ।।
data.es: We should not follow over a long distance those we wish to return, said the ministers to king Dasaratha.
data.anv: यम् whom, पुनः again, आयान्तम् returning, इच्छेत् desires, एनम् him, दूरम् for a long distance,  न अनुव्रजेत् should not follow, इति thus, अमात्याः ministers, महाराजम् king, दशरथम्  to Dasaratha, वचः words, ऊचुः said.

data.v: तेषां वचः सर्वगुणोपपन्नं; प्रस्विन्नगात्रः प्रविषण्णरूपः । निशम्य राजा कृपणः सभार्यो; व्यवस्थितस्तं सुतमीक्षमाणः ।।
data.es: Dasaratha and his wives, overcome with grief, heard their words steeped in virtue (wisdom). The king stood there with his perspiring body and melancholic appearance, fixing his gaze on his son.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortieth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: प्रस्विन्नगात्रः with a perspiring body, प्रविषण्णरूपः with a melancholic appearance, कृपणः overcome with grief, सभार्यः along with his wives, राजा the king, तेषाम् their,  सर्वगुणोपपन्नम् endowed with every virtue, वचः words, निशम्य having heard, तं सुतम् that son, ईक्षमाणः while looking at, व्यवस्थितः stood there.

data.v: तस्मिंस्तु पुरुषव्याघ्रे निष्क्रामति कृताञ्जलौ । आर्तशब्दो हि संजज्ञे स्त्रीणामन्तःपुरे महान् ।।
data.es: When the tiger among men (Rama) was coming out with folded palms, there arose a huge cry of distress among the ladies of the harem:
data.anv: पुरुषव्याघ्रे tiger (foremost) among men, तस्मिन् that Rama, कृताञ्जलौ with folded palms, विनिर्याति having departed, अन्तःपुरे in the inner apartment (of the palace), स्त्रीणाम् of women, आर्तशब्दः cries of distress, संजज्ञे arose.

data.v: अनाथस्य जनस्यास्य दुर्बलस्य तपस्विनः । यो गतिं शरणं चासीत्स नाथः क्व नु गच्छति ।।
data.es: Rama was a refuge and a protector to all the people who were defenceless, weak and miserable. Where is such a protector going now? (said the people).
data.anv: अनाथस्य of the orphan, दुर्बलस्य of the weak, तपस्विनः of the miserable, अस्य जनस्य of these people, यः who, गतिः refuge, शरणं च also the protector, आसीत्  was, सः नाथः such protector, क्व नु गच्छति where is he now going?

data.v: न क्रुध्यत्यभिशस्तोऽपि क्रोधनीयानि वर्जयन् । क्रुद्धान्प्रसादयन्सर्वान्समदुःखः क्व गच्छति ।।
data.es: Rama who used to avoid deeds that caused anger, pacified those who were angry with him, and never lost his cool even when cursed, that Rama is going on exile today.
data.anv: अभिशप्तोऽपि even when denounced, न क्रुध्यति will not be angry, क्रोधनीयानि acts provoking wrath, वर्जयन् while  abandoning, क्रुद्धान् those who were enraged, सर्वान् all of them, प्रसादयन् pacifies, समदुःखः sharing their sorrow, क्व where, गच्छति is going?

data.v: कौसल्यायां महातेजा यथा मातरि वर्तते । तथा यो वर्ततेऽस्मासु महात्मा क्व नु गच्छति ।।
data.es: Rama conducted himself towards us in the same way as he did towards his mother Kausalya right from the begining.
data.anv: महातेजाः effulgent, यः Rama, मातरि with regard to his mother, कौशल्यायाम् Kausalya, यथा as, वर्तते treats, तथा in that way, अस्मासु in us, वर्तते treats, महात्मा a magnanimous  one, क्व नु where, गच्छति is he going?

data.v: कैकेय्या क्लिश्यमानेन राज्ञा संचोदितो वनम् । परित्राता जनस्यास्य जगतः क्व नु गच्छति ।।
data.es: Tormented by Kaikeyi, the king ordered him to go to the forest. Where is he, who happened to be the protector of the people of this world, going now?
data.anv: कैकेय्या by Kaikeyi, क्लिश्यमानेन by being tormented, राज्ञा by the king, वनम् to the forest, सञ्चोदितः one ordered, अस्य जनस्य of these people, जगतः of the whole world, परित्राता protector, Rama, क्व नु where, गच्छति is he going?

data.v: अहो निश्चेतनो राजा जीवलोकस्य संप्रियम् । धर्म्यं सत्यव्रतं रामं वनवासो प्रवत्स्यति ।।
data.es: Alas, the king must be devoid of any sense as he is sending away Rama, who is dear to the world, is righteous and truthful, to dwell in the forest.
data.anv: राजा king, निश्चेतनः nonsense, अहो alas, जीवलोकस्य of the world of living beings, सम्प्रियम् is dear, धर्म्यम् is righteous, सत्यव्रतम् faithful to truth, रामम् Rama, वनवासे to dwell in the forest, प्रवत्स्यति is sending away.

data.v: इति सर्वा महिष्यस्ता विवत्सा इव धेनवः । रुरुदुश्चैव दुःखार्ताः सस्वरं च विचुक्रुशुः ।।
data.es: Thus all the queens like calfless cows cried loudly blaming their husband.
data.anv: इति thus, सर्वाः all, ताः महिष्यः all the wives, विवत्साः deprived of their calfs, धेनवः इव like cows, दुःखार्ताः tormented with sorrow, रुरुदुश्चैव wept, सस्वरम् loudly, विचुक्रुशुः cried.

data.v: स तमन्तःपुरे घोरमार्तशब्दं महीपतिः । पुत्रशोकाभिसंतप्तः श्रुत्वा चासीत्सुदुःखितः ।।
data.es: Tormented with grief on account of his son, the king sank in his seat on hearing the cries of distress from the inner apartment
data.anv: पुत्रशोकाभिसन्तप्तः oppressed with sorrow caused by the departure of his son, सः महीपतिः that king, अन्तःपुरे in the inner apartment (of the palace), घोरम् horible, तम् that, आर्त शब्दम्  wailings, श्रुत्वा having heard, सुदुःखितः आसीत् became increasingly distressed.

data.v: नाग्निहोत्राण्यहूयन्त सूर्यश्चान्तरधीयत । व्यसृजन्कवलान्नागा गावो वत्सान्न पाययन् ।।
त्रिशङ्कुर्लोहिताङ्गश्च बृहस्पतिबुधावपि । दारुणाः सोममभ्येत्य ग्रहाः सर्वे व्यवस्थिताः ।।
data.es: The constellation Trishanku, the planets Mars, Jupiter, Mercury and other fierce planets took their position near the Moon.
data.anv: त्रिशङ्कु: Trishanku, लोहिताङ्गश्च Mars, बृहस्पतिबुधावपि Jupiter as also Mercury, दारुणाः fierce aspect, सर्वे all, ग्रहाः planets, सोमम् Moon, अभ्येत्य approaching, व्यवस्थिताः remained.

data.v: नक्षत्राणि गतार्चींषि ग्रहाश्च गततेजसः । विशाखाश्च सधूमाश्च नभसि प्रचकाशिरे ।।
data.es: The stars were shorn of their radiance. The brilliance of the planets diminished. Shrouded in smoke the Visakha constellation appeared in the sky.
data.anv: नक्षत्राणि the constellation of stars, गतार्चींषि shorn of their radiance, ग्रहाश्च planets also, गततेजसः diminished  their brilliance, विशाखास्तु as for Visakha stars, सधूमाः with smoke, नभसि in the sky, प्रचकाशिरे were shining.

data.v: अकस्मान्नागरः सर्वो जनो दैन्यमुपागमत् । आहारे वा विहारे वा न कश्चिदकरोन्मनः ।।
data.es: All of a sudden the people of the city became miserable. No one was interested in eating and enjoying (life).
data.anv: सर्वः all, नागरः relating to the city, जनः people, अकस्मात् suddenly, दैन्यम् helplessness, उपागमत् obtained, आहारे वा either in nourishment, विहारे वा or in recreation, कश्चित् none, मनः their mind, न अकरात् not done.

data.v: बाष्पपर्याकुलमुखो राजमार्गगतो जनः । न हृष्टो लक्ष्यते कश्चित्सर्वः शोकपरायणः ।।
data.es: The faces of the people on the highway were turbid with tears. None looked happy. All were plunged in sorrow.
data.anv: राजमार्गगतः in the royal highway, जनः people, बाष्पपर्याकुलमुखः faces full of tears, कश्चित् any body, हृष्टः happy, न लक्ष्ययते could not be seen, सर्वः all, शोकपरायणः was plunged in sorrow.

data.v: न वाति पवनः शीतो न शशी सौम्यदर्शनः । न सूर्यस्तपते लोकं सर्वं पर्याकुलं जगत् ।।
data.es: The breeze did not blow cool. No more did the Moon look pleasant. The Sun did not give warmth to the world. All the world was agitated.
data.anv: पवनः wind, शीतः cool, न वाति does not blow, शशी Moon, सौम्यदर्शनः with pleasant appearance, न not, सूर्यः Sun, लोकम् the world, न तपते did not warm, सर्वम्  entire, जगत् world, पर्याकुलम् was agitated.

data.v: अनर्थिनः सुताः स्त्रीणां भर्तारो भ्रातरस्तथा । सर्वे सर्वं परित्यज्य राममेवान्वचिन्तयन् ।।
data.es: Mothers stopped thinking of their sons and husbands of their wives. Brothers were no longer interested in each other. Every one deserted every one and thought only of Rama.
data.anv: सुताः sons, भर्तारः husbands, स्त्रीणाम् towards women, अनर्थिनः had no concern, तथा similarly, भ्रातरः brothers, अनर्थिनः had no mutual interest, सर्वे all, सर्वम् everything, परित्यज्य having deserted, राममेव about Rama only, अन्वचिन्तयन् they thought.

data.v: ये तु रामस्य सुहृदः सर्वे ते मूढचेतसः । शोकभारेण चाक्रान्ताः शयनं न जुहुस्तदा ।।
data.es: All the friends of Rama were stupefied. Afflicted with the burden of sorrow they did not leave their bed.
data.anv: तदा then, रामस्य Rama's, ये सुहृदः those friends, ते सर्वे all of them, मूढचेतसः bewildered, शोकभारेण with burden of sorrow, आक्रान्ताः afflicted, शयनम् couches, न जहुः did not leave.

data.v: ततस्त्वयोध्या रहिता महात्मना; पुरंदरेणेव मही सपर्वता । चचाल घोरं भयभारपीडिता; सनागयोधाश्वगणा ननाद च ।।
data.es: Without magnanimous Rama, Ayodhya thereafter looked like the earth along with its mountains bereft of Indra. Afflicted with fear and sorrow it started shaking dreadfully with the sounds of horses, elephants and warriors. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyfirst sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, पुरन्दरेण by Indra, रहिता without, सपर्वता with mountains, महीव like earth, महात्मना magnanimous Rama, रहिता without, अयोध्या Ayodhya, भयशोकपीडिता agitated by fear and sorrow, घोरम् dreadfully, चचाल had shaken, सनागयोधाश्वगणा filled with hosts of  warriors, elephants and horses, ननाद च made sounds.

data.v: यावत्तु निर्यतस्तस्य रजोरूपमदृश्यत । नैवेक्ष्वाकुवरस्तावत्संजहारात्मचक्षुषी ।।
data.es: As long as the dust raised by the wheels of the chariot of Rama (who was departing to the forest) was visible, Dasaratha, the best of the Ikshvakus, could not withdraw his eyes (from Rama).
data.anv: तस्य that Rama, निर्यतः as he was going, रजोरूपम् the form of dust, यावत् as long as, अदृश्यत was visible, तावत् so long, इक्ष्वाकुवरः the best of Ikshvaku dynasty, king Dasaratha, आत्मचक्षुषी his eyes, नैव सञ्जहार did not withdraw.

data.v: यावद्राजा प्रियं पुत्रं पश्यत्यत्यन्तधार्मिकम् । तावद्व्यवर्धतेवास्य धरण्यां पुत्रदर्शने ।।
data.es: So long as king Dasaratha was able to see his exceedingly virtuous and beloved son (Rama), it appeared that his body kept rising from the earth to have a sight of his son.
data.anv: राजा king, प्रियम् beloved, अत्यन्तधार्मिकम् exceedingly virtuous, पुत्रम् son, यावत् as long as, पश्यति was able to see, तावत् so long, अस्य his, पुत्रदर्शने for the sight of the son, धरण्याम् the dust on the earth, व्यवर्धतेव appeared growing.

data.v: न पश्यति रजोऽप्यस्य यदा रामस्य भूमिपः । तदार्तश्च विषण्णश्च पपात धरणीतले ।।
data.es: When the king could no longer see even the dust, he fell on the ground, despondent and grief stricken.
data.anv: भूमिपः the king, यदा when, अस्य रामस्य that Rama's, रजोऽपि even the dust, न पश्यति could not see, तदा then, आर्तः च stricken with grief, विषण्णः च with despondency, धरणीतले on the earth, पपात fell down.

data.v: तस्य दक्षिणमन्वगात्कौसल्या बाहुमङ्गना । वामं चास्यान्वगात्पार्श्वं कैकेयी भरतप्रिया ।।
data.es: Kausalya reached for the right hand of Dasaratha (to raise him up) and Kaikeyi the beloved (mother) of Bharata reached for his left.
data.anv: अङ्गना wife, कौशल्या Kausalya, तस्य his, दक्षिणं बाहुम् right hand, अन्वगात् reached,  ,भरतप्रिया beloved (mother) of Bharata, कैकेयी च Kaikeyi, वामम् left, पार्श्वम् side, अन्वगात् reached.

data.v: तां नयेन च संपन्नो धर्मेण निवयेन च । उवाच राजा कैकेयीं समीक्ष्य व्यथितेन्द्रियः ।।
data.es: The king, endowed with rectitude, virtue and also humility, stared at and said to Kaikeyi with pain.
data.anv: नयेन with rectitude, धर्मेण with virtue, विनयेन च also with humility, सम्पन्नः endowed with, राजा king, तां कैकेयीम् to that Kaikeyi, समीक्ष्य having seen, व्यथितेन्द्रियः one with painful senses reeling, उवाच said.

data.v: कैकेयि मा ममाङ्गानि स्प्राक्षीस्त्वं दुष्टचारिणी । न हि त्वां द्रष्टुमिच्छामि न भार्या न च बान्धवी ।।
data.es: O Kaikeyi you are a woman of evil conduct. Do not touch my body. I do not wish to see you. You are not my wife or my relation.
data.anv: कैकेयि O Kaikeyi, दुष्टचारिणी a woman of evil conduct, त्वम् you, मम my, अङ्गानि limbs, मा स्प्राक्षीः do not touch, त्वाम् you, द्रष्टुम् to look at, न हि इच्छामि do not wish, भार्या wife, न not, बान्धवी relation, न not.

data.v: ये च त्वामुपजीवन्ति नाहं तेषां न ते मम । केवलार्थपरां हि त्वां त्यक्तधर्मां त्यजाम्यहम् ।।
data.es: Your dependents have nothing to do with me nor I with them. I denounce you since you are a selfseeker without any sense off righteousness.
data.anv: ये च who, त्वाम् you, अनुजीवन्ति depend upon you for subsistence, तेषाम् their, अहम् I, न not, ते they, मम to me, न not, केवलार्थपराम् seeking your selfish interests alone, त्यक्तधर्माम्  deserting righteousness, त्वाम् you, अहम् I, त्यजामि abandon.
data.md: O Kaikeyī, that have decided for following sin, do you not touch my person, nor do I wish to see you. You are no wife of mine, not even a maid-servant of a friend sharing his good graces. I am none to those that subsist on your favour, nor are they anything to me. I renounce you who solely seek your interest and have abandoned virtue.

data.v: अगृह्णां यच्च ते पाणिमग्निं पर्यणयं च यत् । अनुजानामि तत्सर्वमस्मिँल्लोके परत्र च ।।
data.es: I renounce the relationship established with you through marriage by taking your hand and circumambulating the fire, both in this world and in the next.
data.anv: ते your, पाणिम् hand, अगृह्णां (इति) यत् the fact of holding, अग्निम् of (to) fire, पर्यणयं च (इति) यत् the fact of having circumambulated, तत्सर्वम् all that, अस्मिन् in this, लोके world, परत्र च  in the next orld also, अनुजानामि renouncing.
data.md: I renounce all the advantages pertaining either to this world or the next which I am entitled to by virtue of having obtained your hand and having made you circumambulate the sacrificial fire.

data.v: भरतश्चेत्प्रतीतः स्याद्राज्यं प्राप्येदमव्ययम् । यन्मे स दद्यात्पित्रर्थं मा मा तद्दत्तमागमत् ।।
data.es: If Bharata feels pleased to secure this imperishable kingdom, then may his obsequial offerings at my funeral not reach me
data.anv: अव्ययम् imperishable, (इदं) राज्यम् this kingdom, प्राप्य having secured, भरतः Bharata, प्रतीतः स्यात् चेत् if he is pleased, सः he, पित्रर्थम् in the form of funeral offerings, मे to me, यत् which, दद्यात् gives, तद्दत्तम् given by him, माम्  me, मागमत् may it not reach.
data.md: If Bharata is satisfied with receiving this entire kingdom, let not what he spends on account of my funeral obsequies find its way to me.

data.v: अथ रेणुसमुध्वस्तं तमुत्थाप्य नराधिपम् । न्यवर्तत तदा देवी कौसल्या शोककर्शिता ।।
data.es: Then Kausalya, emaciated due to sorrow, lifted the king who was thoroughly coated with dust and returned to the palace.
data.anv: अथ then, रेणुसमुध्वस्तम् coated with dust, तं नराधिपम् to that king, समुत्थाप्य having lifted, देवी queen, कौशल्या Kausalya, शोककर्शिता emaciated due to sorrow, तदा then, न्यवर्तत  returned to her palace.
data.md: Then raising the lord of men covered with dust, the noble Kausalyā pierced with grief, stopped (along with the monarch.)

data.v: हत्वेव ब्राह्मणं कामात्स्पृष्ट्वाग्निमिव पाणिना । अन्वतप्यत धर्मात्मा पुत्रं संचिन्त्य तापसम् ।।
data.es: That virtuous Dasaratha, recalling (the sight of) his son with the robes of an ascetic, burned with remorse as if he had intentionally slain a brahmin or placed his hand in fire.
data.anv: धर्मात्मा virtuous one, तापसम् wearing the robes of an ascetic, पुत्रम् son, सञ्चिन्त्य remembering, कामात् intentionally, ब्राह्मणम् to a brahmin, हत्वेव as if slew, पाणिना with hand, अग्निम् to fire, स्पृष्ट्वा इव as if touched, अन्वतप्यत plunged in grief.
data.md: The righteous one remembering Rāghava repented himself, as if he had slain a Brāhmaṇa through inordinate desire, or as if he had placed his hand in fire.

data.v: निवृत्यैव निवृत्यैव सीदतो रथवर्त्मसु । राज्ञो नातिबभौ रूपं ग्रस्तस्यांशुमतो यथा ।।
data.es: Turning back again and again at the trail of (Rama's) chariot, the grieving king appeared lustreless like the Sun in eclipse.
data.anv: रथवर्त्मसु trail of the chariot, निवृत्त्यैव निवृत्त्यैव turning again and again, सीदतः grieving, राज्ञः  the king's, रूपम् countenance, ग्रस्तस्य as if swallowed by Rahu, अंशुमत: यथा like Sun,  नातिबभौ did not shine.
data.md: Having stopped again and again, the visage of the monarch lamenting on beholding the track of the car, appeared dim like the Moon invaded by Rāhu,

data.v: विललाप च दुःखार्तः प्रियं पुत्रमनुस्मरन् । नगरान्तमनुप्राप्तं बुद्ध्वा पुत्रमथाब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: The griefstricken king began to lament thinking of his beloved son, and (suddenly) realizing that his son had crossed the limits of the city, said:
data.anv: प्रियम् beloved, पुत्रम् son, अनुस्मरन् reflecting, दुःखार्तः tortured with sorrow, विललाप च  lamented, अथ then, पुत्रम् son, नगरान्तम् end of the city, अनुप्राप्तम् havng reached, बुध्वा  having realised, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: And stricken with grief, he lamented, remembering his beloved son, and thinking that by this time he had reached the precincts of the city, he broke out into the following.

data.v: वाहनानां च मुख्यानां वहतां तं ममात्मजम् । पदानि पथि दृश्यन्ते स महात्मा न दृश्यते ।।
data.es: I can see the marks of the hooves of the splendid horses carrying my son on the highway but not that magnanimous Rama.
data.anv: मम my, आत्मजम् son, तम् that Rama, वहताम् carrying, मुख्यानाम् preeminent, वाहनानाम्  horses', पदानि hoofprints, पथि in the path, दृश्यन्ते are seen, महात्मा magnanimous, सः Rama, न दृश्यत is not to be seen.
data.md: On the way are traced the foot-prints of those foremost of bearers that are carrying my son away; but that magnanimous one I do not find.

data.v: स नूनं क्वचिदेवाद्य वृक्षमूलमुपाश्रितः । काष्ठं वा यदि वाश्मानमुपधाय शयिष्यते ।।
data.es: Rama, the best of all my sons who, smeared with sandalpaste and fanned by graceful women used to sleep (with his head) on comfortable cushions will surely, from now on, lie down somewhere at the foot of a tree, (his head) pillowed upon a piece of wood or stone.
data.anv: यः मम सुतोत्तमः best among my  sons, चन्दनरूषितः daubed with sandal cream, महार्हाभिः graceful, स्त्रीभिः by women, वीज्यमानः being fanned, सुखेषु luxurious, उपधानेषु on cushions, शेते was sleeping, सः such Rama, अद्य today, नूनम् surely, क्वचिदेव some where, वृक्षमूलम् at the foot of a tree, उपाश्रितः taking refuge, काष्ठं a log, यदि वा or, आश्मानम् a stone, उपधाय using as pillow, शयिष्यते he will sleep.
data.md: And that meritorious son of mine, who, daubed with sandal, used to rest his head pleasantly upon a pillow, fanned by beauteous damsels decked in ornaments, will to-day surely take refuge underneath a tree, and lay his head on a wooden plank or a stone.

data.v: उत्थास्यति च मेदिन्याः कृपणः पांशुगुण्ठितः । विनिःश्वसन्प्रस्रवणात्करेणूनामिवर्षभः ।।
data.es: That unfortunate Rama, having been covered with dust, will get up from the ground sighing like a bull elephant rising from mount Prasravana.
data.anv: करेणूनाम् of female elephants, ऋषभः lord, bull elephant, प्रस्रवणात् इव like from Prasravana mountain, विनिश्वसन् heaving sighs, पांसुकुण्ठितः crusted with dust, कृपणः unfortunate     Rama, मेदिन्याः from the ground, उत्थास्यति च will rise up.
data.md: Covered with dust, he heaving sighs will rise from the ground in sad guise, like a leader of she-elephants rising from the side of a mountain.

data.v: द्रक्ष्यन्ति नूनं पुरुषा दीर्घबाहुं वनेचराः । राममुत्थाय गच्छन्तं लोकनाथमनाथवत् ।।
data.es: Surely the forestrovers will be gazing upon the longarmed Rama, protector of the world, as he rises (from the ground) and wanders in the jungle unprotected.
data.anv: दीर्घबाहुम् longarmed, लोकनाथं lord of the world, अनाथवत् like without a protector, उत्थाय  rising (from the ground), गच्छन्तम् walking, रामम् Rama, नूनम् surely, वनेचराः forestdwellers, पुरुषाः men, द्रक्ष्यन्ति they will see.
data.md: The rangers of the woods will now see the long-armed Rāma resembling the lord himself of the worlds, rising from the ground and going like one forlorn.

data.v: सकामा भव कैकेयि विधवा राज्यमावस । न हि तं पुरुषव्याघ्रं विना जीवितुमुत्सहे ।।
data.es: O Devi you will certainly rule the kingdom as a widow along with your son. (But) I do not wish to live after Rama is exiled.
data.anv: कैकेयि Kaikeyi, सकामा भव desire be fulfilled, विधवा as widow, राज्यम् kingdom, आवस inhabit, पुरुषव्याघ्रम् tiger among men, तं विना without him, जीवितुम् to live, न उत्सहे हि do not desire.
data.md: O Kaikeyi, do you realise your desire, do you becoming a widow, rule this kingdom. Without that best of men I cannot live.

data.v: इत्येवं विलपन्राजा जनौघेनाभिसंवृतः । अपस्नात इवारिष्टं प्रविवेश पुरोत्तमम् ।।
data.es: Thus the king, who looked like one after the inauspicious (funeral) bath, surrounded by streams of people entered the most beautiful city (Ayodhya) which portended misfortune.
data.anv: इत्येवम् in this manner, विलपन् lamenting, राजा king, जनौघेन by the multitude of people, अभिसंवृतः surrounded, अपस्नातः one who has taken inauspicious (funeral) bath, अरिष्टं इव like an ominous, पुरोत्तमम् best of cities (Ayodhya), प्रविवेश entered.
data.md: Thus lamenting, the king surrounded by the multitude, like one that had performed his bath after death, entered that best of cities filled with people enfeebled and smitten with grief, with its streets thinned of men and its stalls closed.

data.v: शून्यचत्वरवेश्मान्तां संवृतापणदेवताम् । क्लान्तदुर्बलदुःखार्तां नात्याकीर्णमहापथाम् ।।
data.es: There the mansions and squares on the highways were all deserted. The temples and marketplaces were closed. The people were weak, fatigued and tormented with grief. The highways were not much crowded. Having seen such a sight of the city on all sides, lamenting and brooding over Rama, Dasaratha entered his palace like the Sun plunging into a cloud.
data.anv: शून्यचत्वरवेश्मान्ताम् where the courtyards or the mansions were deserted, संवृतापणदेवताम् where temples and marketplaces were closed, क्लान्तदुर्बलदुःखार्ताम् weak and exhausted with with grief, नात्याकीर्णमहापथाम् the highways no longer crowded, ताम् that, सर्वाम् entire, पुरीम् to city of Ayodhya, आवेक्ष्य having seen, राजा king, राममेव about Rama only, अनुचिन्तयन् thinking, विलपन् lamenting, सूर्यः sun, अम्बुदम् इव like clouds, प्राविशत् entered.

data.v: तामवेक्ष्य पुरीं सर्वां राममेवानुचिन्तयन् । विलपन्प्राविशद्राजा गृहं सूर्य इवाम्बुदम् ।।
data.es: There the mansions and squares on the highways were all deserted. The temples and marketplaces were closed. The people were weak, fatigued and tormented with grief. The highways were not much crowded. Having seen such a sight of the city on all sides, lamenting and brooding over Rama, Dasaratha entered his palace like the Sun plunging into a cloud.
data.anv: शून्यचत्वरवेश्मान्ताम् where the courtyards or the mansions were deserted, संवृतापणदेवताम् where temples and marketplaces were closed, क्लान्तदुर्बलदुःखार्ताम् weak and exhausted with with grief, नात्याकीर्णमहापथाम् the highways no longer crowded, ताम् that, सर्वाम् entire, पुरीम् to city of Ayodhya, आवेक्ष्य having seen, राजा king, राममेव about Rama only, अनुचिन्तयन् thinking, विलपन् lamenting, सूर्यः sun, अम्बुदम् इव like clouds, प्राविशत् entered.

data.v: महाह्रदमिवाक्षोभ्यं सुपर्णेन हृतोरगम् । रामेण रहितं वेश्म वैदेह्या लक्ष्मणेन च ।।
data.es: The palace without Rama, Lakshmana and Sita, stood like a vast, unperturbed lake with serpents snatched away by Suparna (Garuda).
data.anv: रामेण with Rama, वैदेह्या with Sita, लक्ष्मणेन च also with Lakshmana, रहितम् absent, वेश्म palace, सुपर्णेन by Suparna, हृतोरगम् a serpent snatched away, अक्षोभ्यम् an unperturbed, महाह्रदम् इव like a great tank

data.v: कौसल्याया गृहं शीघ्रं राम मातुर्नयन्तु माम् । इति ब्रुवन्तं राजानमनयन्द्वारदर्शितः ।।
data.es: Take me quickly to the apartment of Rama's mother, Kausalya. There is no other place where my heart can find solace.
data.anv: राममातुः Rama's mother, कौशल्यायाः Kausalya's, गृहम् apartment, माम् me, शीघ्रम् quickly, नयन्तु be taken, मम हृदयस्य for my heart, अन्यत्र in any other place, आश्वासः solace, न भविष्यति हि not possible.
data.md: Do you speedily take me to the room of Rāma's mother, Kausalyā; for in no other place shall I find rest for my heart.

data.v: ततस्तत्र प्रविष्टस्य कौसल्याया निवेशनम् । अधिरुह्यापि शयनं बभूव लुलितं मनः ।।
data.es: His mind tossed restlessly although he entered Kausalya's palace and climbed into the couch.
data.anv: ततः then, कौशल्यायाः Kausalya's, निवेशनम् residence, प्रविष्टस्य having entered, तस्य his, मनः mind, शयनम् couch, अधिरुह्यापि though having climbed, लुलितम् बभूव was tossed about.
data.md: Having entered Kausalyā's apartment, the king having laid himself on the bed, was overwhelmed with emotion.

data.v: तच्च दृष्ट्वा महाराजो भुजमुद्यम्य वीर्यवान् । उच्चैः स्वरेण चुक्रोश हा राघव जहासि माम् ।।
data.es: The valiant maharaja looked around that palace, lifted up his arms and shouted in a loud voice, Oh scion of the Raghus (Rama) you have forsaken me.
data.anv: वीर्यवान् valiant, महाराजः the great king, तत् that palace, दृष्ट्वा having seen, भुजम् his hands, उद्यम्य  having lifted up, हा राघव Oh Rama, माम् me, जहासि are forsaking, उच्चौः स्वरेण in loud voice, चुक्रोश screamed.
data.md: Beholding this, the puissant sovereign raising up his arm, burst out into lamentations, saying, “Ah! Rāma, you forsakes us both! Ah me! surely those blessed people are happy, who having passed this gap of time, will behold Rāma returned and will embrace him."

data.v: सुखिता बत तं कालं जीविष्यन्ति नरोत्तमाः । परिष्वजन्तो ये रामं द्रक्ष्यन्ति पुनरागतम् ।।
data.es: Oh how fortunate are those best of men who will live until that time to see Rama return and embrace him.
data.anv: ये नरोत्तमाः those fortunate people, तं कालम् till that tme, जीविष्यन्ति will live, पुनः again, आगतम् return, रामम् Rama, परिष्वजन्तः while embracing, सुखिताः happily, द्रक्ष्यन्ति will see, बत what a pity?
data.md: Beholding this, the puissant sovereign raising up his arm, burst out into lamentations, saying, “Ah! Rāma, you forsakes us both! Ah me! surely those blessed people are happy, who having passed this gap of time, will behold Rāma returned and will embrace him."

data.v: न त्वां पश्यामि कौसल्ये साधु मां पाणिना स्पृश । रामं मेऽनुगता दृष्टिरद्यापि न निवर्तते ।।
data.md: I do not perceive you, O Kausalyā. Do you touch me with your hand. My sight having followed Rāma does not return yet.

data.v: तं राममेवानुविचिन्तयन्तं; समीक्ष्य देवी शयने नरेन्द्रम् । उपोपविश्याधिकमार्तरूपा; विनिःश्वसन्ती विललाप कृच्छ्रम् ।।
data.es: Having seen the king in bed brooding over Rama, the queen, (Kausalya), sitting by his side, sighed and lamented, deeply anguished. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे द्विचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortysecond sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: देवी Kausalya, शयने in bed, रामम् एव Rama alone, अनुविचिन्तयन्तम् one who was continuously brooding, तं नरेन्द्रम् that king, समीक्ष्य having seen, उपोपविश्य sitting by his side, अधिकम् extremely, आर्तरूपा distressed, विनिश्वसन्ती sighing deeply, कृच्छ्रम् being in painful situation, विललाप lamented.
data.md: Then seeing that foremost of men absorbed in the contemplation of Rāma, that noble dame sat by him, and afflicted with greater grief, began to indulge in sorrow,* sighing heavily. *Another text reads vinisvasantam, joining it to narendram, foremost of men.

data.v: ततः समीक्ष्य शयने सन्नं शोकेन पार्थिवम् । कौसल्या पुत्रशोकार्ता तमुवाच महीपतिम् ।।
data.es: Struck by the grief of her son's departure, Kausalya looked at the king who lay on the couch completely exhausted and said to him.
data.anv: ततः then, पुत्रशोकार्ता struck by grief on account of her son's departure, कौशल्या  Kausalya, शयने on the couch, शोकेन due to grief, सन्नम् exhausted, पार्थिवम् king, समीक्ष्य having gazed, तं महीपतिम् to that lord of the world, Dasaratha, उवाच said.
data.md: Then seeing the king lying down stupified with grief, Kausalya, aggrieved for her son, spoke to the lord of earth, saying.

data.v: राघवो नरशार्दूल विषमुप्त्वा द्विजिह्ववत् । विचरिष्यति कैकेयी निर्मुक्तेव हि पन्नगी ।।
data.es: Moving crookedly like a snake, Kaikeyi has released her venom on Rama, the best among men. Now she will move about freely like a sheserpent that has cast off its slough.
data.anv: अहिजह्मगा moving obliquely like a serpent, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, नरशार्दूले tiger (best) among men, राघवे in Rama, विषम् venom, उप्त्वा having sown out, निर्मुक्ता casting off the slough, पन्नगी इव like a sheserpent, विचरिष्यति will wander about.
data.md: O best of men, having vented her venom upon Rāghava, the crooked Kaikeyi will go about like a she serpent that has cast off her slough.

data.v: विवास्य रामं सुभगा लब्धकामा समाहिता । त्रासयिष्यति मां भूयो दुष्टाहिरिव वेश्मनि ।।
data.es: Having banished Rama, she is now happy with her desires fulfilled. And like a vicious serpent living in the house she will again frighten me.
data.anv: सुभगा happly, (Kaikeyi), रामम् Rama, विवास्य having banished, लब्दकामा having satisfied her desires, भूयः again, वेश्मनि in the house, दुष्टाहिरिव like a vicious serpent, माम् me, समाहिता accomplished, त्रासयिष्यति will torture me.
data.md: And that fortunate one having by her endeavours attained her end, will frighten me the more like a wicked serpent in one's house.

data.v: अथ स्म नगरे रामश्चरन्भैक्षं गृहे वसेत् । कामकारो वरं दातुमपि दासं ममात्मजम् ।।
data.es: It would have been better had I offered her my son as a slave. He would have lived on in the house by doing his duties and begging his food in the city.
data.anv: मम my, आत्मजम् son, दासम् as slave, दातुम् अपि even to give, वरम् is better, अथ  thereafter, रामः Rama, कामकारः discharging the duties, नगरे in the city (Ayodhya), भैक्षम् food obtained by begging, चरन् moving about, गृहे in the house, वसेत् would have lived.
data.md: If Rāma had stayed in this city subsisting himself by alms, or had I made my son as Kaikeyi's slave, even that would have been preferable (before his retirement to the woods.)
