data.v: पातयित्वा तु कैकेय्या रामं स्थानाद्यथेष्टतः । प्रदिष्टो रक्षसां भागः पर्वणीवाहिताग्निना ।।
data.es: You have thrown away Rama from his place as per the whim of Kaikeyi, like the share of offering meant for gods given away to rakshasas by the sacrificers on the new Moon days.
data.anv: कैकेय्या of Kaikeyi, यथेष्टतः according to her whim, रामम् to Rama, स्थानात् from his place, पातयित्वा having thrown down, अहिताग्निना by the sacrificers, पर्वणि on the new moon days, रक्षसाम् to rakshasas, भागः इव like the share, प्रदिष्टः is given.
data.md: Like to the sacrificial share cast to the Rākşasas by the sacrificers on the occasions of Parvas that wielder of the bow, the mightyarmed Rāma, gifted with the gait of the prince of elephants, cast off by Kaikeyī, takes refuge in the forest in company with his wife and Laks mana.

data.v: गजराजगतिर्वीरो महाबाहुर्धनुर्धरः । वनमाविशते नूनं सभार्यः सहलक्ष्मणः ।।
data.es: My mightyarmed son, a great archer and a hero, Rama whose gait is like that of the king of elephants, must be entering the forest along with his consort Sita and Lakshmana.
data.anv: गजराजगतिः having the gait of the king of the elephants, वीरः hero, महाबाहुः mightyarmed,  धनुर्धरः archer Rama, सभार्यः with wife, सहलक्ष्मणः with Lakshmana, नूनम् surely, वनम् forest, आविशते is entering.

data.v: वने त्वदृष्टदुःखानां कैकेय्यानुमते त्वया । त्यक्तानां वनवासाय का न्ववस्था भविष्यति ।।
data.es: You have banished them as per the desire of Kaikeyi. What will be their plight in the forest, for they have never experienced any hardship earlier
data.anv: अदृष्टदुःखानाम् who have never seen suffering, कैकेय्याः Kaikeyi's, अनुमते her desire, त्वया by you, वनवासाय to dwell in the forest, त्यक्तानाम् have been abandoned, वने in the  forest, का नु what, अवस्था भविष्यति will be their state.
data.md: Despatched by you to the woods at the command of Kaikeyi, to what a plight will they, not inured to the privations of a forest-life, be reduced!

data.v: ते रत्नहीनास्तरुणाः फलकाले विवासिताः । कथं वत्स्यन्ति कृपणाः फलमूलैः कृताशनाः ।।
data.es: Deprived of all costly things they have been banished at the tender age of youth, a time for enjoying their lives. How will they lead a miserable life subsisting on fruits and roots?
data.anv: रत्नहीनाः deprived of best of things, फलकाले at the time of fruition (enjoyment), विवासिताः having been exiled, तरुणाः young people, ते they, कृपणाः living in misery, फलमूलैः fruits and roots, कृताशनाः for food, कथम् how, वत्स्यन्ति will they live?
data.md: And bereft of elegant apparel, how will they of tender years, exiled in this time of enjoyment, pass their lives in misery, subsisting on fruits and roots!

data.v: अपीदानीं स कालः स्यान्मम शोकक्षयः शिवः । सभार्यं यत्सह भ्रात्रा पश्येयमिह राघवम् ।।
data.es: Will there ever be that auspicious moment to end my sorrow? When I can see Rama here along with his wife and brother?
data.anv: यत् when, सभार्यम् with wife, राघवम् Rama, सह भ्रात्रा with Lakshmana, इह here, पश्येयम् I shall see, शोकक्षयः annhilation of sorrow, शिवः auspcious, सः कालः that time, इदानीम्  now, मम to me, अपि स्यात् will it come?
data.md: Will such a time present itself now that my grief removed and my desire attained, I shall here behold Rāghava along with his wife and brother?

data.v: श्रुत्वैवोपस्थितौ वीरौ कदायोध्या भविष्यति । यशस्विनी हृष्टजना सूच्छ्रितध्वजमालिनी ।।
data.es: When will the city of Ayodhya attain that glory when having heard that both the brave brothers have come back the people will rejoice and fill it with uplifted banners?
data.anv: वीरौ the two heroes, उपस्थितौ having returned, श्रुत्वैव hearing, यशस्विनी famous, अयोध्या Ayodhya, हृष्टजना with cheerful people, सूच्छ्रितध्वजमालिनी uplifted flags, कदा when?, भविष्यति will it be?
data.md: When, hearing that those heroes have come, will Ayodhyā adorned with standards and garlands, attain fame, with her populace filled with joy?

data.v: कदा प्रेक्ष्य नरव्याघ्रावरण्यात्पुनरागतौ । नन्दिष्यति पुरी हृष्टा समुद्र इव पर्वणि ।।
data.es: When will, like the swelling sea on a full Moon day, the city hail the return of Rama and Lakshmana, the best among men?
data.anv: अरण्यात् from the forest, पुनः again, आगतौ having come back, नरव्याघ्रौ tigers (best) among men, Rama and Lakshmana, प्रेक्ष्य having seen, पुरी the city of Ayodhya, पर्वणि on a fullmoon day, समुद्र इव like the sea, हृष्टा overflow (overjoyed), कदा when, नन्दिष्यति will it rejoice?
data.md: When, seeing those foremost of men returned from the forest, will the city overflow with delight, like the ocean on the occasion of a Parva?

data.v: कदायोध्यां महाबाहुः पुरीं वीरः प्रवेक्ष्यति । पुरस्कृत्य रथे सीतां वृषभो गोवधूमिव ।।
data.es: When will the mightyarmed hero (Rama) enter the city of Ayodhya with Sita in front in the chariot, like a bull following the cow?
data.anv: महाबाहुः mightyarmed, वीरः hero, वृषभः bull, गोवधूमिव like cow, सीताम् Sita, रथे on the chariot, पुरस्कृत्य placing in front, अयोध्यां पुरीम् to the city of Ayodhya, कदा when, प्रवेक्ष्यति will enter?
data.md: When will the mighty-armed hero enter the city of Ayodhyā, placing Sītā before him on the car, like to a bull having his bovine mate before him?

data.v: कदा प्राणिसहस्राणि राजमार्गे ममात्मजौ । लाजैरवकरिष्यन्ति प्रविशन्तावरिंदमौ ।।
data.es: When will the people in their thousands shower the parched grain on the highway when my sons (Rama and Lakshmana), subduers of enemies, enter the city?
data.anv: प्रविशन्तौ when they enter, अरिन्दमौ subduers of enemies, मम my, आत्मजौ sons, राजमार्गे on the highway, प्राणिसहस्राणि thousands of people, लाजैः with parched grain, कदा when, अवकिरिष्यन्ति shower.
data.md: When will people by thousands shower fried paddy upon my sons on the road, as those repressors of foes will enter the city?

data.v: कदा सुमनसः कन्या द्विजातीनां फलानि च । प्रदिशन्त्यः पुरीं हृष्टाः करिष्यन्ति प्रदक्षिणम् ।।
data.es: When will I see them delightfully moving round the city with young brahmin girls offering them flowers and fruits.
data.anv: हृष्टाः delighted, कन्याद्विजातीनाम् to young girls and to brahmins, सुमनसः flowers, फलानि च fruits also, प्रदिशन्तः while offering, कदा when, पुरीम् the city, प्रदक्षिणम् circling, करिष्यन्ति will do?
data.md: When accepting flowers from girls and fruits from Brahmanas, will they, filled with delight, go round the palace?

data.v: कदा परिणतो बुद्ध्या वयसा चामरप्रभः । अभ्युपैष्यति धर्मज्ञस्त्रिवर्ष इव मां ललन् ।।
data.es: When will Rama, the knower of righteousness, possessing the lustre of gods, and fully mature in age and wisdom come back to me playfully like a threeyearold boy?
data.anv: अमरप्रभः possessing the lustre of gods, धर्मज्ञः knower of righteousness (Rama), बुद्ध्या in wisdom, वयसा च in age, परिणतः fully mature, त्रिवर्षः इव like a three year old boy, ललन् playfully, माम् me, कदा when, अभ्युपैष्यति will he reach?
data.md: When with his intelligence ripened by time, although resembling a celestial in age, will that righteous-souled one come here, rejoicing people like a Trivarsa?* *Three consecutive showers, favourable tot he erops.

data.v: निःसंशयं मया मन्ये पुरा वीर कदर्यया । पातु कामेषु वत्सेषु मातॄणां शातिताः स्तनाः ।।
data.es: O valiant one, in my previous birth I must have undoubtedly hacked off the udders of cows when the calves were thirsting for milk from their mothers.
data.anv: वीर O valiant one, कदर्यया out of avarice, मया by myself, निस्संशयम् undoubtedly, पुरा formerly, वत्सेषु calves, पातुकामेषु thirsting for milk, मातृ़णाम् of mothers, स्तनाः udders, शातिताः hacked by me.
data.md: Doubtless, O hero, formerly of vile ways that I was, I had cut off the paps of kine and thus prevented their calves hungering after their mothers' milk, from drinking it.

data.v: साहं गौरिव सिंहेन विवत्सा वत्सला कृता । कैकेय्या पुरुषव्याघ्र बालवत्सेव गौर्बलात् ।।
data.es: O best of men I have been forcibly separated from my affectionate son by Kaikeyi just like a cow from its calf by a lion.
data.anv: पुरुषव्य्राघ्र O tiger among men, बालवत्सा young calf, गौरिव like cow, वत्सला having affection in the calf, सा अहम् I, कैकेय्या by Kaikeyi, सिंहेन by lion, गौरिव like cow, बलात् forcibly, विवत्सा separated from the calf, कृता is rendered.
data.md: And it is for this sin that, О foremost of men, have I, attached to my son, been forcibly deprived of him by Kaikeyi, like a cow deprived of her calf by a lion.

data.v: न हि तावद्गुणैर्जुष्टं सर्वशास्त्रविशारदम् । एकपुत्रा विना पुत्रमहं जीवितुमुत्सहे ।।
data.es: I cannot live without my only son who is adept in all scriptures and endowed with all virtues.
data.anv: एकपुत्रा having only one son, अहम् I, तावद्गुणैः with such virtue, जुष्टम् endowed with, सर्वशास्त्रविशारदम् adept in all shastras, पुत्रं विना without my son, जीवितुम् to live, न उत्सहे हि I do not desire.
data.md: Having an only son, I dare not live without him endowed with every virtue and versed in every branch of learning.

data.v: न हि मे जीविते किंचित्सामर्थमिह कल्प्यते । अपश्यन्त्याः प्रियं पुत्रं महाबाहुं महाबलम् ।।
data.es: Without seeing my beloved son, longarmed and mighty, I have but little strength to live in this world.
data.anv: महाबाहुम् mightyarmed, महाबलम् immensely strong, प्रियं पुत्रम् beloved son, अपश्यन्त्या: without seeing him, मे for me, इह in this world, जीविते in this life,  किञ्चित् little, सामर्थ्यम् ability, न कल्प्यते हि is not provided.
data.md: Not seeing my beloved son and the mighty Lakşmaņa, I cannot live at all.

data.v: अयं हि मां दीपयते समुत्थित;स्तनूजशोकप्रभवो हुताशनः । महीमिमां रश्मिभिरुत्तमप्रभो; यथा निदाघे भगवान्दिवाकरः ।।
data.es: I am consumed by this blazing fire of grief caused by separation from my son like the earth scorched in summer by the Sungod with his oppressive raysइत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे त्रिचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortythird sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: तनूजशोकप्रभवः born out of the grief of separation from my son, अयम् this, हुताशनः fire, समुत्थितः having arisen, निदाघे in summer, उद्धतप्रभः immense heat, भगवान्  divine, दिवाकरः Sun, रश्मिभिः with his rays, इमाम् this, महीं यथा like earth, माम् me, दीपयते is burning.
data.md: As in summer the divine Sun furnished with fierce rays burns this earth, even so this raging fire of grief of account of my son consumes me.

data.v: विलपन्तीं तथा तां तु कौसल्यां प्रमदोत्तमाम् । इदं धर्मे स्थिता धर्म्यं सुमित्रा वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: While Kausalya, the best of women was thus lamenting, virtuous Sumitra spoke to her these righteous words:
data.anv: धर्मे in virtues, स्थिता abiding, सुमित्रा Sumitra, तथा then, विलपन्तीम् lamenting, प्रमदोत्तमाम् best among women, तां कौशल्याम् to that Kausalya, धर्म्यम् conforming to righteousness, इदं वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: As that best of ladies, Kausalyā, was thus lamenting, Sumitrā ever abiding in virtue, spoke to her these words consistent with righteousness.

data.v: तवार्ये सद्गुणैर्युक्तः पुत्रः स पुरुषोत्तमः । किं ते विलपितेनैवं कृपणं रुदितेन वा ।।
data.es: My venerable lady, your son Rama is the greatest among men and is endowed with every virtue. Why do you lament in this way? Why do you weep bitterly?
data.anv: आर्ये O venerable one, सद्गुणैः with every good quality, युक्तः endowed with, तव your, सः पुत्रः such a son, पुरुषोत्तमः the greatest among men, एवम् in this way, ते you, विलपितेन with lamentation, कृपणम् bitterly, रुदितेन वा or by weeping, किम् what is the use?
data.md: O worshipful one, your son is crowned with all qualities, and is the best of men. Why then do you bewail thus, or weep bitterly?

data.v: यस्तवार्ये गतः पुत्रस्त्यक्त्वा राज्यं महाबलः । साधु कुर्वन्महात्मानं पितरं सत्यवादिनाम् ।।
data.es: In order to vindicate the words of his great and truthful father, O noble lady,your mighty son has renounced the kingdom and has gone (to the forest). He has stuck to the path so scrupulously followed by the wise, the everlasting results of which can be fully realised in the world to come. Such a peerless son is never to be grieved over.
data.anv: आर्ये O noble lady, महाबलः mighty, यः Rama, तव पुत्रः your son, महात्मानम्   magnanimous, पितरम् father, साधु worthy of, सत्यवादिनम् as truthful one, कुर्वन् to do, राज्यम् kingdom, त्यक्त्वा renouncing, शिष्टैः by virtuous men, सम्यक् fully, शश्वत्  everlasting, आचरिते followed, प्रेत्य in the next world, फलोदये at the time of fruition, धर्मे in virtues, स्थितः stuck, श्रेष्ठः best, सः that, रामः Rama, कदाचन at any point, शोच्यः न  not to be grieved over.
data.md: Since, O revered one, renouncing the kingdom, your mighty son wendeth (to the woods) with the view of fulfiling the intention of his high-souled and truthful sire, the worthy Rāma staying in the duty that is completely observed by the good and the performance of which always bringeth welfare in the next world, should by no means be lamented.

data.v: शिष्टैराचरिते सम्यक्शश्वत्प्रेत्य फलोदये । रामो धर्मे स्थितः श्रेष्ठो न स शोच्यः कदाचन ।।
data.es: In order to vindicate the words of his great and truthful father, O noble lady,your mighty son has renounced the kingdom and has gone (to the forest). He has stuck to the path so scrupulously followed by the wise, the everlasting results of which can be fully realised in the world to come. Such a peerless son is never to be grieved over.
data.anv: आर्ये O noble lady, महाबलः mighty, यः Rama, तव पुत्रः your son, महात्मानम्   magnanimous, पितरम् father, साधु worthy of, सत्यवादिनम् as truthful one, कुर्वन् to do, राज्यम् kingdom, त्यक्त्वा renouncing, शिष्टैः by virtuous men, सम्यक् fully, शश्वत्  everlasting, आचरिते followed, प्रेत्य in the next world, फलोदये at the time of fruition, धर्मे in virtues, स्थितः stuck, श्रेष्ठः best, सः that, रामः Rama, कदाचन at any point, शोच्यः न  not to be grieved over.
data.md: Since, O revered one, renouncing the kingdom, your mighty son wendeth (to the woods) with the view of fulfiling the intention of his high-souled and truthful sire, the worthy Rāma staying in the duty that is completely observed by the good and the performance of which always bringeth welfare in the next world, should by no means be lamented.

data.v: वर्तते चोत्तमां वृत्तिं लक्ष्मणोऽस्मिन्सदानघः । दयावान्सर्वभूतेषु लाभस्तस्य महात्मनः ।।
data.es: Blameless Lakshmana, compassionate to all beings, has acted most nobly in this matter for the benefit of his great soul.
data.anv: अनघः blameless one, सर्वभूतेषु in all creatures, दयावान् compassionate, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, अस्मिन् in the matter (of Rama), सदा always, उत्तमाम् highest, वृत्तिम् conduct, वर्तते doing(showing), महात्मनः great soul, तस्य to him, लाभः is benefit.
data.md: That sinless one, Laksmana, kind to all creatures, will minister to Rāma in the best way possible, and this is to the advantage of that high-souled one.

data.v: अरण्यवासे यद्दुःखं जानती वै सुखोचिता । अनुगच्छति वैदेही धर्मात्मानं तवात्मजम् ।।
data.es: The daughter of Videha (Sita) who was used to comforts has knowingly followed your virtuous son into the hardships of forest life.
data.anv: सुखोचिता used to comforts, वैदेही Sita, अरण्यवासे living in the forest, यत् दुःखम् those hardships, जानती वै knowingly, धर्मात्मानम् virtuous, तव your, आत्मजम् son, अनुगच्छति is following.
data.md: And experiencing the hardships that come of living in the forest, Vaidehi deserving of happiness follows your righteous son.

data.v: कीर्तिभूतां पताकां यो लोके भ्रामयति प्रभुः । दमसत्यव्रतपरः किं न प्राप्तस्तवात्मजः ।।
data.es: Your allcompetent son who considers righteousness and truth as wealth, is waving the flag of fame in this world. What is that which your son did not gain ?
data.anv: प्रभुः competent, यः who, कीर्तिभूताम् renowned, पताकाम् the banner, लोके in this world, भ्रमयति waving, धर्मसत्यव्रतधनः one who considers righteousness and truth as wealth, तव आत्मजः your son, किम् what, न प्राप्तः did not gain.
data.md: What is wanting to that maintainer of all, your son of subdued senses, intent upon truth and the observance of vows, who is spreading his banner of fame over the world?

data.v: व्यक्तं रामस्य विज्ञाय शौचं माहात्म्यमुत्तमम् । न गात्रमंशुभिः सूर्यः संतापयितुमर्हति ।।
data.es: Knowing Rama's sterling purity and greatness the Sun evidently dare not scorch his body with its rays.
data.anv: रामस्य Rama's, शौचम् purity, उत्तमम् excellent, माहात्म्यम् greatness, विज्ञाय having known, सूर्यः sun, अंशुभिः with rays, गात्रम् body, सन्तापयितुम् to torment, न अर्हति will not be inclined,  व्यक्तम् this is evident.
data.md: Acquainted with Rāma's manifest purity and high magnanimity, the Sun himself will not dare burn his body with his rays.

data.v: शिवः सर्वेषु कालेषु काननेभ्यो विनिःसृतः । राघवं युक्तशीतोष्णः सेविष्यति सुखोऽनिलः ।।
data.es: A pleasant yet moderately hot and cold breeze blowing through the woodlands will serve Rama at all seasons.
data.anv: शिवः gracious, काननेभ्यः from the woodlands, विनिस्सृतः blowing out, युक्तशीतोष्णः with moderate heat and cold, सुखः pleasant, अनिलः breeze, राघवम् of Rama, सर्वेषु कालेषु at all seasons, सेविष्यति will attend.
data.md: And issuing from the woods at all hours, the delicious air impregnated with heat and cold will serve Raghava.

data.v: शयानमनघं रात्रौ पितेवाभिपरिष्वजन् । रश्मिभिः संस्पृशञ्शीतैश्चन्द्रमा ह्लादयिष्यति ।।
data.es: While that sinless Rama sleeps at night, the Moon will comfort him by touching him with cool beams like a father embracing his son.
data.anv: चन्द्रमा the Moon, रात्रौ at night, अनघं sinless man, शयानम् while asleep, शीतैः cool, रश्मिभिः with rays, संस्पृशन् while touching, पितेव like father, अभिपरिष्वजन् while embracing, आह्लादयिष्यति delight.
data.md: And when he will lie down at night, the Moon touching him with his beams and embracing him even like his own father, will gladden his heart.

data.v: ददौ चास्त्राणि दिव्यानि यस्मै ब्रह्मा महौजसे । दानवेन्द्रं हतं दृष्ट्वा तिमिध्वजसुतं रणे ।।
data.es: To the mighty, heroic Rama, that best of men, Brahmalike Viswamitra has bequeathed many divine weapons, seeing him slay Timidhwaja's son (Subahu), lord of demons, in the battle. He will stay fearless in the forest, relying on the strength of his own arms as though he were living in the palace.
data.anv: रणे in war, दानवेन्द्रम् lord of demons, तिमिध्वजसुतम् Timidhwaja's son, हतम् having been killed, दृष्ट्वा having seen, महौजसे having great lustre, यस्मै to that Rama, ब्रह्मा like second Bramha, (Viswamitra), दिव्यानि divine, अस्त्राणि weapons, ददौ gave, शूरः brave, पुरुषव्याघ्रः best of men, सः that Rama, अरण्यस्थोऽपि though staying in the forest, स्वबाहुबलम् with the strength of his arms, आश्रितः taking refuge, असन्त्रस्तः without fear, वेश्मनीव like in his own palace, निवत्स्यति will reside.
data.md: That hero of mighty energy on whom Brahma had conferred celestial weapons, seeing that foremost of the Dānavas, the son of Timidhvaja, slain in battle, that tiger-like one, relying on the native strength of his arms, will fearlessly abide in the forest as if in his own home.

data.v: पृथिव्या सह वैदेह्या श्रिया च पुरुषर्षभः । क्षिप्रं तिसृभिरेताभिः सह रामोऽभिषेक्ष्यते ।।
data.es: Rama, the best among men, will soon be coronated with these three namely the earth, the goddess of fortune and Sita.
data.anv: पुरुषर्षभः eminent among men, रामः Rama, पृथिव्या सह with earth, वैदेह्य along with Sita, श्रिया च with the goddess of fortune, एताभिः with these, तिसृभिः सह with three, क्षिप्रम् quickly, अभिषेक्षयते will be consecrated.
data.md: And that best of men, Räma, will soon be installed in the kingdom, in company with these three, the Earth, Vaidehī, and the goddess of victory.

data.v: दुःखजं विसृजन्त्यस्रं निष्क्रामन्तमुदीक्ष्य यम् । समुत्स्रक्ष्यसि नेत्राभ्यां क्षिप्रमानन्दजं पयः ।।
data.es: Soon you will see him enthrouned shining in full glory on his return from exile while tears of joy will flow from your eyes.
data.anv: पुनः again, प्रविष्टम् having entered, अभिषिक्तम् enthroned, महाश्रियम् shining in glory, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा having seen, क्षिप्रम् soon, नेत्राभ्याम् from your eyes, अनन्दजम् arising out of joy, पयः water, समुत्स्रक्ष्यसि pour out.

data.v: अभिवादयमानं तं दृष्ट्वा ससुहृदं सुतम् । मुदाश्रु मोक्ष्यसे क्षिप्रं मेघलेकेव वार्षिकी ।।
data.es: Like a flake of cloud in monsoon, you are going to shed tears of joy soon seeing your son along with his friends bowing to you in reverence.
data.anv: अभिवादयमानम् one while bowing to you in reverence, ससुहृदम् along with friends, तं सुतम् to your son, दृष्ट्वा seeing, क्षिप्रम् soon, वार्षिकी pertaining to rainyseason, मेघलेखेव like a streak of clouds, मुदा delightfully, अश्रु tears, मोक्ष्यसे you are going to shed.
data.md: Beholding your son surrounded by his friends, bowing to you, you will soon shed blissful tears, even like a rain-cloud.

data.v: पुत्रस्ते वरदः क्षिप्रमयोध्यां पुनरागतः । कराभ्यां मृदुपीनाभ्यां चरणौ पीडयिष्यति ।।
data.es: Your son, bestower of boons, will soon return to Ayodhya and press your feet with his soft, tender hands.
data.anv: वरदः one who confers boons, ते पुत्रः your son, क्षिप्रम् soon, अयोध्याम् to Ayodhya, पुनः again, आगतः having returned, मृदुपीनाभ्याम् tender and plump, पाणिभ्याम् hands, चरणौ your feet, पीडयिष्यति will press.
data.md: And soon will your son conferring boons, returning (to this place), press your feet with those soft and plump hands of his.

data.v: निशम्य तल्लक्ष्मणमातृवाक्यं; रामस्य मातुर्नरदेवपत्न्याः । सद्यः शरीरे विननाश शोकः; शरद्गतो मेघ इवाल्पतोयः ।।
data.es: On hearing the words of Lakshmana's mother the grief in the heart of the queen (Kausalya), mother of Rama, instantly disappeared like the autumnal cloud that holds but little rain. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे चतुश्चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyfourth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: तत् that, लक्ष्मणमातृवाक्यम् words of Lakshmana's mother, निशम्य having heard, नरदेवपत्न्या: queen, रामस्य मातुः of Rama's mother, शोकः grief, शरद्गतः relating to autumn, अल्पतोयः with slight moisture, मेघ इव like cloud, सद्यः instantly, शरीरे in the body, विननाश destroyed.
data.md: Hearing those words of Laksmana's mother, the wife of the best of men, Rāma's mother, had her sorrow destroyed in her person, even like and autumnal cloud surcharged with slight rain.

data.v: अनुरक्ता महात्मानं रामं सत्यपरक्रमम् । अनुजग्मुः प्रयान्तं तं वनवासाय मानवाः ।।
data.es: When the highsouled Rama whose strength was his sense of truth set out for the forest, the faithful people followed him.
data.anv: अनुरक्ताः devoted, मानवाः men, वनवासाय to dwell in the forest, प्रयान्तम् setting out, महात्मानम् great, सत्यपराक्रमम् to one whose truth is his power, तं रामम् that Rama, अनुजग्मुः followed him.
data.md: The people, who yarned after Rāma having truth for prowess, followed him repairing to the forest.

data.v: निवर्तितेऽपि च बलात्सुहृद्वर्गे च राजिनि । नैव ते संन्यवर्तन्त रामस्यानुगता रथम् ।।
data.es: The king and the hosts of friends were forcibly sent back but they did not return. They continued to follow the chariot of Rama.
data.anv: सुहृद्वर्गे when hosts of friends, राजनि च and when the king, बलात् forcibly, निवर्तितेऽपि च  though sent back, रामस्य Rama's, रथम् chariot, अनुगताः followers, ते those people, नैव     संन्यवर्तन्त did not return.
data.md: Even when the king in the interests of his son had with much ado restrained himself, these, following Răma's car, did not desist.

data.v: अयोध्यानिलयानां हि पुरुषाणां महायशाः । बभूव गुणसंपन्नः पूर्णचन्द्र इव प्रियः ।।
data.es: The illustrious and virtuous Rama was as dear to the inhabitants of Ayodhya as the full Moon.
data.anv: महायशाः illustrious, गुणसम्पन्नः endowed with virtue of every kind, अयोध्यानिलयानाम् dwelling in Ayodhya, पुरुषाणाम् for men, पूर्णचन्द्र इव like the full Moon, प्रियः बभूव हि became dear.
data.md: That illustrious one crowned with every perfection was dear to the inhabitants of Ayodhyā like to the full moon himself.

data.v: स याच्यमानः काकुत्स्थः स्वाभिः प्रकृतिभिस्तदा । कुर्वाणः पितरं सत्यं वनमेवान्वपद्यत ।।
data.es: Although entreated by his subjects (not to go) Rama proceeded to the forest to make his father's vow come true.
data.anv: सः that, काकुत्स्थ: descendant of the Kakutsthas (Rama), तदा then, स्वाभिः his own, प्रकृतिभिः by the subjects, याच्यमानः although pleaded, पितरम् father's, सत्यम् as truthful, कुर्वाणः doing, वनमेव to the forest, अन्वपद्यत proceeded.
data.md: Although besought by the subjects, the truthful Käkutstha having pledged his word to his father, kept on going to the forest.

data.v: अवेक्षमाणः सस्नेहं चक्षुषा प्रपिबन्निव । उवाच रामः स्नेहेन ताः प्रजाः स्वाः प्रजा इव ।।
data.es: Looking at the people with love as if they were his own children and as though drinking them with his glances, Rama appealed to them:
data.anv: रामः Rama, चक्षुषा with eyes, प्रपिबन्निव as if drinking, ताः those, प्रजाः people, स्वाः his own, प्रजाः इव like children, सस्नेहम् (स्नेहेन) with affection, अवेक्षमाणः seeing, उवाच said.
data.md: And affectionately eyeing them as if drinking them with his sight, Rāma touchingly addressed those subjects as if they were his own, The love and regard which the inhabitants of Ayodhyā have for me, let them, for pleasing me, extend in full measure towards Bharata.

data.v: या प्रीतिर्बहुमानश्च मय्ययोध्यानिवासिनाम् । मत्प्रियार्थं विशेषेण भरते सा निवेश्यताम् ।।
data.es: O citizens of Ayodhya may the love and respect you have shown to please me be bestowed specially on Bharata
data.anv: अयोध्यानिवासिनाम् of residents of Ayodhya, मयि in me, या प्रीतिः which love, बहुमानश्च also respect, सा that one, विशेषेण specially, मत्प्रियार्थं for endearing me, भरते in Bharata, निवेश्यताम् be placed on Bharata.
data.md: And affectionately eyeing them as if drinking them with his sight, Rāma touchingly addressed those subjects as if they were his own, The love and regard which the inhabitants of Ayodhyā have for me, let them, for pleasing me, extend in full measure towards Bharata.

data.v: स हि कल्याण चारित्रः कैकेय्यानन्दवर्धनः । करिष्यति यथावद्वः प्रियाणि च हितानि च ।।
data.es: Bharata, enhancer of the delight of Kaikeyi, possesses an auspicious character. He will do for you everything appropriate, agreeable and beneficial.
data.anv: कल्याणचारित्रः one having auspicious character, कैकेय्यानन्दवर्धनः enhancer of  Kaikeyi's delight, सः that Bharata, यथावत् appropriate, वः to you, प्रियाणि agreeable, हितानि च beneficial acts also, करिष्यति हि will do.
data.md: That enhancer of Kaikeyi's delight bearing an auspicious character, will duly compass your happiness and welfare.

data.v: ज्ञानवृद्धो वयोबालो मृदुर्वीर्यगुणान्वितः । अनुरूपः स वो भर्ता भविष्यति भयापहः ।।
data.es: Though tender in age Bharata is mature in intellect. Gentle, valiant and virtuous, he will dispel all your fears and act as a true protector.
data.anv: ज्ञानवृद्धः old in wisdom, वयोबालः young in age, मृदुः gentle, वीर्यगुणान्वितः endowed with valour and virtues, सः he, वः to you, अनुरूपः worthy one, भयापहः eliminating fears, भर्ता भविष्यति will be protector.
data.md: Aged by virtue of his wisdom, although young in years, and mild albeit furnished with heroic virtue, that remover of fear will make a fit ruler for you. son

data.v: स हि राजगुणैर्युक्तो युवराजः समीक्षितः । अपि चापि मया शिष्टैः कार्यं वो भर्तृशासनम् ।।
data.es: Endowed with kingly qualities, he is recognised as heirapparent. Therefore, as I did, all of you should obey the order of the king.
data.anv: राजगुणैः royal qualities, युक्तः endowed with, सः that, युवराजः as heirapparent, समीक्षितः is recognised, अपि च also, मया by me, शिष्टैः by others, वः to  you, भर्तृशासनम् king's order, कार्यम् should be obeyed.
data.md: Crowned with every regal virtue and selected as the heir-apparent (by the monarch), he is more meritorious by far than I am. I behove you to obey the order of your master.

data.v: न च तप्येद्यथा चासौ वनवासं गते मयि । महाराजस्तथा कार्यो मम प्रियचिकीर्षया ।।
data.es: If you desire to please me, act in such a way that the king does not grieve after I have gone to the forest.
data.anv: मयि when I, वनवासम् to the forest, गते had left, असौ महाराजः this king, यथा as, न च सन्तप्येत्  does not grieve, तथा in that way, मम to me, प्रिय चिकीर्षया with a desire to please, कार्यः fit to be done.
data.md: And seeking my good, it beloves you to act so that when I shall have gone to the forest, the king may not grieve.

data.v: यथा यथा दाशरथिर्धर्ममेवास्थितोऽभवत् । तथा तथा प्रकृतयो रामं पतिमकामयन् ।।
data.es: The more the son of Dasaratha (Rama) committed to righteousness, the more the subjects desired that he should be their king.
data.anv: दाशरथिः Dasaratha's son, Rama, यथा यथा such as, धर्मे एव in righteousness only, आस्थितः अभवत् became committed, तथा तथा in the same way, प्रकृतयः subjects, रामम्  Rama, पतिम् as king, अकामयन् desired.
data.md: But as Daśaratha's son was bringing home to the people that their duty lay in obeying the royal Mandata, they desried that even Rāma should rule them.

data.v: बाष्पेण पिहितं दीनं रामः सौमित्रिणा सह । चकर्षेव गुणैर्बद्ध्वा जनं पुनरिवासनम् ।।
data.es: Rama along with Lakshmana attracted the citydwellers who, choked with tears, were looking miserable. It appeared they were bound with his virtues.
data.anv: सौमित्रिणा सह accompanied by the son of Sumitra (Lakshmana), रामः Rama, बाष्पेण with tears, पिहितम् concealed, दीनम् piteous, पुरनिवासिनम् citydwellers, जनम् people, गुणैः with his virtues, बद्ध्वा इव as if bound by, चकर्ष attracted.
data.md: Rāma in company with Sumitrā's attracted the inhabitants of the city subdued by his virtues, who stood with tears in their eyes.

data.v: ते द्विजास्त्रिविधं वृद्धा ज्ञानेन वयसौजसा । वयःप्रकम्पशिरसो दूरादूचुरिदं वचः ।।
data.es: Those brahmins who were senior (to him) on three counts like age, wisdom and spirtuality spoke to him from a distance with their heads shaking with age:
data.anv: ज्ञानेन in wisdom, वयसा in age, ओजसा in spiritual energy, त्रिविधम् in all the three ways, वृद्धाः aged, ते द्विजाः those brahmins, वयः प्रकम्पशिरसः shaking due to old age, दूरात् from a distance, इदम् these, वचः words, ऊचुः spoke.
data.md: The three kinds of the twice-born ones, viz., those old by virtue, respectively, of age, wisdom, and ascetic energy, the old folks with their heads shaking through length of years, cried from a distance.

data.v: वहन्तो जवना रामं भो भो जात्यास्तुरंगमाः । निवर्तध्वं न गन्तव्यं हिता भवत भर्तरि । उपवाह्यस्तु वो भर्ता नापवाह्यः पुराद्वनम् ।।
data.es: O horses of noble breed, turn back Do not carry your master swiftyly any farther. Do good to him.
data.anv: रामम् Rama, वहन्तः conveying, जवनाः swift, जात्याः of noble breed, भो भो तुरङ्गमाः O horses, निवर्तध्वम् turn back, न गन्तव्यम् do not proceed, भर्तरि in your master (Rama), हिताः  भवत be good.
data.md: O you fleet coursers boasting of exalted extraction that bear Rāma away, do you desist, do not go; do you do even what is for the good of your master.

data.v: एवमार्तप्रलापांस्तान्वृद्धान्प्रलपतो द्विजान् । अवेक्ष्य सहसा रामो रथादवततार ह ।।
data.es: Having seen the aged brahmins muttering pitiful lamentations in this manner, Rama immediately alighted from the chariot.
data.anv: एवम् in this manner, आर्तप्रलापान् pitiful lamentations, प्रलपतः muttering, वृद्धान् aged, तान्द्विजान् those brahmins, अवेक्ष्य having seen, रामः Rama, सहसा immediately, रथात् from the chariot, अवततार ह alighted.
data.md: Suddenly seeing those old Brāhmaṇas thus lamenting distressfully, Rāma speedily descended from his car.

data.v: पद्भ्यामेव जगामाथ ससीतः सहलक्ष्मणः । संनिकृष्टपदन्यासो रामो वनपरायणः ।।
data.es: Then Rama along with Sita and Lakshmana began walking on foot with slow steps towards the forest.
data.anv: अथ then, स सीतः along with Sita, सहलक्ष्मणः and Lakshmana, रामः Rama, वनपरायणः (moving) towards the forest, सन्निकृष्टपदन्यासः with a slow pace, पद्भ्याम् एव on foot alone, जगाम went.
data.md: Along with Lakşmaņa and Sitā, Rāma bound for the forest, began to walk near them on foot.

data.v: द्विजातींस्तु पदातींस्तान्रामश्चारित्रवत्सलः । न शशाक घृणाचक्षुः परिमोक्तुं रथेन सः ।।
data.es: Rama a man of probity and compassion could not ride off in his chariot while those brahmins were trudging far behind.
data.anv: चारित्रवत्सलः fond of probity, घृणाचक्षुः compassionate eyes, सः रामः that Rama, पदातीन् those walking on foot, तान् द्विजातीन् those brahmins, रथेन with the chariot, परिमोक्तुम् to leave them, न शशाक was not possible.
data.md: Endowed with kindness, that friend of the good, Rāma, could not by proceeding on his car bear to pare with the Brāhmaṇas that were following on foot.

data.v: गच्छन्तमेव तं दृष्ट्वा रामं संभ्रान्तमानसाः । ऊचुः परमसंतप्ता रामं वाक्यमिदं द्विजाः ।।
data.es: Having seen Rama thus going towards the forest, those brahmins, highly agitated and distressed, said to him:
data.anv: द्विजाः brahmins, गच्छन्तमेव thus going, तं रामम् that Rama, दृष्ट्वा having seen, सम्भ्रान्तचेतसः with agitated mind, परमसन्तप्ताः deeply distressed, इदं वाक्यम् these words, ऊचुः said.
data.md: Seeing him thus going, the Brāhamaņas with agitated hearts, and burning in grief, addressed Rāma in these words.

data.v: ब्राह्मण्यं कृत्स्नमेतत्त्वां ब्रह्मण्यमनुगच्छति । द्विजस्कन्धाधिरूढास्त्वामग्नयोऽप्यनुयान्त्यमी ।।
data.es: This entire order of brahmins with the sacrificial fires on their hsoulders is following you, their wellwisher.
data.anv: सर्वम् all, एतत् these, ब्राह्मण्यम् order of brahmins, ब्रह्मण्यम् seeking good of the brahmins, त्वाम् you, अनुगच्छति is following, अमी these, अग्नयः अपि sacred fires also, द्विजस्कन्धाधिरूढाः mounting on the shoulders of brahmins, त्वाम् you, अनुयान्ति following.
data.md: The Brāhmaṇas in a body are following you ever seeking their good, and mounting on the shoulders of the regenerate ones, the (sacrificial) Fires are walking in your wake.

data.v: वाजपेयसमुत्थानि छत्राण्येतानि पश्य नः । पृष्ठतोऽनुप्रयातानि हंसानिव जलात्यये ।।
data.es: See these umbrellas acquired by us while performing Vajapeya sacrifice are following you like the clouds at the end of the rainy season.
data.anv: वाजपेयसमुत्थानि acquired while performing Vajapeya sacrifice, नः पृष्ठतः behind us, अनुप्रयातानि are coming, एतानि these, छत्राणि umbrellas, जलात्यये at the end of the rainy season, मेघानिव like clouds, पश्य please see.
data.md: And behold these raised umbrellas of ours got from the Vājapeya sacrifice, that like to autumnal clouds follow at your back.

data.v: अनवाप्तातपत्रस्य रश्मिसंतापितस्य ते । एभिश्छायां करिष्यामः स्वैश्छत्रैर्वाजपेयिकैः ।।
data.es: You do not have a royal umbrella and you are scorched by the rays of the Sun. We will offer you shade with the umbrellas acquired during Vajapeya sacrifice.
data.anv: अनवाप्तातपत्रस्य for one without an umbrella, रश्मिसन्तापितस्य of a man scorched with the rays of the Sun, ते to you, वाजपेयिकैः acquired during Vajapeya sacrifice, स्वैः by your own, छत्रैः with umbrellas, छायाम् shade, करिष्यामः will extend.
data.md: With these umbrellas got at the Vājapeya sacrifice, we will afford shade to Rāma destitute of his own white umbrella, when he shall feel the heat of the (solar) rays.

data.v: या हि नः सततं बुद्धिर्वेदमन्त्रानुसारिणी । त्वत्कृते सा कृता वत्स वनवासानुसारिणी ।।
data.es: O dear child, our minds always pursue the study of vedic hymns. For your sake now they are made to follow the life in the forest.
data.anv: वत्स dear child, न: our, या बुद्धि: mind, सततं always, वेदमन्त्रानुसारिणी follows Vedic hymns that one, त्वत्कृते for your sake, वनवासानुसारिणी one seeking the forest life, कृता is made.
data.md: That intelligence of ours which ever follows the Vedic Mantras, is now, O child, ready to follow you to the forest in your interests.

data.v: हृदयेष्ववतिष्ठन्ते वेदा ये नः परं धनम् । वत्स्यन्त्यपि गृहेष्वेव दाराश्चारित्ररक्षिताः ।।
data.es: The Vedas are our greatest wealth and they reside in our hearts. Our wives, protected by their fidelity, shall stay at home.
data.anv: नः our, परं धनम् greatest wealth, ये those, वेदाः the Vedas, हृदयेष्वेव in our hearts, तिष्ठन्ति are remaining, दारा अपि our wives also, चारित्ररक्षिताः protected by fidelity, गृहेष्वेव at home, वत्स्यन्ति shall stay.
data.md: That best of treasurers, the Vedas, resides in our bosoms; and our wives protected by their chastity shall abide in our homes.

data.v: न पुनर्निश्चयः कार्यस्त्वद्गतौ सुकृता मतिः । त्वयि धर्मव्यपेक्षे तु किं स्याद्धर्ममवेक्षितुम् ।।
data.es: We are not going to revoke our decision. We have made up our minds to follow you (into the forest). If you have no regard for this decision, then who will adhere to the path of righteousness?
data.anv: पुनः again (another), निश्चयः decision, न कार्यः should not be taken, त्वद्गतौ on your journey, मतिः mind, सुकृता is well set, त्वयि in you, धर्मव्यपेक्षे reluctant to follow 'dharma', धर्मपथे in the path of righteousness, किम् what?, स्थितं स्यात् is left now?
data.md: As we have already made up our minds to follow you, it is useless to fix our hearts afresh. But if you overlooks virtues, what becomes of abiding by righteousness?* *Another reading is; What becomes of the virtue that we expect at your hands?

data.v: याचितो नो निवर्तस्व हंसशुक्लशिरोरुहैः । शिरोभिर्निभृताचार महीपतनपांशुलैः ।।
data.es: O Rama, you are firm in your duty.We beseech you, our heads bowed with swanwhite hair and soiled with dust, to return to Ayodhya.
data.anv: निभृताचार ever firm in duty, महीपतनपांसुलैः soiled with the dust fallen on the ground, हंसशुक्लशिरोरुहैः having hairs white like the (plumes of a) swan, नः our, शिरोभिः with our  heads, याचितः beg of you, निवर्तस्व you may return.
data.md: O you that are ever firm in virtue, we beseech you by humbling to the dust our heads covered with hair white-hued like cranes, do you desist.

data.v: बहूनां वितता यज्ञा द्विजानां य इहागताः । तेषां समाप्तिरायत्ता तव वत्स निवर्तने ।।
data.es: Many of those brahmins who arrived here have commenced their sacrifices. O dear child, their consummation depends on your return.
data.anv: ये who, इह here, आगताः have arrived, बहूनाम् many, द्विजानाम् brahmins, यज्ञाः sacrifices, वितताः commenced, वत्स O dear child, तेषाम् their, समाप्तिः consummation, तव your, निवर्तने returning, आयत्ता is dependent.
data.md: These numerous Brāhmaṇas that have come hither have entered upon many a sacrifice. The completion of these, O child, depends upon your return.

data.v: भक्तिमन्ति हि भूतानि जंगमाजंगमानि च । याचमानेषु तेषु त्वं भक्तिं भक्तेषु दर्शय ।।
data.es: O Rama, all these living beings, movable and immovable, are devoted to you and are entreating you with devotion to return. Show consideration to those supplicants.
data.anv: राम Rama, जङ्गमाजङ्गमानि movable and immovable, भूतानि living beings, भक्तिमन्ति हि are  devoted to you, त्वम् you, याचमानेषु supplicants, भक्तेषु in devotees, भक्तिम् devotion, दर्शय show.
data.md: All creatures mobile and immobile cherish you with high regard. All these beseech you. Do you show consideration to those that regard you.

data.v: अनुगंतुमशक्तास्त्वां मूलैरुद्धृतवेगिभिः । उन्नता वायुवेगेन विक्रोशन्तीव पादपाः ।।
data.es: Although the trees uplifted by the speed of the wind, intend to follow you, their movement is stalled by their roots. Unable, they appear to be weeping.
data.anv: मूलैः with their roots, उद्धतवेगिनः crushed with their speed, पादपाः trees, त्वाम् you, अनुगन्तुम्  to follow, अशक्ताः unable, वायुवेगेन with the speed of wind, उन्नताः uplifted, विक्रोशन्तीव weeping like.
data.md: Tall trees deprived of motion in consequence of being fast rooted to the earth and incapable of following you, are prohibiting you by sounding with the wind.

data.v: निश्चेष्टाहारसंचारा वृक्षैकस्थानविष्ठिताः । पक्षिणोऽपि प्रयाचन्ते सर्वभूतानुकम्पिनम् ।।
data.es: Even the birds instead of foraging for food are sitting motionless on the trees at one place. They are imploring you, you who are compassionate to all creatures, to return to Ayodhya.
data.anv: पक्षिणोऽपि even the birds, निश्चेष्टाहारसञ्चाराः without foraging for food and wanderings,  वृक्षैकस्थानविष्ठिताः perched on the trees at one place, सर्वभूतानुकम्पिनम् one compassionate to all creatures, प्रयाचन्ते are imploring.
data.md: And birds staying upon trees and neither manifesting any motion nor seeking for their food, beseech you to have compassion upon all creatures.

data.v: एवं विक्रोशतां तेषां द्विजातीनां निवर्तने । ददृशे तमसा तत्र वारयन्तीव राघवम् ।।
data.es: While those brahmins were thus crying out, river Tamasa came into view as if seeking Rama to turn back to Ayodhya.
data.anv: एवम् in this way, निवर्तने seeking his return, तेषां द्विजातीनाम् those brahmins, विक्रोशताम्  crying, तत्र there, तमसा Tamasa river, राघवम् Rama, वारयन्तीव as if preventing, ददृशे appeared.
data.md: While the Brāhmaṇas were loudly demanding the return of Rāma, he found the darkness to descend as if forbidding him.

data.v: ततस्तु तमसा तीरं रम्यमाश्रित्य राघवः । सीतामुद्वीक्ष्य सौमित्रिमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having heard the words of Rama, thus spoke Sita in a faint voice in sadness, with tears flowing incessantly from her eyes:
data.anv: ततः then, राघवः scion of the Raghus (Rama), रम्यम् lovely, तमसातीरम् bank of Tamasa, आश्रित्य having taken refuge, सीताम् Sita, उद्वीक्ष्य having looked at, सौमित्रिम् Sumitra's son (Lakshmana), इदं वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Then Rāghava pausing on the banks of the Tamasā, looked at Sītā and spoke to Sumitrā's son, saying.

data.v: इयमद्य निशा पूर्वा सौमित्रे प्रस्थिता वनम् । वनवासस्य भद्रं ते स नोत्कण्ठितुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana, this happens to be the first night of our exile. You should not have any longing in your mind. Wish you well
data.anv: सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, वनम् to the forest, प्रहिताः having been sent, अद्य today, इयम् this, वनवासस्य exile in the forest, पूर्वा first, निशा night, उत्कण्ठितुम् longing in your mind, न अर्हसि does not behove you, ते भद्रम् wish you well.
data.md: O son of Sumitrā, this is the first night of our exile into the forest. From this day it behoveth you not, good betide you, to suffer your mind to grieve (by dwelling on past joys.)

data.v: पश्य शून्यान्यरण्यानि रुदन्तीव समन्ततः । यथानिलयमायद्भिर्निलीनानि मृगद्विजैः ।।
data.es: Look at the deserted forest. The wild animals and birds have returned to their hideouts. They fill the air with their cries.
data.anv: यथानिलयम् to their respective abodes, आयद्भिः by those returning, मृगद्विजैः by wild animals and birds, निलीनानि concealed themselves in their hideouts, शून्यानि deserted,  अरण्यानि forests, समन्ततः all over, रुदन्तीव as if crying, पश्य see.
data.md: The empty forest resounding with the cries of beasts and birds returned to their abodes, covered with gloom, seems to weep on all sides.

data.v: अद्यायोध्या तु नगरी राजधानी पितुर्मम । सस्त्रीपुंसा गतानस्माञ्शोचिष्यति न संशयः ।।
data.es: There is no doubt that now the men and women of Ayodhya, father's capital city must be bewailing our departure.
data.anv: अद्य now, मम पितुः my father's, राजधानी capital, अयोध्या नगरी city of Ayodhya, सस्त्रीपुंसा   with men and women, गतान् having gone ( to the forest), अस्मान् about us, शोचिष्यति must be mourning, नसंशयः no doubt.
data.md: Doubtless to-day the men and women of Ayodhyā, the metropolis of my father, are bewailing us retired to the forest.

data.v: भरतः खलु धर्मात्मा पितरं मातरं च मे । धर्मार्थकामसहितैर्वाक्यैराश्वासयिष्यति ।।
data.es: Righteous Bharata will indeed console parents with words in conformity with dharma, artha and kama.
data.anv: धर्मात्मा righteous, भरतः Bharata, धर्मार्थकामसहितैः with dharma, artha and kama, वाक्यैः  words, मे my, पितरम् father, मातरं च and mother, आश्वासयिष्यति खलु will console indeed.
data.md: But surely the virtuous Bharata will console our father and mother with words fraught with virtuc, interest and profit.

data.v: भरतस्यानृशंसत्वं संचिन्त्याहं पुनः पुनः । नानुशोचामि पितरं मातरं चापि लक्ष्मण ।।
data.es: As I reflect again and again on the benevolent nature of Bharata, there is no concern in me about my parents, O Lakshmana
data.anv: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, अहं I, भरतस्य Bharata's, अनृशंसत्वम् lack of wickedness, पुनः पुनः again again, विचिन्त्य after reflecting about, पितरम् father, मातरं च and mother, नानुशोचामि have no regrets.
data.md: Reflecting again and again on Bharata's sincerity of soul, I do not, O mighty-armed one, bewail either my mother or my father.

data.v: त्वया कार्यं नरव्याघ्र मामनुव्रजता कृतम् । अन्वेष्टव्या हि वैदेह्या रक्षणार्थे सहायता ।।
data.es: You, O Lakshmana, the best among men, have done a good job by accompanying me. Otherwise assistance for Sita's protection would have been sought (necessary).
data.anv: नरव्याघ्र O best of men, माम् me, अनुव्रजता while accompanying, त्वया by you, कार्यम् good deed, कृतम् has been done, वैदेह्याः Sita, रक्षणार्थे for protection, सहायता assistance,  अन्वेष्टव्या हि to be sought for.
data.md: foremost of men, that you have followed me in what is your duty. (If you had not done so), I should have to seek elsewhere for the protection of Vaidehī.

data.v: अद्भिरेव तु सौमित्रे वत्स्याम्यद्य निशामिमाम् । एतद्धि रोचते मह्यं वन्येऽपि विविधे सति ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana, I shall live this night on water alone. I prefer it, though various kinds of forest products are available.
data.anv: सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, अद्य today, इमां निशाम् this night, अद्भिरेव with water only, वत्स्यामि I will live, विविधे different kinds, वन्ये forest products, सत्यपि available, एतत् this one, मह्यम् to me, रोचते हि is my preference.
data.md: foremost of men, that you have followed me in what is your duty. (If you had not done so), I should have to seek elsewhere for the protection of Vaidehī.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा तु सौमित्रं सुमन्त्रमपि राघवः । अप्रमत्तस्त्वमश्वेषु भव सौम्येत्युवाच ह ।।
data.es: Having said so to Lakshmana, he turned to Sumantra to say O gentle friend, tend the horses with care.
data.anv: राघवः Rama, सौमित्रिम् to Lakshmana, एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having said, सौम्य O gentle one, त्वम् अश्वेषु about horses, अप्रमत्तः भव be careful, इति thus, सुमन्त्रमपि to Sumantra also, उवाच ह said.
data.md: O Sumitrā's son, I will spend here this night, subsisting alone. Even this recommends itself to me, although the forest yields various kinds of fruits.

data.v: सोऽश्वान्सुमन्त्रः संयम्य सूर्येऽस्तं समुपागते । प्रभूतयवसान्कृत्वा बभूव प्रत्यनन्तरः ।।
data.es: As the Sun was setting, Sumantra tethered the horses, fed them with abundant fodder and sat close to them.
data.anv: सः सुमन्त्रः that Sumantra, सूर्ये Sun, अस्तम् was setting, समुपागते was setting, अश्वान् horses, संयम्य tethered, प्रभूतयवसान् with abundant fodder, कृत्वा having made, प्रत्यनन्तरः  बभूव sat in their proximity.
data.md: Having said this to Sumitrā's son, Raghava spoke to Sumantra, saying, “O mild one, do you now heedfully tend the horses.” Then at sunset, fastening the horses, Sumantra fed them plentifully with grass, and then came back.

data.v: उपास्यतु शिवां संध्यां दृष्ट्वा रात्रिमुपस्थिताम् । रामस्य शयनं चक्रे सूतः सौमित्रिणा सह ।।
data.es: Then the charioteer worshipping the auspicious Sandhya (twilight), and seeing the night approach made bed for Rama and Lakshmana.
data.anv: सूतः charioteer, शिवाम् auspicious, सन्ध्याम् Sandhya, उपास्य having worshipped, रात्रिम्  night, उपस्थिताम् having arrived, दृष्ट्वा having seen, सौमित्रिणा सह along with Lakshmana, रामस्य of Rama, शयनम् bed, चक्रे made.
data.md: Then seeing the night arrived, the charioteer worshipped the beneficent Sandhyā, and then in company with Sumitrā's son, prepared Rāma's bed. on water

data.v: तां शय्यां तमसातीरे वीक्ष्य वृक्षदलैः कृताम् । रामः सौमित्रिणां सार्धं सभार्यः संविवेश ह ।।
data.es: Having seen the bed of leaves made ready on the bank of Tamasa, Rama lay down there along with Sita and Lakshmana.
data.anv: तमसातीरे on the bank of Tamasa, वृक्षदलैः with leaves of trees, कृताम् made, तां शय्याम् that bed, वीक्ष्य having seen, रामः Rama, सभार्यः along with his wife, सौमित्रिणा सार्धम along with Lakshmana, संविवेश ह lay down.
data.md: And looking at that bed on the shores of the Tamasā surrounded by trees, Rāma along with his wife and the son of Sumitrā, lay down,

data.v: सभार्यं संप्रसुप्तं तं भ्रातरं वीक्ष्य लक्ष्मणः । कथयामास सूताय रामस्य विविधान्गुणान् ।।
data.es: Having seen that his brother along with his wife had fallen asleep, Lakshmana narrated the many virtues of Rama to Sumantra.
data.anv: लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, सम्प्रसुप्तम् fallen asleep, सभार्यम् along with wife, तं भ्रातरम् that brother, वीक्ष्य having seen, सूताय to the charioteer (Sumantra), रामस्य Rama's, विविधान् various  गुणान् virtues, कथयामास narrated.
data.md: When Lakşmaņa found that Rāma afflicted with fatigue had slept together with his spouse, he began to speak to the charioteer concerning the various qualities of Rāma.

data.v: जाग्रतो ह्येव तां रात्रिं सौमित्रेरुदितो रविः । सूतस्य तमसातीरे रामस्य ब्रुवतो गुणान् ।।
data.es: Lakshmana continued to describe Rama's virtues to the charioteer, keeping awake that entire night on the bank of Tamasa until the Sun rose.
data.anv: तमसातीरे on the bank of river Tamasa, रामस्य Rama's, गुणान् virtues, सूतस्य (in) the chrioteer's (presence), ब्रुवतः telling, सौमित्रेः Lakshmana, तां रात्रिम् that night, जाग्रतोह्येव by keeping awake, रविः the Sun, उदितः arose.
data.md: As remaining awake in the night, Sumitrā's son was engaged in expatiating to the charioteer on the virtues of Rāma on the banks of the Tamasă, the sun arose.

data.v: गोकुलाकुलतीरायास्तमसाया विदूरतः । अवसत्तत्र तां रात्रिं रामः प्रकृतिभिः सह ।।
data.es: Rama spent the night with his subjects not very far from the bank of Tamasa which was crowded with herds of cattle.
data.anv: रामः Rama, प्रकृतिभिः with the subjects, गोकुलाकुलतीरायाः of that bank crowded with herds of cattle, तमसायाः Tamasa, विदूरतः not very far, तां रात्रिम् that night, तत्र there, अवसत् lived.
data.md: Rāma abode that night along with the subjects at some distance from the banks of the Tamasā filled with kine.

data.v: उत्थाय तु महातेजाः प्रकृतीस्ता निशाम्य च । अब्रवीद्भ्रातरं रामो लक्ष्मणं पुण्यलक्षणम् ।।
data.es: On getting up, the brilliant Rama looked at his subjects and said to his brother Lakshmana full of noble qualities:
data.anv: महातेजाः brilliant, सः रामः that Rama, उत्थाय च having risen, ताः those, प्रकृतीः subjects, निशाम्य च having seen, पुण्यलक्षणम् having auspicious qualities, भ्रातरम् brother, लक्ष्मणम् addressing Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् he said.
data.md: Rising (from his bed), that highly energetic one, Rāma, viewing the subjects (asleep), addressed his brother Lakşmana graced with auspicious marks.

data.v: अस्मद्व्यपेक्षान्सौमित्रे निरपेक्षान्गृहेष्वपि । वृक्षमूलेषु संसुप्तान्पश्य लक्ष्मण साम्प्रतम् ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana, son of Sumitra look at these people, fast alseep under the trees. Out of affection for us, they are even indifferent to their home.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, सौमित्रे son of Sumitra, अस्मद्व्यपेक्षान् due to their affection for us, गृहेष्वपि even in their homes, निरपेक्षान् indifferent, साम्प्रतम् now, वृक्षमूलेषु at the foot of the trees, संसुप्तान् are fast asleep, पश्य you may see.
data.md: O son of Sumitrā, these that for our sake have disregarded their own homes, are still asleep beneath the trees.

data.v: यथैते नियमं पौराः कुर्वन्त्यस्मन्निवर्तने । अपि प्राणानसिष्यन्ति न तु त्यक्ष्यन्ति निश्चयम् ।।
data.es: On seeing the people's resolve to take us back, it appears they are prepared to give up their lives rather than abandon their determination.
data.anv: एते पौराः these citizens, अस्मन्निवर्तने on our return, यथा as, नियमम् resolve,  कुर्वन्ति are doing, प्राणानपि even life also, न्यसिष्यन्ति will give up, निश्चयं तु determination, न त्यक्ष्यन्ति will not abandon.
data.md: These citizens have determined upon making me turn back from the forest, they would rather renounce their lives than give up their resolve.

data.v: यावदेव तु संसुप्तास्तावदेव वयं लघु । रथमारुह्य गच्छामः पन्थानमकुतोभयम् ।।
data.es: While they are asleep, we shall quickly mount the chariot and fearlessly proceed on the way.
data.anv: यावदेव so long as, संसुप्ताः they are asleep, तावदेव so long, वयम् we, लघु quickly, रथम् chariot, आरुह्य mounting, अकुतोभयम् without fear, पन्थानम् on our way, गच्छाम we shall go.
data.md: Let us while they are asleep ascending on our car, swiftly go our way without fear of molestation.

data.v: अतो भूयोऽपि नेदानीमिक्ष्वाकुपुरवासिनः । स्वपेयुरनुरक्ता मां वृक्षमूलानि संश्रिताः ।।
data.es: These loyal inhabitants of Ayodhya, the city of the Ikshvakus will no more sleep again shelterd under the trees.
data.anv: अतः therefore, माम् about me, अनुरक्ताः attached, इक्ष्वाकुपुरवासिनः inhabitants of the city of the Ikshvakus, भूयोऽपि again, वृक्षमूलानि at the foot of the trees, संश्रिताः having taken refuge, इदानीम् now, भूयोऽपि again, न स्वपेयुः should not sleep.
data.md: Attached to me, the denizons of Ikşvāku's city will not again indulge in sleep underneath trees.

data.v: पौरा ह्यात्मकृताद्दुःखाद्विप्रमोच्या नृपात्मजैः । न तु खल्वात्मना योज्या दुःखेन पुरवासिनः ।।
data.es: The prince should deliver the citizens from the sufferings caused by themselves but should not make them suffer on their account.
data.anv: पौराः the citizens, नृपात्मजैः by the sons of the king, आत्मकृतात् done by themselves, दुःखात्  from the sufferings, विप्रमोच्या हि are to be delivered, पुरवासिनः people of the city, आत्मना  by themselves, दुःखेन suffering, न योज्याः हि are not to be united.
data.md: A prince should deliver citizens from the calamity they bring upon themselves; but he should by no means drag them into those which he himself has brought on.

data.v: अब्रवील्लक्ष्मणो रामं साक्षाद्धर्ममिव स्थितम् । रोचते मे महाप्राज्ञ क्षिप्रमारुह्यतामिति ।।
data.es: Lakshmana said to Rama who was the very image of like righteousness O wise one, I like this (proposal). Let us quickly mount the chariot.
data.anv: साक्षात् incarnate of, धर्ममिव righteousness, स्थितम् remaining, रामम् to Rama, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, प्राज्ञ O sagacious, मे to me, तथा that way, रोचते is agreeable, क्षिप्रम् quickly, आरुह्यताम् let us board the chariot, इति thus, अब्रवीत् spoken.
data.md: Then Lakşmana spoke to Rāma like to manifest Virtue on earth, "O wise one, even this is relished also by me. Do you speedily ascend (the car.)"

data.v: सूतस्ततः संत्वरितः स्यन्दनं तैर्हयोत्तमैः । योजयित्वाथ रामाय प्राञ्जलिः प्रत्यवेदयत् ।।
data.es: Thereupon the charioteer hurriedly harnessed the splendid horses to the chariot and informed Rama with folded hands:
data.anv: ततः thereupon, सः सूतः that charioteer (Sumantra), त्वरितः in haste , स्यन्दनम् the chariot, तैः those, हयोत्तमैः splendid horses, योजयित्वा having harnessed, अथ and, प्राञ्जलिः with folded palms, रामाय for Rama, प्रत्यवेदयत् informed.
data.md: Thereupon the charioteer bestirring himself, yoking the excellent horses to the car, said to Rāma with joined hands.

data.v: मोहनार्थं तु पौराणां सूतं रामोऽब्रवीद्वचः । उदङ्मुखः प्रयाहि त्वं रथमास्थाय सारथे ।।
data.es: With the intention of confusing the citizens, Rama said to the charioteer, O Sumantra, having seated in the chariot proceed speedly for a while in northerly direction and again turn back the chariot. Accomplish this feat in such a manner that the citizens will not know (where we have gone).
data.anv: रामः Rama, पौराणाम् citizens', मोहनार्थम् to elude, सूतम् to the charioteer, वचः those words, अब्रवीत् said, सारथे O charioteer, त्वम् you, रथम् chariot, आस्थाय having mounted, उदङ्मुखः in northerly direction, प्रयाहि you may proceed, मुहूर्तम् for a while, त्वरितम् speedily, गत्वा having gone, रथम् chariot, पुनः again, निवर्तय turn back, माम् about me, पौराः citizens, यथा how, न विद्युः will not know, तथा in that manner, समाहितः accomplish, कुरु you may act.
data.md: But with the view of deluding the citizens, Rāma said to the charioteer, "O charioteer, do you ascending the car proceed northwards; and having proceeded swiftly for a while, do you turn the car. Do you carefully act so that the citizens nay not perceive this."

data.v: मुहूर्तं त्वरितं गत्वा निर्गतय रथं पुनः । यथा न विद्युः पौरा मां तथा कुरु समाहितः ।।
data.es: With the intention of confusing the citizens, Rama said to the charioteer, O Sumantra, having seated in the chariot proceed speedly for a while in northerly direction and again turn back the chariot. Accomplish this feat in such a manner that the citizens will not know (where we have gone).
data.anv: रामः Rama, पौराणाम् citizens', मोहनार्थम् to elude, सूतम् to the charioteer, वचः those words, अब्रवीत् said, सारथे O charioteer, त्वम् you, रथम् chariot, आस्थाय having mounted, उदङ्मुखः in northerly direction, प्रयाहि you may proceed, मुहूर्तम् for a while, त्वरितम् speedily, गत्वा having gone, रथम् chariot, पुनः again, निवर्तय turn back, माम् about me, पौराः citizens, यथा how, न विद्युः will not know, तथा in that manner, समाहितः accomplish, कुरु you may act.
data.md: But with the view of deluding the citizens, Rāma said to the charioteer, "O charioteer, do you ascending the car proceed northwards; and having proceeded swiftly for a while, do you turn the car. Do you carefully act so that the citizens nay not perceive this."

data.v: रामस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा तथा चक्रे स सारथिः । प्रत्यागम्य च रामस्य स्यन्दनं प्रत्यवेदयत् ।।
data.es: The charioteer did as instructed by Rama, returned to him with the chariot and informed (of its readiness).
data.anv: सः सारथिः that charioteer, रामस्य Rama's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, तथा as instructed, चक्रे having done, प्रत्यागम्य having retuned, रामस्य to Rama, स्यन्दनम् chariot, प्रत्यवेदयत्  informed.
data.md: Hearing Rāma's words, the charioteer did accordingly, and having returned said to Rāma to ascend the car.

data.v: तं स्यन्दनमधिष्ठाय राघवः सपरिच्छदः । शीघ्रगामाकुलावर्तां तमसामतरन्नदीम् ।।
data.es: Rama (along with others) mounted the chariot with his belongings, crossed the rapidly flowing Tamasa agitated with whirlpools.
data.anv: सपरिच्छदः with his belongings, राघवः Rama, तं स्यन्दनम् that chariot, अधिष्ठाय having mounted, शीघ्रगाम् rapidly flowing, आकुलावर्ताम् agitated with whirlpools, तमसां नदीम् Tamasa river, अतरत् crossed.
data.md: Ascending the car after equipping himself, Rāghava crossed the rapidly-rushing Tamasā abounding in eddies.

data.v: स संतीर्य महाबाहुः श्रीमाञ्शिवमकण्टकम् । प्रापद्यत महामार्गमभयं भयदर्शिनाम् ।।
data.es: Having crossed the river, the mightyarmed and gracious Rama proceeded on the auspicious and thornless highway arousing confidence even in the timid.
data.anv: महाबाहुः mightyarmed, श्रीमान् gracious, सः that Rama, सन्तीर्य having crossed, शिवम्  auspicious, अकण्टकम् without thorns (sufferings), भयदर्शिनाम् even for the timid, अभयम् arousing confidence, महामार्गम् highway, प्रापद्यत reached.
data.md: Having crossed (the stream), the auspicious and mighty-armed one came upon a safe and goodly-high way capable of inspiring even timid people with confidence.

data.v: प्रभातायां तु शर्वर्यां पौरास्ते राघवो विना । शोकोपहतनिश्चेष्टा बभूवुर्हतचेतसः ।।
data.es: When the night advanced towards dawn the citizens were stunned not to see the scion of the Raghus (Rama). Overwhelmed with sorrow they lost their senses.
data.anv: प्रभातायां शर्वर्याम् when the night advanced towards dawn, ते पौराः those citizens, राघवं विना not beholding Rama, हतचेतसः deprived of  their senses, शोकोपहतचेतसः crushed with grief, निश्चेष्टाः बभूवुः were stunned.
data.md: When the night had departed an day dawned, the citizens not finding Rāghava, overwhelmed with grief and were deprived of their senses. were

data.v: शोकजाश्रुपरिद्यूना वीक्षमाणास्ततस्ततः । आलोकमपि रामस्य न पश्यन्ति स्म दुःखिताः ।।
data.es: Anguished and drenched with tears of grief they looked hither and thither but could not find even a trace of Rama.
data.anv: शोकजाश्रुपरिद्यूनाः drenched in the tears of grief, ततस्ततः hither and thither, वीक्षमाणाः  looking, दुःखिताः anguished, रामस्य Rama's, आलोकमपि even his light (trace), न पश्यन्ति स्म could not see.
data.md: With tears of grief and afflicted with distress, they looked hither and thither, but they could not discover even the dust raised by Rāma's car.

data.v: ततो मार्गानुसारेण गत्वा किंचित्क्षणं पुनः । मार्गनाशाद्विषादेन महता समभिप्लुतः ।।
data.es: For a short while they followed the tracks (of the chariot) and after having gone a little distance, they missed the way. They were again submerged in deep sorrow.
data.anv: ततः then, क्षणम् for a short while, मार्गानुसारेण following the track, किञ्चित् for a little, गत्वा having gone, मार्गनाशात् by missing the way, पुनः again, महता great, विषादेन with grief,  समभिप्लुताः were overcome.
data.md: Then following for a while the track of the car, they, missing the track, became overwhelmed with woe.

data.v: रथस्य मार्गनाशेन न्यवर्तन्त मनस्विनः । किमिदं किं करिष्यामो दैवेनोपहता इति ।।
data.es: When they could not find the tracks of the chariot, those highminded people turned back and said to themselves 'What is this? We have been deceived by fate. What are we to do now?'
data.anv: मनस्विनः highminded people, रथस्य chariot's, मार्गनाशेन disappearance of the track, किमिदम् what is this?, दैवेन by destiny, उपहताः struck, किं करिष्यामः what are we to do?, इति  thus (saying), न्यवर्तन्त returned.
data.md: And then those intelligent ones came back by the track of the car. "What is this? What shall we do? We have been foiled by some supernatural agency."

data.v: ततो यथागतेनैव मार्गेण क्लान्तचेतसः । अयोध्यामगमन्सर्वे पुरीं व्यथितसज्जनाम् ।।
data.es: Thereafter, all of them, the virtuous people grieving, their minds fatigued, returned to Ayodhya the same way they had come.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, सर्वे all of them, क्लान्तचेतसः with their minds, यथागतेनैव they had come, मार्गेण way, व्यथितसज्जनाम् with virtuous people grieving, अयोध्याम् to Ayodhya, पुरीम् city, आगमन् had come back.
data.md: Then they returned to the city of Ayodhyā with its good people oppressed with grief, by the self-same way by which they had come.

data.v: अनुगम्य निवृत्तानां रामं नगरवासिनाम् । उद्गतानीव सत्त्वानि बभूवुरमनस्विनाम् ।।
data.es: The people afflicted with sorrow followed Rama and returned to the city deeply distressed. Eyes overflowing with tears, they longed for death. Smitten with grief, they lost their highmindedness and looked as if their life had been drained out.
data.anv: एवं in this manner, विषण्णानाम् of dejected ones, अतीव deeply, पीडितानाम् distressed, बाष्पविप्लुतनेत्राणाम् of men with their eyes overflowing with tears, सशोकानाम् of those  smitten with grief, मुमूर्षया desirng death, रामम् Rama, अनुगम्य having followed, निवृत्तानाम् of those who returned, अमनस्विनाम् of disinterested men, तेषाम् their, नगरवासिनाम् citizens', सत्वानि vital airs, उद्गतानीव were as if leaving the body.

data.v: स्वं स्वं निलयमागम्य पुत्रदारैः समावृताः । अश्रूणि मुमुचुः सर्वे बाष्पेण पिहिताननाः ।।
data.es: The subjects reached their respective homes and surrounded by their sons and wives broke down their faces flooded with tears.
data.anv: सर्वे all of them, स्वं स्वम् their respective, निलयम् homes, आगम्य having reached, पुत्रदारैः  with their sons and wives, समावृताः surrounded, बाष्पेण with tears, पिहिताननाः with their faces covered, अश्रूणि tears, मुमुचुः shed.

data.v: न चाहृष्यन्न चामोदन्वणिजो न प्रसारयन् । न चाशोभन्त पण्यानि नापचन्गृहमेधिनः ।।
data.es: The people had no joy in life nor did they find cheer in anything. The merchants did not offer their wares for sale. The marketplace looked graceless (lifeless). (The stocks were empty). The householders did not cook their food.
data.anv: न अहृष्यन् च not rejoiced, न अमोदन् च not delighted, वणिजः traders, न प्रसारयन् did not offer for sale, पण्यानि च marketplaces also, न अशोभन्त did not look graceful, गृहमेधिनः  householders, नापचन् did not cook.
data.md: They forgot to rejoice or make merry, and the traders did not spread (their stores), and stalls did not grace the place, and the householders did not cook, and people did not rejoice on recovering lost property or gaining a profuse accession of wealth, and mothers did not feel any delight on beholding their first-born.

data.v: नष्टं दृष्ट्वा नाभ्यनन्दन्विपुलं वा धनागमम् । पुत्रं प्रथमजं लब्ध्वा जननी नाभ्यनन्दत ।।
data.es: Elephants dropped their morsel of food. Cows did not suckle their calves. Even the mothers were not pleased with their firstborn sons.
data.anv: नष्टम् loss, दृष्ट्वा having seen, नाभ्यनन्दन् stood indifferent, विपुलम् vast, धनागमं वा or acquired wealth, जननी mother, प्रथमजम् firstborn, पुत्रम् son, लब्ध्वा having obtained,  नाभ्यनन्दत not rejoiced.
data.md: They forgot to rejoice or make merry, and the traders did not spread (their stores), and stalls did not grace the place, and the householders did not cook, and people did not rejoice on recovering lost property or gaining a profuse accession of wealth, and mothers did not feel any delight on beholding their first-born.

data.v: गृहे गृहे रुदन्त्यश्च भर्तारं गृहमागतम् । व्यगर्हयन्तो दुःखार्ता वाग्भिस्तोत्रैरिव द्विपान् ।।
data.es: In every house, women wept and in anguish heaped abuses on their husbands on their arrival at home with words (sharp) like goads on elephants:
data.anv: दुःखार्ताः afflicted with sorrow, गृहे गृहे in every house, रुदन्त्यः while crying, तोत्रैः with goads, द्विपान् इव like elephants, वाग्भि: with words, गृहम् आगतम् arrival at home, भर्तारम् husband, व्यगर्हयन्त they reproached.
data.md: And in every home females afflicted with woe, weeping child their husbands coming home, with the following words as (drivers) spur elephants with hooks.

data.v: किं नु तेषां गृहैः कार्यं किं दारैः किं धनेन वा । पुत्रैर्वा किं सुखैर्वापि ये न पश्यन्ति राघवम् ।।
data.es: For those who do not see Rama, of what use are the houses or spouses or sons or fortunes or delight?
data.anv: ये whosoever, राघवम् Rama, न पश्यन्ति do not see, तेषाम् their, गृहैः homes, किम् what use, दारैः with wives, किं कार्यम् what use, धनेन वा with wealth, किम् what use, पुत्रैः वा or with sons, सुखैर्वापि comforts, किम् what use?.
data.md: Of what use are their houses, and wives, and wealth, and sons, and comforts, to those who see not Rāghava (in their midst?)

data.v: एकः सत्पुरुषो लोके लक्ष्मणः सह सीतया । योऽनुगच्छति काकुत्स्थं रामं परिचरन्वने ।।
data.es: Lakshmana is the only fortunate person in the world who has followed Rama of the Kakutstha race along with Sita to serve them.
data.anv: लोके in this world, एकः only, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, सत्पुरुषः is a (fortunate) pious person, यः who, सीतया सह with sita, काकुत्स्थम् of Kakutstha race, रामम् Rama, वने in the forest, परिचरन् attending on them, अनुगच्छति follows.
data.md: There is one only good man in this world even Lakşmaņa, who along with Sītā is following Käkutstha Rāma to the woods.

data.v: आपगाः कृतपुण्यास्ताः पद्मिन्यश्च सरांसि च । येषु स्नास्यति काकुत्स्थो विगाह्य सलिलं शुचि ।।
data.es: The rivers and the lotuspools have done some meritorious acts in the past as a result of which Rama having plunged into their holy waters will make his ablution.
data.anv: येषु in which, शुचि pure, सलिलम् waters, विगाह्य enters, काकुत्स्थ: Rama, स्नास्यति bathes, ताः   those, आपगाः rivers, पद्मिन्यः tanks with lotuses, सरांसि च the lakes, कृतपुण्याः for the meritorious acts done (in the past).
data.md: Those streams, assemblage of lotuses, and pools are blessed by which bathing in the sacred waters, Kakutstha will pass.

data.v: शोभयिष्यन्ति काकुत्स्थमटव्यो रम्यकाननाः । आपगाश्च महानूपाः सानुमन्तश्च पर्वताः ।।
data.es: Forests with beautiful groves rivers with vast expanse of waters, mountains with their slopes will enhance the lustre of the scion of the Kakutsthas (Rama).
data.anv: रम्यकाननाः with beautiful groves, अटव्यः forests, महानूपाः expanse of waters, आपगाः च rivers, सानुमन्तः having slopes, पर्वताः mountains, काकुत्स्थम् scion of the Kakutstha dynasty (Rama), शोभयिष्यन्ति will enhance his lustre.
data.md: And romantic forests and woods, watery expanses of mighty volume, and mountains with flat spaces, will grace Kākutstha.

data.v: काननं वापि शैलं वा यं रामोऽभिगमिष्यति । प्रियातिथिमिव प्राप्तं नैनं शक्ष्यन्त्यनर्चितुम् ।।
data.es: Whichever hill or forest Rama visits, people will receive him there like a welcome guest and will not fail to render hospitality to him.
data.anv: रामः Rama, यम् शैलं वा any hill, काननं वापि or forest, अधिगमिष्यति approaches, they, प्राप्तं  having arrived, प्रियातिथिम् इव like a welcome guest, एनम् him, अनर्चितुम् without extending hospitality, न शक्ष्यन्ति cannot.
data.md: And forests and hills to which will repair Rāma cannot go without paying him homage like to a welcome guest.

data.v: विचित्रकुसुमापीडा बहुमञ्जरिधारिणः । अकाले चापि मुख्यानि पुष्पाणि च फलानि च । दर्शयिष्यन्त्यनुक्रोशाद्गिरयो राममागतम् ।।
data.es: Trees with bunches of cololurful flowers and clusters of blossoms hovering over with black bees will present themselves to the son of the Raghus (Rama).
data.anv: विचित्रकुसुमापीडा bunches of colourful flowers, बहुमञ्जरिधारिणः wearing many clusters of blossoms, भ्रमरशालिनः with bees, नगाः trees, राघवम् Rama, दर्शयिष्यन्ति will present themselves.

data.v: विदर्शयन्तो विविधान्भूयश्चित्रांश्च निर्झरान् । पादपाः पर्वताग्रेषु रमयिष्यन्ति राघवम् ।।
यत्र रामो भयं नात्र नास्ति तत्र पराभवः । स हि शूरो महाबाहुः पुत्रो दशरथस्य च ।।
data.md: And presenting him with many a charming fountain, trees will delight Rāma at the tops of mountains.* Where Rama is, there is nor fear or failure. That mighty-armed son of Dasaratha is heroic. Let us while he is yet ahead within a short distance of us, follow Rāghava. *The meaning is, Trees will please Rāghava by spreading for him a bed of leaves and flowers.

data.v: पुरा भवति नो दूरादनुगच्छाम राघवम् । पादच्छाया सुखा भर्तुस्तादृशस्य महात्मनः । स हि नाथो जनस्यास्य स गतिः स परायणम् ।।
data.es: The shadow of the feet of this magnanimous lord will give us happiness. He alone is the goal and protector of all these people. He is the supreme refuge.
data.anv: तादृशस्य such, महात्मनः magnanimous, भर्तुः master's, पादच्छाया shadow of his feet, सुखा is happy, अस्य of these, जनस्य people's, सः he alone, नाथ: हि is the protector, सः he, गतिः goal, सः he, परायणम् supreme refuge.
data.md: Even the shadow of the feet of our master, so high-souled, would bring us happiness. He is the lord of all these, he is the refuge, he is the accomplishment of our religious duties.

data.v: वयं परिचरिष्यामः सीतां यूयं तु राघवम् । इति पौरस्त्रियो भर्तॄन्दुःखार्तास्तत्तदब्रुवन् ।।
data.es: We will serve Sita. You will serve Rama. Such were the words of the distressed women of the city to their husbands. (They continued).
data.anv: वयम् we, सीताम् Sita, परिचरिष्यामः will serve, यूयं तु you also, राघवम् to Rama, इति like this, पौरस्त्रियः women of the city, दुःखार्ताः distressed in sorrow, भर्तृ़न् to their husbands तत्तत् that kind of words, अब्रुवन् spoke.
data.md: We and you, will serve Sītā, and Rāghava. Thus afflicted with grief, the women of the city spoke to their husbands.

data.v: युष्माकं राघवोऽरण्ये योगक्षेमं विधास्यति । सीता नारीजनस्यास्य योगक्षेमं करिष्यति ।।
data.es: In the forest, Rama will look after your wellbeing and Sita will ensure our, women folk's security.
data.anv: राघवः Rama, अरण्ये in the forest, युष्माकम् for you, योगक्षेमम् aquisition and protection of desired objects, विधास्यति will provide, सीता sita, अस्य (नारी) जनस्य of these (womenfolk), योगक्षेमम् security of possessions, करिष्यति will make.
data.md: In the forest Rāghava will attain for you the unattainable and protect what is attained; and Sītā being a female will do the same for these (women.)

data.v: को न्वनेनाप्रतीतेन सोत्कण्ठितजनेन च । संप्रीयेतामनोज्ञेन वासेन हृतचेतसा ।।
data.es: The people here are choked with grief. Who will like to stay here where life is disagreeable, cheerless, full of despondency and distress?
data.anv: अप्रतीतेन disagreeable, सोत्कण्ठितजनेन च people who are choked with grief, अमनोज्ञेन not delighted, हृतचेतसा senses seized with distress, अनेन वासेन with this kind of living, कः नु who, सम्प्रियेत who will be pleased?
data.md: Who will take pleasure in residing in a dwelling where the heart dies within itself, which is devoid of delight, where the people are always agitated with anxiety and which is exceedingly disagreeable?

data.v: कैकेय्या यदि चेद्राज्यं स्यादधर्म्यमनाथवत् । न हि नो जीवितेनार्थः कुतः पुत्रैः कुतो धनैः ।।
data.es: If Kaikeyi rules this kingdom unethically, we do not want to live here like orphans. What is the use of our progeny or property (in such a place)?
data.anv: अधर्म्यम् unethically, अनाथवत् like orphans (unprotected), राज्यम् kingdom, कैकेय्याः to Kaikeyi, स्याद्यदि  if happens, नः for us, जीवितेन on this life, अर्थः purpose, न हि is not there, पुत्रैः by sons, कुतः what use?, धनैः with wealth, कुतः what use?
data.md: If this kingdom devolves on Kaikeyi it will be divested of all virtues and will be like to one without a master. And of what avail then is our life itself, not to speak of sons and wealth.

data.v: यया पुत्रश्च भर्ता च त्यक्तावैश्वर्यकारणात् । कं सा परिहरेदन्यं कैकेयी कुलपांसनी ।।
data.es: Can Kaikeyi, who has brought disgrace to the race by abandoning her husband and son for the sake of wealth, spare others?
data.anv: यया by whom, ऐश्वर्यकारणात् for the sake of wealth, पुत्रश्च son's, भर्ता च husband as well, त्यक्ता abandoned, कुलपांसनी a woman who is the disgrace to the race, सा कैकेयी that Kaikeyi, अन्यम् others, कम् whom, परिहरेत् will she spare?
data.md: Whom else will that stainer of her line, Kaikeyī, forsake now, who for the sake of wealth has forsaken her son and her lord?

data.v: कैकेय्या न वयं राज्ये भृतका निवसेमहि । जीवन्त्या जातु जीवन्त्यः पुत्रैरपि शपामहे ।।
data.es: We swear on our sons that as long as Kaikeyi lives, or we live, we will never stay in her kingdom as servants.
data.anv: कैकेय्याः Kaikeyi, जीवन्त्याः while she is alive, वयम् we, जीवन्त्यः living, राज्ये in this kingdom, भृतकाः as servants, जातु never, न निवसेमहि will not live, पुत्रैरपि on our sons also, शपामहे we swear.
data.md: We swear by our sons that so long as Kaikeyi is alive, we living will never stay in her kingdom, although we may be maintained by her.

data.v: या पुत्रं पार्थिवेन्द्रस्य प्रवासयति निर्घृणा । कस्तां प्राप्य सुखं जीवेदधर्म्यां दुष्टचारिणीम् ।।
data.es: Who can live with pleasure under the rule of Kaikeyi of unrighteous character and wicked behaviour, one who without compassion banished Rama, son of Dasaratha, king of kings?
data.anv: या that Kaikeyi, निर्घृणा unkind, पार्थिवेन्द्रस्य king's, पुत्रम् son, प्रवासयति has banished, अधर्म्याम्  unrighteous, दुष्टचारिणीम् of wicked behaviour, ताम् her, प्राप्य having her (as a ruler), कः who, सुखम् with pleasure, जीवेत् will live?
data.md: What happiness can be ours by living with that wicked and unrighteous one who lost to every sense of shame is bent upon exiling the son of the foremost of kings?

data.v: न हि प्रव्रजिते रामे जीविष्यति महीपतिः । मृते दशरथे व्यक्तं विलोपस्तदनन्तरम् ।।
data.es: Now that Rama has been banished, the king will not live (long). After his death there will be evidently only lamentations.
data.anv: रामे Rama, प्रव्रजिते is banished, महीपतिः king, न जीविष्यति हि will not survive, दशरथे Dasaratha, मृते is dead, तदनन्तरम् after that,  विलापः lamentations, व्यक्तम् this is evident.
data.md: On Rāma retiring to the forest, the lord of earth will surely not live; and Dasaratha dying, it is evident everything will come to naught.

data.v: ते विषं पिबतालोड्य क्षीणपुण्याः सुदुर्गताः । राघवं वानुगच्छध्वमश्रुतिं वापि गच्छत ।।
data.es: Where you are in deep trouble with merits exhausted, it is better to take poison, or follow Rama or walk into the unknown.
data.anv: क्षीणपुण्याः merits exhausted, सुदुर्गताः in deep troubles, ते you, विषम् poison, आलोड्य seeing this, पिबत drink, राघवं वा or Rama, अनुगच्छध्वम् follow, अश्रुतिं वा unseen (distant) place,  गच्छत go there.
data.md: Do you, your virtue exhausted, and oppressed with grief, pounding poison, take it, or follow Rāghava, or remove to such a place that the very name of Kaikeyī may not reach your ears.

data.v: मिथ्या प्रव्राजितो रामः सभार्यः सहलक्ष्मणः । भरते संनिषृष्टाः स्मः सौनिके पशवो यथा ।।
data.es: Rama along with Sita and Lakshmana has been deceitfully exiled and all of us delivered to Bharata like beasts to a butcher (for protection).
data.anv: ससीतः along with Sita, सहलक्ष्मणः with Lakshmana, रामः Rama, मिथ्या deceitfully, प्रव्राजितः has been exiled, यथा पशवः like beasts, सौनिके to a butcher, भरते Bharata, सन्निसृष्टाः स्मः have been delivered.
data.md: Rāma has been deceitfully exiled along with his wife and Lakşmaņa; and we are bound to Bharata like to a (sacrificial) beast before one that is to slaughter it.

data.v: तास्तथा विलपन्त्यस्तु नगरे नागरस्त्रियः । चुक्रुशुर्भृशसंतप्ता मृत्योरिव भयागमे ।।
data.es: Such was the lamentation of the women of the city. Overcome with grief as if frightened at the approach of death, they wept bitterly.
data.anv: नगरे in the city, ताः those, नागरस्त्रियः women of the city, तथा in that way, विलपन्त्यः lamenting, मृत्योः at the approach of death, भयागमे इव as if frightened, चुक्रुशुः wept र्दुःखसन्तप्ता affected with grief
data.md: Thus lamenting in the city, the females thereof burning in grief became distressed like people stricken with panic on the occasion of a plague.

data.v: तथा स्त्रियो रामनिमित्तमातुरा; यथा सुते भ्रातरि वा विवासिते । विलप्य दीना रुरुदुर्विचेतसः; सुतैर्हि तासामधिको हि सोऽभवत् ।।
data.es: The women grieved over Rama as if a son or a brother had been exiled. Depressed and distressed, they wept and sobbed. For them, Rama was indeed more than their sons.
data.anv: स्त्रियः women, सुते when a  son, भ्रातरिवा or brother, विवासिते exiled, यथा तथा in the same manner, राम निमित्तम् for the sake of Rama, आतुराः grieving, दीनाः dejected, विचेतसः with troubled minds, विलप्य having lamented, रुरुदुः wept, तासाम् for them, सः Rama, सुतैः more than sons, अधिकः more, अभवत् हि became indeed.
data.md: Distressed for the sake of Rāma as if it was a was son or a brother of theirs that was banished, the women weeping forlorn, lamented with senses lost; and Rāma was to them more than a son.

data.v: रामोऽपि रात्रिशेषेण तेनैव महदन्तरम् । जगाम पुरुषव्याघ्रः पितुराज्ञामनुस्मरन् ।।
data.es: Recollecting his father's command, Rama, the foremost among men, covered a long distance during the remaining part of the night.
data.anv: पुरुषव्याघ्रः foremost  among men, रामोऽपि Rama also, पितुः father's, आज्ञाम् command,  अनुस्मरन् recollecting, तेन by that, रात्रिशेषेणैव in the remaining part of the night, महत् vast, अन्तरम् distance, जगाम covered.
data.md: That best of men, Rāma, remembering his father's commanded cleared a large tract of country before the night terminated.

data.v: तथैव गच्छतस्तस्य व्यपायाद्रजनी शिवा । उपास्य स शिवां संध्यां विषयान्तं व्यगाहत ।।
data.es: While Rama was thus travelling, the auspicious night ended. With the sandhya (morning twilight), worship over, he reached the frontiers of the country.
data.anv: तस्य for him, तथा in that manner, गच्छतः एव thus travelling, शिवा auspicious, रजनी night, व्यपायात् ended, (सः he), शिवाम् auspicious, सन्ध्याम् sandhya (morning twilight), उपास्य having worshipped, विषयान्तम् frontiers of the country, व्यगाहत reached.
data.md: And as he went on, the auspicious night was spent. And then having offered up his devotions to the beneficent Sandhyā, Rāma entered into another country.

data.v: ग्रामान्विकृष्टसीमांस्तान्पुष्पितानि वनानि च । पश्यन्नतिययौ शीघ्रं शरैरिव हयोत्तमैः ।।
data.es: Watching the villages furrowed at the outskirts, forests in blossom, hearing the gossips of the people living in the midst of villages, Rama felt he was moving very slowly whereas he had actually covered a long distance with those excellent (swift) horses.
data.anv: विकृष्टसीमान्तान् ploughed outskirts, ग्रामान् villages, पुष्पितानि flowered, वनानि च forests, पश्यन् seeing, ग्रामसंवासवासिनाम् living in the midst of villages, मनुष्याणाम् of the people, वचः discussions, शृण्वन् hearing, हयोत्तमैः on those excellent horses, शीघ्रम् quickly travelling, शनैरिव as if going slowly, अतिययौ went a long distance.
