data.md: And seeing villages having ploughed fields on their skirts, and powering woods, he by means of those excellent horses, proceeded very fast although seeming to go slowly.

data.v: शृण्वन्वाचो मनुष्याणां ग्रामसंवासवासिनाम् । राजानं धिग्दशरथं कामस्य वशमागतम् ।।
data.es: Such were the words of people living in villages and hamlets that Rama the valiant lord of Kosala happened to hear as he was crossing the boundaries of Kosala.
data.anv: वीरः valiant, कोसलेश्वरः lord of Kosala Rama, ग्रामसंवासवासिनाम् living in villages and hamlets, मनुष्याणाम् people's, एताः these, वाचः words, शृण्वन् while listening, कोसलान्  boundaries of Kosala kingdom, अति ययौ crossed.
data.md: And as Rāma proceeded,* he heard the villagers speaking to each other, saying, Fie on king Dasaratha, who has yielded himself up to lust! *The N.W.P. text has an additional couplet:, How will that exalted lady, Janaka's daughter, ever engaged in enjoyment, bear misery?

data.v: हा नृशंसाद्य कैकेयी पापा पापानुबन्धिनी । तीक्ष्णा संभिन्नमर्यादा तीक्ष्णे कर्मणि वर्तते ।।
data.es: (The villagers were speaking among themselves) Fie on the king who is overtaken by passion Alas, the heartless, sinful Kaikeyi, indulging in evil has banished into the forest this prince who is righteous and sagacious, compassionate and selfrestrained. How could this cruel Kaikeyi, by breaking all limits of decorum resort to such atrocious action?
data.anv: कामस्य to passion, वशमागतम् overtaken by, राजानम् king, दशरथम् Dasaratha, धिक् fie on him, हा what a pity, नृशंसा wicked, पापा sinful, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, अद्य now, पापानुबन्धिनी is committed to sins, या that Kaikeyi, धार्मिकम् righteous, महाप्राज्ञम् sagacious,  सानुक्रोशम् full of compassion, जितेन्द्रियम् one who has control over his senses, ईदृशम् such a person, राज्ञः पुत्रम् king's son, वनवासे to dwell in the forest, प्रवासयति has  banished, तीक्ष्णा cruel, सम्भिन्नमर्यादा breaking all limits of decency, तीक्ष्णकर्मणि in an  extremely cruel act, वर्तते is committed.
data.md: Ah! the rebutless, fell and sinful Kaikeyi intent upon impiety, having put by her honour, has resolved upon an exceedingly atrocious deed, she that exiles into the woods such a virtuous son of the monarch, endowed with high wisdom, kind, and having his senses under control.* *The N.W.P. text has an additional line: And of the reprehensible Kaikeyi intent upon cruel deeds.

data.v: या पुत्रमीदृशं राज्ञः प्रवासयति धार्मिकम् । वन वासे महाप्राज्ञं सानुक्रोशमतन्द्रितम् ।।
data.anv: कामस्य to passion, वशमागतम् overtaken by, राजानम् king, दशरथम् Dasaratha, धिक् fie on him, हा what a pity, नृशंसा wicked, पापा sinful, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, अद्य now, पापानुबन्धिनी is committed to sins, या that Kaikeyi, धार्मिकम् righteous, महाप्राज्ञम् sagacious,  सानुक्रोशम् full of compassion, जितेन्द्रियम् one who has control over his senses, ईदृशम् such a person, राज्ञः पुत्रम् king's son, वनवासे to dwell in the forest, प्रवासयति has  banished, तीक्ष्णा cruel, सम्भिन्नमर्यादा breaking all limits of decency, तीक्ष्णकर्मणि in an  extremely cruel act, वर्तते is committed.
data.md: Ah! the rebutless, fell and sinful Kaikeyi intent upon impiety, having put by her honour, has resolved upon an exceedingly atrocious deed, she that exiles into the woods such a virtuous son of the monarch, endowed with high wisdom, kind, and having his senses under control.* *The N.W.P. text has an additional line: And of the reprehensible Kaikeyi intent upon cruel deeds.

data.v: एता वाचो मनुष्याणां ग्रामसंवासवासिनाम् । शृण्वन्नतिययौ वीरः कोसलान्कोसलेश्वरः ।।
data.es: Such were the words of people living in villages and hamlets that Rama the valiant lord of Kosala happened to hear as he was crossing the boundaries of Kosala.
data.anv: वीरः valiant, कोसलेश्वरः lord of Kosala Rama, ग्रामसंवासवासिनाम् living in villages and hamlets, मनुष्याणाम् people's, एताः these, वाचः words, शृण्वन् while listening, कोसलान्  boundaries of Kosala kingdom, अति ययौ crossed.
data.md: Hearing these words of the villagers, that hero, the lord of Kosala, left Kosala behind him. Then crossing the river Vedaśruti of sacred waters, Rāma went in the direction of the quarter in which Agastya resided. (South)

data.v: ततो वेदश्रुतिं नाम शिववारिवहां नदीम् । उत्तीर्याभिमुखः प्रायादगस्त्याध्युषितां दिशम् ।।
data.es: He then crossed the river Vedasruti flowing with sacred waters and went in the southern direction where sage Agastya resided.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, शिववारिवहाम् carrying the auspicious waters, वेदश्रुतिं नाम by name Vedasruti, नदीम् river, उत्तीर्य having crossed, अगस्त्याध्युषिताम् where Agastya was  residing, दिशम् quarter, अभिमुखः in the direction of, प्रायात् went.
data.md: Hearing these words of the villagers, that hero, the lord of Kosala, left Kosala behind him. Then crossing the river Vedaśruti of sacred waters, Rāma went in the direction of the quarter in which Agastya resided. (South)

data.v: गत्वा तु सुचिरं कालं ततः शीतजलां नदीम् । गोमतीं गोयुतानूपामतरत्सागरंगमाम् ।।
data.es: Travelling for a long time along the river Gomati full of cool waters on whose marshy bank cows grazed, Rama crossed it at the point where it flows into the sea.
data.anv: ततः then, सुचिरं कालम् for a long time, गत्वा having travelled, शीत जलाम् of cool waters, गोयुतानूपाम् cows abounding in marshy areas, सागरङ्गमाम् flowing into the sea, गोमतीम्  Gomati, नदीम् river, अतरत् crossed.
data.md: Then proceeding for a good while, he crossed the cool flowing stream Gomati running in the direction of the ocean, with its banks filled with kine and inundating its edge.

data.v: गोमतीं चाप्यतिक्रम्य राघवः शीघ्रगैर्हयैः । मयूरहंसाभिरुतां ततार स्यन्दिकां नदीम् ।।
data.es: Gomati gone, Rama with the swiftmoving horses crossed the river Syandika echoing with the cries of peacocks and swans.
data.anv: राघवः Rama, शीघ्रगैः with swiftmoving, हयैः with horses, गोमतीं चापि Gomati river also, अतिक्रम्य having crossed, मयूरहंसाभिरुताम् echoed with the cries of peacocks and swans,  स्यन्दिकाम् नदीम् river Syandika, ततार crossed.
data.md: Having passed the Gomatī, Rāghava by means of fleet-coursing horses next crossed over the river Sandika resounding with the cries of cranes and peacocks.

data.v: स महीं मनुना राज्ञा दत्तामिक्ष्वाकवे पुरा । स्फीतां राष्ट्रावृतां रामो वैदेहीमन्वदर्शयत् ।।
data.es: Rama showed Sita vast tracts of land encircled by kingdoms which were formerly bestowed upon Ikshvaku by emperor Manu.
data.anv: सः रामः that Rama, पुरा formerly, राज्ञा by the king, मनुना by Manu, इक्ष्वाकवे to Ikshvaku, दत्ताम् bestowed, स्फीताम् vast tracts, राष्ट्रावृताम् encircled by  kingdoms, महीम् land, वैदेहीम् to Sita, अन्वदर्शयत् showed.
data.md: Here Rāma showed to Vaidehi those flourishing regions that had formerly been conferred by king Manu on Ikşvāku, and which teemed with populous tracts.

data.v: सूत इत्येव चाभाष्य सारथिं तमभीक्ष्णशः । हंसमत्तस्वरः श्रीमानुवाच पुरुषर्षभः ।।
data.anv: हंसमत्तस्वरः resembling the intoxicated voice of swans, पुरुषर्षभः the best among men, श्रीमान् graceful, सूत इत्येव O charioteer saying so, तं सारथिम् that charioteer, अभीक्ष्णश: repeatedly, आभाष्य having uttered, उवाच said.
data.md: Then frequently addressing the charioteer, saying, "O Suta", that best of men furnished with grace and endowed with a voice like that of a mad swan, spoke.

data.v: कदाहं पुनरागम्य सरय्वाः पुष्पिते वने । मृगयां पर्याटष्यामि मात्रा पित्रा च संगतः ।।
data.es: When shall I return and reunite with my father and mother and go hunting in the blooming forest on the bank of the river Sarayu?
data.anv: अहम् I, पुनः again, आगम्य having returned, मात्रा with mother, पित्रा च also with father, सङ्गतः united with, सरय्वा: Sarayu river's, पुष्पिते blossoming, वने groves, मृगयाम् hunting, कदा when, पर्यटिष्यामि I shall roam about.
data.md: When shall I coming back, range a hunting the blossoming groves of the Sarayū, along with my father and mother?

data.v: नात्यर्थमभिकाङ्क्षामि मृगयां सरयूवने । रतिर्ह्येषातुला लोके राजर्षिगणसंमता ।।
data.es: In this world, hunting is a unique pleasure. It is regarded as a delightful sport for royal sages. But I do not have a great longing for hunting in the forest on the bank of river Sarayu.
data.anv: एषा this hunting, लोके in this world, अतुला incomparable, राजर्षिगणसम्मता is accepted by royal sages, रतिर्हि is delightful (sport indeed), सरयूवने in the Sarayu forest of, मृगयाम् hunting, अत्यर्थम् greatly, नाभिकाङ्क्षामि do not desire.
data.md: I do not so much long for hunting in the woods of the Sarayū; but a relish (for the pastime) is considered as beyond compare being held in esteem by the Rājarşis.

data.v: स तमध्वानमैक्ष्वाकः सूतं मधुरया गिरा । तं तमर्थमभिप्रेत्य ययौवाक्यमुदीरयन् ।।
data.es: The descendant of Ikshvaku related to the charioteer in a sweet voice the thoughts that came to him and went on the way (continued his journey). इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकोनपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyninth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: सः ऐक्ष्वाकः that descendant of Ikshvaku, Rama, तम् that, सूतम् to charioteer, मधुरया in sweet, गिरा words, तम् तम् these and other, अर्थम् thoughts, अभिप्रेत्य regarding, वाक्यम् words, उदीरयन् pronouncing, अध्वानम् the path, ययौ went (covered).
data.md: Taking this subject, the descendant of Ikşvāku passed the way, addressing sweet words to the charioteer.

data.v: विशालान्कोसलान्रम्यान्यात्वा लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः । आससाद महाबाहुः शृङ्गवेरपुरं प्रति ।।
data.es: Having crossed the vast, beautiful kingdom of Kosala, the sagacious elder brother of Lakshmana stood facing Ayodhya with folded palms and said:
data.anv: लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः Lakshmana's elder brother, धीमान् sagacious, रम्यान् beautiful, विशालान् vast, कोसलान् kingdom of Kosala, यात्वा  gone beyond, अयोध्याभिमुखः facing Ayodhya, प्राञ्जलिः with folded hands, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

data.v: तत्र त्रिपथगां दिव्यां शिवतोयामशैवलाम् । ददर्श राघवो गङ्गां पुण्यामृषिनिसेविताम् ।।
data.es: There Rama saw the holy Ganga flowing in three (worlds) with her sacred waters, free from moss, and worshipped by sages.
data.anv: तत्र there, राघवः Rama, त्रिपथगाम् flowing in three worlds, रम्याम् beautiful, शिवतोयाम् sacred waters, आशैवलाम् free from moss, पुण्याम् holy, ऋषिसेविताम्  worshipped by sages, गङ्गाम् Ganga, ददर्श saw.

data.v: हंससारससंघुष्टां चक्रवाकोपकूजिताम् । शिंशुमरैश्च नक्रैश्च भुजंगैश्च निषेविताम् ।।
data.es: The river reverberates with the cries of swans, cranes and chakravakas (ruddy goose). It rings intermittently with the chirpings of birds charged with endless pasison.
data.anv: हंससारससङ्घुष्टाम् reverberating with cries of swans and cranes, चक्रवाकोपकूजिताम् filled with cries of chakravakas (ruddy geese), सदामदैः विहगैः always filled with passionate birds, अभिसन्नादितान्तराम् filled with sounds at intervals.

data.v: तामूर्मिकलिलावर्तामन्ववेक्ष्य महारथः । सुमन्त्रमब्रवीत्सूतमिहैवाद्य वसामहे ।।
data.es: Beholding river Ganga full of waves and whirlpools, the great chariotwarrior (Rama) said to Sumantra: We shall spend the night here.
data.anv: महारथः great chariotwarrior, ऊर्मिकलिलावर्ताम् river full of tumultuous waves with  whirlpools, ताम् that, अन्ववेक्ष्य on beholding, सूतम् charioteer, सुमन्त्रम् Sumantra, अब्रवीत् said, अद्य today, अत्रैव here itself, वसामहे will spend.
data.md: And beholding (the river) with her surging eddies, that mighty car-warrior said to the charioteer, Sumantra, We will rest here to day.

data.v: अविदूरादयं नद्या बहुपुष्पप्रवालवान् । सुमहानिङ्गुदीवृक्षो वसामोऽत्रैव सारथे ।।
data.es: O charioteer there is a very large ingudi (almond) tree not far from the river, luxuriant with flowers and budding leaves. We shall stay there tonight.
data.anv: सारथे O charioteer, नद्याः river's, अविदूरात् not far from, बहुपुष्पप्रवालवान् having many flowers and budding leaves, सुमहान् very large, अयम् this, इङ्गुदीवृक्षः Ingudi tree, अत्रैव here itself, वसामः shall stay.
data.md: There is hard by the river a gigantic Ingudī tree, bearing a profusion of flowers and fresh leaves. Here, O charioteer, will we stay to-day.

data.v: लक्षणश्च सुमन्त्रश्च बाढमित्येव राघवम् । उक्त्वा तमिङ्गुदीवृक्षं तदोपययतुर्हयैः ।।
data.es: Lakshmana and Sumantra agreed with Rama, saying 'Be it so' and turned the horses towards that ingudi tree.
data.anv: लक्ष्मणश्च Lakshmana, सुमन्त्रश्च Sumantra, राघवम् Rama, बाढमित्येव 'Be it so', उक्त्वा   saying, तदा then, हयैः with horses, तम् that, इङ्गुदीवृक्षम् ingudi tree, उपययतुः both approached.
data.md: Thereupon saying to Rāghava, “Very well,” Lakşinana and Sumantra with the horses went to the Ingudi tree.

data.v: रामोऽभियाय तं रम्यं वृक्षमिक्ष्वाकुनन्दनः । रथादवातरत्तस्मात्सभार्यः सहलक्ष्मणः ।।
data.es: Rama, delight of the Ikshvakus, along with his consort and Lakshmana reached that beautiful tree and alighted from the chariot.
data.anv: इक्ष्वाकुनन्दनः the delight of the Ikshvakus, रामः Rama, रम्यम् beautiful, तं वृक्षम् that tree, अभियाय having reached, सभार्यः with his consort, सहलक्ष्मणः with Lakshmana, तस्मात्  from that, रथात् chariot, अवातरत् alighted.
data.md: And reaching the tree, that descendant of Ikşvāku alighted from the car along with his wife and Lakşmaņa.

data.v: सुमन्त्रोऽप्यवतीर्यैव मोचयित्वा हयोत्तमान् । वृक्षमूलगतं राममुपतस्थे कृताञ्जलिः ।।
data.es: Sumantra also got off the chariot, unyoked the horses and with folded palms stood near Rama who had already reached the foot of the tree.
data.anv: सुमन्त्रोऽपि Sumantra also, अस्मात् from that chariot, अवतीर्य having alighted, हयोत्तमान् the best of horses, मोचयित्वा having unyoked, कृताञ्जलिः with folded palms, वृक्षमूलगतम् sitting at the foot of the tree, रामम् Rama, उपतस्थे stood near.
data.md: Then descending, Sumantra relieved those excellent horses, and with joined hands stood before Rāma seated at the foot of the tree.

data.v: तत्र राजा गुहो नाम रामस्यात्मसमः सखा । निषादजात्यो बलवान्स्थपतिश्चेति विश्रुतः ।।
data.es: There lived the mighty king Guha who was born in the race of nishadas (hunters) and became famous as their lord. He was a friend to Rama who was like his own self.
data.anv: तत्र there, रामस्य to Rama, आत्मसमः like his own self, सखा friend, निषादजात्यः hunter by  race, बलवान् powerful, स्थपतिश्चेति lord of nishada tribe, विश्रुतः wellknown, गुहो नाम Guha by name, राजा king.
data.md: There lived at the place a king named Guha, a friend to Răma, dear as his own self, a Nişāda by birth, powerful and famed as the lord of the Nişādas.

data.v: स श्रुत्वा पुरुषव्याघ्रं रामं विषयमागतम् । वृद्धैः परिवृतोऽमात्यैर्ज्ञातिभिश्चाप्युपागतः ।।
data.es: Having come to know that Rama, the best among men, had arrived in his region Guha accompanied by senior ministers and people of his clan came to greet him.
data.anv: सः he, पुरुषव्याघ्रम् (best) among men, रामम् Rama, विषयम् to his region, आगतम् having arrived, शृत्वा having heard, वृध्दै: by the aged, अमात्यैः by the ministers, ज्ञातिभिश्च by the people of his clan, परिवृतः surrounded by, अभ्युपागतः approached him.
data.md: Hearing that thai foremost of men, Răma, had arrived at the place, he (Guha) surrounded by his aged counsellors and kindred came to him.

data.v: ततो निषादाधिपतिं दृष्ट्वा दूरादवस्थितम् । सह सौमित्रिणा रामः समागच्छद्गुहेन सः ।।
data.es: When Rama and Lakshmana saw from a distance that Guha, king of the nishadas, was approaching them, they went forward to receive him.
data.anv: ततः then, उपस्थितम् approaching, निषादाधिपतिं king of the nishadas, दूरात् from a distance, दृष्ट्वा having seen, सौमित्रिणा सह along with Lakshmana, सः रामः that Rama, गुहेन with Guha, समागच्छत् went forward.
data.md: Seeing the lord of the Nişādhas at a distance, Rāma came up to him in company with Sumitra's son.

data.v: तमार्तः संपरिष्वज्य गुहो राघवमब्रवीत् । यथायोध्या तथेदं ते राम किं करवाणि ते ।।
data.es: Overwhelmed with grief (to see Rama in bark), Guha embraced Rama and said This is just like Ayodhya to you. What can I do for you? O mightyarmed Rama, who can have the good fortune of receiving such a beloved guest like you?
data.anv: आर्तः in anguish, गुहः Guha, तं राघवम् to Rama, सम्परिष्वज्य having embraced, अब्रवीत्  said, राम O Rama, ते to you, अयोध्या Ayodhya, यथा as how,  इयम् this city, तथा like that, ते to you, किम् what, करवाणि shall I do?, महाबाहो O mightyarmed one, ईदृशम् such, प्रियम्  beloved, अतिथिम् guest, कः who, प्राप्स्यति will get.
data.md: Thereat touched, Guha embracing Rāghava said to him, "O Rāma, as Ayodhyā this kingdom is to you. What shall I do for you?"

data.v: ततो गुणवदन्नाद्यमुपादाय पृथग्विधम् । अर्घ्यं चोपानयत्क्षिप्रं वाक्यं चेदमुवाच ह ।।
data.es: Thereafter he quickly brought rice and various kinds of tasty food and drink as welcome offerings and said to him:
data.anv: ततः thereafter, पृथग्विधम् various kinds of, गुणवत् of good quality, अन्नाद्यम् rice and other eatables, उपादाय having brought, क्षिप्रम् quickly, अर्घ्यं च drinks also, उपानयत् he brought, इदम् वाक्यं च these words, उवाच ह also spoke.

data.v: स्वागतं ते महाबाहो तवेयमखिला मही । वयं प्रेष्या भवान्भर्ता साधु राज्यं प्रशाधि नः ।।
data.es: O mightyarmed prince, welcome to you This entire land belongs to you. You are our master and we, your servants. Rule this kingdom happily.
data.anv: महाबाहो O mightyarmed one, ते to you, स्वागतम् welcome, अखिला entire, इयं मही this land, तव is yours, वयम् we, प्रेष्याः are attendants, भवान् you, भर्ता master, नः for us, राज्यम् this kingdom, साधु worthy of, प्रशाधि rule.

data.v: भक्ष्यं भोज्यं च पेयं च लेह्यं चेदमुपस्थितम् । शयनानि च मुख्यानि वाजिनां खादनं च ते ।।
data.es: All kinds of food to be taken by biting, chewing, drinking and licking are here for you. There is an excellent bed ready. There are also enough fodder for the horses.
data.anv: भक्ष्यम् food to be eaten by biting, भोज्यम् food to be eaten by chewing, पेयम् food fit for drinking, लेह्यं च food fit for licking, मुख्यानि excellent, शयनानि beds, ते for you,  वाजिनाम् for horses, खादनं च also fodder, इदम् here, उपस्थितम् awaits.

data.v: गुहमेव ब्रुवाणं तं राघवः प्रत्युवाच ह । अर्चिताश्चैव हृष्टाश्च भवता सर्वथा वयम् ।।
data.es: Hearing (the words of) Guha, Rama replied By coming on foot to meet us and by displaying your friendliness, you have amply honoured us and pleased us.
data.anv: एवम् in this way, ब्रुवाणम् speaking, गुहम् to Guha, राघवः Rama, प्रत्युवाच ह replied, वयम् we, सर्वथा in every way, भवता by you, पद्भ्याम् on foot, अभिगमाच्चैव coming to meet  us, स्नेहसन्दर्शनने च showing your friendliness, अर्चिताश्चैव we have been worshipped,  हृष्टाश्च also pleased.
data.md: When Guha had said this, Rāghava answered him, saying, “We have been well received by you and are well pleased with you, since coming here on foot you have shown us affection."

data.v: पद्भ्यामभिगमाच्चैव स्नेहसंदर्शनेन च । भुजाभ्यां साधुवृत्ताभ्यां पीडयन्वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
दिष्ट्या त्वां गुह पश्यामि अरोगं सह बान्धवैः । अपि ते कूशलं राष्ट्रे मित्रेषु च धनेषु च ।।
data.es: Rama embracing him tightly with his strong arms said, O Guha it is fortunate that I am able to see you and your relations in good health. Hope, all is well with your friends, kingdom and (collection of) revenue.
data.anv: पीनाभ्याम् strong, भुजाभ्याम् with his arms, साधु tightly, पीडयन् pressing together, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said, गुह O Guha, दिष्ट्या luckily, सह बान्धवै: with all relations, अरोगम् hale and hearty, त्वाम् you, पश्यामि am seeing, ते your, राष्ट्रे kingdom, मित्रेषु in friends, धनेषु च wealth also, अपि कुशलम् (hope) all is well.
data.md: Then pressing Guha hard with his arms, Rāma said, O Guha, it is by good luck that I see you whole along with your friends. Is your kingdom in peace both as regards your friends and the forest?

data.v: यत्त्विदं भवता किंचित्प्रीत्या समुपकल्पितम् । सर्वं तदनुजानामि न हि वर्ते प्रतिग्रहे ।।
data.es: I must give you back whatever you have offered me so affectionately. I am not in a position to accept anything.
data.anv: भवता by you, प्रीत्या with affection, इदम् now, यत् किञ्चित् whatever, समुकल्पितम् has been arranged, तत् सर्वम् all that, अनुजानामि I am accepting (giving you back), प्रतिग्रहे in acceptance, न वर्ते हि unable.
data.md: The things that you have presented me with out of love I accept but can not enjoy.

data.v: कुशचीराजिनधरं फलमूलाशनं च माम् । विद्धि प्रणिहितं धर्मे तापसं वनगोचरम् ।।
data.es: You must know me as an ascetic devoted to righeousness,and as a wanderer in the forest wearing garments made of bark, kusa grass and antelope skin, subsisting on fruits and roots.
data.anv: माम् me, कुशचीराजिनधरम् wearing garments made of bark, kusa grass and antelope skin, फलमूलाशिनम् susbsisting on fruits and roots, धर्मे in righteousness, प्रणिहितम् initiated, वनगोचरम् wandering in the forest, तापसम् like an ascetic, विद्धि you may know.
data.md: Do you know me as assuming an ascetic mode of life in the woods, in which I am to wear Kusa and bark and live upon fruits and roots.

data.v: अश्वानां खादनेनाहमर्थी नान्येन केनचित् । एतावतात्रभवता भविष्यामि सुपूजितः ।।
data.es: What I now need is fodder for the horses. Nothing more. If you can do this much, I'll deem it a great honour.
data.anv: अहम् I, अश्वानाम् for horses, खादनेन with fodder, अर्थी I am a seeker, अन्येन by other thing, केनचित् with any one, न not, अत्र here, एतावता to this extent, भवता by you, सुपूजितः wellhonoured, भविष्यामि shall become.
data.md: So, with the single exception of the food for the horses, things require I none; and these horses being well kept, I shall consider myself as entertained by you.

data.v: एते हि दयिता राज्ञः पितुर्दशरथस्य मे । एतैः सुविहितैरश्वैर्भविष्याम्यहमर्चितः ।।
data.es: If these horses which are the favourites of my father, king Dasaratha are wellfed, I shall consider myself honoured.
data.anv: एते these horses, मे पितुः my father's, दशरथस्य राज्ञः king Dasaratha's, दयिताः liked, सुविहितैः welltended, एतैः by these, अश्वैः with horses, अहम् I, अर्चितः worshipped,  भविष्यामि shall become.
data.md: These are the favourites of my father, Dasaratha, and on these horses being well provided for, I shall be well received.

data.v: अश्वानां प्रतिपानं च खादनं चैव सोऽन्वशात् । गुहस्तत्रैव पुरुषांस्त्वरितं दीयतामिति ।।
data.es: Guha ordered the men standing there Give these horses liquids like water and forage.
data.anv: सः that, गुहः Guha, तत्रैव there itself, पुरुषान् men, अश्वानाम् for the horses, प्रतिपानं च liquids like water, खादनं चैव forage, त्वरितम् quickly, दीयतामिति be given, अन्वशात् ordered.
data.md: Thereupon Guha on the spot commanded the men, saying, Let the horses have without delay meats and drinks.

data.v: ततश्चीरोत्तरासङ्गः संध्यामन्वास्य पश्चिमाम् । जलमेवाददे भोज्यं लक्ष्मणेनाहृतं स्वयम् ।।
data.es: Rama wearing the upper garment then offered oblations to Sandhya and partook of only water as refreshment, brought by Lakshmana.
data.anv: ततः then, चीरोत्तरासङ्ग: upper robe, पश्चिमां सन्ध्याम् Sandhya,  अन्वास्य offering oblations, लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, स्वयम् himself, आहृतम् which has been brought, जलमेव water only, भोज्यम् as food, आददे partook.
data.md: Then putting his sheet over his person, he (Rāma) performed his evening devotions. Having done this, he took as his sustenance the water that had been procured by Lakşmaņa himself.

data.v: तस्य भूमौ शयानस्य पादौ प्रक्षाल्य लक्ष्मणः । सभार्यस्य ततोऽभ्येत्य तस्थौ वृक्षमुपाश्रितः ।।
data.es: Lakshmana washed the feet of Rama who along with his consort lay upon the ground, and returned to take rest under the tree.
data.anv: लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, भूमौ on the ground, शयानस्य for sleeping, सभार्यस्य with his consort, तस्य his, पादौ feet, प्रक्षाल्य having washed, ततः then, अभ्येत्य having gone towards, वृक्षम् tree, उपाश्रितः took refuge, तस्थौ he stood.
data.md: On Rāma having lain down on the ground along with his wife, Lakşmaņa washed their feet, and then remained stationed under the tree.

data.v: गुहोऽपि सह सूतेन सौमित्रिमनुभाषयन् । अन्वजाग्रत्ततो राममप्रमत्तो धनुर्धरः ।।
data.es: Guha, bow in hand, conversing with Sumantra and Soumitri (Son of Sumitra, Lakshmana) then kept vigil over Rama by remaining awake (all night).
data.anv: गुहोऽपि Guha also, सूतेन सह along with the charioteer, सौमित्रिम् to Lakshmana, अनुभाषयन् while talking, ततः then, धनुर्धरः bow in hand, अप्रमत्तः by being vigilant, रामम् about Rama, अन्वजाग्रत् kept awake.
data.md: Then bow in hand and with his wits about him, conversing with Sumitra's son along with the charioteer, Guha remained awake, watching Rama.

data.v: तथा शयानस्य ततोऽस्य धीमतो; यशस्विनो दाशरथेर्महात्मनः । अदृष्टदुःखस्य सुखोचितस्य सा; तदा व्यतीयाय चिरेण शर्वरी ।।
data.es: As the wise, illustrious, magnanimous son of Dasaratha (Rama) who was used to pleasures and not discomfort lay on the ground, the long night slipped away. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे पञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftieth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: ततः then, अदृष्टदुःखस्य one who never experienced troubles, सुखोचितस्य used to comforts, धीमतः sagacious, यशस्विनः illustrious, महात्मनः magnanimous, तदा then, तथा like that, शयानस्य lying down, अस्य दाशरथेः for this son of Dasaratha (Rama), सा that, शर्वरी  night, चिरेण as of long duration, व्यतीयाय passed.
data.md: Thus the livelong night passed away with that illustrious, intelligent and high-souled son of Daśaratha, unacquainted with troubles and worthy of happiness.

data.v: तं जाग्रतमदम्भेन भ्रातुरर्थाय लक्ष्मणम् । गुहः संतापसंतप्तो राघवं वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Deeply moved to see Lakshmana, scion of the Raghus, keeping awake all night without any pretence for his brother's sake, Guha spoke.
data.anv: गुहः Guha, भ्रातुः brother, अर्थाय for the sake of, जाग्रतम् keeping awake, राघवम् Raghava born in the family of the Raghus, तं लक्ष्मणम् to that Lakshmana, अदम्भेन without any pretence, सन्तापसन्तप्तः tormented with grief, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: As for the purpose of protecting his brother, Lakṣmaṇa was watching him out of sincere affection, Guha burning in grief addressed that descendant of Raghu, saying.

data.v: इयं तात सुखा शय्या त्वदर्थमुपकल्पिता । प्रत्याश्वसिहि साध्वस्यां राजपुत्र यथासुखम् ।।
data.es: O dear prince this comfortable bed has been arranged for you. Rest happily on this bed.
data.anv: तात O dear, इयम् this, सुखा comfortable, शय्या bed, त्वदर्थम् for your sake, उपकल्पिता has been arranged, राजपुत्र O prince, अस्याम् on this, यथासुखम् comfortably, साधु well, प्रत्याश्वसि हि take rest.
data.md: This O child, is the easeful bed that has been prepared for you. O prince, do you as you listen, lie down upon it.

data.v: उचितोऽयं जनः सर्वः क्लेशानां त्वं सुखोचितः । गुप्त्यर्थं जागरिष्यामः काकुत्स्थस्य वयं निशाम् ।।
data.es: We are used to all kinds of suffering and you, to comfort. We will keep vigil during the night for the protection of Rama, descendant of the Kakutsthas.
data.anv: सर्वः all, अयं जनः these people, myself, क्लेशानाम् for all kinds of suffering, उचितः accustomed, त्वम् you, सुखोचितः accustomed to comforts, काकुत्स्थस्य for Rama descendant of the Kakutsthas, गुप्त्यर्थंम् for the sake of protection, वयम् we, निशाम् all night, जागरिष्यामः will keep awake.
data.md: These (foresters) are inured to this hardship; but you are worthy of ease. We will wake up during the night for guarding Kākutstha.

data.v: न हि रामात्प्रियतरो ममास्ति भुवि कश्चन । ब्रवीम्येतदहं सत्यं सत्येनैव च ते शपे ।।
data.es: For me, there is none dearer than Rama in this world. I speak the truth. I swear by truth.
data.anv: मम for me, रामात् more than Rama, प्रियतमः dearer, कश्चन none, भुवि in this world, नास्ति हि not there, अहम् I, एतत् this one, सत्यम् true, ब्रवीमि I am saying, सत्येनैव by word of truth, ते to you, शपे I swear.
data.md: There is none on earth dearer to me than Răma. This I tell you truly and I swear by truth itself.

data.v: अस्य प्रसादादाशंसे लोकेऽस्मिन्सुमहद्यशः । धर्मावाप्तिं च विपुलामर्थावाप्तिं च केवलाम् ।।
data.es: I am seeking supreme fame in this world through the attainment of dharma and acquisition of abundant artha by the grace of Rama alone.
data.anv: अस्य by this Rama's, प्रसादात् grace, अस्मिन् in this, लोके world, सुमहत् supreme, यशः fame, धर्मावाप्तिं च attainment of dharma, विपुलाम् abundantly, अर्थावाप्तिं च and also acquisition of artha (wealth), केवलम् alone, आशंसे I am seeking.
data.md: Through his grace I hope in this world to attain high fame, and great religious merit as well as completely secure profit and pleasure.

data.v: सोऽहं प्रियसखं रामं शयानं सह सीतया । रक्षिष्यामि धनुष्पाणिः सर्वतो ज्ञातिभिः सह ।।
data.es: I along with my kinsmen, bow in hand, will protect my dear friend, Rama with Sita from every side.
data.anv: सः such, अहम् I, ज्ञातिभिः with kinsmen, सह along with, धनुष्पाणिः bow in hand, सीतया सह along with sita, शयानम् resting, प्रियसखं dear friend, रामम् Rama, सर्वतः from every side,  रक्षिष्यामि I will protect.
data.md: I will bow in hand in company with my kindred adequately guard my dear friend reposing with Sītā.

data.v: न हि मेऽविदितं किंचिद्वनेऽस्मिंश्चरतः सदा । चतुरङ्गं ह्यपि बलं सुमहत्प्रसहेमहि ।।
data.es: Wandering about in this forest all the time there is nothing unknown to me (here). We can withstand even a vast army of four divisions.
data.anv: सदा always, अस्मिन् वने in this forest, चरतः while wandering, मे to me, अविदितम् unknown, किञ्चित् nothing, न हि not there, सुमहत् vast, चतुरङ्गम् four divisions of army, बलम् अपि army also, प्रसहेमहि will endure.
data.md: Always ranging in this forest, nothing herein is unknown to me. I shall vanquish even any mighty body of fourfold forces (that may come up against us.)

data.v: लक्ष्मणस्तं तदोवाच रक्ष्यमाणास्त्वयानघ । नात्र भीता वयं सर्वे धर्ममेवानुपश्यता ।।
data.es: Lakshmana said to Guha, O sinless one when all of us are under your righteous protection we have nothing to fear.
data.anv: तदा then, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, तम् to Guha, उवाच adressed, अनघ O Sinless me, धर्ममेव rigteousness, अनुपश्यता keeping in view, त्वया by you, रक्ष्यमाणाः being protected, वयं सर्वे all of us, अत्र here, न not, भीताः afraid of.
data.md: Thereupon Laksmana said, O sinless one, protected by you ever having your sight fixed on virtue, we do not fear to live in this place. But how with Dasaratha's son lying down on the ground along with Sītă can I indulge in sleep or what is the use of my living and enjoying happiness?

data.v: कथं दाशरथौ भूमौ शयाने सह सीतया । शक्या निद्रा मया लब्धुं जीवितं वा सुखानि वा ।।
data.es: When Rama, son of Dasaratha, sleeps on the ground with Sita how can I sleep or live or enjoy pleasures?
data.anv: दाशरथौ while the son of Dasaratha, सीतया सह along with Sita, भूमौ on the ground, शयाने is sleeping, मया by me, निद्रा sleep, जीवितं वा or life, सुखानि वा or pleasures, लब्धुम् to acquire, कथम् how, शक्या is it possible?
data.md: Thereupon Laksmana said, O sinless one, protected by you ever having your sight fixed on virtue, we do not fear to live in this place. But how with Dasaratha's son lying down on the ground along with Sītă can I indulge in sleep or what is the use of my living and enjoying happiness?

data.v: यो न देवासुरैः सर्वैः शक्यः प्रसहितुं युधि । तं पश्य सुखसंविष्टं तृणेषु सह सीतया ।।
data.es: Look at that Rama whom all the gods and demons cannot face in war sleeps so comfortably on the grass with Sita.
data.anv: यः who, युधि in war, सर्वैः by all, देवासुरैः gods and demons, प्रसहितुम् to face him, न शक्यः not possible, सीतया सह with sita, तृणेषु on the blades of grass, सुखसंविष्टम् sleeping comfortably, तम् that Rama, पश्य see.
data.md: How see him who is capable of bearing in battle the onslaught of the gods and the Asuras combined, sleeping in a cave on grass?

data.v: यो मन्त्र तपसा लब्धो विविधैश्च परिश्रमैः । एको दशरथस्यैष पुत्रः सदृशलक्षणः ।।
data.es: This favourite son of Dasaratha who has similar traits like his father was born after he rigorously practised austerities accompanied by (Vedic) mantras. When he is banished, the king will not live long. Surely this land will soon be widowed.
data.anv: यः whoever, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, सदृशलक्षणः similar traits, एकः only, इष्टः favourite one, मन्त्रतपसा with austerities accompanied by mantras, विविधैश्च various, पराश्रमैः with much efforts, लब्धः obtained, पुत्रः son, अस्मिन् this (Rama), प्रव्राजिते is banished, राजा king, चिरम् for long, न वर्तयिष्यति not live, नूनम् certainly, मदिनां earth क्षिप्रमिव quickly, विधवा widow, भविष्यति will become.

data.v: अस्मिन्प्रव्रजितो राजा न चिरं वर्तयिष्यति । विधवा मेदिनी नूनं क्षिप्रमेव भविष्यति ।।
data.es: This favourite son of Dasaratha who has similar traits like his father was born after he rigorously practised austerities accompanied by (Vedic) mantras. When he is banished, the king will not live long. Surely this land will soon be widowed.
data.anv: यः whoever, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, सदृशलक्षणः similar traits, एकः only, इष्टः favourite one, मन्त्रतपसा with austerities accompanied by mantras, विविधैश्च various, पराश्रमैः with much efforts, लब्धः obtained, पुत्रः son, अस्मिन् this (Rama), प्रव्राजिते is banished, राजा king, चिरम् for long, न वर्तयिष्यति not live, नूनम् certainly, मदिनां earth क्षिप्रमिव quickly, विधवा widow, भविष्यति will become.
data.md: It is by virtue of mighty austerities and uncommon exertions that Dasaratha has obtained this son of his crowned with every auspicious sign. He being banished, the king shall not live long; and the Earth shall certainly be widowed soon.

data.v: विनद्य सुमहानादं श्रमेणोपरताः स्त्रियः । निर्घोषोपरतं तात मन्ये राजनिवेशनम् ।।
data.es: All the women having cried so much must have quietened down out of sheer exhaustion. That is why perhaps the sounds from the royal palace have ceased.
data.anv: स्त्रियः women, सुमहानादम् loud sound, विनद्य having raised, श्रमेण because of exhaustion, उपरताः ceased, अतः for that reason, राजनिवेशनम् king's palace, निर्घोषोपरतम् sounds have ceased, मन्ये I consider.
data.md: Having bewailed aloud, the women have, methinks, (by this time) ceased through fatigue, and the king's residence is still.

data.v: कौसल्या चैव राजा च तथैव जननी मम । नाशंसे यदि जीवन्ति सर्वे ते शर्वरीमिमाम् ।।
data.es: I doubt whether all of them -- the king, Kausalya and my mother -- can survive this night.
data.anv: कौशल्या चैव Kausalya also, राजा च and the king, तथैव in the same way, मम जननी my mother, ते सर्वे all of them, इमाम् this, शर्वरीम् night, यदि जीवन्ति if they live, नाशंसे I do not expect.
data.md: I can not hope that Kausalyā, the king, and my mother (Sumitrā) all those are yet alive.

data.v: जीवेदपि हि मे माता शत्रुघ्नस्यान्ववेक्षया । तद्दुःखं यत्तु कौसल्या वीरसूर्विनशिष्यति ।।
data.es: My mother may live looking forward to Satrughna. But, alas Kausalya may die, separated from her valiant son.
data.anv: शत्रुघ्नस्य Satrughna's, अन्ववेक्षया looking forward, मे माता my mother, जीवेदपि हि if at all may live, वीरसूः valiant son, कौशल्या Kausalya, यत् विनशिष्यति if she perishes, तत् that one, दुःखम् is a sorrowful thing.
data.md: If they are, it is for this night only. Even if my mother live looking up to Satrughna, yet this is my grief that that mother of a hero, Kausalyā will breathe her last.

data.v: अनुरक्तजनाकीर्णा सुखालोकप्रियावहा । राजव्यसनसंसृष्टा सा पुरी विनशिष्यति ।।
data.es: That city (of Ayodhya) is full of loyal people. It brings them happiness. It is dear to them. It will perish due to the sad demise of the king.
data.anv: अनुरक्तजनाकीर्णा filled with loyal people, सुखा causing pleasure, लोकप्रियावहा that brings happiness to the people, सा पुरी that city, राजव्यसनसंसृष्टा overtaken by sorrow due to the death of the king, विनशिष्यति will perish.
data.md: And that palace filled with people attached to Rāma and flooded with the light of delight, will, visited with the calamity that will befall the king meet with destruction.

data.v: अतिक्रान्तमतिक्रान्तमनवाप्य मनोरथम् । राज्ये राममनिक्षिप्य पिता मे विनशिष्यति ।।
data.es: Past is past (irreversible). My father, brooding over his desire of installing Rama as king unfulfilled, will perish.
data.anv: मे पिता my father, अतिक्रान्तमतिक्रान्तम् past is past, मनोरथम् his desire, अनवाप्य without fulfilling, राज्ये in the kingdom, रामम् Rama, अनिक्षिप्य without installing, विनशिष्यति will die.
data.md: Saying, All is lost, All is lost, with his desire unattained, my father having failed to install Rāma in the kingdom, will resign his existence.

data.v: सिद्धार्थाः पितरं वृत्तं तस्मिन्काले ह्युपस्थिते । प्रेतकार्येषु सर्वेषु संस्करिष्यन्ति भूमिपम् ।।
data.es: Those who will remain present around the king, my father, at the time of his death and perform the funeral rites have their desires fulfilled (for they could attend the king's obsequies).
data.anv: तस्मिन् at that, काले time indeed, उपस्थिते present, सिध्दार्थाः those who accomplished their purpose, वृत्तम् laid in that state, पितरम् father, भूमिपम् lord of the land, king, सर्वेषु for all, प्रेतकार्येषु funeral rites, संस्करिष्यन्ति will perform.
data.md: Surely they are blessed that when the time shall come when the king will die, will perform the funeral rites of that descendant of Raghu.

data.v: रम्यचत्वरसंस्थानां सुविभक्तमहापथाम् । हर्म्यप्रासादसंपन्नां गणिकावरशोभिताम् ।।
रथाश्वगजसंबाधां तूर्यनादविनादिताम् । सर्वकल्याणसंपूर्णां हृष्टपुष्टजनाकुलाम् ।।
data.md: Then shall they with happy hearts range the looking terraces, with the highways laid out orderly, crowned with lordly edifices, adorned with various gems, crowded by cars and elephants and horses, resounding with the notes of trumpets, abounding in auspicious things, filled with fat and contented people, having gardens and pleasure-houses, and possessed of divers classed of men indulging festal mirth.

data.v: आरामोद्यानसंपन्नां समाजोत्सवशालिनीम् । सुखिता विचरिष्यन्ति राजधानीं पितुर्मम ।।
अपि सत्यप्रतिज्ञेन सार्धं कुशलिना वयम् । निवृत्ते वनवासेऽस्मिन्नयोध्यां प्रविशेमहि ।।
data.es: Will we ever be able, after completion of the exile, to enter the city of Ayodhya along with Rama who is true to his promise?
data.anv: अस्मिन् this (Rama), निवृत्तवनवासे after completion of the exile, कुशलिना safe, सत्यप्रतिज्ञेन सार्धं with him who is always true to his promise, वयम् we, अयोध्याम् Ayodhya, अपि प्रविशेमहि will enter?
data.md: If we remain in peace, we shall returning from the forest with that one firm in promise, enter Ayodhyā?

data.v: परिदेवयमानस्य दुःखार्तस्य महात्मनः । तिष्ठतो राजपुत्रस्य शर्वरी सात्यवर्तत ।।
data.es: While that noble prince (Lakshmana), tormented with grief, stood thus wailing, the night passed off.
data.anv: महात्मनः of the highsouled, दुःखार्तस्य tormented with grief, राजपुत्रस्य of the prince, परिदेवयमानस्य while he was wailing, तिष्ठतः standing by, सा शर्वरी that night, अत्यवर्तत passed away.
data.md: As the high-souled son of the king oppressed with grief was thus lamenting sitting up, the day broke.

data.v: तथा हि सत्यं ब्रुवति प्रजाहिते; नरेन्द्रपुत्रे गुरुसौहृदाद्गुहः । मुमोच बाष्पं व्यसनाभिपीडितो; ज्वरातुरो नाग इव व्यथातुरः ।।
data.es: Out of great friendship with Guha, Lakshmana thus told the true story of prince (Rama) in the interest of his subject (Guha). (On hearing it) Guha was deeply afflicted with grief and pain and began shedding tears like an elephant suffering from fever.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्यकाण्डे एकपञ्चाश स्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyfirst sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: प्रजाहिते seeking the wellfare of people, नरेन्द्रपुत्रे king'son, गुरुसौहृदात् out of great friendship, तथा like that, सत्यम् truth ब्रुवति telling, गुहः Guha, व्यथातुरः afflicted, व्यसनाभिपीडितः overcome with grief, ज्वरातुरः feverstricken, नागः इव like elephant, बाष्पम् tears, मुमोच shed.
data.md: When that son of the foremost of men, intent on the welfare of the subjects had spoken thus truly, Guha, out of extreme affection for (Rāma), shed tears afflicted with grief and hurt like an elephant suffering from fever.

data.v: प्रभातायां तु शर्वर्यां पृथु वृक्षा महायशाः । उवाच रामः सौमित्रिं लक्ष्मणं शुभलक्षणम् ।।
data.es: As the night advanced towards dawn, broadchested Rama of great renown said to Lakshmana, son of Sumitra, who had auspicious marks on his body:
data.anv: शर्वर्याम् after the night passed, प्रभातायां तु at dawn, पृथुवक्षाः broadchested, महायशाः of great fame, रामः Rama, शुभलक्षणम् of auspicious signs (on his body), सौमित्रिम्  Sumitra's son, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, उवाच said.
data.md: When the morning broke, that illustrious one having a spacious chest, Rāma, addressed Sumitrā's son, Laksmana, graced with auspicious marks.

data.v: भास्करोदयकालोऽयं गता भगवती निशा । असौ सुकृष्णो विहगः कोकिलस्तात कूजति ।।
data.es: O dear Lakshmana the holy night is over and it is time for sunrise. The deep dark bird, the cuckoo is singing.
data.anv: तात dear Lakshmana, अयम् now it is, भास्करोदयकालः time for sunrise, भगवती venerable, निशा night, गता is over, सुकृष्ण: deep dark, विहगः bird, असौ कोकिलः cuckoo, कूजति is singing.

data.v: बर्हिणानां च निर्घोषः श्रूयते नदतां वने । तराम जाह्नवीं सौम्य शीघ्रगां सागरंगमाम् ।।
data.es: Listen to the screams of the peacocks in the forest. The Ganga is flowing fast to merge in the sea. We need to cross it.
data.anv: वने forest, नदताम् screaming, बर्हिणानाम् of the peacocks, निर्घोषः sound, श्रूयते heard, सौम्य handsome, शीघ्रगाम् flowing rapidly, सागरङ्गमाम् to merge in the sea, जाह्नवीम् to Ganga, तराम need to cross.
data.md: This is the time of sunrise: the reverend Night has departed. O child, this gracefully sable-hued bird, the Coel, has began to warble, and I hear the cries of peacocks uttering notes in the woods. O amiable one, we will cross the Jāhnavī, fast rushing to the ocean.

data.v: विज्ञाय रामस्य वचः सौमित्रिर्मित्रनन्दनः । गुहमामन्त्र्य सूतं च सोऽतिष्ठद्भ्रातुरग्रतः ।।
data.es: In response to Rama's desire, Lakshmana, son of Sumitra, one who brings joy to his friends, called Guha and the charioteer (Sumantra) and stood before his brother.
data.anv: मित्रनन्दनः one who keeps his friends happy, सः सौमित्रि: that Lakshmana the son of Sumitra, रामस्य Rama's, वचः words, विज्ञाय knowing, गुहम् to Guha, सूतं च to the charioteer also, आमन्त्र्य calling, भ्रातुः brother's, अग्रतः in front, अतिष्ठत् stood.
data.md: Hearing Rāma's words, that enhancer of the delight of friends, Sumitra's son, conveyed them to Guha and the charioteer; and then stood before his brother.

data.v: ततः कलापान्संनह्य खड्गौ बद्ध्वा च धन्विनौ । जग्मतुर्येन तौ गङ्गां सीतया सह राघवौ ।।
data.es: Rama and Lakshmana then put on their quivers, fastened their swords and holding their bows went towards Ganga along with Sita.
data.anv: ततः then, तौ राघवौ Rama and Lakshmana, सीतया सह with Sita, कलापान् quivers, सन्नह्य having tied, खड्गौ च swords, बध्वा wearing, धन्विनौ holding the bows, येन गङ्गाम् towards Ganga, जग्मतुः went on.
data.md: Then donning on their mail and equipped with their bows, quivers and swords, the Rāghavas along with Sītā descended to the Gangā.

data.v: राममेव तु धर्मज्ञमुपगम्य विनीतवत् । किमहं करवाणीति सूतः प्राञ्जलिरब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: The charioteer (Sumantra) approached the righteous Rama and asked him with folded hands: What can I do?
data.anv: सूतः charioteer, प्राञ्जलि: with folded hands, विनीतवत् humbly, धर्मज्ञम् righteous, राममेव तु near Rama, उपगम्य going towards, अहम् I, किम् what, करवाणि do you want me to do , इति this, अब्रवीत् asked.
data.md: Then coming forward in humble guise before Rāma cognizant of virtue, the charioteer said with joined hands, "What shall I do (now)?"

data.v: निवर्तस्वेत्युवाचैनमेतावद्धि कृतं मम । यानं विहाय पद्भ्यां तु गमिष्यामो महावनम् ।।
data.es: You have done enough. I shall now leave the chariot and walk into the great forest.
data.anv: मम myself, एतावत् till here, कृतं हि brought, निवर्तस्व return, रथम् chariot, विहाय leaving, पद्भ्याम् on foot, महावनम् the great forest, गमिष्यामि wiill go, इति this, उवाच said.
data.md: “Do you” said he to the charioteer, "turn back, So far I have come (in obedience to the order of the monarch.) Now, renouncing the car, will I repair to the mighty forest on foot."

data.v: आत्मानं त्वभ्यनुज्ञातमवेक्ष्यार्तः स सारथिः । सुमन्त्रः पुरुषव्याघ्रमैक्ष्वाकमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having been permitted to go, Sumantra, the distressed charioteer, said to Rama, the best among men, and a descendant of the Ikshvaku race:
data.anv: सारथिः charioteer, सः सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, आत्मानम् self, अभ्यनुज्ञातम् permitted to go, अवेक्षय having seen, आर्तः pained, पुरुषव्याघ्रम् (best) among men, इक्ष्वाकम् of the Ikshvakus, इदम् this, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Finding himself thus commanded, the charioteer, Sumantra grieved at heart spoke to that best of men, the descendant of Ikşvāku.

data.v: नातिक्रान्तमिदं लोके पुरुषेणेह केनचित् । तव सभ्रातृभार्यस्य वासः प्राकृतवद्वने ।।
data.es: None else in this world would be able to live in the forest as you have resolved to, like a common man, along with your brother and spouse.
data.anv: सभ्रातृभार्यस्य of one with brother and wife, तव your, प्राकृतवत् like a common man, वने in the forest, वासः residing, इदम् this, इह लोके in this world, केनचित् पुरुषेण by any person, नातिक्रान्तम् not overcome.
data.md: That Destiny owing to which you will have to pass your days in the forest like a low person, along with your brother and wife, has in this world been withstood by none.

data.v: न मन्ये ब्रह्मचर्येऽस्ति स्वधीते वा फलोदयः । मार्दवार्जवयोर्वापि त्वां चेद्व्यसनमागतम् ।।
data.es: If your celibacy and your grief are the consequences of your study of the Vedic lore, your compassionate nature and simplicity of character, I think there is no use of all these (virtues).
data.anv: त्वाम् to you, व्यसनम् grief, आगतं चेत् has come, ब्रह्मचर्ये celibacy, स्वधीते वा learning the Vedas, मार्दवार्जवयोर्वापि compassionate and pure, फलोदयः this is the result, नास्ति no use, मन्ये I think so.
data.md: I deem the Brahmacarya mode of life, or study, or meekness or sincerity as attended with no fruit, since you have come by calamity.

data.v: सह राघव वैदेह्या भ्रात्रा चैव वने वसन् । त्वं गतिं प्राप्स्यसे वीर त्रीँल्लोकांस्तु जयन्निव ।।
data.es: Valiant scion of the Raghus dwelling in the forest along with Vaidehi (Sita) and brother Lakshmana you will attain the status as if you have won the three worlds.
data.anv: वीर valiant, राघव scion of the Raghu race (Rama), त्वम् you, वैदेह्या सह with Vaidehi, भ्रात्रा चैव and brother, वने forest, वसन् residing, त्रीन् three, लोकान् worlds, जयन्निव as if winning, गतिम् good status, प्राप्स्यसे will acquire.
data.md: O Rāghava, living in the forest with Vaidehi and your brother, you, O Lord, attain a state (of supreme excellence), having, as it were, conquered the three worlds.

data.v: वयं खलु हता राम ये तयाप्युपवञ्चिताः । कैकेय्या वशमेष्यामः पापाया दुःखभागिनः ।।
data.es: Deprived of you, O Rama we will come under the control of that sinful Kaikeyi. We will suffer and die.
data.anv: राम Rama, वयम् we, हताः खलु are destroyed, ये by, त्वयापि you also, उपवञ्चिताः deprived of, दुःखभागिनः full of sorrow, पापायाः sinful, कैकेय्याः Kaikeyi, वशम् under the control, एष्यामः caught up like that.
data.md: O Rāma, it is we, wretched that we are, that are undone, as we, deprived of your company, shall come under the sinful Kaikeyi expressing great misery.

data.v: इति ब्रुवन्नात्म समं सुमन्त्रः सारथिस्तदा । दृष्ट्वा दुर गतं रामं दुःखार्तो रुरुदे चिरम् ।।
data.es: Rama was like his (Sumantra's) own self. When Sumantra, the charioteer, saw that Rama was preparing to go afar for a long time, he started weeping aloud in deep distress.
data.anv: तदा then, सारथिः charioteer, सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, इति thus, ब्रुवन् saying, दूरगतम् gone afar, आत्मसमम् like his own self, रामम् Rama, दृष्ट्वा seeing, दुःखार्तः agonised, चिरम् long time, रुरुदे cried.
data.md: Having said this, the charioteer, Sumantra, seeing Rāma intent upon going to a distant land, wept for a long while in heaviness of heart.

data.v: ततस्तु विगते बाष्पे सूतं स्पृष्टोदकं शुचिम् । रामस्तु मधुरं वाक्यं पुनः पुनरुवाच तम् ।।
data.es: After the flow of tears ceased Sumantra took a sip of water and became sanctified. Then Rama addressed him with sweet words over and over again:
data.anv: ततः then, बाष्पे tears, विगते shedding, स्पृष्टोदकम् taking a sip of water, शुचिम् pure, तं सूतम् to that charioteer, रामस्तु Rama, पुनः पुनः again and again, मधुरम् sweet, वाक्यम् words, उवाच said.
data.md: Then when he had dried up his tears, and sanctified himself by touching the water of the Gangā, Rāma again addressed the charioteer in sweet words, saying.

data.v: इक्ष्वाकूणां त्वया तुल्यं सुहृदं नोपलक्षये । यथा दशरथो राजा मां न शोचेत्तथा कुरु ।।
data.es: I find none else like you as friendly as you are to the Ikshvaku race. So do whatever you like to see that king Dasaratha does not brood over me.
data.anv: इक्ष्वाकूणाम् of the Ikshvaku family, त्वया you, तुल्यम् like, सुहृदम् friend, नोपलक्षये do not see, राजा king, दशरथः Dasaratha, माम् me, यथा as, न शोचेत् not think, तथा like that, कुरु you do.
data.md: I do not find any one that is a friend of the sons of Ikşvāku like to you. Do you so act that king Dasaratha may not grieve (for me.)

data.v: शोकोपहत चेताश्च वृद्धश्च जगतीपतिः । काम भारावसन्नश्च तस्मादेतद्ब्रवीमि ते ।।
data.es: I tell you this because the lord of the earth (Dasaratha), is in deep distress. He is old. And he is under the control of his passion.
data.anv: जगतीपतिः lord of the world (Dasaratha), शोकोपहतचेताश्च consciousness overwhelmed with grief, वृद्धश्च and old also, कामभावावसन्नश्च full of passion, तस्मात् therefore, ते to you, एतत् all this, ब्रवीमि  I am telling.
data.md: The lord of earth has been deprived of his senses by grief, has grown old, and is oppressed by the weight of desires (thwarted.) Therefore it is that I tell you this.

data.v: यद्यदाज्ञापयेत्किंचित्स महात्मा महीपतिः । कैकेय्याः प्रियकामार्थं कार्यं तदविकाङ्क्षया ।।
data.es: To make Kaikeyi happy, do whatever little the great king Dasaratha orders you to do.
data.anv: महात्मा great, सः that, महीपतिः king Dasaratha, यद्यत् in that way, किञ्चित् a little, कैकेय्याः Kaikeyi, प्रियकामार्थम् to make happy, आज्ञापयेत् orders, तत् that, अविकाङ्क्षया all that, कार्यम् tasks be done.
data.md: Whatever that noble-minded lord of earth commands for the pleasure of Kaikeyi, should by us be done with alacrity.

data.v: एतदर्थं हि राज्यानि प्रशासति नरेश्वराः । यदेषां सर्वकृत्येषु मनो न प्रतिहन्यते ।।
data.es: The minds of kings create no hurdles in all that they want to do. That is why they rule kingdoms.
data.anv: एषाम् whatever, मनः in the mind, सर्वकृत्येषु to do all those, यत् न प्रतिहन्यते creater no obstacles, एतदर्थम् that is why, नरेश्वराः king, राज्यानि kingdom, प्रशासति हि rule.
data.md: It is for this that those lords of men, kings, govern, viz., that others may not thwart their purposes.)

data.v: तद्यथा स महाराजो नालीकमधिगच्छति । न च ताम्यति दुःखेन सुमन्त्र कुरु तत्तथा ।।
data.es: Sumantra do things exactly in the manner the great king desires so that he does not feel sad or disappointed.
data.anv: सुमन्त्र Sumantra, सः महाराजः that great king, यत् those tasks, यथा in whatever manner, अलीकम् sad, नाधिगच्छति not feel, दुःखेन in grief, न च ताम्यति not feel distressed, तत् those tasks, तथा in that way, कुरु do.
data.md: O Sumantra, do you act so, that the mighty monarch may not come across anything unpleasant, or be attacked with chagrin through grief.

data.v: अदृष्टदुःखं राजानं वृद्धमार्यं जितेन्द्रियम् । ब्रूयास्त्वमभिवाद्यैव मम हेतोरिदं वचः ।।
data.es: After offering your salutations, tell these words, on my behalf, to the king who is respectable, bent with age and who has conquered his senses and never experienced any sorrow before.
data.anv: अदृष्टदुःखम् one who has not experienced any sorrow, वृद्धम् old, आर्यम् respectable, जितेन्द्रियम् one who has conquered the senses, राजानम् to king, मम हेतोः on my behalf, अभिवाद्यैव offering respects, इदम् these, वचः words, त्वम् you, ब्रूयाः tell.
data.md: Do you saluting him for me say these words to the aged monarch who has his senses under complete control, and who has never seen misfortune before.

data.v: नैवाहमनुशोचामि लक्ष्मणो न च मैथिली । अयोध्यायाश्च्युताश्चेति वने वत्स्यामहेति वा ।।
data.es: I do not regret my banishment from Ayodhya to live in the forest. Neither Lakshmana nor Sita does.
data.anv: अयोध्यायाः from Ayodhya, च्युताश्चेति having been removed, वने in the forest, वत्स्यामहेति च have to dwell, अहम् we, नैव अनुशोचामि do not regret, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, मैथिली च and Sita also, न not.
data.md: Neither I nor Lakşmaņa grieve for being ejected out of Ayodhyā, or that we shall have to abide in the forest.

data.v: चतुर्दशसु वर्षेषु निवृत्तेषु पुनः पुनः । लक्ष्मणं मां च सीतां च द्रक्ष्यसि क्षिप्रमागतान् ।।
data.es: Very quickly these fourteen years will come to an end and we will return (to Ayodhya). Then you will see me, Lakshmana and Sita off and on.
data.anv: चतुर्दशसु fourteen, वर्षेषु years, निवृत्तेषु on completion, क्षिप्रम् quickly, आगतान् coming, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, मां च I also, सीतां च and Sita, पुनः पुनः again and again, द्रक्ष्यसे will keep seeing.
data.md: After these fourteen years have gone by, you will see Lakşmaņa, Sītā and myself come to you speedily.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा तु राजानं मातरं च सुमन्त्र मे । अन्याश्च देवीः सहिताः कैकेयीं च पुनः पुनः ।।
data.es: Having said this to the king, O Sumantra tell my mother, the other queens including Kaikeyi again and again about my wellbeing and the wellbeing of Lakshmana and Sita. Convey our respectful salutations at the feet of mother Kausalya.
data.anv: राजानम् to the king, एवम् all this, उक्तवा having told, सुमन्त्र Sumantra, मे मातरं च to my mother also, सहिताः with, अन्याः other, देवीश्च queens, कैकेयीं च Kaikeyi, पुनः पुनः again and again, आरोग्यम् wellbeing, ब्रूहि convey, अथ and, सीतायाः Sita's, मम च mine, आर्यस्य लक्ष्मणस्य च Lakshmana's also, पादाभिवन्दनम् prostection at the feet, कौशल्याम् Kausalya.
data.md: Having thus, O Sumantra, in my name again and again spoken to the king, to iny mother and to Kaikeyi along with the other revered ladies, do you communicate to Kausalyā our welfare conveying to her at the same time Şītā's and Lakşmana's salutations to her feet as well those of myself who am her eldest son.

data.v: आरोग्यं ब्रूहि कौसल्यामथ पादाभिवन्दनम् । सीताया मम चार्यस्य वचनाल्लक्ष्मणस्य च ।।
data.es: Having said this to the king, O Sumantra tell my mother, the other queens including Kaikeyi again and again about my wellbeing and the wellbeing of Lakshmana and Sita. Convey our respectful salutations at the feet of mother Kausalya.
data.anv: राजानम् to the king, एवम् all this, उक्तवा having told, सुमन्त्र Sumantra, मे मातरं च to my mother also, सहिताः with, अन्याः other, देवीश्च queens, कैकेयीं च Kaikeyi, पुनः पुनः again and again, आरोग्यम् wellbeing, ब्रूहि convey, अथ and, सीतायाः Sita's, मम च mine, आर्यस्य लक्ष्मणस्य च Lakshmana's also, पादाभिवन्दनम् prostection at the feet, कौशल्याम् Kausalya.
data.md: Having thus, O Sumantra, in my name again and again spoken to the king, to iny mother and to Kaikeyi along with the other revered ladies, do you communicate to Kausalyā our welfare conveying to her at the same time Şītā's and Lakşmana's salutations to her feet as well those of myself who am her eldest son.

data.v: ब्रूयाश्च हि महाराजं भरतं क्षिप्रमानय । आगतश्चापि भरतः स्थाप्यो नृपमते पदे ।।
data.es: Tell the king to send for Bharata quickly, and on his arrival, he be placed in the position of the king as per his own desire.
data.anv: महाराजं to the maharaja, is also, ब्रूयाः tell, भरतम् Bharata, क्षिप्रम् quickly, आनय send for, आगतश्चापि and on arrival, भरतः Bharata, नृपमते according to the king's desire, पदे king's position, स्थाप्यः be given.
data.md: Do you also tell the king, 'Do you speedily bring Bharata; and when Bharata has come, let him be the invested with royalty.

data.v: भरतं च परिष्वज्य यौवराज्येऽभिषिच्य च । अस्मत्संतापजं दुःखं न त्वामभिभविष्यति ।।
data.es: On embracing Bharata and making him the crownprince the sorrow due to our departure will not affect you.
data.anv: भरतम् Bharata, परिष्वज्य embracing, यौवराज्ये crown prince, अभिषिच्य च having coronated, अस्मत्संतापजम् arising out of our absence, दुःखम् sorrow, त्वाम् you, न अभिभविष्यति will not affect you.
data.md: When you have embraced Bharata and installed him in the kingdom, you no longer be overpowered with grief on our account.'

data.v: भरतश्चापि वक्तव्यो यथा राजनि वर्तसे । तथा मातृषु वर्तेथाः सर्वास्वेवाविशेषतः ।।
data.es: You should tell Bharata that just as he treats the king so should he treat all the mothers without differentiating betwen them.
data.anv: भरतश्चापि Bharata also, वक्तव्यः should be told, राजनि at the king, यथा just as, वर्तसे treats, सर्वास्वेव at all, मातृषु mothers, तथा likewise, अविशेषतः without differentiating, वर्तेथाः behave.
data.md: And tell Bharata, “As you bear yourself to the king so it behoves you to bear yourself to all your mothers, without making any distinction at hall. As Kaikeyi is unto you, so without distinction is Sumitrā.'

data.v: यथा च तव कैकेयी सुमित्रा चाविशेषतः । तथैव देवी कौसल्या मम माता विशेषतः ।।
data.anv: तव your, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, यथा च just as, सुमित्रा च Sumitra also, विशेषतः in a special manner, देवी Devi, sumitra विशेषतः specially, मम माता my mother, कौशल्या Kausalya, तथैव in the same way.
data.md: And tell Bharata, “As you bear yourself to the king so it behoves you to bear yourself to all your mothers, without making any distinction at hall. As Kaikeyi is unto you, so without distinction is Sumitrā.'

data.v: निवर्त्यमानो रामेण सुमन्त्रः शोककर्शितः । तत्सर्वं वचनं श्रुत्वा स्नेहात्काकुत्स्थमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: When Sumantra was asked by Rama to go back, he grew griefstricken. Having heard all that was said by the scion of the Kakutsthas, he replied:
data.anv: रामेण by Rama, निवर्त्यमानः sent back, सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, शोककर्शितः afflicted with grief, तत् then, सर्वम् all, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, स्नेहात् out of affection, काकुत्स्थम् Rama of Kakutstha race, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Told by Rāma to go back and instructed in this wise, Sumantra having heard everything, addressed Kākutstha from affection, saying.

data.v: यदहं नोपचारेण ब्रूयां स्नेहादविक्लवः । भक्तिमानिति तत्तावद्वाक्यं त्वं क्षन्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: I beg your pardon for what I have told you out of love. Accept it as the words of a devotee expressed without fear or formality.
data.anv: स्नेहात् out of love, अविक्लबः without fear, नोपचारेण informally, अहम् I am, यत् वाक्यम् these words, ब्रूयाम् telling, तत् then, भक्तिमान् इति like a devotee, त्वम् you, क्षन्तुम् to excuse, अर्हसि तावत् that.
data.md: It behoves you to forgive what I say plainly from affection, without letting myself by overwhelmed with emotion, and with due reverence for you. How can I, O child, without you return to that city, which seems as it afflicted with the grief incident to the loss of a son?

data.v: कथं हि त्वद्विहीनोऽहं प्रतियास्यामि तां पुरीम् । तव तात वियोगेन पुत्रशोकाकुलामिव ।।
data.es: Without you how can I go back to the city (of Ayodhya) which, separated from you, is grieving like a lady who has lost her son?
data.anv: अहम् I, त्वद्विहीनः leaving you, तव your, वियोगेन तावत् being separated from you, पुत्रशोकाकुलामिव like one who has lost her son, ताम् that, पुरीम् to the city (of Ayodhya), कथं हि how can I, प्रतियास्यामि return.
data.md: It behoves you to forgive what I say plainly from affection, without letting myself by overwhelmed with emotion, and with due reverence for you. How can I, O child, without you return to that city, which seems as it afflicted with the grief incident to the loss of a son?

data.v: सराममपि तावन्मे रथं दृष्ट्वा तदा जनः । विना रामं रथं दृष्ट्वा विदीर्येतापि सा पुरी ।।
data.es: The people who had seen Rama board the chariot will be brokenhearted to see it without him.
data.anv: तदा then, जनः people, सराममपि with Rama, मे रथम् my chariot, दृष्ट्वा seeing, तावत् then, विना रामम् without Rama, रथम् chariot, दृष्ट्वा seeing, सा पुरी (people of) that city, विदीर्येतापि will be brokenhearted.
data.md: Having then seen my car with Rāma on it, the hearts of the people and the palace will in all likelihood burst when they shall see it without Rāma. Surely the city will be distressed on beholding this empty car, like a host seeing car with its ro slain and the charioteer alone left in the field.

data.v: दैन्यं हि नगरी गच्छेद्दृष्ट्वा शून्यमिमं रथम् । सूतावशेषं स्वं सैन्यं हतवीरमिवाहवे ।।
data.es: Seeing the empty chariot the people of the city will look pitiable just like an army left only with the charioteer after its hero is killed in the war.
data.anv: शून्यम् empty, इमम् this, रथम् chariot, दृष्ट्वा seeing, आहवे हतवीरम् the hero killed in war, सूतावशेषम् with only the charioteer left, स्वम् they, सैन्यम् इव like the army, नगरी entering the city, दैन्यम् pitiable, गच्छेत् हि as will become.

data.v: दूरेऽपि निवसन्तं त्वां मानसेनाग्रतः स्थितम् । चिन्तयन्त्योऽद्य नूनं त्वां निराहाराः कृताः प्रजाः ।।
data.es: Although living at a distance, the subjects feel in their minds that you are just ahead of them. Today they will certainly go without food, brooding over you.
data.anv: प्रजाः people, अद्य today, दूरे at a distance, निवसन्तम् अपि although living, मानसेन in their minds, अग्रतः in front, स्थितम् staying, त्वाम् you, चिन्तयन्त्यः thinking, निराहाराः without food, कृताः done, नूनम् certainly.
data.md: Thinking in their minds that you although actually at a great distance from them, are before them, the subjects (not finding you) will renounce food (and thus destroy themselves.)

data.v: आर्तनादो हि यः पौरैर्मुक्तस्तद्विप्रवासने । रथस्थं मां निशाम्यैव कुर्युः शतगुणं ततः ।।
data.es: You have witnessed the cry of agony raised by the citizens at the time of your banishment. Now when they see the (empty) chariot, they will make it (raise their cry) a hundredfold.
data.anv: त्वद्विप्रवासने at the time of your banishment, पौरैः by citizens, यः how much of, आर्तनादः cry of agony, मुक्तः released (raised), सरथम् with chariot, माम् me, निशाम्यैव on seeing, ततः then, शतगुणम् a hundredfold, कुर्युः will make.
data.md: They will on seeing me with the car, burst out into lamentations exceeding a hundred times in bitterness those in which they indulged when you set out for the forest.

data.v: अहं किं चापि वक्ष्यामि देवीं तव सुतो मया । नीतोऽसौ मातुलकुलं संतापं मा कृथा इति ।।
data.es: What shall I say to Kausalya? Shall I say 'O venerable queen I have left your son at his maternal uncle's, hence don't grieve'.
data.anv: असौ Alas, सुतः son, मया myself, मातुलकुलम् to the maternal uncle's, नीतः took, सन्तापम् grief, मा कृथाः do not make, इति this, अहम् I, देवीम् Kausalya, वक्ष्यामि किं चापि what can I say?
data.md: Shall I say to the worshipful one, 'I have conveyed your son to the home of his maternal uncle. Do you not grieve.' I will never tell such a lie. Yet how can I speak this truth which is so very unpleasant?

data.v: असत्यमपि नैवाहं ब्रूयां वचनमीदृशम् । कथमप्रियमेवाहं ब्रूयां सत्यमिदं वचः ।।
data.es: How can I lie to her? How can I tell her the unpleasent truth?
data.anv: अहम् I, असत्यम् untrue, ईदृशम् like this, वचनमपि words too, नैव ब्रूयाम् not tell, अहम् I, अप्रियम् unpleasant, सत्यम् truth, इदं वचः such words, कथम् how can, ब्रूयाम् I speak.
data.md: Shall I say to the worshipful one, 'I have conveyed your son to the home of his maternal uncle. Do you not grieve.' I will never tell such a lie. Yet how can I speak this truth which is so very unpleasant?

data.v: मम तावन्नियोगस्थास्त्वद्बन्धुजनवाहिनः । कथं रथं त्वया हीनं प्रवक्ष्यन्ति हयोत्तमाः ।।
data.es: How can these excellent horses who used to carry you and your friends till now draw this chariot without you even though they are at my command?
data.anv: त्वद्बन्धुजनवाहिनः carrying your king, मम my, नियोगस्था under command, हयोत्तमाः excellent horses, त्वया हीनम् without you, रथम् chariot, कथम् how, प्रवक्ष्यन्ति will draw.
data.md: And ever abiding by my command and used to carry your friends, how can these excellent horses bear this car without you?

data.v: यदि मे याचमानस्य त्यागमेव करिष्यसि । सरथोऽग्निं प्रवेक्ष्यामि त्यक्त मात्र इह त्वया ।।
data.es: If you forsake me in spite of my request I shall immediately enter fire along with my chariot.
data.anv: याचमानस्य request, मे my, त्यागमेव forsaking, करिष्यसि यदि if you, त्वया by you, त्यक्तमात्रः immediately after being forsaken, इह here, सरथः with the chariot, अग्निम् into fire प्रवेक्ष्यामि I will enter.
data.md: But if you forsake me who beseech you, I will as soon as left by you, enter into fire along with the car.

data.v: भविष्यन्ति वने यानि तपोविघ्नकराणि ते । रथेन प्रतिबाधिष्ये तानि सत्त्वानि राघव ।।
data.es: With my chariot I shall retaliate and prevent all those animals in the forest causing obstacles to your austerities, O Rama
data.anv: राघव O Rama, वने in the forest, यानि all those, ते to you, तपोविघ्नकराणि causing obstacles to your austerity, भविष्यन्ति are expected, तानि सत्त्वानि all those animals, रथेन with my chariot, प्रतिबाधिष्ये will avert by retaliating.
data.md: I shall, O Rāghava, by means of this car, withstand all those impediments that shall present themselves against your ascetic austerities in the forest.

data.v: तत्कृतेन मया प्राप्तं रथ चर्या कृतं सुखम् । आशंसे त्वत्कृतेनाहं वनवासकृतं सुखम् ।।
data.es: By your grace I experienced the pleasure of driving your chariot, and by your grace, too, I am looking forward to deriving the pleasure of dwelling in the forest.
data.anv: त्वत्कृतेन by your grace, मया by me, रथचर्याकृतम् by driving the chariot, सुखम् pleasure, अवाप्तम् is experienced, त्वत्कृते न by your favour, अहम् I, वनवासकृतम् dwelling in the forest, सुखम् pleasure, आशंसे I am looking forward.
data.md: I have through your favour experienced the pleasure of driving the car. I expect at your hands the pleasure of living in the woods.

data.v: प्रसीदेच्छामि तेऽरण्ये भवितुं प्रत्यनन्तरः । प्रीत्याभिहितमिच्छामि भव मे पत्यनन्तरः ।।
data.es: Be pleased. I wish to stay with you in the forest I long to hear from you these favourable words, 'Stay with me'.
data.anv: प्रसीद be pleased, आरण्ये in the forest, ते to you, प्रत्यनन्तरः very close, भवितुम् to become, इच्छामि desirng, मे to me, प्रत्यनन्तरः be favourable (close), भव to me, प्रीत्या affectionately, अभिहितम् to be told,  इच्छामि wish.
data.md: Be you propitious. It is my wish to remain in the forest with you, and do you say, affectionately, 'Do you remain by my side.'

data.v: तव शुश्रूषणं मूर्ध्ना करिष्यामि वने वसन् । अयोध्यां देवलोकं वा सर्वथा प्रजहाम्यहम् ।।
data.es: As I dwell in the forest, I shall serve you with my head bowed. For this I may altogether relinquish Ayodhya or even heaven.
data.anv: वने in the forest, वसन् while dwelling, मूर्ध्ना with my head, तव your, शुश्रूषणम् service, करिष्यामि will render, अयोध्याम् to Ayodhya, देवलोकं वा or the world of the gods, अहम् I, सर्वथा altogether, प्रजहामि relinquish.
data.md: Living in the forest, I will serve you with the crown of my head; and I will entirely renounce Ayodhyā or the celestial regions themselves.

data.v: न हि शक्या प्रवेष्टुं सा मयायोध्या त्वया विना । राजधानी महेन्द्रस्य यथा दुष्कृतकर्मणा ।।
data.es: Just as a sinner cannot enter the capital of Indra (heaven), it is impossible for me to enter Ayodhya without you.
data.anv: त्वया विना without you, मया by me, दुष्कृतकर्मणा by the wicked, महेन्द्रस्य Indra's, राजधानी यथा like the capital, सा अयोध्या that Ayodhya, प्रवेष्टुम् to enter, न हि शक्या not possible.
data.md: Even as a doer of evil deeds cannot enter the metropolis of the mighty Indra, I am incapable of entering Ayodhyā without you.

data.v: इमे चापि हया वीर यदि ते वनवासिनः । परिचर्यां करिष्यन्ति प्राप्स्यन्ति परमां गतिम् ।।
data.es: O valiant one, if these horses too could render services to you while you dwell in the forest, they would attain the supreme state.
data.anv: वीर O valiant one, इमे these, हयश्चापि horses also, वनवासिनः dwelling in the forest, ते to you, परिचर्याम् service, करिष्यन्ति if they do, यदि if so, परमाम् supreme, गतिम् state, प्राप्स्यन्ति will attain.
data.md: And these horses, O hero, will attain to a supreme state if your serve you during your abode in the forest.

data.v: वनवासे क्षयं प्राप्ते ममैष हि मनोरथः । यदनेन रथेनैव त्वां वहेयं पुरीं पुनः ।।
data.es: It is my cherished desire to take you after the completion of your exile, back to the city (Ayodhya) in this chariot alone.
data.anv: मम myself, एषः हि this alone, मनोरथः cherished desire, यत् that, वनवासे in the forest, क्षयम् completion, प्राप्ते gaining, अनेन by this, रथेनैव chariot alone, त्वाम् you, पुनः again, पुरीम् to the city (Ayodhya), वहेयम् shall take.
data.md: This is my desire that the term of exile over, I may carry you back to the palace on this very car.

data.v: चतुर्दश हि वर्षाणि सहितस्य त्वया वने । क्षणभूतानि यास्यन्ति शतशस्तु ततोऽन्यथा ।।
data.es: You have been directed by Kaikeyi to live in the forest for fourteen years. Accordingly you must now commence counting those years as directed.
data.anv: वने in the forest, त्वया with you, सहितस्य accompanied, चतुर्दश वर्षाणि fourteen years, क्षणभूतानि like a moment, यास्यन्ति will pass, अत: more than this, अन्यथा in any other way,  शतसङ्ख्यानि (will seem like) a hundred years.
data.md: Remaining with you in the forest the fourteen years will pass away dwindled into a moment, but without you, they shall the proportions of an hundred years. assume

data.v: भृत्यवत्सल तिष्ठन्तं भर्तृपुत्रगते पथि । भक्तं भृत्यं स्थितं स्थित्यां त्वं न मां हातुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: O Rama you are affectionate towards your servants. I abide in the path followed by you, my master's son. I am your devoted servant. It does not behove you to forsake me who is faithful.
data.anv: भृत्यवत्सल one who is affectionate towards the servants, भर्तृपुत्र master's son, पथि on the path, तिष्ठन्तम् standing, भक्तम् devotee, भृत्यम् servant, स्थित्याम् on duty, स्थितम् fixed, माम् me, त्वम् you, हातुम् to forsake न अर्हसि does not behove.
data.md: O you bearing affection towards your servants, it does not behove you to forsake your servant having regard for you, ever abiding by the way that is wended by the son of his master, and observing the duties of his position.

data.v: एवं बहुविधं दीनं याचमानं पुनः पुनः । रामो भृत्यानुकम्पी तु सुमन्त्रमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Repeatedly implored in various ways by the miserable Sumantra, Rama who is compassionate to his servants replied:
data.anv: भृत्यानुकम्पी compassionate towards servants, रामः Rama, एवम् in this way, बहुविधम् in many ways, पुनः पुनः again and again, याचमानम् requesting, दीनम् miserable, सुमन्त्रम् to Sumantra, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Thereupon Rāma kind towards servants, said these words to Sumantra as he besought him thus humbly in various ways, O you that bear attachment to your master, I know that you regard me highly. But do you listen as to why I send you to the city from hence.

data.v: जानामि परमां भक्तिं मयि ते भर्तृवत्सल । शृणु चापि यदर्थं त्वां प्रेषयामि पुरीमितः ।।
data.es: O Sumantra, listen I know your deep devotion to me (I also know) you are loyal to your master (Dasaratha). So I am sending you to the city (Ayodhya) from here.
data.anv: भर्तृवत्सल one loyal to the master, ते your, मयि in me, परमाम् supreme, भक्तिम् devotion, जानामि I know, इतः from here, त्वम् you, यदर्थम् for the reason, पुरीम् to Ayodhya, प्रेषयामि I am sending, शृणु चापि please listen.
data.md: Thereupon Rāma kind towards servants, said these words to Sumantra as he besought him thus humbly in various ways, O you that bear attachment to your master, I know that you regard me highly. But do you listen as to why I send you to the city from hence.

data.v: नगरीं त्वां गतं दृष्ट्वा जननी मे यवीयसी । कैकेयी प्रत्ययं गच्छेदिति रामो वनं गतः ।।
data.es: When my younger mother Kaikeyi sees that you have returned to Ayodhya, she will believe that Rama has really gone to the forest.
data.anv: नगरीम् to the city of Ayodhya, गतम् gone, त्वाम् you, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, मे my, यवीयसी younger, जननी mother, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, रामः Rama, वनम् to the forest, गतः had gone, इति thus, प्रत्ययम् conviction, गच्छेत् will have.
data.md: Seeing you returned to the city, my youngest mother Kaikeyi will believe that Rāma has gone to the woods.

data.v: परितुष्टा हि सा देवि वनवासं गते मयि । राजानं नातिशङ्केत मिथ्यावादीति धार्मिकम् ।।
data.es: If queen Kaikeyi is fully satisfied that I have gone to dwell in the forest, she will no longer have any doubt and will believe that righteous king Dasaratha is not a liar.
data.anv: मयि when I, वनवासम् dwell in the forest, गते having gone, सा देवी that queen, परितुष्टा completely satisfied, धार्मिकम् righteous, राजानम् about king Dasaratha, 'मिथ्यावादी'ति   claimed to be a liar, नातिशङ्केत not have any doubt.
data.md: Then well pleased on my having repaired to the woods, she will not entertain any apprehension anent the righteous monarch, thinking that he is intruthful.

data.v: एष मे प्रथमः कल्पो यदम्बा मे यवीयसी । भरतारक्षितं स्फीतं पुत्रराज्यमवाप्नुयात् ।।
data.es: My prime resolve is that my younger mother should enjoy this prosperous and vast kingdom ruled by her son Bharata.
data.anv: एषः this is, मे my, प्रथमः prime, कल्पः resolve, यत् that, मे my, यवीयसी younger, अम्बा mother, भरतारक्षितम् ruled by Bharata, स्फीतम् prosperous, पुत्रराज्यम् son's kingdom, अवाप्नुयात् will receive.
data.md: This is my first wish that my youngest mother may obtain her son's kingdom, prosperous and well protected by Bharata.

data.v: मम प्रियार्थं राज्ञश्च सरथस्त्वं पुरीं व्रज । संदिष्टश्चासि यानर्थांस्तांस्तान्ब्रूयास्तथातथा ।।
data.es: Sumantra, return to the city with the chariot for my pleasure and also for the pleasure of the king and convey to each of the persons concerned the message exactly as instructed.
data.anv: त्वम् you, सरथः along with the chariot, मम my, राज्ञश्च king's, प्रियार्थम् for the sake of (my) pleasure, पुरीम् to the city (Ayodhya), व्रज return, यान् अर्थान् those messages intended for every one, सन्दिष्टः असि you have been advised, तान्तान् all such, तथा तथा in the same way, ब्रूयाः please tell.
data.md: Do you, O Sumantra, bear yourself to the palace to compass the end of both the king and myself, and do you communicate in the desired way what I have said to the respective parties.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा वचनं सूतं सान्त्वयित्वा पुनः पुनः । गुहं वचनमक्लीबं रामो हेतुमदब्रवीत् । जटाः कृत्वा गमिष्यामि न्यग्रोधक्षीरमानय ।।
data.es: Having spoken to the charioteer and consoling him again and again, indefatigable Rama spoke to Guha words full of reasoning:
data.anv: अक्लीबः indefatigable, रामः Rama, सूतम् to the charioteer, इति thus, वचनम् words, उक्त्वा having said, पुनः पुनः again and again, सान्त्वयित्वा after consoling, गुहम् to Guha, हेतुमत् reasonable, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Having said this to the charioteer and consoled him again and again, the energetic Rāma spoke to Guha the following words fraught with reason.

data.v: तत्क्षीरं राजपुत्राय गुहः क्षिप्रमुपाहरत् । लक्ष्मणस्यात्मनश्चैव रामस्तेनाकरोज्जटाः ।।
data.es: Guha fetched the latex quickly and gave it to the prince (Rama) and with that Rama matted his own hair and Lakshmana's.
data.anv: गुहः Guha, क्षिप्रम् quickly, राजपुत्राय for the prince (Rama), तत् that, क्षीरम् milk, उपाहरत् brought  , रामः Rama, तेन with that, लक्ष्मणस्य for Lakshmana, आत्मनश्चैव of his own, जटाः matted locks of hair, अकरोत् made.

data.v: तौ तदा चीरवसनौ जटामण्डलधारिणौ । अशोभेतामृषिसमौ भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ ।।
data.es: The longarmed Rama, the best of men, put on locks of matted hair. As the two brothers, Rama and Lakshmana stood dressed in bark wearing crowns of matted hair, they resembled two resplendent ascetics.
data.anv: दीर्घबाहुः longarmed, नरव्याघ्रः tiger (best) among men, जटिलत्वम् their hair twisted and matted,  अधारयत् put on, तदा then, चीरवसनौ wearing the robes (of bark), जटामण्डलधारिणौ wearing crown of matted locks, भ्रातरौ brothers, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, ऋषिसमौ resembling sages, अशोभेताम् shone.

data.v: ततो वैखानसं मार्गमास्थितः सहलक्ष्मणः । व्रतमादिष्टवान्रामः सहायं गुहमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having adopted the path of ascetics along with Lakshmana, Rama said to his friend Guha:
data.anv: ततः thereafter, सहलक्ष्मणः along with Lakshmana, वैखानसम् relating to sages, मार्गम् the path, आस्थितः having resorted to, रामः Rama, व्रतम् religious vow, आदिष्टवान् having accepted, सखायम् his friend, गुहम् to Guha, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Then entering upon the Vānaprastha mode of life, Rāma along with Lakşmaņa assuming the vow of that life, observed to that adherent of his, Guha.

data.v: अप्रमत्तो बले कोशे दुर्गे जनपदे तथा । भवेथा गुह राज्यं हि दुरारक्षतमं मतम् ।।
data.es: O Guha you must be vigilant about your army, treasury, forts and provinces. A kingdom, it is (rightly) said, is protected with great difficulty.
data.anv: गुह Guha, बले in the army, कोशे in the treasury, दुर्गे in the fort, तथा similarly, जनपदे in the provinces, अप्रमत्तः alert, भवेथाः you shall be, राज्यम् kingdom, दुरारक्षतमम् with great difficulty, मतं हि it is said.
data.md: Do you, my friend, vigilantly protect the army, the exchequer, the fort and the provinces; for a kingdom demands all the exertions (of the king thereof).

data.v: ततस्तं समनुज्ञाय गुहमिक्ष्वाकुनन्दनः । जगाम तूर्णमव्यग्रः सभार्यः सहलक्ष्मणः ।।
data.es: Rama, delight of the Ikshvakus, along with his consort and Lakshmana reached that beautiful tree and alighted from the chariot.
data.anv: ततः then after, इक्ष्वाकुनन्दनः Delight of (also son of) the Iksvakus (Rama), तं गुहम् to that Guha, समनुज्ञाय after permitting him to leave, अव्यग्रः peacefully, सभार्यः with his consort, सहलक्ष्मणः with Lakshmana, तूर्णम् swiftly, जगाम went.
data.md: Then taking the permission of Guha, the descendant of Ikşvāku, holding his soul in calmness, set out with his wife and Lakşmaņa.

data.v: स तु दृष्ट्वा नदीतीरे नावमिक्ष्वाकुनन्दनः । तितीर्षुः शीघ्रगां गङ्गामिदं लक्ष्मणमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Seeing the boat on the river bank and intending to cross the swiftly flowing Ganga, Rama, descendant of the Iksvakus said to Lakshmana:
data.anv: सः इक्ष्वाकुनन्दनः Rama, descendant of the Ikshvakus, नदीतीरे on the bank of the river, नावम् boat, दृष्ट्वा having seen, शीघ्रगाम् swiftly flowing, गङ्गाम् Ganga, तितीर्षुः intending to cross, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Seeing a boat at the river-side, that son of Ikşvāku desirous of crossing the swift-coursing Garigā, spoke these words.

data.v: आरोह त्वं नर व्याघ्र स्थितां नावमिमां शनैः । सीतां चारोपयान्वक्षं परिगृह्य मनस्विनीम् ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana, the best of men the boat stands ready, get into it slowly (carefully), and then help the noble Sita board it by holding the beam (which balances the boat).
data.anv: नरव्याघ्रः (best) among men (Lakshmana), त्वम् you, स्थितम् standing, इमाम् this, नावम् boat, शनैः slowly, आरोह board, अन्वक्षम् along with the beam, मनस्विनीम् highminded, सीतां च Sita also, परिगृह्य holding her, आरोपय help her to get in.
data.md: Do you ascend, gently, O foremost of men, the boat that stay here, after the making the virtuous Sītā ascend by taking her by the hand.

data.v: स भ्रातुः शासनं श्रुत्वा सर्वमप्रतिकूलयन् । आरोप्य मैथिलीं पूर्वमारुरोहात्मवांस्ततः ।।
data.es: Having heard his brother's command the selfcontrolled Lakshmana did as he was told.He first helped Sita get into the boat and thereafter boarded it himself.
data.anv: आत्मवान् selfcontrolled, सः that Lakshmana, भ्रातुः brother, शासनम् command, श्रुत्वा on hearing, सर्वम् all, अप्रतिकूलयन् without acting contrarily, पूर्वम् first, मैथिलीम् Sita, आरोप्य having helped her board, ततः thereafter, आरुरोह got in
data.md: Hearing his brother's command, that strongwilled one, furthering everything, having made Mithila's daughter ascend, ascended himself.

data.v: अथारुरोह तेजस्वी स्वयं लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः । ततो निषादाधिपतिर्गुहो ज्ञातीनचोदयत् ।।
data.es: With the boat boarded by the glorious Rama, Lakshmana's elder brother, Guha, king of the nishadas urged his kinsmen (to row the boat).
