data.anv: अथ then after, तेजस्वी glorious, लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः Lakshmana's elder brother, स्वयम् himself, आरुरोह boarded, निषादाधिपतिः king of nishadas, गुहः Guha, ज्ञातीन् kinsmen, आचोदयत् unged (to row the boat).
data.md: That energetic elder brother of Lakşmaņa next ascended himself. Then the lord of the Nişadas, Guha, incited his kinsfolk.

data.v: अनुज्ञाय सुमन्त्रं च सबलं चैव तं गुहम् । आस्थाय नावं रामस्तु चोदयामास नाविकान् ।।
data.es: Having permitted Sumantra and Guha with his army to leave, Rama seated on the boat urged the boatmen to proceed.
data.anv: रामस्तु as for Rama, सुमन्त्रम् Sumantra, सबलम् along with his army, तं गुहम् to that Guha, अनुज्ञाय permitting (to leave), नावम् boat, आस्थाय having seated, नाविकान् boatmen, चोदयामास directed to proceed.
data.md: Then telling Sumantra, Guha, and the forces, Rāma ascending the boat, ordered the boatmen (to proceed).

data.v: ततस्तैश्चोदिता सा नौः कर्णधारसमाहिता । शुभस्फ्यवेगाभिहता शीघ्रं सलिलमत्यगात् ।।
data.es: The wellruddered boat rowed by the helmsmen and propelled by strong oars, swiftly crossed the waters of the river.
data.anv: ततः then, कर्णधारसमाहिता wellruddered by the helmsmen, सा नौः that boat, तैः by them, चोदिता rowed, शुभस्फ्यवेगाभिहता propelled by the speed of strong oars, शीघ्रम् swiftly, सलिलम् waters, अत्यगात् crossed.
data.md: Then the boat decked out by the heimsman, moved by them, and urged on by the pulls of the goodly roars, proceeded apace in the water.

data.v: मध्यं तु समनुप्राप्य भागीरथ्यास्त्वनिन्दिता । वैदेही प्राञ्जलिर्भूत्वा तां नदीमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: When the boat reached the midstream that unblemished Sita with palms folded invoked the river thus:
data.anv: अनिन्दिता blameless, वैदेही Sita, भागीरथ्याः river Bhagheerathi's, मध्यम् middle, समनुप्राप्य having reached, प्राञ्जलिः भूत्वा with folded palms, तां नदीम् to that river, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् uttered.
data.md: Having arrived at the middle of the Bhagirathi, that blameless one, Vaidehi, with joined hands, addressed the river, saying.

data.v: पुत्रो दशरथस्यायं महाराजस्य धीमतः । निदेशं पालयत्वेनं गङ्गे त्वदभिरक्षितः ।।
data.md: O Ganga, protected by you, may the son of the intelligent and mighty monarch, Dasaratha, execute the mandate (of the latter.)

data.v: चतुर्दश हि वर्षाणि समग्राण्युष्य कानने । भ्रात्रा सह मया चैव पुनः प्रत्यागमिष्यति ।।
data.md: Having spent complete fourteen years in the forest, he will return in company with his brother and myself.

data.v: ततस्त्वां देवि सुभगे क्षेमेण पुनरागता । यक्ष्ये प्रमुदिता गङ्गे सर्वकामसमृद्धये ।।
data.md: Then, O worshipful one, O you of auspicious fortune, having returned safely, I will, O Gangā, worship you, you that crown every desire.

data.v: त्वं हि त्रिपथगा देवि ब्रह्म लोकं समीक्षसे । भार्या चोदधिराजस्य लोकेऽस्मिन्संप्रदृश्यसे ।।
data.es: O Devi, you are Tripathaga, flowing in three directions (worlds). You behold the region of Brahma and happen to be the spouse of the king of the ocean in this world (of mortals).
data.anv: देवि O Devi, त्रिपथगा one flowing in the three worlds, त्वम् you, ब्रह्मलोकम् the region of Brahma, the creator, समीक्षसे हि are seeing, अस्मिन् in this, लोके world, उदधिराजस्य king of the ocean, भार्या च are a spouse, संप्रदृश्यसे appear (to mortals).
data.md: O you that wend in three ways, O revered one, you envelope the regions of Brahma. You appear in this world as the spouse of the Ocean-king.

data.v: सा त्वां देवि नमस्यामि प्रशंसामि च शोभने । प्राप्त राज्ये नरव्याघ्र शिवेन पुनरागते ।।
data.es: O Devi O lovely Ganga I offer you my obeisance and my adorations. After the safe return of Rama, the tiger (best) among men, from the forest and after he regains the kingdom I shall give a hundred thousand cows, clothing and delicious food to brahmins as a mark of regard, which will please you.
data.anv: देवि O Devi, शोभने O lovely one, सा that me, त्वाम् you, नमस्यामि pay homage, प्रशंसामि च adore, शिवेन safely, पुनः again, आगते on return, नरव्याघ्रे (best) among men, प्राप्तराज्ये having regained the kingdom, तव to you, प्रियचिकीर्षया to with the intention of pleasing, गवाम् of cows, शतसहस्राणि one hundred thousand, वस्त्राणि clothes, पेशलम् very delicious, अन्नं च food also, ब्राह्मणेभ्यः to brahmins, प्रदास्यामि will give.
data.md: I will, O respected one, bow down to you, O beauteous one, I will hymn you, when, with good fortune returned, the foremost of men has obtained the kingdom, I will to please you give away to Brāhmaṇas hundreds and thousands of kine, cloths, sapid rice, and vessels of wine by thousands, and pillaos.

data.v: गवां शतसहस्राणि वस्त्राण्यन्नं च पेशलम् । ब्राह्मणेभ्यः प्रदास्यामि तव प्रियचिकीर्षया ।।
data.es: O Devi O lovely Ganga I offer you my obeisance and my adorations. After the safe return of Rama, the tiger (best) among men, from the forest and after he regains the kingdom I shall give a hundred thousand cows, clothing and delicious food to brahmins as a mark of regard, which will please you.
data.anv: देवि O Devi, शोभने O lovely one, सा that me, त्वाम् you, नमस्यामि pay homage, प्रशंसामि च adore, शिवेन safely, पुनः again, आगते on return, नरव्याघ्रे (best) among men, प्राप्तराज्ये having regained the kingdom, तव to you, प्रियचिकीर्षया to with the intention of pleasing, गवाम् of cows, शतसहस्राणि one hundred thousand, वस्त्राणि clothes, पेशलम् very delicious, अन्नं च food also, ब्राह्मणेभ्यः to brahmins, प्रदास्यामि will give.
data.md: I will, O respected one, bow down to you, O beauteous one, I will hymn you, when, with good fortune returned, the foremost of men has obtained the kingdom, I will to please you give away to Brāhmaṇas hundreds and thousands of kine, cloths, sapid rice, and vessels of wine by thousands, and pillaos.

data.v: तथा संभाषमाणा सा सीता गङ्गामनिन्दिता । दक्षिणा दक्षिणं तीरं क्षिप्रमेवाभ्युपागमत् ।।
data.es: While the unblemished, auspicious Sita was thus addressing (the river), the boat swiftly reached the south bank.
data.anv: अनिन्दिता blameless, दक्षिणा auspicious, सा सीता that sita, तथा thus, सम्भाषमाणा addressing, क्षिप्रमेव quickly, दक्षिणम् southern, तीरम् side, अभ्युपागमत् reached.
data.md: Having thus addressed the Gangā, that blameless one ever obedient to her husband, swiftly went to the south bank (of the river).

data.v: तीरं तु समनुप्राप्य नावं हित्वा नरर्षभः । प्रातिष्ठत सह भ्रात्रा वैदेह्या च परंतपः ।।
data.es: Rama, the best of men and tormentor of enemies, after reaching the other side of the river, left the boat and proceeded with Sita and his brother.
data.anv: नरर्षभः the best of men, परन्तपः tormentor of enemies, तीरम् bank, समनुप्राप्य having reached, नावम् the boat, हित्वा leaving, भ्रात्रा सह with his brother, वैदेह्या च and Sita, प्रातिष्ठत proceeded forward.
data.md: Going to the (other) bank of the stream, that best of men, and subduer of foes stood along with his brother and Vaidehī.

data.v: अथाब्रवीन्महाबाहुः सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनम् । अग्रतो गच्छ सौमित्रे सीता त्वामनुगच्छतु ।।
data.es: The longarmed Rama then said to Lakshmana, enhancer of the joy of Sumitra: Whether in populated areas or in solitary places, excercise alacrity in the matter of protection.
data.anv: अथ then, महाबाहुः one with long arms, सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनम् to Lakshmana, enhancer of the joy of Sumitra, अब्रवीत् said, सजने in populated areas, विजनेऽपि वा or in solitary places, संरक्षणार्थाय for protection, भव be ready.

data.v: पृष्ठतोऽहं गमिष्यामि त्वां च सीतां च पालयन् । अद्य दुःखं तु वैदेही वनवासस्य वेत्स्यति ।।
data.es: O best of men, I will follow you and Sita and keep watch. We must ensure mutual protection.
data.anv: अहम् I, त्वां च you also, सीतां च also Sita ,पालयन् protecting, पृष्ठतः behind, गमिष्यामि I will keep walking, पुरुषर्षभ best of men, इह here, न: for us, अन्योन्यस्य mutually, रक्षा protection, कर्तव्या fit to be done.

data.v: गतं तु गङ्गापरपारमाशु; रामं सुमन्त्रः प्रततं निरीक्ष्य । अध्वप्रकर्षाद्विनिवृत्तदृष्टि;र्मुमोच बाष्पं व्यथितस्तपस्वी ।।
data.es: The wretched Sumantra kept gazing at Rama who swiftly reached the other side of the Ganga and only when he could not see him because of long distance, he turned away his gaze and, overcome with grief, shed tears.
data.anv: तपस्वी the miserable, सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, आशु swiftly, गङ्गापरपारम् other side of Ganga, गतम् reached, रामम् of Rama, प्रततम् continuously, निरीक्ष्य having gazed, अध्वप्रकर्षात् due to long distance, विनिवृत्तदृष्टिः turning away his sight, व्यथितः distressed, बाष्पम् मुमोच shed tears.
data.md: On Rāma having speedily crossed the Gangā, the distressed Sumantra who had been gazing at him steadfastly, being no longer able to discern him, turned away his eyes and, overcome with grief, shed tears.

data.v: तौ तत्र हत्वा चतुरो महामृगा;न्वराहमृश्यं पृषतं महारुरुम् । आदाय मेध्यं त्वरितं बुभुक्षितौ; वासाय काले ययतुर्वनस्पतिम् ।।
data.es: Famished, they (Rama and Lakshmana) killed a boar, a rishya (whitefooted male antelope), a spotted deer and a great deer with black stripes. They partook the meat and reached a tree by evening where they rested for the night.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे द्विपञ्चाश स्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftysecond sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: बुभुक्षितौ famished, तौ they, तत्र there, वराहम् a boar, ऋश्यम् a whitefooted male antelope, पृषतम् spotted deer, महारुरुम् a great deer with black stripes, चतुरः four, मृगान् animals, हत्वा killed, मेध्यम् pure meat, त्वरितम् quickly, आदाय partaking as food, काले in the evening, वासाय for rest, वनस्पतिम् under a tree, ययतुः reached.
data.md: And then the two (brothers) having slain the four kinds of beasts, viz., boars, rsyas, prsatas and maharurus,* and taking their flesh, in the evening took refuge under a mighty tree, feeling the demands of appetite. *Varieties of deer.

data.v: स तं वृक्षं समासाद्य संध्यामन्वास्य पश्चिमाम् । रामो रमयतां श्रेष्ठ इति होवाच लक्ष्मणम् ।।
data.es: On reaching the foot of the tree, Rama offered oblations to Sandhya of the west. And then he who is the best in keeping people in good humour said to Lakshmana:
data.anv: रमयताम् among those who bring delight to others, श्रेष्ठः best, सः रामः that Rama, तं वृक्षम् to that tree, समासाद्य having reached, पश्चिमाम् western, सन्ध्याम् sandhya, अन्वास्य having offered oblations, लक्ष्मणम् looking at Lakshmana, इति these words, उवाच ह spoke.
data.md: Having taken refuge under the tree and performed his evening devotions, that foremost of those capable of charming others. Rāma, addressed Laksmana, saying.

data.v: अद्येयं प्रथमा रात्रिर्याता जनपदाद्बहिः । या सुमन्त्रेण रहिता तां नोत्कण्ठितुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: We will have to spend this first night without Sumantra and away from human habitation. (Yet) you need not worry.
data.anv: अद्य today, सुमन्त्रेण Sumantra, रहिता without, या इयम् this, प्रथमा रात्रिः first night, जनपदात्   away from human habitation, बहिः outside, याता will be spent, ताम् about that night, उत्कण्ठितुम् to feel anxiety, नार्हसि does not behove.
data.md: To day is the first night (which we must spend) outside the inhabited tracts without the company of Sumantra.. You ought not to suffer your mind to be uneasy on that score.

data.v: जागर्तव्यमतन्द्रिभ्यामद्य प्रभृति रात्रिषु । योगक्षेमो हि सीताया वर्तते लक्ष्मणावयोः ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana, from now on we must be sleeplessly vigilant at night. The welfare and safety of Sita depend on us both.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, अद्य प्रभृति from now on, रात्रिषु during the nights, अतन्द्रिभ्याम्  sleeplessly, जागर्तव्यम् keep awake, सीतायाः Sita's, योगक्षेमौ acquisition and protection, अवयोः on both of us, वर्ते हि depends.
data.md: From to night forth, we shall have to guard her vigilantly, for, O Laksmana, the preservation of what she has as well as the securing to her of what she has not, rests with us.

data.v: रात्रिं कथंचिदेवेमां सौमित्रे वर्तयामहे । उपावर्तामहे भूमावास्तीर्य स्वयमार्जितैः ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana, we will have to somehow pass this night, sleeping on the ground spread with whatever we have procured.
data.anv: सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, इमां रात्रिम् this night, कथञ्चिदेव somehow, वर्तयामहे pass, स्वयम् by ourselves, आर्जितैः procured, भूमौ on the ground, आस्तीर्य spread with, उपावर्तामहे we will lie down.
data.md: We will, O son of Sumitrā, anyhow pass the night; let us ourselves procuring (leaves) and spreading them on the ground, anyhow lie down on it.

data.v: स तु संविश्य मेदिन्यां महार्हशयनोचितः । इमाः सौमित्रये रामो व्याजहार कथाः शुभाः ।।
data.es: Rama who deserved a luxurious bed lay down on the ground and uttered these beneficial words to Lakshamana:
data.anv: महार्हशयनोचितः fit to rest on luxurious bed, सः Rama, मेदिन्याम् on the ground, संविश्य lying down, सौमित्रये to Lakshmana, शुभाः beneficial, इमाः कथाः these words, व्याजहार uttered.
data.md: Saying this, Rāma lying down on the ground although worthy of a costly bed, spoke these excellent words to Sumitrā's son.

data.v: ध्रुवमद्य महाराजो दुःखं स्वपिति लक्ष्मण । कृतकामा तु कैकेयी तुष्टा भवितुमर्हति ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana, the maharaja must be having a painful sleep tonight. But Kaikeyi with her desires fulfilled, ought to feel satisfied.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, अद्य at this time, महाराजः the great king, ध्रुवम् surely, दुःखम् with difficulty, स्वपिति sleeps, कृतकामा with the desires fulfilled, कैकेयी तु however Kaikeyi, तुष्टा satisfed, भवितुम् अर्हति should become.
data.md: O Lakşmaņa, surely the king sleeps uneasily to day, and Kaikeyi having attained her end ought to be satisfied.

data.v: सा हि देवी महाराजं कैकेयी राज्यकारणात् । अपि न च्यावयेत्प्राणान्दृष्ट्वा भरतमागतम् ।।
data.es: After the arrival of Bharata, I hope queen Kaikeyi does not deprive the king of his life for the sake of the kingdom?
data.anv: सा that, देवी queen, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, आगतम् arrived, भरतम् Bharata, दृष्ट्वा having seen, राज्यकारणात् for the sake of kingdom, महाराजम् king, प्राणान् life, न च्यावयेदपि will not deprive  of.
data.md: Will not that revered lady, for the purpose of having Bharata established in the kingdom, take the king's life, when she shall see Bharata arrived?

data.v: अनाथश्चैव वृद्धश्च मया चैव विनाकृतः । किं करिष्यति कामात्मा कैकेय्या वशमागतः ।।
data.es: That lustful king, having come under the hold of Kaikeyi, has been deprived of my presence. What can that forlorn and aged king do?
data.anv: अनाथश्च forlorn, वृद्धश्च aged, मया by me, विना च कृतः separated, कामात्मा that lustful one, कैकेयीवशम् under the influence of Kaikeyi, आगतः having come, किं what, करिष्यति can he   do?
data.md: Forlorn and old and deprived of me. I do not know what he will do, his soul possessed by desire, and having come under the influence of Kaikeyi.

data.v: इदं व्यसनमालोक्य राज्ञश्च मतिविभ्रमम् । काम एवार्धधर्माभ्यां गरीयानिति मे मतिः ।।
data.es: Reflecting on the calamity and mental aberration of the king, I think passion is stronger than wealth and righteousness.
data.anv: इदम् this, व्यसनम् calamity, राज्ञः king's, मतिविभ्रमं च mind's aberration, आलोक्य having seen, अर्थधर्माभ्याम् between wealth (artha) and righteousness (dharma), काम एव passion only, गरीयान् is stronger, इति thus, मे मतिः is my thinking.
data.md: Viewing this calamity that has overtaken us) and the disorder that has taken place in the senses of the monarch, I deem even lust as more potent than either virtue or interest.

data.v: को ह्यविद्वानपि पुमान्प्रमदायाः कृते त्यजेत् । छन्दानुवर्तिनं पुत्रं तातो मामिव लक्ष्मण ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana, will even an illiterate man for the sake of a woman ever abandon his son like me who is faithful and obedient, as did my father?
data.anv: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, तातः father, मामिव as in my case, प्रमदायाः कृते for the sake of a woman, छन्दानुवर्तिनम् obedient, पुत्रम् son, अविद्वानपि even an illiterate man, कः पुमान् who is the man, त्यजेत् will abandon?
data.md: O Lakşmana, what man is there ignorant though he be, who for the sake of a female forsake as my father has done me, his son following his foot-steps?

data.v: सुखी बत सभार्यश्च भरतः केकयीसुतः । मुदितान्कोसलानेको यो भोक्ष्यत्यधिराजवत् ।।
data.es: Bharata, son of Kaikeyi, with his wife will alone enjoy like an emperor this kingdom of Kosala full of happy people.
data.anv: यः he, एकः alone, अधिराजवत् like an emperor, मुदितान् with happy people, कोसलान् Kosala country, भोक्ष्यति will enjoy, सभार्यः with his spouse, कैकयी सुतः Kaikeyi's son, भरतः Bharata, सुखी  with happniess, बतः may be.
data.md: Ah! Kaikeyi's son Bharata with his wife is really happy, he that enjoys the sole sovereignty of the delighted Kosalas.

data.v: स हि सर्वस्य राज्यस्य मुखमेकं भविष्यति । ताते च वयसातीते मयि चारण्यमाश्रिते ।।
data.es: The king is advanced in age and I have to dwell in the forest. Therefore, Bharata alone will be the chief of this entire kingdom.
data.anv: ताते dear one, वयसा with age, अतीते advanced, मयि च I also, अरण्यम् the forest, आस्थिते dwelling, सः that Bharata, सर्वस्य entire, राज्यस्य kingdom, एकम् alone, मुखम् chief man, भविष्यति will remain.
data.md: Now that our father has grown old and I have taken refuge in the forest, he will alone experience the supreme felicity in the kingdom.

data.v: अर्थधर्मौ परित्यज्य यः काममनुवर्तते । एवमापद्यते क्षिप्रं राजा दशरथो यथा ।।
data.es: Any king who abandons dharma and artha and adopts a life of pleasure will very soon reach this state as Dasaratha has attained.
data.anv: यः he, अर्थधर्मौ dharma and artha (prosperity and righteousness), परित्यज्य having abandoned, कामम् pleasure, अनुवर्तते seeks, राजा such a king, दशरथो यथा like Dasaratha, क्षिप्रम् soon, एवम् in this way, आपद्यते will reach such a state.
data.md: He that renouncing interest and virtue, follows lust, speedily gets himself involved in troubles even like king Dasaratha.

data.v: मन्ये दशरथान्ताय मम प्रव्राजनाय च । कैकेयी सौम्य संप्राप्ता राज्याय भरतस्य च ।।
data.es: O handsome Lakshmana I think Kaikeyi has come to our house for the destruction of Dasaratha, for my banishment and enthronement of Bharata in the kingdom.
data.anv: सौम्य handsome, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, दशरथान्ताय for the destruction of Dasaratha, मम my,  प्रव्राजनाय च for banishment, भरतस्य Bharata's, राज्याय च for kingdom, सम्प्राप्ता arrived, मन्ये I consider.
data.md: O amiable one, I think that Kaikeyi has been born for making an end of Dasaratha, sending me into exile, and conferring the kingdom on Bharata.

data.v: अपीदानीं न कैकेयी सौभाग्यमदमोहिता । कौसल्यां च सुमित्रां च संप्रबाधेत मत्कृते ।।
data.es: Intoxicated with her good fortune will not Kaikeyi torment Kausalya and Sumitra for my sake?
data.anv: कैकेयी Kaikeyi, सौभाग्यमदमोहिता intoxicated with good fortune, मत्कृते because of me, कौसल्यां च Kausalya, सुमित्रां च and also Sumitra, इदानीम् now, अपि न संप्रबाधेत will not torment?
data.md: At present for impareing me pain, Kaikeyi intoxicated by the tide of good fortune, will afflict Kausalya and Sumitrā.

data.v: मा स्म मत्कारणाद्देवी सुमित्रा दुःखमावसेत् । अयोध्यामित एव त्वं काले प्रविश लक्ष्मण ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana, because of me mother Sumitra should not live in sorrow. Therefore, tomorrow morning go back to Ayodhya from here itself.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, मत्कारणात् because of me, देवी mother, सुमित्रा Sumitra, दुःखम् in sorrow, मा आवसेत् स्म should not experience, त्वम् you, काल्ये in the morning, इत एव from here, अयोध्याम् to Ayodhya, प्रविश enter.
data.md: Your mother, the reversed Sumitrā, will be smitten with grief on our account. Do you, Laks maņa, tomorrow morning repair to Ayodhyā:

data.v: अहमेको गमिष्यामि सीतया सह दण्डकान् । अनाथाया हि नाथस्त्वं कौसल्याया भविष्यसि ।।
data.es: I shall go with Sita into the Dandaka forest and you be the protector of the helpless, Kausalya.
data.anv: अहम् myself I, एकः alone, सीतया सह along with Sita, दण्डकान् Dandaka forest, गमिष्यामि  shall go, अनाथायाः for the helpless, कौशल्यायाः for Kausalya, त्वम् you, नाथः (भविष्यसि) be a protector.
data.md: I alone will go to Dandaka along with Sītā. You will be the protector of the helpless Kausalya.

data.v: क्षुद्रकर्मा हि कैकेयी द्वेषादन्याय्यमाचरेत् । परिदद्या हि धर्मज्ञे भरते मम मातरम् ।।
data.es: Kaikeyi who is a woman of heinous deeds may follow, out of hostility, an unjust way in respect of my mother. In that case my mother may be entrusted to the care of Bharata who is righteous.
data.anv: क्षुद्रकर्मा one of heinous deeds, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, द्वेष्यम् in hostility, अन्याय्यम् unjust actions, आचरेत् follows, मम my, मातरम् mother, धर्मज्ञे with the righteous, भरते to Bharata, परिदद्याः हि you may entrust.
data.md: Kaikeyi is surely mean-minded, she perpetrates wrongs from malice. O you cognizant of virtue, she may administer poison to my mother.

data.v: नूनं जात्यन्तरे कस्मिं स्त्रियः पुत्रैर्वियोजिताः । जनन्या मम सौमित्रे तदप्येतदुपस्थितम् ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana, surely in one of her previous births did my mother separate women from their sons. That is why this (calamity) has befallen her.
data.anv: सौमित्रे Lakshmana, मम जनन्या by my mother, कस्मिन् जात्यन्तरे in some previous birth, स्त्रियः women, पुत्रैः with sons, वियोजिताः separated, तस्मात्  for that reason, एतत् all this, उपस्थितम् befallen, नूनम् certainly.
data.md: Surely, O child, in a former birth, women were bereft of their sons by my mother, O son of Sumitrā; and it is for this that this misfortune has befallen her.

data.v: मया हि चिरपुष्टेन दुःखसंवर्धितेन च । विप्रायुज्यत कौसल्या फलकाले धिगस्तु माम् ।।
data.es: Kausalya nurtured me for a long time and reared me with great difficulty. When she was going to enjoy the fruits of her labour, I have been separated from her. Fie upon me
data.anv: चिरपुष्टेन nurtured for a long time, दुःखसंवर्धितेन reared with great dificulty, मया me, कौशल्या Kausalya, फलकाले at the moment of fuition, विप्रायुज्यत has been separated, माम् me, धिक् अस्तु shame on me.
data.md: Having been brought up and reared with great pains by Kausalyä, I have left her at the time when her labours ought to have borne fruit, Fie on me.

data.v: मा स्म सीमन्तिनी काचिज्जनयेत्पुत्रमीदृशम् । सौमित्रे योऽहमम्बाया दद्मि शोकमनन्तकम् ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana, I am causing endless sorrow to my mother. May no mother give birth to a son like me
data.anv: सौमित्रे Lakshmana, यः अहम् am I, अम्बायाः to my mother, अनन्तकम् infinite, शोकम् pain, दद्मि am giving, ईदृशम् such, पुत्रम् a son, काचित् सीमन्तिनी (जननी) any mother, मा स्म जनयेत् may not give birth.
data.md: Let on woman, O son of Sumitrā, gibe birth to a son like me who have imparted such infinite pain to my mother.

data.v: मन्ये प्रीतिविशिष्टा सा मत्तो लक्ष्मणसारिका । यस्यास्तच्छ्रूयते वाक्यं शुक पादमरेर्दश ।।
data.es: (On hearing my banishment) her myna would say to her parrot, 'O parrot, bite the foot of the enemy (Kaikeyi)'. I think that bird is a greater source of joy to my mother than I, O Lakshmana
data.anv: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, यस्याः myna's, शुक parrot, अरेः enemy's, पादम् foot, दश bite, तत् वाक्यम् such statement, श्रूयते heard, सा शारिका that myna, मत्तः more than I, प्रीतिविशिष्टा more pleased, मन्ये I think.
data.md: O Laksmana, I consider my mother's female parrot as more sharing her affection, since she is heard to say, 'O Śuka, do you bite the foot of the foe?

data.v: शोचन्त्याश्चाल्पभाग्याया न किंचिदुपकुर्वता । पुर्त्रेण किमपुत्राया मया कार्यमरिंदम ।।
data.es: My mother has less fortune and more grief like a woman without a son, O Lakshmana, subduer of enemies For her, what is the use of a son like me who cannot render any service to her?
data.anv: अरिन्दम conquerer of enemies, शोचन्त्याः experiencing great sorrow, अल्पभाग्यायाः less fortunate, अपुत्रायाः without a son, किञ्चित् little, नोपकुर्वता could not be helped, पुत्रेण by the son, मया by me, किम् what, कार्यम् can be done?
data.md: What am I, O repressor of foes, now to do for her, bewailing, of slender fortune, she that has not profited in the least by her son, and who stands in no further need of his good offices ? Surely my unfortunate mother, Kausalyā, bereft of me, lies down on the ground, overwhelmed with woe, and plunged in an ocean of grief..

data.v: अल्पभाग्या हि मे माता कौसल्या रहिता मया । शेते परमदुःखार्ता पतिता शोकसागरे ।।
data.es: My mother is unlucky as she has been separated from me. Extremely distressed, she must have plunged into an ocean of grief.
data.anv: अल्पभाग्या less fortunate, मे माता my mother, कौशल्या Kausalya, मया with me, रहिता bereft of, परमदुःखार्ता extremely distressed, शोकसागरे ocean of sorrow, पतिता fallen into, शेते  must be lying.
data.md: What am I, O repressor of foes, now to do for her, bewailing, of slender fortune, she that has not profited in the least by her son, and who stands in no further need of his good offices ? Surely my unfortunate mother, Kausalyā, bereft of me, lies down on the ground, overwhelmed with woe, and plunged in an ocean of grief..

data.v: एको ह्यहमयोध्यां च पृथिवीं चापि लक्ष्मण । तरेयमिषुभिः क्रुद्धो ननु वीर्यमकारणम् ।।
data.es: Once enraged, O Lakshmana I can overpower Ayodhya, even the whole world all by myself with my arrows. But exhibition of prowess without any reason is not desirable.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, अहम् I, क्रुद्धः am enraged, एकः alone, अयोध्यां च Ayodhya, पृथिवीं चापि and also the whole earth, इषुभिः with arrows, तरेयम् will cross, वीर्यम् prowess, अकारणं ननु  without reason.
data.md: O Laksmana, enraged, I alone without doubt, can rid Ayodhyā, the Earth herself, by means of my arrows. But improper is the display of prowess for no reason,

data.v: अधर्मभय भीतश्च परलोकस्य चानघ । तेन लक्ष्मण नाद्याहमात्मानमभिषेचये ।।
data.es: O sinless one, I did not get myself coronated owing to fear of unrighteous conduct and fear of the other world.
data.anv: अनघ O sinless one, अहम् I, अधर्मभयभीतश्च with the fear of unrighteous conduct, परलोकस्य च for the other world also, लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, तेन therefore, अद्य at this time, आत्मानम् myself, नाभिषेचये did not get crowned.
data.md: O sinless one, I am afraid of unrighteousness and of the next life; and for this it is that, O Lakşmaņa, I do not install myself in the kingdom.

data.v: एतदन्यच्च करुणं विलप्य विजने बहु । अश्रुपूर्णमुखो रामो निशि तूष्णीमुपाविशत् ।।
data.es: Like this and in many other ways Rama lamented pitifully in that desolate forest. When his face was filled with tears, he sat silently in the night.
data.anv: रामः Rama, निशि in the night, विजने in the desolate, वने in the  forest, एतत् all these, अन्यच्च and other, करुणम् pitiful, विलप्य lamenting, अश्रुपूर्णमुखः face filled with tears, तूष्णीम् silently, उपाविशत् sat.
data.md: Having in solitude for a long while piteously bewailed thus and in other ways, Rāma sat silent in the night with tears in his eyes.

data.v: विलप्योपरतं रामं गतार्चिषमिवानलम् । समुद्रमिव निर्वेगमाश्वासयत लक्ष्मणः ।।
data.es: Lakshmana consoled Rama who ceased to lament like fire with extinguished flames or like a motionless sea:
data.anv: विलप्य having lamented, उपरतम् ceased, गतार्चिषम् with extinguished flames, अनलम् इव  like fire, निर्वेगम् without moving, समुद्रमिव like the sea, रामम् Rama, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, आश्वासयत consoled.
data.md: Thereupon Lakşmaņa consoled Rāma spent with lamentation, like to fire deprived of its radiance or the ocean of its tide.

data.v: ध्रुवमद्य पुरी राम अयोध्या युधिनां वर । निष्प्रभा त्वयि निष्क्रान्ते गतचन्द्रेव शर्वरी ।।
data.es: O Rama, foremost of warriors, it is certain that since your departure, the city of Ayodhya must be lustreless like night without the Moon.
data.anv: आयुधिनाम् among wielder of weapons, वर foremost, राजन् O king, अद्य now, अयोध्यापुरी city of Ayodhya, त्वयि when you, निष्क्रान्ते had departed, गतचन्द्र without moon, शर्वरीव like night, निष्प्रभा without lustre, ध्रुवम् certain.
data.md: Surely, O Rama, O foremost of warriors, on your having come out, the city of Ayodhyā is shorn of its splendour like the night deprived of the moon.

data.v: नैतदौपयिकं राम यदिदं परितप्यसे । विषादयसि सीतां च मां चैव पुरुषर्षभ ।।
data.es: This is not the way you should lament, O Rama. O foremost of men, by doing so you are disheartening me and Sita as well.
data.anv: राम O Rama, इदम् in this manner, यत् परितप्यते that you are lamenting, एतत् all this, औपयिकम् proper, न not, पुरुषर्षभ foremost of men, सीतां च Sita, मां चैव me also, विषादयसि disheartening.
data.md: This is not fit that you should grieve; for thereby, O foremost of men, you make both Sītā and myself grieve.

data.v: न च सीता त्वया हीना न चाहमपि राघव । मुहूर्तमपि जीवावो जलान्मत्स्याविवोद्धृतौ ।।
data.es: Without you Sita or I will not survive even for a moment like a fish taken out of water, O Rama
data.anv: राघव O Rama, त्वया by you, हीना without, सीता Sita, न not,  अहमपि I also, न not, जलात्  from water, उद्धृतौ removed, मत्स्याविव like fish, मुहूर्तमपि even for a moment, न जीवावः will not survive.
data.md: O Rāghava, deprived of you neither Sītā nor I can live for a moment, like fish taken out of water : without you.

data.v: न हि तातं न शत्रुघ्नं न सुमित्रां परंतप । द्रष्टुमिच्छेयमद्याहं स्वर्गं वापि त्वया विना ।।
data.es: Without you, O Rama, tormentor of enemies, I wish to see neither father nor Satrughna nor Sumitra nor even heaven itself
data.anv: परन्तप O tomentor of enemies, Rama, अहम् I, अद्य now, त्वया विना without you, तातम्  father, द्रष्टुम् see, न हि इच्छेयम् shall not desire, शत्रुघ्नम् Satrughna, न not, सुमित्राम्  Sumitra, स्वर्गं चापि even heaven.
data.md: O repressor of foes, I wish to see neither my father, nor Satrughna, nor Sumitrā, nor heaven itself.

data.v: स लक्ष्मणस्योत्तम पुष्कलं वचो; निशम्य चैवं वनवासमादरात् । समाः समस्ता विदधे परंतपः; प्रपद्य धर्मं सुचिराय राघवः ।।
data.es: Rama, the tormentor of enemies, listened, out of love, to the excellent and copious words of Lakshmana and permitted him to live in the forest for the entire period of fourteen years by observing the prescribed code of conduct as enjoined on life in the forest.
data.anv: परन्तपः tormentor of enemies, सः राघवः that Rama, एवम् thus, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, उत्तमपुष्कलम् excellent and copious, वचः utterances, आदरात् out of love, निशम्य having heard, सुचिराय for a long period, धर्मम् that code of conduct of forest life, प्रपद्य having obtained, समस्ता: all, समाः the years, वनवासम् life in the forest, विदधे resorted to.
data.md: Hearing Lakşmaņa's excellent and appropriate words with which he gladly assumed a life in the woods, that subduer of foes, Rāghava, in the name of righteousness, at once fully granted him the permission to dwell with him for the entire fourteen years.

data.v: ते तु तस्मिन्महावृक्ष उषित्वा रजनीं शिवाम् । विमलेऽभ्युदिते सूर्ये तस्माद्देशात्प्रतस्थिरे ।।
data.es: They (Rama, Sita and Lakshmana) spent that auspicious night under that great tree and set out from there after the bright sun rose.
data.anv: ते they (Rama, Sita and Lakshmana), शिवाम् auspicious, रजनीम् night, तस्मिन् that, महावृक्षे big tree, उषित्वा having remained, विमले when the bright, सूर्ये Sun, अभ्युदिते had risen, तस्मात् देशात् from that region, प्रतस्थिरे set out.
data.md: Having passed the auspicious night underneath that might tree, they, when the sun had risen in unclouded splendour, went away from that place.

data.v: यत्र भागीरथी गङ्गा यमुनामभिवर्तते । जग्मुस्तं देशमुद्दिश्य विगाह्य सुमहद्वनम् ।।
data.es: Illustrious Rama, Sita and Lakshmana entered the deep forest and saw the different regions of the land and other enchanting places which they had never seen before and proceeded towards the region where the river Yamuna merged with Bhagirathi Ganga.
data.anv: यशश्विनः illustrious, ते they, सुमहत् very great, वनम् forest, विगाह्य having entered, विविधान् different, भूमिभागान् regions of the land, अदृष्टपूर्वान् hithertounseen, मनोरमान् enchanting, देशांश्चापि regions also, तत्र तत्र here and there, पश्यन्तः viewing, यमुना Yamuna, यत्र where, भागीरथीम् Bhagirathi, गङ्गाम् Ganga's, अभिप्रवर्तते flows into, तं देशम् that place, उद्दिश्य intending (to reach), जग्मुः went.
data.md: Then dividing into a mighty forest, they proceeded in the direction in which the Bhāgirathi Gangå meets with the Yamunā.

data.v: ते भूमिमागान्विविधान्देशांश्चापि मनोरमान् । अदृष्टपूर्वान्पश्यन्तस्तत्र तत्र यशस्विनः ।।
data.es: Illustrious Rama, Sita and Lakshmana entered the deep forest and saw the different regions of the land and other enchanting places which they had never seen before and proceeded towards the region where the river Yamuna merged with Bhagirathi Ganga.
data.anv: यशश्विनः illustrious, ते they, सुमहत् very great, वनम् forest, विगाह्य having entered, विविधान् different, भूमिभागान् regions of the land, अदृष्टपूर्वान् hithertounseen, मनोरमान् enchanting, देशांश्चापि regions also, तत्र तत्र here and there, पश्यन्तः viewing, यमुना Yamuna, यत्र where, भागीरथीम् Bhagirathi, गङ्गाम् Ganga's, अभिप्रवर्तते flows into, तं देशम् that place, उद्दिश्य intending (to reach), जग्मुः went.
data.md: Those illustrious ones went on, viewing at intervals various fields and delightful lands which they had never seen before.

data.v: यथाक्षेमेण गच्छन्स पश्यंश्च विविधान्द्रुमान् । निवृत्तमात्रे दिवसे रामः सौमित्रिमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Walking on the safe path and observing various kinds of trees Rama said to Lakshmana at the end of the day:
data.anv: सः रामः that Rama, यथा क्षेमेण on a safe way, गच्छन् going, विविधान् various, द्रुमान् trees, पश्यंश्च looking at, दिवसे day, निवृत्तमात्रे when ended, सौमित्रिम् to Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: And going on beholding various kinds of blossoming trees, Rāma when the day had declined, spoke to Sumitrā's son saying.

data.v: प्रयागमभितः पश्य सौमित्रे धूममुन्नतम् । अग्नेर्भगवतः केतुं मन्ये संनिहितो मुनिः ।।
data.es: O son of Sumitra, look at the column of smoke rising like the banner of the venerable firegod near Prayaga. I think an ascetic dwells nearby.
data.anv: सौमित्रे O son of Sumitra, Lakshmana, प्रयागम् अभितः near Prayaga, उन्नतम् rising high, भगवतः of the venerable, अग्नेः fire's, केतुम् the banner, धूमम् smoke, पश्य look, मुनिः the sage, सन्निहितः close by, मन्ये I think.
data.md: O son of Sumitrā, do you behold the beautiful wreath of smoke that rises in front of Prayāga, sign of the worshipful Fire, and I infer some ascetic to be near.

data.v: नूनं प्राप्ताः स्म संभेदं गङ्गायमुनयोर्वयम् । तथा हि श्रूयते शम्ब्दो वारिणा वारिघट्टितः ।।
data.es: We have surely reached the confluence of Ganga and Yamuna which can be ascertained from the sounds of clashing water.
data.anv: वयम् we, गङ्गायमुनयोः Ganga and Yamuna, सम्भेदम् confluence, प्राप्ताः स्म have reached,  नूनम् it is certain, तथा हि as for, वारिघट्टितः dashed by waters, वारिणः waters, शब्दः sound, श्रूयते is heard.
data.md: For certain we have arrived at the confluence of the Gangā and the Yamunā; and it is for this that we hear the roar of the waters produced by the rushing of them.

data.v: दारूणि परिभिन्नानि वनजैरुपजीविभिः । भरद्वाजाश्रमे चैते दृश्यन्ते विविधा द्रुमाः ।।
data.es: Here are logs of wood cut into pieces by forestdwellers, living on forest products. You can see various trees near the hermitage of sage Bharadwaja.
data.anv: वनजैः by the foresters, उपजीविभिः those people subsisting on them, परिभिन्नानि are broken,  दारूणि logs of wood, भरद्वाजाश्रमे in the hermitage of Bharadwaja, एते all these, विविधाः different, द्रुमाश्च trees also, दृश्यन्ते are seen.
data.md: All these various trees with their wood hewn away by foresters are seen in the asylums.

data.v: धन्विनौ तौ सुखं गत्वा लम्बमाने दिवाकरे । गङ्गायमुनयोः संधौ प्रापतुर्निलयं मुनेः ।।
data.es: The two archers (Rama and Lakshmana) reached comfortably (walking at an easy pace) by evening the hermitage of sage Bharadwaja near the confluence of Ganga and Yamuna.
data.anv: धन्विनौ the two archers, तौ those two, सुखम् comfortably, गत्वा having gone,  दिवाकरे Sun, लम्बमाने was hanging, गङ्गायमुनयोः of Ganga and yamuna, सन्धौ at the confluence, मुनेः of sage Bharadwaja, निलयम् hermitage, प्रापतुः arrived.
data.md: Thus having proceeded at ease, you bowmen when the sun stood aslant, arrived in the vicinity of the ascetic's residence on the delta of the Yamunā and the Gangā.

data.v: रामस्त्वाश्रममासाद्य त्रासयन्मृगपक्षिणः । गत्वा मुहूर्तमध्वानं भरद्वाजमुपागमत् ।।
data.es: Seeing Rama approaching the hermitage the deer and the birds were frightened. Proceeding on the path, for a while Rama reached (the place of) Bharadwaja.
data.anv: रामः Rama, अश्रमम् hermitage, आसाद्य having approached, मृगपक्षिणः animals and birds, त्रासयन् frightening, मुहूर्तम् for a moment, अध्वानम् on the path, गत्वा proceeding, भरद्वाजम् Bharadhwaja, उपागमत् reached.
data.md: Proceeding awhile on the way, Rāma, in presence of the asylum, came up to Bharadvāja's place, frightening beasts and birds.

data.v: ततस्त्वाश्रममासाद्य मुनेर्दर्शनकाङ्क्षिणौ । सीतयानुगतौ वीरौ दूरादेवावतस्थतुः ।।
data.es: Thereafter the two heroes followed by Sita arrived at the hermitage and, wishing to see the sage, waited at a distance.
data.anv: ततः then, सीतया by Sita, अनुगतौ followed, वीरौ those two heroes, आश्रमम् hermitage, आसाद्य having reached, मुनेः ascetic's, दर्शनकाङ्क्षिणौ wishing to see, दूरादेव at a distance, अवतस्थतुः stood.
data.md: Arriving at the hermitage, the heroes desirous of seeing the ascetic, stood at a distance with Sītā behind them.

data.v: हुताग्निहोत्रं दृष्ट्वैव महाभागं कृताञ्जलिः । रामः सौमित्रिणा सार्धं सीतया चाभ्यवादयत् ।।
data.es: Rama entered the hermitage and saw that highsouled Bharadwaja surrounded by his disciples. He was a distinguished sage who (himself) kindled sacrficial fires and acquired spiritual insight by practising rigid austerities with concentration of mind and ascetic powers. Rama, Lakshmana and Sita paid their obeisance to that great sage.
data.anv: सः रामः Rama, प्रविश्य having entered, संशितव्रतम् one practising rigorous austerities, एकाग्रम् with concentration of mind, तपसा with asceticism, लब्दचक्षुषम् one who has obtained spiritual insight, हुताग्निहोत्रम् one who has kindled fire in sacrificial rituals, महाभागम् distinguished, शिष्यगणैः with disciples, वृतम् surrounded by, महात्मानम् highsouled, ऋषिम् sage, दृष्ट्वैव having seen, सौमित्रिणा Lakshmana, सार्धम् along with, सीतया च Sita too, अभ्यवादयत् paid obeisance.
data.md: And as soon as entering in, that exalted one saw that high-souled anchoret of accomplished vows, who had attained spiritual insight through austerities, sitting surrounded by his disciples after having finished the Agnihotra, Rāma with joined hands saluted him along with Sumitra's son and Sita.

data.v: न्यवेदयत चात्मानं तस्मै लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः । पुत्रौ दशरथस्यावां भगवन्रामलक्ष्मणौ ।।
data.es: Lakshmana's elder brother (Rama) introduced himself (to Bharadwaja), O venerable one, we are both sons of Dasaratha, Rama and Lakshmana.
data.anv: लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः Lakshmana's elder brother (Rama), तस्मै to that sage, आत्मानम् himself, न्यवेदयत introduced, भगवन् O venerable one, अवाम् both of us, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, पुत्रौ sons, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana.

data.v: भार्या ममेयं वैदेही कल्याणी जनकात्मजा । मां चानुयाता विजनं तपोवनमनिन्दिता ।।
data.es: This blessed one is my consort, Sita, daughter of Janaka. Irreproachable she has followed me to the desolate grove of penance (hermitage).
data.anv: इयम् this, कल्याणी auspicious one, मम my, भार्या consort, जनकात्मजा daughter of Janaka, वैदेही Vaidehi (Sita), अनिन्दिता irreproachable, माम् me, विजनम् desolate, तपोवनम् penacegrove, अनुयाता has followed.

data.v: पित्रा प्रव्राज्यमानं मां सौमित्रिरनुजः प्रियः । अयमन्वगमद्भ्राता वनमेव दृढव्रतः ।।
data.es: This is the son of Sumitra, my beloved younger brother, a man of firm resolve. He has accompanied me when I was sent on exile to the forest by my father.
data.anv: दृढव्रतः of firm resolve, भ्राता brother, अनुजः younger, प्रियः dear, अयं सौमित्रिः this son of Sumitra, पित्रा by father, प्रव्राज्यमानम् being sent on exile, माम् me, वनमेव to the forest, अन्वगमत् followed.

data.v: पित्रा नियुक्ता भगवन्प्रवेष्यामस्तपोवनम् । धर्ममेवाचरिष्यामस्तत्र मूलफलाशनाः ।।
data.es: O venerable one on my father's command we entered the desolate forest of penance. Subsisting on roots and fruits, I shall practise the righteous way of life.
data.anv: भगवन् O venerable one, पित्रा by father, नियुक्ताः ordered by, तपोवनम् penancegrove प्रवेक्ष्यामः we will enter, तत्र there, मूलफलाशनाः subsisting on roots and fruits, धर्ममेव following righteous ways, चरिष्यामः will practise.
data.md: O revered one, commissioned by my father, I will enter the forest of asceticism, and there subsisting on fruits and roots will practise virtue.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राजपुत्रस्य धीमतः । उपानयत धर्मात्मा गामर्घ्यमुदकं ततः ।।
data.es: Sage Bharadwaja heard the words of sagacious Rama and offered a bull, water (for washing feet) and arghya (offering to a guest).
data.anv: धर्मात्मा sage Bharadwaja, धीमतः of the sagacious, तस्य that, राजपुत्रस्य prince's,  तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, ततः then, गाम् bull, अर्घ्यम् for arghya, उदकम् water, उपानयत brought.
data.md: Hearing those words of the intelligent prince, that righteous (ascetic) brought a bull* as well as Arghya and water and divers kinds of edibles consisting of wild fruits and roots. *When an eminent guest came to a person's house, as he offered madhuparka, with a bull which was killed for his entertainment

data.v: मृगपक्षिभिरासीनो मुनिभिश्च समन्ततः । राममागतमभ्यर्च्य स्वागतेनाह तं मुनिः ।।
data.es: There the sage sat, surrounded by hermits, animals and birds after having welcomed Rama with due honour.
data.anv: मृगपक्षिभिः by animals and birds, मुनिभिश्च by hermits also, समन्ततः surrounded, आसीनः seated, मुनिः sage (Bharadwaja), आगतम् arrived, तं रामम् to that Rama, स्वागतेन with  welcome, अभ्यर्च्य having paid homage, आह uttered.
data.md: Then paying homage to Rāma he proceeded by short stages, and asking him, Has your journey been a pleasant one?, the ascetic sat down. And when Rāghava had sat down after receiving the homage, Bharadvāja spoke to him these words fraught with virtue.

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य च तामर्चामुपविष्टं सराघवम् । भरद्वाजोऽब्रवीद्वाक्यं धर्मयुक्तमिदं तदा ।।
data.es: Rama accepted the hospitality of Bharadwaja and took a seat in front of the sage, who spoke to him these words in conformity with righteousness:
data.anv: सः भरद्वाजः that Bharadwaja, तदा then, ताम् that, अर्चाम् hospitality, प्रतिगृह्य having  received, उपविष्टम् seated in front, राघवम् to Rama, धर्मयुक्तम् in conformity with  righteousness, इदं वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Then paying homage to Rāma he proceeded by short stages, and asking him, Has your journey been a pleasant one?, the ascetic sat down. And when Rāghava had sat down after receiving the homage, Bharadvāja spoke to him these words fraught with virtue.

data.v: चिरस्य खलु काकुत्स्थ पश्यामि त्वामिहागतम् । श्रुतं तव मया चेदं विवासनमकारणम् ।।
data.es: O descendant of the Kakutstha dynasty, I am able to see you on your arrival here after a long time. I have also heard about your unwarranted banishment.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ O descendant of the Kakutstha dynasty, चिरस्य after a long time, इह here, आगतम् arrived here, त्वाम् you, पश्यामि खलु I see indeed, अकारणम् without any reason, तव your, इदम् this, विवासनम् banishment, मया by me, श्रुतं च is heard too.
data.md: O Kākutstha, I behold you come after a long time. I have heard of your causeless exile.

data.v: अवकाशो विविक्तोऽयं महानद्योः समागमे । पुण्यश्च रमणीयश्च वसत्विह भगान्सुखम् ।।
data.es: This sacred and solitary region near the confluence of two great rivers (Ganga and Yamuna) is a pleasant place. You may stay here comfortably.
data.anv: महानद्योः of two great rivers, समागमे at the confluence, अयम् this, अवकाशः region, विविक्तः solitary, पुण्यश्च is also sacred, रमणीयश्च pleasant, भवान् you, इह here, सुखम् comfortably, वसतु can dwell.
data.md: This spot at the meeting of the mighty rivers is lonely, sacred and charming. Do you dwell here happily.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु वचनं भरद्वाजेन राघवः । प्रत्युवाच शुभं वाक्यं रामः सर्वहिते रतः ।।
data.es: Rama, ever devoted to the wellbeing of every one, heard Bharadwaja and replied to him with these auspicious words:
data.anv: सर्वहिते for the wellbeing of all, रतः devoted, राघवः born in the dynasty of Raghu, रामः Rama, भरद्वाजेन by Bharadwaja, एवम् in this way, वचनम् these words, उक्तः having been addressed, शुभम् auspicious, वाक्यम् words, प्रत्युवाच spoke in reply.
data.md: Thus addressed by Bharadvāja, that descendant of Raghu, Rāma intent on the welfare of all, answered in auspicious words.

data.v: भगवन्नित आसन्नः पौरजानपदो जनः । आगमिष्यति वैदेहीं मां चापि प्रेक्षको जनः । अनेन कारणेनाहमिह वासं न रोचये ।।
data.es: O venerable sage, I feel the people living in nearby villages and towns, perceiving that we can be easily seen here, will frequent this ashram. This is the reason I don't wish to stay here.
data.anv: भगवन् O venerable one, इतः from here, पौरजानपदः inhabiting towns and villages, जनः subjects, आसन्नः living closely, इह here, माम् me, सुदर्शम् easily to be seen, प्रेक्ष्य having seen, जनः people, वैदेहीम् Sita, मां चापि me too, प्रेक्षकः in order to see, इमम् आश्रमम् to this hermitage, आगमिष्यति will frequent, अहम् I, मन्ये think so, अनेन कारणेन for this reason, अहम् I, इह here, वासम् to reside, न रोचये do not desire.
data.md: O reverend one, I apprehend that, living hard by, the inhabitants of the city and the provinces, thinking me as easily to be seen, will come to this asylum desirous of beholding me and Vaidehī. It is for this reason that living at this place does not recommended itself to me.

data.v: एकान्ते पश्य भगवन्नाश्रमस्थानमुत्तमम् । रमते यत्र वैदेही सुखार्हा जनकात्मजा ।।
data.es: O revered one, Janaka's daughter (Sita) deserves comfort. Suggest a solitary and agreeable place for our hermitage where she can enjoy herself.
data.anv: भगवन् revered one, सुखार्हा deserves comfort, जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, वैदेही Vaidehi, यत्र where, रमेत may enjoy, एकान्ते in a solitary, उत्तमम् agreeable, आश्रमस्थानम् hermitage, पश्य see.
data.md: Do you, O worshipful one, hit upon a retired and agreeable asylum where Janaka's daughter worthy of happiness, will pass her days pleasantly.

data.v: एतच्छ्रुत्वा शुभं वाक्यं भरद्वाजो महामुनिः । राघवस्य ततो वाक्यमर्थ ग्राहकमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: On hearing the auspicious words of Rama conveying his intention, the great sage Bharadwaja replied to him thus:
data.anv: महामुनिः great sage, भरद्वाजः Bharadwaja, राघवस्य Rama's, एतत् these, शुभम् auspicious, वाक्यम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, ततः after that, अर्थग्राहकम् conveying the meaning, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Hearing this auspicious speech of Rāghava, that eminent anchoret Bharadvāja said these words calculated to serve Rāma's purpose.

data.v: दशक्रोश इतस्तात गिरिर्यस्मिन्निवत्स्यसि । महर्षिसेवितः पुण्यः सर्वतः सुख दर्शनः ।।
data.es: O my son ten krosas (about twenty miles) from here is a mountain wellknown as Chitrakuta, resembling 'Gandhamadana'. That mountain frequented by maharshis is sacred. It looks pleasant from all sides. Monkeys, apes and bears wander there and it is an appropriate place for you to live in.
data.anv: तात O dear, महर्षिसेवितः inhabited by sages, पुण्यः sacred, सर्वतः from all sides, सुखदर्शनः whose sight causes delight, गोलाङ्गूलानुचरितः full of wandering apes, वानरर्क्षनिषेवितः inhabited by monkeys and bears, चित्रकूटः इति by name Chitrakuta, ख्यातः wellknown, गन्धमादनसन्निभः like 'Gandhamadana' mountain, गिरिः mountain, इतः from here, दशक्रोशे at a distance of ten krosas, यत्र there, निवत्स्यसि you can live.

data.v: गोलाङ्गूलानुचरितो वानरर्क्षनिषेवितः । चित्रकूट इति ख्यातो गन्धमादनसंनिभः ।।
data.es: O my son ten krosas (about twenty miles) from here is a mountain wellknown as Chitrakuta, resembling 'Gandhamadana'. That mountain frequented by maharshis is sacred. It looks pleasant from all sides. Monkeys, apes and bears wander there and it is an appropriate place for you to live in.
data.anv: तात O dear, महर्षिसेवितः inhabited by sages, पुण्यः sacred, सर्वतः from all sides, सुखदर्शनः whose sight causes delight, गोलाङ्गूलानुचरितः full of wandering apes, वानरर्क्षनिषेवितः inhabited by monkeys and bears, चित्रकूटः इति by name Chitrakuta, ख्यातः wellknown, गन्धमादनसन्निभः like 'Gandhamadana' mountain, गिरिः mountain, इतः from here, दशक्रोशे at a distance of ten krosas, यत्र there, निवत्स्यसि you can live.
data.md: Ten Krosas hence, my child, is the mountain where you shall dwell. it is inhabited by maharsis, and is sacred, and picturesque throughout, abounding in Golāngulas, monkeys, and bears, known by the name of Citrakuta, resembling Gandhamädana.

data.v: यावता चित्र कूटस्य नरः शृङ्गाण्यवेक्षते । कल्याणानि समाधत्ते न पापे कुरुते मनः ।।
data.es: As long as one beholds the peaks of mount Chitrakuta, he will be inspired to do good deeds and will not employ his mind in sinful thoughts.
data.anv: नरः a man, यावता as long as, चित्रकूटस्य Chitrakuta mountain's, शृङ्गानि peaks, आवेक्षते beholds, कल्याणानि auspicious deeds, समाधत्ते will perform, पापे in sinful thoughts, मनः the mind, न कुरुते will not employ.
data.md: On beholding the peaks of Citrakuța, one reaps welfare, and ignorance does not envelope one's mind.

data.v: ऋषयस्तत्र बहवो विहृत्य शरदां शतम् । तपसा दिवमारूढाः कपालशिरसा सह ।।
data.es: On the Chitrakuta mountain many ascetics wandered about (lived) for hundreds of years carrying on penance. In the process they became so much emaciated that they looked as if they were left (only) with the skulls on their heads. (In the end) they ascended heaven.
data.anv: तत्र there, बहवः many, ऋषयः ascetics, शरदां शतम् for hundreds of years, तपसा with austerities, विहृत्य having roamed about, कपालशिरसा सह with the skulls on their heads, दिवम् heaven, आरूढाः have ascended.
data.md: There innumerable saints with the hair of their heads rendered white like skulls, having spent hundreds of years, have through austerities ascended heaven.

data.v: प्रविविक्तमहं मन्ये तं वासं भवतः सुखम् । इह वा वनवासाय वस राम मया सह ।।
data.es: O Rama, I think you will enjoy your stay there in a solitary place. Or else, you may live with me here during the period of banishment.
data.anv: राम Rama, प्रविविक्तम् solitary, तं वासम् that abode, भवतः for your, सुखम् happiness, अहम् I,  मन्ये think, मया सह with me, इह वा or here, वनवासाय for the period of banishment, वस you may live.
data.md: That solitary spot I deem as one which will make a happy residence for you. O Rāma, do you, for living out the term of your banishment, dwell either here or with me.

data.v: स रामं सर्वकामैस्तं भरद्वाजः प्रियातिथिम् । सभार्यं सह च भ्रात्रा प्रतिजग्राह धर्मवित् ।।
data.es: Bharadwaja, who knows his duty honoured Rama, his beloved guest with his consort and brother by extending all kinds of hospitality.
data.anv: धर्मवित् one who knows his duty, सः भरद्वाजः that Bharadwaja, सभार्यम् with his consort, भ्रात्रा सह with brother, च and, प्रियातिथिम् beloved guest, तं रामम् that Rama, सर्वकामैः with all desires, प्रतिजग्राह honoured.
data.md: Bharadvāja entertained his welcome guest, Rāma, along with his wife and brother by extending towards them every rite of hospitality.

data.v: तस्य प्रयागे रामस्य तं महर्षिमुपेयुषः । प्रपन्ना रजनी पुण्या चित्राः कथयतः कथाः ।।
data.es: At Prayaga, while the great sage Bharadwaja was narrating to Rama sitting near him several interesting anecdotes, the holy night set in.
data.anv: प्रयागे at Prayaga, तं महर्षिम् that great sage, उपेयुषः sitting near, रामस्य of Rama, चित्राः interesting, कथाः tales, कथयतः while conversing, पुण्या that holy, रजनी night, प्रपन्ना had set in.
data.md: At Prayāga Rāma having obtained the company of that Maharși, and discoursing on a variety of sacred topics, the night came on.

data.v: प्रभातायां रजन्यां तु भरद्वाजमुपागमत् । उवाच नरशार्दूलो मुनिं ज्वलिततेजसम् ।।
data.es: When the night passed into dawn, Rama the best of men approached the resplendent Bharadwaja and said.
data.anv: नरशार्दूलः tiger (best) among men, रजन्याम् after the night, प्रभातायाम् at dawn, भरद्वाजम् to Bharadwaja, उपागमत् approached, ज्वलिततेजसम् with blazing lustre, मुनिम् the sage, उवाच said.
data.md: When the night had passed away and day dawned, (Rāma) approached Bharadvāja, and that chief of men addressed that ascetic of flaming energy.

data.v: शर्वरीं भवनन्नद्य सत्यशील तवाश्रमे । उषिताः स्मेह वसतिमनुजानातु नो भवान् ।।
data.es: O venerable sage devoted to truth, we have spent the night in your hermitage. Please permit us to depart for the dwellingplace (suggested by you).
data.anv: सत्यशील O truthful, भगवन् O venerable, इह here, तव आश्रमे in your hermitage, शर्वरीम् the night, उषिता स्म we have spent, अद्य to day, नः us, भवान् you, वसतिम् dwellingplace, अनुजानातु permit.
data.md: O reverend sire of truthful character, we have here in your asylum spent the night. Do you now permit us to set forward (for Citrakuta).

data.v: रात्र्यां तु तस्यां व्युष्टायां भरद्वाजोऽब्रवीदिदम् । मधुमूलफलोपेतं चित्रकूटं व्रजेति ह ।।
data.es: When the night came to a close, Bharadwaja said (to Rama): You may proceed to Chitrakuta which abounds in roots, fruits and honey.
data.anv: तस्याम् रात्र्याम् when that night, व्युष्टायाम् had come to a close, भरद्वाजः Bharadwaja, मधुमूलफलोपेतम् abounding in honey, roots, and fruits, चित्रकूटम् to Chitrakuta, व्रज go, इति thus, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

data.v: तत्र कुञ्जरयूथानि मृगयूथानि चाभितः । विचरन्ति वनान्तेषु तानि द्रक्ष्यसि राघव ।।
data.es: You will see, O Rama, herds of elephants and deer ranging in the forest.
data.anv: राघव Rama, तत्र there, अस्मिन् वनान्ते in the middle of the forest, अभितः throughout, कुञ्जरयूथानि herds of elephants, मृगयूथानि च and herds of deer, विचरन्ति range about, तानि all that, द्रक्षयसि you will see.

data.v: प्रहृष्टकोयष्टिककोकिलस्वनै;र्विनादितं तं वसुधाधरं शिवम् । मृगैश्च मत्तैर्बहुभिश्च कुञ्जरैः; सुरम्यमासाद्य समावसाश्रमम् ।।
data.es: The auspicious mountain (Chaitrakuta) resounds with the note of cheerful lapwings and cuckoos. Intoxicated elephants and deer move about in the enchanting mountain. There you may settle down in a hermitage. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे चतुःपञ्चाश स्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyfourth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: प्रहृष्टकोयष्टिककोकिलस्वनैः with the notes of cheerful lapwings and cuckoos, विनादितम् echoed, बहुभिः by many, मृगैश्च deer (animals), मत्तै: intoxicated, कुञ्जरैश्च by elephants, सुरम्यम् exceedingly charming, तं वसुधाधरम् that mount Chitrakuta, आसाद्य having reached, आश्रमम् hermitage, समावस dwell there.
data.md: Delighted with the notes of joyous Koyastivas and coels, and the cries of deer and coundess mad elephants, do you, arriving at the auspicious mountain, reside at the romantic asylum.

data.v: उषित्वा रजनीं तत्र राजपुत्रावरिंदमौ । महर्षिमभिवाद्याथ जग्मतुस्तं गिरिं प्रति ।।
data.es: After spending the night, the princes, destroyers of enemies, offered obeisance to that great sage (Bharadhwaja) and went towards that mount Chitrkuta.
data.anv: अरिन्दमौ destroyers of enemies, राजपुत्राः the (two) princes, तत्र there, रजनी night, उषित्वा having spent, अथ thereafter, महर्षिम् great sage (Bharadwaja), अभिवाद्य having offered obeisance, तं गिरिं प्रति in the direction of that mountain, जग्मतुः went.
data.md: Having spent the night there, those princes, repressors of their foes, after paying their obeisance to the Maharși, set out for the mountain.

data.v: प्रस्थितांश्चैव तान्प्रेक्ष्य पिता पुत्रानिवान्वगात् । ततः प्रचक्रमे वक्तुं वचनं स महामुनिः ।।
data.es: Seeing them setting forth, the great sage blessed them for a safe journey and followed them like a father following his children.
data.anv: सः महर्षिः that great sage, तेषाम् to them, स्वस्त्ययनम् blessings for their safe journey, चकार ह made, प्रस्थितान् set forth, तान् them, प्रेक्ष्य having seen, पिता father, पुत्रानिव like his own children, अन्वगात् च followed also.

data.v: अथासाद्य तु कालिन्दीं शीघ्रस्रोतसमापगाम् । तत्र यूयं प्लवं कृत्वा तरतांशुमतीं नदीम् ।।
data.es: On reaching that swiftflowing river Yamuna, O Rama and Lakshmana O scions of the Raghu race, you will find an ancient spot (on the river bank). There make a raft and cross Kalindi, daughter of the Sun.
data.anv: राघवौ the scions of the Raghus (Rama and Lakshmana), अथ then, शीघ्रस्रोतसम् rapidiy flowing आपगाम् river, कालिन्दीम् Kalindi (Yamuna), आसाद्य having reached, प्रचलितम् served by many, पुराणम् ancient, तस्याः तीर्थम् spot on the river bank, प्रेक्ष्य finding, तत्र there, यूयम् you, प्लवम् a raft, कृत्वा having made, अंशुमतीम् that daughter of the Sun (Yamuna), नदीम् river, तरत cross over.
data.md: Arriving at the Kalindi running in a contrary direction, you will, O Rāghava, behold a goodly bathing place well-worn by foot-passengers. There constructing a raft, do you cross over the river who is the daughter of the Sun.

data.v: ततो न्यग्रोधमासाद्य महान्तं हरितच्छदम् । विवृद्धं बहुभिर्वृक्षैः श्यामं सिद्धोपसेवितम् ।।
data.es: There you will find a large, banyan tree with its lush green leaves, looking dark with its densely grown trees. It is inhabited by siddhas. Sita should offer with folded palms invocations for her wellbeing.
data.anv: ततः हरितच्छदम् with lush green leaves, महान्तम् large, बहुभि: by many, वृक्षै: trees, विवृध्दम्  densely grown, सिध्दोपसेवितम् inhabited by siddhas (sages who have attained perfection), श्यामम् dark (shady), न्यग्रोधम् banyan tree, आसाद्य having approached, सीता Sita, तस्मै to it, अञ्जलिम् folded palms, कृत्वा having made, शिवाः auspicious, आशिष: invocations, प्रयुञ्जीत offer.

data.v: क्रोशमात्रं ततो गत्वा नीलं द्रक्ष्यथ काननम् । पलाशबदरीमिश्रं राम वंशैश्च यामुनैः ।।
data.es: Reaching that tree, you may tarry or proceed further. A krosa from there, you will see a beautiful forest filled with dark trees mixed with Palasas and badaris and bamboos on the Yamuna.
data.anv: तम् वृक्षम् that tree, समासाद्य having reached, वसेद्वा one may tarry or, अतिक्रमेत वा or can go past, तत: from there, क्रोशमात्रम् at a distance of a krosa, गत्वा having gone, नीलम् dark, पलाशबदरीमिश्रम् mixed with Palasa and Badari trees, यामुनै: on Yamuna, वंशै: च with bamboos also, रम्यम् beautiful, काननम् forest, द्रक्ष्यथ you will see.

data.v: स पन्थाश्चित्रकूटस्य गतः सुबहुशो मया । रम्यो मार्दवयुक्तश्च वनदावैर्विवर्जितः । इति पन्थानमावेद्य महर्षिः स न्यवर्तत ।।
data.es: That path leads to Chitrakuta. I had travelled through it several times. It is beautiful, smooth and safe from forest fires.
data.anv: स: that one, चित्रकूटस्य of Chitrakuta, पन्था: path, मया by me, बहुश: several times, गत: gone, रम्य beautiful, मार्दवयुक्तश्च marked with smoothness, वनदावै: forest fires, विवर्जित: is without.
data.md: I went to Citrakuța many a time by that road, which is beautiful, sandy, and free from forestfire.

data.v: उपावृत्ते मुनौ तस्मिन्रामो लक्ष्मणमब्रवीत् । कृतपुण्याः स्म सौमित्रे मुनिर्यन्नोऽनुकम्पते ।।
data.es: With the sage gone, Rama said, O Saumitri (son of Sumitra) we are lucky, for the sage has been so kind.
data.anv: तस्मिन् मुनौ the sage (Bharadhwaja), उपावृत्ते having turned back, राम Rama, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् said, सौमित्रे son of Sumitra, Lakshmana, कृतपुण्या: स्म we are fortunate indeed, यत् since, मुनिः the sage, न: on us, अनुकम्पते is showing compassion.
data.md: On the ascetic turning away, Rāma spoke to Lakṣmaṇa, “We had surely acquired religious merit, good betide you, since, the ascetic has shown compassion to us.

data.v: इति तौ पुरुषव्याघ्रौ मन्त्रयित्वा मनस्विनौ । सीतामेवाग्रतः कृत्वा कालिन्दीं जग्मतुर्नदीम् ।।
data.es: Thus talking with one another, the two nobleminded tigers (best) among men advanced towards river Kalindi (Yamuna) with Sita walking in front.
data.anv: मनस्विनौ nobleminded, तौ those two, पुरुषव्याघ्रौ tigers (best) among men, इति thus, मन्त्रयित्वा conversing, सीताम् to Sita, अग्रत: इव ahead of them, कृत्वा keeping, कालिन्दीं नदीम्     towards river Kalindi (Yamuna), जग्मतु: proceeded.
data.md: Having thus conversed with each other, those foremost of men endowed with intelligence, place Sītā in their front, proceeded towards the rive Kalindi.

data.v: तौ काष्ठसंघाटमथो चक्रतुः सुमहाप्लवम् । चकार लक्ष्मणश्छित्त्वा सीतायाः सुखमानसम् ।।
data.es: Then they both made a big wooden float by joining logs of wood, spreading bamboos on it and covering it with the (fragrant roots of) Ushira bushes.
data.anv: अथ then, तौ both of them, शुष्कै: with dry, वंशै: bamboos, समास्तीर्णम् wellspread, उशीरै: fragrant roots of Ushira bush, समावृतम् covered with, काष्टसङ्घातम् with logs of wood joined together, महाप्लवम् big float, चक्रतु: made.
data.md: Then with heaps of dry wild wood covered with grass, they constructed a large raft. And the puissant Lakşmaņa tearing twigs from the ratan and the rose-apple, made a comfortable seat for Sita.

data.v: तत्र श्रियमिवाचिन्त्यां रामो दाशरथिः प्रियाम् । ईषत्संलज्जमानां तामध्यारोपयत प्लवम् ।।
data.es: Rama, son of Dasaratha helped his beloved (Sita), who was looking inconceivably like Lakshmi (goddess of wealth) and was feeling a little bashful while stepping on to the float.
data.anv: दाशरथि: Dasaratha's son, रामः Rama, तत्र there, श्रियमिव looking like Lakshmi (goddess of wealth), अचिन्त्याम् inconceivable (majesty), ईषत् a little, संलज्जमानाम् feeling shy, ताम् प्रियाम् that beloved Sita, प्लवम् float, अध्यारोपयत ascended.
data.md: Then Dasaratha's son, Rāma, made his bashful wife (in power) inconceivable like to Śrī herself, ascend the raft, and carefully laid beside Vaidehī her attires and ornaments as well as the hoe and the basket.

data.v: ततः प्लवेनांशुमतीं शीघ्रगामूर्मिमालिनीम् । तीरजैर्बहुभिर्वृक्षैः संतेरुर्यमुनां नदीम् ।।
data.es: They crossed the swiftflowing river Yamuna, daughter of the Sungod, full of waves and with trees growing thick on her banks.
data.anv: तत: then, शीघ्रगाम् swiftflowing, ऊर्मिमालिनीम् full of waves, तीरजै: growing on the banks, बहुभि: many, वृक्षै: trees, अंशुमतीम् daughter of the Sungod, यमुनां नदीम् river Yamuna, सन्तेरु: crossed.
data.md: And by means of that raft they crossed that fleet-coursing daughter of the Sun, heaving with billows, the river Yamunā with her banks abounding with innumerable trees.

data.v: ते तीर्णाः प्लवमुत्सृज्य प्रस्थाय यमुनावनात् । श्यामं न्यग्रोधमासेदुः शीतलं हरितच्छदम् ।।
data.es: Having crossed the river, they left the float and proceeded from the adjoining forest of Yamuna and reached the dark, cool banyan tree covered with lush green leaves.
data.anv: तीर्णा: having crossed, ते they, प्लवम् raft, उत्सृज्य after leaving, यमुनावनात् from the forest adjoining Yamuna river, प्रस्थाय after starting, हरितच्छदम् a place full of greenery, शीतलम्  cool, श्यामम् dark, न्यग्रोधम् banyan tree, असेदु: reached.
data.md: Then renouncing the raft, and passing by the woods adjoining the Yamunā, they came upon a banian Syāma by name, of cool shade and verdant foliage.

data.v: कौसल्यां चैव पश्येयं सुमित्रां च यशस्विनीम् । इति सीताञ्जलिं कृत्वा पर्यगछद्वनस्पतिम् ।।
data.es: Having reached the banyan tree, Sita invoked it, saying, 'O great tree I offer you my salutations. May my husband fulfil his vow May I behold Kausalya and the illustrious Sumitra on my return. Saying so, she went round the tree offering reverential salutations with folded hands.
data.anv: वैदेही Sita, तं न्यग्रोधम् that banyan tree, उपागम्य having reached, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said, महावृक्ष O great tree, ते to you, नम:अस्तु my salutations, मे पतिः my husband, व्रतम् vow, पारयेत् may fulfil, कौशल्यां च and Kausalya, यशश्विनीम् illustrious, सुमित्रां च also Sumitra, पश्येयम् may I behold, सीता Sita, इति in this way, अञ्जलिं कृत्वा offering reverential salutations with folded hands, वनस्पतिम् to the tree, पर्यगच्छत् went round.

data.v: क्रोशमात्रं ततो गत्वा भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ । बहून्मेध्यान्मृगान्हत्वा चेरतुर्यमुनावने ।।
data.es: After walking a krosa into the forest on the bank of Yamuna, the two brothers killed many deer suitable for sacrifice and ate them.
data.anv: तत: then, भ्रातरौ the two brothers, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, क्रोशमात्रम् a krosa, गत्वा having gone, मेध्यान् suitable for sacrifice (pure), बहून् many, मृगान् deer, हत्वा having slain, यमुनावने in the forest on the bank of Yamuna, चेरतु: ate.
data.md: And having proceeded just a Krosa, those brothers, Rāma and Lakşmaņa, having killed many a sacred deer, began to range in the woods of the Yarnunā.

data.v: विहृत्य ते बर्हिणपूगनादिते; शुभे वने वारणवानरायुते । समं नदीवप्रमुपेत्य संमतं; निवासमाजग्मुरदीनदर्शनः ।।
data.es: They reached the tableland on the bank of that river and moved in high spirit in the lovely forest resounding with cries of flocks of peacocks and teeming with monkeys and elephants. Finally they selected a spot for their stay.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे पञ्चपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyfifth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: अदीनदर्शना: appearing in high spirits, ते they, बर्हिणपूगनादिते resounding with the melody of peacocks, वानरवारणायुते inhabited by monkeys and elephants, शुभे वने in that lovely forest, विहृत्य roaming about, समम् levelled, सम्मतम् convenient, नदीवप्रम् bank of the river, उपेत्य having reached, निवासम् dwelling, आजग्मतु: made.
data.md: And having disported in the beautiful woods resounding with multitudes of peacocks and inhabited by elephants and monkeys, they looking as lively as ever, coming to the level banks of the river, took up their quarters there.

data.v: अथ रात्र्यां व्यतीतायामवसुप्तमनन्तरम् । प्रबोधयामास शनैर्लक्ष्मणं रघुनन्दनः ।।
data.es: When the night was over, Rama, Delight of the Raghus, gently awakened Lakshmana who was asleep.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, रघुनन्दन: Delight of the Raghus (Rama), रात्र्याम् night, अतीतायाम् had passed, अनन्तरम् then, अवसुप्तम् sleeping, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, शनै: gently, प्रबोधयामास awakened.
data.md: When the night had been spent, that best of Raghus gently awakened Lakşmaņa from his light sleep.

data.v: सौमित्रे शृणु वन्यानां वल्गु व्याहरतां स्वनम् । संप्रतिष्ठामहे कालः प्रस्थानस्य परंतप ।।
data.es: Listen to the songs of the forest birds, O son of Sumitra O tormentor of foes it is time we set out.
data.anv: सौमित्रे  Saumitri (son of Sumitra), वल्गु sweet, व्याहरताम् singing, वन्यानाम् of the sylvan birds, स्वनम् voices, श्रुणु you may listen, परन्तप O tormentor of enemies, प्रस्थानस्य  to set out, काल: time, सम्प्रतिष्ठामहे we shall set out.
data.md: O Sumiträ's son, do you hear the dulcet notes of the birds in the woods. Let us proceed. O repressor of foes, the time of our departure is present.

data.v: स सुप्तः समये भ्रात्रा लक्ष्मणः प्रतिबोधितः । जहौ निद्रां च तन्द्रीं च प्रसक्तं च पथि श्रमम् ।।
data.es: Awakened by his brother in time, Lakshmana shook off his sleep, his drowsiness and his fatigue due to journey.
data.anv: सुप्त: one asleep, स: लक्ष्मण: that Lakshmana, समये in time, भ्रात्रा by his brother, प्रतिबोधित: awakened, निद्रां च sleep, तन्द्रीं च and drowsiness, पथि during journey, प्रसक्तम् associated with, श्रमं च fatigue, जहौ cast off.
data.md: Awakened at the proper time, Rāma's brother left off sleep and drowsiness and clinging fatigue.

data.v: तत उत्थाय ते सर्वे स्पृष्ट्वा नद्याः शिवं जलम् । पन्थानमृषिणोद्दिष्टं चित्रकूटस्य तं ययुः ।।
data.es: Then they all rose, touched the river's auspicious waters and went the way the sage had directed -- towards mount Chitrakuta.
data.anv: तत: then, ते सर्वे they all, उत्थाय rising, नद्या: river's, शिवम् auspicious, जलम् water, स्पृष्ट्वा having touched, ऋषिणा by the sage (Bharadwaja), आदिष्टम् directed, तम् that, चित्रकूटस्य of Chitrakuta, पन्थानम् path, ययु: went.
data.md: Then they all arising touched the sacred waters of the river, and began to proceed on the way to Citrakuța inhabited by ascetics.

data.v: ततः संप्रस्थितः काले रामः सौमित्रिणा सह । सीतां कमलपत्राक्षीमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Early in the morning Rama set out with Lakshmana and said this to Sita with eyes like lotus petals:
data.anv: तत: then, काले at the proper time, सौमित्रिणा सह along with Lakshmana, सम्प्रस्थित:  setting out, राम: Rama, कमलपत्राक्षीम् eyes like lotus petals, सीताम् addressing Sita, इदं वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Setting out in season with Sumitra's son, he of eyes resembling lotus-petais spoke these words to Sītā.

data.v: आदीप्तानिव वैदेहि सर्वतः पुष्पितान्नगान् । स्वैः पुष्पैः किंशुकान्पश्य मालिनः शिशिरात्यये ।।
data.es: O daughter of Videha behold these kimsuka trees in full bloom everywhere. With the passing of winter, they appear bright as though they are garlanded by their own flowers.
data.anv: वैदेहि O daughter of Videha (Sita), शिशिरात्यये at the end of winter, सर्वत: all over, पुष्पितान् in full bloom, आदीप्तानिव as if illuminated, स्त्वै: by their own, पुष्पै: flowers, मालिन: garland, किंशुकान् नगान् Kimsuka trees, पश्य see.
data.md: O Vaidehi, behold these flowering trees, the Kinsukas in spring appearing engarlanded with their own flowers, and as if flaming., Do you behold the Bhallatakas and Bilvas bending beneath their fruits and flowers, with no man to enjoy them. Surely, we: shall be able to live here.

data.v: पश्य भल्लातकान्फुल्लान्नरैरनुपसेवितान् । फलपत्रैरवनतान्नूनं शक्ष्यामि जीवितुम् ।।
data.es: Behold these bhallataka trees in full bloom though there are none to enjoy them. They are bent with fruits and leaves. Surely, we can live here. (This place is fit for our habitation).
data.anv: फुल्लान् in full bloom, फलपत्रै: with fruits and leaves, अवनतान् bent low, नरै: by people, अनुपसेवितान् not enjoyed, भल्लातकान् bhallataka trees, पश्य see, नूनम् surely, जीवितुम् to reside, शक्ष्याम able.

data.v: पश्य द्रोणप्रमाणानि लम्बमानानि लक्ष्मण । मधूनि मधुकारीभिः संभृतानि नगे नगे ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana see the honeycombs of the size of wooden vessels crowded by the honeybees hanging down from every tree.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, नगे नगे in every tree, मधुकारीभि: by bees, सम्भृतानि assembled, द्रोणप्रमाणानि of the size of wooden vessels, लम्बमानानि hanging down, मधूनि honey, पश्य see.
data.md: Behold, O Laksmana, these honeycombs measuring about a Droņa have been hung up on trees by the bees.

data.v: एष क्रोशति नत्यूहस्तं शिखी प्रतिकूजति । रमणीये वनोद्देशे पुष्पसंस्तरसंकटे ।।
data.es: In this delightful forest region strewn with fallen flowers the peacock is responding to the screaming of natyuha bird.
data.anv: पुष्पसंस्तरसङ्कटे on the ground strewn with fallen flowers, रमणीये in a delightful, वनोद्धेशे in the forest region, एष: this, नत्यूह: natyuha (a type of cuckoo), क्रोशति is screaming, तम् that bird, शिखी peacock, प्रतिकूजति responding with its screaming.
data.md: In the charming woods overarched by flowers, the Datyuha cries, and is responded to by the peacock.

data.v: मातंगयूथानुसृतं पक्षिसंघानुनादितम् । चित्रकूटमिमं पश्य प्रवृद्धशिखरं गिरिम् ।।
data.es: See these flocks of singing birds followed by herds of elephants. See this mount Chitrakuta with its towering peaks.
data.anv: मातङ्गयूथानुसृतं followed by the herds of elephants, पक्षिसंङ्घानुनादितम् with flocks of singing birds, प्रवृद्धशिखरम् with very towering peaks, इदम् this, गिरिम् mountain, पश्य see.
data.md: Do you behold Citrakuta frequented by mad elephants and resonant with the voice of multitudes of birds, the mountain with its towering summits.

data.v: ततस्तौ पादचारेण गच्छन्तौ सह सीतया । रम्यमासेदतुः शैलं चित्रकूटं मनोरमम् ।।
data.es: Then they both along with Sita walked to that lovely, delightful Chitrakuta mountain.
data.anv: तत: then, सीतयासह with Sita, पादचारेण walking on foot, गच्छन्तौ going, तौ both (Rama and Lakshmana), रम्यम् beautiful, मनोरमम् delightful, चित्रकूटं शैलम् Chitrakuta mountain, आसेदतुः reached.
data.md: Then they proceeding on foot along with Sītā, arrived at the charming and beautiful mountain Citrakuta.

data.v: तं तु पर्वतमासाद्य नानापक्षिगणायुतम् । अयं वासो भवेत्तावदत्र सौम्य रमेमहि ।।
data.es: Rama arrived at that enchanting mountain full of various kinds of birds, fruits and roots, and sweet water. (And said to Lakshmana:)
data.anv: नानापक्षिगणायुतम् filled with various kinds of birds, बहुमूलफलम् with varieties of roots and fruits, रम्यम् enchanting, सम्पन्नम् rich, सरसोदकम् of tasty water, तं पर्वतम् that mountain, आसाद्य having reached, (Rama said).
data.md: Arriving at the mountain inhabited by birds of various kinds, abounding in fruits and roots, and furnished with watery expanses, (Răma) said.

data.v: लक्ष्मणानय दारूणि दृढानि च वराणि च । कुरुष्वावसथं सौम्य वासे मेऽभिरतं मनः ।।
data.es: O handsome Lakshmana, make a hut with strong, sound logs of wood. My mind impels me to stay here.
data.anv: सौम्य लक्ष्मण O handsome Lakshmana, दृढानि strong, वराणि च good, दारूणि logs of wood, आनय fetch, अवसथम् a dwelling, कुरुष्व build, मे मन: my mind, वासे in staying, अभिरतम् is eager.
data.md: O Lakşmaņa, bring you wood good and strong. O amiable one, construct a dwelling. My mind is set upon staying here.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा सौमित्रिर्विविधान्द्रुमान् । आजहार ततश्चक्रे पर्ण शालामरिं दम ।।
data.es: Having heard Rama, Saumitri, the subduer of enemies fetched different kinds of logs of wood, and with them made a hut and thatched it with leaves.
data.anv: सौमित्रि: son of Sumitra (Lakshmana), तस्य Rama's, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, विविधान् different kinds of, दृमान् logs of wood, आजहार fetched, अरिन्दम: subduer of enemies, तत: then, पर्णशालाम् cottage thatched with leaves, चक्रे built.
data.md: Hearing his words, Sumitra's son procured woods of various descriptions, and then that subduer of foes reared a cottage thatched with leaves.

data.v: शुश्रूषमाणमेकाग्रमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् । ऐणेयं मांसमाहृत्य शालां यक्ष्यामहे वयम् ।।
स लक्ष्मणः कृष्णमृगं हत्वा मेध्यं पतापवान् । अथ चिक्षेप सौमित्रिः समिद्धे जातवेदसि ।।
data.es: Then the powerful son of Sumitra killed a black antelope fit for offering, and offered it to the wellkindled fire.
data.anv: अथ then, सौमित्रि: son of Sumitra, प्रतापवान् powerful, स: लक्ष्मण: that Lakshmana, मेथ्यम् fit for offering pure, कृष्णमृगम् black antelope, हत्वा having killed, समिद्धे in a wellkindled, जातवेदसि fire, चिक्षेप offered.
data.md: Then Lakşmana the son of Sumitrā endowed with vigour, having slain a sacred black deer, threw it into flaming fire.

data.v: तं तु पक्वं समाज्ञाय निष्टप्तं छिन्नशोणितम् । लक्ष्मणः पुरुषव्याघ्रमथ राघवमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: With the blood drained out of the venison, Lakshmana roasted it and cooked it well, and then said to Rama, the tiger (best) among men.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण: Lakshmana, निष्टप्तम् roasted well, छिन्नशोणितम् with blood drained out, तम् that, पक्वम्  cooked, परिज्ञाय having found, अथ then, पुरुषव्याघ्रम् tiger (best) among men, राघवम् to Rama, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: And seeing it well scorched and hot and free from blood, Lakşmaņa spoke to that foremost of men, Rāghava, saying.

data.v: अयं कृष्णः समाप्ताङ्गः शृतः कृष्ण मृगो यथा । देवता देवसंकाश यजस्व कुशलो ह्यसि ।।
data.es: This black antelope with all its limbs is wellcooked. O divine sire, you may make the offering to Vastu devata in which you are proficient.
data.anv: समस्ताङ्ग: with all the limbs, अयम् this, कृष्णमृग: black antelope, सर्व: completely, मया by me, श्रुत: is wellcooked, देवसङ्काश like a god, देवता: devatas, यजस्व offer with sacrifice, कुशल: असि हि you are proficient.

data.v: रामः स्नात्वा तु नियतो गुणवाञ्जप्यकोविदः । पापसंशमनं रामश्चकार बलिमुत्तमम् ।।
data.es: Virtuous Rama, who was an expert in the recitation of mantras, took his bath and his mind controlled, intoned briefly all the mantras appropriate to the completion of the ritual.
data.anv: गुणवान् virtuous,जप्यकोविद: expert in reciting appropriate mantras, राम: Rama, स्नात्वा having bathed, नियत: with his senses restrained, सत्रावसानिकान् rites performed at the end of the ritual, सर्वान् all that, मन्त्रान् mantras, सङ्ग्रहेण briefly, अकरोत् performed (intoned).

data.v: तां वृक्षपर्णच्छदनां मनोज्ञां; यथाप्रदेशं सुकृतां निवाताम् । वासाय सर्वे विविशुः समेताः; सभां यथा देव गणाः सुधर्माम् ।।
data.anv: वृक्षपर्णच्छदनाम् covered with the leaves of trees, मनोज्ञाम् charming, यथाप्रदेशम् built on a suitable site, सुकृताम् wellbuilt, निवाताम् protected against storm, ताम् that hut, सर्वे all, समेता together, वासाय for purposes of living, देवगणाः gods, सुधर्माम् Sudharma, सभां यथा like the court, विविशु: entered.
data.md: And as the celestials enter the hall entitled Sudharmă, they together with the view of dwelling in it, entered the mansion beautiful to behold, thatched with the leaves of trees, built at a convenient site, well-made, and keeping out the wind.

data.v: अनेकनानामृगपक्षिसंकुले; विचित्रपुष्पस्तबलैर्द्रुमैर्युते । वनोत्तमे व्यालमृगानुनादिते; तथा विजह्रुः सुसुखं जितेन्द्रियाः ।।
data.anv: तदा then, जितेन्द्रियाः who had conquered the senses, अनेकनानामृगपक्षिसङ्कुले filled with  many varieties of animals and birds, विचित्रपुष्पस्तबकै: with bunches of bright flowers, द्रुमै with trees, युते full of, व्यालमृगानुनादिते echoing with the sounds of wild animals, वनोत्तमे in that splendid forest, सुसुखम् very happily, विजह्रु: wandered.

data.v: सुरम्यमासाद्य तु चित्रकूटं; नदीं च तां माल्यवतीं सुतीर्थाम् । ननन्द हृष्टो मृगपक्षिजुष्टां; जहौ च दुःखं पुरविप्रवासात् ।।
data.anv: सुरम्यम् marvellous, चित्रकूटम् mount Chitrakuta, आसाद्य having reached, सुतीर्थाम् with excellent holy places, मृगपक्षिजुष्टाम् full of animals and birds, ताम् that, माल्यवतीं नदीं च that Malyavati river, हृष्ट: filled with delight, ननन्द rejoiced, पुरविप्रवासात् banishment from the city, दुखम् sorrow, जहौ च left.
data.md: And having come to the charming Citrakuta and the river Mālyavatī furnished with excellent bathing places, and haunted by beasts and fowls, they rejoiced with glad hearts, and forsook the grief incident to their exile from the city.

data.v: कथयित्वा सुदुःखार्तः सुमन्त्रेण चिरं सह । रामे दक्षिण कूलस्थे जगाम स्वगृहं गुहः ।।
data.es: Until Rama reached the southern bank, Guha kept talking with Sumantra for long and returned home with great sorrow.
data.anv: रामे Rama, दक्षिणकूलस्थे had reached the southern bank (of the river), गुह: Guha, सुमन्त्रेण सह with Sumantra, चिरम् for a long while, कथयित्वा after talking, सुदुःखार्तः tormented with anguish, स्वगृहम् his home, जगाम reached.
data.md: Having for a long time conversed with Sumantra, Guha distressed at heart on Rāma reaching the southern bank, retraced his steps homewards.

data.v: अनुज्ञातः सुमन्त्रोऽथ योजयित्वा हयोत्तमान् । अयोध्यामेव नगरीं प्रययौ गाढदुर्मनाः ।।
data.es: Permitted by Rama to leave, Sumantra harnessed the best of horses and set out for the city of Ayodhya with a heavy heart.
data.anv: अथ after this, अनुज्ञातः having been permitted by Rama to leave, सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, हयोत्तमान् best of horses, योजयित्वा harnessing, गाढदुर्मनाः with a heavy heart, अयोध्यां नगरीमेव to the city of Ayodhya, प्रययौ set out.
data.md: Learning from envoys at (Śrngaverapura) all about Rāma's visit to Bharadvāja at Prayāga and his reception (at Bharadvāja's place) as well as their destined journey (to Citrakuta), Sumantra, taking the permission (of Guha), yoked those excellent horses and with a heavy heart directed his course to the city of Ayodhyā.

data.v: स वनानि सुगन्धीनि सरितश्च सरांसि च । पश्यन्नतिययौ शीघ्रं ग्रामाणि नगराणि च ।।
data.es: Beholding the fragrancefilled forests, rivers, lakes, villages and towns on the way, Sumantra quickly crossed them.
data.anv: सः that, सुगन्धीनि fragrant, वनानि forests, सरितः च rivers as well, सरांसि च lakes also, ग्रामाणि villages, नगराणि च towns also, पश्यन् seeing, शीघ्रम् swiftly, अतिययौ passed through them.
data.md: And beholding perfumed woods and rivers and watery expanses and towns and villages, he eagerly proceeded on his way.

data.v: ततः सायाह्नसमये तृतीयेऽहनि सारथिः । अयोध्यां समनुप्राप्य निरानन्दां ददर्श ह ।।
data.es: The charioteer reached Ayodhya on the third day at dusk and found the city cheerless.
data.anv: सारथिः charioteer, तृतीये on the third, अहनि day, सायाह्न समये at dusk, निरानन्दाम् cheerless, अयोध्याम् Ayodhya, समनुप्राप्य having reached, ददर्श ह saw.
data.md: And on the third day at dusk the charioteer arriving at Ayodhyā saw it bereft of happiness.

data.v: स शून्यामिव निःशब्दां दृष्ट्वा परमदुर्मनाः । सुमन्त्रश्चिन्तयामास शोकवेगसमाहतः ।।
