data.es: Beholding the silent city, almost empty, the deeply depressed Sumantra, afflicted with gushing tears reflected:
data.anv: सः सुमन्त्रः that Sumantra, निश्शब्दाम् silent, शून्यामिव almost empty, दृष्ट्वा having seen, परमदुर्मनाः deeply dejected, शोकवेगसमाहतः afflicted with gushing tears, चिन्तयामास reflected.
data.md: And beholding it empty and still, Sumantra afflicted with exceeding sorrow, and overwhelmed with grief, thought, “Perhaps the city with her elephants and horses and men and king has been consumed by the fire of grief on account of Rāma."

data.v: कच्चिन्न सगजा साश्वा सजना सजनाधिपा । रामसंतापदुःखेन दग्धा शोकाग्निना पुरी । इति चिन्तापरः सूतस्त्वरितः प्रविवेश ह ।।
data.es: Has the city along with its elephants, horses, people and its king perished in the fire of grief for Rama?
data.anv: सगजाः with elephants, साऽश्वाः with horses, सजनाः with its people, सजनाधिपा with the king, पुरी city, रामसन्तापदुःखेन in the sorrow caused by Rama's suffering, शोकाग्निना by the fire of sorrow, दग्धा burnt.

data.v: सुमन्त्रमभियान्तं तं शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः । क्व राम इति पृच्छन्तः सूतमभ्यद्रवन्नराः ।।
data.es: Meanwhile as the charioteer was moving towards the city, hundreds and thousands of men came pouring towards him enquiring, 'Where is Rama?'
data.anv: अथ thereafter, अभियान्तम् moving towards, तम् that, सूतम् charioteer, सुमन्त्रम् Sumantra, रामः Rama, क्व where?, इति thus, पृच्छन्तः enquiring, नराः people, शतशः in hundreds, सहस्रशः in thousands, अभ्यद्रवन् poured towards him.
data.md: Thereupon, people by hundreds and thousands rushed after the charioteer, Sumantra, asking, "Where is Rāma?”

data.v: तेषां शशंस गङ्गायामहमापृच्छ्य राघवम् । अनुज्ञातो निवृत्तोऽस्मि धार्मिकेण महात्मना ।।
data.es: I took leave of the great, righteous Rama on the bank of the Ganga and have returned with his permission. (replied Sumantra).
data.anv: अहम् I, गङ्गायाम् river Ganga, राघवम् Rama, आपृच्छ्य having taken leave, धार्मिकेण by the  righteous, महात्मना great (Rama), अनुज्ञातः having been permitted, निवृत्तः अस्मि I have returned, तेषाम् to them, शशंस said.

data.v: ते तीर्णा इति विज्ञाय बाष्पपूर्णमुखा जनाः । अहो धिगिति निःश्वस्य हा रामेति च चुक्रुशुः ।।
data.es: Hearing that they had (the trio) crossed the river Ganga, the people, with their faces filled with tears sighed and saying 'Fie upon us Alas, Rama' cried out aloud.
data.anv: ते they, तीर्णाः इति crossed the river, thus, विज्ञाय having come to know, जनाः people, बाष्पपूर्णमुखाः faces filled with tears, अहो Oh, धिक् O fie upon us, इति thus, निश्श्वस्य sighing, हा राम इति saying 'Alas Rama', चुक्रुशुः च cried aloud.

data.v: शुश्राव च वचस्तेषां वृन्दं वृन्दं च तिष्ठताम् । हताः स्म खलु ये नेह पश्याम इति राघवम् ।।
data.es: He saw them gathering in groups, saying, Henceforth we will not be able to see Rama and without him, we are lost indeed.
data.anv: ये all of us, इह here, राघवम् Rama, न पश्यामः unable to see, हताः स्म खलु indeed we are  lost (deprived), इति thus saying, बृन्दम् बृन्दम् in groups, तिष्ठताम् standing, तेषाम् their, वचः words, शुश्राव च also heard.

data.v: दानयज्ञविवाहेषु समाजेषु महत्सु च । न द्रक्ष्यामः पुनर्जातु धार्मिकं राममन्तरा ।।
data.es: No longer will we see Rama at sacrifices, weddings, great assemblies and at places of charitable activity.
data.anv: दानयज्ञविवाहेषु in acts of charity, sacrifices and weddings, महत्सु in great, समाजेषु च  assemblies also, अन्तरा in their midst, धार्मिकम् righteous, रामम् Rama, पुनः again, जातु ever, न द्रक्ष्यामः will not see.
data.md: We shall no longer see the righteous Rāma in the midst of mighty assemblies engaged in charity, sacrifice or nuptial rites.

data.v: किं समर्थं जनस्यास्य किं प्रियं किं सुखावहम् । इति रामेण नगरं पितृवत्परिपालितम् ।।
data.es: Rama looked after his people like a father always thinking what was good for them, dear to them and comfortable to them.
data.anv: अस्य जनस्य to these people, किम् what, समर्थम् is meaningful, किम् what, प्रियम् pleases, किम् what, सुखावहम् brings happiness, इति in this way, रामेण by Rama, नगरम् this city of Ayodhya, पितृवत् like father, परिपालितम् looked after.
data.md: What was necessary for this body? What was dear to them and what did they delight in?, (constantly revolving all this in his mind), Rāma ruled this city even as father.

data.v: वातायनगतानां च स्त्रीणामन्वन्तरापणम् । रामशोकाभितप्तानां शुश्राव परिदेवनम् ।।
data.es: (He) heard wailings of women looking through the window and of the people in marketplaces burning with sorrow over Rama's exile.
data.anv: वातायनगतानाम् looking through the windows, स्त्रीणाम् women's, अन्वन्तरापणम् in the stalls, रामशोकाभितप्तानाम् burning with sorrow due to Rama's exile, परिदेवनम् bewailings, शुश्राव heard.
data.md: Then proceeding past the stalls, Sumantra heard the lamentations of females at windows, burning in grief for Rāma.

data.v: स राजमार्गमध्येन सुमन्त्रः पिहिताननः । यत्र राजा दशरथस्तदेवोपययौ गृहम् ।।
data.es: Sumantra with his face muffled, drove along the highway straight to the palace of king Dasaratha.
data.anv: सः सुमन्त्रः that Sumantra, पिहिताननः with his face muffled, राजमार्गमध्येन along the highway, राजा दशरथः king Dasaratha, यत्र where, तत् that, गृहम् house, उपययौ reached straight.
data.md: With his face muffled, Sumantra proceeded on the highway towards the palace of Daśaratha.

data.v: सोऽवतीर्य रथाच्छीघ्रं राजवेश्म प्रविश्य च । कक्ष्याः सप्ताभिचक्राम महाजनसमाकुलाः ।।
data.es: Quickly alighting from the chariot, he entered the king's palace and crossed the seven courtyards overcrowded with people.
data.anv: सः that, रथात् from the chariot, अवतीर्य alighting, शीघ्रम् quickly, राजवेश्म king's palace, प्रविश्य च having entered, महाजनसमाकुलाः overcrowded with people, सप्त seven, कक्ष्याः courtyards, अभिक्राम crossed.
data.md: Swiftly alighting from the car and entering the royal residence, he went past seven apartments thronged with people.

data.v: ततो दशरथस्त्रीणां प्रासादेभ्यस्ततस्ततः । रामशोकाभितप्तानां मन्दं शुश्राव जल्पितम् ।।
data.es: (He) heard wailings of women looking through the window and of the people in marketplaces burning with sorrow over Rama's exile.
data.anv: ततः then, ततस्ततः here and there, प्रासाद्येभ्यः from palaces, रामशोकाभितप्तानाम् afflicted with sorrow due to Rama's exile, दशरथस्त्रीणाम् of the wives of Dasaratha, मन्दम् जल्पितम् whispers, शुश्राव heard.
data.md: Waxing still more aggrieved, the females looked at each other with their expansive and transparent eyes fast flooded with tears. And then he heard the talk, as toned down it proceeded from the royal mansions, of the wives of Dasaratha afflicted with grief for Rāma.

data.v: सह रामेण निर्यातो विना राममिहागतः । सूतः किं नाम कौसल्यां शोचन्तीं प्रतिवक्ष्यति ।।
data.es: The charioteer left with Rama and returned without him. What can he say to the wailing Kausalya?
data.anv: रामेण सह with Rama, निर्यातः went out, विना रामम् without Rama, इह here, आगतः returned, सूतः charioteer, शोचन्तीम् worrying, कौशल्याम् Kausalya, किं नाम what can, प्रतिवक्ष्यति will he say?
data.md: Going in company with Rāma, and returning without him, what will the charioteer answer Kausalya bewailing (for her son)?

data.v: यथा च मन्ये दुर्जीवमेवं न सुकरं ध्रुवम् । आच्छिद्य पुत्रे निर्याते कौसल्या यत्र जीवति ।।
data.es: I think it is indeed difficult for Kausalya to live wherever and whichever way she tries as she has been separated from her son. (the queens said).
data.anv: पुत्रे when the son, आच्छिद्य severing all connections, निर्याते had set out, कौसल्या Kausalya, यथा in whichever way, यत्र जीवति wherever surviving still, दुर्जीवम् it is difficult to live, मन्ये I consider, एवम् like this, सुकरम् easily, न not, ध्रुवम् certain.
data.md: Surely life is miserable, yet is incapable of being renounced, since, although her son leaving (the installation) has gone away, yet Kausalyā still lives.

data.v: सत्य रूपं तु तद्वाक्यं राज्ञः स्त्रीणां निशामयन् । प्रदीप्तमिव शोकेन विवेश सहसा गृहम् ।।
data.es: Listening to the correct words of the king's wives, he immediately entered the palace as if in flames (of grief).
data.anv: राज्ञ: king's, स्त्रीणाम् wives, सत्यरूपम् truth embodied, तत् वाक्यम् that word, निशामयन्  listening, सहसा immediately, शोकेन with grief, प्रदीप्तमिव as if burning, गृहम् house, विवेश entered.
data.md: Having heard those words of the queens, fraught with truth, Sumantra burning as it were in grief, at once entered the (next) apartment.

data.v: स प्रविश्याष्टमीं कक्ष्यां राजानं दीनमातुलम् । पुत्रशोकपरिद्यूनमपश्यत्पाण्डरे गृहे ।।
data.es: On entering the eighth courtyard, he saw in a pale white chamber king Dasaratha desolate, anguished and withered with the sorrow of separation from his son.
data.anv: सः he (Sumantra), अष्टमीम् eighth, कक्ष्याम् courtyard, प्रविश्य having entered, पाण्डुरे in pale white, गृहे chamber, दीनम् desolate, आतुरम् anguished, पुत्रशोकपरिम्लानम् withered by sorrow over his son, राजानम् king, अपश्यत् saw.
data.md: And entering the eighth apartment he beheld in a gloomy chamber the king distressed and in a pitiable plight, woe-begone for grief for his son.

data.v: अभिगम्य तमासीनं नरेन्द्रमभिवाद्य च । सुमन्त्रो रामवचनं यथोक्तं प्रत्यवेदयत् ।।
data.es: Sumantra approached the king who was seated, paid obeisance to him and conveyed Rama's words verbatim.
data.anv: सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, असीनम् seated, नरेन्द्रम् king, अभिगम्य having approached, अभिवाद्य paying  obeisance, रामवचनम् Rama's words, यदोक्तम् verbatim, प्रत्यवेदयत् conveyed.
data.md: Thereupon presenting himself before the monarch, Sumantra saluted him and then conveyed to the king the words of Rāma as he had uttered them.

data.v: स तूष्णीमेव तच्छ्रुत्वा राजा विभ्रान्त चेतनः । मूर्छितो न्यपतद्भूमौ रामशोकाभिपीडितः ।।
data.es: The king silently listened to Rama's message. Bewildered and tormented by the grief of Rama's absence, he fell down on the ground in a swoon.
data.anv: सः that, राजा king, तूष्णीमेव silently, तत् those words, श्रुत्वा having listened, विभ्रान्तचेतनः  with a bewildered mind, रामशोकाभिपीडितः tormented by the grief due to Rama's absence, मूर्छितः with senses lost, भूमौ on the ground, न्यपतत् fell.
data.md: Hearing them silently, the monarch with his mind exceedingly wrought, dropped down to the ground in a swoon, afflicted with grief for Rāma.

data.v: ततोऽन्तःपुरमाविद्धं मूर्छिते पृथिवीपतौ । उद्धृत्य बाहू चुक्रोश नृपतौ पतिते क्षितौ ।।
data.es: The moment the lord of the earth fell down on the ground unconscious, the women in the inner apartment burst into tears, raising their arms.
data.anv: ततः then, पृथिवीपतौ when lord of the earth (the king), मूर्छिते had fallen unconscious, अन्तःपुरम्  inner apartment, आविद्धम् broken down, नृपतौ king, क्षितौ on the ground, पतिते had fallen, बाहू arms, उद्धृत्य having raised, चुक्रोश cried loudly.
data.md: On the lord of earth swooning away and falling to the ground, the inmates of the inner apartment raising their burst into lamentations. arms of an

data.v: सुमित्रया तु सहिता कौसल्या पतितं पतिम् । उत्थापयामास तदा वचनं चेदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having seen her husband collapsed on the ground, Kausalya assisted by Sumitra lifted him up and said to him thus:
data.anv: तदा then, सुमित्रया सहिता together with Sumitra, कौशल्या Kausalya, पतितम् fallen on the ground, पतिम् husband, उत्थापयामास lifted him up, इदम् these, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Kausalyā availing herself of the aid of Sumantra, raised up her fallen lord and addressed him, saying.

data.v: इमं तस्य महाभाग दूतं दुष्करकारिणः । वनवासादनुप्राप्तं कस्मान्न प्रतिभाषसे ।।
data.es: O distinguished king, why are you not enquiring from the messenger about him (Rama) who is capable of performing arduous tasks?
data.anv: महाभाग O distinguished one, वनवासात् from the forest, अनुप्राप्तम् returned, दुष्करकारिणः one who had accomplished arduous tasks, तस्य Rama's, इमम् this, दूतम् messenger, कस्मात् why, न प्रतिभाषसे are not talking.
data.md: This, O eminently virtuous one, is the envoy of that one an exceedingly arduous achievement returned from the forest. Why do you not accost him?

data.v: अद्येममनयं कृत्वा व्यपत्रपसि राघव । उत्तिष्ठ सुकृतं तेऽस्तु शोके न स्यात्सहायता ।।
data.es: O descendant of the Raghus are you ashamed of having done an injustice? Arise. you may be a blessed one (for fulfilling your promise). If you grieve, none will help you.
data.anv: राघव O descendant of the Raghus, अनयम् injustice, कृत्वा having done, अद्य now, एवम् in this way, व्यपत्रपसि are feeling ashamed, उत्तिष्ठ rise, ते to you, सुकृतम् the merit (of having fullfilled your word), अस्तु obtained, शोके in this sorrow, सहायता help, न स्यात् will not get.
data.md: O descendant of Raghu, you are ashamed today, having done this wrong. Do you rise: merit be yours (arising from this act.) Let not your adherents come to naught (because of your sorrow).

data.v: देव यस्या भयाद्रामं नानुपृच्छसि सारथिम् । नेह तिष्ठति कैकेयी विश्रब्धं प्रतिभाष्यताम् ।।
data.es: Kaikeyi for fear of whom you dare not ask the charioteer about Rama, O king is not here. You may speak to him without fear.
data.anv: देव O king, यस्याः by whose, भयात् from fear, सारथिम् charioteer, रामम् about Rama, नानुपृच्छसि you are not enquiring, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, इह now, न तिष्ठति not here, विस्रब्धम् without fear, प्रतिभाष्यताम् you may speak.
data.md: O worshipful one, she from fear of whom you do not speak to the charioteer, Kaikeyi, is not here. Do you therefore speak to him without fear.

data.v: सा तथोक्त्वा महाराजं कौसल्या शोकलालसा । धरण्यां निपपाताशु बाष्पविप्लुतभाषिणी ।।
data.es: Absorbed in grief, Kausalya spoke to the maharaja in a voice choked with tears and then collapsed on the floor.
data.anv: बाष्पविप्लुतभाषिणी speaking with a voice choked with tears, शोकलालसा absorbed in grief, सा कौशल्या that Kausalya, महाराजम् to the maharaja, तथा that way, उक्त्वा having said, आशु suddenly, धरण्याम् on the ground, निपपात fell down.
data.md: Having said this to the monarch, Kausalyā overwhelmed with grief, with her voice oppressed with the vapour begot of emotion, all on a sudden fell to the earth.

data.v: एवं विलपतीं दृष्ट्वा कौसल्यां पतितां भुवि । पतिं चावेक्ष्य ताः सर्वाः सस्वरं रुरुदुः स्त्रियः ।।
data.es: All those women saw weeping Kausalya as well as their husband fallen on the ground and wailed loudly in a chorus.
data.anv: सर्वाः all, ताः स्त्रियः those women, एवम् thus, विलपतीम् lamenting, भुवि पतिताम्  fallen on the ground, कौशल्याम् Kausalya, दृष्ट्वा having seen, पतिं च also their husband, अवेक्ष्य having seen, सुस्वरम् in chorus, रुरुदुः wailed loudlly.
data.md: Behoiding Kausalyā fallen on the ground bewailing, as also their husband, the ladies seated around, began to Lament,

data.v: ततस्तमन्तःपुरनादमुत्थितं; समीक्ष्य वृद्धास्तरुणाश्च मानवाः । स्त्रियश्च सर्वा रुरुदुः समन्ततः; पुरं तदासीत्पुनरेव संकुलम् ।।
data.es: Having heard the sound emanating from the inner apartment, people, old, young and women, of the city lamented. The city was crowded again. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे सप्तपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyseventh sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, उत्थितम् rising, तम् that, अन्तःपुरनादम् sound from the inner apartment, समीक्षय having seen, वृद्धा: old, तरुणाश्च young, मानवाः people, सर्वाः all, स्त्रीयश्च also women, समन्ततः all around, रुरुदुः lamented, तदा then, पुरम् city, पुनरेव again, सङ्कुलम् आसीत् was filled (with people).
data.md: Hearing the sounds of wailing arise from the inner apartment, old and young as well as females, set up lamentations all round; and the city was again filled with them.

data.v: प्रत्याश्वस्तो यदा राजा मोहात्प्रत्यागतः पुनः । अथाजुहाव तं सूतं रामवृत्तान्तकारणात् ।।
data.es: When the king regained his consciousness and was consoled, he summoned the charioteer to hear news about Rama.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, राजा king, यदा when, प्रत्याश्वस्तः consoled, मोहात् from loss of consciousness, पुनः again, प्रत्यागतम् having regained his senses, रामवृत्तान्त कारणात् due to the news about Rama, तं सूतम् that charioteer, आजुहाव called for him.
data.md: When having been ministered to and when his senses has returned after the swoon, the king summoned Sumantra for hearing tidings of Rama.

data.v: वृद्धं परमसंतप्तं नवग्रहमिव द्विपम् । विनिःश्वसन्तं ध्यायन्तमस्वस्थमिव कुञ्जरम् ।।
data.es: Then the charioteer with folded palms approached the king who, deeply afflicted with grief and pain, was brooding over Rama alone. Aged Dasaratha was heaving deep sighs like a newlycaptured, indisposed elephant.
data.anv: अथ then, सूतः the charioteer, कृताञ्जलिः with folded palms, राममेव Rama alone, अनुशोचन्तम् thinking of Rama, दुःखशोकसमन्वितम् by grief and sorrow, वृद्धम्  aged, परमसन्तप्तम् deeply afflicted, नवग्रहम् newlycaptured, द्विपमिव like an elephant, विनिःश्वसन्तम् heaving deep sighs, अस्वस्थम् indisposed, कुञ्जरमिव like an elephant, ध्यायन्तम् brooding, महाराजम् king, उपस्थितः approached.

data.v: राजा तु रजसा सूतं ध्वस्ताङ्गं समुपस्थितम् । अश्रुपूर्णमुखं दीनमुवाच परमार्तवत् ।।
data.es: Seeing the dejected charioteer standing before him, the desolate king covered all over with dust and his face bathed in tears, said to him in extreme grief:
data.anv: राजा king, रजसा with dust, ध्वस्ताङ्गम् covered all over, अश्रुपूर्णमुखम् face bathed in tears, दीनम् dejected, समुपस्थितम् standing nearby,  सूतम् charioteer, परमार्तवत् filled with extreme grief, उवाच said.

data.v: क्व नु वत्स्यति धर्मात्मा वृक्षमूलमुपाश्रितः । सोऽत्यन्तसुखितः सूत किमशिष्यति राघवः । भूमिपालात्मजो भूमौ शेते कथमनाथवत् ।।
data.es: O charioteer Rama is rightous and he is acustoomed to all sorts of comfort. Taking refuge at the foot of a tree how shall he live and what shall he eat?
data.anv: सूत the charioteer, धर्मात्मा righteous (Rama), वृक्षमूलम् foot of the tree, उपाश्रितः having taken refuge, क्वनु where, वत्स्यति will he live?, अत्यन्त सुखितः enjoyed supreme luxury, स: राघवः that Rama, किम् what?, अशिष्यति will he eat?
data.md: Where stays that righteous one, taking refuge under a tree? lapped in luxury, what, O charioteer, will Rāghava feed on?

data.v: यं यान्तमनुयान्ति स्म पदातिरथकुञ्जराः । स वत्स्यति कथं रामो विजनं वनमाश्रितः ।।
data.es: Wherever Rama went, elephants, chariots and footsoldiers followed him. How can he (now) live in the desolate forest where he has taken refuge?
data.anv: यान्तम् when he went out, यम् whom, पदातिरथकुञ्जरा: footsoldiers, chariots and elephants, अनुयान्ति स्म followed, सः that, रामः Rama, विजनम् desolate, वनम् forest, आश्रितः having taken shelter, कथम् how, वत्स्यति can live.
data.md: How is Rāma passing his days in the lone forest, he who when he went out used to be followed by foot-men and elephants?

data.v: व्यालैर्मृगैराचरितं कृष्णसर्पनिषेवितम् । कथं कुमारौ वैदेह्या सार्धं वनमुपस्थितौ ।।
data.es: How can the two young men along with Vaidehi live in the forest infested with black cobras and wicked, wild animals?
data.anv: कुमारौ the two youths (Rama and Lakshmana), वैदेह्या सार्धम् with Vaidehi also, व्यालैः by wicked wild elephants, मृगैः animals, आचरितम् ranging about, कृष्णसर्पनिषेवितम् abounding in black cobras, वनम् forest, कथम् how, उपस्थितौ exist.
data.md: How are the princes in company with Vaidehi living in the woods, ranged by serpents and beasts and inhabited by black snakes?

data.v: सुकुमार्या तपस्विन्या सुमन्त्र सह सीतया । राजपुत्रौ कथं पादैरवरुह्य रथाद्गतौ ।।
data.es: O Sumantra how did those two princes along with pitiable, delicate Sita, alight from the chariot, and enter the forest on foot?
data.anv: सुमन्त्र Sumantra, राजपुत्रौ king's sons, सुकुमार्या along with delicate, तपस्विन्या by the pitiable, सीतया सह with Sita, रथात् from the chariot, पादैः on foot, अवरुह्य  alighting, कथम् how, गतौ did they go.
data.md: How, O Sumantra, having descended from the car, the princes along with the tender and unfortunate Sītā are proceeding on foot?

data.v: सिद्धार्थः खलु सूत त्वं येन दृष्टौ ममात्मजौ । वनान्तं प्रविशन्तौ तावश्विनाविव मन्दरम् ।।
data.es: You are blessed indeed, O charioteer to have seen my sons entering the outskirts of the forest like Aswinis stepping into the region of the Mandara mountain.
data.anv: सूत O charioteer, येन by you, अश्विनौ Aswinis, मन्दरम् इव like Mandara mountain, वनान्तम् on the outskirts of the forest, प्रविशन्तौ entering, मम my, आत्मजौ sons, दृष्टौ have been seen, त्वम् you, सिद्धार्थः खलु are blessed indeed.
data.md: O charioteer, surely you are blessed, for you have beheld my sons enter the forest, like the Asvins entering the Mandāra hill.

data.v: किमुवाच वचो रामः किमुवाच च लक्ष्मणः । सुमन्त्र वनमासाद्य किमुवाच च मैथिली । आसितं शयितं भुक्तं सूत रामस्य कीर्तय ।।
data.es: Upon reaching the forest, O Sumantra what did Rama, Lakshmana and Sita say?
data.anv: सुमन्त्र Sumantra, वनम् forest, आसाद्य on reaching, रामः Rama, किम् what?, वचः words, उवाच did speak, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, किम् what, उवाच did say, मैथिली च and Sita, किम् what, उवाच did say.
data.md: And what did Rāma say? And what did Laks mana? And, O Sumantra, arriving at the forest what did Mithila's daughter?

data.v: इति सूतो नरेन्द्रेण चोदितः सज्जमानया । उवाच वाचा राजानं सबाष्पपरिरब्धया ।।
data.es: Thus questioned by the king the charioteer, his voice choked with tears and words faltering in grief, addressed the king:
data.anv: नरेन्द्रेण by the king, Dasaratha, इति in this way, बोधितः questioned, सः सूतः that charioteer, बाष्पपरिबद्धया with voice choked with tears, सज्जमानया faltering with grief, वाचा  with words, राजानम् to the king, उवाच said.
data.md: Thus urged by the king, the charioteer spoke to the king with his voice faltering and suppressed with the vapour of grief.

data.v: अब्रवीन्मां महाराज धर्ममेवानुपालयन् । अञ्जलिं राघवः कृत्वा शिरसाभिप्रणम्य च ।।
data.es: With palms folded and head bowed, O great king Rama offered his salutations to you in confirmity with righteousness and said to me:
data.anv: महाराज O great king, राघवः the descendant of the Raghu race (Rama), धर्ममेव righteousness also, अनुपालयन् guarding, अञ्जलिम् with folded hands, कृत्वा having set, शिरसा bowing his head, अभिप्रणम्य च offering  salutations, माम् to me, अब्रवीत् said.

data.v: सूत मद्वचनात्तस्य तातस्य विदितात्मनः । शिरसा वन्दनीयस्य वन्द्यौ पादौ महात्मनः ।।
data.es: 'Convey on my behalf, O charioteer to my illustrious father who is known for his selfknowledge, and is worthy of homage, that I am saluting his feet with my head bowed.
data.anv: सूत O charioteer, मद्वचनात् as my words, विदितात्मनः knower of the self, महात्मनः illustrious, वन्दनीयस्य worthy of salutations, तस्य that, तातस्य father's, पादौ feet, शिरसा head, वन्द्यौ are worthy of salutations.

data.v: सर्वमन्तःपुरं वाच्यं सूत मद्वचनात्त्वया । आरोग्यमविशेषेण यथार्हं चाभिवादनम् ।।
data.es: 'On my behalf convey, O charioteer, without any distinction, my salutations to all the women befitting their status and tell them I was enquiring about their wellbeing.
data.anv: सूत O charioteer, त्वया by you, मद्वचनात् at my words, सर्वम् entire, अन्तःपुरम् inmates of the inner apartment, अविशेषेण without distinction, आरोग्यम् wellbeing, यथार्हम् befitting their status, अभिवादनं च salutations, वाच्यम् fit to be conveyed.

data.v: माता च मम कौसल्या कुशलं चाभिवादनम् । देवि देवस्य पादौ च देववत्परिपालय ।।
data.es: 'Convey my mother carefully my saluations and my wellbeing and tell her:
data.anv: मम my, माता mother, कौसल्या Kausalya, कुशलम् welfare, अभिवादनं च salutations, अप्रमादं च  alertness, वक्तव्या is worthy of conveying, इदम् this, वचश्च word, ब्रूयाः tell.
data.md: Having saluted my mother Kausalyā and conveyed to her news of my welfare, as well as of my unswerving adherence to morality, do you tell her these words, Do you remaining steady in virtue, at the proper hour bestir yourself in behalf of the chamber of sacrificial fire. And, O revered one, do you minister to the feet of that worshipful one, (the king), as if they were very deities.

data.v: भरतः कुशलं वाच्यो वाच्यो मद्वचनेन च । सर्वास्वेव यथान्यायं वृत्तिं वर्तस्व मातृषु ।।
data.es: 'Tell Bharata of my welfare and tell him on my behalf that he should honour all our mothers equally.
data.anv: भरतः Bharata, कुशलम् welfare, वाच्यः deserves to be told, मद्वचनेन by my word, वाच्यः च  is to be told, सर्वासु among all, मातृषु mothers, यथान्यायम् rightly, वृत्तिम् behaviour, वर्तस्व follow.
data.md: Do you communicate to Bharata news of my welfare and say in my name, Do you behave properly with all your mothers.

data.v: वक्तव्यश्च महाबाहुरिक्ष्वाकुकुलनन्दनः । पितरं यौवराज्यस्थो राज्यस्थमनुपालय ।।
data.anv: इक्ष्वाकुकुलनन्दनः delight of the race of Ikshvaku, महाबाहुः mightyarmed, वक्तव्यश्च deserves be told this way, यौवराज्यस्थः crowned as prince regent, राज्यस्थम् being in the kingdom, पितरम् father, अनुपालय rule the kingdom (by being obedient to him).
data.md: And to that delight of the Ikṣvāku line do you further say, Having been installed as the heirapparent, be you, looking upon the king as the supreme authority in the state, obedient to him.

data.v: इत्येवं मां महाराज ब्रुवन्नेव महायशाः । रामो राजीवताम्राक्षो भृशमश्रूण्यवर्तयत् ।।
data.es: While saying this the red lotuslike eyes of illustrious Rama streamed with tears, O maharaja
data.anv: महाराज O king, महायशाः renowned, राजीवताम्राक्षः with red lotuslike eyes, रामः Rama, माम् to me, इत्येवम् thus, ब्रुवन्नेव while saying, भृशम् copious,  अश्रूणि tears, अवर्तयत् shed.

data.v: लक्ष्मणस्तु सुसंक्रुद्धो निःश्वसन्वाक्यमब्रवीत् । केनायमपराधेन राजपुत्रो विवासितः ।।
data.es: But Lakshmana, seething with anger and sighing said, 'For what offence has this king's son been banished'?
data.anv: लक्ष्मणस्तु Lakshmana, सुसङ्कृद्धः mighty angry, निश्श्वसन् sighing, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said, अयम् this, राजपुत्रः king's son, केन by what, अपराधेन offence, विवासितः has been banished?
data.md: Thereupon Lakşmaņa waxing wroth, breathing hard, said, For what fault of his has the Prince been banished?

data.v: यदि प्रव्राजितो रामो लोभकारणकारितम् । वरदाननिमित्तं वा सर्वथा दुष्कृतं कृतम् । रामस्य तु परित्यागे न हेतुमुपलक्षये ।।
data.es: 'Whether it was out of greed (for the kingdom) or for (the execution of) the boon bestowed, this act of banishment is by all means wicked'.
data.anv: रामः Rama, लोभकारणकारितम् out of greed (for the kingdom), वरदाननिमित्तं वा or on account of the boons bestowed, प्रव्राजितः यदि if banished, सर्वथा by all means, दुष्कृतम् wicked act, कृतम् has been done.
data.md: Whether Rāma has been exiled through Kaikeyi's lust for dominion or through the exigencies of the bestowal of the boon, there cannot be any doubt that the king has acted most unrighteously.

data.v: असमीक्ष्य समारब्धं विरुद्धं बुद्धिलाघवात् । जनयिष्यति संक्रोशं राघवस्य विवासनम् ।।
data.es: 'Unjustly, foolishly and without (proper) consideration Rama has been banished. This will (definitely) cause sorrow'.
data.anv: बुद्धिलाघवात् out of lack of intelligence, असमीक्ष्य without (proper) consideration, समारब्धम् commenced, विरुद्धम् contrary (to justice), राघवस्य Rama's, विवासनम् banishment, सङ्क्रोशम् bewailment, जनयिष्यति will produce.
data.md: The king through lack of sense has done herulessly what is opposed to morality; and this banishment of Rāma will but bring upon him woe here and hereafter.

data.v: अहं तावन्महाराजे पितृत्वं नोपलक्षये । भ्राता भर्ता च बन्धुश्च पिता च मम राघवः ।।
data.es: 'I do not regard the great king as my father. Rama alone is my brother, protector, friend and father.
data.anv: अहम् I, महाराजे in that great king, पितृत्वम् fatherhood, नोपलक्ष्ये I do not see, मम to me, राघवः Rama alone, भ्राता च brother, भर्ताच also protector, बन्धुश्च friend, पिता father.
data.md: Fatherhood find I none in the monarch. My brother and feeder and friend and father is even Rāghava.

data.v: सर्वलोकप्रियं त्यक्त्वा सर्वलोकहिते रतम् । सर्वलोकोऽनुरज्येत कथं त्वानेन कर्मणा ।।
data.es: 'How can anyone in this world be pleased with you for deserting Rama, the beloved of all, and ever devoted to their welfare?
data.anv: सर्वलोकप्रियम् beloved to all, सर्वलोकहिते in the welfare of all, रतम् devoted, त्यक्त्वा after deserting, अनेन कर्मणा with this act, त्वा towards you, सर्वलोकः entire world, कथम् how, अनुरज्येत will be pleased?
data.md: Renouncing one that is universally dear, and that is ever engaged in the good of all, how by such an act will the king please the people?

data.v: जानकी तु महाराज निःश्वसन्ती तपस्विनी । भूतोपहतचित्तेव विष्ठिता विष्मृता स्थिता ।।
data.es: O great king as for that sensitive Janaki, she stood sighing, stupefied and oblivious (of the past), yet smiling as though her mind was possessed by an evil spirit.
data.anv: महाराज O great king, मनस्विनी sensitive lady, जानकी तु Janaki, निश्श्वसन्ती heaving sighs, भूतोपहतचित्तेव like one possessed, विस्मृता स्मिता like one unconcerned with the surroundings and yet smiling, विष्ठिता stood stupefied.
data.md: O mighty monarch, Janaki also, unfortunate that she is, sighing heavily, stood wildered like one that had been possessed.

data.v: अदृष्टपूर्वव्यसना राजपुत्री यशस्विनी । तेन दुःखेन रुदती नैव मां किंचिदब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: That glorious princess Sita who had never experienced any adversity earlier, weeping with sorrow, could not even speak to me anything.
data.anv: अदृष्टपूर्वव्यसना who had never experienced adversity, यशस्विनी celebrated, राजपुत्री that princess, तेन that, दुःखेन with sorrow, रुदती weeping, माम् to me, किञ्चित् even a little, नैव  अब्रवीत् did not at all say.
data.md: And not having experienced any calamity before, the famed princes weeping because of this misfortune, told me nothing.

data.v: उद्वीक्षमाणा भर्तारं मुखेन परिशुष्यता । मुमोच सहसा बाष्पं मां प्रयान्तमुदीक्ष्य सा ।।
data.es: When she saw me leaving, she looked at her husband with a dry (pale) face and suddenly burst into tears.
data.anv: सा she, प्रयान्तम् moving, माम् me, उदीक्ष्य having seen, परिशुष्यता with driedup, मुखेन face, भर्तारम् husband, उद्वीक्षमाणा beholding, सहसा suddenly, बाष्पम् tears, मुमोच shed.
data.md: Looking up to her lord with a blank countenance, she suddenly let fall tears, perceiving the destruction of the subject.

data.v: तथैव रामोऽश्रुमुखः कृताञ्जलिः; स्थितोऽभवल्लक्ष्मणबाहुपालितः । तथैव सीता रुदती तपस्विनी; निरीक्षते राजरथं तथैव माम् ।।
data.es: Supported by Lakshmana's arms, Rama stood, his face streaming with tears and palms folded, while the wretched Sita, glaring at me and the royal chariot, weeping. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे अष्टपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyeighth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: तथैव thus, रामः Rama, अश्रुमुखः with his face filled with tears, कृताञ्जलिः with folded hands, लक्ष्मणबाहुपालितः supported by the arms of Lakshmana, स्थितः अभवत् stood, तपस्विनी pitiable, सीता Sita, रुदती weeping, राजरथम् king's chariot, माम् me, निरीक्षते kept gazing.
data.md: Thus said Rāma ministered to by Lakşmaņa, with a tearful countenance; and thus stood the unfortunate and weeping Sītå beholding the royal car and myself.

data.v: मम त्वश्वा निवृत्तस्य न प्रावर्तन्त वर्त्मनि । उष्णमश्रु विमुञ्चन्तो रामे संप्रस्थिते वनम् ।।
data.es: When Rama set out for the forest, and I turned back, my horses shedding hot tears were reluctant to walk the path.
data.anv: रामे Rama, वनम् for the forest, सम्प्रस्थिते when setting out, निवृत्तस्य when I returned, मम my, अश्वा: तु as for horses, उष्णम् hot, अश्रुप्रमुञ्चन्तः shedding tears, वर्त्मनि on the path, न प्रावर्तन्त did not proceed.
data.md: On Rāma having gone to the forest, my horses as I turned away, did not proceed vigorously on the way, and shed warm tears. And having (done homage) to both the princes by joining my hands, I turned my back, bearing as best I could that load of sorrow.

data.v: उभाभ्यां राजपुत्राभ्यामथ कृत्वाहमज्ञलिम् । प्रस्थितो रथमास्थाय तद्दुःखमपि धारयन् ।।
data.es: Thereafter, controlling my grief and paying obeisance to both the princes with folded palms, I ascended the chariot and returned.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, अहम् I, उभाभ्याम् to both, राजपुत्राभ्याम् princess, अञ्जलिम् folded palms, कृत्वा having made, तत् that, दुःखम् अपि grief, धारयन् controlling, रथम् chariot, आस्थाय ascending, प्रस्थितः set out.

data.v: गुहेव सार्धं तत्रैव स्थितोऽस्मि दिवसान्बहून् । आशया यदि मां रामः पुनः शब्दापयेदिति ।।
data.es: There along with Guha I waited for (three) days that Rama might call me back.
data.anv: रामः Rama, पुनः again, माम् me, शब्दापयेत् यदि if calls me, इति thus, आशया with hope, तत्रैव there itself, गुहेन सार्धम् with Guha, बहून् many (three), दिवसान् अस्मि I waited.
data.md: Indulging in the hope that Rāma might again summon me by any of the envoys (of Guha left there), I stayed there with Guha for many days.

data.v: विषये ते महाराज रामव्यसनकर्शिताः । अपि वृक्षाः परिम्लानः सपुष्पाङ्कुरकोरकाः ।।
data.es: O great king even trees with their flowers, buds and shoots throughout your empire have withered because of the calamity on Rama.
data.anv: महाराज O great king, ते विषये throughout your empire, वृक्षाः अपि even trees, सपुष्पाङ्कुरकोरकाः with flowers, buds and shoots, रामव्यसनकर्शिताः oppressed on account of the calamity on Rama, परिम्लानाः withered.
data.md: In your dominions, O monarch, exercised by the calamity that has befallen Rāma, even trees bearing blossoms and buds and sprouts look sad; the rivers and pools and liquid lapses have their waters dried up; and the woods and groves have their foliage withered.

data.v: न च सर्पन्ति सत्त्वानि व्याला न प्रसरन्ति च । रामशोकाभिभूतं तन्निष्कूजमभवद्वनम् ।।
data.es: No living being move about and even wild animals roam no more. Overwhelmed with grief on account of Rama a great silence pervades the forest.
data.anv: सत्त्वानि living beings, न च सर्पन्ति are not moving, व्यालाः च wild animals also, नप्रचरन्ति not ranging, तत् वनम् that forest, रामशोकाभिभूतम् overpowered by grief on account of Rama, निष्कूजम् silent, अभवत् became.
data.md: Creatures do not move and beasts of prey cease to range about; and the forest appears to be dumb, stupefied by grief on account of Rāma.

data.v: लीनपुष्करपत्राश्च नरेन्द्र कलुषोदकाः । संतप्तपद्माः पद्मिन्यो लीनमीनविहंगमाः ।।
data.es: The water in the lotus lakes, O king, has become turbid. The blue lotuses have withered and their shrivelled petals are submerged in water. The fishes and aquatic birds are hidden under waters.
data.anv: नरेन्द्र O king, पद्मिन्यः lotus lakes, लीनपुष्करपत्राः च with the shrivelled blue lotus leaves submerged in water, कलुषोदकाः with waters turbid, सन्तप्तपद्माः withered lotuses, लीनमीनविहङ्गमाः devoid of fishes and birds.

data.v: जलजानि च पुष्पाणि माल्यानि स्थलजानि च । नाद्य भान्त्यल्पगन्धीनि फलानि च यथा पुरम् ।।
data.es: Bunches of flowers grown in water and on land, as well as fruits with their scant fragrance do not shine as before.
data.anv: जलजानि born in water, पुष्पाणि flowers, स्थलजानि born on the land, माल्यानि garlands of flowers, फलानि च fruits, अद्य now, अल्पगन्धीनि with scant fragrance, यथापुरम् as before, न भान्ति do not shine.
data.md: Streams containing lotuses with their leaves shrivelled, have their waters stained; and lotuses have their leaves burnt; and fished and (aquatic) birds have grown lean. And flowers both on land and water have been deprived of their freshness and fragrance; and they no longer retain their former condition.

data.v: प्रविशन्तमयोध्यां मां न कश्चिदभिनन्दति । नरा राममपश्यन्तो निःश्वसन्ति मुहुर्मुहुः ।।
data.es: None greeted me when I entered Ayodhya, People heaved sighs repeatedly when they did not see Rama.
data.anv: अयोध्यायाम् Ayodhya, प्रविशन्तम् entering, कश्चित् any one, न अभिनन्दति is not greeting, नराः people, रामम् Rama, अपश्यन्तः without beholding, मुहुर्मुहुः again and again, निश्श्वसन्ति are heaving sighs.
data.md: When I entered Ayodhyā, none greeted me. And not seeing Rāma, the people sigh momentarily.

data.v: हर्म्यैर्विमानैः प्रासादैरवेक्ष्य रथमागतम् । हाहाकारकृता नार्यो रामादर्शनकर्शिताः ।।
data.es: Women from mansions, sevenstoried buildings and from royal palaces, sighted him and pained at not seeing Rama cried out 'Alas, Alas'.
data.anv: नार्य: women, हर्म्यै: from mansions, विमानैः from sevenstoried buildings, प्रासादैः from royal palaces, आगतम् arrived, रथम् chariot, अवेक्ष्य having seen, रामादर्शनकर्शिताः afflicted by the absence of Rama, हाहाकारकृताः cried 'Alas, Alas'.
data.md: And beholding Sumantra returned to the city crowned with edifices, seven-storied houses, and palatial mansions, the women, stricken with the absence of Rama, set up a cry of "Oh" and "Alas."

data.v: आयतैर्विमलैर्नेत्रैरश्रुवेगपरिप्लुतैः । अन्योन्यमभिवीक्षन्ते व्यक्तमार्ततराः स्त्रियः ।।
data.es: The women in great anguish stood silently looking at one another, their large eyes flooded with overflowing tears.
data.anv: स्त्रियः women, आर्ततराः in deep anguish, आयतैः with large, विमलैः bright, अश्रुवेगपरिप्लुतैः flooded with gushing tears, नेत्रै: with their eyes, अव्यक्तम् silently, अन्योन्यम् one another, अभिवीक्षन्ते are looking at.
data.md: Waxing still more aggrieved, the females looked at each other with their expansive and transparent eyes fast flooded with tears. And then he heard the talk, as toned down it proceeded from the royal mansions, of the wives of Dasaratha afflicted with grief for Rāma.

data.v: नामित्राणां न मित्राणामुदासीनजनस्य च । अहमार्ततया कंचिद्विशेषं नोपलक्षये ।।
data.es: I did not see any difference in the degree of anguish among friends, those who are not friends and and those who are indifferent. (The degree of agony was same in all).
data.anv: अहम् I, आर्ततया in great agony, अमित्राणाम् among those who are not friends, किञ्चित् even a little, विशेषम् diference, न उपलक्षये could not see, मित्राणाम् among friends, उदासीनजनस्य of people indifferent, न could not see.
data.md: And in consequence of the general grief that prevailed, I could not perceive any difference between friends and foes and persons indifferent.

data.v: अप्रहृष्टमनुष्या च दीननागतुरंगमा । आर्तस्वरपरिम्लाना विनिःश्वसितनिःस्वना ।।
data.es: O maharaja, Ayodhya is filled with cheerless people with deep sighs, agonised voices and pale faces depressed and distressed due to Rama's exile. (Even) elephants and horses look spiritless. For me it (the city) resembles (dejected) Kausalya deprived of her son.
data.anv: महाराज O great king, अप्रहृष्टमनुष्या च people cheerless, दीननागतुरङ्गमा spiritless elephants and horses, आर्तस्वरपरिम्लाना with agonised voices and pale faces, विनिश्वसित निस्स्वना with deep sighs, निरानन्दा depressed, रामप्रव्राजनातुरा distressed due to Rama's exile, पुत्रहीना deprived of her son, कौसल्या इव like Kausalya, मा प्रतिभाति appears to me.
data.md: O mighty monarch, distressed in consequence of the exile of Rāma, men appear sunk in dejection, and elephants and horses are spiritless; and seized with cheerlessness, they utter doleful sounds and heave profound sighs. Ayodhyā appears to me joyless like Kausalyă deprived of her son.

data.v: निरानन्दा महाराज रामप्रव्राजनातुरा । कौसल्या पुत्रहीनेव अयोध्या प्रतिभाति मा ।।
data.es: O maharaja, Ayodhya is filled with cheerless people with deep sighs, agonised voices and pale faces depressed and distressed due to Rama's exile. (Even) elephants and horses look spiritless. For me it (the city) resembles (dejected) Kausalya deprived of her son.
data.anv: महाराज O great king, अप्रहृष्टमनुष्या च people cheerless, दीननागतुरङ्गमा spiritless elephants and horses, आर्तस्वरपरिम्लाना with agonised voices and pale faces, विनिश्वसित निस्स्वना with deep sighs, निरानन्दा depressed, रामप्रव्राजनातुरा distressed due to Rama's exile, पुत्रहीना deprived of her son, कौसल्या इव like Kausalya, मा प्रतिभाति appears to me.
data.md: O mighty monarch, distressed in consequence of the exile of Rāma, men appear sunk in dejection, and elephants and horses are spiritless; and seized with cheerlessness, they utter doleful sounds and heave profound sighs. Ayodhyā appears to me joyless like Kausalyă deprived of her son.

data.v: सूतस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा वाचा परमदीनया । बाष्पोपहतया राजा तं सूतमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: At these words of the charioteer, the king in deep distress replied with a voice choked with tears:
data.anv: राजा king, सूतस्य charioteer's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, परमदीनया deeply dejected, बाष्पोपहतया choked with tears, वाचा with a voice, तं सूतम् to the charioteer, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Hearing the words of the charioteer, the king like an exceedingly forlorn, addressed the former in words lost in the vapour of sorrow.

data.v: कैकेय्या विनियुक्तेन पापाभिजनभावया । मया न मन्त्रकुशलैर्वृद्धैः सह समर्थितम् ।।
data.es: Incited by Kaikeyi of sinful relations and sinful motive, I did not consult expert, elderly counsellers.
data.anv: पापाभिजनभावया by one who has wicked relations and sinful intention, कैकेय्या by Kaikeyi, विनियुक्तेन having been incited, मया by me, मन्त्रकुशलैः with men skilled in giving advice, वृद्धै: सह with seniors, न समर्थितम् was not consulted.
data.md: Exhorted by Kaikeyi of a sinful country, born in a sinful race and cherishing sinful designs, I did not take counsel with aged people capable of offering advice.

data.v: न सुहृद्भिर्न चामात्यैर्मन्त्रयित्वा न नैगमैः । मयायमर्थः संमोहात्स्त्रीहेतोः सहसा कृतः ।।
data.es: For the sake of a woman, this act was committed in great haste, without consulting friends or ministers or men of prudence.
data.anv: सुहृद्भि: with friends, अमात्यैः with ministers, नैगमैः च with men of prudence, न मन्त्रयित्वा without consulting, मया by me, अयम् this, अर्थः act, स्त्रीहेतो: for the sake of a woman, सहसा in great haste, कृतः committed.
data.md: Without consulting with friends or courtiers or persons versed in the Vedas, I have in the interest of a woman rashly done this thing through ignorance.

data.v: भवितव्यतया नूनमिदं वा व्यसनं महत् । कुलस्यास्य विनाशाय प्राप्तं सूत यदृच्छया ।।
data.es: Surely it is destiny and this calamity has befallen for the wilful destruction of the (entire) race, O charioteer
data.anv: सूत O charioteer, वा otherwise, इदम् this, महत् great, व्यसनम् calamity, भवितव्यतया because it was destined to happen this way, अस्य this, कुलस्य race's, विनाशाय for destruction, यदृच्छया wilfully, प्राप्तम् has befallen, नूनम् surely.
data.md: Meseems, O charioteer, for the purpose of destroying this line entirely, this mighty disaster has surely befallen us through the influence of Destiny.

data.v: सूत यद्यस्ति ते किंचिन्मयापि सुकृतं कृतम् । त्वं प्रापयाशु मां रामं प्राणाः संत्वरयन्ति माम् ।।
data.es: O Charioteer, if ever I have rendered you any favour, quickly take me to Rama. My life is hastening me (fast running out).
data.anv: सूत O Charioteer, मया by me, ते to you, किंचित् even a little, सुकृतम् favour, कृतम् अस्ति यदि  if it has been rendered, त्वम् you, आशु quickly, माम् me, रामम् to Rama, प्रापय take, प्राणाः life, माम् me, संत्वरयन्ति are hastening me up.
data.md: O charioteer, if I have ever done you any good do you immediately take me to Rāma: my life urges me on (in this direction).

data.v: यद्यद्यापि ममैवाज्ञा निवर्तयतु राघवम् । न शक्ष्यामि विना राम मुहूर्तमपि जीवितुम् ।।
data.es: If my command prevails today, Rama may be brought back. Without Rama I cannot live for a moment even.
data.anv: अद्यापि even now, मम my, आज्ञैव by command, राघवम् Rama, निवर्तयतु be brought back, रामं विना without Rama, मुहूर्तमपि even for a moment, जीवितुम् to live, न शक्ष्यामि am not able.
data.md: Or let my command make Rāghava turn back. I cannot live for a moment without Rāma.

data.v: अथ वापि महाबाहुर्गतो दूरं भविष्यति । मामेव रथमारोप्य शीघ्रं रामाय दर्शय ।।
data.anv: अथवा or otherwise also, महाबाहुः mightyarmed, दूरम् far away, गतः भविष्यति must have gone, मामेव me alone, रथम् on the chariot, आरोप्य placing, शीघ्रम् quickly, रामाय to Rama, दर्शय show.
data.md: But if that mighty-armed one has proceeded far, do you placing me on a car speedily show me to Rāma.

data.v: वृत्तदंष्ट्रो महेष्वासः क्वासौ लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः । यदि जीवामि साध्वेनं पश्येयं सह सीतया ।।
data.es: Where is that Rama, elder brother to Lakshmana who has wellshaped teeth and wields a mighty bow? If I can see him along with Sita I will survive.
data.anv: वृत्तदंष्ट्रः one with wellshaped teeth, महेष्वासः a great archer, असौ that, लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः elder brother of Lakshmana, Rama, क्व where is he?, एनम् him, सीतया सह along with Sita, साधु well, पश्येयं यदि if I can see him, जीवामि I can live.
data.md: Where is that elder brother of Lakşmaņa of a mighty bow, furnished with teeth resembling Kunda flowers? If I live so long, I will behold him in company with Sītā.

data.v: लोहिताक्षं महाबाहुमामुक्तमणिकुण्डलम् । रामं यदि न पश्यामि गमिष्यामि यमक्षयम् ।।
data.es: If I cannot see Rama of redcoloured eyes, the mightyarmed one and wearing earrings bedecked with precious stones I shall surely go to the abode of Yama, the god of death.
data.anv: लोहिताक्षम् one with redcoloured eyes, महाबाहुम् mightyarmed, आमुक्तमणिकुण्डलम् wearing earrings bedecked with gems, रामम् Rama, न पश्येयं यदि if I cannot see him, यमक्षयम् kingdom of Yama, lord of death, गमिष्यामि I will go.
data.md: What can be sadder than this, that reduced to such a pass, I cannot see here that descendant of Ikşvāku, Rāghava?

data.v: अतो नु किं दुःखतरं योऽहमिक्ष्वाकुनन्दनम् । इमामवस्थामापन्नो नेह पश्यामि राघवम् ।।
data.es: What else can be of greater sorrow to me who having reached this state, am still unable to see Rama?
data.anv: इमाम् this, अवस्थाम् condition, आपन्नः having reached, सः अहम् such me, इक्ष्वाकुकुलनन्दनम्  Delight of the Ikshvakus, राघवम् Rama, इह now, न पश्यामि see not, अतः than this, दुःखतरम् greater sorrow,  किं नु what more.
data.md: What can be sadder than this, that reduced to such a pass, I cannot see here that descendant of Ikşvāku, Rāghava?

data.v: हा राम रामानुज हा हा वैदेहि तपस्विनी । न मां जानीत दुःखेन म्रियमाणमनाथवत् । दुस्तरो जीवता देवि मयायं शोकसागरः ।।
data.es: Ah Rama, Ah Lakshmana, Ah unfortunate Vaidehi, you do not know that I am dying like an orphan because of my grief.
data.anv: हा राम Ah Rama, हा रामानुज Ah Lakshmana, तपस्विनि the unfortunate, हा वैदेहि Ah Vaidehi,  माम् me, दुःखेन due to grief, अनाथवत् like an orphan, म्रियमाणम् dying, न जानीत you do not know.
data.md: Ah Rāma! Ah you younger brother of Rāma! Ah you unfortunate Vaidehī! You do not know that I am through grief lamenting like one deserted.

data.v: अशोभनं योऽहमिहाद्य राघवं; दिदृक्षमाणो न लभे सलक्ष्मणम् । इतीव राजा विलपन्महायशाः; पपात तूर्णं शयने स मूर्छितः ।।
data.es: Though I wish I cannot see Rama together with Lakshmana. Indeed this is very unfortunate. Lamenting thus, king Dasaratha of great reknown fell on the bed, unconscious.
data.anv: यः he who, अहम् I, अद्य now, दिदृक्षमाणः wishing to see, सलक्ष्मणम् with Lakshamana, राघवम् Rama, इह here, न लभे unable to get them, अशोभनम् inauspicious, इतीव in this way, महायशाः of great reknown, सः राजा that king, विलपन् lamenting, मूर्छितः lying unconcsious, तूर्णम् immediately, शयने on the bed, पपात fell.

data.v: इति विलपति पार्थिवे प्रनष्टे; करुणतरं द्विगुणं च रामहेतोः । वचनमनुनिशम्य तस्य देवी; भयमगमत्पुनरेव राममाता ।।
data.es: Wailing, Dasaratha fell unconscious. He was doubly grieved due to his yearning for Rama. Rama's mother was seized with fear hearing those lamentations.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकोनषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyninth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: पार्थिवे king, रामहेतोः for the sake of Rama, करुणतरम् in greater grief, द्विगुणं च doubly, विलपति lamenting, प्रणष्टे losing senses, राममाता Rama's mother, देवी queen Kausalya, तस्य वचनम् his words, अनुनिशम्य having heard, पुनरेव once again, भयम् fear, अगमत् seized.
data.md: On the king swooning away lamenting, that exalted lady, Rāma's mother, hearing his words doubly bitter and more piteous than ever uttered for Rāma, was seized with fresh apprehension.

data.v: ततो भूतोपसृष्टेव वेपमाना पुनः पुनः । धरण्यां गतसत्त्वेव कौसल्या सूतमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Thereafter Kausalya, trembling as if possessed by an evil spirit and rolling on the floor like one who her senses now and again, said to the charioteer (Sumantra):
data.anv: ततः thereafter, कौशल्या Kausalya, भूतोपसृष्टेव as if possessed by an evil spirit, वेपमाना trembling, गतसत्त्वेव like one who has his senses lost, पुनः पुनः again and again, धरण्याम् on the floor, सूतम् to the  charioteer (Sumantra), अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Then like one possessed by an evil spirit, and trembling again and again, Kausalyä lying down on the ground like one dead, spoke to the charioteer, saying.

data.v: नय मां यत्र काकुत्स्थः सीता यत्र च लक्ष्मणः । तान्विना क्षणमप्यत्र जीवितुं नोत्सहे ह्यहम् ।।
data.es: Take me where Rama, Sita and Lakshmana are. I do not wish to live even for a moment without them.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थः Rama, सीता च Sita, यत्र wherever, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, यत्र wherever, तत्र there, माम् to me, नय take, तान् विना without them, अत्र here,  क्षणमपि even for a moment, जीवितुम्  to live, अहम् I, न उत्सहे do not wish.
data.md: Do you take me where Kākutstha is and Sītā and Lakşınaņa: without them, I cannot live for a moment.

data.v: निवर्तय रथं शीघ्रं दण्डकान्नय मामपि । अथ तान्नानुगच्छामि गमिष्यामि यमक्षयम् ।।
data.es: 'Turn back your chariot immediately and take me to the Dandaka forest. If I do not follow them, I shall enter the world of Yama'.
data.anv: रथम् chariot, शीघ्रम् quickly, निवर्तय turn back, मामपि me also, दण्डकान् to Dandaka, नय  take, अथ if, तान् them, नानु गच्छामि if I do not follow, यमक्षयम् to the world of Yama, गमिष्यामि shall go.
data.md: Do you without delay turn the car. Do you take me also to Dandaka. If I do not follow them, I shall repair to the mansion of Yama.

data.v: बाष्पवेगौपहतया स वाचा सज्जमानया । इदमाश्वासयन्देवीं सूतः प्राञ्जलिरब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: With folded hands and faltering words choked by his fastflowing tears the charioteer tried to console Kausalya:
data.anv: सः सूतः that charioteer, बाष्पवेगोपहतया prevented by fastflowing tears, सज्जमानया faltering, वाचा with words, देवीम् to Kausalya, आश्वसयन् consoling, प्राञ्जलिः with folded palms, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Thereat the cahrioteer with joined hands comforted that exalted lady with ready words faltering and choked with rising vapour, "Do you leave grief and sorrow and the violent emotion. Renouncing grief, Rāghava is living in the woods."

data.v: त्यज शोकं च मोहं च संभ्रमं दुःखजं तथा । व्यवधूय च संतापं वने वत्स्यति राघवः ।।
data.es: Abandon your tears, delusion and despair arising out of sorrow. Rama is going to live in the forest, brushing aside all agony.
data.anv: शोकम् grief, मोहम् delusion, तथा also, दुःखजम् arising out of sorrow, सम्भ्रमं च despair, त्यज abandon, राघवः Rama, सन्तापम् difficulties, व्यवधूय after brushig aside, वने in the forest, वत्स्यति is going to live.
data.md: Thereat the cahrioteer with joined hands comforted that exalted lady with ready words faltering and choked with rising vapour, "Do you leave grief and sorrow and the violent emotion. Renouncing grief, Rāghava is living in the woods."

data.v: लक्ष्मणश्चापि रामस्य पादौ परिचरन्वने । आराधयति धर्मज्ञः परलोकं जितेन्द्रियः ।।
data.es: Selfcontrolled Lakshmana, aware of his duty, serves Rama in the forest. By this he is securing his next world.
data.anv: धर्मज्ञ: knower of duty, लक्ष्मणश्चापि also Lakshmana, वने in the forest, जितेन्द्रियः one whose senses are controlled, रामस्य to Rama' s, पादौ feet, परिचरन् serving at, परलोकम् the other world, आराधयति is accomplishing.
data.md: And in the forest, the righteous Laksmara, having his senses under control, is ministering to Răma's feet and is thus adoring the gods for happiness in the next world.

data.v: विजनेऽपि वने सीता वासं प्राप्य गृहेष्विव । विस्रम्भं लभतेऽभीता रामे संन्यस्तमानसा ।।
data.es: Sita with her mind fixed on Rama is living confidently in that desolate forest without any fear as if it were her home.
data.anv: सीता Sita, विजने in the desolate, वनेपि in the forest also, गृहेष्विव like at home, वासम् living, प्राप्य having obtained, रामे in Rama, सन्न्यस्तमानसा with her mind fixed, अभीता without fear, विस्रम्भम् confidence, लभते  is getting.
data.md: And even in the lonely woods, Sītā as if remaining at home, having fixed her thoughts on Rāma, is living a life of love.

data.v: नास्या दैन्यं कृतं किंचित्सुसूक्ष्ममपि लक्षये । उचितेव प्रवासानां वैदेही प्रतिभाति मा ।।
data.es: I could not see even the slightest depression in Sita as if she was accustomed to staying away from home.
data.anv: अस्याः of her, सुसूक्ष्ममपि even the slightest, दैन्यम् dejection, किञ्चित् not even a little, कृतम् done, न लक्ष्यते not to be seen, वैदेही Sita, प्रवासानाम् for staying away from home, उचितेव as if accustomed, मा to me, प्रतिभाति appears.
data.md: And there appears not the least trace of any distress afflicting her; and Vaidehi seems to me as if she were meant (by Nature) for a life away from home.

data.v: नगरोपवनं गत्वा यथा स्म रमते पुरा । तथैव रमते सीता निर्जनेषु वनेष्वपि ।।
data.es: Earlier, just as Sita used to revel in the gardens of the city, so does she now in those desolate forests.
data.anv: सीता Sita, पुरा earlier, नगरोपवनम् to the pleasuregardens of the city, गत्वा having gone, यथा as, रमतेस्म was enjoying, निर्जनेषु in desolate, वनेष्वपि even in the forest, तथैव in the same way, रमते enjoying.
data.md: And as forinerly going to urban villas she disported, she disports now even in the lonely forest.

data.v: बालेव रमते सीता बालचन्द्रनिभानना । रामा रामे ह्यदीनात्मा विजनेऽपि वने सती ।।
data.es: Charming Sita whose face resembles the full Moon, with her mind fixed on Rama, is enjoying even the desolate forest like a child.
data.anv: रामा charming lady, रामे in Rama, अधीनात्मा one with absorbed mind, अबालचन्द्रनिभानना countenance resembling the full Moon, सीता Sita, विजने desolate, वने in the forest also, सती अपि staying, बालेव like a child, रमते is enjoying.
data.md: And although living in the lone forest, that one of a countenance resembling the infant moon, sports merrily like a girl, in the garden represented by Rāma's self.

data.v: तद्गतं हृदयं ह्यस्यास्तदधीनं च जीवितम् । अयोध्यापि भवेत्तस्या रामहीना तथा वनम् ।।
data.es: Her heart is ever united with Rama, and her life is under his control. Without Rama, even Ayodhya would become a forest for her.
data.anv: अस्याः her, हृदयम् heart, तद्गतम् united with Rama, जीवितं च life also, तदधीनम् under his control, अयोध्यापि even Ayodhya too, रामहीना without Rama, तदा then, तस्याः to her, वनम् forest, भवेत् would have become.
data.md: Ayodhyā without Rāma would have seemed a wilderness to her whose heart is fixed on him and whose very life depends upon him.

data.v: पथि पृच्छति वैदेही ग्रामांश्च नगराणि च । गतिं दृष्ट्वा नदीनां च पादपान्विविधानपि ।।
data.es: Seeing villages, cities, trees of different kinds and courses of rivers, Sita is enquiring from Rama or Lakshmana about them. She feels as though she is sporting in the pleasuregarden just a krosa from Ayodhya.
data.anv: अयोध्या क्रोशमात्रे at the distance of a krosa from Ayodhya, विहारम् pleasuregarden, संश्रिता इव as if sporting, वैदेही Sita, ग्रामांश्च villages, नगराणि च cities,नदीनाम् rivers', गतिं च   courses, विविधान् different kinds of, पादपानपि trees also, दृष्ट्वा seeing, रामम् to Rama, परिपृच्छति enquiring, लक्ष्मणं वापि or Lakshmana, पृष्ट्वा asking, जानाति knowing.
data.md: Vaidehī is now asking (Rāma) concerning the villages and towns (in their way); and observing various trees and the courses of the rivers, Jānaki, asking Råma Laksmana (for information), is learning all about them. And Sītā sports as she used to do in arbours stationed at the distance of only one krosa from Ayodhyā.

data.v: अध्वना वातवेगेन संभ्रमेणातपेन च । न हि गच्छति वैदेह्याश्चन्द्रांशुसदृशी प्रभा ।।
data.es: Just like the beams of the Moon, Sita's glow is not affected by the fatigue of the journey or by the speed of the wind or by the scorching heat.
data.anv: वैदेह्याः Sita's, चन्द्रांशु सदृशी resembling the beams of the Moon, प्रभा lustre, अध्वना on the way, वातवेगेन or by the speed of the wind, सम्भ्रमेण or due to haste, आतपेन च or due to scorching heat also, न विगच्छति does not fade.
data.md: Neither through the fatigue of travel, nor the influence of the wind, nor excitement, nor the sun, has Vaidehi's lustre resembling the lunar light suffered any diminution.

data.v: सदृशं शतपत्रस्य पूर्णचन्द्रोपमप्रभम् । वदनं तद्वदान्याया वैदेह्या न विकम्पते ।।
data.es: The countenance of Sita with her gentle eloquence resembles a hundredpetalled lotus. She has the luminance of the full Moon that has not wilted.
data.anv: वदान्यायाः of that munificent, वैदेह्याः Sita, शतपत्रस्य a hundredpetalled lotus, सदृशम् similar to, पूर्णचन्द्रोपमप्रभम् like the splendour of the full Moon, तत् वदनम् that countenance, न विकम्पते does not change at all.
data.md: The countenance of that fair-speaking one resembling the lotus and comparable to the full moon in splendour, has not waxed pale.

data.v: अलक्तरसरक्ताभावलक्तरसवर्जितौ । अद्यापि चरणौ तस्याः पद्मकोशसमप्रभौ ।।
data.es: Her feet, now devoid of lacdye, still look red like lac and shine like the lotus bud.
data.anv: अलक्तरसक्ताभौ shining red like the liquid lac, अलक्तरसवर्जितौ no longer tinted with such liquid, तस्याः her, चरणौ feet, अद्यापि even now, पद्मकोशसमप्रभौ are shining like the lotus buds.
data.md: Her feet now without your dye of the liquid lac, but naturally furnished with the roseate hue of the same, are gorgeous like lotus buds.

data.v: नूपुरोद्घुष्टहेलेव खेलं गच्छति भामिनी । इदानीमपि वैदेही तद्रागा न्यस्तभूषणा ।।
data.es: Casting off her ornaments, the damsel (Sita) is gracefully walking as if dalliant with her tinkling anklets for her love for him (Rama).
data.anv: भामिनी damsel (Sita), नूपुरोद्घुष्ट हेलेव tinkling anklets proclaiming dalliance, खेलम् (as if) playing, गच्छति going, वैदेही Sita, इदानीमपि even now, तद्रागात् due to affection for Rama, नयस्तभूषणा cast off the ornaments.
data.md: Still Vaidehī decked in ornaments from affection for Rāma, goes gracefully rebuking with her bangles the wavy gait (of cranes).

data.v: गजं वा वीक्ष्य सिंहं वा व्याघ्रं वा वनमाश्रिता । नाहारयति संत्रासं बाहू रामस्य संश्रिता ।।
data.es: Though in the forest, Sita, under the protection of Rama's arms, is afraid of neither elephants nor lions nor tigers.
data.anv: वनम् forest, आश्रिता resorted, रामस्य Rama's, बाहू arms, संश्रिता having taken refuge, गजं वा elephant, सिंहं वा or lion, व्याघ्रं वा or tiger, वीक्ष्य having seen, सन्त्रासं fear, नाऽहारयति does not get.
data.md: Supporting herself on Rāma's arm, Sītă arrived at the forest, is not inspired with fear on beholding either an elephant, or a lion, or a tiger.

data.v: न शोच्यास्ते न चात्मा ते शोच्यो नापि जनाधिपः । इदं हि चरितं लोके प्रतिष्ठास्यति शाश्वतम् ।।
data.es: You need not lament for them or for yourself or for the king. This story of Rama will endure permanently in the world.
data.anv: ते they, न शोच्याः need not be pitied, आत्मनः च yourself, न not, जनाधिप अपि king also, इदम् this, चरितम् history, लोके in the world, शाश्वतम् permanently, प्रतिष्ठास्यति will endure.
data.md: Therefore they are not to be bewailed, nor your own self, nor the lord of men. This history of Rāma will endure for ever in this world.

data.v: विधूय शोकं परिहृष्टमानसा; महर्षियाते पथि सुव्यवस्थिताः । वने रता वन्यफलाशनाः पितुः; शुभां प्रतिज्ञां परिपालयन्ति ते ।।
data.es: They are upholding the sacred promise of their father with cheerful hearts, grief given the goby, steadfastly pursuing the path established by maharsis, subsisting on forest fruits and enjoying the forest life.
data.anv: ते they, शोकम् grief, विधूय shaking off, परिहृष्टमानसाः with cheerful hearts, महर्षियाते  established by maharshis, पथि in the path, सुव्यवत्स्थिताः firmly fixed, वने in the forest, रताः  are enjoying, वन्यफलाशनाः subsisting on forest fruits, पितुः father's, शुभाम् auspicious, प्रतिज्ञाम् promise, परिपालयन्ति are upholding.
data.md: Renouncing grief and with cheerful hearts, well established in the life led by the Maharşis, they living in the forest on wild fruits as their sustenance, are maintaining the noble promise of their sire.

data.v: तथापि सूतेन सुयुक्तवादिना; निवार्यमाणा सुतशोककर्शिता । न चैव देवी विरराम कूजिता;त्प्रियेति पुत्रेति च राघवेति च ।।
data.es: Though Sumantra was speaking with befitting words to prevent Kausalya from weeping over her son which had enfeebled her, she did not stop crying, 'O my beloved', 'O my son', 'O Rama'. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे षष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtieth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: सुयुक्तवादिना by one who was speaking befittingly, सूतेना by Sumantra, तथा like that, निवार्यमाणापि though prevented, देवी queen Kausalya, सुतशोककर्शिता enfeebled with weeping over her son, प्रियेति 'O My beloved', पुत्रेति 'O my son', राघवेति च 'O Rama', कूजितात् from crying, नचैव विरराम did not stop.
data.md: Consoled by the truth-telling yet sweetspeeched charioteer, that lady oppressed with grief for her son, ceased not to wail loudly, "My beloved,” “My son," "Rāghava."

data.v: वनं गते धर्मपरे रामे रमयतां वरे । कौसल्या रुदती स्वार्ता भर्तारमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: When Rama, the greatest among those who please the people, he who was conscious of his duty left for the forest. Kausalya, sobbing in bitter anguish, said to her husband:
data.anv: धर्मपरे dutiful, रमयताम् pleasing others, वरे greatest, रामे Rama, वनम् forest, गते had gone, कौशल्या Kausalya, स्वार्ता in bitter anguish, रुदती sobbing, भर्तारम् to her husband, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: On that foremost of those capable of charming people, the righteous Rāma, repairing to the forest, Kausalyā crying in grief said to her husband.

data.v: यद्यपित्रिषु लोकेषु प्रथितं ते मयद्यशः । सानुक्रोशो वदान्यश्च प्रियवादी च राघवः ।।
data.es: Your great fame has spread all over the three worlds. People know you as compassionate, generous and sweetspeaking scion of the Raghus.
data.anv: राघवः Dasaratha, scion of the Raghu dynasty, सानुक्रोशः compassionate, वदान्यश्च generous, प्रियवादी च sweettongued, ते your, महत् great, यशः fame, त्रिषु three, लोकेषु in worlds, प्रथितं यद्यपि even though very popular.
data.md: Your great fame has spread over the three worlds; and the descendant of Raghu is kind, munificent and fair-speaking.

data.v: कथं नरवरश्रेष्ठ पुत्रौ तौ सह सीतया । दुःखितौ सुखसंवृद्धौ वने दुःखं सहिष्यतः ।।
data.es: O Dasaratha, the best among kings, how will your two sons and Sita brought up in great comfort now tolerate the hardships of forest life?
data.anv: नरवरश्रेष्ठ best among kings (Dasaratha), सुखसंवृद्धौ brought up with comfort, तौ पुत्रौ your two sons, सीतया सह with Sita, दुःखितौ stricken with grief, वने in the forest, दुःखम्  suffering, कथम् how?, सहिष्यतः endure?
data.md: Why then have you forsaken those foremost of men along with Sītā? Brought up in happiness, and now brought to misery, how can they bear it?

data.v: सा नूनं तरुणी श्यामा सुकुमारी सुखोचिता । कथमुष्णं च शीतं च मैथिली प्रसहिष्यते ।।
data.es: How can the daughter of Mithila (Sita) who in the prime of her life, accustomed to comforts, endure heat and cold indeed?
data.anv: तरुणी young, श्यामा in the prime of life, सुकुमारी delicate, सुखोचिता accustomed to comfort, सा मैथिली that Sita, उष्णं च heat, शीतं च cold, नूनम् surely, कथम् how?, प्रसहिष्यते will bear.
data.md: How can the youthful daughter of Mithilā of slender make, tender, and deserving of happiness, bear heat and cold?

data.v: भुक्त्वाशनं विशालाक्षी सूपदंशान्वितं शुभम् । वन्यं नैवारमाहारं कथं सीतोपभोक्ष्यते ।।
data.es: How can the largeeyed Sita having enjoyed delicious food mixed with condiments and soup now partake the food prepared with wild grains?
data.anv: विशालाक्षी largeeyed, सीता Sita, सूपदं शान्वितम् with condiments and soup, शुभम् wellprepared, अशनम् food, भुक्त्वा having partaken, वन्यम् in the forest, नैवारम् made with wild rice, आहारम् food, कथं उपभोक्ष्यते how will she eat?
data.md: Having formerly partaken of (excellent) rice with curries, how will Sita feed on wild rice?

data.v: गीतवादित्रनिर्घोषं श्रुत्वा शुभमनिन्दिता । कथं क्रव्यादसिंहानां शब्दं श्रोष्यत्यशोभनम् ।।
data.es: How can the blameless Sita, used to the soft sound of songs and musical instruments hear the frightful roars of lions and other carnivorous animals?
data.anv: अनिन्दिता blameless, शुभम् auspicious, गीतवादित्रनिर्घोषम् sounds of songs and musical instruments, श्रुत्वा having heard, अशोभनम् inauspicious, क्रव्यादसिंहानाम् carnivorous animals' and lions', शब्दम् sound, कथम् how?, श्रोष्यति can hear.
data.md: Having heard excellent vocal and instrumental music, how will Sītă hear the frightful cries of carnivorous lions?

data.v: महेन्द्रध्वजसंकाशः क्व नु शेते महाभुजः । भुजं परिघसंकाशमुपधाय महाबलः ।।
data.es: Where will that mightyarmed and powerful Rama, as lofty as Indra's banner, sleep using his ironbarlike arm as pillow?.
data.anv: महेन्द्रध्वजसङ्काशः resembling mighty Indra's banner, महाभुजः longarmed one, महाबलः mighty, परिघसङ्काशम् like a sword, भुजम् arm, उपधाय using as a pillow, क्व where, शेते नु is he sleeping?
data.md: Resembling the gonfalon of the great Indra, where sleeps the mighty-armed and exceedingly powerful Råma, making his arm like to a mace his pillow?

data.v: पद्मवर्णं सुकेशान्तं पद्मनिःश्वासमुत्तमम् । कदा द्रक्ष्यामि रामस्य वदनं पुष्करेक्षणम् ।।
data.es: When shall I see Rama with his lotushued face, his beautiful locks of hair, breath of lotus fragrance and eyes like blue lotus?
data.anv: पद्मवर्णम् lotuslike complexion, सुकेशान्तम् having beautiful hairends, पद्मनिश्श्वासम् breath of lotus fragrance, पुष्करेक्षणम् eyes like blue lotus, उत्तमम् excellent, रामस्य वदनम् Rama's countenance, कदा when, द्रक्ष्यामि shall I behold?.
data.md: When shall I behold Rāma's countenance hued like the lotus, with his hair ending beautifully (in curls), and his breath impregnated with the fine perfume of the lotus, and his eyes resembling lotus leaves?

data.v: वज्रसारमयं नूनं हृदयं मे न संशयः । अपश्यन्त्या न तं यद्वै फलतीदं सहस्रधा ।।
data.es: No doubt my heart must be made of thunderbolt, since unable to see Rama it does not split into a thousand pieces.
data.anv: मे हृदयम् my heart, वज्रसारमयम् is made of thunderbolt, नूनम् surely, संशयः doubt, न not, यत् since, तम् Rama, अपश्यन्त्याः without seeing, इदम् this heart, सहस्रधा thousand pieces, न फलति वै does not shatter.
data.md: Surely my heart, without doubt, is made of the essence of the thunderbolt, since not beholding him, it is not cracked in a thousand fragments.

data.v: यदि पञ्चदशे वर्षे राघवः पुनरेष्यति । जह्याद्राज्यं च कोशं च भरतेनोपभोक्ष्यते ।।
data.es: Even if Rama returns in the fifteenth year, it is unlikely that Bharata will give up the kingdom and royal treasury (in favour of Rama).
data.anv: राघवः Rama, पञ्चदशे वर्षे in the fifteenth year, पुनः एष्यति यदि if returns, भरतः Bharata, राज्यं च kingdom, कोषं च treasury too, जह्यात् will give up, नोपलक्ष्यते it does not appear.
data.md: If after the expiration of the five and ten years, Rāghava does return, it does not appear likely that Bharata will renounce the kingdom and the exchequer.

data.v: एवं कनीयसा भ्रात्रा भुक्तं राज्यं विशां पते । भ्राता ज्येष्ठा वरिष्ठाश्च किमर्थं नावमंस्यते ।।
data.es: O Lord of the world why not the eldest and the most distinguished among the brothers likewise disdain the kingdom enjoyed by the younger brother?
data.anv: विशाम्पते O Lord of the world (Dasaratha), एवम् likewise, ज्येष्ठः eldest, वरिष्ठश्च most distinguished one, भ्राता brother, कनीयसा by the younger, भ्रात्रा brother, भुक्तम् enjoyed, राज्यम् kingdom, किमर्थम् why, नावमंस्यते will not disdain.
data.md: Why will not an elder brother and one who has sterling merits, O monarch, disregard a kingdom which has been thus enjoyed by his younger brother?

data.v: न परेणाहृतं भक्ष्यं व्याघ्रः खादितुमिच्छति । एवमेव नरव्याघ्रः परलीढं न मंस्यते ।।
data.es: Just as a tiger will not eat the food acquired by another beast, Rama, the tiger (best) among men will not accept the kingdom enjoyed by others.
data.anv: व्याघ्रः tiger, परेण by some other animal, आहृतम् procured, भक्ष्यम् food, खादितुम् to eat,        न  इच्छति does not like, एवं in the same way, नरव्याघ्रः the (best) among men (Rama), एतत् परलीढम् enjoyed by others, न मन्यते will not accept.
data.md: A tiger does not like to feed on food procured by others. Even so that tiger-like personage does not regard anything that has come to be tasted by another.

data.v: हविराज्यं पुरोडाशाः कुशा यूपाश्च खादिराः । नैतानि यातयामानि कुर्वन्ति पुनरध्वरे ।।
data.es: Havis, sacrificial offerings like ghee, cakes, kusha grass, and sacrificial posts made from khadira wood, once used in the sacrifice cannot be used again.
data.anv: हविः offering to the Firegod, आज्यम् ghee, पुरोडाशाः sacrificial cakes, कुशाः kusha grass, खादिराः khadira wood, यूपाश्च sacrificial posts, यातयामानि after the lapse of one Yama (three hours), एतानि all these, अध्वरे in the sacrifice, पुनः again, न कुर्वन्ति will not be used.
data.md: Clarified butter, sacrificial cakes, Kusa, stakes of catechu having been used in one sacrifice cannot be used in another.

data.v: तथा ह्यात्तमिदं राज्यं हृतसारां सुरामिव । नाभिमन्तुमलं रामो नष्टसोममिवाध्वरम् ।।
data.es: In the same way Rama will not accept this kingdom enjoyed by others like liquour or soma juice drained of its essence.
data.anv: तथा in the same way, रामः Rama, आत्तम् enjoyed by others, इदं राज्यम् this kingdom, हृतसाराम् its essence taken away, सुरामिव like liquour, नष्टसोमम् like the run out soma juice, अध्वरमिव like a sacrifice, अभिमन्तुम् to accept, नालम् should not.
data.md: Even so this kingdom which has been already enjoyed, like to liquor deprived of its essence or a sacrifice whose soma has been eaten, cannot be accepted by Rāma.

data.v: नैवंविधमसत्कारं राघवो मर्षयिष्यति । बलवानिव शार्दूलो बालधेरभिमर्शनम् ।।
data.es: A powerful tiger will not allow its tail to be twisted. In the same way Rama also will not tolerate an insult of this sort.
data.anv: बलवान् strong, शार्दूलः tiger, वालधेः of its tail, अभिमर्शनम् इव like twisting, राघवः Rama, एवं विधम् such, असत्कारम् insult, न मर्षयिष्यति will not tolerate.
data.md: Such an ill treatment Rāghava will not put up with, even as a powerful tiger cannot bear the rubbing of its tail (by another).

data.v: स तादृशः सिंहबलो वृषभाक्षो नरर्षभः । स्वयमेव हतः पित्रा जलजेनात्मजो यथा ।।
data.es: Such Rama, the best among men, powerful like a lion, with eyes fierce like that of a bull has been destroyed by his own father just as the big fish destroys its own offsprings.
data.anv: तादृशः such, सिंहबलः powerful as lion, वृषभाक्षः his eyes resembling a bull's, सः नरर्षभः that one, a bull among men, जलजेन by fish, आत्मजो यथा its own offspring, पित्रैव by his father himself, स्वयम् by himself, हतः killed.
data.md: But such a man of men, possessed of leonine strength, and graced with the eyes of a bull, has been destroyed by his father, like a fish destroying his offspring.

data.v: द्विजाति चरितो धर्मः शास्त्रदृष्टः सनातनः । यदि ते धर्मनिरते त्वया पुत्रे विवासिते ।।
data.es: You have banished your son who is devoted to righteousness. Is it in accordance with the scriptures and the eternal tradition followed by the twiceborn?
data.anv: धर्मनिरते devoted to righteousness, पुत्रे son, त्वया by you, विवासिते has been banished, ते  to you, शास्त्रदृष्टः seen in the scriptures, सनातनः eternal, द्विजातिचरितः followed by the twiceborn, धर्मः यदि is it righteous act?
data.md: If you had believed in the morality prescribed in the scriptures, and which is followed by the twice-born ones, you would not have banished your son. But disregarding such morality, you have banished your virtuous son.

data.v: गतिरेवाक्पतिर्नार्या द्वितीया गतिरात्मजः । तृतीया ज्ञातयो राजंश्चतुर्थी नेह विद्यते ।।
data.es: O king for a woman the first refuge is the husband, the second her son, the third her relatives and there is no fourth alternative in this world.
data.anv: राजन् O king, नार्याः for a woman,पतिः husband, एका one, गतिः refuge, आत्मजः son, द्वितीया गतिः second refuge, ज्ञातयः relatives, तृतीया third, चतुर्थी fourth, इह in this world, न विद्यते does not exist.
data.md: One of the refuges of a woman is her husband, a second is her son, and a third is her relatives; and a fourth she has none.

data.v: तत्र त्वं चैव मे नास्ति रामश्च वनमाश्रितः । न वनं गन्तुमिच्छामि सर्वथा हि हता त्वया ।।
data.md: But you cease to be mine; and Rāma has been sent to the woods. I do not like to go into the forest; so I am entirely undone by you.

data.v: हतं त्वया राज्यमिदं सराष्ट्रं; हतस्तथात्मा सह मन्त्रिभिश्च । हता सपुत्रास्मि हताश्च पौराः; सुतश्च भार्या च तव प्रहृष्टौ ।।
data.md: This kingdom, your own kingdom, has been destroyed by you; destroyed are all along with the counsellors; destroyed am I with my son; and destroyed are the citizens: your son and your wife are alone delighted.

data.v: इमां गिरं दारुणशब्दसंश्रितां; निशम्य राजापि मुमोह दुःखितः । ततः स शोकं प्रविवेश पार्थिवः; स्वदुष्कृतं चापि पुनस्तदास्मरत् ।।
data.md: Hearing these words uttered in heart-rending accents, Dasaratha exceedingly distressed, became senseless. And being afflicted with grief, he again remembered his evil act.

data.v: एवं तु क्रुद्धया राजा राममात्रा सशोकया । श्रावितः परुषं वाक्यं चिन्तयामास दुःखितः ।।
data.es: Forced to hear the harsh words of angry Kausalya, the king, deeply distressed, was absorbed in sad thought.
data.anv: क्रुद्धया in anger, सशोकया afflicted with sorrow, राममात्रा by Rama's mother, एवम् in that way, परुषम् harsh, वाक्यम् words, श्रावितः was forced to hear, राजा king, दुःखितः distressed, चिन्तयामास sadly reflected.
data.md: Thus harshly addressed by the indignant mother of Rāma, the king aggrieved was plunged in thought. Having thought for a long while, that repressor of foes, the king, who had lost his senses through grief, regained consciousness.

data.v: तस्य चिन्तयमानस्य प्रत्यभात्कर्म दुष्कृतम् । यदनेन कृतं पूर्वमज्ञानाच्छब्दवेधिना ।।
data.es: While he was thus reflecting on a sinful act he had inadvertently comitted long ago, the act of discharging an arrow that could hit its target following the sound, flashed in his mind.
data.anv: चिन्तयमानस्य as he was thinking, तस्य his, पूर्वम् formerly, अनेन by such, शब्दवेधिना Capable of hitting the target by following the sound, अज्ञानात् without knowledge, यत् which, कृतम् has been committed, दुष्कृतम् sinful, कर्म act, प्रत्यभात् flashed back.
data.md: As he was thinking, the sinful act which he had through ignorance formerly committed by means of the shaft which hits by sounds, rose up in his recollection,

data.v: अमनास्तेन शोकेन रामशोकेन च प्रभुः । दह्यमानस्तु शोकाभ्यां कौसल्यामाह भूपतिः ।।
data.es: The great king, the lord with a broken heart started regretting deeply about both the grievous acts he had committed previously (one is shooting at the son of a sage and the other, banishing Rama).
data.anv: तेन शोकेन with that grief, रामशोकेन with the grief of Rama's separation, अमनाः with a broken heart, प्रभुः lord, महाराजः maharaja, द्वाभ्याम् by both, शोकाभ्याम् अपि the sorrows also, अन्वतप्यत started regretting.
data.md: Afflicted with this grief as well as that on account of Rāma, that lord, the king, burned in these two several griefs.

data.v: प्रसादये त्वां कौसल्ये रचितोऽयं मयाञ्जलिः । वत्सला चानृशंसा च त्वं हि नित्यं परेष्वपि ।।
data.es: O Kausalya I entreat you with folded palms. Be merciful. Forever affectionate, you are not cruel even towards your enemies.
data.anv: कौशल्ये O Kausalya, त्वाम् you, प्रसादये be merciful, मया by me, अयम् this, अञ्जलिः folded  palms, रचितः set, त्वम् you, परेष्वपि even towards enemies, नित्यम् always, वत्सला is affectionate, अनृशंसा च हि not cruel.
data.md: I deprecate your displeasure. O Kausalyä with joined hands. You are ever affectionate and did not treat harshly even enemies.

data.v: भर्ता तु खलु नारीणां गुणवान्निर्गुणोऽपि वा । धर्मं विमृशमानानां प्रत्यक्षं देवि दैवतम् ।।
data.es: O Devi for women who have regard for righteousness, a husband, whether virtuous or not, is a god incarnate.
data.anv: देवि O Devi, धर्मम् righteousness, विमृशमानानाम् pondering over, नारीणाम् for women, गुणवान् virtuous, निर्गुणोपि वा or not virtuous, भर्ता husband, प्रत्यक्षम् visible, दैवतं खलु indeed god to them.
data.md: Verily to women cognizant of virtue, a husband, whether he has any merits or not, is a very deity.

data.v: सा त्वं धर्मपरा नित्यं दृष्टलोकपरावर । नार्हसे विप्रियं वक्तुं दुःखितापि सुदुःखितम् ।।
data.es: You always adhere to righteousness. You have seen both the extremes (good and bad) of this world. Athough you yourself are in grief it does not behove you to speak unpleasant words to one who is suffering from a greater grief.
data.anv: नित्यम् always, धर्मपरा righteousminded one, दृष्टलोकवरावरा knower of both the extremities, सा त्वम् such as you, दुःखितापि although grieved, सुदुःखितम् one who is weighed down with grief, विप्रियम् unpleasant words, वक्तुम् to speak, नार्हसि does not behove you.
data.md: Ever virtuous, you, that have seen both the virtuous and the vicious, although aggrieved, ought not to say anything unpleasant to me who am weighed down with woe.

data.v: तद्वाक्यं करुणं राज्ञः श्रुत्वा दीनस्य भाषितम् । कौसल्या व्यसृजद्बाष्पं प्रणालीव नवोदकम् ।।
data.es: Kausalya heard the pitiable words uttered by the king who was in a wretched condition. She shed tears like a water channel discharging fresh rainwater.
data.anv: कौशल्या Kausalya, दीनस्य of the wretched, राज्ञः king's, करुणम् pitiable, भाषितम् utterances, तत् वाक्यम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, प्रणाली water conduit, नवोदकमिव like discharging fresh rainwater, बाष्पम् tears, व्यसृजत् shed.
data.md: Having heard these piteous words of the distressed king, Kausalyā uttered words even as a water-way lets out fresh accession of rain.

data.v: स मूद्र्ह्णि बद्ध्वा रुदती राज्ञः पद्ममिवाञ्जलिम् । संभ्रमादब्रवीत्त्रस्ता त्वरमाणाक्षरं वचः ।।
data.es: Frightened Kausalya, weeping and raising her palms folded like lotus on to her head, and charged with emotions said with stumbling syllables:
data.anv: सा that Kausalya, रुदती crying, पद्ममिव like lotus, राज्ञः king's, अञ्जलिम् folded palms,  मूर्ध्नि on her head, बध्वा setting, त्रस्ता frightened, सम्भ्रमात् out of emotion, त्वरमाणाक्षरम्   stumbling syllables, वचः words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: And weeping, she drew on her head the joined hands of the king resembling lotuses; and then flurried spoke these words hurriedly informed with extreme affection.

data.v: प्रसीद शिरसा याचे भूमौ निततितास्मि ते । याचितास्मि हता देव हन्तव्याहं न हि त्वया ।।
data.es: O lord, by falling on the ground at your feet, bowing my head I beg of you to be pleased. By your act of beseeching me, I have been badly hurt. I do deserve to be pardoned.
data.anv: देव O lord, प्रसोद be pleased, भूमौ on the earth, निपतिता अस्मि I have fallen down, शिरसा bowing down my head, याचे I beg of you, ते your (by you), याचिता besought, हता अस्मि I have been hit, अहम्  I, त्वया by you, न क्षन्तव्या हि unfit to be pardoned.
data.md: Be you propitious; I beseech with (bended) head. I bow to you, falling on the ground. O reverend one, besought by you, I shall be undone. I do not deserve to be forgiven by you.

data.v: नैषा हि सा स्त्री भवति श्लाघनीयेन धीमता । उभयोर्लोकयोर्वीर पत्या या संप्रसाद्यते ।।
data.es: O heroic one a woman, who is entreated by her sagacious and praiseworthy husband, loses both the worlds.
data.anv: वीर O heroic one, या whoever, श्लाघनीयेन by the praiseworthy, धीमता sagacious one, पत्या by the husband, सम्प्रसाद्यते is appeased, सा एषा such this, स्त्री woman, उभयोः both, लोकयोः worlds, न भवति हि does not belong.
data.md: She cannot be reckoned a gentlewoman, who is propitiated by her intelligent husband, worthy of being extolled in both worlds.

data.v: जानामि धर्मं धर्मज्ञ त्वां जाने सत्यवादिनम् । पुत्रशोकार्तया तत्तु मया किमपि भाषितम् ।।
data.es: O righteous one I know the path of dharma. I also know that you are a truthful. Afflicted with grief on account of my son, I spoke somewhat harshly.
