data.anv: धर्मज्ञ O righteous one, धर्मम् righteousness, जानामि I know, त्वाम् you, सत्यवादिनम् truthful, जाने know, तु but, पुत्रशोकार्तया by one afflicted with grief over a son, मया by me, तत् that, किमपि somewhat improper, भाषितम् spoken.
data.md: I know duty, O righteous one; I know that you are truth-telling. And it is because I was exceedingly distressed on account of my son that I spoke harshly to you.

data.v: शोको नाशयते धैर्यं शोको नाशयते श्रुतम् । शोको नाशयते सर्वं नास्ति शोकसमो रिपुः ।।
data.es: Grief destroys fortitude. Grief destroys knowledge of the scriptures, grief destroys everything. There is no enemy equal to grief.
data.anv: शोकः grief, धैर्यम् patience, नाशयते destroys, शोकः grief, श्रुतम् knowledge of the scriptures, नाशयते destroys, शोकः grief, सर्वम् everything, नाशयते destroys, शोकसमः equal to grief, रिपुः enemy, नास्ति not there.
data.md: Sorrow destroys patience, sorrow destroys knowledge of the scriptures, sorrow destroys every things; there is no enemy like to sorrow.

data.v: शयमापतितः सोढुं प्रहरो रिपुहस्ततः । सोढुमापतितः शोकः सुसूक्ष्मोऽपि न शक्यते ।।
data.es: One can endure an unexpected blow from the enemy's hand but to endure unexpected grief, however slight it may be, is impossible.
data.anv: रिपुहस्तः from the enemy's hand, आपतितः suddenly fallen, प्रहारः blow, सोढुम् to endure, शक्यः possible, शोकः grief, सुसूक्ष्मोऽपि however slight, सोढुम् to endure, न शक्यते not possible.
data.md: One can falling down bear ever beating from an enemy; but one cannot falling down bear ever so little sorrow.

data.v: वनवासाय रामस्य पञ्चरात्रोऽद्य गण्यते । यः शोकहतहर्षायाः पञ्चवर्षोपमो मम ।।
data.es: This is the fifth night of Rama's exile, but it is like five years to me whose joy has been destroyed by sorrow.
data.anv: वनवासाय for exile in the forest, रामस्य Rama's, पञ्चरात्रः five nights, अद्य today, गण्यते has been counted, यः such a period, शोकहतहर्षायाः whose joy has been destroyed by sorrow, मम to me, पञ्चवर्षोपमः equal to five years.
data.md: This is the fifth night of the banishment of Rāma, as calculated by me; and to me rendered cheerless by sorrow, this interval has assumed the proportions of five years.

data.v: तं हि चिन्तयमानायाः शोकोऽयं हृदि वर्धते । अदीनामिव वेगेन समुद्रसलिलं महत् ।।
data.es: As I think of Rama, my heart swells with sorrow just as the ocean rises with rushing rivers.
data.anv: तम् Rama, चिन्तयमानायाः while thinking of, हृदि in my heart, अयम् this, शोकः sadness, नदीनाम् by river waters, वेगेन by speed, महत् great, समुद्रसलिलमिव like seawaters, वर्धते is increasing.
data.md: And fostered by thought on my part, this grief increases in my bosom, like the mighty waters of the ocean increased by the vehement discharge of rivers.

data.v: एवं हि कथयन्त्यास्तु कौसल्यायाः शुभं वचः । मन्दरश्मिरभूत्सुर्यो रजनी चाभ्यवर्तत ।।
data.es: While Kausalya was speaking these hearttouching words, the rays of the Sun began to fade and the night fell.
data.anv: कौशल्यायाः of Kausalya, एवम् in that manner, शुभम् auspicious, वचः words, कथयन्त्याः speaking, सूर्यः the Sun, मन्दरश्मिः आभूत् faded rays, रजनी च night, अभ्यवर्तत had set in.
data.md: As Kausalyā was thus speaking auspiciously, the rays of the sun grew milder, and the night arrived. Cheered up by the words of Kausalya, the king overcome by grief, felt the influence of sleep.

data.v: अथ प्रह्लादितो वाक्यैर्देव्या कौसल्यया नृपः । शोकेन च समाक्रान्तो निद्राया वशमेयिवान् ।।
data.md: As Kausalyā was thus speaking auspiciously, the rays of the sun grew milder, and the night arrived. Cheered up by the words of Kausalya, the king overcome by grief, felt the influence of sleep.

data.v: प्रतिबुद्धो मुहुर्तेन शोकोपहतचेतनः । अथ राजा दशरथः स चिन्तामभ्यपद्यत ।।
data.es: Waking up in a moment tormented with grief, the king began to ponder once again.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, सः राजा that king, मूहूर्तेन in a moment, प्रतिबुद्धः was awakened, शोकोपहतचेतनः with his spirit gripped by sorrow, चिन्ताम् worry, अभ्यपद्यत obtained.
data.md: Starting in a moment from sleep, king Dasaratha deprived (almost) of his consciousness by grief, (again) became a prey to thought.

data.v: रामलक्ष्मणयोश्चैव विवासाद्वासवोपमम् । आविवेशोपसर्गस्तं तमः सूर्यमिवासुरम् ।।
data.es: Indralike Dasaratha due to banishment of Rama and Lakshmana, was besieged by a great calamity like the Sun enveloped by demonic dark at the time of eclipse.
data.anv: रामलक्ष्मणयोः Rama and Lakshmana, विवासात् due to banishment, वासवोपमम् like Indra, तम् him, असुरम् relating to that asura, तमः darkness, सूर्यमिव like the Sun, उपसर्गः great calamity, आविवेश took possesion of.
data.md: I consequence of the exile of Rāma and Laks mana, the king resembling Våsava was overpowered by grief, like the darkness of Rāhu enveloping the sun. was own

data.v: स राजा रजनीं षष्ठीं रामे प्रव्रजिते वनम् । अर्धरात्रे दशरथः संस्मरन्दुष्कृतं कृतम् । कौसल्यां पुत्रशोकार्तामिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: After the banishment of Rama the king spent the sixth night, recalling the evil deed done by him in the past.
data.anv: रामे Rama, वनम् to forest, प्रव्राजिते was banished, राजा king, सः दशरथः Dasaratha, षष्ठीम् sixth, रजनीम् night, अर्धरात्रे in the middle of the night, कृतम् done in the past, दुष्कृतम् evil deeds, संस्मरन् recalled.
data.md: And on the sixth night after Rāma had repaired to the forest, the king Dasaratha, when it midnight, remembered his unrighteous act.

data.v: यदाचरति कल्याणि शुभं वा यदि वाशुभम् । तदेव लभते भद्रे कर्ता कर्मजमात्मनः ।।
data.es: O gentle auspicious lady a man has to reap the fruit of his action, good or evil.
data.anv: कल्याणि O auspicious lady, भद्रे o gentle lady, कर्ता the agent of an act, शुभं वा good or, यदि वा or if, अशुभम् evil, यत् whichever, आचरति (कुरुते) performs, आत्मनः his, कर्मजम् result of action, तदेव the same only, लभते will attain.
data.md: As are the actions of one, O auspicious one, whether good otherwise, the consequences, O gentle lady, reaped by the doer of them.

data.v: गुरु लाघवमर्थानामारम्भे कर्मणां फलम् । दोषं वा यो न जानाति स बाल इति होच्यते ।।
data.es: He who, at the commencement of any action, does not foresee the good or evil consequences of his action in considered a child.
data.anv: यः whoever, कर्मणाम् actions, आरम्भे at the beginning, अर्थानाम् the benefits, गुरुलाघवम् relative value, फलम् fruit, दोषं वा or blemish, न जानाति does not know, सः that one, बालः इति as a boy, उच्यते ह is considered.
data.md: He that on the eve of beginning an action either relating to this world or the next, does not take into consideration the fact that actions entail consequences light or grave, disagreeable (or otherwise), is styled a child.

data.v: कश्चिदाम्रवणं छित्त्वा पलाशांश्च निषिञ्चति । पुष्पं दृष्ट्वा फले गृध्नुः स शोचति फलागमे ।।
data.es: If some one cuts down mango trees and plants palasa trees and waters them will repent when he sees only flowers while he expects fruit.
data.anv: कश्चित् some one, पुष्पम् flowers, दृष्ट्वा having seen, फले fruit (of that tree), गृध्नुः greed, आम्रवणम् mango trees, छित्वा having cut, पलाशाम् palasa tree, निषिञ्चति waters, सः he, फलागमे when the fruits are borne, शोचति will repent.
data.md: He that cutting down a mango grove, waters Palasa trees, beholding the flowers (blooming), will covet fruits; and grieve when their season arrives. The person that without apprehending (the principle of causation) rushed to action, grieves at the season of fruits, even like him that waters kinsuka trees (hewing down his mango grove). or are

data.v: सोऽहमाम्रवणं छित्त्वा पलाशांश्च न्यषेचयम् । रामं फलागमे त्यक्त्वा पश्चाच्छोचामि दुर्मतिः ।।
data.es: So I have cut the mango trees and watered palasa trees. In utter foolishness, I have banished Rama at the time of fruition and regretting later.
data.anv: सः अहम् such me, आम्रवणम् mango trees, छित्वा cutting, पलाशान् च palasa trees, न्यषेचयम् have watered, दुर्मतिः unwise, फलागमे at the time of bearing fruit, रामम् Rama, त्यक्त्वा leaving, पश्चात् repenting, शोचामि I am grieving.
data.md: And is this way, I fool that I am having hewn down my grove of mangoes and watered Palāsas, having renounced Räma in the season of fruit, is grieving in the end.

data.v: लब्धशब्देन कौसल्ये कुमारेण धनुष्मता । कुमारः शब्दवेधीति मया पापमिदं कृतम् । तदिदं मेऽनुसंप्राप्तं देवि दुःखं स्वयं कृतम् ।।
data.es: O Kausalya in my youth I was a great archer who could hit the target by its sound. As such I committed this sin.
data.anv: कौशल्ये O Kausalya, शब्दवेधी one who can shoot arrows aiming at the target by sound, कुमारः इति in chidhood itself, लब्धशब्देन attaining knowledge of sound, कुमारेण in my youth, धनुष्मता as an archer, मया by me, इदम् this, पापम् sin, कृतम् was done.
data.md: Having, O Kausalyā, earned the expression, 'The Prince can pierce his aim by sound alone,', I, a prince and bowman, did this offence.

data.v: संमोहादिह बालेन यथा स्याद्भक्षितं विषम् । एवं ममाप्यविज्ञातं शब्दवेध्यमयं फलम् ।।
data.es: Like some one who is deluded by palasa trees I too did not realise the consequences of shooting the target following the direction of the sound.
data.anv: अन्यः other, कश्चित् some one, पुरुषः man, पलाशैः by palasa trees, यथा as, मोहितः deluded, भवेत् becomes, एवम् like that, ममापि to me, शब्दवेध्यमयम् the act of shooting the target on hearing the sound, फलम् the consequences, अविज्ञातम् was not premeditated.

data.v: देव्यनूढा त्वमभवो युवराजो भवाम्यहम् । ततः प्रावृडनुप्राप्ता मदकामविवर्धिनी ।।
data.es: O Kausalya, you were not married then. I was prince regent. The rainy season that inflames passion and pride had just set in.
data.anv: देवि O Kausalya, त्वम् you, अनूढा not married, अभवः you were, युवराज: भवामि I was prince regent, ततः at that time, मदकामविवर्धिनी inflaming passion and pride, प्रावृट् rainy season, अनुप्राप्ता had set in.
data.md: O lady, you were then unwedded; and I was a youthful prince. And it was at this time that the rainy season increasing my desire set in.

data.v: उपास्यहि रसान्भौमांस्तप्त्वा च जगदंशुभिः । परेताचरितां भीमां रविराविशते दिशम् ।।
data.es: Having sucked the waters of the earth and scorching the world with its rays, the Sun had entered the frightful southern quarter ranged by departed souls.
data.anv: रविः Sun, भौमान् relating to the earth, रसान् juices, उपास्य sucking, जगत् world, अंशुभिः by the rays, तप्त्वा च scorching, परेता चरिताम् ranged by departed souls, भीमाम् fearful, दिशम् quarter, आविशते enter sattained.
data.md: Drawing moisture from the ground and heated the earth by his rays, the Sun goes to the dreadful quarter whither repair the dead.

data.v: उष्णमन्तर्दधे सद्यः स्निग्धा ददृशिरे घनाः । ततो जहृषिरे सर्वे भेकसारङ्गबर्हिणः ।।
data.es: At that time the heat subsided, glistening clouds appeared. The frogs, geese and peacocks began to rejoice.
data.anv: सद्यः instantaneously, उष्णम् heat, अन्तर्दधे vanished, स्निग्धा: glistening, घनाः clouds, ददृशिरे were seen, ततः thereafter, सर्वे all, भेकसारङ्गबर्हिणः frogs, geese and peacocks, जहृषिरे rejoiced.
data.md: The heat was immediately dispelled, and the gelid clouds snowed themselves; and frogs and Sārangas and peacocks began to rejoice; and, finding it unpleasant, the feathered ones bathed and with the surface of their plumage shrunk up from the wet, took refuge in trees shaken by the wind and rain.

data.v: पतितेनाम्भसा छन्नः पतमानेन चासकृत् । आबभौ मत्तसारङ्गस्तोयराशिरिवाचलः ।।
data.es: Engulfed by torrents of rain that continued to fall ceaselessly, the mountain visited by intoxicated antelopes looked like a mass of water.
data.anv: पतितेन dropped, असकृत् ceaselessly, पतमानेन dropping, अम्भसा with rain water, छन्नः covered, मत्तसारङ्गः intoxicated antelopes, अचलः mountain, तोयराशिरिव like a mass of water, अबभौ looked like.
data.md: And the hill graced by maddened Sārangas, covered by showers falling simultaneously looked like a mass of waters.

data.v: तस्मिन्नतिसुखे काले धनुष्मानिषुमान्रथी । व्यायाम कृतसंकल्पः सरयूमन्वगां नदीम् ।।
data.es: In that highly delightful season, wishing to go hunting I, armed with bow and arrows, rode my chariot towards river Sarayu.
data.anv: अतिसुखे highly delightful, तस्मिन् काले in that season, व्यायामकृतसङ्कल्पः determined to go hunting, धनुष्मान् holding bow, इषुमान् holding arrows, रथी a charioteer, सरयूनदीम् river Sarayu, अन्वगाम् went.
data.md: At such a sweet hour, I intent upon taking exercise, taking my bow and arrows and mounted on my car, sallied out for the river Sarayū, with the intention that I with my senses under control, should in the watery expense slay any buffalo, elephant, or any other beast that mighty have come there in the night.

data.v: निपाने महिषं रात्रौ गजं वाभ्यागतं नदीम् । अन्यं वा श्वापदं कंचिज्जिघांसुरजितेन्द्रियः ।।
data.es: And there, with no control over my senses, I hid in a lonely place with my bow in readiness intending to shoot a buffalo or an elephant or any other wild animal that might come to the spot for drinking water in the night.
data.anv: अहम् I, अजितेन्द्रियः without any control over my senses, तस्मिन् there, निपाने in a spot for drinking water, नदीम् river, रात्रौ in the night, अभ्यागतम् having arrived, महिषम् buffalo, गजं वा or elephant, अन्यम् any other, श्वापदं वा any wild animal, जिघांसुः desirous of killing, तत्र there, रात्रौ in the night, एकान्ते in a lonely place, विवृतकार्मुकः with bow strung.
data.md: At such a sweet hour, I intent upon taking exercise, taking my bow and arrows and mounted on my car, sallied out for the river Sarayū, with the intention that I with my senses under control, should in the watery expense slay any buffalo, elephant, or any other beast that mighty have come there in the night.

data.v: अथान्धकारे त्वश्रौषं जले कुम्भस्य पर्यतः । अचक्षुर्विषये घोषं वारणस्येव नर्दतः ।।
data.es: Then at a place that was out of the range of my sight in darkness I heard the sound of a pitcher being filled with water which resembled the sound of an elephant.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, अन्धकारे in the darkness, अचक्षुर्विषये not within the range of sight, नर्दतः making sounds, वारणस्येव like the sound of an elephant, जले in water, पूर्यतः being filled, कुम्भस्य a pitcher, घोषम् sound, अश्रौषम् heard.
data.md: And (coming there) while it was so dark that : nothing could be discovered, I heard sounds of a filling pitcher proceeding from the waters; resembling the roars of an elephant.

data.v: ततोऽहं शरमुद्धृत्य दीप्तमाशीविषोपमम् । अमुञ्चं निशितं बाणमहमाशीविषोपमम् ।।
data.es: Wishing to kill the elephant, I seized my arrow glowing like a venomous snake and aimed it towards the sound.
data.anv: ततः then, अहम् I, गजप्रेप्सुः wishing to get the elephant, दीप्तम् bright, आशीविषोपमम् like a venomous serpent, शरम् shaft, उधृत्य शब्दं प्रति in the direction of the sound, अभिलक्ष्य aiming at, अपातयम् released.

data.v: तत्र वागुषसि व्यक्ता प्रादुरासीद्वनौकसः । हा हेति पततस्तोये वागभूत्तत्र मानुषी । कथमस्मद्विधे शस्त्रं निपतेत्तु तपस्विनि ।।
data.es: Then I discharged a sharp shaft like a venomous serpent. In the morning twilight I saw that the shaft had hit the vital part of the body of a forest dweller and his cry of 'Alas', was clearly heard as he fell in the water.
data.anv: अहम् I, आशीविषोपमम् like a venomous serpent, निशितम् sharp, बाणम् shaft, अमुञ्चम् dischrged, तत्र there, उषसि in the morning twilight, बाणाभिहतमर्मणः with the vital organ hit by the shaft, तोये in water, पततः falling, वनौकसः forestdweller, हा हा इति saying 'Alas', व्यक्ता screaming aloud, वाक् words, प्रादुरासीत् arose.

data.v: प्रविविक्तां नदीं रात्रावुदाहारोऽहमागतः । इषुणाभिहतः केन कस्य वा किं कृतं मया ।।
data.es: 'I have come to this lonely spot of the river to take water. Who has hit me with this arrow? What (harm) have I done to any one?'
data.anv: अहम् I, उदाहारः in order to take water, रात्रौ at night, प्रविविक्ताम् lonely, नदीम् river, आगतः have come, इषुणा by an arrow, केन by whom, अभिहतः hit, मया by me, कस्य to any, किम् what offence, कृतम् done.

data.v: ऋषेर्हि न्यस्त दण्डस्य वने वन्येन जीवतः । कथं नु शस्त्रेण वधो मद्विधस्य विधीयते ।।
data.es: 'Renouncing violence I live the life of an ascetic on forest produce. Why should any one kill me with a weapon?
data.anv: न्यस्तदण्डस्य renouncing violence, वने in  the forest, वन्येन forest produce जीवतःsubsisting, मद्विधस्य men like me, ऋषेः for an ascetic, शस्त्रेण with weapon, वधः killing, कथं नु in what way?, विधीयते is perpetrated.

data.v: जटाभारधरस्यैव वल्कलाजिनवाससः । को वधेन ममार्थी स्यात्किं वास्यापकृतं मया ।।
data.es: 'Who wants to kill me who lives like an ascetic with matted hair and wearing bark or the skin of an antelope? What harm have I done to him?
data.anv: जटाभारधरस्यैव with matted hair, वल्कलाजिनवाससः wearing bark and skin of an antelope, मम my, वधेन by killing, अर्थी interested, कः who?, स्यात् मया could be?, अस्य to him, किं वा what, अपकृतम् harm?

data.v: एवं निष्फलमारब्धं केवलानर्थसंहितम् । न कश्चित्साधु मन्येत यथैव गुरुतल्पगम् ।।
data.es: 'Whoever it is, he has committed only a mischievous and senseless act. This sin like a disciple sleeping on the bed of his preceptor none will approve of.
data.anv: एवम् in this way, केवलानर्थसंहितम् only for mischief, निष्फलम् fruitless, आरब्धम् effort, कश्चित् some one, गुरुतल्पगं यथैव like one who occupies the teacher's bed, साधु मन्येत will consider this proper.

data.v: नेमं तथानुशोचामि जीवितक्षयमात्मनः । मातरं पितरं चोभावनुशोचामि मद्विधे ।।
data.es: 'I do not regret so much about the loss of my own life as about my mother and father after I am dead.
data.anv: अहम् I, आत्मनः my own, जीवितक्षयम् loss of life, तथा not so much, नानुशोचामि do not regret, मद्वधे after my killing, मातरम् mother, पितरं च and father, उभौ both, अनुशोचामि I am grieving.

data.v: तदेतान्मिथुनं वृद्धं चिरकालभृतं मया । मयि पञ्चत्वमापन्ने कां वृत्तिं वर्तयिष्यति ।।
data.es: 'So long I have been supporting this aged couple. After I am dead, how will they live?
data.anv: मयि when I, पञ्चत्वम् with five elements, आपन्ने reduced to, मया by me, चिरकालभृतम् supported for a long time, वृद्धम् in old age, एतत् this, मिथुनम् couple, काम् what, वृत्तिम् life, वर्तयिष्यति will live in future.

data.v: वृद्धौ च मातापितरावहं चैकेषुणा हतः । केन स्म निहताः सर्वे सुबालेनाकृतात्मना ।।
data.es: 'My aged parents along with me are killed by a single arrow. Who is that malicious knave who has slain us?
data.anv: वृद्धौ aged, मातापितरौ my parents, अहं च me also, एकेषुणा with one single arrow, हताः killed, अकृतात्मना one with malicious intention, सुबालेन by a good boy, केन by whom, सर्वे निहताः स्म all of us are killed.

data.v: तं गिरं करुणां श्रुत्वा मम धर्मानुकाङ्क्षिणः । कराभ्यां सशरं चापं व्यथितस्यापतद्भुवि ।।
data.es: On hearing the piteous voice the bow and arrow dropped from my (trembling) hands since I was keen on following the righteous path.
data.anv: करुणाम् piteous, तां गिरम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, धर्मानुकाङ्क्षिणं keen on following the righteous path (fearing that an unrighteous act has been performed), व्यथितस्य worrying, मम my, कराभ्याम् from my hands, सशरम् along with the arrow, चापम् bow भुवि on the land, अपतत् fell down.

data.v: तं देशमहमागम्य दीनसत्त्वः सुदुर्मनाः । अपश्यमिषुणा तीरे सरय्वास्तापसं हतम् ।।
data.es: With dissipated energy and intensely troubled mind, I reached the bank of river Sarayu and there I saw the ascetic lying struck by the arrow and with scattered locks of hair. The water pitcher was thrown away and his body smeared with blood and dust as he lay on the ground.
data.anv: अहम् I, दीनसत्त्वः in a dissipated state, सुदुर्मनाः with troubled mind, तं देशम् that place, आगम्य having reached, सरय्वाः Sarayu, तीरे on the bank, इषुणा by the arrow, हतम् struck, अवकीर्णजटाभारम् with scattered locks of hair, प्रविद्धकलशोदकम् with water pitcher thrown away, पांसुशोणितदिग्धाङ्गम् body smeared with blood and dust, शयानम् lying, शल्यपीडितम् pierced by the arrow, तापसम् the sage, अपश्यम् I saw.

data.v: स मामुद्वीक्ष्य नेत्राभ्यां त्रस्तमस्वस्थचेतसम् । इत्युवाच वचः क्रूरं दिधक्षन्निव तेजसा ।।
data.es: I was mentally stricken and frightened. He looked up as if buring me with the energy of his eyes. Then he uttered the words 'A cruel act'
data.anv: सः he, त्रस्तम् frightened, अस्वस्थचेतसम् shaken up mentally, माम् me, तेजसा with his energy, दिधक्षन्निव as if burning, नेत्राभ्याम् with both eyes, उवदीक्ष्य looked up, ततः then, क्रूरम् cruel, इति thus, उवाच said.

data.v: किं तवापकृतं राजन्वने निवसता मया । जिहीर्षुरम्भो गुर्वर्थं यदहं ताडितस्त्वया ।।
data.es: 'O king you have struck me when I was trying to carry water to my parents. I am a forestdweller. What harm have I done to you?
data.anv: राजन् O king, गुर्वर्थम् for the sake of my parents, अम्भ: water, जिहीर्षुः wishing to take, अहम् I, त्वया you, ताडितः have been struck, वने in the forest, निवसता residing, मया by me, तव your, किम् what, अपकृतम् harm.
data.md: What wrong, O monarch, had I residing in the woods done you, that coming to procure water for my parents, I have been thus afflicted by. you?

data.v: एकेन खलु बाणेन मर्मण्यभिहते मयि । द्वावन्धौ निहतौ वृद्धौ माता जनयिता च मे ।।
data.es: 'By striking at the vital part of my body with one arrow, you have killed both my aged and blind mother and father too.
data.anv: एकेन by one, बाणेन arrow, मयि at me, मर्मणि vital part, अभिहते when struck, मे my, माता mother, जनयिता च father, अन्धौ blind, द्वौ both, वृद्धौ old ones, निहतौ खलु are killed indeed.
data.md: By piercing my marrow with a shaft, you have slain both my aged and blind father and mother.

data.v: तौ नूनं दुर्बलावन्धौ मत्प्रतीक्षौ पिपासितौ । चिरमाशाकृतां तृष्णां कष्टां संधारयिष्यतः ।।
data.es: 'How will the two who are frail, thirsty and blind wait for me for long controlling their thirst with great difficulty with the expectation (that I would fetch them water)?
data.anv: दुर्बलौ weak ones, अन्धौ blind, पिपासितौ thirsty, तौ both of them, कष्टाम् difficult, आशाकृताम् due to expectation, तृष्णाम् thirst, चिरम् for a long time, कथम् how, सन्धारयिष्यतः will control.
data.md: Surely, they feeble and blind, who afflicted by thirst are remaining in expectation of me, will now bear (the stress and tension of) the expectation as well as the parching thirst.

data.v: न नूनं तपसो वास्ति फलयोगः श्रुतस्य वा । पिता यन्मां न जानाति शयानं पतितं भुवि ।।
data.es: 'My father does not know that I am lying on the ground. It is true that there is no reward either for asceticism or for scriptural knowledge.
data.anv: नूनम् surely, तपसो वा either for asceticism, श्रुतस्य वा or for scriptural knowledge, फलयोगः attainment of fruit, नास्ति not there, यत् since, पिता my father, भुवि on this earth, पतितम् fallen, शयानम् lying, माम् me, न जानाति not know.
data.md: Surely asceticism and study carry no fruit with them, since I lying low on the ground, my father knows nothing about it.

data.v: जानन्नपि च किं कुर्यादशक्तिरपरिक्रमः । भिद्यमानमिवाशक्तस्त्रातुमन्यो नगो नगम् ।।
data.es: 'What can my weak father who has no strength to walk do, even if he knows about it? Like a tree which cannot protect another which is being severed, he is helpless.
data.anv: अशक्ति: without energy, अपरिक्रमः who cannot walk, भिद्यमानम् being severed, नगम् tree, त्रातुम् to protect, अशक्तः is incapable, अन्यः other, नगः tree, इव like, जानन्नपि knowing also, किम् what, कुर्यात् can it do?
data.md: And what could he do, even if he knew it, being as he is incapable and unable to go about? One tree cannot rescue another that is being battered (by the winds).

data.v: पितुस्त्वमेव मे गत्वा शीघ्रमाचक्ष्व राघव । न त्वामनुदहेत्क्रुद्धो वनं वह्निरिवैधितः ।।
data.es: O scion of the Raghus (Dasaratha) Go at once and inform my father, lest in anger he should burn you like ignited fire consuming the forest.
data.anv: राघव O scion of the Raghus (Dasaratha), त्वमेव you yourself, शीघ्रम् quickly, गत्वा having gone, मे पितुः to my father, आचक्ष्व inform, क्रुद्ध in wrath, एधितः ignited, वह्निः fire, वनमिव like a forest, त्वाम् you, नानुदहेत् will not be burnt.
data.md: Do you, O descendant of Raghu, yourself going to my father, speedily inform of him this that has occurred. But take care that like a fire waxing furious consuming a woods, he in his ire do not burn you.

data.v: इयमेकपदी राजन्यतो मे पितुराश्रमः । तं प्रसादय गत्वा त्वं न त्वां स कुपितः शपेत् ।।
data.es: 'O king, this footpath leads to my father's hermitage. Go and beg his forgiveness so that he may not curse you out of anger.
data.anv: राजन् O king, यतः from whichever side, मे पितुः my father's, आश्रमः hermitage, इयम् this, एकपदी footpath, त्वम् you, गत्वा having  gone, तम् him, प्रसादय beg his forgiveness, सः he, कुपितः in wrath, त्वाम् you, न शपेत् may not curse.
data.md: This narrow way, O king, will lead you to my father's dwelling. Do you going there, pacify him, so that getting wroth he may not curse you.

data.v: विशल्यं कुरु मां राजन्मर्म मे निशितः शरः । रुणद्धि मृदु सोत्सेधं तीरमम्बुरयो यथा ।।
data.es: 'Gently remove the arrow from my body, O king the sharp arrow is piercing deep into my vital just like the current of the river hits its elevated bank'.
data.anv: राजन् O king, माम् me, विशल्यम् with weapon taken out, कुरु make, निशितः sharp, शरः arrow, मे मर्म my vital part of the body, मृदु gently, सोत्सेधम् elevated, तीरम् bank, अम्बुरयः like the flow of water, यथा in the same manner, रुणद्धि is preventing.
data.md: Do you (now), O king, take out the arrow. Your sharpened shaft afflicts my marrow, like the tide of a river wearing away a hollowheaving sand bank.

data.v: न द्विजातिरहं राजन्मा भूत्ते मनसो व्यथा । शूद्रायामस्मि वैश्येन जातो जनपदाधिप ।।
data.es: 'O king Dasaratha, lord of the land, I am not a brahmin. Feel no sense of guilt in your mind. I was born of a sudra mother and a vaisya father.
data.anv: जनपदाधिप O Lord of the land (Dasaratha), राजन् king, न not, अहम् I am, द्विजातिः a brahmin, न not, ते your, मनसः to mind, व्यथा fear, माभूत् may not happen, वैश्येन by a vaisya, शूद्रायाम् to a sudra woman, जातः born, अस्मि I am.

data.v: इतीव वदतः कृच्छ्राद्बाणाभिहतमर्मणः । तस्य त्वानम्यमानस्य तं बाणमहमुद्धरम् ।।
जलार्द्रगात्रं तु विलप्य कृच्छा;न्मर्मव्रणं संततमुच्छसन्तम् । ततः सरय्वां तमहं शयानं; समीक्ष्य भद्रे सुभृशं विषण्णः ।।
data.md: On beholding him with his body dripping with water, and mortally wounded, and breathing hard without respite, after he had bewailed his mortal wound, lying on the banks of the Sarayü, I lamented him and was, O gentle lady, greatly aggrieved.

data.v: तदज्ञानान्महत्पापं कृत्वा संकुलितेन्द्रियः । एकस्त्वचिन्तयं बुद्ध्या कथं नु सुकृतं भवेत् ।।
data.es: Having committed the sin unwittingly, I was greatly agitated. I reflected in my mind as to how to atone for this great sin.
data.anv: अहम् I, अज्ञानात् in ignorance, तत् that, महत् great, पापम् sin, कृत्वा having done, सङ्कुलेन्द्रियः with agitated senses, एकस्तु myself alone, कथं नु how, सुकृतम् well done, भवेत् shall be, बुध्या in my mind, अचिन्तयम् reflected.
data.md: Having unwittingly committed that great sin, I, with my senses oppressed through grief, thought within myself as to how I could mend it.

data.v: ततस्तं घटमादय पूर्णं परमवारिणा । आश्रमं तमहं प्राप्य यथाख्यातपथं गतः ।।
data.es: Holding the pot filled with clean water I reached the hermitage following the path as directed.
data.anv: ततः then, परमवारिणा with clean water, पूर्णम् filled, तम् that, घटम् pot आदाय taking hold of, यथाऽख्यातपथम् the path as directed, प्राप्य having reached, अहम् I, अश्रमम् hermitage, गतः entered.
data.md: Then taking up the pitcher filled with excellent water, I went by the way mentioned and (at last) reached the asylum.

data.v: तत्राहं दुर्बलावन्धौ वृद्धावपरिणायकौ । अपश्यं तस्य पितरौ लूनपक्षाविव द्विजौ ।।
data.es: There I found his weak, blind, old parents. With no supporter, they looked like birds with clipped wings. They sat there helplessly like orphans and passively talking about their son, their only hope that I have deprived them of.
data.anv: तत्र there, अहम् I, दुर्बलौ frail, अन्धौ blind, वृद्धौ old, अपरिणायकौ without any supporter, लूनपक्षौ with wings severed, द्विजौ इव like birds, तन्निमित्ताभिः on account of their son, कथाभिः with stories, आसीनौ seated, अपरिश्रमौ without any work, मत्कृते  done by me, ताम् आशाम् their hope, हीनौ deprived of, अनाथवत् like orphans, उदासीनौ passive, तस्य his, पितरौ parents, अपश्यम् I saw.
data.md: There I found his aged, infirm, forlorn, parents, without any one to help them in moving about, like to birds whose wings have been severed, keeping up a talk about (their son) without experiencing any fatigue, and like helpless ones feeding on a hope which had been blasted by me.

data.v: तन्निमित्ताभिरासीनौ कथाभिरपरिक्रमौ । तामाशां मत्कृते हीनावुदासीनावनाथवत् ।।
data.es: There I found his weak, blind, old parents. With no supporter, they looked like birds with clipped wings. They sat there helplessly like orphans and passively talking about their son, their only hope that I have deprived them of.
data.anv: तत्र there, अहम् I, दुर्बलौ frail, अन्धौ blind, वृद्धौ old, अपरिणायकौ without any supporter, लूनपक्षौ with wings severed, द्विजौ इव like birds, तन्निमित्ताभिः on account of their son, कथाभिः with stories, आसीनौ seated, अपरिश्रमौ without any work, मत्कृते  done by me, ताम् आशाम् their hope, हीनौ deprived of, अनाथवत् like orphans, उदासीनौ passive, तस्य his, पितरौ parents, अपश्यम् I saw.
data.md: There I found his aged, infirm, forlorn, parents, without any one to help them in moving about, like to birds whose wings have been severed, keeping up a talk about (their son) without experiencing any fatigue, and like helpless ones feeding on a hope which had been blasted by me.

data.v: पदशब्दं तु मे श्रुत्वा मुनिर्वाक्यमभाषत । किं चिरायसि मे पुत्र पानीयं क्षिप्रमानय ।।
data.es: Hearing the sound of my footsteps, the sage said 'O son why have you delayed? Bring me some water quickly'.
data.anv: मे my, पदशब्दम् sound of footsteps, श्रुत्वा having heard, मुनिः sage, वाक्यम् words, अभाषत spoke this, पुत्र son, किम् why, चिरायसि are you delaying, क्षिप्रम् quickly, मे to me, पानीयम् water, आनय bring.
data.md: Hearing my footsteps, the ascetic said, “Why, my son, delay you? Bring the drink at once.

data.v: यन्निमित्तमिदं तात सलिले क्रीडितं त्वया । उत्कण्ठिता ते मातेयं प्रविश क्षिप्रमाश्रमम् ।।
data.es: 'O Dear child, whatever be the reason, you have been sporting in the water so long, come at once to the hermitage. Your mother is anxious.
data.anv: तात O Dear child, त्वया by you, यन्निमित्तम् for whatever reason, सलिले in the water, इदम् this, क्रीडितम् sported, इयम् this, ते माता your mother, उत्कण्ठिता with anxicty, क्षिप्रम् quickly, आश्रमम् hermitage, प्रविश enter.
data.md: Your mother, O child, was exceedingly anxious in consequence of your sporting in the waters. Do you speedily enter the asylum.

data.v: यद्व्यलीकं कृतं पुत्र मात्रा ते यदि वा मया । न तन्मनसि कर्तव्यं त्वया तात तपस्विना ।।
data.es: 'O Child, O Son if your mother or I have done anything disagreeable, do not take it to heart, for you are an ascetic.
data.anv: पुत्र son, ते your, मात्रा mother, यदिवा or, मया by myself, यत् any, व्यलीकम् displeasing act, कृतम् has been done, तात O Child, तपस्विना by being ascetic, त्वया by you, तत् that one,  मनसि in the mind, न कर्तव्यम् should not be taken seriously.
data.md: O child, it behove you not to take to heart any unkind action that, O son, may have been done to you of high fame either by your mother or myself.

data.v: त्वं गतिस्त्वगतीनां च चक्षुस्त्वं हीनचक्षुषाम् । समासक्तास्त्वयि प्राणाः किंचिन्नौ नाभिभाषसे ।।
data.es: 'You are a support to the supportless, eyes to the blind, you are our very vital life. Why don't you speak to us'?
data.anv: अगतीनाम् for us with no support, त्वम् you, गतिः are support, अचक्षुषाम् for us who have no eyes, त्वम् you, चक्षुः हि are our eyes, प्राणाः our vital life, त्वयि in you, समासक्ताः are attached, त्वम् you, नः to us, किम् why, नाभिभाषसे are not talking?
data.md: You are the resource of these helpless ones; you are the eyes of these bereft of their sight. was Our lives are bound up with you. Why do not answer?'

data.v: मुनिमव्यक्तया वाचा तमहं सज्जमानया । हीनव्यञ्जनया प्रेक्ष्य भीतो भीत इवाब्रुवम् ।।
data.es: As I saw him, my heart was filled with terror and I stammered as I spoke in garbled sentences.
data.anv: अहम् I, तं मुनिम् that sage, प्रेक्ष्य having seen, भीतचित्त इव with a frightened mind, अव्यक्तया indistinctly, सज्जमानया stammering, हीनव्यञ्जनया with slurring syllables, वाचा with words, अब्रुवम् I uttered.
data.md: Seeing the ascetic with a choked utterance indistinctly speaking thus with the letters not articulated clearly, I, dashed in spirits, yet concealing the real state of my mind by assuming a doughty tongue, communicated to him the danger that had befallen him in consequence of the calamity of his son:

data.v: मनसः कर्म चेष्टाभिरभिसंस्तभ्य वाग्बलम् । आचचक्षे त्वहं तस्मै पुत्रव्यसनजं भयम् ।।
data.es: After a lot of effort, with great fear controlling my thoughts and the power of speech, I related to him the calamity that had befallen his son.
data.anv: अहम् I, चेष्टाभिः with efforts, मनसः mind's, कर्म thoughts, वाग्बलम् power of speech, अभिसंस्तभ्य  holding up firmly, तस्मै him, पुत्रव्यसनजम् the calamity arising due to the death of his son, भयम् fear, आचचक्षे related to him.
data.md: Seeing the ascetic with a choked utterance indistinctly speaking thus with the letters not articulated clearly, I, dashed in spirits, yet concealing the real state of my mind by assuming a doughty tongue, communicated to him the danger that had befallen him in consequence of the calamity of his son:

data.v: क्षत्रियोऽहं दशरथो नाहं पुत्रो महात्मनः । सज्जनावमतं दुःखमिदं प्राप्तं स्वकर्मजम् ।।
data.es: O magnanimous sage I am a kshatriya known as Dasaratha. I am not your son. A pathetic incident has been caused by my own action, condemnable by the virtuous.
data.anv: अहम् I, दशरथः Dasaratha, क्षत्रियः kshatriya, अहम् I, महात्मनः of the great, पुत्रः son, न not, सज्जनावमतम् condemnable by the virtuous, इदम् this, स्वकर्मजम् caused out of my own action, दुःखम् sorrowful, प्राप्तम् has befallen.
data.md: I am a Ksatriya, Dasaratha (by name), and no son of yours, O magnanimous one. I have come by a misfortune in consequence of an act blamed by the good.

data.v: भगवंश्चापहस्तोऽहं सरयूतीरमागतः । जिघांसुः श्वापदं किंचिन्निपाने वागतं गजम् ।।
data.es: Wishing to hunt a wild elephant coming down to the water hole for drinking, I went to the bank of Sarayu, bow in hand, O revered sage
data.anv: भगवन् O revered one, अहम् I, चापहस्तः bow in hand, कञ्चित् a certain, श्वापदम् wild animal, निपाने drinking at the water hole, आगतम् which has come, गजं च an elephant, जिघांसुः wishing to kill, सरयूतीरम् to the bank of river Sarayu, आगतः arrived.
data.md: O revered one, desirous of killing some beast of prey, and elephant (or some other), come to the waters, I went to the banks of the Sarayū bow in hand.

data.v: तत्र श्रुतो मया शब्दो जले कुम्भस्य पूर्यतः । द्विपोऽयमिति मत्वा हि बाणेनाभिहतो मया ।।
data.es: There I heard the sound of a pot being filled with water and mistaking it to be an elephant's, shot an arrow.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, मया by me, जले in the water, पूर्यतः being filled, कुम्भस्य pot's, शब्दः sound, श्रुतः was heard, अयम् this one, द्विपः इति taking for an elephant, मत्वा having thought, अयम् he, मया by me, बाणेन with arrow, अभिहतः was killed.
data.md: Then hearing sounds from the water of a filling pitcher, I thought, This must be an elephant. I wounded it with a shaft. Next coming to the edge of the river, I saw an ascetic lying down on the ground almost deprived of life, with his heart pierced with an arrow.

data.v: गत्वा नद्यास्ततस्तीरमपश्यमिषुणा हृदि । विनिर्भिन्नं गतप्राणं शयानं भुवि तापसम् ।।
data.es: Thereafter I reached the river bank and beheld an ascetic with an arrow pierced in his chest. He was lying on the ground, his life ebbing away.
data.anv: ततः then, नद्याः river's, तीरम् bank, गत्वा having gone, इषुणा with an arrow, हृदि in the chest, विनिर्भिन्नम् pierced it, गतप्राणम् with ebbing life, भुवि on the ground, शयानम् lying, तापसम् an ascetic, अपश्यम् I beheld.
data.md: Then hearing sounds from the water of a filling pitcher, I thought, This must be an elephant. I wounded it with a shaft. Next coming to the edge of the river, I saw an ascetic lying down on the ground almost deprived of life, with his heart pierced with an arrow.

data.v: भगवञ्शब्दमालक्ष्य मया गजजिघांसुना । विसृष्टोऽम्भसि नाराचस्तेन ते निहतः सुतः ।।
data.es: O venerable one I released an arrow towards the water aiming at the sound intending to kill an elephant but it hit your son.
data.anv: भगवन् O venerable one, शब्दम् sound, आलक्ष्य aiming at, गजजिघांसुना intending to kill an elephant, मया by me, अम्भसि in the water, नाराचः with an arrow, विसृष्टः has been released, तेन by that, ते your, सुतः son, निहतः was struck.

data.v: स चोद्धृतेन बाणेन तत्रैव स्वर्गमास्थितः । भगवन्तावुभौ शोचन्नन्धाविति विलप्य च ।।
data.es: Grieving for both of you and crying you are blind he died as soon as the arrow was pulled out.
data.anv: सः च he also, पितरौ parents, भवन्तौ about both of you, शोचन् while grieving, अन्धौ इति   saying you are blind, विलप्य च wailing, उधृतेन extracted, तेन बाणेन by that arrow, तत्रैव there itself, स्वर्गम् heaven, आस्थितः attained.
data.md: And as soon as the arrow had been extracted, he ascended heaven, O reverend sir, lamenting and bewailing you, both grown old.

data.v: अज्ञानाद्भवतः पुत्रः सहसाभिहतो मया । शेषमेवंगते यत्स्यात्तत्प्रसीदतु मे मुनिः ।।
data.es: Your son has been killed by me due to my ignorance. Since this has happened, may the ascetic be pleased to command me on the next course of action.
data.anv: अज्ञानात् by my ignorance, सहसा suddenly, भवतः पुत्रः your son, मया by me, निहतः was slain, एवं गते when this has happened, यत् whatever, शेषं स्यात् remains to be done, तत् that, मुनिः ascetic, प्रसीदतु be pleased.
data.md: It is through ignorance that I suddenly wounded your son. This having been past, do you favour me with telling me what is now to be done, O ascetic.

data.v: स तच्छ्रुत्वा वचः क्रूरं निःश्वसञ्शोककर्शितः । मामुवाच महातेजाः कृताञ्जलिमुपस्थितम् ।।
data.es: The griefstricken, glorious ascetic with his face filled with tears, heaving deep sighs broke down with grief and spoke to me as I was standing with folded palms.
data.anv: महातेजाः brilliant, सः that ascetic, बाष्पपूर्णवदनः face filled with tears, निश्श्वसन् heaving sighs, शोककर्शितः broken with grief, कृताञ्जलिम् with folded palms, उपस्थितम् standing nearby, माम् me, उवाच said.
data.md: With eyes flooded with tears, and well nigh deprived of his senses by grief, that highly energetic one said to me standing with joined hands.

data.v: यद्येतदशुभं कर्म न स्म मे कथयेः स्वयम् । फलेन्मूर्धा स्म ते राजन्सद्यः शतसहस्रधा ।।
data.es: 'O king, hadn't you yourself broken this inauspicious news, your head would have split into a hundred thousand pieces right now.
data.anv: राजन् O king, अशुभम् inauspicious, एतत् this, कर्म act, त्वम् you, मे to me, स्वयम् yourself, न कथयेः यदि not spoke, सद्य: right now, ते your, मूर्धा your head, शतसहस्रधा a hundred thousand pieces, फलेत् स्म would have been split.
data.md: If, O king, you had not of yourself immediately communicated to us this unpleasant news, your head would have been reduced to a thousand flaws.

data.v: क्षत्रियेण वधो राजन्वानप्रस्थे विशेषतः । ज्ञानपूर्वं कृतः स्थानाच्च्यावयेदपि वज्रिणम् ।।
data.es: 'If a kshatriya kills any one knowingly, particularly when in vanaprastha (third stage) this sin can displace even Indra, wielder of the thunderbolt from his position, O king.
data.anv: राजन् king, क्षत्रियेण by a kshatriya, ज्ञानपूर्वम् with prior knowledge, कृतः done, वधः the act of killing, विशेषतः especially, वानप्रस्थे of a forestdweller, वज्रिणम् अपि even if he is wielder of thunderbolt (Indra), स्थानात् from his position, च्वावयेत् would overthrow.
data.md: Not to speak of Kștriyas, I can even drag the very wielder of the thunderbolt himself from his position, if he knowingly kills one, in especial, that has assumed the Vånaprastha mode of life.

data.v: अज्ञानाद्धि कृतं यस्मादिदं तेनैव जीवसि । अपि ह्यद्य कुलं नस्याद्राघवाणां कुतो भवान् ।।
data.es: 'Since you have done this unwittingly you are still alive. If it had been otherwise, your Ikshvaku race itself would have been exterminated, what to speak of you
data.anv: इदम् this, यस्मात् for which reason, आज्ञानात् out of ignorance, कृतं हि has been done, तेनैव that is why, जीवसि you will live, इक्ष्वाकूणाम् Ikshvakus', कुलमपि race itself, अद्य now, न स्यात् हि would not have been there, भवान् you also, कुतः where are you
data.md: It is because you have done this through ignorance that you (still) live, else the race itself of the Rāghavas should be not, and where are you?

data.v: नय नौ नृप तं देशमिति मां चाभ्यभाषत । अद्य तं द्रष्टुमिच्छावः पुत्रं पश्चिमदर्शनम् ।।
data.es: 'O king take us to that place. We wish to have the last look at him, at his garment of antelope skin in disarray, his body spattered with blood, lying on the ground unconscious under the sway of the lord of death'. Thus the sage said to me.
data.anv: नृप king, अद्य now, पश्चिमदर्शनम् for the last time to see, रुधिरेण in blood, अवसिक्ताङ्गम्   his body spattered, प्रकीर्णाजिनवाससम् with antelope skin in disarray, भुवि on the ground, शयानम् lying, निस्संज्ञम् without senses, धर्मराजवशम् under the sway of the Lord of death, गतम् gone, पुत्रम् son, द्रष्टुम् to see, इच्छावः intend, तं देशम् to that place, नौ us, नय take us, इति thus, माम् me, अभ्यभाषत च spoke.
data.md: He then said, 'Do you, o king, take us to the scene. To day will we look our last on our son besmeared with blood, his deer-skin garb falling off (from his body), lying senseless on the earth, and come under the subjection of the lord of righteousness.'

data.v: रुधिरेणावसिताङ्गं प्रकीर्णाजिनवाससम् । शयानं भुवि निःसंज्ञं धर्मराजवशं गतम् ।।
data.es: 'O king take us to that place. We wish to have the last look at him, at his garment of antelope skin in disarray, his body spattered with blood, lying on the ground unconscious under the sway of the lord of death'. Thus the sage said to me.
data.anv: नृप king, अद्य now, पश्चिमदर्शनम् for the last time to see, रुधिरेण in blood, अवसिक्ताङ्गम्   his body spattered, प्रकीर्णाजिनवाससम् with antelope skin in disarray, भुवि on the ground, शयानम् lying, निस्संज्ञम् without senses, धर्मराजवशम् under the sway of the Lord of death, गतम् gone, पुत्रम् son, द्रष्टुम् to see, इच्छावः intend, तं देशम् to that place, नौ us, नय take us, इति thus, माम् me, अभ्यभाषत च spoke.
data.md: Thereupon I alone taking them exceedingly disconsolate to the spot, made the ascetic and his wife touch their son.

data.v: अथाहमेकस्तं देशं नीत्वा तौ भृशदुःखितौ । अस्पर्शयमहं पुत्रं तं मुनिं सह भार्यया ।।
data.es: Thereupon, I took both of them all by myself to that spot and made the grieving ascetics touch the body of their son.
data.anv: अथ thereupon, एकः alone, अहम् I, भृशदुःखितौ deeply grieved, तौ both of them, तं देशम् to that place, नीत्वा having taken, भार्यया सह along with his wife, तं मुनिम् to that asetic, तं पुत्रम् their son, अस्पर्शयम् made them touch.
data.md: Thereupon I alone taking them exceedingly disconsolate to the spot, made the ascetic and his wife touch their son.

data.v: तौ पुत्रमात्मनः स्पृष्ट्वा तमासाद्य तपस्विनौ । निपेततुः शरीरेऽस्य पिता चास्येदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Both the ascetics stroking their son's body and collapsed upon it. And the father said:
data.anv: तपस्विनौ both the ascetics, तौ both, तम् their, आत्मनः own, पुत्रम् son, आसाद्य having approached, स्पृष्टवा having touched, अस्य his, शरीरे on body, निपेततुः fell, अस्य his, पिता च father, इदम् this way, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: And having approached their son and touched him, ascetics fell on his person, and then his father addressed him thus.

data.v: न न्वहं ते प्रियः पुत्र मातरं पश्य धार्मिक । किं नु नालिङ्गसे पुत्र सुकुमार वचो वद ।।
data.es: 'O righteous son if I am no longer dear to you, (at least) look at your mother. O tender child, why are you not embracing me? Speak.
data.anv: धार्मिक O righteous, पुत्र son, अहम् I, ते to you, प्रियम् dear, न तु if not so, मातरम् mother, पश्य look at, पुत्र O son, किं नु why, नालिङ्गसे are not embracing, सुकुमार O tender child, वचः words, वद tell.
data.md: If, my son, you do not feel kindly to me, do you look up to your virtuous mother. And why, O son, do you not embrace me? Do you speak tender words.

data.v: कस्य वापररात्रेऽहं श्रोष्यामि हृदयंगमम् । अधीयानस्य मधुरं शास्त्रं वान्यद्विशेषतः ।।
data.es: 'From whom shall I hear the sweet recitation of scriptures or other texts, delightful to my heart in the last watch of the night?
data.anv: अपररात्रे in the last watch of the night, शास्त्रम् scriptures, विशेषत: especially, अन्वद्वा any other, अधीयानस्य while reciting, कस्य वा or whose, हृदयङ्गमम् delightful to the heart, मधुरम् sweet sound, अहम् I, श्रोष्यामि shall listen?
data.md: At the small hours, form whom engaged in study, shall I hear the scriptures sweetly read in a way coming home to the listener's mind?

data.v: को मां संध्यामुपास्यैव स्नात्वा हुतहुताशनः । श्लाघयिष्यत्युपासीनः पुत्रशोकभयार्दितम् ।।
data.es: 'O son I am tortured with sorrow and fear. Who will serve me from now on after the ablution and the morning worship of Sandhya, followed by oblations to the sacrificial fire?
data.anv: पुत्र O son, कः who, स्नात्वा after the ablution, सन्द्याम् morning Sandhya, उपास्यैव having worshipped, हुतहुताशनः having offered oblations to the sacrificial fire, उपासीनः seated near, शोकभयार्दितम् tormented with sorrow and fear, माम् to me, श्लाघयिष्यति serve?
data.md: Who, having performed his daily devotions and offered oblation to the sacrificial fire, will bathe me, afflicted with grief for my son?

data.v: कन्दमूलफलं हृत्वा को मां प्रियमिवातिथिम् । भोजयिष्यत्यकर्मण्यमप्रग्रहमनायकम् ।।
data.es: 'I am incapable of doing any work, I am unable to procure anything (to meet my needs. now). I have no guide (to help me walk my way). Who will feed me like a welcome guest with tubers and fruits?
data.anv: कन्दमूलफलम् tubers and fruits, हृत्वा having brought, कः who, अकर्मण्यम् incapable of  doing any work, अप्रग्रहम् incapable of procuring anything, अनायकम् one who has no guide, माम् me, प्रियम् dear, अतिथिमिव like a guest, भोजयिष्यति will feed?
data.md: Who procuring Kandas, fruits and roots, will feed me like an welcome guest, incapable of and doing anything and furnishing provisions, and without any one to take care of myself.?

data.v: इमामन्धां च वृद्धां च मातरं ते तपस्विनीम् । कथं पुत्र भरिष्यामि कृपणां पुत्रगर्धिनीम् ।।
data.es: 'O son how can I support your wretched and pitiable mother, who is blind, old and yearning for her son?
data.anv: वत्स O son, अन्धाम् blind, वृद्धाम् old, तपस्विनीम् miserable, कृपणाम् wretched, पुत्रगर्धिनीम्   yearning for her son, इमाम् this, ते your, मातरम् mother, कथम् how, भरिष्यामि support her?
data.md: And, my son, how will I maintain this blind ascetic mother of yours, proud of her son, who is passing her days in misery?

data.v: तिष्ठ मा मा गमः पुत्र यमस्य सदनं प्रति । श्वो मया सह गन्तासि जनन्या च समेधितः ।।
data.es: 'My dear son, stay with me, do not go (now) to the abode of Yama, (lord of death). Tomorrow accompanied by me and your mother you may
data.anv: पुत्र son, मां तिष्ठ stay with me, यमस्य of the lord of death, सदनं प्रति to the abode, मागमः do not go, मया with me, जनन्या सह च along with your mother also, समेधितः accompanied by, श्वः tomorrow, गन्तासि may go.
data.md: Do you stay my son, in my behalf. Tomorrow you will go to Yama's mansion with me and your mother.

data.v: उभावपि च शोकार्तावनाथौ कृपणौ वने । क्षिप्रमेव गमिष्यावस्त्वया हीनौ यमक्षयम् ।।
data.anv: त्वया by you, हीनौ having been deserted, शोकार्तौ afflicted with grief, वने in the forest, अनाथौ without support, कृपणौ wretched ones, उभावपि च both of us also, क्षिप्रमेव quickly, यमक्षयम् to the abode of Yama, गमिष्यावः will go.
data.md: Distressed with grief and rendered miserable in the forest, both of us deprived of you shall soon repair to the abode of Yama.

data.v: ततो वैवस्वतं दृष्ट्वा तं प्रवक्ष्यामि भारतीम् । क्षमतां धर्मराजो मे बिभृयात्पितरावयम् ।।
data.es: 'There seeing Yama, (lord of death), I shall say O Lord of Justice forgive me. Let this boy continue to maintain his parents.
data.anv: ततः then, वैवस्वतम् lord of death, Yama, दृष्ट्वा having seen, तम् him, भारतीम् in speech, प्रवक्ष्यामि I shall say, धर्मराजः the lord of justice, मे me, क्षमताम् forgive, अयम् this man, पितरौ parents, बिभृयात् continue to maintain.
data.md: Seeing Vivasvata's son, I will say to him, Do you, O lord of justice forgive me, and let this my son, continue to maintain us, his parents.

data.v: अपापोऽसि यथा पुत्र निहतः पापकर्मणा । तेन सत्येन गच्छाशु ये लोकाः शस्त्रयोधिनाम् ।।
data.es: 'O sinless son, you are killed by a person of sinful deeds. On this truth, quickly go to those worlds which are attained by those valiant heroes.
data.anv: पुत्र O son, पापकर्मणा by a person of sinful deeds, निहतः killed, यथा just as, अपापः असि you are sinless, तेन that, सत्येन with truth, शस्त्रयोधिनाम् those who fight with weapons, ये whichever, लोका: worlds, आशु quickly, गच्छ go.

data.v: यान्ति शूरा गतिं यां च संग्रामेष्वनिवर्तिनः । हतास्त्वभिमुखाः पुत्र गतिं तां परमां व्रज ।।
data.anv: पुत्र son, सङ्ग्रामेषु in wars, अनिवर्तिनः the men who do not retreat, शूराः warriors, अभिमुखाः याम् facing the enemy, गतिम् ultimate state, यान्ति will attain, ताम् that one, परमाम् supreme, गतिम् state, व्रज attain.

data.v: यां गतिं सगरः शैब्यो दिलीपो जनमेजयः । नहुषो धुन्धुमारश्च प्राप्तास्तां गच्छ पुत्रक ।।
data.es: 'You will attain, my son, the same supreme state achieved by Sagara, Saibya, Dilipa, Janamejaya, Nahusha and Dundumara.
data.anv: पुत्रक O son, सगरः Sagara, शैब्यः Saibya, दिलीपः Dilipa, जनमेजयः Janamejaya, नहुषः Nahusha, दुन्दुमारश्च Dundumara also, याम् which, गतिम् state, प्राप्ताः have attained, ताम् the same, गच्छ attain.
data.md: Do you, O son, go the way that has been gone by Sagara and Saivya and Dilīpa and Janamejaya and Nahusa and Dhundhumāra.

data.v: या गतिः सर्वसाधूनां स्वाध्यायात्पतसश्च या । भूमिदस्याहिताग्नेश्च एकपत्नीव्रतस्य च ।।
data.es: 'You, my son, shall attain that supreme state obtained by those who are virtuous, who study the Vedas and practise asceticism.You shall attain the state merited by those bestowers of land as charity, who kindle the sacred fires, who are monoganists, who offer a thousand cows in charity, who nurture the venerable and who willingly lay down their bodies.
data.anv: पुत्रक O son, सर्वसाधूनाम् of all virtuous people, या which, गतिः state, स्वाध्यायात् with the study of Vedas, तपसा च by asceticism, भूमिदस्य  bestowers of land as charity, आहिताग्नेः  who kindle the sacred fires, एकपत्नीव्रतस्य च of the monogamist too, गोसहस्रप्रदातृ़णाम्  who offer a thousand cows in charity, या which, गुरुभृतामपि who nurture the venerable ones, देहन्यासकताम् for those who lay down their bodies voluntarily, या च and those, तां गतिम् the same state, गच्छ you will attain.
data.md: Do you, O son, go the way that is gone by all creatures, even by ascetics engaged in the study of the Veda, by bestowers of lands, by those performing fire-sacrifices, by individuals each devoted to a single wife, men giving away a thousand kine, persons tending their preceptors, and individuals renouncing lives by fasting.

data.v: गोसहस्रप्रदातॄणां या या गुरुभृतामपि । देहन्यासकृतां या च तां गतिं गच्छ पुत्रक । न हि त्वस्मिन्कुले जातो गच्छत्यकुशलां गतिम् ।।
एवं स कृपणं तत्र पर्यदेवयतासकृत् । ततोऽस्मै कर्तुमुदकं प्रवृत्तः सह भार्यया ।।
data.es: In this way the ascetic piteously wailed again and again. Thereafter, he with his wife set about to perform the funeral obsequies of their son.
data.anv: सः he, एवम् in this way, तत्र there, असकृत् again and again, कृपणम् piteously, पर्यदेवयत  bewailed, ततः then, अस्मै to him, भार्यया सह along with his wife, उदकं कर्तुम् to perform funeral obsequies, प्रवृत्तः commenced.
data.md: Having thus piteously wept, he along with his wife set about performing the watery rites on behalf of his son.

data.v: स तु दिव्येन रूपेण मुनिपुत्रः स्वकर्मभिः । आश्वास्य च मुहूर्तं तु पितरौ वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: The virtuous son of that ascetic assumed a celestial form through the merit of his good deeds and ascended heaven at once with Indra.
data.anv: धर्मवित् one conversant with righteousness, सः that, मुनिपुत्रः son of the sage, स्वकर्मभिः by the merit of his own deeds, शक्रेण सह with Indra, दिव्येन in a celestial, रूपेण form, क्षिप्रम् quickly, स्वर्गम् heaven, अध्यारुहत् ascended.
data.md: Then (returning) along with Sakra, the ascetic comforting his aged parents, addressed them, sa ing.

data.v: स्थानमस्मि महत्प्राप्तो भवतोः परिचारणात् । भवन्तावपि च क्षिप्रं मम मूलमुपैष्यतः ।।
data.es: 'I have attained this supreme state by virtue of the service rendered to you. You will also attain my state soon.'
data.anv: भवतोः your, परिचारणात् by (your) service, महत् supreme, स्थानम् state, प्राप्तः अस्मि I have  attained, भवन्तौ अपि च you also, क्षिप्रम् quickly, मम my, मूलम् presence, उपैष्यतः will obtain.
data.md: I have attained a high state in consequence of having served you. Do you also without delay come to me.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा तु दिव्येन विमानेन वपुष्मता । आरुरोह दिवं क्षिप्रं मुनिपुत्रो जितेन्द्रियः ।।
data.es: The sage's son with his senses under control said this while ascending heaven on a beautiful, celestial, aerial chariot.
data.anv: जितेन्द्रियः one with his senses conquered, मुनिपुत्रः sage's son, एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having said, वपुष्मता beautiful, दिव्येन celestial, विमानेन aerial chariot, क्षिप्रम् quickly, दिवम् heaven, आरुरोह ascended.
data.md: Having said this, the ascetic's son of restrained sense ascended heaven by means of an excellent and commodious car.

data.v: स कृत्वा तूदकं तूर्णं तापसः सह भार्यया । मामुवाच महातेजाः कृताञ्जलिमुपस्थितम् ।।
data.es: The griefstricken, glorious ascetic with his face filled with tears, heaving deep sighs broke down with grief and spoke to me as I was standing with folded palms.
data.anv: महातेजाः brilliant, सः तापसः that ascetic, भार्यया सह with his wife, तूर्णम् immediately, उदकं कृत्वा offering funeral libations, कृताञ्जलिम् with folded palms, उपस्थितम् standing nearby, माम् me, उवाच addressed.
data.md: With eyes flooded with tears, and well nigh deprived of his senses by grief, that highly energetic one said to me standing with joined hands.

data.v: अद्यैव जहि मां राजन्मरणे नास्ति मे व्यथा । यच्छरेणैकपुत्रं मां त्वमकार्षीरपुत्रकम् ।।
data.es: 'Kill me, O king with the same arrow by which you rendered me childless. Death holds no pain for me.
data.anv: राजन् king, त्वम् you, यत् since, ऐक पुत्रम् having only one son, माम् me, शरेण with the arrow, अपुत्रकम् childless, अकार्षीः rendered, अद्यैव right now, माम् me, जहि slay, मे to me, मरणे in death, व्यथा pain, नास्ति not.
data.md: Do you, O monarch, slay me on the instant. I do not grieve to die', you have by your shaft rendered me who had an only son, absolutely sonless.

data.v: त्वया तु यदविज्ञानान्निहतो मे सुतः शुचिः । तेन त्वामभिशप्स्यामि सुदुःखमतिदारुणम् ।।
data.es: 'Though you have killed my purehearted son unintentionally, I will pronounce a disastrous and dreadful curse on you.
data.anv: त्वया by you, अविज्ञानात् in ignorance, मे my, शुचिः purehearted, सुतः son, यत् since, निहतः was killed, तेन therefore, त्वाम् you, सुदुःखम् deeply sorrowful, अतिदारुणम् extremely dreadful, अभिशप्स्यामि I will curse.

data.v: पुत्रव्यसनजं दुःखं यदेतन्मम साम्प्रतम् । एवं त्वं पुत्रशोकेन राजन्कालं करिष्यसि ।।
data.es: 'Just as I am now suffering from grief caused by my son's death, you, O king, shall die from the sorrow on account of (separation from) your son.
data.anv: साम्प्रतम् now, यत् एतत् just as this, पुत्रव्यसनजम् caused by my son's death, दुःखम् grief, एवम् the same way, राजन् O king, त्वम् you, पुत्रशोकेन by the sorrow over your son, कालं करिष्यसि will die.
data.md: Since this sorrow arising from the calamity that has befallen my son, is at present mine (through your instrumentality), I curse you. You shall even in this way find your death from grief born of separation from your son.

data.v: तस्मान्मामागतं भद्रे तस्योदारस्य तद्वचः । यदहं पुत्रशोकेन संत्यक्ष्याम्यद्य जीवितम् ।।
data.es: O gentle lady, the words of that noble ascetic have come true today. Hence I am now going to give up my life.
data.anv: भद्रे O gentle lady, तस्मात् hence, अहम् I, पुत्रशोकेन due to sorrow over my son, जीवितम् life, यत् सन्त्यक्ष्यामि since I am giving up, उदारस्य of the noble, तस्य that ascetic's, तत् वचः those words, मम for me, अद्य today, आगतम् have come true.

data.v: यदि मां संस्पृशेद्रामः सकृदद्यालभेत वा । न तन्मे सदृशं देवि यन्मया राघवे कृतम् ।।
data.es: Before I die, will Rama touch me once or will he come to me? After reaching the abode of Yama men cannot see their relations.

data.v: चक्षुषा त्वां न पश्यामि स्मृतिर्मम विलुप्यते । दूता वैवस्वतस्यैते कौसल्ये त्वरयन्ति माम् ।।
data.es: O Kausalya, I am unable to see you. My memory is failing and the messengers of Yama are hastening me.
data.anv: कौसल्ये O Kausalya, चक्षुषा with my eyes, त्वाम् you, न पश्यामि cannot see, मम my, स्मृतिः memory, विलुप्यते is failing, वैवस्वतस्य Yama's, एते दूताः these messengers, माम् me, त्वरयन्ति are hastening up.
data.md: But I do not see you with my eyes, and my memory fails. These envoys of Vivasvata's son, OKausalya, urge speed upon me.

data.v: अतस्तु किं दुःखतरं यदहं जीवितक्षये । न हि पश्यामि धर्मज्ञं रामं सत्यपराक्यमम् ।।
data.es: Can there be a greater sorrow than that at the last moment of my life I am unable to see my righteous and truthful son, Rama?
data.anv: अहम् I, जीवितक्षये at the last moment of my life, धर्मज्ञम् to the knower of righteousness, सत्यपराक्रमम्  to one possessing the strength of truth, रामम् Rama, न पश्यामि हि इति यत् the fact that I am unable to see,  अतः more than this, दुःखतरम् more sorrowful, किं नु what is there?
data.md: What can be an object of greater regret than that I during my last moments cannot behold the righteous Rāma having truth for prowess?

data.v: न ते मनुष्या देवास्ते ये चारुशुभकुण्डलम् । मुखं द्रक्ष्यन्ति रामस्य वर्षे पञ्चदशे पुनः ।।
data.es: Those who will behold Rama's countenance adorned with auspicious earrings on his return in the fifteenth year are gods not men.
data.anv: पञ्चदशे वर्षे in the fifteenth year, ये whoever, चारु elegant, शुभकुण्डलम् with auspicious ear rings, रामस्य Rama's, मुखम् countenance, पुनः again, द्रक्ष्यन्ति will behold, ते those, देवाः gods, मनुष्याः men, न not.
data.md: Those are not men, those are gods who in the fifteenth year shall again behold Rāma's countenance graced with elegant and burnished ear-rings.

data.v: पद्मपत्रेक्षणं सुभ्रु सुदंष्ट्रं चारुनासिकम् । धन्या द्रक्ष्यन्ति रामस्य ताराधिपनिभं मुखम् ।।
data.es: Blessed are they who will behold Rama's countenance resembling the Moon, lord of the stars with eyes like lotus petals graceful eyebrows, even teeth and a nose.
data.anv: पद्मपत्रेक्षणम् eyes like lotus petals, सुभ्रु graceful eyebrows, सुदंष्ट्रम् even teeth, चारुनासिकम् of shapely nose, ताराधिपनिभम् resembling the lord of the stars (the Moon), रामस्य Rama's, मुखम् countenance, धन्याः blessed, द्रक्ष्यन्ति will behold.
data.md: O you of graceful eye-brows, blessed are they who shall behold Rāma's countenance furnished with eyes resembling lotus-petals, with excellent teeth and a shapely nose, like to the lord of the stars himself.

data.v: सदृशं शारदस्येन्दोः फुल्लस्य कमलस्य च । सुगन्धि मम नाथस्य धन्या द्रक्ष्यन्ति तन्मुखम् ।।
data.es: Fortunate indeed are the men who will behold my son's fragrant countenance camparable to the autmnal Moon and the fullblown lotus.
data.anv: शारदस्य autumnal, इन्दोः Moon, सदृशम् similar, पुल्लस्य fullblown, कमलस्य च similar to lotus, सुगन्धि fragrant, मम नाथस्य my son's, तत् that, मुखम् countenance, धन्याः blessed, द्रक्ष्यन्ति will behold.
data.md: Blessed are they that shall behold that fragrant face of his like to the autumnal moon, or the fullblown lotus. Thrice-blessed they who with delighted hearts, shall behold Rāma returned from the forest and come back to Ayodhyā, like to Sukra crowning the zenith?

data.v: निवृत्तवनवासं तमयोध्यां पुनरागतम् । द्रक्ष्यन्ति सुखिनो रामं शुक्रं मार्गगतं यथा ।।
data.es: Lucky men will behold Rama return to Ayodhya after the completion of his exile, like the planet Venus moving forward on its orbit.
data.anv: निवृत्तवनवासम् after completing the period of exile, अयोध्याम् to Ayodhya, पुनः again, आगतम् returning, रामम् Rama, मार्गगतम् moving on the highway, शुक्रं यथा like the planet Venus, सुखिनः happy persons, द्रक्ष्यन्ति will behold.
data.md: Blessed are they that shall behold that fragrant face of his like to the autumnal moon, or the fullblown lotus. Thrice-blessed they who with delighted hearts, shall behold Rāma returned from the forest and come back to Ayodhyā, like to Sukra crowning the zenith?

data.v: अयमात्मभवः शोको मामनाथमचेतनम् । संसादयति वेगेन यथा कूलं नदीरयः ।।
data.es: This selfcreated grief is rapidly destroying me like the bank of a river eroded by its swift current, leaving me helpless and insensible.
data.anv: आत्मभवः selfcreated on account of my son, अयम् this, शोकः sorrow, अनाथम् helpless, अचेतनम् insensible, माम् me, नदीरयः current of the river, कूलं यथा like the bank, वेगेन rapidly, संसादयति eroding.
data.md: As the violence of a river wears away its banks, my grief occasioned through my own agency is destroying me, who am helpless and insensible.

data.v: हा राघव महाबाहो हा ममायास नाशन । राजा दशरथः शोचञ्जीवितान्तमुपागमत् ।।
data.es: Ah, mightyarmed Rama, destroyer of my agonies, Ah, the delight of your father, Ah, my protector, Ah, my son, where have you gone?.
data.anv: महाबाहो O mightyarmed one, हा राघव Ah Rama, मम my, आयासनाशन destroyer of my agony, हा Ah , हा पितृप्रिय Ah delight of your father, मे नाथ my protector, हा Ah सुत son, क्व where, गतः असि have you gone?.
data.md: Having thus lamented in presence of Rāma's mother and Sumitrā, king Daſaratha breathed his last.

data.v: तथा तु दीनं कथयन्नराधिपः; प्रियस्य पुत्रस्य विवासनातुरः । गतेऽर्धरात्रे भृशदुःखपीडित;स्तदा जहौ प्राणमुदारदर्शनः ।।
data.es: King Dasaratha, a man of noble vision and lord of men, anguished by the exile of his son, kept pitiably muttering till past midnight until tormented by an intense agony he breathed his last.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे चतुष्षष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyfourth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: उदारदर्शनः a man of noble vision, नराधिपः king, दीनम् pitiably, कथयन् while speaking,  पुत्रस्य son's, विवासनातुरः distraught on account of his exile, अर्धरात्रे at midnight, गते having passed away, यदा when, भृशदुःखपीडितः tormented with intense sorrow, तदा then, प्राणम् life, जहौ gave up.
data.md: Thus that distressed lord of men, smitten with 1e exile of his beloved son, that one possessed fa gracious presence, when the night had been alf spent, wrought up with the violence of his notion, departed this life.

data.v: अथ रात्र्यां व्यतीतायां प्रातरेवापरेऽहनि । बन्दिनः पर्युपातिष्ठंस्तत्पार्थिवनिवेशनम् ।।
data.es: Then on the following day (unaware of Dasaratha's death) panegyrists uttering benedictions, highly accomplished bards and genealogists proficient in reciting auspicious words, singers versed in musical science reached the palace one after another eulogising the king's glory.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, रात्र्याम्  that night, व्यतीतायाम् had passed, अपरे on the following, अहनि day, प्रातः एव in the morning, परमसंस्काराः highly accomplished men, उत्तमश्रुताः proficient in learning, मङ्गलाश्च auspicious men, सूताः genealogists, स्तुतिशीलाः those versed in praising, गायकाः singers, वन्दिनः panegyrists, पृथक् पृथक् separately one by one, निगदन्तः reciting audibly, तत् that, पार्थिवनिवेशनम् palace of the king, पर्युपातिष्ठन् reached.

data.v: ततः शुचिसमाचाराः पर्युपस्थान कोविदः । स्त्रीवर्षवरभूयिष्ठा उपतस्थुर्यथापुरम् ।।
data.es: Thereafter, as usual, men observing purificatory practices and skilled in royal service assembled along with women and eunuchs.
data.anv: ततः then, शुचिसमाचाराः observing purificatory practices, स्त्रीवर्ष धरभूयिष्ठाः many women  and eunuchs, पर्युपस्थानकोविदा: skilled to serve, यथापुरम् as usual, उपतस्थुः assembled.
data.md: And as on former occasions, men practising purity and well up in serving, with numerous women and eunuchs entered appearance.

data.v: हरिचन्दनसंपृक्तमुदकं काञ्चनैर्घटैः । आनिन्युः स्नानशिक्षाज्ञा यथाकालं यथाविधि ।।
data.es: The bathattendants brought water mixed with yellow sandal paste in golden vessels at appropriate times in accordance with tradition.
data.anv: स्नानशिक्षाज्ञाः those acquainted with bathing ceremonies, हरिचन्दन सम्पृक्तम् mixed with yellow sandal paste, उदकम् water, काञ्चनैः in golden, घटैः vessels, यथाकालम् at appropriate times, यथाविधि according to tradition, आनिन्युः brought.
data.md: Persons acquainted with the ceremonials connected with bath, according to the ordinance and in due time, in golden vessels brought water impregnated with Hair sandal powder.

data.v: मङ्गलालम्भनीयानि प्राशनीयानुपस्करान् । उपनिन्युस्तथाप्यन्याः कुमारी बहुलाः स्त्रियः ।।
data.es: Also, a group of women mostly young maidens brought auspicious unguents, articles gratifying the senses and those necessary accessories for completion of bathing process.
data.anv: तथा also, अन्याः some other, कुमारीबहुलाः with young maidens in large numbers, स्त्रियः women, मङ्गलालम्भनीयानि auspicious unguents, प्राशनीयाः articles gratifying to the senses, उपस्करान् articles necessary for completion of bathing ritual, उपनिन्युः brought.
data.md: Pure females together with many virgins brought kine &c, which were to be touched, Ganges water for sipping, mirrors, cloths, ornaments and other areicles.

data.v: अथ याः कोसलेन्द्रस्य शयनं प्रत्यनन्तराः । ताः स्त्रियस्तु समागम्य भर्तारं प्रत्यबोधयन् ।।
data.es: The women who usually attend to the bed (maids who do the bed in the morning) of Dasaratha (king of Kosala) without any restrictions, approached the king and began waking him up.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, याः स्त्रियः those women, कोशलेन्द्रस्य of the king of Kosala (Dasaratha's), शयनं प्रति attending on the bed, अनन्तराः with unrestricted movement, ताः तु those women, समागम्य on coming near, भर्तारम् that lord, प्रत्यबोधयन् and began waking him up.
data.md: Those ladies that were beside the bed of the lord of Kosala, were consoling their husband.

data.v: ता वेपथुपरीताश्च राज्ञः प्राणेषु शङ्किताः । प्रतिस्रोतस्तृणाग्राणां सदृशं संचकम्पिरे ।।
data.es: Those women knowledgeable in ascertaining the nature of sleep based on the actions, movements, etc. were apprehensive whether the king was alive or not. Trembling severely they seemed like the tips of reeds that stand against the current.
data.anv: ताः स्त्रीयः those women, चेष्टासञ्चलनादिषु in actions, movements, etc, स्वप्नशीलज्ञाः who know the nature of sleeping men, ताः those women, राज्ञः king's, प्राणेषु regarding king's life, शङ्किताः apprehensive of, वेपथुपरीताः च trembling severely, प्रतिस्रोतस्त्रृणाग्राणाम् the tips of reeds standing against the current, सदृशम् like, सञ्चकाशिरे remained.

data.v: अथ संवेपमनानां स्त्रीणां दृष्ट्वा च पार्थिवम् । यत्तदाशङ्कितं पापं तस्य जज्ञे विनिश्चयः ।।
data.es: Having seen the king more closely, those women who were apprehensive till then, became certain of the inevitable.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, पार्थिवम् king, दृष्ट्वा च having seen, सन्देहमानानाम् suspicious, स्त्रीणाम्  women, यत् that, तत् this, पापम् evil, आशङ्कितम् apprehensive, तस्य its, विनिश्चय: certain, जज्ञे became.

data.v: ततः प्रचुक्रुशुर्दीनाः सस्वरं ता वराङ्गनाः । करेणव इवारण्ये स्थानप्रच्युतयूथपाः ।।
data.es: Then those women bewailed bitterly and loudly in distress like female elephants in the forest when their leader has fallen out of the herd.
data.anv: ततः then, ताः वराङ्गनाः those women, अरण्ये in the forest, स्थानप्रच्युतयूथपाः the leader of the herd dislodged, करेणवः इव like the female elephants, दीनाः in distress, सस्वरम् loudly, प्रचुक्रुशुः wailed bitterly.
data.md: Thereupon exceedingly distressed, those paragons of their sex, like she-elephants in the forest deprived of their leader of the herd, broke out into wailing.

data.v: तासामाक्रन्द शब्देन सहसोद्गतचेतने । कौसल्या च सुमित्राच त्यक्तनिद्रे बभूवतुः ।।
data.es: Hearing the lamentations of the women suddenly Kausalya and Sumitra woke up from sleep, their senses recovered.
data.anv: कौशल्या च Kausalya, सुमित्रा च Sumitra too, तासाम् their, आक्रन्दशब्देन by the sound of  their cries, सहसा suddenly, उद्धतचेतने recovering senses, त्यक्तनिद्रे बभूवतुः deserted their sleep.
data.md: At the sounds of their lamentations, both Kausalya and Sumitrā suddenly regaining consciousness, awoke from their sleep.

data.v: कौसल्या च सुमित्रा च दृष्ट्वा स्पृष्ट्वा च पार्थिवम् । हा नाथेति परिक्रुश्य पेततुर्धरणीतले ।।
data.es: Kausalya and Sumitra looked at the king, touched his body, cried aloud, 'Ah, lord' and collapsed on the floor.
data.anv: कौशल्याच Kausalya, सुमित्रा च and Sumitra, पार्थिवम् the king,  दृष्ट्वाच having seen,स्पृष्ट्वा च having touched, हा नाथ इति Ah, lord, saying so, परिक्रुश्य crying loudly, धरणीतले on the floor, पेततुः fell down.
data.md: And Kausalya and Sumitrā looking at the king and feeling him, fell down to the earth, exclaiming, "Ah lord.”

data.v: सा कोसलेन्द्रदुहिता वेष्टमाना महीतले । न बभ्राज रजोध्वस्ता तारेव गगनच्युता ।।
data.es: Kausalya, daughter of the lord of Kosala, lay on the ground writhing in pain, coated with dust, and devoid of brightness like a star without radiance fallen from the sky.
data.anv: सा that, कोशलेन्द्रदुहिता daughter of the lord of Kosala, Kausalya, महीतले on the ground, वेष्टमाना rolling, रजोध्वस्ता coated with dust, गगनात् from the sky, च्युता fallen down, तारेव like a star, न बभ्राज did not shine.
data.md: As the daughter of Kosala's lord rolled on the ground, she covered with dust did not appear in all her loveliness, like a star fallen from the sky to the earth below.

data.v: तत्समुत्त्रस्तसंभ्रान्तं पर्युत्सुकजनाकुलम् । सर्वतस्तुमुलाक्रन्दं परितापार्तबान्धवम् ।।
data.es: On the demise of Dasaratha, joy instantly vanished. The palace was thronged with anxious people who were exceedingly bewildered and frightened. The royal family was anguished with distress. The palace was filled all over with the tumult of cries of agony. And it looked miserable with grief.
data.anv: दिष्टान्तम् demise, ईयुषः of him who reached, नरदेवस्य king's, तत् सद्म that palace, परित्रस्तन्त्रसम्भ्रान्त पर्युत्सुकजनाकुलम् thronged with anxious people who were exceedingly bewildered and frightened, सर्वतः all over, तुमुलाक्रन्दम् tumultuous with cries of agony, परितापार्तबान्धवम् with relatives anguished with distress, सद्यः at an instant, निपतितानन्दम् joy  vanished, दीनविक्लबदर्शनम् looked miserable with grief, बभूव became.
data.md: The mansion of the king became filled with people exceedingly excited and frightened, eager to know all about the matter, became filled with lamentations, with friends afflicted with distress, its joy instantaneously vanished, a scene of distress and dole.

data.v: सद्यो निपतितानन्दं दीनविक्लवदर्शनम् । बभूव नरदेवस्य सद्म दिष्टान्तमीयुषः ।।
data.es: On the demise of Dasaratha, joy instantly vanished. The palace was thronged with anxious people who were exceedingly bewildered and frightened. The royal family was anguished with distress. The palace was filled all over with the tumult of cries of agony. And it looked miserable with grief.
data.anv: दिष्टान्तम् demise, ईयुषः of him who reached, नरदेवस्य king's, तत् सद्म that palace, परित्रस्तन्त्रसम्भ्रान्त पर्युत्सुकजनाकुलम् thronged with anxious people who were exceedingly bewildered and frightened, सर्वतः all over, तुमुलाक्रन्दम् tumultuous with cries of agony, परितापार्तबान्धवम् with relatives anguished with distress, सद्यः at an instant, निपतितानन्दम् joy  vanished, दीनविक्लबदर्शनम् looked miserable with grief, बभूव became.
data.md: The mansion of the king became filled with people exceedingly excited and frightened, eager to know all about the matter, became filled with lamentations, with friends afflicted with distress, its joy instantaneously vanished, a scene of distress and dole.

data.v: अतीतमाज्ञाय तु पार्थिवर्षभं; यशस्विनं संपरिवार्य पत्नयः । भृशं रुदन्त्यः करुणं सुदुःखिताः; प्रगृह्य बाहू व्यलपन्ननाथवत् ।।
data.es: Realising that the great and illustrious king, Dasaratha, had passed away, his wives gathered around him, weeping piteously and bitterly and holding one another's hands bewailed like orphans.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे पञ्चषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyfifth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: पत्नयः wives of the king, यशस्विनम् the illustrious, पार्थिवर्षभम् best of kings, अतीतम् him who has passed away, आज्ञाय realising, सम्परिवार्य surrounding him, सुदुःखिताः with intense sorrow, करुणम् piteously, भृशम् bitterly, रुदन्त्यः weeping, बाहू both their arms, प्रगृह्य holding, अनाथवत् like orphans, व्यलपन् bewailed.
data.md: Knowing that the lord of earth had departed, his wives surrounding that illustrious one, smitten with excess of sorrow and weeping bitterly and piteously, holding the king's hands indulged in lamentations, like forlorn ones.

data.v: तमग्निमिव संशान्तमम्बुहीनमिवार्णवम् । हतप्रभमिवादित्यं स्वर्गथं प्रेक्ष्य भूमिपम् ।।
data.es: On seeing the king who ascended the heaven just as a blazing fire suddenly extinguishes, or like the ocean emptied of water or the Sun bereft of splendour Kausalya raised the head of the king on to her lap, her eyes filled with tears and body shrunk in sorrow, looked at Kaikeyi and said:
data.anv: संशान्तम् pacified, अग्निमिव like blazing fire, अम्बुहीनम् without water, अर्णवमिव like the ocean, हतप्रभम् bereft of brightness, आदित्यमिव like the Sun, स्वर्गस्थम् ascended heaven, तं पार्थिवम् that king, प्रेक्ष्य on seeing, कौशल्या Kausalya, बाष्पपूर्णाक्षी with her eyes filled with tears, विविधाम् in several ways, शोककर्शिता emaciated with sorrow, राज्ञः king's, शिरः head, उपगृह्य having grasped, कैकेयीं प्रति looking at Kaikeyi, अभाषत uttered.
data.md: Seeing the king had ascended heaven, like to a fire that has cooled, or an ocean deprived of its waters, or the sun shorn of his splendour, Kausalyā afflicted with woe, taking on her lap the head of the king, with tears in her eyes, said.

data.v: कौसल्या बाष्पपूर्णाक्षी विविधं शोककर्शिता । उपगृह्य शिरो राज्ञः कैकेयीं प्रत्यभाषत ।।
data.es: On seeing the king who ascended the heaven just as a blazing fire suddenly extinguishes, or like the ocean emptied of water or the Sun bereft of splendour Kausalya raised the head of the king on to her lap, her eyes filled with tears and body shrunk in sorrow, looked at Kaikeyi and said:
data.anv: संशान्तम् pacified, अग्निमिव like blazing fire, अम्बुहीनम् without water, अर्णवमिव like the ocean, हतप्रभम् bereft of brightness, आदित्यमिव like the Sun, स्वर्गस्थम् ascended heaven, तं पार्थिवम् that king, प्रेक्ष्य on seeing, कौशल्या Kausalya, बाष्पपूर्णाक्षी with her eyes filled with tears, विविधाम् in several ways, शोककर्शिता emaciated with sorrow, राज्ञः king's, शिरः head, उपगृह्य having grasped, कैकेयीं प्रति looking at Kaikeyi, अभाषत uttered.
data.md: Seeing the king had ascended heaven, like to a fire that has cooled, or an ocean deprived of its waters, or the sun shorn of his splendour, Kausalyā afflicted with woe, taking on her lap the head of the king, with tears in her eyes, said.

data.v: सकामा भव कैकेयि भुङ्क्ष्व राज्यमकण्टकम् । त्यक्त्वा राजानमेकाग्रा नृशंसे दुष्टचारिणि ।।
data.es: O cruel one O perverse wretch, O Kaikeyi, your wishes have been fulfilled. You have forsaken the king, that was your only objective. (Now) enjoy the kingdom alone without any obstacles on your way.
data.anv: नृशंसे O cruel one, दुष्टचारिणि O perverse wretch, कैकेयि O Kaikeyi, सकामा भव remain with your wishes fulfilled, राजानम् king, त्यक्त्वा forsaking, एकाग्रा with one objective, अकण्टकम् without any obstacle, राज्यम् kingdom, भुङ्क्ष्व enjoy.
data.md: O Kaikeyī, attain you your wished: do you enjoy this kingdom rid of your thorn. O cruel one, O you of wicked ways, you that forsaking the king had set your heart (on having your son crowned), Rāma had gone away, forsaking me; and now my lord has ascended heaven. I can no longer bear to live, like one left lone in a wilderness by her companions.

data.v: विहाय मां गतो रामो भर्ता च स्वर्गतो मम । विपथे सार्थहीनेव नाहं जीवितुमुत्सहे ।।
data.es: Rama has gone away leaving me. My lord has ascended the heaven, traversing the wrong road. With my wellwishers gone, I do not want to live.
data.anv: रामः Rama, माम् me, विहाय having left, गतः has gone, मम my, भर्ता च lord also, स्वर्गतः has  ascended heaven, विपथे on a wrong path, सार्थहीनेव without wellwishers अहम् I, जीवितुम् to live, न उत्सहे do not desire.
data.md: O Kaikeyī, attain you your wished: do you enjoy this kingdom rid of your thorn. O cruel one, O you of wicked ways, you that forsaking the king had set your heart (on having your son crowned), Rāma had gone away, forsaking me; and now my lord has ascended heaven. I can no longer bear to live, like one left lone in a wilderness by her companions.

data.v: भर्तारं तं परित्यज्य का स्त्री दैवतमात्मनः । इच्छेज्जीवितुमन्यत्र कैकेय्यास्त्यक्तधर्मणः ।।
data.es: Which woman wishes to live, leaving her godlike husband, except Kaikeyi who has given up her sense of duty?
data.anv: त्यक्तधर्मणः one who has abandoned righteousness, कैकेय्याः अन्यत्र other than Kaikeyi, का स्त्री which woman, आत्मनः her own, दैवतम् god, तं भर्तारम् her husband, परित्यज्य having abandoned, जीवितुम् to live, इच्छेत् desires.
data.md: What other woman except Kaikeyi lost to righteousness, having lost her deity, her lord, wishes to carry on existence in another's kingdom?

data.v: न लुब्धो बुध्यते दोषान्किं पाकमिव भक्षयन् । कुब्जानिमित्तं कैकेय्या राघवाणान्कुलं हतम् ।।
data.es: Like a greedy man who eats the (poisonous) kimpaka fruit without realising the defects of the fruit, Kaikeyi has destroyed the Raghu race on account of the hunchback (Manthara).
data.anv: लुब्ध: a greedy man, किम्पाकम् a poisonous fruit of bad taste, भक्षयन्निव as if one has eaten, दोषान् faults, न बुध्यते does not know, कुब्जानिमित्तम् on account of the hunchback, कैकेय्या by Kaikeyi, राघवाणाम् of Raghus, कुलम् race, हतम् is destroyed.
data.md: As a covetous person taking poison (through anger or some other passion), does not consider himself guilty, (so Kaikeyī) having done this evil through Manthara's incitement, does not bring her guilt home to her mind. It is through the instrumentality of the humpbacked woman that this race of the Rāghavas has been destroyed by Kaikeyi. Hearing that the king being made to do an unrighteous action, has banished Rāma together with his wife, king Janaka will be filled with grief as I have been.

data.v: अनियोगे नियुक्तेन राज्ञा रामं विवासितम् । सभार्यं जनकः श्रुत्वा परितप्स्यत्यहं यथा ।।
data.es: Hearing the unrighteous action ordered by the king in banishing Rama and his wife king Janaka will suffer great agony like me.
data.anv: सभार्यम् with wife, रामम् Rama, अनियोगे is an unworthy act, नियुक्तेन ordered, राज्ञा by the king, विवासितम् has been banished, श्रुत्वा having heard, जनकः Janaka, अहं यथा like me, परितप्स्यति will suffer.
data.md: As a covetous person taking poison (through anger or some other passion), does not consider himself guilty, (so Kaikeyī) having done this evil through Manthara's incitement, does not bring her guilt home to her mind. It is through the instrumentality of the humpbacked woman that this race of the Rāghavas has been destroyed by Kaikeyi. Hearing that the king being made to do an unrighteous action, has banished Rāma together with his wife, king Janaka will be filled with grief as I have been.

data.v: रामः कमलपत्राक्षो जीवनाशमितो गतः । विदेहराजस्य सुता तहा सीता तपस्विनी । दुःखस्यानुचिता दुःखं वने पर्युद्विजिष्यति ।।
data.es: In the same way Sita, daughter of the king of Videha, who does not deserve hardships will be in deep agony.
