data.anv: तथा also, तपस्विनी a miserable woman, दुःखस्य of hardships, अनुचिता unworthy, विदेहराजस्य king Videha's, सुता daughter, सीता Sita, वने in the forest, दुःखम् great sorrow, पर्युद्विजिष्यति will be agitated in her mind.
data.md: The fair daughter of Videha's king unworthy of hardship, in ascetic guise is leading a life of trouble and terror in the woods.

data.v: नदतां भीमघोषाणां निशासु मृगपक्षिणाम् । निशम्य नूनं संस्त्रस्ता राघवं संश्रयिष्यति ।।
data.es: Hearing the ghastly sounds of animals and birds, Sita will surely get frightened and take shelter in Rama.
data.anv: निशाम् at night, भीमघोषाणाम् ghastly sounds, मृगपक्षिणाम् of animals and birds, नदताम् by those making sounds, निशम्य having heard, सन्त्रस्ता frightened, नूनम्  surely, राघवम् Rama, संश्रयिष्यति will take shelter.
data.md: Hearing at night the dreadful roars of birds and beasts crying, she exceedingly frightened takes shelter with Rāghava.

data.v: वृद्धश्चैवाल्पपुत्रश्च वैदेहीमनिचिन्तयन् । सोऽपि शोकसमाविष्टो ननु त्यक्ष्यति जीवितम् ।।
data.es: Old and sonless Janaka, constantly thinking of Sita and overpowered with grief will surely give up his life.
data.anv: वृद्धश्चैव aged, अल्पपुत्रश्च not having sons, सोऽपि that Janaka too, शोकसमाविष्टः  overpowered by grief, वैदेहीम् Sita, अनुचिन्तयन् constantly thinking, जीवितम् life, त्यक्ष्यति ननु will give up indeed.
data.md: Old and having an only daughter, he revolving in his mind thoughts of Vaidehi, shall, smitten with grief, surely renounce his life. I ever faithful to my lord will die this very day, embracing this body; I will enter fire.

data.v: तां ततः संपरिष्वज्य विलपन्तीं तपस्विनीम् । व्यपनिन्युः सुदुःखार्तां कौसल्यां व्यावहारिकाः ।।
data.es: The servants led away that unfortunate Kausalya who was lamenting in great anguish embracing the body of Dasaratha.
data.anv: व्यावहारिकाः maidservants (those who customarily attend on the queens), सम्परिष्वज्य  having embraced, विलपन्तीम् lamenting, तपस्विनीम् unfortunate, सुदुःखार्ताम् deeply distressed, तां कौशल्याम् to that Kausaya, ततः from there, व्यपनीय removed.
data.md: As embracing the (dead) body, that unfortunate lady was bewailing, the courtiers had the distressed (queen) removed from there.

data.v: तैलद्रोण्यामथामात्याः संवेश्य जगतीपतिम् । राज्ञः सर्वाण्यथादिष्टाश्चक्रुः कर्माण्यनन्तरम् ।।
data.es: The counsellors, instructed (by Vasistha and others), placed the king's body in an oil tub with the understanding that the funeral rites were to be performed hereafter.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, आदिष्टाः having been instructed, अमात्याः counsellors, जगतीपतिम् the (corpse) of the lord of the world (Dasartha), तैलद्रोण्याम् in an oil tub, संवेश्य keeping, अनन्तरम् thereafter, कर्माणि ceremonies, सर्वाणि all, चक्रुः performed.
data.md: Then placing the corpse of the king in a (capacious) pan with oil, the courtiers performed the mourning rites of the monarch.

data.v: न तु संकलनं राज्ञो विना पुत्रेण मन्त्रिणः । सर्वज्ञाः कर्तुमीषुस्ते ततो रक्षन्ति भूमिपम् ।।
data.es: The counsellors who were acquainted with all such matters (relating to the king's funeral) were unwilling to perform the obsequies in the absence of any of the king's sons. Meanwhile, they kept watch over the deadbody of the king.
data.anv: सर्वज्ञाः conversant with all such matters (relating to the obsequies), मन्त्रिणः counsellors, विना पुत्रेण without sons, राज्ञः king's, सङ्कलनम् funeral obsequies, कर्तुम् to do, न ईषुः did not desire, ततः then, भूमिपम् king's body, रक्षन्ति they are protecting.
data.md: But well versed in everything, the counsellors, in the absence of his son, did not perform the funeral obsequies of the king; and therefore they placed his body stretched in the pan of oil. Alas! at length concluding it for certain that the king was dead, the ladies burst out into lamentaions.

data.v: तैलद्रोण्यां तु सचिवैः शायितं तं नराधिपम् । हा मृतोऽयमिति ज्ञात्वा स्त्रियस्ताः पर्यदेवयन् ।।
data.es: On seeing the king's body laid in the oil vat by the counsellors, the women cried Alas, the king is dead.
data.anv: सचिवैः by counsellors, तैलद्रोण्याम् in the oil vat, शायितम् made to lay down, तं नराधिपम् that king, ज्ञात्वा on knowing (having seen), हा alas, अयम् this, मृतः is dead, इति in this way, ताः those, स्त्रियः women, पर्यदेवयन् cried.

data.v: बाहूनुद्यम्य कृपणा नेत्रप्रस्रवणैर्मुखैः । रुदन्त्यः शोकसंतप्ताः कृपणं पर्यदेवयन् ।।
data.es: With tears flowing down their faces, piteously raising their arms, groaning in their burning grief, the women lamented helplessly.
data.anv: नेत्रप्रस्रवणैः tears flowing from their eyes, मुखैः with faces, कृपणाः piteously, बाहून् hands, उद्यम्य raising, रुदन्त्यः groaning, शोकसन्तप्ताः burning in grief, कृपणम् helplessly, पर्यदेवयन् lamented.
data.md: And raising their arms, with tears trickling down their faces, they in dire affliction and extremely exercised with grief, lamented.

data.v: निशानक्षत्रहीनेव स्त्रीव भर्तृविवर्जिता । पुरी नाराजतायोध्या हीना राज्ञा महात्मना ।।
data.es: Like night without the Moon, like a woman forsaken by her husband, this city of Ayodhya without that magnanimous king has lost its earlier splendour.
data.anv: महात्मना by the great, राज्ञा king, हीना deprived, अयोध्यापुरी city of Ayodhya, चन्द्रविहीना devoid of moon, निशेव night, भर्तृविवर्जिता forsaken by husband, स्त्रीव like woman, नाराजत  did not shine.
data.md: Like a night without stars, like a fair one forsaken by her husband, the city of Ayodhyā without the magnanimous monarch did not appear delightful as it had done before, with the populace filled with tears, the ladies uttering exclamations of distress, and the terraces and courts deserted.

data.v: बाष्पपर्याकुलजना हाहाभूतकुलाङ्गना । शून्यचत्वरवेश्मान्ता न बभ्राज यथापुरम् ।।
data.es: With the people of Ayodhya shedding tears, the housewives crying, in anguish, 'alas alas' the courtyards houses and squares of the roads deserted, the city has lost its earlier brilliance.
data.anv: बाष्पपर्याकुलजना filled with people shedding tears, हाहाभूतकुलाङ्गना with the cries of anguish of housewives, शून्यचत्वरवेश्मान्ता infront of their houses and the public squares in between the houses, यथा पुरम् city with its earlier brilliance, न बभ्राज does not shine.
data.md: Like a night without stars, like a fair one forsaken by her husband, the city of Ayodhyā without the magnanimous monarch did not appear delightful as it had done before, with the populace filled with tears, the ladies uttering exclamations of distress, and the terraces and courts deserted.

data.v: गतप्रभा द्यौरिव भास्करं विना; व्यपेतनक्षत्रगणेव शर्वरी । पुरी बभासे रहिता महात्मना; न चास्रकण्ठाकुलमार्गचत्वरा ।।
data.es: The city, bereft of illustrious Dasaratha was filled with people sobbing in the courtyards in front of their houses and in the squares in between. That city of Ayodhya bereft of brightness, appeared like the day without the Sun and the night without constellations of stars.
data.anv: महात्मना by the great Dasaratha, रहिता bereft of, अस्रकण्ठाकुलमार्गचत्वरा courtyards in front of their houses and the squares on the roads filled with people sobbing, पुरी Ayodhya, भास्करं विना without the Sun, द्यौरिव like the sky, व्यपेतनक्षत्रगणाः with crowds of stars, शर्वरीव like night, गतप्रभा having lost the brightness, न बभासे did not shine.
data.md: And with her terraces overflowing with tears that flooded the throats of the mourners, the city appeared like the welkin without its splendour in the absence of the sun, or the night with the stars enveloped.

data.v: नराश्च नार्यश्च समेत्य संघशो; विगर्हमाणा भरतस्य मातरम् । तदा नगर्यां नरदेवसंक्षये; बभूवुरार्ता न च शर्म लेभिरे ।।
data.es: After the demise of the king, men and women in the city assembled in groups and denounced the mother of Bharata. Extremely distressed, they had no peace of mind. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे षट्षष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtysixth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: तदा then, नरदेवसङ्क्षये after the demise of the king, नगर्याम् in the city, नराश्च men, नार्यश्च women, सङ्घशः in groups, समेत्य assembled, भरतस्य Bharata's, मातरम् mother, विगर्हमाणाः denounced, आर्ताः बभूवुः became extremely distressed, शर्म peace, न च लेभिरे did not have
data.md: And on on the demise of that illustrious personage, in the city men and women in multitudes, censuring Bharata's mother, became extremely distressed, and did not attain peace of mind.

data.v: व्यतीतायां तु शर्वर्यामादित्यस्योदये ततः । समेत्य राजकर्तारः सभामीयुर्द्विजातयः ।।
data.es: When the night finally ended and after the sunrise next day, the brahmins who perform royal investiture having been called and reached the assembly hall.
data.anv: ततः then, शर्वर्याम् when the night, व्यतीतायां तु passed, आदित्यस्य उदये at sunrise, राजकर्तारः those who perform royal investiture, द्विजातयः brahmins, समेत्य having been called, सभाम् assembly hall, ईयुः reached.

data.v: मार्कण्डेयोऽथ मौद्गल्यो वामदेवश्च काश्यपः । कात्ययनो गौतमश्च जाबालिश्च महायशाः ।।
data.es: Markandeya, Maudgalya, Kasyapa, Katyayana, Gautama, Jabali of great renown accompanied by ministers and brahmins approached Vasistha, the chief priest of the king and expressed different opinions (on the investiture).

data.es: Markandeya, Maudgalya, Kasyapa, Katyayana, Gautama, Jabali of great renown accompanied by ministers and brahmins approached Vasistha, the chief priest of the king and expressed different opinions (on the investiture).
data.anv: मार्कण्डेयः Markandeya, अथ and, मौद्गल्यः Maudgalya, अथ also, काश्यपः Kasyapa, कात्यायनः Katyayana, गौतमश्च Gautama also, महायशाः of great renown, जाबालिश्च Jabali too, एते  these, द्विजाः brahmins, अमात्यैः सह with ministers, श्रेष्ठम् the chief, राजपुरोहितम् king's priest, वसिष्ठमेव Vasistha himself, अभिमुखाः approached, पृथक् different, वाचम् opinions  उदीरयन् expressed.

data.v: अतीता शर्वरी दुःखं या नो वर्षशतोपमा । अस्मिन्पञ्चत्वमापन्ने पुत्रशोकेन पार्थिवे ।।
data.es: While king Dasaratha died on account of grief over (separation from) his son and rejoined the five elements, the sorrowful night seemed like a hundred years for us. (commented the assembly of ministers).
data.anv: अस्मिन् पार्थिवे this king, पुत्रशोकेन out of grief over (seperation from) his son, पञ्चत्वम् dissolution into the five elements (death), आपन्ने having attained, या that night, नः for us, वर्षशतोपमा like a hundred years, शर्वरी such night, दुःखम्  sorrowful, अतीता passed.
data.md: Then facing the royal priest, the eminent Vasistha, they said, "That night that had appeared like to an hundred years has at last been painfully passed.

data.v: स्वर्गतश्च महाराजो रामश्चारण्यमाश्रितः । लक्ष्मणश्चापि तेजस्वी रामेणैव गतः सह ।।
data.es: The great king has attained heaven, Rama has taken refuge in the forest and brilliant Lakshmana has also gone with Rama.
data.anv: महाराजः the great king, स्वर्गतश्च had attained heaven, रामश्च Rama also, अरण्यम् in the forest, आश्रितः taken refuge, तेजस्वी lustrous, लक्ष्मणश्च Lakshmana, रामेणैव सह with Rama, गतः went.
data.md: The king racked by sorrow for his son having breathed his last, the mighty monarch has ascended heaven, Rāma has taken refuge in the woods, the energetic Lakşmaņa has gone with Rama, and does Bharata and Satrughna, repressors of foes, are staying in Kekaya in pleasant Rājagrha, the abode of their maternal grandfather.

data.v: उभौ भरतशत्रुघ्नौ क्केकयेषु परंतपौ । पुरे राजगृहे रम्ये मातामहनिवेशने ।।
data.es: Bharata and Satrughna, destroyers of enemies, are at the beautiful city of Rajagriha in the Kekaya kingdom, the palace of their maternal grandfather's palace.
data.anv: परन्तपौ destroyers of enemies, भरतशत्रुघ्नौ Bharata and Satrughna, उभौ both, केकयेषु in the Kekaya kingdom, राजगृहे at Rajagriha, पुरे city, रम्ये beautiful, मातामहनिवेशने are in maternal grandfather's palace.

data.v: इक्ष्वाकूणामिहाद्यैव कश्चिद्राजा विधीयताम् । अराजकं हि नो राष्ट्रं न विनाशमवाप्नुयात् ।।
data.es: Therefore, let someone from the race of Ikshvakus be appointed king right now. since without a king, the country will be destroyed.
data.anv: इक्ष्वाकूणाम् in the race of Ikshvakus, कश्चित् anyone, इह here, अद्यैव right now, राजा as king, विधीयताम् should be made, अराजकम् without a king, नः our, राष्ट्रम् country, विनाशम्  destruction, (सम् अव) आप्नुयात् will attain.
data.md: Do you select some on this very day from the descendants of Ikşvāku, to be king here. Verily does a kingdom go to ruin, when without a king.

data.v: नाराजले जनपदे विद्युन्माली महास्वनः । अभिवर्षति पर्जन्यो महीं दिव्येन वारिणा ।।
data.es: In a country without a king, thunderous clouds garlanded by lightning would no longer water the earth with celestial showers.
data.anv: अराजके where there is no king, जनपदे in a country, विद्युन्माली garlanded with a row of lightning, महास्वनः thunderous, पर्जन्यः raingod, महीम् the earth, दिव्येन with celestial, वारिणा with rain, नाभिवर्षति does not shower.
data.md: He that goes garlanded with lightning, and has a mighty voice, even the Cloud, does not with Skye shower drench the Earth in a kingdom without a king.

data.v: नाराजके जनपदे बीजमुष्टिः प्रकीर्यते । नाराकके पितुः पुत्रो भार्या वा वर्तते वशे ।।
data.es: Where there is no king, even a handful of seeds will not be sown (will not sprout). In a kingless kingdom, a son or a wife will not obey the father (head of the family).
data.anv: अराजके where there is no king, जनपदे in a country, बीजमुष्टिः handfuls of seeds, न प्रकीर्यते will not be sown (sprout), अराजके where there no king, पुत्र: son, भार्या वा or wife, पितुः father's, वशे control, न वर्तते do not remain.
data.md: In a kingless kingdom no one sows corn. In a kingless kingdom the son does not obey his sire, or the wife her husband.

data.v: अराजके धनं नास्ति नास्ति भार्याप्यराजके । इदमत्याहितं चान्यत्कुतः सत्यमराजके ।।
data.es: In a kingdom without a king wealth cannot be preserved, no wife would like to stay (with her husband). There is one more cause for a great peril, that is, there is no place for truth in a country (where there is no king).
data.anv: अराजके when there is no king, धनम् wealth, नास्ति not, अराजके without a king, भार्यापि even wife, नास्ति is not, अत्याहितम् cause of great peril, अन्यत् another, इदं च this one also exists, अराजके where there no king, सत्यम् truth, कुतः where?
data.md: A kingless kingdom possesses no wealth, and wives are hard to keep in such a place. This great fear attends a kingless country. And where is other morality (besides that detailed above) to be found at such a place?

data.v: नाराजके जनपदे कारयन्ति सभां नराः । उद्यानानि च रम्याणि हृष्टाः पुण्यगृहाणि च ।।
data.es: In a country where there is no king, no assemblies are convened by pleasure seeking people, nor do they build delightful gardens or sacred edifices.
data.anv: अराजके where there is no king, जनपदे in a country, नराः people, हृष्टाः rejoiced, सभाम्  assembly, रम्याणि delightful, उद्यानानि gardens, पुण्यगृहाणि sacred edifices (like temples), न कारयन्ति are not built.
data.md: In a kingless country men do not form themselves into associations, nor do they, inspired with cheerfulness, make elegant gardens or sacred edifices.

data.v: नाराजके जनपदे यज्ञशीला द्विजातयः । सत्राण्यन्वासते दान्ता ब्राह्मणाः संशितव्रताः ।।
data.es: In a country without a king, selfcontrolled brahmins in charge of sacrificial ceremonies, wellversed in the study of Vedas and strict followers of austerity will not function.
data.anv: अराजके without a king, जनपदे in a country, यज्ञशीलाः where sacrificial ceremonies are conducted, दान्ताः selfcontrolled, ब्राह्मणाः versed in the study of Vedas, संशितव्रताः of rigorous austerity, द्विजातयः brahmins, सत्राणि sacrifices, न अन्वासते do not practise.
data.md: In a kingless country, the twice-born ones do not celebrate sacrifices. In a kingless country, in mighty sacrifices wealthy Brāhmaṇas do not confer (on the officiating priests) the Dakșiņās (which they receive according to the ordinance).

data.v: नाराजके जनपदे प्रभूतनटनर्तकाः । उत्सवाश्च समाजाश्च वर्धन्ते राष्ट्रवर्धनाः ।।
data.es: In a country without a king, celebrations of associations promoting the welfare of the country, actors and dancers in large numbers do not prosper.
data.anv: अराजके where there is no king, जनपदे in a country, प्रभूतनटनर्तकाः actors and dancers in large numbers, राष्ट्रवर्धनाः promoting the welfare of the country, उत्सवाश्च celebrations, समाजाश्च assemblies, न वर्धन्ते do not prosper.
data.md: In a kingless country, neither neither social gatherings, nor festivities characterised by the presence of merry theatrical managers and performers, increase.

data.v: नारजके जनपदे सिद्धार्था व्यवहारिणः । कथाभिरनुरज्यन्ते कथाशीलाः कथाप्रियैः ।।
data.es: Where there is no king, those engaged in lawsuits will not succeed and those who are accustomed to storytelling will not entertain those who love to listen to stories.
data.anv: अराजके where there is no king, जनपदे in a country, व्यवहारिणः those engaged in lawsuits, सिद्धार्थाः succeed, न not, कथाशीलाः those who are accustomed to storytelling, कथाप्रियैः with those who love to listen to stories, कथाभिः with stories, न अनुरज्यन्ते are not entertained.
data.md: In a kingless country disputants cannot decide their point; nor are persons given to hearing Puranic recitations pleased by those delighting in the practice.

data.v: नाराजके जनपदे वाहनैः शीघ्रगामिभिः । नरा निर्यान्त्यरण्यानि नारीभिः सह कामिनः ।।
data.es: In a country without a king, pleasureseeking men will not drive in the woods on swiftmoving chariots with women.
data.anv: अराजके without a king, जनपदे in a country, कामिनः pleasureseeking men, नराः men, नारीभिः with women too, शीघ्रगामिभिः by swift moving, वाहनैः chariots, अरण्यानि in the woods (for recreation), न निर्यान्ति will not go.
data.md: In a kingless country pleasure-seeking people do not in company with females go to the woods by means of swift vehicles.

data.v: नाराकजे जनपदे धनवन्तः सुरक्षिताः । शेरते विवृत द्वाराः कृषिगोरक्षजीविनः ।।
data.es: In a country without a king, wealthy people who live on farming and raising cattle cannot sleep safely in their homes with doors wide open.
data.anv: अराजके without a king, जनपदे in a country, कृषिगोरक्षजीविनः living by farming and  protecting cattle, धनवन्तः wealthy people, सुरक्षिताः wellprotected, विवृतद्वाराः with the doors wide open, न शेरते do not sleep.
data.md: In a kingless country, the wealthy are not well protected; nor do shepherds and cultivators sleep with their doors open.

data.v: नाराजके जनपदे वणिजो दूरगामिनः । गच्छन्ति क्षेममध्वानं बहुपुण्यसमाचिताः ।।
data.es: In a country without a king merchants travelling long distances with several kinds of saleable goods cannot go safely on their way.
data.anv: अराजके without a king, जनपदे in a country, दूरगामिनः travelling long distances, वणिजः merchants, बहुपण्यसमाचिताः with several kinds of marketable goods, क्षेमम् safely, अध्वानम् on the way, न गच्छन्ति do not go.
data.md: In a kingless country traders coming from distant lands, loaded with various kinds of merchandise, do not with safety go along the roads.

data.v: नाराजके जनपदे चरत्येकचरो वशी । भावयन्नात्मनात्मानं यत्रसायंगृहो मुनिः ।।
data.es: In a country where there is no king, an ascetic who (normally) moves alone, selfcontrolled and contemplating on the higher self no longer wanders or rests in the inn.
data.anv: अराजके where there is no king, जनपदे in a country, एकचरः moving alone, वशी selfcontrolled, आत्मना in mind, आत्मानाम् on the higher self, भावयन् contemplating, यत्रसायं गृहः inn, मुनिः ascetic, न चरति does not wander.
data.md: In a kingless country the ascetic with his subdued senses, himself his sole protector, who makes his quarters wherever evening overtakes him, cannot walk contemplating the Deity.

data.v: नाराजके जनपदे योगक्षेमं प्रवर्तते । न चाप्यराजके सेना शत्रून्विषहते युधि ।।
data.es: In a country without a king, there is no security of possessions and the army cannot withstand the enemy in a battle.
data.anv: नाराजके without a king, जनपदे in a country, योगक्षेमम् security of possession, न प्रवर्तते does not exist, अराजके without a king, सेना army, युधि in a battle, शत्रून् enemies, न विषहते not be able to oppose.
data.md: In a kingless country, one cannot protect what one has, or procure what one has not. In a kingless country, the forces cannot bear the onslaught of the foe.

data.v: यथा ह्यनुदका नद्यो यथा वाप्यतृणं वनम् । अगोपाला यथा गावस्तथा राष्ट्रमराजकम् ।।
data.es: (The kingdom without a king) is like rivers without water, forests without vegetation and cows without cowherds.
data.anv: अनुदकाः without water, नद्यः rivers, यथा as, आतृणम् without vegetation, वनम् forest, यथा वा or as, आगोपालाः without cowherds, गावः cows, यथा as, अराजकम् without a king, राष्ट्रम्  country, तथा is like that.
data.md: Even as a river without water, a wood without grass, a herd of kine without a keeper, is a kingdom without a king.

data.v: नाराजके जनपदे स्वकं भवति कस्यचित् । मत्स्या इव नरा नित्यं भक्षयन्ति परस्परम् ।।
data.es: In a country where there is no king, no one can own anything and, like fish, people devour one another ceaselessly.
data.anv: अराजके where there is no king, जनपदे in the country, कस्य चित् for any one, स्वकम् as his own, न भवति does not exist, नराः men, मत्स्याः इव like fish, नित्यम् ceaselessly, परस्परम्  one another, भक्षयन्ति devour.
data.md: In a kingless country a person hardly preserves his life; and like fishes people eat up one another.

data.v: येहि संभिन्नमर्यादा नास्तिकाश्छिन्नसंशयाः । तेऽपि भावाय कल्पन्ते राजदण्डनिपीडिताः ।।
data.es: Atheists, who disregard the bounds of morality and live freely dispelling doubts will tend to follow virtuous path out of fear when subjected to royal punishment.
data.anv: सम्भिन्नमर्यादाः those disregarding the bounds of morality, छिन्नसंशयाः dispelling doubts, ये हि those, नास्तिकाः atheists, तेऽपि they also, राजदण्डनिपीडिताः when subjected to royal  punishment, भावाय for virtuous path, कल्पन्ते adopt.
data.md: Even those heretics who having disregarded the dignity of social morality had met with chastisement at the hands of the king, their fear removed, give themselves airs.

data.v: अहो तम इवेदं स्यान्न प्रज्ञायेत किंचन । राजा चेन्न भवेँल्लोके विभजन्साध्वसाधुनी ।।
data.es: If the king did not show the distinction between the good and evil actions, this world would have been enveloped by darkness. Nothing could have been seen. How great (is the king)?
data.anv: अहो how great, राजा a king, साध्वसाधुनी good and evil actions, विभजन् showing the distinction, लोके in the world, न भवेद्यदि if it were not to happen, इदम् this, तमः स्यात्  would be darkness, किञ्चन even a little, न प्रज्ञायेत could not have been known.
data.md: If there were not a king in this world to adjudge fair and foul, darkness would overspread (the face of the earth) and people could not distinguish anything whatever. As the ocean keeps within its continent, we even while the monarch lived, did not disregard your words.

data.v: जीवत्यपि महाराजे तवैव वचनं वयम् । नातिक्रमामहे सर्वे वेलां प्राप्येव सागरः ।।
data.es: Even while the great king was alive, we never defied your word like the ocean which does not overstep its shore.
data.anv: महाराजे when the great king, जीवत्यपि was alive also, वयम् we, सर्वे all, सागरः sea, वेलाम्  shore, प्राप्येव after reaching, तव your, वचनमेव words, नातिक्रमामहे never overstepped.
data.md: If there were not a king in this world to adjudge fair and foul, darkness would overspread (the face of the earth) and people could not distinguish anything whatever. As the ocean keeps within its continent, we even while the monarch lived, did not disregard your words.

data.v: स नः समीक्ष्य द्विजवर्यवृत्तं; नृपं विना राज्यमरण्यभूतम् । कुमारमिक्ष्वाकुसुतं वदान्यं; त्वमेव राजानमिहाभिषिञ्चय ।।
data.es: O Vasistha, the best of brahmins, considering all that has happened and knowing that a kingdom without a king is like a forest, you may consecrate a generous son from the Ikshvaku race as our king.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे सप्तषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyseventh sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: द्विजवर्य O best of brahmins, सः you, वृत्तम् all that has happened, समीक्ष्य having considered, नृपं विना without a king, राज्यम् kingdom, अरण्यभूतम् like a forest, त्वमेव yourself, इह here, वदान्यम् generous, इक्ष्वाकु सुतम् born in the Ikshvaku race, कुमारम् son, नः for us, राजानम् as king, अभिषिञ्च consecrate him.
data.md: Do you, O best of Brāhmaṇas, beholding our acts rendered nugatory, and this empire became a wilderness for want of a king, install that descendant of Ikşvāku or any other as king of this realm.

data.v: तेषां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा वसिष्ठः प्रत्युवाच ह । मित्रामात्यगणान्सर्वान्ब्राह्मणांस्तानिदं वचः ।।
data.es: Having listened to their (the counsellors') words, Vasistha replied to the host of friends and counsellors of the king and to all the brahmins:
data.anv: तेषाम् their, वचनं words, श्रुत्वा having listened, वसिष्टः Vasistha, तान् those, मित्रामात्यगणान्  host of friends and counsellors (of the king), सर्वान् all, ब्राह्मणान् brahmins, इदं वचः these words, प्रत्युवाचह said in reply.
data.md: Hearing their words, Vasiştha said to the Brāhmaṇas and the adherents and counsellors (of the king)

data.v: यदसौ मातुलकुले पुरे राजगृहे सुखी । भरतो वसति भ्रात्रा शत्रुघ्नेन समन्वितः ।।
data.es: Bharata on whom the kingdom has been conferred is living comfortably in his maternal uncle's house. Let swift messengers go quickly on speeding horses and bring back the valiant brothers, Bharata and Satrughna. What is there to deliberate for us in this matter?
data.anv: दत्तराज्यम् on whom the kingdom  has been conferred, असौ भरतः that Bharata, भ्रात्रा with his brother, शत्रुघ्नेन with Satrughna, समन्वितः accompanied by, यत् since, मातुलकुले in maternal uncle's house, परम् extremely, सुखी happy, वसति is living, तत् for that reason, वीरौ two valiant, भ्रातरौ brothers, आनेतुम् to bring, जवनाः swift ones, दूताः messengers, त्वरितैः by high speed, हयैः on horses, शीघ्रम् quickly, गच्छन्तु let them go, वयम् we, किम् what, समीक्षामहे shall we deliberate.
data.md: Bharata, on whom the king has conferred the kingdom, along with his brother Satrughna, is living happily in the house of his maternal uncle.

data.v: तच्छीघ्रं जवना दूता गच्छन्तु त्वरितैर्हयैः । आनेतुं भ्रातरौ वीरौ किं समीक्षामहे वयम् ।।
data.es: Bharata on whom the kingdom has been conferred is living comfortably in his maternal uncle's house. Let swift messengers go quickly on speeding horses and bring back the valiant brothers, Bharata and Satrughna. What is there to deliberate for us in this matter?
data.anv: दत्तराज्यम् on whom the kingdom  has been conferred, असौ भरतः that Bharata, भ्रात्रा with his brother, शत्रुघ्नेन with Satrughna, समन्वितः accompanied by, यत् since, मातुलकुले in maternal uncle's house, परम् extremely, सुखी happy, वसति is living, तत् for that reason, वीरौ two valiant, भ्रातरौ brothers, आनेतुम् to bring, जवनाः swift ones, दूताः messengers, त्वरितैः by high speed, हयैः on horses, शीघ्रम् quickly, गच्छन्तु let them go, वयम् we, किम् what, समीक्षामहे shall we deliberate.
data.md: Let envoys by means of fleet coursers speedily repair thither and bring those heroic brothers. What shall we decide?

data.v: गच्छन्त्विति ततः सर्वे वसिष्ठं वाक्यमब्रुवन् । तेषां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा वसिष्ठो वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Let the messengers go, said all of them to Vasistha. On hearing this, Vasistha replied again.
data.anv: ततः after that, गच्छन्तु let them go, इति thus, सर्वे all, वसिष्ठम् addressing Vasistha, वाक्यम् words, अब्रुवन् uttered, तेषाम् their, तत् those, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, वसिष्ठः Vasistha, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: "Let them go", said all to Vasistha. Hearing their words, Vasistha spoke to them, saying.

data.v: एहि सिद्धार्थ विजय जयन्ताशोकनन्दन । श्रूयतामितिकर्तव्यं सर्वानेव ब्रवीमि वः ।।
data.es: Calling Siddhartha, Vijaya, Jayanta, Asoka and Nandana, Vasistha said, All of you listen to what is required to be done (by you).
data.anv: सिद्धार्थ O Siddhartha, विजय O Vijaya, जयन्त O Jayanta, अशोक O Asoka, नन्दन O Nandana, एहि come, वः us, सर्वानेव addressing all of you, (अहम् I), ब्रवीमि am telling, इतिकर्तव्यम् what is required to be done, श्रूयाताम् hear.
data.md: Come here, you Siddhārtha, and Vijaya, and Jayanta, and Asokanandana. Do you hear. I well tell you what you are to do.

data.v: पुरं राजगृहं गत्वा शीघ्रं शीघ्रजवैर्हयैः । त्यक्तशोकैरिदं वाच्यः शासनाद्भरतो मम ।।
data.es: Go at once from here on swift horses to the city of Rajagrha and concealing signs of grief, convey these words to Bharata as my command:
data.anv: (इतः from here), शीघ्रजवैः go swiftly, हयैः on horses, राजगृहम् to Rajagrha, पुरम् city, गत्वा  having gone, त्यक्त शोकैः concealing signs of grief, भरतः Bharata, मम my, शासनात् by command, इदम् these words, वाच्यः should be told.
data.md: First going speedily to the royal residence by means of swift horses, do you, renouncing grief, by my order speak these words of mine to Bharata.

data.v: पुरोहितस्त्वां कुशलं प्राह सर्वे च मन्त्रिणः । त्वरमाणश्च निर्याहि कृत्यमात्ययिकं त्वया ।।
data.es: The family priest and all the counsellors wish your welfare. You must return in haste. There is an urgent task required to be done by you.
data.anv: पुरोहितः the family priest, त्वाम् your, कुशलम् welfare, प्राह has wished, सर्वे all, मन्त्रिणश्च counsellors too, त्वरमाणः च in all haste, निर्याहि return, त्वया by you, आत्ययिकम् urgent, कृत्यम् task exists.
data.md: The priest as well as the counsellors have enquired after your welfare. Do you at once set out. A business is at hand that brooks no delay on your part.

data.v: मा चास्मै प्रोषितं रामं मा चास्मै पितरं मृतम् । भवन्तः शंसिषुर्गत्वा राघवाणामिमं क्षयम् ।।
data.es: All of you go there and do not communicate (to Bharata) about the exile of Rama or the demise of his father and the disaster that has befallen the Raghus.
data.anv: भवन्तः all of you, गत्वा having gone, आस्मै to him, रामम् Rama, प्रोषितम् been exiled to the forest, मा शंसिषुः shall not be communicated, पितरम् father's, मृतम् demise, राघवाणाम् of Raghus, इमम् this, क्षयम् decline, मा शंसिषुः shall not communicate.
data.md: But you must on no account communicate to him the exile of Rāma, or the demise of the monarch, or the destruction that has befallen the Raghu race through this occasion.

data.v: कौशेयानि च वस्त्राणि भूषणानि वराणि च । क्षिप्रमादाय राज्ञश्च भरतस्य च गच्छत । वसिष्ठेनाभ्यनुज्ञाता दूताः संत्वरिता ययुः ।।
data.es: Take with you silk garments and precious ornaments for the king of Kekaya and Bharata and depart at once.
data.anv: राज्ञश्च the kings, भरतस्य च to Bharata, कौशेयानि वस्त्राणि silk garments, वराणि precious, भूषणानि च ornaments, आदाय taking with you, क्षिप्रम् गच्छत immediately go.
data.md: Do you, speedily taking silk apparel and excellent ornaments for king Bharata, set off.

data.v: ते हस्तिन पुरे गङ्गां तीर्त्वा प्रत्यङ्मुखा ययुः । पाञ्चालदेशमासाद्य मध्येन कुरुजाङ्गलम् ।।
data.es: The messengers crossed Ganga at Hastinapura, and went in the westerly direction through the middle of Kurujangala and reached the country of Panchala. Beholding lakes full of water and rivers of pellucid waters there, they travelled fast with a view to fulfilling their mission.
data.anv: ते दूताः those messengers, हस्तिनापुरे at Hastinapura, गङ्गाम् Ganga, तीर्त्वा having crossed, प्रत्यङ्मुखाः in the westerly direction, ययुः went, मध्येन कुरुजाङ्गलम् through the middle of Kurujangala, पाञ्चालदेशम् Panchala country, आसाद्य having reached, सुपूर्णानि filled with water, सरांसि च lakes, विमलोदकाः of pellucid waters, नदीश्च rivers, निरीक्षमाणाः  beholding, कार्यवशात् with a view to fulfil their mission, द्रुतम्  fast, जग्मुः went.
data.md: Then crossing the Gangā at Hastināpura, and arriving at Pāñcāla, they proceeded west ward through Kurujāngala.

data.v: ते प्रसन्नोदकां दिव्यां नानाविहगसेविताम् । उपातिजग्मुर्वेगेन शरदण्डां जनाकुलाम् ।।
data.es: The messengers crossed the divine Saradanda of calm waters frequented by fowls of various speices and thronged with people. And proceeded speedily.
data.anv: ते those messengers, प्रसन्नोदकाम् of calm waters, दिव्याम् divine, नानाविहगसेविताम्    frequented by fowls of various species, जनाकुलाम् thronged with people, शरदण्डाम् Saradanda river, उपातिजग्मुः crossed and went.
data.md: And they darted past the Saradanda overflowing with delightful water, beautiful, and haunted by fowls of various kinds.

data.v: निकूलवृक्षमासाद्य दिव्यं सत्योपयाचनम् । अभिगम्याभिवाद्यं तं कुलिङ्गां प्राविशन्पुरीम् ।।
data.es: They reached a divine tree (of great powers) known as Satyopayachana tree and having gone round and paid homage they entered the Kulinga city.
data.anv: दिव्यम् divine, सत्योपयाचनम् Satyopayachana (a tree granting the wishes of those who pray for), निकूलवृक्षम् a tree on the bank, आसाद्य having reached, अभिवाद्यम् paying homage, तम् that one, अभिगम्य having reached, कुलिङ्गांपुरीम् Kulinga city, प्राविशन् entered.
data.md: Then on the western bank of the stream, coming upon a tree called Satyopayācana presided by a deity, and bowing down to the tree and going round it, they entered the city of Kulinga.

data.v: अभिकालं ततः प्राप्य तेजोभिभवनाच्च्युताः । ययुर्मध्येन बाह्लीकान्सुदामानं च पर्वतम् । विष्णोः पदं प्रेक्षमाणा विपाशां चापि शाल्मलीम् ।।
ते श्रान्तवाहना दूता विकृष्टेन सता पथा । गिरि व्रजं पुर वरं शीघ्रमासेदुरञ्जसा ।।
data.es: After a prolonged journey the messengers with their tired horses soon reached Girivraja, the (capital city of Kekaya kingdom) best of cities.
data.anv: विकृष्णेन by  prolonged, पथा journey, श्रान्त वाहनाः tired horses, ते दूताः those mesengers, ततः then, शीघ्रम् swiftly, अञ्जसा straight on, पुरवरम् best of cities, गिरिव्रजम् Girivrajam, आसेदुः reached.
data.md: And with their vehicles fatigued, the ambassadors, on account of the great distance of the way; speedily reached that best of cities, Girivraja.

data.v: भर्तुः प्रियार्थं कुलरक्षणार्थं; भर्तुश्च वंशस्य परिग्रहार्थम् । अहेडमानास्त्वरया स्म दूता; रात्र्यां तु ते तत्पुरमेव याताः ।।
data.es: To please their master (sage Vasistha) and to preserve the royal dynasty and also to protect the honour of the (race and people), the messengers soon reached their destination by night without any negligence of their duty.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे अष्टषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyeighth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: ते दूताः those messengers, भर्तुः lord's, प्रियार्थम् to please, कुलरक्षणार्थम् to preserve the royal dynasty, भर्तुः of the king's, वंशस्य the house of the Ikshvakus, परिग्रहार्थम् for the protection of (royal honour), त्वरया quickly, अहेडमानाः without negligence, रात्य्राम् in the night, तत् that, पुरमेव that city, याताः reached.
data.md: And for pleasing their master, for the preservation of the people, and enabling Bharata to assume the reins of government, those envoys, casting aside negligence, swiftly entered the city in the night.

data.v: यामेव रात्रिं ते दूताः प्रविशन्ति स्म तां पुरीम् । भरतेनापि तां रात्रिं स्वप्नो दृष्टोऽयमप्रियः ।।
data.es: On the very night the messengers were entering the city, Bharata had a distressing dream.
data.anv: ते दूताः those messengers, यामेव on whichever, रात्रिम् night, तां पुरीम् that city, प्रविशन्ति स्म were entering, तां रात्रिम् that night, भरतेनापि by Bharata also, अयम् this, आप्रियः distressing, स्वप्नः dream, दृष्टः has been seen.
data.md: The very same night that the envoys entered the city, Bharata saw an evil dream.

data.v: व्युष्टामेव तु तां रात्रिं दृष्ट्वा तं स्वप्नमप्रियम् । पुत्रो राजाधिराजस्य सुभृशं पर्यतप्यत ।।
data.es: The son of the king of kings (Bharata) felt extremely troubled hen he had an unpleasant dream at dawn.
data.anv: राजाधिराजस्य (the son) of the king of kings, पुत्रः son, तां रात्रिम् that night, व्युष्टाम् एव when dawn appeared, तम् that, अप्रियम् unpleasant, स्वप्नम् dream, दृष्ट्वा having seen, सुभृशम् extremely, पर्यतप्यत felt troubled.
data.md: And seeing that evil dream during the short hours, the son of that king of kings exceedingly burned in grief.

data.v: तप्यमानं समाज्ञाय वयस्याः प्रियवादिनः । आयासं हि विनेष्यन्तः सभायां चक्रिरे कथाः ।।
data.es: Observing him griefstricken his peers who always spoke pleasant words, engaged him in a variety of ways in the assembly in order to divert him.
data.anv: प्रियवादिनः speaking pleasing words, वयस्याः peers, तप्यमानम् griefstricken, समाज्ञाय having observed, आयासम् despair, विनेष्यन्तः with a view to remove, सभायाम् in the assembly, कथाः stories, चक्रिरे made.
data.md: And finding him aggrieved, his sweet. speeched associates, endeavouring to chase the heaviness, began to converse on a variety of subjects.

data.v: वादयन्ति तथा शान्तिं लासयन्त्यपि चापरे । नाटकान्यपरे प्राहुर्हास्यानि विविधानि च ।।
data.es: In order to provide mental peace to Bharata, some played stringed instruments while some enacted dramatic scenes, some danced and cracked various kinds of jokes.
data.anv: शान्तिम् to provide mental peace, वादयन्ति played stringed instruments, तथा similarly, अपरे some, नाटकानि dramatic scenes, लासयन्त्यपि danced, अपरे some, विविधानि various kinds of, हास्यानि jokes, प्राहुः told.
data.md: Some played on instruments; some for the purpose of pacifying his mind, danced (the courtezans); others performed scenes variously fraught with the sentiment of mirth.

data.v: स तैर्महात्मा भरतः सखिभिः प्रिय वादिभिः । गोष्ठीहास्यानि कुर्वद्भिर्न प्राहृष्यत राघवः ।।
data.es: The magnanimous Bharata born in the race of Raghus, was not delighted by the conversations and jokes and soothing words of his friends.
data.anv: राघवः one born in the Raghu race, महात्मा the magnanimous, सः भरतः that Bharata, गोष्ठीहास्यानि conversations and jokes, कुर्वद्भि: while performing, प्रियवादिभिः were soothing words, सखिभिः by friends also, न प्राहृष्यत could not be delighted.
data.md: But although his friends intending to ally his agitation set about enacting passages calculated to amuse family circles, that magnanimous descendant of Raghu did not indulge in laughter.

data.v: तमब्रवीत्प्रियसखो भरतं सखिभिर्वृतम् । सुहृद्भिः पर्युपासीनः किं सखे नानुमोदसे ।।
data.es: Addressing Bharata amidst his companions some one close among them said O friend why are you dejected in spite of being in the company of friends.
data.anv: प्रियसखः one dear friend, सखिभिः with friends, वृतम् surrounded, भरतं addressing that Bharata, अब्रवीत् said, सखे O friend, सुहृद्भिः with friends, पर्युपासीनः accompanied by, किम् why, न अनुमोदसे you are not pleased.
data.md: Then a dear friend addressed Bharata, as he sat surrounded by his friends, “Surrounded by your friends, why do you not, my friend, join in the mirth?"

data.v: एवं ब्रुवाणं सुहृदं भरतः प्रत्युवाच ह । शृणु त्वं यन्निमित्तंमे दैन्यमेतदुपागतम् ।।
data.es: Addressing his companion who was speaking thus, Bharata replied, saying Listen to the reason this desolation has overtaken me:
data.anv: भरतः Bharata, एवम् in this manner, ब्रुवाणम् saying, सुहृदम् his companion, प्रत्युवाच ह replied, मे my, यन्निमित्तम् for what reason, एतत् this, दैन्यम् desolation, उपागतम् that has overtaken me, त्वम् you, श्रुणु listen.
data.md: Thus asked by his friend, Bharata answered, “Listen why this depression has overtaken me. In a dream I beheld my father, pale, with his hair loosely flowing about, plunging from the summit of a mountain into a dirty pool filled with cowdung.”

data.v: स्वप्ने पितरमद्राक्षं मलिनं मुक्तमूर्धजम् । पतन्तमद्रिशिखरात्कलुषे गोमये ह्रदे ।।
data.es: In my dream I saw my father looking pale, with dishevelled hair, his body filled with filth falling from the peak of a mountain into a pool of cow dung.
data.anv: स्वप्ने in a dream, मलिनम् pale, मुक्तमूर्धजम् with dishevelled hair, अद्रिशिखरात् from the peak of a mountain, कलुषे dirty, गोमयह्रदे pool filled with cow dung, पतन्तम् falling down, पितरम् father, अद्राक्षम् saw.
data.md: Thus asked by his friend, Bharata answered, “Listen why this depression has overtaken me. In a dream I beheld my father, pale, with his hair loosely flowing about, plunging from the summit of a mountain into a dirty pool filled with cowdung.”

data.v: प्लवमानश्च मे दृष्टः स तस्मिन्गोमयह्रदे । पिबन्नञ्जलिना तैलं हसन्निव मुहुर्मुहुः ।।
data.es: I saw my father floating in that pool of cow dung, drinking oil with cupped palms and bursting into laughter again and again.
data.anv: सः he, तस्मिन् that, गोमयह्रदे in the pool filled with cow dung, प्लवमानः floating, अञ्जलिना with both palms cupped, तैलम् oil, पिबन् drinking मुहुर्मुहुः again and again, हसन् laughing, मे by me, दृष्टः was seen.
data.md: And I saw him floating on a sink of cowdung, and yet with a momentary laugh drinking oil by means of his joined hands.

data.v: ततस्तिलोदनं भुक्त्वा पुनः पुनरधःशिराः । तैलेनाभ्यक्तसर्वाङ्गस्तैलमेवावगाहत ।।
data.es: Thereafter I beheld him eating rice cooked with sesame seeds, his body besmeared with oil plunging again and again into it (the pool).
data.anv: ततः thereafter, तिलौदनम् rice cooked with sesame seeds, भुक्त्वा eating, पुनः पुनः again and again, अधःशिराः plunging his head downwards, तैलेन with oil, अभ्यक्तसर्वाङ्ग: his body besmeared with oil, तैलमेव into the oil alone, अन्वगाहत entered.
data.md: Then feeding on rice mixed with sesame, he again and again hanging his head down, dives into oil with his limbs rubbed with oil.

data.v: स्वप्नेऽपि सागरं शुष्कं चन्द्रं च पतितं भुवि । सहसा चापि संशन्तं ज्वलितं जातवेदसम् ।।
अवदीर्णां च पृथिवीं शुष्कांश्च विविधान्द्रुमान् । अहं पश्यामि विध्वस्तान्सधूमांश्चैव पार्वतान् ।।
पीठे कार्ष्णायसे चैनं निषण्णं कृष्णवाससम् । प्रहसन्ति स्म राजानं प्रमदाः कृष्णपिङ्गलाः ।।
data.es: In the dream, I beheld my father clad in black clothes and resting on a seat made of iron and the women in dark and brownish complexion laughing at him.
data.anv: कार्ष्णायसे on an iron, पीठे seat, निषण्णम् resting, कृष्णवाससम्  clad in black clothes, एनं राजानं this king, कृष्णपिङ्गलाः having dark and brownish complexion, प्रमादाः women, प्रहसन्ति were laughing.
data.md: I saw the king seated on a sable seat of iron, clad in a sable garb; and women black and yellow beating him.

data.v: त्वरमाणश्च धर्मात्मा रक्तमाल्यानुलेपनः । रथेन खरयुक्तेन प्रयातो दक्षिणामुखः ।।
data.es: Thereafter, I beheld that virtuous monarch bedecked with garlands made of red flowers and his body bedaubed with red sandalpaste, hurrying off southward on a chariot yoked with asses.
data.anv: धर्मात्मा virtuous one, रक्तमाल्यानुलेपनः wearing garlands of red flowers and with his body  bedaubed with red sandal, त्वरमाणश्च hurrying off, खरयुक्तेन yoked with asses, रथेन on chariot, दक्षिणामुखः southward, प्रयातः went.
data.md: And bearing a garland of red flowers, with his body daubed with red sandal, he was fast proceeding to the south in a car yoked with asses.

data.v: एवमेतन्मया दृष्टमिमां रात्रिं भयावहाम् । अहं रामोऽथ वा राजा लक्ष्मणो वा मरिष्यति ।।
data.es: I had such a frightful dream last night. Either I, Rama, the king or Lakshmana might die.
data.anv: एवम् in this manner, इमां रात्रिम् last night, भयावहम् frightening, एतत् this one, (मया)                           दृष्टम् was beheld (by me), अहम् either me, अथवा or, राजा the king, लक्ष्मणो वा or Lakshmana, मरिष्यति might die.
data.md: This was the dream that I saw this terrible night. Either I, or Rama, or the king, or Lakşmaņa is to breathe our last.

data.v: नरो यानेन यः स्वप्ने खरयुक्तेन याति हि । अचिरात्तस्य धूमाग्रं चितायां संप्रदृश्यते । एतन्निमित्तं दीनोऽहं तन्न वः प्रतिपूजये ।।
data.es: If one beholds in a dream a person setting out on a carriage yoked to asses, the wreath of smoke ascending from his funeral pyre will be seen soon.
data.anv: स्वप्ने in the dream, यः any one, नरः human, रस्वयुक्तेन yoked to asses, यानेन by carriage, याति sets out, अचिरात् in a short time, चितायाम् on the funeral pyre, तस्य his, धूमाग्रम् wreath of smoke of his deadbody ascending, सम्प्रदृश्यते will be seen.
data.md: The smoke of the funeral pyre of him will be shortly visible that goes in the car yoked with asses. It is for this reason that I am poor of spirit, and that I do not respond to your words. Further, my throat is parched, and my mind ill at ease.

data.v: शुष्यतीव च मे कण्ठो न स्वस्थमिव मे मनः । जुगुप्सन्निव चात्मानं न च पश्यामि कारणम् ।।
इमां हि दुःस्वप्नगतिं निशाम्य ता;मनेकरूपामवितर्कितां पुरा । भयं महत्तद्धृदयान्न याति मे; विचिन्त्य राजानमचिन्त्यदर्शनम् ।।
data.es: On observing the course of this nightmare, with all those images formerly unconceived and having thought of the king's incomprehensible presence, a great fear that has gripped my heart does not leave me.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकोनसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyninth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki
data.anv: अनेकरूपाम् of several images, पुरा formerly, अतर्किताम् unthought of, ताम् such, इमाम् this, दुःस्वप्नगतिम् the course of this nightmare, निशाम्य having perceived, राजानम् the king, अचिन्त्यदर्शनम् as incomprehensible view, विचिन्त्य having thought of, महत् great, तत् that, भयम् fear, मे हृदयात् from my heart, न याति does not go.
data.md: Bringing to mind this various-looking dream which I had not thought of before, and remembering the king of incomprehensible presence, this fear goes not from my heart.

data.v: भरते ब्रुवति स्वप्नं दूतास्ते क्लान्तवाहनाः । प्रविश्यासह्यपरिखं रम्यं राजगृहं पुरम् ।।
data.es: While Bharata was relating his dream, the mounted messengers (from Ayodhya) with their weary horses entered the lovely city of Rajagriha surrounded by an impassable moat. There they met the king of Kekaya country and his son, Yuddhajit and were received with honour. Touching the feet of the king with reverence, they said to Bharata:
data.anv: भरते Bharata, स्वप्नं about the dream, ब्रुवति while relating, क्लान्तवाहना: men with their vehicles (horses) weary, दूताः messengers, असह्यपरिखम् impassable moat, रम्यम् lovely, राजगृहम् Rajagriha, पुरम् city, प्रविश्य having entered, राज्ञा च with Kekaya king, राजपुत्रेण with king's son, Yuddhajit, समागम्य having met, अर्चिताः were honoured, राज्ञः king's,पादौ feet, गृहीत्वा having touched with reverence, तं भरतम् addressing that Bharata, वचः words, ऊचुः.told.
data.md: Bharata was speaking thus when the envoys with their vehicles fatigued, entered the splendid royal residence surrounded by a strong rampart.

data.v: समागम्य तु राज्ञा च राजपुत्रेण चार्चिताः । राज्ञः पादौ गृहीत्वा तु तमूचुर्भरतं वचः ।।
data.es: While Bharata was relating his dream, the mounted messengers (from Ayodhya) with their weary horses entered the lovely city of Rajagriha surrounded by an impassable moat. There they met the king of Kekaya country and his son, Yuddhajit and were received with honour. Touching the feet of the king with reverence, they said to Bharata:
data.anv: भरते Bharata, स्वप्नं about the dream, ब्रुवति while relating, क्लान्तवाहना: men with their vehicles (horses) weary, दूताः messengers, असह्यपरिखम् impassable moat, रम्यम् lovely, राजगृहम् Rajagriha, पुरम् city, प्रविश्य having entered, राज्ञा च with Kekaya king, राजपुत्रेण with king's son, Yuddhajit, समागम्य having met, अर्चिताः were honoured, राज्ञः king's,पादौ feet, गृहीत्वा having touched with reverence, तं भरतम् addressing that Bharata, वचः words, ऊचुः.told.
data.md: Presenting themselves before the king, they, well received by him as well as the prince, bowed down to the feet of the monarch.

data.v: पुरोहितस्त्वा कुशलं प्राह सर्वे च मन्त्रिणः । त्वरमाणश्च निर्याहि कृत्यमात्ययिकं त्वया ।।
data.es: The family priest and all the counsellors wish your welfare. You must return in haste. There is an urgent task required to be done by you.
data.anv: पुरोहितः the family priest (Vasistha), त्वाम् about your, कुशलम् welfare, प्राह enquired, सर्वे  all, मन्त्रिणश्च counsellors also, त्वरमाणः च immediately, निर्याहि you may return, त्वया by you,  आत्ययिकम् urgent matter, कृत्यम्  to be attended.
data.md: The priest as well as the counsellors have enquired after your welfare. Do you at once set out. A business is at hand that brooks no delay on your part.

data.v: अत्र विंशतिकोट्यस्तु नृपतेर्मातुलस्य ते । दशकोट्यस्तु संपूर्णास्तथैव च नृपात्मज ।।
data.es: O prince these gifts worth twenty crore are intended for the king and the rest of the gifts worth ten crore for your maternal uncle.
data.anv: नृपात्मज O prince Bharata, अत्र among this, विंशतिकोट्यः twenty crore, नृपतेः for the king, तथैव च similarly, सम्पूर्णाः complete, दशकोट्यस्तु ten crores, ते to your, मातुलस्य to be given to your maternal uncle.
data.md: Twenty Kotis are intended for the king and complete ten for your maternal uncle, O son of the monarch.

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य च तत्सर्वं स्वनुरक्तः सुहृज्जने । दूतानुवाच भरतः कामैः संप्रतिपूज्य तान् ।।
data.es: Affectionate towards his relatives and friends, Bharata received all those gifts and in return honoured those messengers with things they liked, asking them:
data.anv: सुहृज्जने the relatives and friends, स्वनुरक्तः who is very affectionate, भरतः Bharata, तत् that, सर्वम् all, प्रतिगृह्य having received, तान् दूतान् those messengers, कामैः what they liked, सम्प्रतिपूज्य in return honouring them, उवाच said.
data.md: Taking all these, Bharata attached to his relatives, made the articles over to them; and receiving the envoys with goodly gifts, spoke to them.

data.v: कच्चित्सुकुशली राजा पिता दशरथो मम । कच्चिच्चारागता रामे लक्ष्मणे वा महात्मनि ।।
data.es: I hope my father, Dasaratha is doing well and revered Rama and Lakshmana are in good health
data.anv: मम पिता my father, राजा दशरथः king Dasaratha, कच्चित् I hope, सकुशली doing well, रामे Rama, महात्मनि great, लक्ष्मणे च in Lakshmana also, अरोगता good health, कच्चित् I hope.
data.md: Is my father, king Dasaratha, well? And is it well with Rama and the high-souled Laksmana?

data.v: आर्या च धर्मनिरता धर्मज्ञा धर्मदर्शिनी । अरोगा चापि कौसल्या माता रामस्य धीमतः ।।
data.es: (I hope) Kausalya mother of the sagacious Rama the venerable lady devoted to righteousness one who knows the ways of righteousness and observes the prescribed code of conduct, is keeping sound health.
data.anv: आर्या च venerable lady indeed, धर्मनिरता devoted to righteousness, धर्मज्ञा adept in  righteousness, धर्मदर्शिनी observes the prescribed code of conduct, धीमतः sagacious, रामस्य Rama's, माता mother, कौशल्या Kausalya, अपि अरोगा is she keeping good health.
data.md: And is the mother of the intelligent Rāma, the revered Kausalyā, conversant with virtue and ever practising it, well?

data.v: कच्चित्सुमित्रा धर्मज्ञा जननी लक्ष्मणस्य या । शत्रुघ्नस्य च वीरस्य सारोगा चापि मध्यमा ।।
data.es: I hope my mother Sumitra (the middle one) who is familiar with the ways of righteousness, the mother of valiant Lakshmana and Satrughna, is enjoying good health.
data.anv: या that, धर्मज्ञा knowledgeable in the ways of righteousness, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, वीरस्य one who is full of valour, शत्रुघ्नस्य च Satrughna's, जननी mother, मध्यमा middle mother, सा सुमित्रापि that Sumitra, कच्चित् I hope, अरोगा is free from illness.
data.md: Is the virtuous Sumitrā, mother of Lakşmaņa and of the heroic Śatrughna, well?

data.v: आत्मकामा सदा चण्डी क्रोधना प्राज्ञमानिनी । अरोगा चापि कैकेयी माता मे किमुवाच ह ।।
data.es: And what about my mother Kaikeyi, ever intent on her own wellbeing, wrathful, irascible and proud of her intelligence? Is she maintaining sound health?
data.anv: आत्मकामा ever intent on her welfare, सदा always, चण्डी irascible, क्रोधना wrathful, प्राज्ञमानिनी who is proud of her intelligence, मे माता my mother, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, अपि अरोगा is she free from illness, किम् what, उवाच ह did she say?
data.md: And that wrathful one ever intent on her interest and setting immense store by her wisdom, my mother Kaikeyī, is it also well with her?

data.v: एवमुक्तास्तु ते दूता भरतेन महात्मना । ऊचुः संप्रश्रितं वाक्यमिदं तं भरतं तदा । कुशलास्ते नरव्याघ्र येषां कुशलमिच्छसि ।।
data.es: Having listened to the words of that magnanimous Bharata, those messengers addressed him gracefully with these words.
data.anv: महात्मना magnanimous, भरतेन by Bharata, एवम् in this way, उक्ताः uttered, ते दूताः those messengers, तदा then, तं भरतम् addressing that Bharata, सप्रश्रयम् respectfully, इदं these  वाक्यम् (वचः) words, ऊचुः spoke.
data.md: Thus addressed by the magnanimous Bharata, the envoys spoke to him these humble and brief words.

data.v: भरतश्चापि तान्दूतानेवमुक्तोऽभ्यभाषत । आपृच्छेऽहं महाराजं दूताः संत्वरयन्ति माम् ।।
data.es: Having thus been addressed, Bharata said to the messengers. Let me seek the permission of the great king of Kekaya to leave and say goodbye, informing him that the messengers are hastening me up.
data.anv: एवम् thus, उक्तः uttered, भरतश्चापि Bharata, तान् दूतान् to those messengers, अभ्यभाषत said, माम् me, दूताः messengers, सन्त्वरयन्ति are hastening me up, अहम् I, महाराजम् great king (of Kekaya), आपृच्छे shall seek permission to leave.
data.md: Thus addressed, Bharata said to the envoys, “Let me tell the king that the envoys are urging speed on me.”

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा तु तान्दूतान्भरतः पार्थिवात्मजः । दूतैः संचोदितो वाक्यं मातामहमुवाच ह ।।
data.es: Having addressed the messengers who were pressing him to leave (for Ayodhya) Bharata said to his maternal grandfather:
data.anv: दूतैः messengers, सञ्चोदितः having been pressed, पार्थिवात्मजः king's son, भरतः Bharata,  तान् दूतान् to those messengers, एवम् in the aforesaid manner, उक्त्वा having said, मातामहम् addressing maternal grandfather, वाक्यम् these words, उवाच ह said.
data.md: Having said this, that son of the king, Bharata, communicated to his maternal grand-father what the envoys had told him.

data.v: राजन्पितुर्गमिष्यामि सकाशं दूतचोदितः । पुनरप्यहमेष्यामि यदा मे त्वं स्मरिष्यसि ।।
data.es: O king, urged by these messengers I wish to go to my father. I shall come back again (from Ayodhya) whenever you remember me.
data.anv: राजन् O king, दूतचोदितः urged by the messengers, पितुः father's, सकाशम् for, गमिष्यामि I shall go, त्वम् you, मे for me, यदा whenever, स्मरिष्यसि remember, पुनरपि again, अहं एष्यामि I shall come.
data.md: Asked by the envoys, I shall, O monarch, go to my father. I shall come again whenever you will remember me.

data.v: भरतेनैवमुक्तस्तु नृपो मातामहस्तदा । तमुवाच शुभं वाक्यं शिरस्याघ्राय राघवम् ।।
data.es: Then the king of Kekaya, the maternal grandfather of Bharata, having heard the words of the scion of the Raghu dynasty (Bharata), kissed him on his forehead and spoke these auspicious words:
data.anv: तदा then, भरतेन by Bharata, एवम् thus, उक्तः urged, मातामहः the maternal grandfather, नृपः king (of Kekaya), तम् that, राघवम् to one of Raghu dynasty (Bharata), शिरसि on his head, आघ्राय having smelt, शुभम् auspicious, वाक्यम् words, उवाच spoke.
data.md: Thus accosted by Bharata, his maternal grandfather, the king, smelling Bharata's head, spoke these auspicious words to that descendant of Raghu.

data.v: गच्छ तातानुजाने त्वां कैकेयी सुप्रजास्त्वया । मातरं कुशलं ब्रूयाः पितरं च परंतप ।।
data.es: You may go, my child I permit you to leave. Kaikeyi has a worthy son in you. O slayer of enemies convey my best wishes to your mother and father.
data.anv: तात O child, गच्छ you may go, त्वाम् you, अनुजाने I permit, त्वया by you, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, सुप्रजाः has a worthy son, परन्तप O slayer of enemies, मातरम् your mother, पितरं च and father, कुशलम् welfare, ब्रूयाः convey.
data.md: Go, my child; I permit you. Kaikeyi is mother of a worthy son through you. Do you O subduer of foes, communicate our welfare to both your father and your mother.

data.v: पुरोहितं च कुशलं ये चान्ये द्विजसत्तमाः । तौ च तात महेष्वासौ भ्रातरु रामलक्ष्मणौ ।।
data.es: My child, convey my best wishes, too, to your family priest Vasistha and other illustrious brahmins and also to those two great bowmen (Rama and Lakshmana).
data.anv: तात O child, पुरोहितम् to the family priest (Vasistha), अन्ये and others, ये द्विजसत्तमाः those illustrious brahmins, महेष्वासौ great bowmen (Rama and Lakshmana), कुशलम् best wishes, (ब्रूहि convey).
data.md: Do you likewise communicate the same to the priest and the other principal Brāhmaṇas; as also, my child, to those mighty bowmen, the brothers Rāma and Lakşmaņa.

data.v: तस्मै हस्त्युत्तमांश्चित्रान्कम्बलानजिनानि च । अभिसत्कृत्य कैकेयो भरताय धनं ददौ ।।
data.es: The king of Kekaya felicitated Bharata, out of affection and bestowed on him wellbred elephants, manycoloured blankets, antelope skins and riches.
data.anv: कैकेयः king of Kekaya, तस्मै भरताय to that Bharata, हस्त्युत्तमान् wellbred elephants, चित्रान्  of manycoloured, कम्बलान् blankets, अजिनानि च antelope skins, धनम् riches, अभिसत्कृत्य  having felicitated, ददौ bestowed.
data.md: Then honouring Bharata, king Kekaya conferred on Bharata wealth consisting of choice elephants maintained (at the palace) and woollen sheets and deerskins.

data.v: रुक्म निष्कसहस्रे द्वे षोडशाश्वशतानि च । सत्कृत्य कैकेयी पुत्रं केकयो धनमादिशत् ।।
data.es: King of Kekaya generously gave to the son of Kaikeyi (Bharata) in his honour two thousand gold coins and sixteen hundred horses.
data.anv: केकयः king of Kekaya, कैकयीपुत्रं son of Kaikeyi, सत्कृत्य having honoured, द्वे two, रुक्मनिष्कसहस्रे two thousand gold coins, षोडश अश्वशतानि च sixteen hundred  horses also, धनम् as wealth, आदिशत् bestowed.
data.md: Honouring the son of Kaikeyi, Kekaya gave him two thousand nishkas and six hundred : horses.

data.v: तथामात्यानभिप्रेतान्विश्वास्यांश्च गुणान्वितान् । ददावश्वपतिः शीघ्रं भरतायानुयायिनः ।।
data.es: Similarly his maternal uncle Ashwapati quickly presented him amenable, trustworthy and virtuous counsellors as companions on his return journey.
data.anv: तथा in the same way, अश्वपतिः Ashwapati, भरताय for Bharata, अभिप्रेतान् eamenable, विश्वास्यान् trustworthy men, गुणान्वितान् virtuous men, अमात्यान् counsellors, अनुयायिनः as companions, ददौ gave.
data.md: And for following Bharata, Aśvapati without delay assigned a number of goodly, trustworthy, and qualified courtiers.

data.v: ऐरावतानैन्द्रशिरान्नागान्वै प्रियदर्शनान् । खराञ्शीघ्रान्सुसंयुक्तान्मातुलोऽस्मै धनं ददौ ।।
data.es: His maternal uncle gave him the wealth of goodlooking elephants born in Iravata and Indrasira mountains and swiftmoving and welltrained asses which can be yoked easily. He gave riches too.
data.anv: मातुलः maternal uncle, अस्मै for him (Bharata), ऐरावतान् born in Iravata mountain, ऐन्द्रशिरान्  born in Indrasira mountain, प्रियदर्शनान् beautiful to behold, नागान् elephants, शीघ्रान् swift moving, सुसंयुक्तान् welltrained, खरान् asses, धनम् riches, ददौ gave.
data.md: Bharata's maternal uncle conferred on Bharata wealth in the shape of graceful elephants sprung in the īrāvat mountain and the country called Indrasira; as well as fleet and well-broken horses.

data.v: अन्तःपुरेऽतिसंवृद्धान्व्याघ्रवीर्यबलान्वितान् । दंष्ट्रायुधान्महाकायाञ्शुनश्चोपायनं ददौ ।।
data.es: He also gave him a gift of wellraised dogs of the inner apartment hugebodied with the strength and courage of tigers who used their fangs as weapons.
data.anv: अन्तःपुरे in the inner apartment, अति संवृद्धान् wellraised, व्याघ्रवीर्यबलान्वितान् having the  strength and courage of tigers, दंष्ट्राऽऽयुधान् whose fangs are their weapons spears, महाकायान् of huge body, शुनश्च dogs also, उपायनम् as gift, ददौ gave.
data.md: The king presented him with dogs brought up in the inner apartment, resembling tigers in strength and prowess, furnished with teeth representing weapons, and large of body.

data.v: स मातामहमापृच्छ्य मातुलं च युधाजितम् । रथमारुह्य भरतः शत्रुघ्नसहितो ययौ ।।
data.es: Thus having taken leave of his maternal grandfather and uncle Yuddhajit, Bharata accompanied by Satrughna boarded the chariot and went along.
data.anv: सः भरतः that Bharata, मतामहम् maternal grandfather, मातुलम् uncle, युधाजितम् Yaddhajit, आपृच्छ्य taking leave, शत्रुघ्नसहितः along with Satrughna, रथम् chariot, आरुह्य having ascended, ययौ went.
data.md: Then after speaking with his maternal grandfather and uncle, Yudhajit, Bharata ascending a car, set out with Satrughna.

data.v: रथान्मण्डलचक्रांश्च योजयित्वा परःशतम् । उष्ट्रगोश्वखरैर्भृत्या भरतं यान्तमन्वयुः ।।
data.es: And the servants harnessing more than a hundred chariots of wellrounded wheels and also camels, oxen and horses followed Bharata who started off.
data.anv: भृत्याः servants, मण्डलचक्रांश्च of wellrounded wheels, परश्शतान् more than a hundred, रथान् chariots, योजयित्वा harnessing, उष्ट्रगोश्वबलैः with camels, oxen, and horses, यान्तम् going on, भरतम् Bharata, अन्ययुः followed.
data.md: Thereat servants by means of an hundred cars, furnished with circular wheels, and yoked with camels, oxen, horses, and asses, followed Bharata.

data.v: बलेन गुप्तो भरतो महात्मा; सहार्यकस्यात्मसमैरमात्यैः । आदाय शत्रुघ्नमपेतशत्रु;र्गृहाद्ययौ सिद्ध इवेन्द्रलोकात् ।।
data.es: Under the protection of the army, the illustrious Bharata who was devoid of enemies, accompanied by ministers who were comparable to him and Satrughna, departed from his venerable grandfather's house like a siddha leaving the regions of Indra. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे सप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventieth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: बलेन with army, गुप्तः under the protection of, महात्मा illustrious, अपेतशत्रुः devoid of enemies, भरतः Bharata, आत्मसमैः like himself, अमात्यैस्सह accompanied by ministers, शत्रुघ्नम् Satrughna, आदाय having taken, आर्यकस्य venerable grandfather's, गृहात् from house, सिद्ध: like siddha, इन्द्रलोकादिव from the regions of Indra, ययौ went.
data.md: Protected by the forces and the courtiers of his maternal grandfather dear to him like his ownself, the magnanimous Bharata who had his foes removed, taking with him his brother, Śatrughna, departed from the abode (of the king), like Siddha issuing from the regions of Indra.

data.v: स प्राङ्मुखो राजगृहादभिनिर्याय वीर्यवान् । ह्रादिनीं दूरपारां च प्रत्यक्स्रोतस्तरङ्गिणीम् । शतद्रूमतरच्छ्रीमान्नदीमिक्ष्वाकुनन्दनः ।।
data.anv: ﻿﻿﻿﻿ द्युतिमान् the glorious, श्रीमान् the auspicious, इक्ष्वाकुकुलनन्दनः the delight of the Ikshvaku race, सः राघवः that (Bharata) of Raghu dynasty, राजगृहात् from Rajagriha, प्राङ्मुखः eastwards, अभिनिर्याय set out, ततः then, ताम् that, सुदामाम् Sudama, नदीम् river, आवेक्ष्य seen, सन्तीर्य having crossed, ह्लादिनीम् river Hladini, दूरपाराम् very wide, प्रत्यक्स्रोतस्तरङ्गिणीम् flowing westwards crested with waves, शतद्रूम् नदीम् river Satadru (Satlej), अतरत् crossed.
data.md: Issuing from the palace, the blazing Bharata endowed with prowess went in an easterly direction, and seeing before him the river called Sudāmā, crossed it. Then the auspicious descendant of Iksvāku crossed the broad Hrādinſ coursing westwards, as also the river Satadru.

data.v: एलधाने नदीं तीर्त्वा प्राप्य चापरपर्पटान् । शिलामाकुर्वतीं तीर्त्वा आग्नेयं शल्यकर्तनम् ।।
data.anv: ﻿﻿ सत्यसन्ध: one who is always true to his word, शुचिः purehearted, श्रीमान् handsome, सः he (Bharata), ऐलाधाने in Eladhana, नदीम् river, तीर्त्वा crossed, अपरपर्पटान् Aparaparpata region, प्राप्य च having reached, शिलाम् hill, अकुर्वतीम् originating, तीर्त्वा having crossed, आग्नेयम् towards northeast, शल्यकर्षणम् Salyakarsna, शिलावहाम् Silavaha, प्रेक्षमाणः observing, चैत्ररथं वनं प्रति towards a forest called Chaitraratha, महाशैलान् great mountains, अत्ययात् went beyond.
data.md: Then crossing a river at Eladhana,' and coming to Aparaparvata”, he crossed the Sila? and the Akurvatī, and arrived at Agneya* and Salyakarsanam. 1. Some read Eladhani. 2. Some read Apharaparyata. 3. The river, according to some is so named because it transforms the surrounding objects to stone. 4. Some make Agneya an epithet to Salyakarsana, meaning, relating to the south-east.

data.v: सत्यसंधः शुचिः श्रीमान्प्रेक्षमाणः शिलावहाम् । अत्ययात्स महाशैलान्वनं चैत्ररथं प्रति ।।
data.anv: ﻿﻿ सत्यसन्ध: one who is always true to his word, शुचिः purehearted, श्रीमान् handsome, सः he (Bharata), ऐलाधाने in Eladhana, नदीम् river, तीर्त्वा crossed, अपरपर्पटान् Aparaparpata region, प्राप्य च having reached, शिलाम् hill, अकुर्वतीम् originating, तीर्त्वा having crossed, आग्नेयम् towards northeast, शल्यकर्षणम् Salyakarsna, शिलावहाम् Silavaha, प्रेक्षमाणः observing, चैत्ररथं वनं प्रति towards a forest called Chaitraratha, महाशैलान् great mountains, अत्ययात् went beyond.
data.md: And having purified himself and seen Silavaha,' that one of truthful purposes passed the Mahacailas,' and entered the forest of Caitraratha. 1. According to Tirtha, Silavaha is a strcam having Āgneya on one side and Salyakarşaņa on the other. 2. Lit, mighty mountains.

data.v: वेगिनीं च कुलिङ्गाख्यां ह्रादिनीं पर्वतावृताम् । यमुनां प्राप्य संतीर्णो बलमाश्वासयत्तदा ।।
data.anv: ﻿ वेगिनीम् rapidlyflowing, पर्वतावृताम् hillbound, ह्लादिनीम् pleasing to the mind, कुलिङ्गाख्याम् known as Kulinga, यमुनाम् Yamuna, प्राप्य having arrived, सन्तीर्णः he crossed, तदा then, बलम् army, आश्वासयत् made them rest.
data.md: Next crossing the rapid river Kulingā and the Hrādinſ surrounded by hills, as well as the Yamunā, he ordered the forces to halt.

data.v: शीतीकृत्य तु गात्राणि क्लान्तानाश्वास्य वाजिनः । तत्र स्नात्वा च पीत्वा च प्रायादादाय चोदकम् ।।
data.anv: ﻿ गात्राणि their limbs, शीतीकृत्य having cooled, क्लान्तान् weary, वाजिनः horses, आश्वास्य having refreshed, तत्र there, स्नात्वा having bathed, पीत्वा च and drinking, उदकम् water, आदाय took, प्रायात् set out.
data.md: Then cooling the limbs of the fatigued horses (with water) and refreshing them, Bharata himself bathed there and drank of the water; and then resumed the march, furnished with the water. Then the gentle prince by means of an excellent car, like to the wind-god himself, entered the mighty forest inhabited by various races of men.

data.v: राजपुत्रो महारण्यमनभीक्ष्णोपसेवितम् । भद्रो भद्रेण यानेन मारुतः खमिवात्ययात् ।।
data.anv: ﻿ भद्रः the blessed one, राजपुत्रः prince (Bharata), अनभीक्ष्णोपसेवितम् uninhabited, महारण्यम् vast forest, भद्रेण by an excellent, यानेन on chariot, मारुतः windgod, खमिव like sky, अत्ययात् passed through.

data.v: तोरणं दक्षिणार्धेन जम्बूप्रस्थमुपागमत् । वरूथं च ययौ रम्यं ग्रामं दशरथात्मजः ।।
data.anv: ﻿ दशरथात्मजः son of Dasaratha, (Bharata), तोरणम् Torana region, दक्षिणार्थेन southern direction of, जम्बूप्रस्थम् Jambuprastha village, उपागमत् arrived, वरूथम् Varutha village, रम्यं pleasant, ग्रामं च village, ययौ obtained.
data.md: Then proceeding by the south of Toraņa, he came to Jambuprastha. Then Dasaratha's son went to the beautiful village of Varūtha.

data.v: तत्र रम्ये वने वासं कृत्वासौ प्राङ्मुखो ययौ । उद्यानमुज्जिहानायाः प्रियका यत्र पादपाः ।।
data.anv: ﻿ असौ he (Bharata), अत्र there, रम्ये charming, वने forest, वासम् stay, कृत्वा having made, प्राङ्मुखः eastwards, यत्र where, प्रियकाः known as priyaka, पादपाः trees, उज्जिहानायाः Ujjihana, उद्यानम् garden, ययौ reached.
data.md: Having for a while stayed at that romantic wood, he proceeded eastwards, and presented himself at the villa of Ujjihānāya, where abound trees (called) Priyaka.

data.v: सालांस्तु प्रियकान्प्राप्य शीघ्रानास्थाय वाजिनः । अनुज्ञाप्याथ भरतो वाहिनीं त्वरितो ययौ ।।
data.anv: ﻿ भरतः Bharata, सालान् sala trees, प्रियकान् priyaka trees, प्राप्य having reached, शीघ्रान् swiftrunning, वाजिनः horses, आस्थाय having harnessed, अथ thereafter, वाहिनीम् forces, अनुज्ञाप्य having commanded, त्वरितः quickly, ययौ set out.
data.md: Coming to the Priyakas, Bharata speedily yoking the horses, set out without delay, issuing his orders to the forces.

data.v: वासं कृत्वा सर्वतीर्थे तीर्त्वा चोत्तानकां नदीम् । अन्या नदीश्च विविधाः पार्वतीयैस्तुरंगमैः ।।
data.anv: ﻿ सर्वतीर्थे in a place known as Sarvatirtha, वासम् halt, कृत्वा having made, उत्तानिकां नदीम् Uttanika river, विविधाः various, अन्याः others, नदीश्च rivers, पार्वतीयैः born in the mountains, तुरङ्गमैः on horses, तीर्त्वा having crossed, हस्तिपृष्ठकम् on an elephant, आसाद्य ascending, कुटिकाम् Kutika river, अत्यवर्तत crossed over, सः नरव्याघ्रः the tiger among men, लौहित्ये near Lauhitya, कपीवतीम् river Kapivati, ततार crossed.

data.v: हस्तिपृष्ठकमासाद्य कुटिकामत्यवर्तत । ततार च नरव्याघ्रो लौहित्ये स कपीवतीम् । एकसाले स्थाणुमतीं विनते गोमतीं नदीम् ।।
कलिङ्ग नगरे चापि प्राप्य सालवनं तदा । भरतः क्षिप्रमागच्छत्सुपरिश्रान्तवाहनः ।।
data.anv: ﻿ भरतः Bharata, एकसाले at Ekasala village, स्थाणुमतीम् Sthanumati river, विनते at Vinata village, गोमतीं नदीम् Gomati river, सुपरिश्रान्तवाहनः with extremely fatigued horses, तदा then, कलिङ्गनगरे चापि at Kalinganagara, सालवनम् sala forest, प्राप्य having reached, क्षिप्रम् quickly, आगच्छत् came.

data.v: वनं च समतीत्याशु शर्वर्यामरुणोदये । अयोध्यां मनुना राज्ञा निर्मितां स ददर्श ह ।।
data.anv: ﻿ आशु quickly, शर्वर्याम् in the night, वनं च forest also, समतीत्य having passed through, अरुणोदये at sunrise, मनुना राज्ञा by king Manu, निर्मिताम् built, अयोध्याम् Ayodhya, सन्ददर्श ह saw.

data.v: तां पुरीं पुरुषव्याघ्रः सप्तरात्रोषिटः पथि । अयोध्यामग्रतो दृष्ट्वा रथे सारथिमब्रवीत् ।।
data.anv: ﻿ पथि on the way, सप्तरात्रोषितः spent seven nights, पुरुषव्याघ्रः tiger among men, अग्रतः before him, ताम् अयोध्यां पुरीम् that Ayodhya city, दृष्ट्वा having seen, सारथिम् to the charioteer, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

data.v: एषा नातिप्रतीता मे पुण्योद्याना यशस्विनी । अयोध्या दृश्यते दूरात्सारथे पाण्डुमृत्तिका ।।
data.anv: ﻿ सारथे O charioteer, पुण्योद्याना a city of sacred gardens, यशस्विनी of great renown, पाण्डुमृत्तिका with white clay, यज्वभिः those who perform sacrifices, गुणसम्पन्नैः by the virtuous, वेदपारगैः by those well versed in the vedas, भूयिष्ठम् in abundance , ऋद्धैः by the wealthy, ब्राह्मणैः by brahmins, आकीर्णा filled with, राजर्षिपरिपालिता ruled by rajarsis, एषा अयोध्या such Ayodhya, मे to me, नातिप्रतीता not so clearly, दूरात् from a distance, दृश्यते is seen.

data.v: यज्वभिर्गुणसंपन्नैर्ब्राह्मणैर्वेदपारगैः । भूयिष्ठमृद्धैराकीर्णा राजर्षिवरपालिता ।।
data.anv: ﻿﻿﻿ सारथे O charioteer, पुण्योद्याना a city of sacred gardens, यशस्विनी of great renown, पाण्डुमृत्तिका with white clay, यज्वभिः those who perform sacrifices, गुणसम्पन्नैः by the virtuous, वेदपारगैः by those well versed in the vedas, भूयिष्ठम् in abundance , ऋद्धैः by the wealthy, ब्राह्मणैः by brahmins, आकीर्णा filled with, राजर्षिपरिपालिता ruled by rajarsis, एषा अयोध्या such Ayodhya, मे to me, नातिप्रतीता not so clearly, दूरात् from a distance, दृश्यते is seen.

data.v: अयोध्यायां पुराशब्दः श्रूयते तुमुलो महान् । समन्तान्नरनारीणां तमद्य न शृणोम्यहम् ।।
data.anv: ﻿ पुरा earlier, अयोध्यायाम् in Ayodhya, नरनारीणाम् men and women, महान् great, तुमुलः tumultous, शब्दः sound, समन्तात् all over, श्रूयते would hear, अद्य now, तम् that sound, अहम् I, न श्रुणोमि not hear.

data.v: उद्यानानि हि सायाह्ने क्रीडित्वोपरतैर्नरैः । समन्ताद्विप्रधावद्भिः प्रकाशन्ते ममान्यदा ।।
data.anv: ﻿ सायाह्ने early in the morning, क्रीडित्वा sporting, उपरतैः free from desire, समन्तात् all over, परिधावद्भिः strolling, नरैः people, उद्यानानि parks, मम I, अन्यथा no one, प्रकाशन्ते हि looking bright.
data.md: The gardens where from persons having sported in the evening used to rush out (at day break) wear a different aspect now. Forsaken by the pleasure-seekers, the garden appear to weep.

data.v: तान्यद्यानुरुदन्तीव परित्यक्तानि कामिभिः । अरण्यभूतेव पुरी सारथे प्रतिभाति मे ।।
data.anv: ﻿ कामिभिः people full of passion, परित्यक्तानि abandoned, तानि that, अद्य now, अनुरुदन्तीव as if weeping, सारथे O charioteer, पुरी city, अरण्यभूतेव like a forest, मे to me, प्रतिभाति it appears.

data.v: न ह्यत्र यानैर्दृश्यन्ते न गजैर्न च वाजिभिः । निर्यान्तो वाभियान्तो वा नरमुख्या यथापुरम् ।।
data.anv: ﻿﻿ अत्र here, नरमुख्याः important people, यथापुरम् as in the past, यानैः riding, निर्यान्तो वा people going (out of city), अभियान्तो वा or coming in, न दृश्यन्ते हि not seen, गजैः elephants, न not, वाजिभिः च horses also, न not.
data.md: O charioteer, the city appears to me like a wilderness. And I do not as formerly behold the flower of the city leaving or entering her on cars or elephants or horses.

data.v: अनिष्टानि च पापानि पश्यामि विविधानि च । निमित्तान्यमनोज्ञानि तेन सीदति ते मनः ।।
data.anv: ﻿ अनिष्टानि inauspicious symptoms, च also, पापानि sinful sights, पश्यामि see, विविधानि various निमित्तानि passing, अमनोज्ञानि ugly, तेन hence, सीदति filled with grief, मे my मनः mind.
data.md: I witness various evil, unsightly, and unpleasant* omens, and hence my mind is depressed. *The commentator renders amongnani, inauspicious. I venture to differ from him.,

data.v: द्वारेण वैजयन्तेन प्राविशच्छ्रान्तवाहनः । द्वाःस्थैरुत्थाय विजयं पृष्टस्तैः सहितो ययौ ।।
data.anv: ﻿ श्रान्तवाहनः with his horses exhausted, वैजयन्तेन known as Vaijayanta, द्वारेण through gate of, प्राविशत् entered, द्वाःस्थैः by gate keepers, उत्थाय having stood up, विजयम् victory, पृष्टः having been uttered, तैः सहितः along with them, ययौ went.
data.md: And Bharata having his vehicles fatigued, entered by the Vaijayanta* gate, and went on, followed by the gate-keepers, who enquired after his welfare. *Vijayantena. Another meaning is, By the gate resembling that of Indra's palace.

data.v: स त्वनेकाग्रहृदयो द्वाःस्थं प्रत्यर्च्य तं जनम् । सूतमश्वपतेः क्लान्तमब्रवीत्तत्र राघवः ।।
data.anv: ﻿ सः राघवः तु as for the descendant of Raghus, अनेकाग्रहृदयः with a bewildered mind, द्वास्स्थम् to the gatekeepers, तम् those, जनम् people, प्रत्यर्च्य greeting in turn तत्र there, अश्वपतेः to Ashwapati, क्लान्तम् exhausted, सूतम् to the charioteer, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Then courteously telling the warders to desist, he with an agitated heart spoke to the tired charioteer of Aśvapati, “O sinless one, why have I been brought in this haste without any (adequate) reason?" My heart apprehended some evil; and my disposition gives way.

data.v: श्रुता नो यादृशाः पूर्वं नृपतीनां विनाशने । आकारास्तानहं सर्वानिह पश्यामि सारथे ।।
data.anv: ﻿ सारथे O charioteer, नृपतीनाम् kings', विनाशने in destruction, यादृशाः such kind of, पूर्वम् in times past, नः us, श्रुताः have been heard, तान् सर्वान् all those, आकारान् signs, अहम् I, इह पश्यामि I am seeing now.
data.md: O charioteer, I see around me all those signs which I had heard told as occurring on the occasion of he death of monarchs.

data.v: मलिनं चाश्रुपूर्णाक्षं दीनं ध्यानपरं कृशम् । सस्त्री पुंसं च पश्यामि जनमुत्कण्ठितं पुरे ।।
data.anv: ﻿ तथा as before, देवायतनचैत्येषु in temples and in sanctuaries, पक्षिगणाः multitude of birds, दीनाः dispirited, पुरे in the city, सस्त्रीपुंसम् with women and men, जनम् people, उत्कण्ठितम् with choked throats, मलिनम् dull, अश्रुपूर्णाक्षम् eyes filled with tears, दीनम् piteous, ध्यानपरम् absorbed in distressing thoughts, कृशम् emaciated, पश्यामि I see.
data.md: And in temples and Caityas birds and beasts appear dispirited. And in the city I behold men and women pale and woe-begone and emaciated and anxious, with tears filling their eyes.

data.v: इत्येवमुक्त्वा भरतः सूतं तं दीनमानसः । तान्यनिष्टान्ययोध्यायां प्रेक्ष्य राजगृहं ययौ ।।
data.anv: ﻿ भरतः Bharata, अयोध्यायाम् in Ayodhya, तानि these, अनिष्टानि ominous sights, प्रेक्ष्य having seen, दीनमानसः with depressed heart, तं सूतम् that charioteer, इत्येवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having said, राजगृहम् king's palace, ययौ proceeded.
data.md: Having said this to the charioteer, Bharata, beholding these inauspicious sights, entered the palace of the king with a depressed heart.

data.v: तां शून्यशृङ्गाटकवेश्मरथ्यां; रजोरुणद्वारकपाटयन्त्राम् । दृष्ट्वा पुरीमिन्द्रपुरी प्रकाशां; दुःखेन संपूर्णतरो बभूव ।।
data.anv: ﻿ शून्यशृङ्गाटकवेश्मरथ्याम् a place with crossroads, houses, and highways deserted, रजोऽरुणद्वारकवाटयन्त्राम् the fittings (nuts and bolts) on the doors red with dust, इन्द्रपुरप्रकाशाम् once having the lustre of the city of Indra, तां पुरीम् that city, दृष्ट्वा having seen, दुःखेन with grief, सम्पूर्णतरः overwhelmed, बभूव became.
data.md: Beholding the city resembling the city of Indra, with her crossings and houses and roads void of people, and the doors and hinges covered with dust, Bharata was filled with greater grief.

data.v: बहूनि पश्यन्मनसोऽप्रियाणि; यान्यन्न्यदा नास्य पुरे बभूवुः । अवाक्शिरा दीनमना नहृष्टः; पितुर्महात्मा प्रविवेश वेश्म ।।
data.md: And witnessing many unpleasant things which he had never seen during the life of the monarch, that high-souled one entered the mansion of his father, bending his head, depressed in spirits, and with his mind extremely aggrieved.

data.v: अपश्यंस्तु ततस्तत्र पितरं पितुरालये । जगाम भरतो द्रष्टुं मातरं मातुरालये ।।
data.es: Not finding his father in his abode, Bharata went to see his mother in her apartment.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, भरतः Bharata, तत्र there, पितुः father's, आलये abode, पितरम् father, अपश्यन् not seen, मातुः mother's, आलये in the abode, मातरम् mother, द्रष्टुम् to see,  जगाम went.
data.md: Not having seen his father in his father's quarters, Bharata went to his mother's apartment for seeing her. *The text is evidently corrupt. From the sequel it appears that Bharata has not seen the king at that time. That commentator, however, passes over the point in silence, which is to be accounted for by the slovenliness of the way of though characterising the Sanskrit commentators in general. An English commentator would have considered the matter as of very great importance, but his Hindu brother takes it quietly, and passes on with indifference.

data.v: अनुप्राप्तं तु तं दृष्ट्वा कैकेयी प्रोषितं सुतम् । उत्पपात तदा हृष्टा त्यक्त्वा सौवर्णमानसम् ।।
data.es: On seeing her son, who was sent away, presently arriving, the delighted Kaikeyi sprang up from her golden seat.
data.anv: कैकेयी Kaikeyi, प्रोषितम् sent, तं सुतम् that son, अनुप्राप्तम् who had arrived, दृष्ट्वा having seen, तदा then, हृष्टा delighted, सौवर्णम् golden, आसनम् seat, त्वक्त्वा leaving, उत्पपात sprang up.
data.md: On seeing her son before her after his sojourn from home, Kaikeyi delighted, rose up from her golden seat.

data.v: स प्रविश्यैव धर्मात्मा स्वगृहं श्रीविवर्जितम् । भरतः प्रेक्ष्य जग्राह जनन्याश्चरणौ शुभौ ।।
data.es: On entering home the righteous Bharata found it devoid of cheer and touched the auspicious feet of his mother (with reverence).
data.anv: धर्मात्मा a man of righteous conduct, सः भरतः that Bharata, श्रीविवर्जितम् devoid of cheer, स्वगृहम् his home, प्रविश्यैव on entering, जनन्याः mother's, शुभौ auspicious, चरणौ feet, प्रतिजग्राह clasped.
data.md: On entering his own quarter which he found deprived of grace, the virtuous Bharata took hold of his mother's auspicious feet.

data.v: तं मूर्ध्नि समुपाघ्राय परिष्वज्य यशस्विनम् । अङ्के भरतमारोप्य प्रष्टुं समुपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: Kaikeyi, gave her illustrious son Bharata a hug, kissed him on his forehead, made him rest on her lap and began her query.
data.anv: सा she, यशस्विनम् illustrious, तं भरतम् to Bharata, मूर्धनि on his forehead, उपाघ्राय having smelt, परिष्वज्य having hugged, अङ्के on her lap, आरोप्य made him rest, प्रष्टुम् to  question, उपचक्रमे began.
data.md: Then smelling the crown of his head and embracing him and taking that illustrious one on her lap, Kaikeyi addressed him, saying.

data.v: अद्य ते कतिचिद्रात्र्यश्च्युतस्यार्यकवेश्मनः । अपि नाध्वश्रमः शीघ्रं रथेनापततस्तव ।।
data.es: How many nights have you spent (on the way) since you left your noble grandfather's residence? Hasn't the hurried journey (over such a long distance) on the chariot left you exhausted?
data.anv: आर्यकवेश्मनः from your noble grandfather's residence, च्युतस्य having left, ते to you, अद्य by now, कतिचित् how many, रात्र्य: nights, शीघ्रम् swiftly, रथेन on chariot, आपततः while moving, तव to you, अध्वश्रमः weary of journey, अपि न is not there?
data.md: How many days hence did you leave the residence of the revered one? Have you felt any fatigue on the way incident to the car proceeding swiftly?

data.v: आर्यकस्ते सुकुशलो युधाजिन्मातुलस्तव । प्रवासाच्च सुखं पुत्र सर्वं मे वक्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: My son are your revered grandfather and your maternal uncle Yudhajit doing well? Did you have a pleasant time during the sojourn? You should tell me all this.
