data.anv: धर्मवित् knower of righteousness, पुरोहितः the chief priest, समग्राः complete, सर्वाः all, राज्ञः king's, प्रकृतीः ministers, प्रेक्ष्य having seen, भरतम् Bharata, मृदु in a gentle way, इदम् these, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: And seeing all the subjects of the sovereign gathered together, the priest cognizant of virtue softly spoke to Bharata.

data.v: तात राजा दशरथः स्वर्गतो धर्ममाचरन् । धन धान्यवतीं स्फीतां प्रदाय पृथिवीं तव ।।
data.es: O dear child following the righteous path king Dasaratha conferred on you this vast kingdom abounding in wealth and grains before attaining heaven.
data.anv: तात dear child, राजा king, दशरथः Dasaratha, धर्मम् righteousness, आचरन् while following, धनधान्यवतीम् abounding in wealth and grains, स्फीताम् vast, पृथिवीम् kingdom, तव to you, प्रदाय having given, स्वर्गतः attained heaven.
data.md: Your child, leaving to you this prosperous carth abounding in corn and wealth, king Dasaratha having performed his duties, has gone to heaven.

data.v: रामस्तथा सत्यधृतिः सतां धर्ममनुस्मरन् । नाजहात्पितुरादेशं शशी ज्योत्स्नामिवोदितः ।।
data.es: Abiding in truth, remembering the righteous ways of virtuous men just as the rising Moon does not leave its beams, Rama too did not move away from his father's command.
data.anv: तथा and, सत्यधृतिः abiding in truth, रामः Rama, सताम् of the virtuous, धर्मम् righteousness, अनुस्मरन् remembering, उदितः rising, शशी moon, ज्योत्स्नामिव like moon light, पितुः father's, आदेशम् command, नाजहात् did not abandon.
data.md: And Rāma of truthful character observing the virtue of the righteous has not set aside his father's commands. even as the risen moon does not renounce the moonlight.

data.v: पित्रा भ्रात्रा च ते दत्तं राज्यं निहतकण्टकम् । तद्भुङ्क्ष्व मुदितामात्यः क्षिप्रमेवाभिषेचय ।।
data.es: The kingdom free from obstacles has been passed on to you by your father and brother. Get yourself coronated quickly and enjoy it along with your cheerful ministers.
data.anv: पित्रा by your father, भ्रात्रा च by your brother also, निहतकण्टकम् all thorns removed, राज्यम् kingdom, ते to you, दत्तम् has been given, मुदितामात्यः with ministers pleased, तत् that king dom, भुङ्क्ष्व enjoy, क्षिप्रमेव quickly, अभिषेचय be consecrated.
data.md: Loved by the courtiers, do you, having been installed, enjoy this kingdom conferred on you by your father and mother, rid of its thorn. Let princes throned as well as those without thrones, from east, and west, north and south, and also persons ranging the sea, procure countless gems (for presenting them to you.

data.v: उदीच्याश्च प्रतीच्याश्च दाक्षिणात्याश्च केवलाः । कोट्यापरान्ताः सामुद्रा रत्नान्यभिहरन्तु ते ।।
data.es: Let kings from the north, the west, the south, the bordering kingdoms, and the seatraders offer you crores of gems as gifts.
data.anv: उदीच्याः kings from the north, प्रतीच्या श्च from the west, दाक्षिणात्याश्च from the south, केवलाः solely, अपरान्ताः kings of the bordering kingdoms, सामुद्राः seatraders, ते they, कोट्या crores in number, रत्नानि gems, अभिहरन्तु may offer to you as gift.
data.md: Loved by the courtiers, do you, having been installed, enjoy this kingdom conferred on you by your father and mother, rid of its thorn. Let princes throned as well as those without thrones, from east, and west, north and south, and also persons ranging the sea, procure countless gems (for presenting them to you.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा भरतो वाक्यं शोकेनाभिपरिप्लुतः । जगाम मनसा रामं धर्मज्ञो धर्मकाङ्क्षया ।।
data.es: On hearing those words, Bharata who knew his duty was overwhelmed with distress and, resolved to abide by righteousness, reached Rama through his mind (thought of Rama).
data.anv: धर्मज्ञः knower of duty, भरतः Bharata, तत् that, वाक्यम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, शोकेन with distress, अभिपरिप्लुतः overwhelmed, धर्मकाङ्क्षया wishing to abide by  righteousness, रामम् Rama, मनसा with mind, जगाम reached.
data.md: Hearing this speech, Bharata cognizant of virtue, filled with sorrow, mentally repaired to Rāma desirous of reaping merit.

data.v: स बाष्पकलया वाचा कलहंसस्वरो युवा । विललाप सभामध्ये जगर्हे च पुरोहितम् ।।
data.es: Young Bharata with the melodious voice of a swan, choked with tears, lamenting in the assembly, reproached the family priest Vasistha, saying:
data.anv: कलहंसस्वरः voice resembling the melodious cackle of a swan, युवा the young man, सबाष्पकलया voice choked with sobs, वाचा words, सभामध्ये in the midst of the assembly, विललाप lamented, पुरोहितम् to the family priest Vasistha, जगर्हे च reproached.
data.md: Then in words choked with the melodious voice of a swan, lamented and taxed the priest, in the midst of the assembly.

data.v: चरितब्रह्मचर्यस्य विद्या स्नातस्य धीमतः । धर्मे प्रयतमानस्य को राज्यं मद्विधो हरेत् ।।
data.es: Would any man seize this kingdom which rightfully belongs to sagacious Rama, who practises brahmacharya, who is wellversed in all branches of learning and who endeavours to protect righteousness?
data.anv: चरितब्रह्मचर्यस्य one who practised brahmacharaya, विद्यास्नातस्य who is wellversed in all branches of learning, धीमतः of the sagacious, धर्मे in righteousness, प्रयतमानस्य endeavouring, राज्यम् kingdom, मद्विधः a man like me, कः who, हरेत् will seize?
data.md: Who like myself ever deprives one that has led a Brahmacharya mode of life, that is endowed with understanding and performed his bath after having acquired learning, and that is always intent on righteousness, of one's kingdom?

data.v: कथं दशरथाज्जातो भवेद्राज्यापहारकः । राज्यं चाहं च रामस्य धर्मं वक्तुमिहार्हसि ।।
data.es: How can any usurper of the kingdom be born of Dasaratha? Or, how would any progeny of Dasaratha become the usurper of the kingdom? I and the kingdom, both belong to Rama. You should tell the truth about this.
data.anv: दशरथात् from Dasaratha, जातः born, राज्यापहारकः usurper of the kingdom, कथम् भवेत् how will he become?, राज्यं च kingdom, अहं च I also, रामस्य belong to Rama, इह in this matter, धर्मम् truth, वक्तुम् to tell, अर्हसि it behoves you.
data.md: How begot of Dasaratha, shall I deprive Rāma of his kingdom. It behove you to speak righteousness before this assembly.

data.v: ज्येष्ठः श्रेष्ठश्च धर्मात्मा दिलीपनहुषोपमः । लब्धुमर्हति काकुत्स्थो राज्यं दशरथो यथा ।।
data.es: The eldest, eminent and righteous Rama, the scion of the Kakutstha dynasty, who is comparable to Dilipa and Nahusha deserves to inherit this kingdom just as Dasaratha did.
data.anv: ज्येष्ठः eldest, श्रेष्ठः च and also eminent, धर्मात्मा righteous one, दिलीपनहुषोपमः comparable to Dilipa and Nahusha, काकुत्स्थ Rama of Kakutstha dynasty, दशरथो यथा like Dasaratha, राज्यम् kingdom, लब्धुम् to inherit, अर्हति deserves.
data.md: First-born, and foremost in merit, righteoussouled, and comparable to Dilipa and Nahuşa, Kākutstha deserves the kingdom, just as Dasaratha did.

data.v: अनार्यजुष्टमस्वर्ग्यं कुर्यां पापमहं यदि । इक्ष्वाकूणामहं लोके भवेयं कुलपांसनः ।।
data.es: If I commit this evil act followed by wretched people which would not lead any one to heaven, I shall only be bringing disgrace to the kings of the Ikshvaku dynasty.
data.anv: अहम् I, अनार्यजुष्टम् followed by wretched ones, अस्वर्ग्यम् not leading to heaven, पापम् sin, कुर्यां यदि if I do, लोके in this world, इक्ष्वाकूणाम् to the Ikshvaku kings, कुलपांसनः one who is a disgrace to the family, भवेयम् I shall become.
data.md: If I commit myself to this sin dishonourable and calculated to bring me to perdition, I shall in this world bring disgrace on the race of the Ikşvākus.

data.v: यद्धि मात्रा कृतं पापं नाहं तदभिरोचये । इहस्थो वनदुर्गस्थं नमस्यामि कृताञ्जलिः ।।
data.es: I will never accept the evil deed committed by my mother. From here itself I shall pay obeisance with folded palms to my brother who dwells in the impenetrable forest.
data.anv: मात्रा by my mother, यत् which, पापम् sin, कृतम् was committed, तत् अपि that one also, अहम् I, न रोचये हि do not accept, इहस्थः from here, वनदुर्गस्थम् one staying in impenetrable forest, कृताञ्जलिः with folded palms, नमस्यामि pay obeisance.
data.md: I do not at all relish the sin that has been committed by mother. Remaining here with joined hands I bow down to Rāma gone to the forest fastness.

data.v: राममेवानुगच्छामि स राजा द्विपदां वरः । त्रयाणामपि लोकानां राघवो राज्यमर्हति ।।
data.es: I shall follow Rama the best among men. He alone and no one else deserves to rule over the kingdom of the three worlds.
data.anv: राममेव Rama alone, अनुगच्छामि I will follow, द्विपदां वरः best among men, सः he alone, राजा is the king, राघवः Rama, त्रयाणां लोकानाम् of the three worlds', राज्यमपि kingdom, अर्हति deserves.
data.md: I will follow Rāma. That best of men is the king. Rāghava deserves the dominion of the three worlds themselves.

data.v: तद्वाक्यं धर्मसंयुक्तं श्रुत्वा सर्वे सभासदः । हर्षान्मुमुचुरश्रूणि रामे निहितचेतसः ।।
data.es: Hearing the words of Bharata full of righteousness, all the men assembled there shed tears of joy, thinking of Rama.
data.anv: सर्वे all, सभासदः members of the assembly, धर्मसंयुक्तम् bound by righteousness, तद्वाक्यम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, रामे on Rama, निहितचेतसः fixing their thoughts, हर्षात् out of joy, अश्रूणि tears, मुमुचुः shed.
data.md: Hearing words informed with those righteousness, the entire assembly with their minds intent upon Rāma, from joy shed tears.

data.v: यदि त्वार्यं न शक्ष्यामि विनिवर्तयितुं वनात् । वने तत्रैव वत्स्यामि यथार्यो लक्ष्मणस्तथा ।।
data.es: If I am not able to bring back my noble brother (Rama) from the forest, I shall also dwell there like my noble brother Lakshmana.
data.anv: आर्यम् my noble brother, वनात् from the forest, विनिवर्तयितुम् to bring back, न शक्ष्यामि यदि if I am not able, आर्यः noble brother, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, यथा as, तथा so, तत्र there, वने एव in the forest itself, वत्स्यामि I shall dwell.
data.md: If I fail to bring back the noble one from the forest, I will like the exalted Lakşmaņa remain even in that forest.

data.v: सर्वोपायं तु वर्तिष्ये विनिवर्तयितुं बलात् । समक्षमार्य मिश्राणां साधूनां गुणवर्तिनाम् ।।
data.es: I shall employ all possible means to bring him back and join you who are respectable, virtuous and pious.
data.anv: गुणवर्तिनाम् of the virtuous, साधूनाम् of the pious, आर्यमिश्राणाम् noble ones, समक्षम् in the  presence, बलात् with all force, विनिवर्तयितुम् to bring back, सर्वोपायम् by all means, वर्तिष्ये I shall attempt.
data.md: I will in presence of this mixed assembly of pious and honourable persons following every perfection, adopt every expedient to bring back Rāma.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा तु धर्मात्मा भरतो भ्रातृवत्सलः । समीपस्थमुवाचेदं सुमन्त्रं मन्त्रकोविदम् ।।
data.es: Righteous Bharata who was full of devotion towards his brother having uttered thus, addressed the skilful counsellor Sumantra standing nearby:
data.anv: धर्मात्मा righteous one, भ्रातृवत्सलः a devoted brother, भरतः Bharata, एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा तु having uttered, समीपस्थम् standing nearby, मन्त्रकोविदम् skilled  in counselling, सुमन्त्रम् to Sumantra, इदम् these words, उवाच said.
data.md: Having said this, the virtuous Bharata attached to his brother spoke to Sumantra skilled in counsel, who was by, saying.

data.v: तूर्णमुत्थाय गच्छ त्वं सुमन्त्र मम शासनात् । यात्रामाज्ञापय क्षिप्रं बलं चैव समानय ।।
data.es: O Sumantra quickly rise and go. On my authority, order the expedition and let the army be marshalled at once.
data.anv: सुमन्त्र Sumantra, मम my, शासनात् on command, तूर्णम् quickly, उत्थाय after rising, गच्छ त्वं go, क्षिप्रम् speedily, यात्राम् expedition, आज्ञापय order, बलं चैव army also, समानय bring.
data.md: Up, and go, O Sumantra at my command. Do you make known this journey and bring the forces.

data.v: एवमुक्तः सुमन्त्रस्तु भरतेन महात्मना । प्रहृष्टः सोऽदिशत्सर्वं यथा संदिष्टमिष्टवत् ।।
data.es: On hearing the words of the magnanimous Bharata, Sumantra was delighted and as instructed, ordered everything as if he was anxious to do it himself.
data.anv: महात्मना magnanimous, भरतेन by Bharata, एवम् in that way, उक्तः having been instructed, सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, हृष्टः in delight, तत् then, सर्वम् entirely, यथासन्दिष्टम् as has been commanded, इष्टवत् as if he longed, आदिशत् ordered.
data.md: Thus accosted by the magnanimous Bharata, Sumantra with a cheerful heart issued orders concerning everything desirable as he was ordered.

data.v: ताः प्रहृष्टाः प्रकृतयो बलाध्यक्षा बलस्य च । श्रुत्वा यात्रां समाज्ञप्तां राघवस्य निवर्तने ।।
data.es: Having come to know that orders were issued to send the army on an expedition to bring back Rama, the subjects and the army chiefs were delighted.
data.anv: राघवस्य Rama's, निवर्तने return, समाज्ञप्ताम् ordered, बलस्य च army's, यात्राम् the expedition, श्रुत्वा having heard, ताः those, प्रकृतयः subjects, बलाध्यक्षाः chiefs of army, प्रहृष्टाः were delighted.
data.md: Hearing that the army had been ordered to march forth for bringing back Rāma, the subjects as well as the generals of the forces became exceedingly delighted.

data.v: ततो योधाङ्गनाः सर्वा भर्तॄन्सर्वान्गृहेगृहे । यात्रा गमनमाज्ञाय त्वरयन्ति स्म हर्षिताः ।।
data.es: Then, the wives of the soldiers having come to know of the expedition were all delighted and in every household hastened up their husbands.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, गृहेगृहे in every house, सर्वाः all, योधाङ्गनाः wives of soldiers, यात्रागमनम् for expedition, आज्ञाय having come to know, हर्षिताः gladly, सर्वान् all, भर्त्रून् their husbands, त्वरयन्ति स्म hastened   them up.
data.md: Hearing of the journey to Rāma, for bringing him back the wives of the soldiers apprised of the order that had been issued to the latter, being exceedingly delighted, hurried on.

data.v: ते हयैर्गोरथैः शीघ्रैः स्यन्दनैश्च मनोजवैः । सह योधैर्बलाध्यक्षा बलं सर्वमचोदयन् ।।
data.es: Those chiefs of the army urged the soldiers, horses, fastmoving bullockcarts and swift chariots (to move on).
data.anv: ते those, बलाध्यक्षाः chiefs of army, हयैः horses, शीघ्रैः fastmoving, गोरथैः bullock carts, महाजवैः of swift, स्यन्दनैश्च by chariots, योधैश्च सह with soldiers, सर्वम् all, बलम् army, अचोदयन् urged.
data.md: And the generals expeditiously despatched their forces with warriors by means of horses and cares and cars fleet as the mind.

data.v: सज्जं तु तद्बलं दृष्ट्वा भरतो गुरुसंनिधौ । रथं मे त्वरयस्वेति सुमन्त्रं पार्श्वतोऽब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: When Bharata saw that the army was ready, he instructed Sumantra who was standing by the side of the preceptor to quickly prepare his chariot.
data.anv: भरतः Bharata, सज्जम् ready, तत् बलम् that army, दृष्ट्वा having seen, गुरुसन्निधौ in the presence of  the preceptor (Vasistha), पार्श्वतः on his side, सुमन्त्रम् to Sumantra, मे my, रथम् chariot, त्वरयस्व quickly prepare, इति like this, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Seeing those force marshalled, Bharata staying near his preceptor, said to Sumantra who was at his side, “Do you speedily bring my car”

data.v: भरतस्य तु तस्याज्ञां प्रतिगृह्य प्रहर्षितः । रथं गृहीत्वा प्रययौ युक्तं परमवाजिभिः ।।
data.es: He (Sumantra) received the command of Bharata in great delight and set out with a chariot harnessed with excellent horses.
data.anv: तस्य भरतस्य that Bharata's, आज्ञाम् command, प्रतिगृह्य having received, हर्षितः delighted, परमवाजिभिः with excellent horses, युक्तम् harnessed, रथम् chariot, गृहीत्वा grasping, प्रययौ  went.
data.md: In obedience to the mandate of Bharata, Sumantra exceedingly rejoiced, appeared with the car yoked with superb steeds.

data.v: स राघवः सत्यधृतिः प्रतापवा;न्ब्रुवन्सुयुक्तं दृढसत्यविक्रमः । गुरुं महारण्यगतं यशस्विनं; प्रसादयिष्यन्भरतोऽब्रवीत्तदा ।।
data.es: Bharata, a descendant of the Raghu race, firm in truth, one whose valour comes out of unswerving truth, speaking judiciously said this to propitiate his esteemed brother who was in the dense forest:
data.anv: तदा then, राघवः Bharata, सत्यधृतिः firm in truth, प्रतापवान् valiant, दृढसत्यविक्रमः whose valour comes out of unshakable truth, सुयुक्तम् judiciously, ब्रुवन् speaking, भरतः Bharata, महारण्यगतम् gone to the great forest, यशस्विनम् illustrious, गुरुम् esteemed brother, प्रसादयिष्यन् to propitiate, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Then that powerful descendant of Raghu of truthful character, and having unswerving truth for his prowess, Bharata, having said what was fit, spoke words calculated to gladden his illustrious superior gone to the mighty forest.

data.v: तूर्णं समुत्थाय सुमन्त्र गच्छ; बलस्य योगाय बलप्रधानान् । आनेतुमिच्छामि हि तं वनस्थं; प्रसाद्य रामं जगतो हिताय ।।
data.es: O Sumantra, arise, go at once to the leaders of the army and ask them to assemble the troops. I shall propifiate Rama who is in the deep forest and bring him back for the welfare of the world.
data.anv: सुमन्त्र Sumantra, समुत्थाय arise, बलस्य the army's, योगाय to assemble, बलप्रधानान् to  leaders of the army, तूर्णम् quickly, गच्छ go, वनस्थम् who is in the forest, तम् रामम् that Rama, प्रसाद्य having appeased, जगतः world's, हिताय welfare, आनेतुम् to bring, इच्छामि हि am wishing.
data.md: O Sumantra, arise you speedily and, your desire fully attained, go by my command, and tell the chiefs of the army, and our principal adherents to array the forces.

data.v: स सूतपुत्रो भरतेन सम्य;गाज्ञापितः संपरिपूर्णकामः । शशास सर्वान्प्रकृतिप्रधाना;न्बलस्य मुख्यांश्च सुहृज्जनं च ।।
data.es: The charioteer categorically commanded by Bharata, his desire fulfilled, communicated the royal mandate to all important subjects, chiefs of army and friends.
data.anv: भरतेन by Bharata, सम्यक् distinctly, आज्ञापितः having been ordered, सम्परिपूर्णकामः with his desire fulfilled, सः that, सूतपुत्रः charioteer, सर्वान् all, प्रकृतिप्रधानान् to important subjects, बलस्य army's, मुख्यांश्च chiefs, सुहृज्जनं च to friends, शशास ordered.

data.v: ततः समुत्थाय कुले कुले ते; राजन्यवैश्या वृषलाश्च विप्राः । अयूयुजन्नुष्ट्ररथान्खरांश्च; नागान्हयांश्चैव कुलप्रसूतान् ।।
data.es: Thereafter, men from every household, kshatriyas, vaisyas, sudras and brahmins came out and harnessed their chariots to the camels and asses, elephants and horses of high pedigree.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे द्व्यशीतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eightysecond sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: ततः there after, कुले कुले in every household, ते those, राजन्यवैश्याः kshatriyas, vaisyas वृषलाश्च sudras, विप्राः brahmins, समुत्थाय after rising up, उष्ट्रखरान् camels and asses, रथांश्च chariots, कुलप्रसूतान् born in a good race, नागान् elephants, हयांश्चैव horses as well, अयूयुजन् harnessed.
data.md: Thereat rising, Rājanyas and Vaisyas, and Vņşalas; and Vipras in every house began to yoke camels and cars and mules and elephants and excellent steeds.

data.v: ततः समुत्थितः काल्यमास्थाय स्यन्दनोत्तमम् । प्रययौ भरतः शीघ्रं रामदर्शनकाङ्क्षया ।।
data.es: Getting up at dawn, Bharata boarded his excellent chariot and set forth swiftly, longing to see Rama.
data.anv: ततः then, भरतः Bharata, काल्यम् at dawn, समुत्थितः risen, स्यन्दनोत्तमम् best chariot, आस्थाय having boarded, रामदर्शनकाङ्क्षया longing to see Rama, शीघ्रम् swiftly, प्रययौ set forth.
data.md: Rising with the morrow, Bharata anxious to behold Rāma, speedily set out ascending an excellent car.

data.v: अग्रतः प्रययुस्तस्य सर्वे मन्त्रिपुरोधसः । अधिरुह्य हयैर्युक्तान्रथान्सूर्यरथोपमान् ।।
data.es: All the ministers and priests went ahead of Bharata mounting their chariots, harnessed with horses and resembling the chariot of the Sun god.
data.anv: सर्वे all, मन्त्रिपुरोधस: ministers and priests, हयैः horses, युक्तान् harnessed, सूर्यरथोपमान्  resembling the chariot of the Sun, रथान् chariots, अधिरुह्य having mounted, तस्य his, अग्रतः in front of, प्रययुः went.
data.md: Before him went the councillors and priests, ascending cars resembling that of the Sun yoked with steeds.

data.v: नवनागसहस्राणि कल्पितानि यथाविधि । अन्वयुर्भरतं यान्तमिक्ष्वाकु कुलनन्दनम् ।।
data.es: As per tradition, nine thousand elephants were arranged to follow Bharata, delight of the race of the Ikshvakus as he set out.
data.anv: यथाविधि as per tradition, कल्पितानि arranged, नवनागसहस्राणि nine thousand elephants, यान्तम् while going, इक्ष्वाकुकुलनन्दनम् the delight of the house of Ikshvakus, भरतम् Bharata, अन्वयुः followed.
data.md: And a thousand elephants duly consecrated went in the wake of that son of the Ikşvāku line as he was proceeding.

data.v: षष्ठी रथसहस्राणि धन्विनो विविधायुधाः । अन्वयुर्भरतं यान्तं राजपुत्रं यशस्विनम् ।।
data.es: Sixty thousands chariots and many archers holding weapons of every kind followed the illustrious prince Bharata as he went.
data.anv: षष्टि: sixty, रथसहस्राणि thousands of chariots, विविधायुधा: men with weapons of every kind, धन्विनः archers, यान्तम् while going, यशस्विनम् illustrious, राजपुत्रम् king's son, भरतम् Bharata, अन्वयुः followed.
data.md: And six thousand with bow-men furnished with various weapons followed the illustrious prince Bharata as he was proceeding.

data.v: शतं सहस्राण्यश्वानां समारूढानि राघवम् । अन्वयुर्भरतं यान्तं राजपुत्रं यशस्विनम् ।।
data.es: Sixty thousands chariots and many archers holding weapons of every kind followed the illustrious prince Bharata as he went.
data.anv: राघवम् born in the Raghu race (Bharata), सत्यसन्धम् adhering to truth, जितेन्द्रियम् one who conquered passions, यान्तम् while going, भरतम् Bharata, समारूढानि mounted by riders, अश्वानाम् of horses, शतम् hundred, सहस्राणि thousand, अन्वयुः followed.
data.md: And six thousand with bow-men furnished with various weapons followed the illustrious prince Bharata as he was proceeding.

data.v: कैकेयी च सुमित्रा च कौसल्या च यशस्विनी । रामानयनसंहृष्टा ययुर्यानेन भास्वता ।।
data.es: Kaikeyi, Sumitra as well as the illustrious Kausalya travelled by a resplendent chariot, delighted with the thought of bringing Rama back.
data.anv: कैकेयी च Kaikeyi as well as, सुमित्रा च Sumitra also, यशस्विनी illustrious, कौसल्या च Kausalya also, रामानयनसंहृष्टाः delighted at the thought of bringing Rama back, भास्वता by a resplendent, यानेन by the chariot, ययुः went.
data.md: Kaikeyi and Sumitrā and the highly famous Kausalyā rejoicing at the prospect of the bringing of Rāma, went in an effulgent car. cars

data.v: प्रयाताश्चार्यसंघाता रामं द्रष्टुं सलक्ष्मणम् । तस्यैव च कथाश्चित्राः कुर्वाणा हृष्टमानसाः ।।
data.es: Venerable people in groups, narrating various accomplishments of Rama and eager to see him with Lakshmana, proceeded in a delightful mood.
data.anv: आर्यसङ्घाताश्च venerable groups of people, हृष्टमानसाः delighted in their hearts, चित्राः  various, तस्यैव Rama's only, कथाः accomplishments, कुर्वाणाः doing, सलक्ष्मणम् with Lakshmana, रामम् Rama, द्रष्टुम् to see, प्रयाताः went forth.
data.md: And the honourable persons (belonging to all the three orders) went with the object of beholding Rāma in company with Lakşmaņa.

data.v: मेघश्यामं महाबाहुं स्थिरसत्त्वं दृढव्रतम् । कदा द्रक्ष्यामहे रामं जगतः शोकनाशनम् ।।
data.es: When shall we see that mightyarmed Rama of darkblue complexion like the raincloud, firm in strength and steadfast in vows and the destroyer of the sorrows of this world?
data.anv: मेघश्यामम् darkblue like raincloud, महाबाहुम् the mightyarmed, स्थिरसत्त्वम् firm in strength, दृढव्रतम् steadfast in vows, जगतः of this world, शोकनाशनम् destroyer of sorrow, रामम् Rama, कदा when, द्रक्ष्यामहे shall see?
data.md: They with glad hearts variously conversed with each other, “When shall we see the mighty armed Rāma sable like to a cloud, of steady strength, firm in vows, the remover of the world's grief?

data.v: दृष्ट एव हि नः शोकमपनेष्यति राघवः । तमः सर्वस्य लोकस्य समुद्यन्निव भास्करः ।।
data.es: At his sight alone our sorrows will be dispelled, the way the darkness of the entire world is dispelled by the rising Sun.
data.anv: समुद्यन् rising, भास्करः Sun, सर्वस्य of the entire, लोकस्य world's, तमः इव like darkness, राघवः Rama, दृष्ट एव at his sight alone, नः our, शोकम् sorrow, अपनेष्यति will dispel.
data.md: As soon as we shall see him, Rāghava will remove our sorrow; even as the Sun arising dispels the darkness of the entire world.

data.v: इत्येवं कथयन्तस्ते संप्रहृष्टाः कथाः शुभाः । परिष्वजानाश्चान्योन्यं ययुर्नागरिकास्तदा ।।
data.es: The inhabitants of the town proceeded joyfully, narrating Rama's delightful achievements on their way by embracing one another.
data.anv: ते they, नागरिकाः जनाः inhabitants of the city, इत्येवम् in this way, शुभाः delightful, कथाः achievements, कथयन्तः narrating, सम्प्रहृष्टाः joyfully, अन्योन्यम् mutually, परिष्वजानाश्च embracing also, ययुः proceeded.
data.md: Thus cheerfully carrying on an auspicious talk, the citizens embracing each other went along.

data.v: ये च तत्रापरे सर्वे संमता ये च नैगमाः । रामं प्रति ययुर्हृष्टाः सर्वाः प्रकृतयस्तदा ।।
data.es: Respectable city folks, like traders and other subjects went along in great delight towards Rama.
data.anv: तत्र there, ये च अपरे all the others, सम्मताः respectable, ये च नैगमाः those merchants, तथा similarly, सर्वाः all, प्रकृतयः subjects, हृष्टाः delighted, रामम् प्रति to Rama, ययुः went along.
data.md: And all other, and the foremost merchants as well as all the principal classes, joyfully went in quest of Rāma.

data.v: मणि काराश्च ये केचित्कुम्भकाराश्च शोभनाः । सूत्रकर्मकृतश्चैव ये च शस्त्रोपजीविनः ।।
मायूरकाः क्राकचिका रोचका वेधकास्तथा । दन्तकाराः सुधाकारास्तथा गन्धोपजीविनः ।।
सुवर्णकाराः प्रख्यातास्तथा कम्बलधावकाः । स्नापकाच्छादका वैद्या धूपकाः शौण्डिकास्तथा ।।
रजकास्तुन्नवायाश्च ग्रामघोषमहत्तराः । शैलूषाश्च सह स्त्रीभिर्यान्ति कैवर्तकास्तथा ।।
समाहिता वेदविदो ब्राह्मणा वृत्तसंमताः । गोरथैर्भरतं यान्तमनुजग्मुः सहस्रशः ।।
data.es: Brahmins learned in the Vedas and renowned for their virtuous conduct followed Bharta in their thousands on bullock carts with composed minds.
data.anv: समाहिताः with composed mind, वृत्तसम्मताः renowned for their virtuous conduct, वेदविदः learned in the Vedas, सहस्रशः in thousands, ब्राह्मणाः brahmins, यान्तम् departing, भरतम् Bharata, गोरथैः on bullock carts, अनुजग्मुः followed.

data.v: सुवेषाः शुद्धवसनास्ताम्रमृष्टानुलेपनाः । सर्वे ते विविधैर्यानैः शनैर्भरतमन्वयुः ।।
data.es: Dressed well in clean clothes and anointed with pure red sandalpaste, they all slowly followed Bharata, mounting on various vehicles.
data.anv: सुवेषाः welldressed, शुद्धवसनाः in clean clothing, ताम्रमृष्टानुलेपनाः anointed with pure red sandalpaste, ते सर्वे all those, विविधैः various, यानैः on vehicles, शनैः slowly, भरतम् Bharata, अन्वयुः followed.

data.v: प्रहृष्टमुदिता सेना सान्वयात्कैकयीसुतम् । व्यवतिष्ठत सा सेना भरतस्यानुयायिनी ।।
data.es: The army, overwhelmed with joy and cheer followed the devoted brother Bharata who had set out to bring back Rama.
data.anv: प्रहृष्टमुदिता overwhelmed with joy and cheer, सा सेना that army, भ्रातुः brother's, आनयने to bring back, यान्तम् set out, कैकयीसुतम् Kaikeyi's son (Bharata), भ्रातृवत्सलम् to his brother, Rama, भरतम् Bharata, अन्वयात् followed.
data.md: All these gradually followed Bharata by means of excellent vehicles. And the army delighted and in high spirits went in the wake of Kaikeyi's son attached to his brother, going to bring back his brother.

data.v: निरीक्ष्यानुगतां सेनां तां च गङ्गां शिवोदकाम् । भरतः सचिवान्सर्वानब्रवीद्वाक्यकोविदः ।।
data.es: As he beheld the army following him and the river Ganga of sacred waters in front of him, Bharata who was proficient in speech said to his ministers:
data.anv: अनुगताम् following, सेनाम् army, शिवोदकाम् having sacred waters, तां गङ्गां च that river Ganga, निरीक्षय having gazed at, वाक्यकोविदः proficient in speech, भरतः Bharata, सर्वान् all, सचिवान् to ministers, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Having come to the banks of the Gangā graced with Cakravākas, the army which was following Bharata halted. Seeing the army inactive as well as the Gangā of sacred waters, Bharata versed in speech spoke to the courtiers.

data.v: निवेशयत मे सैन्यमभिप्रायेण सर्वशः । विश्रान्तः प्रतरिष्यामः श्व इदानीं महानदीम् ।।
data.es: You may, according to your convenience, halt the army anywhere here and, after taking rest (for the night), we shall cross the river Ganga tomorrow.
data.anv: मे सैन्यम् my army, अभिप्रायेण according to their desires, सर्वतः all over, निवेशयत you may halt, इदानीम् now, विश्रान्ताः having taken rest, नदीम् river, श्वः tomorrow, प्रतरिष्यामः will cross.
data.md: Do you communicating to all our intentions, encamp the army. Having been fatigued, we shall cross the ocean-going Gangā on the morrow.

data.v: दातुं च तावदिच्छामि स्वर्गतस्य महीपतेः । और्ध्वदेह निमित्तार्थमवतीर्योदकं नदीम् ।।
data.es: Meanwhile, I shall get into this river and offer libations with water to the departed king for the good of his life in the other world.
data.anv: नदीम् river, अवतीर्य descending, स्वर्गतस्य to the departed, महीपतेः king's, और्ध्वदेहनिमित्तार्थम् for the good of his life in the other world, उदकम् libations with water, दातुम् च to offer, इच्छामि तावत् I wish.
data.md: Having crossed the stream, I am anxious to offer its water to the monarch, who has gone to heaven in behalf of his spiritual body.

data.v: तस्यैवं ब्रुवतोऽमात्यास्तथेत्युक्त्वा समाहिताः । न्यवेशयंस्तांश्छन्देन स्वेन स्वेन पृथक्पृथक् ।।
data.es: While he (Bharata's) was speaking this way, all the ministers assented by saying 'Be it so' and made arrangement for their troops to rest separately according to their pleasure.
data.anv: तस्य his (Bharata's), एवम् in this way, ब्रुवतः while saying, अमात्याः ministers, तथेति 'be it so', उक्त्वा  saying, समाहिताः with composed minds, ताम् they, स्वेन स्वेन each of their, छन्देन with pleasure, पृथक् पृथक् separately न्यवेशयन् rested.
data.md: When he had said this, the courtiers with collected minds saying, “Be it so,” disposed their forces, each according to his wish.

data.v: निवेश्य गङ्गामनु तां महानदीं; चमूं विधानैः परिबर्ह शोभिनीम् । उवास रामस्य तदा महात्मनो; विचिन्तयानो भरतो निवर्तनम् ।।
data.es: The army encamped by Bharata looked splendid with royal insigaia. After making necessary arrangements for the army on the bank of the mighty river Ganga and pondering over the means of bringing back the magnanimous Rama, Bharata stayed.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे त्र्यशीतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eightythird sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: भरतः Bharata, परिबर्हशोभिनीम् looking splendid with their royal insignia, चमूम् army, ताम् that, महानदीम् mighty river, गङ्गाम् अनु following Ganga, विधानैः with adequate arrangements, निवेश्य encamping, तदा then, महात्मनः magnanimous, रामस्य Rama's, निवर्तनम् to bring back, विचिन्तयानः pondering, उवास stayed.
data.md: Having on the mighty stream, Gangā, quartered his forces furnished with all appliances for the journey, Bharata remained there, revolving the means of making the high-souled Rāma turn back.

data.v: ततो निविष्टां ध्वजिनीं गङ्गामन्वाश्रितां नदीम् । निषादराजो दृष्ट्वैव ज्ञातीन्संत्वरितोऽब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Guha, king of the nishadas, observed the bannered army encamped all along the bank of the river Ganga, hurried off and said to his kinsmen:
data.anv: ततः then, निषादराजः king of the nishadas (Guha), गङ्गां नदीम् river Ganga, अन्वाश्रिताम् all along the bank, निविष्टाम् encamped, ध्वजिनीम् the bannered army, दृष्ट्वैव on seeing, सन्त्वरितः hurriedly, ज्ञातीन् to relatives, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Seeing the forces with banners flying quartered on the banks of the river Gangā, and engaged in carious occupations, the lord of the Nisadas, Guha, said to his relatives ranged around.

data.v: महतीयमतः सेना सागराभा प्रदृश्यते । नास्यान्तमवगच्छामि मनसापि विचिन्तयन् ।।
data.es: Here is an army as vast as the ocean, and I am unable to comprehend its magnitude even mentally.
data.anv: इतः this side, सागराभा looking like an ocean, इयम् this, महती vast, सेना army, प्रदृश्यते appearing, मनसा in my mind, विचिन्तयन्नपि even by thinking, अस्याः this army's, अन्तम्  end, नाधिगच्छामि I am not able to reach.
data.md: This mighty host here appears like an ocean. I do not find its end even by thinking of it in my mind.

data.v: स एष हि महाकायः कोविदारध्वजो रथे । बन्धयिष्यति वा दाशानथ वास्मान्वधिष्यति ।।
अथ दाशरथिं रामं पित्रा राज्याद्विवासितम् । भरतः कैकेयीपुत्रो हन्तुं समधिगच्छति ।।
data.es: Could it be that Bharata, son of Kaikeyi, has come here to bind us with the cords or to slay us? Or is he marching forward with the intention of taking possession of a prosperous, rare kingdom by slaying Rama who has been banished by his father:
data.anv: कैकयीपुत्रः Kaikeyi's son, भरतः Bharata, दाशान् fishermen, बन्धयिष्यति is going to bind us  with cords?, अथवा or, अस्मान् us, वधिष्यति will slay?, अथ or, तस्य राज्ञः that king's, सम्पन्नाम्  prosperous, सुदुर्लभाम् not easily obtainable, श्रियम् wealth, अन्विच्छन् wishing, पित्रा by father, राज्यात् from kingdom, विवासितम् banished, दाशरथिम् son of Dasaratha, रामम् to Rama, हन्तुम् to slay, समधिगच्छति is he marching forward?

data.v: भर्ता चैव सखा चैव रामो दाशरथिर्मम । तस्यार्थकामाः संनद्धा गङ्गानूपेऽत्र तिष्ठत ।।
data.es: Rama, son of Dasaratha, is not only my master but also my friend. Therefore, to safeguard his interests remain stationed here on the bank of the river Ganga.
data.anv: दाशरथिः son of Dasaratha, रामः Rama, मम to me, भर्ता चैव is my master, सखाचैव friend too, तस्य his, अर्थकामाः wealth and desires, गङ्गाऽनूपे on the bank of river Ganga, प्रतिष्ठत   remain stationed.
data.md: Rāma the son of Daśaratha is both my maintainer and friend. Do you in his interests, donning on your mail, wait on the banks of the river.

data.v: तिष्ठन्तु सर्वदाशाश्च गङ्गामन्वाश्रिता नदीम् । बलयुक्ता नदीरक्षा मांसमूलफलाशनाः ।।
data.es: Let all the fishermen, who live on meat, roots and fruits and protect the river, stay here with the troops by taking up positions along the banks of the river Ganga.
data.anv: मांसमूलफलाशनाः living on meat, roots and fruits, नदीरक्षाः protectors of the river, सर्वे all, दाशाश्च fishermen, बलयुक्ताः with your troops, गङ्गां नदीम् river Ganga, अन्वाश्रिताः following  and taking up your positions, तिष्ठन्तु stay here.
data.md: And stationed on the river Gangā, let my powerful retainers subsisting on fruits and roots and meat, be prepared for opposing Bharata's passages over the river.

data.v: नावां शतानां पञ्चानां कैवर्तानां शतं शतम् । संनद्धानां तथा यूनां तिष्ठन्त्वत्यभ्यचोदयत् ।।
data.es: Let five hundred boats, each manned by a hundred young fishermen fully equipped, be in readiness he exhorted them.
data.anv: पञ्चानाम् five, शतानाम् hundred, नावाम् boats, सन्नद्धानाम् fully equipped, तथा also, यूनाम् youths, कैवर्तानाम् fishermen, शतं शतम् one hundred in each, तिष्ठन्तु stand, इति like that, अभ्यचोदयत् exhorted.
data.md: And let hundreds upon hundreds of Kaivarta youths accoutred in mail remain in each of five hundred barks., Guha issued this order.

data.v: यदा तुष्टस्तु भरतो रामस्येह भविष्यति । सेयं स्वस्तिमयी सेना गङ्गामद्य तरिष्यति ।।
data.es: Should it happen that Bharata is not illdisposed toward Rama, the army will safe cross the river Ganga today itself.
data.anv: भरतः Bharata, इह here, रामस्य toward Rama, अदुष्टः not illdisposed, यदा तु भविष्यति  when it be proved, सा इयम् that this, सेना army, अद्य today, स्वस्तिमती in safety, गङ्गाम् Ganga, तरिष्यति will cross over.
data.md: But if Bharata be well disposed towards Rāma, this host shall today safely cross the Ganga.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वोपायनं गृह्य मत्स्यमांसमधूनि च । अभिचक्राम भरतं निषादाधिपतिर्गुहः ।।
data.es: Having spoken thus, Guha, lord of the nishadas, approached Bharata, taking with him fish, meat and wine as offerings.
data.anv: निषादाधिपतिः गुहः overlord of the nishadas, Guha, इति thus, उक्त्वा having spoken, मत्स्यमांसमधूनि fish, meat and wine, उपायनम् as gifts, गृह्य holding, भरतम् to Bharata, अभिचक्राम approached.
data.md: Having said this, the lord of the Nişādas, Guha, taking a present of flesh, fish and honey, went out for interviewing Bharata.

data.v: तमायान्तं तु संप्रेक्ष्य सूतपुत्रः प्रतापवान् । भरतायाचचक्षेऽथ विनयज्ञो विनीतवत् ।।
data.es: The valiant Sumantra, conversant with ways of modesty, observed Guha approaching them and humbly informed Bharata.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, प्रतापवान् valiant, विनयज्ञः conversant with modesty, सूतपुत्रः son of charioteer, Sumantra, आयान्तम् approaching, तम् him, सम्प्रेक्ष्य having seen, विनीतवत्   humbly, भरताय to Bharata, आचचक्षे informed.
data.md: Seeing Guha approaching, the powerful son of the charioteer knowing season, humbly informed Bharata of it, saying.

data.v: एष ज्ञातिसहस्रेण स्थपतिः परिवारितः । कुशलो दण्डकारण्ये वृद्धो भ्रातुश्च ते सखा ।।
data.es: Guha who has come here surrounded by too many thousands of his relations is fully acquainted with the Dandaka forest. He is an aged man and a friend of your brother said Sumatra.
data.anv: ज्ञातिसहस्रेण with thousands of relations, परिवारितः surrounded by, एषः स्थपतिः this lord,  दण्डकारण्ये in the Dandaka forest, कुशलः skilled, वृद्धः aged one, ते your, भ्रातुः brother's, सखा च friend also.
data.md: This lord (that approaches) surrounded by his relatives, is very potent in Dandaka and is an old friend of your brother. Therefore let Guha, the lord of the Nişādas, see you, O Kākutstha. He indubitably knows where Rāma and Lakşmaņa are.

data.v: तस्मात्पश्यतु काकुत्स्थ त्वां निषादाधिपो गुहः । असंशयं विजानीते यत्र तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ ।।
data.es: O scion of the Kakusthas (Bharata) therefore, give audience to the overlord of the nishadas, Guha, who undoubtedly knows the whereabouts of Rama and Lakshmana.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ O Kakutstha, तस्मात् therefore, निषादाधिपः overlord of Nishadas, गुहः Guha, त्वाम्  you, पश्यतु let him see, तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ both Rama and Lakshmana, यत्र where, असंशयम्   undoubtedly, विजानीते he will know.
data.md: This lord (that approaches) surrounded by his relatives, is very potent in Dandaka and is an old friend of your brother. Therefore let Guha, the lord of the Nişādas, see you, O Kākutstha. He indubitably knows where Rāma and Lakşmaņa are.

data.v: एतत्तु वचनं श्रुत्वा सुमन्त्राद्भरतः शुभम् । उवाच वचनं शीघ्रं गुहः पश्यतु मामिति ।।
data.es: On hearing these auspicious words of Sumantra, Bharata said Let Guha see me at once.
data.anv: भरतः Bharata, सुमन्त्रात् from Sumantra, एतत् शुभम् these auspicious, वचनम् word, श्रुत्वा having heard, गुहः Guha, शीघ्रम् at once, माम् me, पश्यतु let him see, इति these, वचनम् word, उवाच said.
data.md: Hearing these wise words of Sumantra, Bharata at once said, "Let Guha see me."

data.v: लब्ध्वाभ्यनुज्ञां संहृष्टो ज्ञातिभिः परिवारितः । आगम्य भरतं प्रह्वो गुहो वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having obtaind the permission, a delighted Guha, escorted by his relatives, approached Bharata and humbly said:
data.anv: गुहः Guha, अभ्यनुज्ञाम् permission, लब्ध्वा having obtained, संहृष्टः delighted, ज्ञातिभिः relatives, परिवारितः escorted by, आगम्य having approached, प्रह्वः bowing humbly, भरतम् to Bharata, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Receiving permission, Guha, right glad, appeared before Bharata, bending low, and said.

data.v: निष्कुटश्चैव देशोऽयं वञ्चिताश्चापि ते वयम् । निवेदयामस्ते सर्वे स्वके दाशकुले वस ।।
data.es: This country is like a pleasuregarden at the backyard of your palace. All of us are subordinate to you and we solicit you to stay in the house of this servant of yours.
data.anv: अयम् this, देशः country, ते your, निष्कुटः is like a pleasuregarden behind your house, वयम् we, वञ्चिताश्चापि are subordinate, ते सर्वे all of us, निवेदयामः soliciting, दासकुले in the house of this servant, वस stay.
data.md: This place is your home. But you have stolen a march over us. We dedicate all this to you. Do you reside in the abode of your servant.

data.v: अस्ति मूलं फलं चैव निषादैः समुपाहृतम् । आर्द्रं च मांसं शुष्कं च वन्यं चोच्चावचं महत् ।।
data.es: Here are roots, fruits and a great variety of forest produce, fresh and dried meat brought by the nishadas.
data.anv: निषादैः by nishadas, समुपाहृतम् have been brought, मूलम् root, फलं चैव fruits also, वन्यम्  the forest produce, आर्द्रम् fresh, शुष्कं च dried, उच्चावचम् of great variety, महत् best, मांसं च  अस्ति meat are here.
data.md: Here are fruits and roots gathered by the Nişādas and meat dry and moist and various other produces of the forest.

data.v: आशंसे स्वाशिता सेना वत्स्यतीमां विभावरीम् । अर्चितो विविधैः कामैः श्वः ससैन्यो गमिष्यसि ।।
data.es: We hope your army having refreshed themselves will spend the night here. With our hospitality extended, you can proceed tomorrow.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे चतुरशीतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eightyfourth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: सेना army, स्वाशिता refreshed, इमाम् विभावरीम् this night, वत्स्यति will spend, आशंसे I hope, विविधैः by various, कामैः by our hospitality, अर्चितः treated, श्वः tomorrow, ससैन्यः with army, गमिष्यसि will go.
data.md: I pray that entertained in various ways and heartily partaking of meats and drinks, this army may spend the night here. Tomorrow morning, you will go along with your forces.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु भरतो निषादाधिपतिं गुहम् । प्रत्युवाच महाप्राज्ञो वाक्यं हेत्वर्थसंहितम् ।।
data.es: Thus addressed by Rama who was an adept in the use of words, eloquent Lakshmana gently replied:
data.anv: एवम् thus, उक्तः having spoken, महाप्राज्ञः  great intellectual, भरतः Bharata, निषादाधिपतिम् the overlord of the nishadas, गुहम् Guha, हेत्वर्थसंहितम् in well thought out and significant, वाक्यम् words, प्रत्युवाच replied.
data.md: Thus addressed, the exceedingly wise Bharata answered the lord of the Nişādas, in words fraught with sense and reason.

data.v: ऊर्जितः खलु ते कामः कृतो मम गुरोः सखे । यो मे त्वमीदृशीं सेनामेकोऽभ्यर्चितुमिच्छसि ।।
data.es: O dear friend of my elder brother, your desire to extend hospitality to this large army all alone is indeed noble.
data.anv: मम my, गुरोः elder brother's, सखे friend, यः त्वम् you, एकः alone, ईदृशीम् this large, सेनाम् army, अभ्यर्चितुम् to extend hospitality, इच्छसि want, ते your, कृतः done, कामः desire, ऊर्जितः खलु is indeed great.
data.md: Your great desire, O friend of my superior, is surely as good as attained; since you of mighty energy have set your heart on entertaining my army.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा तु महातेजा गुहं वचनमुत्तमम् । अब्रवीद्भरतः श्रीमान्निषादाधिपतिं पुनः ।।
data.es: Having spoken to Guha courteously, the majestic, radiant Bharata continued:
data.anv: महातेजाः of great radiance, श्रीमान् the majestic one, भरतः Bharata, गुहम् to Guha, उत्तमम् courteous, वचनम् word, उक्त्वा तु having said, पुनः again, निषादाधिपतिम्  addressing king of the nishadas, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Having said these fair words to Guha, the graceful and highly energetic Bharata again addressed the lord of Nişādas.

data.v: कतरेण गमिष्यामि भरद्वाजाश्रमं गुह । गहनोऽयं भृशं देशो गङ्गानूपो दुरत्ययः ।।
data.es: O Guha this region of Ganga with its dense forest is very difficult to cross. How can I reach the hermitage of Bharadwaja?
data.anv: गुह Guha, कतरेण by which path, भरद्वाजाश्रमम् to the hermitage of Bharadwaja, गमिष्यामि can I go, गङ्गनूपः marshy banks of Ganga, अयम् this, देशः region, भृशम् highly, गहनः is dense, दुरत्ययः very difficult to traverse.
data.md: By what way shall I go to Bharadvāja's hermitage? These lands watered by the Gangā are dense and hard to track.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राजपुत्रस्य धीमतः । अब्रवीत्प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यं गुहो गहनगोचरः ।।
data.es: Sage Bharadwaja heard the words of sagacious Rama and offered a bull, water (for washing feet) and arghya (offering to a guest).
data.anv: धीमतः of the sagacious, तस्य राजपुत्रस्य of that king's son, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, गहनगोचरः one who ranges in the dense forest, गुहः Guha, प्राञ्जलिः with folded palms (in reverence), वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Hearing those words of the intelligent prince, that righteous (ascetic) brought a bull* as well as Arghya and water and divers kinds of edibles consisting of wild fruits and roots. *When an eminent guest came to a person's house, as he offered madhuparka, with a bull which was killed for his entertainment

data.v: दाशास्त्वनुगमिष्यन्ति धन्विनः सुसमाहिताः । अहं चानुगमिष्यामि राजपुत्र महायशः ।।
data.es: O prince of great renown I shall follow you, wellprepared with these fishermen, armed with bows.
data.anv: महायशः a man of great renown, राजपुत्रः king's son, धन्विनः armed with bows, दाशाः fishermen, सुसमाहिताः wellprepared, त्वा you, अनुगमिष्यन्ति shall follow, अहम् I, त्वा you, अनुगमिष्यामि shall follow.
data.md: My servant well acquainted with the place shall attentively follow you; and, O prince possessed of mighty strength, I myself will also walk in your wake.

data.v: कच्चिन्न दुष्टो व्रजसि रामस्याक्लिष्टकर्मणः । इयं ते महती सेना शङ्कां जनयतीव मे ।।
data.es: Are you not going to that place with the evil intention of causing harm to Rama of unwearied actions? This large army of yours arouses doubts in me.
data.anv: अक्लिष्टकर्मणः of unwearied actions, रामस्य towards Rama, दुष्टः bearing illwill, न व्रजसि कच्छित् are you not going to that place?, महती large, ते your, इयं सेना this army, मे to me, शङ्काम् doubt, जनयतीव as though arouses.
data.md: But do you go after Rāma of energetic acts with some evil intention? This vast force of yours raise my apprehension/

data.v: तमेवमभिभाषन्तमाकाश इव निर्मलः । भरतः श्लक्ष्णया वाचा गुहं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: When he heard Guha thus speaking, Bharata who was as tranquil as the sky, said to him in a gentle voice.
data.anv: आकाशः इव like the sky, निर्मलः tranquil, भरतः Bharata, एवम् thus, अभिभाषन्तम् talking, तं गुहम् addressing Guha, श्लक्ष्णया in gentle, वाचा voice, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: When Guha had asked this, Bharata with a presence unclouded like the sky, spoke to Guha these sweet words.

data.v: मा भूत्स कालो यत्कष्टं न मां शङ्कितुमर्हसि । राघवः स हि मे भ्राता ज्येष्ठः पितृसमो मम ।।
data.es: That calmitous time will never come (again). You should not suspect me. I look upon Rama, my eldest brother, as my father.
data.anv: यत् which, कष्टम् calamity, सः कालः that time, मा भूत् shall not come, माम् to me, शङ्कितुम् to suspect, नार्हसि you should not, मे my, ज्येष्ठः eldest, भ्राता brother, सः राघवः that Rama, पितृसमः is equal to my father, मतः हि he has been held in high esteem.
data.md: May a time never come when I shall do wrong to Rāghava! It behoves you not to fear me. Rāghava is my eldest brother dear to me even as my sire himself.

data.v: तं निवर्तयितुं यामि काकुत्स्थं वनवासिनम् । बुद्धिरन्या न ते कार्या गुह सत्यं ब्रवीमि ते ।।
data.es: I am going to bring back that scion of the kakutsthas (Rama) who resides in the forest. O Guha, do not entertain any other thought. I am tellng you the truth.
data.anv: वनवासिनम् residing in the forest, तम् काकुत्स्थम् to that scion of the Kakutsthas, निवर्तयितुम् to bring back, यामि I am going, गुह O Guha, ते to you, अन्या other, बुद्धि: thought, न कार्या not to be entertained, ते to you, सत्यम् truth, ब्रवीमि I am telling.
data.md: I go to make Kākutstha dwelling in the woods, turn back. Other intention cherish I none. O Guha, this I tell you truly.

data.v: स तु संहृष्टवदनः श्रुत्वा भरतभाषितम् । पुनरेवाब्रवीद्वाक्यं भरतं प्रति हर्षितः ।।
data.es: When he heard those words of Bharata, Guha was delighted and his face beamed with joy as he said to Bharata:
data.anv: भरतभाषितम् Bharata's words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, संहृष्टवदनः one whose is face beaming with joy, सः तु that Guha, हर्षितः delighted, भरतं प्रति looking at Bharata, पुनरेव once  again, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Having heard Bharata's speech, Guha with a countenance lighted up with delight, again cheerfully addressed Bharata, saying.

data.v: धन्यस्त्वं न त्वया तुल्यं पश्यामि जगतीतले । अयत्नादागतं राज्यं यस्त्वं त्यक्तुमिहेच्छसि ।।
data.es: Blessed indeed you are as you desire to renounce the kingdom that has come to you effortlessly. I see none equal to you on this earth.
data.anv: यः त्वम् such a man as you are, इह now, अयत्नात् effortlessly, आगतम् arrived, राज्यम् kingdom, त्यक्तुम् to renounce, इच्छसि wish, त्वम् you, धन्यः are blessed, त्वया your, तुल्यम् equal, जगतीतले on this earth, न पश्यामि I do not see.
data.md: Blessed are you! Your like find I none on earth, inasmuch as you wish to resign a kingdom that comes to you without search.

data.v: शाश्वती खलु ते कीर्तिर्लोकाननुचरिष्यति । यस्त्वं कृच्छ्रगतं रामं प्रत्यानयितुमिच्छसि ।।
data.es: You desire to bring back Rama who is in great difficulty. This everlasting fame of yours will spread all over the world.
data.anv: यः त्वम् you, कृच्छ्रगतम् who is in great difficulty, रामम् Rama, प्रत्यानयितुम् to bring back, इच्छसि desire, ते your, शाश्वती everlasting, कीर्तिः fame, लोकान् in this world, अनुचरिष्यति will spread.
data.md: Your eternal fame will certainly range this world, since you wish to bring back Rāma passing through misfortune.

data.v: एवं संभाषमाणस्य गुहस्य भरतं तदा । बभौ नष्टप्रभः सूर्यो रजनी चाभ्यवर्तत ।।
data.es: As Guha was thus conversing with Bharata, the rays of the Sun diminished and the night set in.
data.anv: तदा then, गुहस्य Guha's, एवं thus, भरतं to Bharata, सम्भाषमाणस्य while conversing, सूर्यः sun, नष्टप्रभः diminished light, बभौ shone, रजनी च night, अभ्यवर्तत set in.
data.md: As Guha was speaking thus to Bharata, the sun became shorn of his splendour and night fell.

data.v: संनिवेश्य स तां सेनां गुहेन परितोषितः । शत्रुघ्नेन सह श्रीमाञ्शयनं पुनरागमत् ।।
data.es: Fortunate Bharata gratified by Guha encamped his army and retired to bed along with Satrughna.
data.anv: श्रीमान् fortunate Bharata, सः he, तां सेनां that army, सन्निवेश्य having encamped, गुहेन with Guha, परितोषितः gratified, शत्रुघ्नेन सह along with Satrughna, शयनं sleep, समुपागमत्  obtained.
data.md: Thereupon having disposed his troops, the auspicious Bharata gratified by Guha, went to bed along with Śatrughna.

data.v: रामचिन्तामयः शोको भरतस्य महात्मनः । उपस्थितो ह्यनर्हस्य धर्मप्रेक्षस्य तादृशः ।।
data.es: But the thought of Rama caused grief to the magnanimous Bharata, a man of righteous outlook who did not deserve such grief.
data.anv: महात्मनः of the magnanimous, धर्मप्रेक्षस्य of a man of righteous outlook, अनर्हस्य of him who  does not deserve (grief), भरतस्य Bharata's, तादृशः such, रामचिन्तामयः filled with the thought of Rama, शोकः grief, उपस्थितः हि had befallen.
data.md: Then arose thoughts of Rāma in the mind of the magnanimous Bharata ever having his gaze fixed on virtue and undeserving (of hardship).

data.v: अन्तर्दाहेन दहनः संतापयति राघवम् । वनदाहाभिसंतप्तं गूढोऽग्निरिव पादपम् ।।
data.es: Just like a concealed forestfire scorching the dried up forest, the fire of sorrow kindled in his mind scorched Bharata.
data.anv: वनदाहाभिसन्तप्तं dried by forest fire, पादपं tree, गूढः hidden, अग्निरिव like a fire, राघवम्  Bharata, दहनः grief, अन्तर्दाहेन burning within himself, सन्तापयति scorching.
data.md: Then even as a tree already heated by a forestfire burns with a fire hidden in its cavity that descendant of Raghu began to burn with the fire of grief inflamed in his heart.

data.v: प्रस्रुतः सर्वगात्रेभ्यः स्वेदः शोकाग्निसंभवः । यथा सूर्यांशुसंतप्तो हिमवान्प्रस्रुतो हिमम् ।।
data.es: Like the ice melted by the heat of the Sun's rays flows down the Himalayas, sweat poured from all parts of his body caused by the fire of grief.
data.anv: सूर्यांशुसन्तप्तः heated by the Sun's rays, हिमवान् Himalayas, यथा just as, हिमं ice, प्रसृतः melted, सर्वगात्रेभ्यः from all limbs, शोकाग्निसम्भवम् caused by the fire of grief, स्वेदम् sweat, प्रसृतः poured out.
data.md: Perspiration produced by the fire of sorrow issued out of all his limbs, as the Himavat heated by the solar warmth generates water.

data.v: ध्याननिर्दरशैलेन विनिःश्वसितधातुना । दैन्यपादपसंघेन शोकायासाधिशृङ्गिणा ।।
data.es: Bharata, son of Kaikeyi was stricken by a lofty mountain of grief. The cavityless rocks of that mountain were his contemplation, the minerals were his sighs, the multitude of trees were his desolation, peaks were his fatigue and mental distress, the unlimited number of animals were his stupor, the bamboo tree was his sorrow.
data.anv: कैकयीसुतः Kaikeyi's son, ध्याननिर्धरशैलेन by the cavityless rocks of that mountain of contemplation, विनिःश्वसितधातुना by the minerals of heaving sighs, दैन्यपादपसंघेन by the multitude of trees in the form of dejection, शोकायासाधिशृङ्गिणा by the peaks of  sorrow fatigue and mental distress, प्रमोहानन्तसत्त्वेन by the countless creatures of stupor, सन्तापौषधिवेणुना by the bamboo tree of sorrow, महता great, दुःखशैलेन by the mountains of grief, आक्रान्तः was invaded.
data.md: And Kaikeyi's son was overpowered and drowned by the mountain of grief, having thoughts (of Rāma) for its entire crags, sighs for its mineral substance, disgust with the avocations of life, for its trees, mental feebleness through grief for its summits, stupor for the animals inhabiting it, and burning for its annual shrubs and bamboos.

data.v: प्रमोहानन्तसत्त्वेन संतापौषधिवेणुना । आक्रान्तो दुःखशैलेन महता कैकयीसुतः ।।
data.es: Bharata, son of Kaikeyi was stricken by a lofty mountain of grief. The cavityless rocks of that mountain were his contemplation, the minerals were his sighs, the multitude of trees were his desolation, peaks were his fatigue and mental distress, the unlimited number of animals were his stupor, the bamboo tree was his sorrow.
data.anv: कैकयीसुतः Kaikeyi's son, ध्याननिर्धरशैलेन by the cavityless rocks of that mountain of contemplation, विनिःश्वसितधातुना by the minerals of heaving sighs, दैन्यपादपसंघेन by the multitude of trees in the form of dejection, शोकायासाधिशृङ्गिणा by the peaks of  sorrow fatigue and mental distress, प्रमोहानन्तसत्त्वेन by the countless creatures of stupor, सन्तापौषधिवेणुना by the bamboo tree of sorrow, महता great, दुःखशैलेन by the mountains of grief, आक्रान्तः was invaded.
data.md: And Kaikeyi's son was overpowered and drowned by the mountain of grief, having thoughts (of Rāma) for its entire crags, sighs for its mineral substance, disgust with the avocations of life, for its trees, mental feebleness through grief for its summits, stupor for the animals inhabiting it, and burning for its annual shrubs and bamboos.

data.v: गुहेन सार्धं भरतः समागतो; महानुभावः सजनः समाहितः । सुदुर्मनास्तं भरतं तदा पुन;र्गुहः समाश्वासयदग्रजं प्रति ।।
data.es: Bharata, a man of great magnanimity, joined Guha together with his people with composed mind. Then Guha, greatly distraught, again consoled Bharata regarding his elder brother Rama.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे पञ्चाशीतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eightyfifth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: महानुभावः magnanimous, सजनः along with his people, भरतः Bharata, समाहितः with a composed mind, गुहेन सार्धं with Guha, समागतः joined, तदा then, सुदुर्मनाः with greatly distraught mind, गुहः Guha, तं भरतम् that Bharata, पुनः again, अग्रजं प्रति about elder brother Rama, आश्वासयत् consoled.
data.md: Meeting with Guha, the magnanimous Bharata accompanied by his people, engrossed with the thoughts of Rāma, became oppressed with grief. (Seeing this), Guha by and by encouraged Bharata concerning his elder brother.

data.v: आचचक्षेऽथ सद्भावं लक्ष्मणस्य महात्मनः । भरतायाप्रमेयाय गुहो गहनगोचरः ।।
data.es: Then Guha, the forest ranger, described to Bharata the countless qualities of the goodnatured, magnanimous Lakshmana:
data.anv: अथ then, गहनगोचरः forest ranger, गुहः Guha, अप्रमेयाय to a man of immeasurable (virtues), भरताय to Bharata, महात्मनः of the magnanimous, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, सद्भावम् good nature, आचचक्षे explained.
data.md: Guha, acquainted with the forest, described to Bharata of immeasurable prowess the regard the high-souled Laksmana bore to Rama.

data.v: तं जाग्रतं गुणैर्युक्तं वरचापेषुधारिणम् । भ्रातृ गुप्त्यर्थमत्यन्तमहं लक्ष्मणमब्रवम् ।।
data.es: I spoke to the virtuous Lakshmana, who was holding arrows, bow and sword in his hand and keeping awake completely for the protection of his brother.
data.anv: अहम् I, भ्रातृगुप्त्यर्थम् for the sake of protecting his brother, अत्यन्तम् completely, जाग्रतम् keeping awake, शरचापासिधारिणम् holding arrows, bow and sword, गुणैः with virtues, युक्तम् endowed with, तं लक्ष्मणम् that Lakshmana, अबृवम् I said.
data.md: To Lakşmaņa crowned with every virtue, waking up, holding the bow with the arrow fixed on it for the purpose of guarding well his brother.

data.v: इयं तात सुखा शय्या त्वदर्थमुपकल्पिता । प्रत्याश्वसिहि शेष्वास्यां सुखं राघवनन्दन ।।
data.es: O dear prince this comfortable bed has been arranged for you. Rest happily on this bed.
data.anv: राघवनन्दन delight of the race of Raghu, तात my friend, (लक्ष्मण Lakshmana), सुखा comfortable, इयम् this, शय्या couch, त्वदर्थम् for your sake, उपकल्पिता has been arranged, प्रत्याश्वसिहि be assured, अस्याम् upon it, सुखम् peacefully, शेष्व lie down.
data.md: This O child, is the easeful bed that has been prepared for you. O prince, do you as you listen, lie down upon it.

data.v: उचितोऽयं जनः सर्वे दुःखानां त्वं सुखोचितः । धर्मात्मंस्तस्य गुप्त्यर्थं जागरिष्यामहे वयम् ।।
data.es: We are used to all kinds of suffering and you, to comfort. We will keep vigil during the night for the protection of Rama, descendant of the Kakutsthas.
data.anv: धर्मात्मन् O righteous one, अयम् this, सर्वः all, जनः people, दुःखानाम् for hardships, उचितः  are accustomed, त्वम् you, सुखोचितः are used to comfort, तस्य for Rama's, गुप्त्यर्थम् for the sake of protection, वयम् we, जागरिष्यामहे will stay awake.
data.md: These (foresters) are inured to this hardship; but you are worthy of ease. We will wake up during the night for guarding Kākutstha.

data.v: न हि रामात्प्रियतरो ममास्ति भुवि कश्चन । मोत्सुको भूर्ब्रवीम्येतदप्यसत्यं तवाग्रतः ।।
data.es: For me, there is none dearer than Rama in this world. I speak the truth. I swear by truth.
data.anv: मम for me, भुवि on earth, रामात् more than Rama, प्रियतरः dearer, कश्चन none, नास्ति हि does not exist, अथ and, उत्सुकः anxious, मा भूः do not have, तव your, अग्रतः in presence, एतत् this, सत्यम् truthful, वाक्यम् words, ब्रवीमि I am telling.
data.md: There is none on earth dearer to me than Răma. This I tell you truly and I swear by truth itself.

data.v: अस्य प्रसादादाशंसे लोकेऽस्मिन्सुमहद्यशः । धर्मावाप्तिं च विपुलामर्थावाप्तिं च केवलाम् ।।
data.es: I am seeking supreme fame in this world through the attainment of dharma and acquisition of abundant artha by the grace of Rama alone.
data.anv: अस्य this Rama's, प्रसादात् grace, अस्मिन् in this लोके world, सुमहत् great, यशः renown, विपुलाम् abundance of, धर्मावाप्तिं च advantage of righteousness, केवलम् solely, अर्थकामौ च  artha (prosperity) and kama (pleasure), आशंसे I desire.
data.md: Through his grace I hope in this world to attain high fame, and great religious merit as well as completely secure profit and pleasure.

data.v: सोऽहं प्रियसखं रामं शयानं सह सीतया । रक्षिष्यामि धनुष्पाणिः सर्वैः स्वैर्ज्ञातिभिः सह ।।
data.es: I along with my kinsmen, bow in hand, will protect my dear friend, Rama with Sita from every side.
data.anv: सः अहं as for me, सर्वैः with all, स्वैः own, ज्ञातिभिः सह with relatives, सीतया सह along with Sita, शयानम् asleep, प्रियसखम् dear friend, रामम् to Rama, धनुष्पाणिः bow in hand, रक्षिष्यामि I will protect.
data.md: I will bow in hand in company with my kindred adequately guard my dear friend reposing with Sītā.

data.v: न हि मेऽविदितं किंचिद्वनेऽस्मिंश्चरतः सदा । चतुरङ्गं ह्यपि बलं प्रसहेम वयं युधि ।।
data.es: Wandering about in this forest all the time there is nothing unknown to me (here). We can withstand even a vast army of four divisions.
data.anv: अस्मिन् वने in this forest, सदा always, चरतः ranging, मे to me, अविदितम् unknown, किञ्चित् nothing, न हि not, वयम् we, युधि in the battle, चतुरङ्गं बलम् अपि four divisions of the army also, प्रसहेम हि will withstand.
data.md: Always ranging in this forest, nothing herein is unknown to me. I shall vanquish even any mighty body of fourfold forces (that may come up against us.)

data.v: एवमस्माभिरुक्तेन लक्ष्मणेन महात्मना । अनुनीता वयं सर्वे धर्ममेवानुपश्यता ।।
data.es: Lakshmana said to Guha, O sinless one when all of us are under your righteous protection we have nothing to fear.
data.anv: एवं thus, अस्माभिः by us, उक्तेन having been uttered, महात्मना by the  magnanimous, धर्ममेव virtuousness alone, अनुपश्यता seeing, लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, वयम् we, सर्वे all, अनुनीताः  have been entreated.
data.md: Thus accosted by us, the magnanimous Laks maņa with his gaze ever fixed on virtue, humbly observed.

data.v: कथं दाशरथौ भूमौ शयाने सह सीतया । शक्या निद्रामया लब्धुं जीवितं वा सुखानि वा ।।
data.es: When Rama, son of Dasaratha, sleeps on the ground with Sita how can I sleep or live or enjoy pleasures?
data.anv: दाशरथौ Rama, सीतया सह with Sita, भूमौ on the ground, शयाने while sleeping, मया by me,  निद्रा sleep, लब्धुम् to obtain, कथम् how, शक्या is it possible, जीवितं वा either life, सुखानि वा  or comforts.
data.md: Thereupon Laksmana said, O sinless one, protected by you ever having your sight fixed on virtue, we do not fear to live in this place. But how with Dasaratha's son lying down on the ground along with Sītă can I indulge in sleep or what is the use of my living and enjoying happiness?

data.v: यो न देवासुरैः सर्वैः शक्यः प्रसहितुं युधि । तं पश्य गुह संविष्टं तृणेषु सह सीतया ।।
data.es: Look at that Rama whom all the gods and demons cannot face in war sleeps so comfortably on the grass with Sita.
data.anv: गुह O Guha, यः that Rama, सर्वैः by all, देवासुरैः by gods and demons, युधि in battle, प्रसहितुं  to withstand, न शक्यः not possible, तम् him, सीतया सह with Sita, तृणेषु on the grass, संविष्टम् lying down, पश्य behold.
data.md: How see him who is capable of bearing in battle the onslaught of the gods and the Asuras combined, sleeping in a cave on grass?

data.v: महता तपसा लब्धो विविधैश्च परिश्रमैः । एको दशरथस्यैष पुत्रः सदृशलक्षणः ।।
data.es: This favourite son of Dasaratha who has similar traits like his father was born after he rigorously practised austerities accompanied by (Vedic) mantras. When he is banished, the king will not live long. Surely this land will soon be widowed.
data.anv: एषः this Rama, महता by great, तपसा with austerities, विविधैः by various, परिश्रमैश्च with   efforts as well, लब्धः was obtained, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, एकः one, सदृशलक्षणः one with very similar virtues, पुत्रः is the son.
data.md: It is by virtue of mighty austerities and uncommon exertions that Dasaratha has obtained this son of his crowned with every auspicious sign. He being banished, the king shall not live long; and the Earth shall certainly be widowed soon.

data.v: अस्मिन्प्रव्राजिते राजा न चिरं वर्तयिष्यति । विधवा मेदिनी नूनं क्षिप्रमेव भविष्यति ।।
data.es: This favourite son of Dasaratha who has similar traits like his father was born after he rigorously practised austerities accompanied by (Vedic) mantras. When he is banished, the king will not live long. Surely this land will soon be widowed.
data.anv: अस्मिन् when he, प्रव्राजिते is exiled, राजा king Dasaratha, चिरम् for a long time, न वर्तयिष्यति will not survive, नूनम् surely, मेदिनी earth, क्षिप्रमेव soon, विधवा widow, भविष्यति will become.
data.md: It is by virtue of mighty austerities and uncommon exertions that Dasaratha has obtained this son of his crowned with every auspicious sign. He being banished, the king shall not live long; and the Earth shall certainly be widowed soon.

data.v: विनद्य सुमहानादं श्रमेणोपरताः स्त्रियः । निर्घोषोपरतं नूनमद्य राजनिवेशनम् ।।
data.es: All the women having cried so much must have quietened down out of sheer exhaustion. That is why perhaps the sounds from the royal palace have ceased.
data.anv: स्त्रियः women, सुमहानादम् loud sounds, विनद्य having cried, श्रमेण with exhaustion, उपरताः  have ceased, अद्य now, राजनिवेशने in the king's palace, निर्घोषः clamour, नूनम् surely, विरतः   has subsided.
data.md: Having bewailed aloud, the women have, methinks, (by this time) ceased through fatigue, and the king's residence is still.

data.v: कौसल्या चैव राजा च तथैव जननी मम । नाशंसे यदि ते सर्वे जीवेयुः शर्वरीमिमाम् ।।
data.es: I doubt whether all of them -- the king, Kausalya and my mother -- can survive this night.
data.anv: कौसल्या चैव even Kausalya, राजा च king also, तथैव in the same way, मम जननी my mother, ते सर्वे all of them, इमाम् this, रजनीम् night, यदि जीवेयुः if they are alive, नाशंसे I do not think.
data.md: I can not hope that Kausalyā, the king, and my mother (Sumitrā) all those are yet alive.

data.v: जीवेदपि हि मे माता शत्रुघ्नस्यान्ववेक्षया । दुःखिता या तु कौसल्या वीरसूर्विनशिष्यति ।।
data.es: My mother may live looking forward to Satrughna. But, alas Kausalya may die, separated from her valiant son.
data.anv: मे माता my mother, शत्रुघ्नस्य Satrughna's, अन्ववेक्षया looking at, जीवेदपि च might be alive, वीरसूः mother of a warrior, या कौसल्या that Kausalya, सा तु as for her, दुःखिता with extreme grief, विनशिष्यति will die.
data.md: If they are, it is for this night only. Even if my mother live looking up to Satrughna, yet this is my grief that that mother of a hero, Kausalyā will breathe her last.

data.v: अतिक्रान्तमतिक्रान्तमनवाप्य मनोरथम् । राज्ये राममनिक्षिप्य पिता मे विनशिष्यति ।।
data.es: Past is past (irreversible). My father, brooding over his desire of installing Rama as king unfulfilled, will perish.
data.anv: मे पिता my father, अतिक्रान्तम् अतिक्रान्तम् gone by one after another, मनोरथम् cherished desire, अनवाप्य without fulfilling, राज्ये in the kingdom, रामम् Rama, अनिक्षिप्य without placing, विनशिष्यति will pass away.
data.md: Saying, All is lost, All is lost, with his desire unattained, my father having failed to install Rāma in the kingdom, will resign his existence.

data.v: सिद्धार्थाः पितरं वृत्तं तस्मिन्काले ह्युपस्थिते । प्रेतकार्येषु सर्वेषु संस्करिष्यन्ति भूमिपम् ।।
data.es: Those who will remain present around the king, my father, at the time of his death and perform the funeral rites have their desires fulfilled (for they could attend the king's obsequies).
data.anv: तस्मिन्काले when that moment, उपस्थिते had arrived, वृत्तम् being in that state, पितरम् my father, भूमिपम् for the lord of the earth, सर्वेषु all, प्रेतकार्येषु in funeral rites, संस्करिष्यन्ति will perform, सिद्धार्थाः men who attained their purpose.
data.md: Surely they are blessed that when the time shall come when the king will die, will perform the funeral rites of that descendant of Raghu.

data.v: रम्यचत्वरसंस्थानां सुविभक्तमहापथाम् । हर्म्यप्रासादसंपन्नां सर्वरत्नविभूषिताम् ।।
data.md: Then shall they with happy hearts range the looking terraces, with the highways laid out orderly, crowned with lordly edifices, adorned with various gems, crowded by cars and elephants and horses, resounding with the notes of trumpets, abounding in auspicious things, filled with fat and contented people, having gardens and pleasure-houses, and possessed of divers classed of men indulging festal mirth.

data.v: गजाश्वरथसंबाधां तूर्यनादविनादिताम् । सर्वकल्याणसंपूर्णां हृष्टपुष्टजनाकुलाम् ।।
data.md: Then shall they with happy hearts range the looking terraces, with the highways laid out orderly, crowned with lordly edifices, adorned with various gems, crowded by cars and elephants and horses, resounding with the notes of trumpets, abounding in auspicious things, filled with fat and contented people, having gardens and pleasure-houses, and possessed of divers classed of men indulging festal mirth.

data.v: आरामोद्यानसंपूर्णां समाजोत्सवशालिनीम् । सुखिता विचरिष्यन्ति राजधानीं पितुर्मम ।।
data.md: Shall we, on the occasion of Rāma's return, with glad hearts peacefully enter the city in company with that one firm in his promise?

data.v: अपि सत्यप्रतिज्ञेन सार्धं कुशलिना वयम् । निवृत्ते समये ह्यस्मिन्सुखिताः प्रविशेमहि ।।
data.es: Will we ever be able, after completion of the exile, to enter the city of Ayodhya along with Rama who is true to his promise?
data.anv: वयं we, आस्मिन् in this, समये the time, निवृत्ते returning, सत्यप्रतिज्ञेन who fulfilled his vow, कुशलिना सार्धं along with him in safe condition, सुखिताः with happiness, अपि प्रविशेमहि will we enter Ayodhya?
data.md: If we remain in peace, we shall returning from the forest with that one firm in promise, enter Ayodhyā?

data.v: परिदेवयमानस्य तस्यैवं सुमहात्मनः । तिष्ठतो राजपुत्रस्य शर्वरी सात्यवर्तत ।।
data.es: While that noble prince (Lakshmana), tormented with grief, stood thus wailing, the night passed off.
data.anv: सुमहात्मनः of the highminded, एवं in this way, परिदेवयमानस्य lamenting so, तस्य राजपुत्रस्य that prince, तिष्ठतः while waiting, सा शर्वरी that night, अत्यवर्तत elapsed.
data.md: As the high-souled son of the king oppressed with grief was thus lamenting sitting up, the day broke.

data.v: प्रभाते विमले सूर्ये कारयित्वा जटा उभौ । अस्मिन्भागीरथीतीरे सुखं संतारितौ मया ।।
data.es: The next morning when the Sun shone bright, both of them matted their hair on the bank of the river Bhagirathi (Ganga) and I ferried them across comfortably.
data.anv: विमले when bright, सूर्ये Sun, प्रभाते at dawn, उभौ both, आस्मिन् in this, भागीरथीतीरे on the bank of Bhagirathi, जटाः matting their hair, कारयित्वा made, मया by me, सुखम् comfortably, सन्तारितौ were ferried.
data.md: In the morning, with an unclouded sun, both, having made matted locks on the banks of the Bhāgīrathi, crossed the river along with me.

data.v: जटाधरौ तौ द्रुमचीरवाससौ; महाबलौ कुञ्जरयूथपोपमौ । वरेषुचापासिधरौ परंतपौ; व्यवेक्षमाणौ सह सीतया गतौ ।।
data.es: Rama and Lakshmana, slayers of enemies, who are as strong as bull elephants, with their hair matted, wearing robes made of bark, armed with excellent bows, arrows and swords went along with Sita looking around (vigilantly).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे षडशीतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eightysixth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: जटाधरौ wearing matted hair, द्रुमचीरवाससौ those two dressed in bark robes, महाबलौ of great strength, कुञ्जरयूथपोपमौ comparable to elephants, वरेषुचापासिधरौ armed with excellent bows, arrows and swords, तौ both, परन्तपौ slayers of enemies, व्यपेक्षमाणौ looking back alertly, सीतया सह along with Sita, गतौ went.
data.md: Wearing matted locks and clad in barks of trees, those persons possessed of mighty strength, like to leaders of elephant-herds, equipped with excellent arrows and quivers and bows, those repressors of foes, expecting (their return form exile), departed with Sītā.

data.v: गुहस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा भरतो भृशमप्रियम् । ध्यानं जगाम तत्रैव यत्र तच्छ्रुतमप्रियम् ।।
data.es: Extremely unhappy over what he heard from Guha, Bharata was immersed in thought then and there.
data.anv: भरतः Bharata, भृशम् highly, अप्रियम् unpleasant, गुहस्य from Guha, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, तत् अप्रियम् that unpleasant, यत्र wherever, श्रुतम् was heard, तत्रैव there only, ध्यानम्  thought, जगाम obtained.
data.md: Hearing the words of Guha, exceedingly unpleasant, Bharata as soon as he heard them, became plunged in thought.

data.v: सुकुमारो महासत्त्वः सिंहस्कन्धो महाभुजः । पुण्डरीक विशालाक्षस्तरुणः प्रियदर्शनः ।।
data.es: The delicate, youthful, highly energetic and mightyarmed Bharata of graceful appearance, with shoulders like that of a lion and wideeyed like lotus petals, recovered for a moment and with a mind deeply distressed fell down at once like an elephant smitten by a goad.
data.anv: सुकुमारः delicate, महासत्त्वः highly energetic, सिंहस्कन्धः with shoulders like that of a lion, महाभुजः mightyarmed, पुण्डरीकविशालाक्षः wideeyed like lotus petals, तरुणः youthful, प्रियदर्शनः of graceful appearance, मुहूर्तं कालं तु for a moment, प्रत्याश्वस्य having revived, परमदुर्मनाः with deeply distressed mind, तोत्रैः by whips, अतिविद्धः smitten, द्विपः इव like an elephant, सहसा at once, पपात fell down.
data.md: And then taking heart for a while, that tenderfamed one possessed of immense strength, gifted with leonine shoulders and length of arms, having expansive eyes resembling white lotuses, young in years, and endowed with a handsome presence, afflicted with great grief, was overpowered, like an elephant wounded in the heart with a goad.

data.v: प्रत्याश्वस्य मुहूर्तं तु कालं परमदुर्मनाः । पपात सहसा तोत्रैर्हृदि विद्ध इव द्विपः ।।
data.es: The delicate, youthful, highly energetic and mightyarmed Bharata of graceful appearance, with shoulders like that of a lion and wideeyed like lotus petals, recovered for a moment and with a mind deeply distressed fell down at once like an elephant smitten by a goad.
data.anv: सुकुमारः delicate, महासत्त्वः highly energetic, सिंहस्कन्धः with shoulders like that of a lion, महाभुजः mightyarmed, पुण्डरीकविशालाक्षः wideeyed like lotus petals, तरुणः youthful, प्रियदर्शनः of graceful appearance, मुहूर्तं कालं तु for a moment, प्रत्याश्वस्य having revived, परमदुर्मनाः with deeply distressed mind, तोत्रैः by whips, अतिविद्धः smitten, द्विपः इव like an elephant, सहसा at once, पपात fell down.
data.md: And then taking heart for a while, that tenderfamed one possessed of immense strength, gifted with leonine shoulders and length of arms, having expansive eyes resembling white lotuses, young in years, and endowed with a handsome presence, afflicted with great grief, was overpowered, like an elephant wounded in the heart with a goad.

data.v: तदवस्थं तु भरतं शत्रुघ्नोऽनन्तर स्थितः । परिष्वज्य रुरोदोच्चैर्विसंज्ञः शोककर्शितः ।।
data.es: Seeing Bharata in that state, Satrughna who was standing close by, smitten with grief clasped him, cried loudly and fell senseless.
data.anv: अनन्तरस्थितः standing close by, शत्रुघ्नः Satrughna, तदवस्थम् in this state, भरतम् Bharata, परिष्यज्य having embraced, शोककर्शितः smitten with grief, विसंज्ञः having lost his senses,  उच्चैः loudly, रुरोद cried.
data.md: Seeing Bharata in that condition, ſatrughna who was near, taking the former on his lap, began to cry, almost deprived of his senses and oppressed with grief.

data.v: ततः सर्वाः समापेतुर्मातरो भरतस्य ताः । उपवास कृशा दीना भर्तृव्यसनकर्शिताः ।।
data.es: Then Bharata's mothers, who were emaciated due to fasting and afflicted by the calamity of the death of their husband were desolate, rushed towards him.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, उपवासकृशाः emaciated due to fasting, दीनाः desolate, भर्तृव्यसनकर्शिताः afflicted by the calamity of their husband's death, सर्वाः all, भरतस्य Bharata's, ताः मातरः  mothers, समापेतुः rushed towards him.

data.v: ताश्च तं पतितं भूमौ रुदन्त्यः पर्यवारयन् । कौसल्या त्वनुसृत्यैनं दुर्मनाः परिषस्वजे ।।
data.es: Sobbing, they gathered around Bharata who had fallen on the ground, while Kausalya approached him in a depressed state and took him into her arms.
data.anv: ताश्च all of them, रुदन्त्य: sobbing, भूमौ on the ground, पतितम् fallen, तम् him, पर्यवारयन् surrounded, कौसल्या तु as for Kausalya, दुर्मनाः in a depressed mind, अनुसृत्य approaching, एनम् that Bharata, परिषस्वजे took him into her arms.

data.v: वत्सला स्वं यथा वत्समुपगूह्य तपस्विनी । परिपप्रच्छ भरतं रुदन्ती शोकलालसा ।।
data.es: Desolate Kausalya, in deep distress, clasped Bharata out of filial love as if he were her own child, wept and enquired of him:
data.anv: शोकलालसा distressed in grief, तपस्विनी desolate, वत्सला with filial love, रुदन्ती weeping, स्वम् her own, वत्सं यथा like child, उपगूह्य clasping, भरतम् Bharata, परिपप्रच्छ enquired.

data.v: पुत्रव्याधिर्न ते कच्चिच्छरीरं परिबाधते । अद्य राजकुलस्यास्य त्वदधीनं हि जीवितम् ।।
data.es: O son I hope you are not affected by illness. Now the existence of this royal house devolves on you.
data.anv: पुत्र O son, व्याधिः illness, ते शरीरम् your body, कच्चित् न परिबाधते is not troubling, I hope, अद्य now, अस्य राजकुलस्य of this royal house, जीवितम् life, त्वदधीनं हि is dependent on you.
data.md: My son, does any malady afflict your body? Now the life of this royal race is, without doubt, in your hands.

data.v: त्वां दृष्ट्वा पुत्र जीवामि रामे सभ्रातृके गते । वृत्ते दशरथे राज्ञि नाथ एकस्त्वमद्य नः ।।
data.es: O my son, with Rama gone to the forest along with your brother Lakshmana and with king Dasaratha departed from this world, I continue to live seeing you. From now on you alone are our sole protector.
data.anv: पुत्र O son, सभ्रातृके along with your brother, Lakshmana, रामे Rama, गते having  gone, राज्ञि king, दशरथे Dasaratha, वृत्ते had departed, त्वाम् you, दृष्ट्वा seeing, जीवामि I am living, अद्य now, त्वम् you, एकः alone, नः for us, नाथः are protector.
data.md: Ráma having gone away along with his brother, I shall, O son, live, seeing you. King Dasaratha having departed this life, you alone are our lord.

data.v: कच्चिन्न लक्ष्मणे पुत्र श्रुतं ते किंचिदप्रियम् । पुत्र वा ह्येकपुत्रायाः सहभार्ये वनं गते ।।
data.es: O my son, I hope you have not heard any unpleasant news about Lakshmana or about my only son Rama who has gone to the forest along with his wife.
data.anv: पुत्र O son, लक्ष्मणे relating to Lakshmana, सहभार्ये with his wife, वनम् to the forest, गते had gone, एकपुत्रायाः of me having only one son, पुत्रे वा or relating to Rama, किंचित् even  little, अप्रियम् unpleasant news, ते to you, कच्चित् न श्रुतम् is not heard, I hope not.
data.md: Have you, my son, heard anything unpleasant concerning Lakṣmaṇa; or the son of that one having an only son,* who has gone to the forest along with his wife? *Meaning herself.

data.v: स मुहूर्तं समाश्वस्य रुदन्नेव महायशाः । कौसल्यां परिसान्त्व्येदं गुहं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Highly renowned Bharata, composing himself for a moment and still weeping, reassured Kauslaya, and then said this to Guha:
data.anv: महायशाः of great renown, सः that Bharata, मुहूर्तम् for a moment, समाश्वस्य composing himself, कौसल्याम् Kausalya, परिसान्त्वेद्यं reassuring, रुदन्नेव still weeping, गुहम् to Guha, वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Having taken comfort for a while, that one of high fame weeping, and solacing Kausalya, spoke to Guha, saying.

data.v: भ्राता मे क्वावसद्रात्रिं क्व सीता क्व च लक्ष्मणः । अस्वपच्छयने कस्मिन्किं भुक्त्वा गुह शंस मे ।।
data.es: O Guha where did my brother Rama, Sita and Lakshmana spend that night? What did they eat? On what couch did they sleep? Tell me all that.
data.anv: गुह O Guha, मे भ्राता my brother, रात्रौ in the night, क्व where, अवसत् did he dwell, सीता Sita, क्व where did she stay, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, क्व where did he stay, किम् what, भुक्त्वा  having eaten, कस्मिन् in which, शयने couch, अस्वपत् did he sleep, मे to me, शंस tell me.
data.md: Where did my brother pass the night? And where did Sītā? And where did, again, Laks maņa? And in what bed did he sleep, and what did he previously partake of? Do you, O Guha, tell me this.

data.v: सोऽब्रवीद्भरतं पृष्टो निषादाधिपतिर्गुहः । यद्विधं प्रतिपेदे च रामे प्रियहितेऽतिथौ ।।
data.es: Thereupon delighted Guha, overlord of the nishadas, told Bharata all that he had provided to Rama, his beloved friend and guest:
data.anv: निषादाधिपतिः overlord of the nishadas, सः गुहः that Guha, हृष्टः delighted, प्रियहिते beloved  friend, अतिथौ guest, रामे relating to Rama, यद्विधम् in whatever way, प्रतिपेदे all that he had  provided, भरतम् to Bharata, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Thereat, well pleased, Gulha, the lord of Nişādas, related to Bharata how he had acted in respect of Rāma, his dear guest, studious of his welfare.

data.v: अन्नमुच्चावचं भक्ष्याः फलानि विविधानि च । रामायाभ्यवहारार्थं बहुचोपहृतं मया ।।
data.es: I offered Rama rice including a variety of eatables like fruits in great quantity for his food.
data.anv: मया by me, रामाय to Rama, अभ्यवहारार्थम् for the purpose of meal, उच्चावचम् of various kinds, अन्नम् rice, भक्षाः eatables, विविधानि of several kinds, फलानि च fruits also, बहु in great quantity, उपहृतम् was brought.
data.md: I procured for Rāma's use rice and fruits and roots and various kinds of food.

data.v: तत्सर्वं प्रत्यनुज्ञासीद्रामः सत्यपराक्रमः । न हि तत्प्रत्यगृह्णात्स क्षत्रधर्ममनुस्मरन् ।।
data.es: Rama whose prowess is his truth, acknowledged all that but remembering the duty enjoined on a kshatriya did not accept them.
data.anv: सत्यपराक्रमः a man with truth as prowess, रामः Rama, तत्सर्वम् all that, प्रत्यनुज्ञासीत् acknowledged ordered, सः he, क्षत्रधर्मम् the duty of a kshatriya, अनुस्मरन् remembering, तत् all that, न तु प्रत्यगृह्णात् did not accept it.
