data.md: All these Rāma having truth for his prowess accepted, but observing Ksatriya morality, he did not take them.

data.v: न ह्यस्माभिः प्रतिग्राह्यं सखे देयं तु सर्वदा । इति तेन वयं राजन्ननुनीता महात्मना ।।
data.es: O king that great Rama entreated us in a friendly manner by saying 'O friend we should always give to others but should never accept anything from others'.
data.anv: राजन् O king, सखे O friend, आस्माभिः by us, न प्रतिग्राह्यम् should not be received, सर्वदा always, देयम् should be given, इति thus, महात्मना by the great, तेन by him, वयम् we, अनुनीताः were entreated.
data.md: 'O friend, we ought not to take anything: ours is always to give.'

data.v: लक्ष्मणेन समानीतं पीत्वा वारि महायशाः । औपवास्यं तदाकार्षीद्राघवः सह सीतया ।।
data.es: Illustrious Rama along with Sita only drank the water brought by Lakshamana and undertook fasting.
data.anv: महायशाः the illustrious one, राघवः Rama, तदा then, लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, समानीतम् brought by, वारि water, सीतया सह with Sita, पीत्वा after drinking, औपवास्यम् fasting, अकार्षीत्  undertook.
data.md: Thus did that magnanimous one beseech us. On the high-souled Lakşmaņa bringing water, Rāghava having drunk it, fasted along with Sītā.

data.v: ततस्तु जलशेषेण लक्ष्मणोऽप्यकरोत्तदा । वाग्यतास्ते त्रयः संध्यामुपासत समाहिताः ।।
data.es: Thereafter Lakshmana also drank the remainder of water. Then all the three observing silence intently performed the evening worship.
data.anv: ततः तु thereafter, तदा then, लक्ष्मणोऽपि Lakshmana also, जलशेषेण with the remainder of the water, अकरोत् satisfied his hunger, ते त्रयः those three, वाग्यताः observing silence, संहिताः intently, सन्ध्याम् evening worship, समुपासत performed.
data.md: Then Lakşmaņa drank up the water that remained. Then the three with fixed minds silently performed their adorations to the Twilight.

data.v: सौमित्रिस्तु ततः पश्चादकरोत्स्वास्तरं शुभम् । स्वयमानीय बर्हींषि क्षिप्रं राघव कारणात् ।।
data.es: Therafter, the son of Sumitra (Lakshmana) himself fetched darbha grass and quickly prepared an auspicious and comfortable bed for Rama.
data.anv: ततः पश्चात् thereafter, सौमित्रिस्तु son of Sumitra on his part, स्वयम् himself, बर्हींषि darbha grass, आनीय having brought, राघवकारणात् for the sake of Rama, क्षिप्रम् quickly, शुभम् auspicious, स्वास्तरम् comfortable bed, अकरोत् prepared.
data.md: After that, Sumitrā's son prepared a goodly bed for Rāghava, himself bringing Kuća grass.

data.v: तस्मिन्समाविशद्रामः स्वास्तरे सह सीतया । प्रक्षाल्य च तयोः पादावपचक्राम लक्ष्मणः ।।
data.es: Rama lay down upon the bed along with Sita. Thereafter Lakshmana, having washed their feet, moved to a distant place.
data.anv: रामः Rama, तस्मिन् on that, स्वास्तरे bed, सीतया सह with Sita, समाविशत् lay down, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana,  तयोः their, पादौ feet, प्रक्षाल्य having washed, अपचक्राम left for a distant place.
data.md: And in that bed lay down Rāma in company with Sītā. Next washing their feet, Lakşmaņa turned away.

data.v: एतत्तदिङ्गुदीमूलमिदमेव च तत्तृणम् । यस्मिन्रामश्च सीता च रात्रिं तां शयितावुभौ ।।
data.es: Here at the foot of the ingudi tree and upon that bed of grass both Rama and Sita rested that night.
data.anv: रामश्च Rama as well as, सीता Sita, उभौ both, तां रात्रिम् that night, यस्मिन् where, शयितौ slept, तत् that, इंगुदीमूलम् foot of the ingudi tree, एतत् this only, तत् that, तृणं च grass bed, इदमेव this one only.
data.md: This is the foot of the Ingudī, and this that grass. On it both Rāma and Sītā lay down that night.

data.v: नियम्य पृष्ठे तु तलाङ्गुलित्रवा;ञ्शरैः सुपूर्णाविषुधी परंतपः । महद्धनुः सज्यमुपोह्य लक्ष्मणो; निशामतिष्ठत्परितोऽस्य केवलम् ।।
data.es: Lakshmana, the scorcher of enemies, wearing protective covering for his palms and fingers (made of gohaskin), strapping on his back two quivers filled with arrows, holding a great bow, strung ready, stood sentinel throughout the night guarding the surrounding.
data.anv: परन्तपः scorcher of enemies, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, तलाङ्गुलित्रवान् wearing protective covering for his palms and fingers (made of gohaskin), शरैः arrows, सुपूर्णौ filled with,  इषुधी two quivers, पृष्ठे on his back, नियम्य strapping, सज्यम् furnished with string, महत् great, धनुः bow, उपोह्य holding, निशाम् during that night, अस्य Rama's, परितः  surrounding, अतिष्ठत् केवलम् stood throughout.
data.md: Fastening on his back a pair of quivers filled with arrows furnished with finger-fences, and taking his mighty bow, Lakşmaņa all night kept watch around.

data.v: ततस्त्वहं चोत्तमबाणचापधृ;क्स्थितोऽभवं तत्र स यत्र लक्ष्मणः । अतन्द्रिभिर्ज्ञातिभिरात्तकार्मुकै;र्महेन्द्रकल्पं परिपालयंस्तदा ।।
data.es: Then, holding the best of arrows and bow along with my indefatigable kinsmen similarly armed with bows, I stood by the side of Lakshmana guarding Rama who is comparable to Indra.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे सप्ताशीतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eightyseventh sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, अहं तु as for me, तदा then, उत्तमबाणचापधृत् holding the best of arrows and bow, अतन्द्रितैः with the indefatigable, आत्तकार्मुकैः armed with bows, ज्ञातिभिः with my kinsmen, महेन्द्रकल्पम् comparable to Indra, परिपालयन् while protecting, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, यत्र wherever, तत्र there, स्थितः अभवम् remained standing.
data.md: I also taking an excellent bow, remained where remained Lakṣmaṇa, and surrounded by my kindred who stayed there vigilantly, equipped with bows, guarded him that resembled the mighty Indra.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा निपुणं सर्वं भरतः सह मन्त्रिभिः । इङ्गुदीमूलमागम्य रामशय्यामवेक्ष्य ताम् ।।
data.es: After listening to all that Guha had said, Bharatha reached the foot of the ingudi tree accompanied by his ministers and gazing at Rama's bed, said to all his mothers the magnanimous Rama rested that night here on this ground in that crushed bed.
data.anv: भरतः Bharata, तत् सर्वम् all that, निपुणम् attentively, श्रुत्वा having listened, मन्त्रिभिस्सह along with ministers, इङ्गुदीमूलम् to the foot of the ingudi tree, आगम्य having reached, ताम्  रामशय्याम् that Rama's bed, अवेक्ष gazing, सर्वाः all, जननीः mothers, अब्रवीत् said, तेन महात्मना by that magnanimous, Rama, इह here, भूमौ on the ground, शर्वरी night, शयिता has been slept, अस्य his, विमर्दितम् crushed bed, इदम् this one.
data.md: Having heard everything, Bharata in company with the counsellors went to the foot of the Ingudi tree and saw the bed of Rāma.

data.v: अब्रवीज्जननीः सर्वा इह तेन महात्मना । शर्वरी शयिता भूमाविदमस्य विमर्दितम् ।।
data.es: After listening to all that Guha had said, Bharatha reached the foot of the ingudi tree accompanied by his ministers and gazing at Rama's bed, said to all his mothers the magnanimous Rama rested that night here on this ground in that crushed bed.
data.anv: भरतः Bharata, तत् सर्वम् all that, निपुणम् attentively, श्रुत्वा having listened, मन्त्रिभिस्सह along with ministers, इङ्गुदीमूलम् to the foot of the ingudi tree, आगम्य having reached, ताम्  रामशय्याम् that Rama's bed, अवेक्ष gazing, सर्वाः all, जननीः mothers, अब्रवीत् said, तेन महात्मना by that magnanimous, Rama, इह here, भूमौ on the ground, शर्वरी night, शयिता has been slept, अस्य his, विमर्दितम् crushed bed, इदम् this one.
data.md: And he said to his mothers, That high-souled one lay down here on the ground during the night, and his limbs pressed this spot.

data.v: महाभागकुलीनेन महाभागेन धीमता । जातो दशरथेनोर्व्यां न रामः स्वप्तुमर्हति ।।
data.es: Rama, son of highly fortunate and sagacious Dasaratha, born of a noble lineage does not deserve to rest on this naked earth.
data.anv: महाभागकुलीनेन by the highborn, महाभागेन by a highly fortunate man, धीमता by the sagacious, दशरथेन by Dasaratha, जातः born, रामः Rama, उर्व्याम् on the naked earth, स्वप्तुम् to sleep, न अर्हति does not deserve.
data.md: Begot of that foremost of monarchs, the exalted and intelligent Daſaratha, Rāma does not deserve to sleep on the earth.

data.v: अजिनोत्तरसंस्तीर्णे वरास्तरणसंचये । शयित्वा पुरुषव्याघ्रः कथं शेते महीतले ।।
data.es: How could Rama, the best among men used to a bed made of a pile of excellent spreads and overspread with deer skin, sleep on the bare ground?
data.anv: पुरुषव्याघ्रः best among men, Rama, अजिनोत्तरसंस्तीर्णे on over spreads of deer skin,          वरास्तरणसंचये on bed made of a pile of excellent spreads, शयित्वा used to sleep, महीतले on the ground, कथम् how, शेते can sleep?
data.md: How can that chief of men having reposed in beds furnished with pillows made of deer-skins and having superb cloths, have lain down on the earth?

data.v: प्रासादाग्र विमानेषु वलभीषु च सर्वदा । हैमराजतभौमेषु वरास्तरणशालिषु ।।
पुष्पसंचयचित्रेषु चन्दनागरुगन्धिषु । पाण्डुराभ्रप्रकाशेषु शुकसंघरुतेषु च ।।
गीतवादित्रनिर्घोषैर्वराभरणनिःस्वनैः । मृदङ्गवरशब्दैश्च सततं प्रतिबोधितः ।।
बन्दिभिर्वन्दितः काले बहुभिः सूतमागधैः । गाथाभिरनुरूपाभिः स्तुतिभिश्च परंतपः ।।
अश्रद्धेयमिदं लोके न सत्यं प्रतिभाति मा । मुह्यते खलु मे भावः स्वप्नोऽयमिति मे मतिः ।।
data.es: It is unbelievable that such a thing has happened to Rama in this world. It does not seem real to me and looks appears like a dream and my mind is bewildered.
data.anv: लोके in the world, इदम् this, अश्रद्धेयम् can not be believed, सत्यम् truly, मा to me, न प्रतिभाति does not appear, मे my, भावः thought (mind), मुह्यते खलु is bewildered, अयम् this, स्वप्नः इति like a dream, मे my, मतिः thinking.
data.md: It does by no means look to me like truth. Forsooth, I am amazed. I take it, this is a vision.

data.v: न नूनं दैवतं किंचित्कालेन बलवत्तरम् । यत्र दाशरथी रामो भूमावेवं शयीत सः ।।
data.es: Dasaratha's son, Rama had to rest on the ground would admittedly mean that no divine power is mightier than Time (Destiny).
data.anv: दैवतम् divine power, कालेन in course of time, किंचित् even a little, बलवत्तरम् more strong, न not, नूनम् surely, यत्र where, सः दाशरथि: that Dasaratha's son, रामः Rama, भूमावेव on the ground itself, शयीत had to sleep.
data.md: Verily, no destiny is superior to Time, since Dasaratha's son, Rāma himself, had to repose on the earth, and the beauteous beloved daughter of Videha's king, and the daughter-in-law of Dasaratha, had to lie down on the ground.

data.v: विदेहराजस्य सुता सीता च प्रियदर्शना । दयिता शयिता भूमौ स्नुषा दशरथस्य च ।।
data.es: Sita, daughter of Janaka, king of Videha, and beloved daughterinlaw of Dasaratha who caused delight to the beholder, too had to rest on the bare ground.
data.anv: विदेहराजस्य king of Videha, सुता daughter, प्रियदर्शना one who causes delight to the beholder, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, दयिता beloved, स्नुषा च daughterinlaw also, सीता च Sita too, भूमौ on the ground, शयिता rested.

data.v: इयं शय्या मम भ्रातुरिदं हि परिवर्तितम् । स्थण्डिले कठिने सर्वं गात्रैर्विमृदितं तृणम् ।।
data.es: This is my brother's couch and it is here where he had tossed about. The grass spread on this hard surface is crushed by his limbs.
data.anv: इयम् this, मम भ्रातुः my brother's, शय्या couch, इदम् here, परिवर्तितं हि tossed about, कठिने on a hard, स्थण्डिले earth, सर्वम् entire, तृणम् grass, गात्रैः by his limbs, विमृदितम् is crushed.
data.md: This was the bed of my brother; on this hard spot did he turn his lovely limbs, and this grass was pressed by them.

data.v: मन्ये साभरणा सुप्ता सीतास्मिञ्शयने तदा । तत्र तत्र हि दृश्यन्ते सक्ताः कनकबिन्दवः ।।
data.es: Some particles of gold dust are seen stuck to this bed here and there. I think Sita might have rested on this excellent bed with all her jewellery.
data.anv: सीता Sita, अस्मिन् this, शयनोत्तमे on excellent bed, साभरणा with her jewellery, सुप्ता must have slept, मन्ये I think, तत्र तत्र here and there, सक्ताः stuck to, कनकबिन्दवः particles of gold dust, दृश्यन्ते are seen.
data.md: I think that the graceful Sītā adorned with ornaments slept in this bed, for here and there are scattered particles of gold.

data.v: उत्तरीयमिहासक्तं सुव्यक्तं सीतया तदा । तथा ह्येते प्रकाशन्ते सक्ताः कौशेयतन्तवः ।।
data.es: That the upper garment of Sita might have been caught here is well evident from the shining silken threads stuck.
data.anv: तदा then, सीतया by Sita, उत्तरीयम् upper garment, इह here, आसक्तम् had been, सुव्यक्तम् is  is well evident, तथाहि as for instance, सक्ताः stuck, एते कौशेयतन्तवः these silken threads, प्रकाशन्ते are shining.
data.md: It is clear that Sītā had spread her sheet at this spot, hence it is that fibres of silk are discoverable here.

data.v: मन्ये भर्तुः सुखा शय्या येन बाला तपस्विनी । सुकुमारी सती दुःखं न विजानाति मैथिली ।।
data.es: Hapless Sita is young and delicate. Being a chaste lady, she, even in these (adverse) circumstances, does not feel the brunt. Hence, maybe she thinks her husbands' (hard) bed comfortable to her.
data.anv: येन for what reason, बाला the young lady, तपस्विनी unfortunate, सुकुमारी delicate lady, सती chaste lady, मैथिली Sita, दुःखम् suffering, न हि (वि)जानाति does not know, for that reason, भर्तुः husband's, शय्या bed, सुखा comfortable, मन्ये I think.
data.md: I deem that the bed of her lord appears agreeable to a wife, since a girl tender and in affliction, the chaste daughter of Mithilā experienced no inconvenience (in sleeping in one such).

data.v: सार्वभौम कुले जातः सर्वलोकसुखावहः । सर्वलोकप्रियस्त्यक्त्वा राज्यं प्रियमनुत्तमम् ।।
data.es: How could such Rama sleep on the ground? He was born in the house of emperors, worthy of reverence by the entire world and beloved of all the worlds, with the complexion of a blue lotus, with red eyes, and pleasing looks, one who deserves to be happy and not to suffer by renouncing the kingdom and excellent comforts.
data.anv: सार्वभौमकुले in the house of emperors, जातः was born, सर्वलोकस्य of the entire world, सम्मतः worthy of reverence, सर्वलोकप्रियः beloved of all the worlds, इन्दीवरश्यामः with the complexion of a blue lotus, रक्ताक्षः of reddened eyes, प्रियदर्शनः pleasing to look, सुखभागी worthy of happiness, न दुःखार्हः does not deserve suffering, राघवः Rama, राज्यम् kingdom, अनुत्तमम् excellent, सुखम् comforts, त्यक्त्वा having given up, भुवि on this ground, कथम् how, शयितः did he sleep?
data.md: Born in the imperial race, and capable of conferring happiness on all, the bringer-about of all good, why did Rāghava of dark blue hue like that of a lotus, graceful, and crowned with red eyes, the inheritor of happiness and undeserving of misery, having left his dear consummate kingdom, lie down on the ground?

data.v: कथमिन्दीवरश्यामो रक्ताक्षः प्रियदर्शनः । सुखभागी च दुःखार्हः शयितो भुवि राघवः ।।
data.es: How could such Rama sleep on the ground? He was born in the house of emperors, worthy of reverence by the entire world and beloved of all the worlds, with the complexion of a blue lotus, with red eyes, and pleasing looks, one who deserves to be happy and not to suffer by renouncing the kingdom and excellent comforts.
data.anv: सार्वभौमकुले in the house of emperors, जातः was born, सर्वलोकस्य of the entire world, सम्मतः worthy of reverence, सर्वलोकप्रियः beloved of all the worlds, इन्दीवरश्यामः with the complexion of a blue lotus, रक्ताक्षः of reddened eyes, प्रियदर्शनः pleasing to look, सुखभागी worthy of happiness, न दुःखार्हः does not deserve suffering, राघवः Rama, राज्यम् kingdom, अनुत्तमम् excellent, सुखम् comforts, त्यक्त्वा having given up, भुवि on this ground, कथम् how, शयितः did he sleep?
data.md: Born in the imperial race, and capable of conferring happiness on all, the bringer-about of all good, why did Rāghava of dark blue hue like that of a lotus, graceful, and crowned with red eyes, the inheritor of happiness and undeserving of misery, having left his dear consummate kingdom, lie down on the ground?

data.v: सिद्धार्था खलु वैदेही पतिं यानुगता वनम् । वयं संशयिताः सर्वे हीनास्तेन महात्मना ।।
data.es: Sita has, indeed, accomplished her object by accompanying her husband (to the forest). Bereft of that magnanimous Rama, all of us are in doubt (if he will accept our services).
data.anv: या that Sita, वनम् to the forest, पतिम् husband, अनुगता had followed, वैदेही Sita, सिद्धार्था खलु has surely acomplished her object, महात्मना by the magnanimous, तेन by that Rama, हीनाः bereft of, वयम् we, सर्वे all, संशयिताः are full of doubts.
data.md: And blessed is Videha's daughter who follows her husband into the woods. Bereft of that magnanimous one, we have all been brought into jeopardy.

data.v: अकर्णधारा पृथिवी शून्येव प्रतिभाति मा । गते दशरथे स्वर्गे रामे चारण्यमाश्रिते ।।
data.es: King Dasaratha having ascended to heaven and Rama taken shelter in the forest, this kingdom appears to me like a ship without a helmsman.
data.anv: दशरथे Dasaratha, स्वर्गम् to heaven, गते having ascended, रामे च when Rama too, अरण्यम् forest, आश्रिते having taken shelter, पृथिवी earth, आकर्णधारा without helmsman, नौः इव like a ship, मा to me, प्रतिभाति appears.
data.md: The Earth without her helmsman seems to me quite empty, on Dasaratha having ascended the celestial regions and Rāma taken refuge in the wilderness.

data.v: न च प्रार्थयते कश्चिन्मनसापि वसुंधराम् । वनेऽपि वसतस्तस्य बाहुवीर्याभिरक्षिताम् ।।
data.es: No one, even in thought, would ever desire this kingdom, protected by the strength of his arms even while residing in the forest.
data.anv: वने in the forest, वसतः अपि though residing, तस्य his, बाहुवीर्याभिरक्षिताम् protected by the might of his arms, वसुन्धराम् this earth, कश्चित् none, मनसापि even in thought, न च प्रार्थयते does not desire.
data.md: On Rãma having set up his dwelling in the forest, one (like me) does not even mentally covet this earth which had been protected by the immense prowess (of Rāghava).

data.v: शून्यसंवरणारक्षामयन्त्रितहयद्विपाम् । अपावृतपुरद्वारां राजधानीमरक्षिताम् ।।
data.es: Now the gates of our capital city (Ayodhya) are wide open. The city is unprotected and endangered. There are no guards to keep vigil over the ramparts. The horses and elephants are not in control (hence unprepared for battle). The army is unhappy and demoralised. At this state even the enemies will not like to seize the city, they will shun it like food mixed with poison.
data.anv: शून्यसंवरणारक्षां without guards to keep vigil over the ramparts, अयन्त्रितहयद्विपाम् with horses and elephants are not in control, अपावृतपुरद्वाराम् with the city gates kept wide open, अरक्षिताम् unprotected, अप्रहृष्टबलाम् unhappy army, शून्याम् empty (demoralised), विषमस्थाम् in dire difficulties, अनावृताम् wide open, राजधानीम् the capital city (Ayodhya), शत्रवः enemies, विषकृतान् mixed with poison, भक्षानिव like food, नाभिमन्यन्ते will not think of.
data.md: With her walls undefined, her horses and elephants unrestrained, and her gates left open, the defenceless metropolis deprived of her power, placed in peril and without any protection, is surely not regarded by the enemies, like food mixed with poison.

data.v: अप्रहृष्टबलां न्यूनां विषमस्थामनावृताम् । शत्रवो नाभिमन्यन्ते भक्ष्यान्विषकृतानिव ।।
data.es: Now the gates of our capital city (Ayodhya) are wide open. The city is unprotected and endangered. There are no guards to keep vigil over the ramparts. The horses and elephants are not in control (hence unprepared for battle). The army is unhappy and demoralised. At this state even the enemies will not like to seize the city, they will shun it like food mixed with poison.
data.anv: शून्यसंवरणारक्षां without guards to keep vigil over the ramparts, अयन्त्रितहयद्विपाम् with horses and elephants are not in control, अपावृतपुरद्वाराम् with the city gates kept wide open, अरक्षिताम् unprotected, अप्रहृष्टबलाम् unhappy army, शून्याम् empty (demoralised), विषमस्थाम् in dire difficulties, अनावृताम् wide open, राजधानीम् the capital city (Ayodhya), शत्रवः enemies, विषकृतान् mixed with poison, भक्षानिव like food, नाभिमन्यन्ते will not think of.
data.md: With her walls undefined, her horses and elephants unrestrained, and her gates left open, the defenceless metropolis deprived of her power, placed in peril and without any protection, is surely not regarded by the enemies, like food mixed with poison.

data.v: अद्य प्रभृति भूमौ तु शयिष्येऽहं तृणेषु वा । फलमूलाशनो नित्यं जटाचीराणि धारयन् ।।
data.es: From today onwards, wearing matted hair and clad in robes made of bark and living on fruits and roots, I too shall sleep on the naked ground or on grass.
data.anv: अद्य प्रभृति from today, अहम् I, जटाचीराणि matted hair and robes made of bark, धारयन् wearing, नित्यम् always, फलमूलाशनः eating fruits and roots, भूमौ तु on the ground itself, तृणेषु वा or on the grass, शयिष्ये I will sleep.
data.md: From this day forth I will lie down on the ground, or on the grass, daily subsisting on fruits and roots, and bearing matted locks and a cloth of bark.

data.v: तस्यार्थमुत्तरं कालं निवत्स्यामि सुखं वने । तं प्रतिश्रवमामुच्य नास्य मिथ्या भविष्यति ।।
data.es: Taking upon myself the vow of Rama, I too shall live in the forest cheerfully for the rest of the term on behalf of him so that his vow shall not prove untrue.
data.anv: तम् Rama's, प्रतिश्रवम् vow, आमुच्य casting on me, उत्तरं कालम् the rest of his term (of exile), तस्य अर्थम् on account of him, वने in the forest, सुखम् cheerfully, निवत्स्यामि shall dwell, अस्य his vow, मिथ्या untrue, न भविष्यति shall not become.
data.md: And for his sake I will in future live happily in the woods. (By my doing so), the promise of that high-minded one shall not be rendered null.

data.v: वसन्तं भ्रातुरर्थाय शत्रुघ्नो मानुवत्स्यति । लक्ष्मणेन सह त्वार्यो अयोध्यां पालयिष्यति ।।
data.es: As I live in the forest on behalf of my brother Rama, Satrughna will live with me. My esteemed brother Rama will rule Ayodhya along with Lakshmana.
data.anv: शत्रुघ्नः Satrughna, भ्रातुः अर्थाय on behalf of my  brother Rama, वसन्तम् living (in the forest), मा me, अनुवत्स्यति will live by following me, आर्यः esteemed brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह along with Lakshmana, अयोध्याम् Ayodhya, पालयिष्यति हि will rule.
data.md: Me residing in the forest in the interests of my brother, Satrughna shall bear company; while my noble one will rule Ayodhyā assisted by Laksmana.

data.v: अभिषेक्ष्यन्ति काकुत्स्थमयोध्यायां द्विजातयः । अपि मे देवताः कुर्युरिमं सत्यं मनोरथम् ।।
data.es: In Ayodhya the brahmins shall coronate Rama. Will the gods make this desire of mine true?
data.anv: द्विजातयः brahmins, काकुत्स्थम् to Rama, अयोध्यायाम् in Ayodhya, अभिषेक्ष्यन्ति will crown him, देवताः gods, इमम् this, मे my, मनोरथम् desire, सत्यम् as true, अपि कुर्युः will they make it?
data.md: The twice-born ones will sprinkle Kākutstha in Ayodhyā. May the deities realize this desire of mine!

data.v: प्रसाद्यमानः शिरसा मया स्वयं; बहुप्रकारं यदि न प्रपत्स्यते । ततोऽनुवत्स्यामि चिराय राघवं; वने वसन्नार्हति मामुपेक्षितुम् ।।
data.es: I will seek his grace in many ways by bowing down my head. Even then if Rama does not grant my wish, I shall also live with him as long as it takes. He will not be able to ignore a forester like me.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे अष्टाशीतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eightyeigth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: मया by me, स्वयम् personally, बहुप्रकारम् in many ways, शिरसा bowing down my head, प्रसाद्यमानः seeking his grace, न प्रपत्स्यते यदि if it is not granted, ततः then, वने चरन् living in the forest, राघवम् Rama, चिराय for a long time, अनुवत्स्यामि will live along him, माम् me, उपेक्षितुम् to ignore, नार्हति he cannot.
data.md: Propitiated by me personally in various ways with bent head, if he do not consent, then shall I ever stay with Rāghava in the woods. Surely he cannot long persist in putting me off.

data.v: व्युष्य रात्रिं तु तत्रैव गङ्गाकूले स राघवः । भरतः काल्यमुत्थाय शत्रुघ्नमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Bharata got up at daybreak after spending the night on the bank of the Ganga at that very place where Rama, the descendent of Raghu, had stayed. And said these words to Satrughna:
data.anv: राघवः born in the race of Raghu, सः भरतः that Bharata, तत्र there, गङ्गाकूले एव on the bank of the river Ganga only, रात्रिम् night, उष्य having stayed, काल्यम् at daybreak, उत्थाय rising, शत्रुघ्नम् Satrughna, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Having spent the night there on the banks of the Gangā, that descendant of Raghu rising early in the morning, said these words to Satrughna.

data.v: शत्रुघोत्तिष्ठ किं शेषे निषादाधिपतिं गुहम् । शीघ्रमानय भद्रं ते तारयिष्यति वाहिनीम् ।।
data.es: O Satrughna, blessings to you Why are you still alseep? Arise fetch Guha the king of the nishadas quickly. He will ferry the army across the river.
data.anv: शत्रुघ्न Satrughna, उत्तिष्ठ arise, किम् why, शेषे are you asleep, ते for you, भद्रम् blessings to you, निषादाधिपतिम् overlord of Nishada, गुहम् Guha, शीघ्रम् quickly, आनय fetch, वाहिनीम् the army, तारयिष्यति he will help us in ferrying across.
data.md: O Śatrughna, arise! Why sleepest you? Bring you at once that lord of the Nisādhas, Guha, Good betide you! he will take the army (over the stream.)

data.v: जागर्मि नाहं स्वपिमि तथैवार्यं विचिन्तयन् । इत्येवमब्रवीद्भ्रात्रा शत्रुघ्नोऽपि प्रचोदितः ।।
data.es: Urged by his brother Bharata, Satrughna replied 'I am not asleep. I am awake. I am deeply thinking of our esteemed brother, Rama'
data.anv: भ्राता the brother, शत्रुघ्नोऽपि Satrughna also, प्रचोदितः having been urged upon, अहम् I, तम् that, आर्यम् एव about esteemed brother Rama only, विचिन्तयन् thinking about, जागर्मि I am awake, न स्वपिमि not sleeping, इत्येवम् in this way, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Thus urged by his brother, Śatrughna said, "Thinking of that noble one (Rāma), I have not slept, but have remained awake in a like manner. *i.e., as you have done.

data.v: इति संवदतोरेवमन्योन्यं नरसिंहयोः । आगम्य प्राञ्जलिः काले गुहो भरतमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: While the two lions among men, Bharata and Satrughna were thus conversing with each other, Guha came in the appropriate time and said to Bharata with folded palms:
data.anv: नरसिंहयोः lions among men, Bharata and Satrughna, इत्येवम् in this way, अन्योन्यम् with one another, संवदतोः while both of them were conversing, गुहः Guha, काले at appropriate time, आगम्य having arrived, प्राञ्जलिः with folded palms, भरतम् to Bharata, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: As those chiefs of men were thus conversing with each other, Guha appearing in time with joined hands, remarked.

data.v: कच्चित्सुखं नदीतीरेऽवात्सीः काकुत्स्थ शर्वरीम् । कच्चिच्च सह सैन्यस्य तव सर्वमनामयम् ।।
data.es: O scion of the Kakutstha race (Bharata) I trust, you and your army passed the night on the river bank comfortably without any inconvenience.
data.anv: काकुत्थ्स O scion of the Kakutstha race (Bharata), शर्वरीम् night, नदीतीरे on the bank of the river, सुखम् comfortably, कच्चित् वात्सीः you had passed, I hope, सह सैन्यस्य along with the army, ते to you, सर्वम् all, अनामयं तावत् कच्चित् there was no inconvenience, I trust.
data.md: O Kākutstha, have you spent the night happily on the banks of the river? And is it continuous good fortune with you along with your forces?

data.v: गुहस्य तत्तु वचनं श्रुत्वा स्नेहादुदीरितम् । रामस्यानुवशो वाक्यं भरतोऽपीदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: On hearing Guha's affectionate words Bharata, ever obedient to Rama, replied:
data.anv: रामस्य of Rama, अनुवशः obedient, भरतोऽपि Bharata too, स्नेहात् out of affection, उदीरितम् uttered, तत् that, गुहस्य Guha's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, इदं वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Hearing Guha's speech fraught with affection, Bharata ever obedient to Rāma, spoke on his pare, saying. "Happily have we spent the night; and we have also been well received by you. Now let your servants take us over by means of many boats."

data.v: सुखा नः शर्वरी राजन्पूजिताश्चापि ते वयम् । गङ्गां तु नौभिर्बह्वीभिर्दाशाः संतारयन्तु नः ।।
data.es: O king (Guha) the night passed comfortably for us. We have been honoured by you in many ways. Let your fishermen be ordered to ferry us across the Ganga in their boats.
data.anv: राजन् O king, नः for us, शर्वरी the night, सुखा comfortable, वयम् we, ते to (by) you, पूजिताश्चापि have been honoured, दाशाः fishermen, बह्वीभिः by many, नौभिः boats, नः us, गङ्गाम् the river Ganga, सन्तारयन्तु please, ferry us across.
data.md: Hearing Guha's speech fraught with affection, Bharata ever obedient to Rāma, spoke on his pare, saying. "Happily have we spent the night; and we have also been well received by you. Now let your servants take us over by means of many boats."

data.v: ततो गुहः संत्वरितः श्रुत्वा भरतशासनम् । प्रतिप्रविश्य नगरं तं ज्ञातिजनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Then at Bharata's command Guha returned to his habitation quickly and said to his relations:
data.anv: ततः then, गुहः Guha, सन्त्वरितम् quickly, भरतशासनम् at Bharata's command, श्रुत्वा having heard, नगरम् his establishment, प्रति प्रविश्य having entered, तम् that, ज्ञातिजनम् to his relations, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Thereat, hearing Bharata's mandate, Guha, bestirring himself, re-entered the city and addressed his kinsfolk, saying.

data.v: उत्तिष्ठत प्रबुध्यध्वं भद्रमस्तु हि वः सदा । नावः समनुकर्षध्वं तारयिष्याम वाहिनीम् ।।
data.es: Arise and awake. May you be ever blessed. Haul down the boats into the river. We have to ferry the army (across the river).
data.anv: उत्तिष्ठत arise, प्रबुध्यध्वम् awake, सदा always, वः भद्रम् अस्तु be blessed, नावः the boats, समनुकर्षध्वम् haul down, वाहिनीम् the army, तारयिष्याम we shall ferry them across.
data.md: Arise you! Awake! May good always attend you! Do you draw up the boats; I shall ferry the forces over.

data.v: ते तथोक्ताः समुत्थाय त्वरिता राजशासनात् । पञ्च नावां शतान्येव समानिन्युः समन्ततः ।।
data.es: On hearing these words, they arose in haste and immediately brought five hundred boats from every direction in accordance with the command of their king (Guha).
data.anv: तथा thus, उक्ताः addressed, ते they, राजशासनात् by the king's command, त्वरिताः in haste, आशु immediately, समन्ततः from every direction, नावाम् of the boats, पञ्चशतानि five hundreds, समानिन्युः brought.
data.md: Thus asked, they arising and bestirring themselves in consequence of the king's command, brought up five hundred boats around.

data.v: अन्याः स्वस्तिकविज्ञेया महाघण्डा धरा वराः । शोभमानाः पताकिन्यो युक्तवाताः सुसंहताः ।।
data.es: They brought excellent boats known as Swastika, solidly built, they lookd magnificent, filled with large bells, sails and flags.
data.anv: महाघंटाधराः fitted with large bells, वराः excellent, पताकाभिः with flags, शोभमानाः looking  magnificent, युक्तवाताः filled with sails, सुसंहताः built solidly, स्वस्तिकविज्ञेयाः known as Swastika, अन्याः also some other boats (brought).
data.md: Others also known by the name of Swastika, bearing large bells on their prows, and banners, well decked out, furnished with oars, and manned by bargemen, with their joints firmly constructed, (were brought up).

data.v: ततः स्वस्तिकविज्ञेयां पाण्डुकम्बलसंवृताम् । सनन्दिघोषां कल्याणीं गुहो नावमुपाहरत् ।।
data.es: Then Guha personally brought an auspicious boat known as Swastika covered with white canvas and generating captivating sounds.
data.anv: ततः then, गुहः Guha, पाण्डुकम्बलसंवृताम् covered with white canvas, सनन्दिघोषाम् generating aptivating sounds, कल्याणीं auspicious, स्वस्तिकविज्ञेयाम् known as Swastika, नावम् boat, उपाहरत् brought.
data.md: And Guha himself brought a graceful barge called Swastika, covered with pale woollen cloth, and resounding with music.

data.v: तामारुरोह भरतः शत्रुघ्नश्च महाबलः । कौसल्या च सुमित्रा च याश्चान्या राजयोषितः ।।
data.es: The family priest (Vasistha) and other brahmins were the first to board. Next mighty Bharata and Satrughna, Kausalya, Sumitra, women of the palace including the other wives of the king and wagons and supplies followed.
data.anv: भरतः Bharata, ताम् आरुरोह boarded it, महाबलः of great strength, शत्रुघ्नश्च Satrughna also, कौसल्या च Kausalya, सुमित्रा च Sumitra, अन्याः other, याः राजयोषितः other royal women, तत्पूर्वम् before them, पुरोहितश्च family priest (Vasistha), गुरवः preceptors, ये ब्राह्मणाश्च such  brahmins, अनन्तरम् thereafter, राजदाराः king's wives, तथैव also, शकटापणाः wagons and supplies.
data.md: On this boat ascended Bharata, the mighty Śatrughna, Kausalyā, Sumitrā, and other wives of the king. The priests, and preceptors belonging to the Brāhmaṇa order, has already ascended. After (Bharata and others had got up), ascended the wives of auxiliary princes, and cars and provisions were got on board.

data.v: पुरोहितश्च तत्पूर्वं गुरवे ब्राह्मणाश्च ये । अनन्तरं राजदारास्तथैव शकटापणाः ।।
data.es: The family priest (Vasistha) and other brahmins were the first to board. Next mighty Bharata and Satrughna, Kausalya, Sumitra, women of the palace including the other wives of the king and wagons and supplies followed.
data.anv: भरतः Bharata, ताम् आरुरोह boarded it, महाबलः of great strength, शत्रुघ्नश्च Satrughna also, कौसल्या च Kausalya, सुमित्रा च Sumitra, अन्याः other, याः राजयोषितः other royal women, तत्पूर्वम् before them, पुरोहितश्च family priest (Vasistha), गुरवः preceptors, ये ब्राह्मणाश्च such  brahmins, अनन्तरम् thereafter, राजदाराः king's wives, तथैव also, शकटापणाः wagons and supplies.
data.md: On this boat ascended Bharata, the mighty Śatrughna, Kausalyā, Sumitrā, and other wives of the king. The priests, and preceptors belonging to the Brāhmaṇa order, has already ascended. After (Bharata and others had got up), ascended the wives of auxiliary princes, and cars and provisions were got on board.

data.v: आवासमादीपयतां तीर्थं चाप्यवगाहताम् । भाण्डानि चाददानानां घोषस्त्रिदिवमस्पृशत् ।।
data.es: The clamour of the people setting fire to the temporary shelters in that camp, descending down the river and transporting the supplies into the boats reached the heaven.
data.anv: आवासम् the shelters in that camp, आदीपयताम् those who are burning, तीर्थं चापि through the descent of the river, अवगाहताम् those who are going down, भाण्डानि supplies, आददानानाम् of transporting, घोषः clamour, त्रिदिवम् the heaven, अस्पृशत् not touching.
data.md: And the uproar consequent of the troops burning down dwellings, pressing down descents to the river, and loading goods, spread on all sides.

data.v: पताकिन्यस्तु ता नावः स्वयं दाशैरधिष्ठिताः । वहन्त्यो जनमारूढं तदा संपेतुराशुगाः ।।
data.es: Those boats adorned with flags were propelled by the fishermen occupying them. They sailed with men rowing on board fast.
data.anv: पताकिन्यः (adorned) with flags, दाशैः by the fishermen, स्वयम् themselves, अधिष्ठिताः  occupied, ताः नावः those boats, तदा then, आरूढम् boarded, जनम् men, वह्नत्यः carrying, आशुगाः swiftly rowing men, सम्पेतुः moved.
data.md: Then those boats hung with pennons, managed by the kinsfolk (of Guha), set off at speed with the teeming folks that had got on board.

data.v: नारीणामभिपूर्णास्तु काश्चित्काश्चित्तु वाजिनाम् । कश्चित्तत्र वहन्ति स्म यानयुग्यं महाधनम् ।।
data.es: Some boats were filled with women, some others with horses. while still others transported draught animals for drawing carriages and the great treasures.
data.anv: अत्र there, काश्चित् some boats, नारीणाम् with women, अभिपूर्णाः were filled with, काश्चित् some others, वाजिनाम् with horses, काश्चित् while still others, यानयुग्यम् the draught animals for drawing carriages, महाधनम् great treasures, वहन्ति स्म were transporting.
data.md: And some of these were filled with women, and some with horses, and some conveyed cars and cattle of great value.

data.v: ताः स्म गत्वा परं तीरमवरोप्य च तं जनम् । निवृत्ताः काण्डचित्राणि क्रियन्ते दाशबन्धुभिः ।।
data.es: Having reached the other bank, the men disembarked. While returning, the fisherfolk exhibited their craft of lovely formations.
data.anv: ताः those, परं तीरम् the other bank, गत्वा having reached, तं जनम् the men, अवरोप्य disembarked, निवृत्ताः स्म returned, दाशबन्धुभिः the fisherfolk, काण्डचित्राणि lovely formations with their craft, क्रियन्ते स्म exhibited.
data.md: And going to the other bank and landing the crowds on the shore, the friends and slaves (of Guha) while returning, movements (of the boats).

data.v: सवैजयन्तास्तु गजा गजारोहैः प्रचोदिताः । तरन्तः स्म प्रकाशन्ते सध्वजा इव पर्वताः ।।
data.es: The elephants, embellished with banners and goaded by their mahouts looked splendid like mountains with banners while crossing in the water.
data.anv: सवैजयन्ताः embellished with banners, गजारोहप्रचोदिताः goaded by their mahouts, गजाः the elephants, तरन्तः while crossing the water, सध्वजाः with flags, पर्वताः इव like mountains, प्रकाशन्ते स्म were shining.
data.md: And elephants graced with flags ing spurred on by their riders, began to cross the stream, appearing like (so many) winged hills.

data.v: नावश्चारुरुहुस्त्वन्ये प्लवैस्तेरुस्तथापरे । अन्ये कुम्भघटैस्तेरुरन्ये तेरुश्च बाहुभिः ।।
data.es: Only some of the people were able to board the boats. Some others crossed on rafts and on large pots. Still others swam with their arms.
data.anv: अन्ये other, नावः boats, आरुरुहुश्च boarded, अपरे others, तथा like that, प्लवैः on rafts, तेरुः crossed, अन्ये others, कुम्भघटैः with large pots, तेरुः crossed, अन्ये others, बाहुभिः with their arms, तेरुः च crossed.
data.md: Others ascended boats, and others crossed on rafts, others crossed by means of reversed pitchers, and others by their arms alone.

data.v: सा पुण्या ध्वजिनी गङ्गां दाशैः संतारिता स्वयम् । मैत्रे मुहूर्ते प्रययौ प्रयागवनमुत्तमम् ।।
data.es: The auspicious army, ferried across the river Ganga by the fishermen, reached the great forest of Prayaga at the auspicious hour of Maitra.
data.anv: दाशैः by the fishermen, स्वयम् themselves, गङ्गाम् the river Ganga, सन्तारिता ferried over, पुण्या auspicious, सा ध्वजिनी army, मैत्रे मुहूर्ते at the auspicious hour of Maitra, उत्तमम् great, प्रयागवनम् forest of Prayaga, प्रययौ reached.
data.md: Ferried over the Gangā by the servants (of Guha), that beautiful army graced with streamers, at the third Muhurta arrived at the romantic woods of Prayāga.

data.v: आश्वासयित्वा च चमूं महात्मा; निवेशयित्वा च यथोपजोषम् । द्रष्टुं भरद्वाजमृषिप्रवर्य;मृत्विग्वृतः सन्भरतः प्रतस्थे ।।
data.es: The noble Bharata, got his army encamped according to their pleasure and set out, accompanied by his priests, to see the distinguished sage Bharadwaja.
data.anv: महात्मा the noble one, भरतः Bharata, चमूम् the army, आश्वासयित्वा having rested, यथोपजोषम्  according to their pleasure, निवेशयित्वा having encamped, ऋषिप्रवर्यम् the distinguished rishi, भरद्वाजम् Bharadwaja, द्रष्टुम् to see, ऋत्विग्वृतस्सन् surrounded by his priests, प्रतस्थे  set out.

data.v: भरद्वाजाश्रमं दृष्ट्वा क्रोशादेव नरर्षभः । बलं सर्वमवस्थाप्य जगाम सह मन्त्रिभिः ।।
data.es: Bharata, the knower of righteous ways and the best among men, saw the hermitage of Bharadwaja from a distance of one krosa and brought his entire army to a halt. He laid aside all his royal robes and weapons. Clad in silk garments, he went on foot along with his ministers, with the family priest Vasistha ahead of him.
data.anv: धर्मज्ञः knower of righteous ways, नरर्षभः the best among men, क्रोशादेव from a distance of one krosa, भरद्वाजाश्रमम् Bharadwaja's hermitage, दृष्ट्वा having seen, सर्वम् entire, बलम् army, अवस्थाप्य  brought to a halt, न्यस्तशस्त्रपरिच्छदः lay aside the royal robes and weapons, क्षौमे वाससी silk garments, वसानः wearing, पुरोधसम् with family priest, Vasistha, पुरोधाय placing ahead of him, मन्त्रिभिस्सह along with ministers, पद्भ्याम् एव on foot, जगाम went.

data.v: पद्भ्यामेव हि धर्मज्ञो न्यस्तशस्त्रपरिच्छदः । वसानो वाससी क्षौमे पुरोधाय पुरोहितम् ।।
data.es: Bharata, the knower of righteous ways and the best among men, saw the hermitage of Bharadwaja from a distance of one krosa and brought his entire army to a halt. He laid aside all his royal robes and weapons. Clad in silk garments, he went on foot along with his ministers, with the family priest Vasistha ahead of him.
data.anv: धर्मज्ञः knower of righteous ways, नरर्षभः the best among men, क्रोशादेव from a distance of one krosa, भरद्वाजाश्रमम् Bharadwaja's hermitage, दृष्ट्वा having seen, सर्वम् entire, बलम् army, अवस्थाप्य  brought to a halt, न्यस्तशस्त्रपरिच्छदः lay aside the royal robes and weapons, क्षौमे वाससी silk garments, वसानः wearing, पुरोधसम् with family priest, Vasistha, पुरोधाय placing ahead of him, मन्त्रिभिस्सह along with ministers, पद्भ्याम् एव on foot, जगाम went.
data.md: Having arrived at (the neighbourhood of) Bharadvāja's asylum, that foremost of men while it was a krosa (to the destination), left his forces behind and went thither, accompanied by his counsellors alone. And leaving his attire and arms, and clad in a silk cloth, that pious one placing the priest in front, went on foot.

data.v: ततः संदर्शने तस्य भरद्वाजस्य राघवः । मन्त्रिणस्तानवस्थाप्य जगामानु पुरोहितम् ।।
data.es: Then the scion of the Raghu race (Bharata) halted his ministers within sight of Bharadwaja's (hermitage) and went along following his priest Vasistha.
data.anv: ततः then, राघवः scion of the Raghu race (Bharata), तान् मन्त्रिणः those ministers, तस्य भरद्वाजस्य that Bharadwaja's, संदर्शने within sight, अवस्थाप्य halted, अनुपुरोहितम् following his priest जगाम went.
data.md: Then with the view of seeing Bharadvāja, that descendent of Raghu leaving behind the counsellors also, went in the wake of the priest.

data.v: वसिष्ठमथ दृष्ट्वैव भरद्वाजो महातपाः । संचचालासनात्तूर्णं शिष्यानर्घ्यमिति ब्रुवन् ।।
data.es: On seeing Vasistha, the great ascetic Bharadwaja immediately left his seat and said to his disciples, Bring offerings of water.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, महातपाः the great ascetic, भरद्वाजः Bharadwaja, वसिष्ठम् Vasistha, दृष्ट्वैव on seeing, अर्घ्यम् इति bring offerings of water, शिष्यान् to disciples, ब्रुवन् saying, तूर्णम् soon, आसनात् from seat, सञ्चचाल moved.
data.md: As soon as Bharadvāja of rigid austerities saw Vasiştha, he at once rose from his seat, saying to him disciples "Arghya!"

data.v: समागम्य वसिष्ठेन भरतेनाभिवादितः । अबुध्यत महातेजाः सुतं दशरथस्य तम् ।।
data.es: After meeting Vasistha and greeted by Bharata, the radiant Bharadwaja could recognize he was the son of Dasaratha.
data.anv: महातेजाः radiant Bharadwaja, वसिष्ठेन with Vasistha, समागम्य having met, भरतेन by Bharata, अभिवादितः greeted, तम् him, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, सुतम् as son,  अबुद्ध्यत knew of.
data.md: On being called upon by Vasiştha, that highly energetic one understood that it was Daſaratha's son.

data.v: ताभ्यामर्घ्यं च पाद्यं च दत्त्वा पश्चात्फलानि च । आनुपूर्व्याच्च धर्मज्ञः पप्रच्छ कुशलं कुले ।।
data.es: Offering them both in order arghya (welcomeoffering), water to wash their feet and fruits in accordance with the practice, he enquired Bharata about the welfare of the family.
data.anv: धर्मज्ञः knower of righteous ways (Bharadwaja), आनुपूर्व्यात् in order, ताभ्याम् to both of them, अर्घ्यं च welcomeoffering, पाद्यं च water for washing feet, पश्चात् thereafter, फलानि च fruits, दत्वा having given, कुले in the family, कुशलम् welfare, पप्रच्छ enquired.
data.md: Having offered them (the guests) water to wash their feet and Arghya, as well as fruits subsequently, that virtuous one (Bharadvāja) successively enquired after the welfare of their (respective) homes; and after that, of the forces, exchequer, friends and counsellors in Ayodhyā. And knowing that Dasaratha had departed this life, he did not ask anything relating to the monarch.

data.v: अयोध्यायां बले कोशे मित्रेष्वपि च मन्त्रिषु । जानन्दशरथं वृत्तं न राजानमुदाहरत् ।।
data.es: He enquired about the welfare of Ayodhya, of the army, treasury, friends and the ministers. But knowingly did not mention about Dasaratha's wellbeing (the knew Dasaratha was dead).
data.anv: अयोध्यायाम् in Ayodhya, बले in the army, कोशे in the treasury, मित्रेष्वपि च of the friends also, मन्त्रिषु of the ministers, वृत्तम् wellbeing, जानन् knowingly, राजानम् king, दशरथम् Dasaratha, नोदाहरत् did not mention.
data.md: Having offered them (the guests) water to wash their feet and Arghya, as well as fruits subsequently, that virtuous one (Bharadvāja) successively enquired after the welfare of their (respective) homes; and after that, of the forces, exchequer, friends and counsellors in Ayodhyā. And knowing that Dasaratha had departed this life, he did not ask anything relating to the monarch.

data.v: वसिष्ठो भरतश्चैनं पप्रच्छतुरनामयम् । शरीरेऽग्निषु वृक्षेषु शिष्येषु मृगपक्षिषु ।।
data.es: Vasistha and Bharata also enquired about his health and welfare of his sacred fires, his disciples, animals and birds and trees of the hermitage.
data.anv: वसिष्ठः Vasistha, भरतश्च also Bharata, एनम् him, शरीरे about his health, अग्निषु his sacred fires, वृक्षेषु his trees, शिष्येषु his disciples, मृगपक्षिषु about animals and birds, अनामयम् well being, पप्रच्छतुः enquired.
data.md: Then Vasiştha and Bharata questioned him as to his welfare, in relation to the body, the (sacrificial) fire, the trees, the beasts and the birds (of the hermitage).

data.v: तथेति च प्रतिज्ञाय भरद्वाजो महातपाः । भरतं प्रत्युवाचेदं राघवस्नेहबन्धनात् ।।
data.es: Saying, all is well, the great ascetic Bharadwaja, out of his affection for Rama, said to Bharata:
data.anv: महातपाः the great ascetic, भरद्वाजः Bharadwaja, तथेति saying so, so, तत् that welfare, प्रतिज्ञाय informing, राघवस्नेहबन्धनात् out of affection for Rama, भरतं प्रति addressing Bharata, इदम् these words, उवाच said.
data.md: To all this returning "So it is,” the illustrious Bharadvāja from affection for Rāghava said to Bharata.

data.v: किमिहागमने कार्यं तव राज्यं प्रशासतः । एतदाचक्ष्व मे सर्वं न हि मे शुध्यते मनः ।।
data.es: Why have you come here when you ought to be ruling the kingdom? Tell me everything about this. My mind is not clear in this matter.
data.anv: राज्यम् kingdom, प्रशासतः while ruling over, तव for you, इह here, आगमने in the arrival, कार्यम् reason, किम् what, एतत् all this, सर्वम् completely, मे to me, आचक्ष्व tell, मे to me, मनः my mind, न हि शुद्ध्यते is not clear about it.
data.md: What is the use of your visit here, seeing that you are engaged in the task of governing the kingdom? Do you relate all this to me; my mind is ill at ease.

data.v: सुषुवे यम मित्रघ्नं कौसल्यानन्दवर्धनम् । भ्रात्रा सह सभार्यो यश्चिरं प्रव्राजितो वनम् ।।
नियुक्तः स्त्रीनियुक्तेन पित्रा योऽसौ महायशाः । वनवासी भवेतीह समाः किल चतुर्दश ।।
कच्चिन्न तस्यापापस्य पापं कर्तुमिहेच्छसि । अकण्टकं भोक्तुमना राज्यं तस्यानुजस्य च ।।
एवमुक्तो भरद्वाजं भरतः प्रत्युवाच ह । पर्यश्रु नयनो दुःखाद्वाचा संसज्जमानया ।।
data.es: At these words, Bharata, eyes filled with tears of grief, replied to Bharadwaja in a stumbling voice:
data.anv: एवम् thus, उक्तः addressed, भरतः Bharata, दुःखात् with grief, पर्यश्रुनयनः with tears in his eyes, संसज्जमानया with stumbling, वाचा words, भरद्वाजम् to Bharadwaja, प्रत्युवाच ह said in reply.
data.md: Thus accosted, Bharata replied to Bharadvāja with tears filling his eyes and his words choked with grief.

data.v: हतोऽस्मि यदि मामेवं भगवानपि मन्यते । मत्तो न दोषमाशङ्केर्नैवं मामनुशाधि हि ।।
data.es: When one so venerable like you too misunderstands me, I am gone. There is no danger for him from me. Do not rebuke me this way.
data.anv: भगवानपि even one venerable like you, माम् about me, एवम् in this way, मन्यते यदि if you think, हतः अस्मि I am done with, मत्तः from me, दोषम् evil, न आशङ्के do not suspect, माम् me, एवम् in this way, न अनुशास्तु हि not rebuke.
data.md: Undone am I if the reverend one also deems me so. Do not apprehend any wrong from me; and do you not reproach me thus.

data.v: न चैतदिष्टं माता मे यदवोचन्मदन्तरे । नाहमेतेन तुष्टश्च न तद्वचनमाददे ।।
data.es: I do not approve of whatever my mother said in my absence. I am not happy with those words and I do not accept them.
data.anv: मे माता my mother, मदन्तरे in my absence, यत् whatever, अवोचत् said, एतत् that one, इष्टम् to my liking, न च not, एतेन by this, अहम् I, तुष्टश्च pleased, न not, तद्वचनं those words, न आददे I do not accept.
data.md: Whatever my mother has said in relation to me, does not express my wish, I am not satisfied with that, nor do I endorse her speech.

data.v: अहं तु तं नरव्याघ्रमुपयातः प्रसादकः । प्रतिनेतुमयोध्यां च पादौ तस्याभिवन्दितुम् ।।
data.es: I have come to worship the feet of Rama, the best of men and persuade him to return to Ayodhya.
data.anv: अहं तु as for me, नरव्याघ्रम् the best among men, Rama, तम् him, प्रसादकः after persuading, अयोध्याम् to Ayodhya, प्रतिनेतुम् to take him back, तस्य his, पादौ feet, अभिवन्दितुम् च to worship, उपयातः I have come.
data.md: I, intending to pacify him, and going to that chief of men, with the view of taking him to Ayodhyā and of paying homage to his feet.

data.v: त्वं मामेवंगतं मत्वा प्रसादं कर्तुमर्हसि । शंस मे भगवन्रामः क्व संप्रति महीपतिः ।।
data.es: O venerable one in consideration of the circumstances I am in, be kind to me and tell me the whereabouts of Rama, lord of the earth.
data.anv: भगवन् O Lord, त्वम् you, माम् me, एवंगतम् in these circumstances, मत्वा having considered, प्रसादम् kindness, कर्तुम् to do, अर्हसि be pleased, महीपतिः lord of the earth, रामः Rama, सम्प्रति now, क्व where, मे to me, शंस tell.
data.md: Thinking me as already gone, you should show your favour to me. O reverend Sir, tell me where stay at present Rāma, lord of the earth.

data.v: उवाच तं भरद्वाजः प्रसादाद्भरतं वचः । त्वय्येतत्पुरुषव्याघ्र युक्तं राघववंशजे । गुरुवृत्तिर्दमश्चैव साधूनां चानुयायिता ।।
data.es: O best of men (Bharata) your conduct towards the preceptors, your selfrestraint and devotion to the virtuous are all in keeping with those born in the race of Raghu.
data.anv: पुरुषव्याघ्रः O best of men, गुरुवृत्ति: conduct towards spiritual preceptors, दमश्चैव control over senses, साधूनाम् of virtuous people, अनुयायिता following, एतत् all this, राघववंशजे born in the Raghu race, त्वयि in you, युक्तम् is appropriate.
data.md: foremost of men, even this is worthy of you. Serving superiors, restraint of the senses, and following the pious, are ever found in one sprung in the Rāghava line.

data.v: जाने चैतन्मनःस्थं ते दृढीकरणमस्त्विति । अपृच्छं त्वां तवात्यर्थं कीर्तिं समभिवर्धयन् ।।
data.es: I am aware of the feelings in your heart. Even then I enquired in order to confirm it and to further your fame.
data.anv: ते your, मनस्थम् feelings of your heart, एतत् this, जाने च I am aware, दृढीकरणम् अस्तु let it be confirmed, इति in this manner, (तव your), कीर्तिम् fame, अत्यर्थम् greatly, समभिवर्धयन् to increase it, त्वाम् you, अपृच्छम् I asked.
data.md: I know that even this is your intention, but for the purpose of making your mind all the firmer, I had asked you in this wise; so that your fame might greatly increase.

data.v: असौ वसति ते भ्राता चित्रकूटे महागिरौ । श्वस्तु गन्तासि तं देशं वसाद्य सह मन्त्रिभिः । एतं मे कुरु सुप्राज्ञ कामं कामार्थकोविद ।।
data.es: O supremely sagacious prince gifted with the knowledge of kama (desire) and artha (wealth), tomorrow you go, but to night stay here with your ministers and fulfil my desire.
data.anv: तं देशम् to that place, श्वः tomorow, गन्तासि shall go, अद्य today, मन्त्रिभिस्सह along with  ministers, वस you may stay, सुप्राज्ञ O supremely sagacious prince, कामार्थकोविद who is aware of kama (desire) and artha (prosperity), मे my, एतम् this, कामं desire, कुरु fulfil.
data.md: On the morrow you will set out for that region. Do you to-day sojourn here along with your counsellors. O wise one, do this at your pleasure, O you understanding interest and desire.

data.v: ततस्तथेत्येवमुदारदर्शनः; प्रतीतरूपो भरतोऽब्रवीद्वचः । चकार बुद्धिं च तदा महाश्रमे; निशानिवासाय नराधिपात्मजः ।।
data.es: A man of liberal disposition, Bharata expressed his intention, saying, 'Be it so'. Then the prince made up him mind to spend the might in that hermitage. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे नवतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the ninetieth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: उदारदर्शनः a man of liberal outlook, भरतः Bharata, प्रतीतरूपः expressing his intention, ततः then, तथा be it so, इत्येवम् saying, वचः words, अब्रवीत् said, तदा then, नराधिपात्मजः son of the king, तदाश्रमे in that hermitage, निशानिवासाय to spend the night, बुद्धिम् decision, चकार made.
data.md: Thereat the gently-looking and highly famous one said, “Be it so;" and the king's son made up his mind to spend the night in the great hermitage (of the saint).

data.v: कृतबुद्धिं निवासाय तथैव स मुनिस्तदा । भरतं कैकयी पुत्रमातिथ्येन न्यमन्त्रयत् ।।
data.es: With the decision of Bharata, son of Kaikeyi, to stay there for the night, sage Bharadwaja extended to him all hospitality.
data.anv: सः that, मुनिः sage (Bharadwaja), तदा then, तत्रैव there itself, निवासाय to stay, कृतबुद्धिम् having resolved, कैकयीपुत्रम् Kaikeyi's son, भरतम् Bharata, आतिथ्येन with hospitality, न्यमन्त्रयत् invited.
data.md: Then the ascetic asked Bharata, the son of Kaikeyi, when he had decided for staying there, to receive his hospitality.

data.v: अब्रवीद्भरतस्त्वेनं नन्विदं भवता कृतम् । पाद्यमर्घ्यं तथातिथ्यं वने यदूपपद्यते ।।
data.es: Bharata said to Bharadwaja, You have already extended the hospitality in offering water for washing the feet with and of arghya befitting a guest as available in the forest.
data.anv: भरतस्तु as for Bharata, एनम् to him, अब्रवीत् said, भवता by you, पाद्यम् water for washing the feet with, अर्घ्यम् welcome offering, तथा also, वने in the forest, यत् whichever, उपपद्यते is available, इदम् this, आतिथ्यम् hospitality, कृतं ननु has been made.
data.md: Thereat Bharata said, “You have for certain done this, (have offered me) water for washing my feet, Arghya, and hospitality with what can be procured in the forest.

data.v: अथोवाच भरद्वाजो भरतं प्रहसन्निव । जाने त्वां प्रीति संयुक्तं तुष्येस्त्वं येन केनचित् ।।
data.es: Bharadwaja then said to Bharata with a gentle smile, I know you are full of love and content with whatever is offered you.
data.anv: अथ then, भरद्वाजः Bharadwaja, प्रहसन्निव with a gentle smile, भरतम् to Bharata, उवाच said, त्वाम् you, प्रीतिसंयुक्तम् are full of love, जाने I know, त्वाम् you, येन केन चित् with whatever  offered, तुष्येः are contented.
data.md: Then Bharadvāja as if in jest, said to Bharata, "I know you to be of a complacent disposition; and that you are pleased with anything and everything."

data.v: सेनायास्तु तवैतस्याः कर्तुमिच्छामि भोजनम् । मम प्रितिर्यथा रूपा त्वमर्हो मनुजर्षभ ।।
data.es: O Bharata, the best of men, I want to treat your army with food. This will please me and I hope you will act accordingly.
data.anv: मनुजर्षभ best among mortals, तव your, एतस्याः for all the, सेनायाः the army men, भोजनम् food, कर्तुम् I am to offer, इच्छामि wish, मम my, प्रीतिः pleasure, यथा रूपा in whatever way, तथा accordingly, अर्हः worthy of.
data.md: But I wish to feast your forces. And, O best of men, it behoves you to act in harmony with my desire.

data.v: किमर्थं चापि निक्षिप्य दूरे बलमिहागतः । कस्मान्नेहोपयातोऽसि सबलः पुरुषर्षभ ।।
data.es: Why did you, O Bharata, the best of men, station your army at a distance before coming here? Could you not approach me along with your army?
data.anv: पुरुषर्षभः best of men, किमर्थम् for what reason, बलम् army, दूरे at a distance, निक्षिप्य having stationed, इह here, आगतः you have come, इह here, सबलः with your army, कस्मात् why, न उपयातः असि not come with.
data.md: Why did you coming higher, leave your army at a distance:? And, you man of men, why did you not come accompanied with your forces?

data.v: भरतः प्रत्युवाचेदं प्राञ्जलिस्तं तपोधनम् । ससैन्यो नोपयातोऽस्मि भगवन्भगवद्भयात् ।।
data.es: With folded palms (in reverence), Bharata said to sage Bharadwaja whose penance was his wealth: I did not approach you with the army for fear of you, O venerable one.
data.anv: भरतः Bharata, प्राञ्जलिः with folded palms (in reverence), तपोधनम् who has benance as his wealth (sage), तम् him, इदम् this, प्रत्युवाच replied, भगवन् O venerable one, भगवद्भयात् for fear of you, ससैन्यः with army, नोपयातोऽस्मि did not approach.
data.md: Bharata replied to him, saying, “I had not come accompanied with my forces, from fear of you, O reverend Sir.”

data.v: वाजि मुख्या मनुष्याश्च मत्ताश्च वर वारणाः । प्रच्छाद्य महतीं भूमिं भगवन्ननुयान्ति माम् ।।
data.es: O venerable sage spirited horses, men and mighty rutting elephants follow me covering a wide expanse of land.
data.anv: भगवन् O Lord, वाजिमुख्याः spirited horses, मनुष्याश्च men also, मत्ताः rutting, वरवारणाश्च mighty elephants, महतीम् wide, भूमिम् earth, प्रच्छाद्य spread over, माम् me, अनुयान्ति are following.
data.md: Choice steeds, men, and mad elephants of the best kind, covering a spacious tract of country, come in my train, respected Sir.

data.v: ते वृक्षानुदकं भूमिमाश्रमेषूटजांस्तथा । न हिंस्युरिति तेनाहमेक एवागतस्ततः ।।
data.es: Lest the army should damage the huts, trees, land, and defile the water in the ashram, I came here alone.
data.anv: ते they, आश्रमेषु in ashrams, वृक्षान् trees, उदकम् water, भूमिम् land, तथा also, उटजान् huts, न हिंस्युः shall not damage, इति so, तेन therefore, अहम् I, एक एव alone, समागतः came here.
data.md: That these might not injure trees or water or the grounds of the cottages pertaining to the asylums, have I come hither alone.

data.v: आनीयतामितः सेनेत्याज्ञप्तः परमर्षिणा । तथा तु चक्रे भरतः सेनायाः समुपागमम् ।।
data.es: Thus commanded the great ascetic, 'Let the army be brought here'. Accordingly, Bharata ordered the army to come.
data.anv: ततस्तु all, सेना army, इतः here, अनीयताम् be brought, इति thus, परमर्षिणा great sage, आज्ञप्तः having been commanded, भरतः Bharata, सेनायाः the army's, समुपागमम् to get, चक्रे made.
data.md: "Bring the forces here,", thus desired by the mighty ascetic, Bharata accordingly caused the troops to be brought in.

data.v: अग्निशालां प्रविश्याथ पीत्वापः परिमृज्य च । आतिथ्यस्य क्रियाहेतोर्विश्वकर्माणमाह्वयत् ।।
data.es: Then Bharadwaja entered the fire sanctuary, sipped water and washed his hands with water and invoked Visvakarma to provide hospitality.
data.anv: अथ then, अग्निशालाम् fire sanctuary, प्रविश्य entered, आपः water, पीत्वा sipped, परिमृज्य च washing his hands, आतिथ्यस्य for the hospitality, क्रियाहेतोः to provide, विश्वकर्माणम् to Visvakarma, आह्वयत् invoked.
data.md: Then entering the chamber of the sacrificial fire, (Bharadvāja) having sipped water and rubbed his lips therewith, invoked Viśvakarmā for the purpose of entertaining his guest.

data.v: आह्वये विश्वकर्माणमहं त्वष्टारमेव च । आतिथ्यं कर्तुमिच्छामि तत्र मे संविधीयताम् ।।
data.es: I intend to provide hospitality for which I am invoking Visvakarma and Tvastara who builds houses. Let adequate arrangements be made.
data.anv: अहम् I, आतिथ्यम् hospitality, कर्तुम् to perform, इच्छामि am intending, त्वष्टारम् एव च even Tvastara who builds homes, विश्वकर्माणम् Visvakarma, आह्वये I am invoking, तत्र in this matter, मे to me, संविधीयताम् things may be arranged.
data.md: I invoke Visvakarmā; even Tvasta himself. I wish to entertain guests. Let him accomplish this for me.

data.v: प्राक्स्रोतसश्च या नद्यः प्रत्यक्स्रोतस एव च । पृथिव्यामन्तरिक्षे च समायान्त्वद्य सर्वशः ।।
data.es: Let the rivers flowing towards the east, and the west, flowing on the earth and in the sky, flowing everywhere reach here and now.
data.anv: या नद्यः those revers, पृथिव्याम् on the earth, अन्तरिक्षे in the sky, प्राक्स्रोतसः flowing towards the east, प्रत्यक्स्रोतसः towards the west, सर्वशः from everywhere, अद्य now, समायान्तु may come.
data.md: Let those rivers that flow westwards, and those that move tortuously on the earth and in the sky, come hither in a body.

data.v: अन्याः स्रवन्तु मैरेयं सुरामन्याः सुनिष्ठिताम् । अपराश्चोदकं शीतमिक्षुकाण्डरसोपमम् ।।
data.es: Let some rivers flow with liquor made of datepalms, some with wellprepared wine and some with cool water which tastes like sugarcane juice.
data.anv: अन्याः other rivers, मैरेयम् intoxicating liquour (made of datepalms), स्रवन्तु let them flow, अन्याः other rivers, सुविष्ठिताम् wellprepared, सुराम् wine, अपराश्च still others, इक्षुकाण्डरसोपमम् tasting like sugar cane juice, शीतम् cool, उदकम् water, स्रवन्तु let them flow.
data.md: And let others run Maireya, and others refined wine, and others again cool waters resembling the juice of the sugarcane.

data.v: आह्वये देवगन्धर्वान्विश्वावसुहहाहुहून् । तथैवाप्सरसो देवीर्गन्धर्वीश्चापि सर्वशः ।।
data.es: I invoke the gandharvas, Visvavasu, Ha Ha and Hu Hu, and also goddesses like gandharvas (heavenly musicians) and apsaras (nymphs) from all regions.
data.anv: देवगन्धर्वान् the gandharvas of deities, विश्वावसु Visvavasu, हहाहुहून् Ha Ha and Hu Hu, तथैव also, देवीः goddesses, गन्धर्वीश्चापि female gandharvas (heavenly musicians), अप्सरसः apsaras (nymphs), सर्वशः from all regions, आह्वये invoke.
data.md: I invoke the celestials and the Gandharvas and Viśvāvasu and Hahā and Huhu and also the divine Apsaras and Gandharvis all.

data.v: घृताचीमथ विश्वाचीं मिश्रकेशीमलम्बुसाम् । शक्रं याश्चोपतिष्ठन्ति ब्रह्माणं याश्च भामिनीः । सर्वास्तुम्बुरुणा सार्धमाह्वये सपरिच्छदाः ।।
data.es: I invoke all the women who attend on Indra and Bramha along with tumbur with all their (musical) instruments.
data.anv: याश्च those, योषितः women, शक्रम् Indra, उपतिष्ठन्ति are serving, याश्च those, ब्रह्माणम् attending on Bramha, सपरिच्छदाः with all their musical instruments, सर्वाः all, तुम्बुरुणा सार्धम् with their tumbur, आह्वये I am invoking.
data.md: And those ladies that attend Sakra, and those that attend Brahmā. I invoke all these females well attired, in company with Tumuru.

data.v: वनं कुरुषु यद्दिव्यं वासो भूषणपत्रवत् । दिव्यनारीफलं शश्वत्तत्कौबेरमिहैव तु ।।
data.es: Let Kubera's divine forest situated in the land of Kurus, where leaves serve as raiment and ornaments and celestial women as its fruits come here.
data.anv: कुरुषु in the land of Kurus, शश्वत् always, वासोभूषणपत्रवत् leaves serving as raiment and ornaments, दिव्यनारीफलम् celestial women as fruits, कौबेरम् relating to Kubera, यत् which, दिव्यं वनम् divine forest, तत् that, इह here, एतु let it come over.
data.md: And let that beautiful forest of Kubera in the north Kuru, having its foliage resembling attires and ornaments, and its fruits debonair damsels, exist even at this very spot.

data.v: इह मे भगवान्सोमो विधत्तामन्नमुत्तमम् । भक्ष्यं भोज्यं च चोष्यं च लेह्यं च विविधं बहु ।।
data.es: Let the blessed Moon furnish me with excellent food of every kind -- solid, liquid, soft and those which are to be sucked and licked in great variety and quantity.
data.anv: भगवान् the lord, सोमः Moon, मे for me, इह here, उत्तमम् excellent, अन्नम् food, विविधम् many kinds, बहु many varieties, भक्ष्यम् eatables, भोज्यम् chewable food, चोष्यम् food eaten by sucking, लेह्यं च that which is licked, विधत्ताम् be provided.
data.md: And here let the worshipful Soma yield me excellent viands of diverse kinds in plenty; things; that may be eaten or enjoyed, sucked or licked; and variegated blossoms growing in the trees, and wines and (other) drinks, and meats of various kinds.

data.v: विचित्राणि च माल्यानि पादपप्रच्युतानि च । सुरादीनि च पेयानि मांसानि विविधानि च ।।
data.es: Let her furnish me with manycoloured garlands of fresh flowers from trees, wines and other drinks and meat of different kinds.
data.anv: पादपप्रच्युतानि those dropped from trees, विचित्राणि manycoloured, माल्यानि च flower garlands, सुरादीनि wines and others, पेयानि drinks, विविधानि of different kinds, मांसानि च meat be furnished.
data.md: And here let the worshipful Soma yield me excellent viands of diverse kinds in plenty; things; that may be eaten or enjoyed, sucked or licked; and variegated blossoms growing in the trees, and wines and (other) drinks, and meats of various kinds.

data.v: एवं समाधिना युक्तस्तेजसाप्रतिमेन च । शिक्षास्वरसमायुक्तं तपसा चाब्रवीन्मुनिः ।।
data.es: The valiant ascetic of incomparable lustre and power of penance in profound meditation said this in an accent in conformity with Vedic instruction.
data.anv: समाधिना in profound meditation, अप्रतिमेन incomparable, तेजसा च with radiance, तपसा च with the power of penance, युक्तं filled with, मुनिः ascetic, शीक्षास्वरसमायुक्तम् with accent in conformity with Vedic instruction, एवम् in this way, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Thus, furnished with unrivalled ascetic energy, did that anchorite observing excellent vows, express himself orthoepically in consonance with Śikṣā.

data.v: मनसा ध्यायतस्तस्य प्राङ्मुखस्य कृताञ्जलेः । आजग्मुस्तानि सर्वाणि दैवतानि पृथक्पृथक् ।।
data.es: As Bharadwaja with folded palms was thus meditating with his face turned eastward, all the deities appeared there one by one.
data.anv: तस्य his, प्राङ्मुखस्य facing east, कृताञ्जलेः with folded palms, मनसा in mind, ध्यायतः while meditating, सर्वाणि all, तानि दैवतानि those deities, पृथक्पृथक् one by one, आजग्मुः arrived.
data.md: And as he sat with joined hands facing the west with a rapt mind, there came separately all those deities.

data.v: मलयं दुर्दुरं चैव ततः स्वेदनुदोऽनिलः । उपस्पृश्य ववौ युक्त्या सुप्रियात्मा सुखः शिवः ।।
data.es: Meanwhile, soft auspicious and pleasant breeze passing over Malaya and Dardura mountains, comforting and cooling the sweat, began to blow.
data.anv: ततः then, अनिलः wind, मलयम् Malaya hill, दर्दुरं चैव mount Dardura, उपस्पृश्य having touched, युक्त्या by virtue of contact, सुप्रियात्मा most pleasant, सुखः comforting, शिवः auspicious, स्वेदनुदः cooling the sweat, ववौ blew.
data.md: And then touching Malaya and Dardura, and laden (with perfumes), a delicious and welcome wind began to blow delightfully, removing sweat.

data.v: ततोऽभ्यवर्तन्त घना दिव्याः कुसुमवृष्टयः । देवदुन्दुभिघोषश्च दिक्षु सर्वासु शुश्रुवे ।।
data.es: Then divine clouds rolled in and showered celestial flowers. The sounds of heavenly gongs could be heard in every direction.
data.anv: ततः then, दिव्याः celestial, कुसुमवृष्टयः rain of flowers, घनाः clouds, अभ्यवर्षन्त showered, सर्वासु in all, दिक्षु directions, दिव्यदुन्दुभिघोषश्च sounds of divine musical gongs, शुश्रुवे could be heard.
data.md: And the clouds poured down a pleasant shower of blossoms; and from all sides were heard sounds of celestial kettle-drums.

data.v: प्रववुश्चोत्तमा वाता ननृतुश्चाप्सरोगणाः । प्रजगुर्देवगन्धर्वा वीणा प्रमुमुचुः स्वरान् ।।
data.es: Gentle breeze began to blow. Troops of apsaras danced. Gandharvas and gods sang and the lyres rang.
data.anv: उत्तमाः gentle, वाताश्च winds, प्रववु blew, अप्सरोगणाः troops of apsaras, ननृतुश्च also danced, देवगन्धर्वाः divine gandharvas, जगुश्च sang, वीणाः lyres, स्वरान् notes, प्रमुमुचुः issued forth.
data.md: And a rare breeze set in, and the multitudes of Apsaras danced; and the celestials and the Gandharvas sang, and the Vinas let out their notes.

data.v: स शब्दो द्यां च भूमिं च प्राणिनां श्रवणानि च । विवेशोच्चारितः श्लक्ष्णः समो लयगुणान्वितः ।।
data.es: That soft, melodious, rhythmic and wellmodulated sound entered the heaven and earth as well as the ears of all living beings.
data.anv: उच्चरितः uttered, श्लक्षणः soft melody, लयसमन्वितः rhythmic, समः modulation, सः शब्दः those sounds, द्यां च the sky, भूमिं च the earth, प्राणिनाम् of all living beings, श्रवणानि च in the ears, विवेश entered.
data.md: And the dulcet sounds high and low furnished with Sama and measure, entered the Earth and the firmament and the ears of all creatures.

data.v: तस्मिन्नुपरते शब्दे दिव्ये श्रोत्रसुखे नृणाम् । ददर्श भारतं सैन्यं विधानं विश्वकर्मणः ।।
data.es: When the celestial sounds pleasing to the ears of men had subsided, the army of Bharata beheld the wonderful creations of Visvakarma.
data.anv: नृणाम् for men, शोत्रसुखे pleasing to the ears, तस्मिन् when that, दिव्ये celestial, शब्दे sound, उपरते had subsided, भारतम् relating to Bharata, सैन्यम् army, विश्वकर्मणः Visvakarma's, विधानम् the creations, ददर्श he beheld.
data.md: When that celestial symphony delightful to the ears of men, had thus developed itself, Bharata's forces saw the workmanship of Visvakarman.

data.v: बभूव हि समा भूमिः समन्तात्पञ्चयोजनम् । शाद्वलैर्बहुभिश्छन्ना नीलवैदूर्यसंनिभैः ।।
data.es: The ground was levelled on every side for five yojanas and covered with several grass lawns resembling lapis lazuli (blue sapphire) and cat's eye.
data.anv: समन्तात् on every side, पञ्चयोजना five yojanas (forty miles), भूमिः the ground, समा has been levelled, नीलवैढूर्यसन्निभैः with sapphires or gems called cat'seye (beryl) spread, बहुभिः by many, शाद्वलैः grass lawns, छन्ना covered with, बभूव हि became৷৷
data.md: That spot widening into a level plain measuring five Yojanas was covered with thick grass resembling blue lapises.

data.v: तस्मिन्बिल्वाः कपित्थाश्च पनसा बीजपूरकाः । आमलक्यो बभूवुश्च चूताश्च फलभूषणाः ।।
data.es: There the best of fruitbearing trees like bilva trees, woodapple trees, citrons, emblic myrobalan trees and mango trees laden with fruits sprang up.
data.anv: तस्मिन् there, फलभूषणाः fruits as adorenments, बिल्वाः Bilva, कपित्थाश्च woodapple trees, पनसाः jackfruit trees, बीजपूरकाः citron trees, आमलक्यः emblic myrobalan trees, चूताश्च mangotrees, बभूवुः sprang up.
data.md: And on it stood Bilvas, and Kapitthas, Panasas, citrons, and Amalakas, and mangoes, embellished with fruits.

data.v: उत्तरेभ्यः कुरुभ्यश्च वनं दिव्योपभोगवत् । आजगाम नदी दिव्या तीरजैर्बहुभिर्वृता ।।
data.es: From the forests of the northern Kuru kingdom, with all delights of heaven, a divine river with innumerable trees that grow on river banks came into existence.
data.anv: उत्तरेभ्यः कुरुभ्यः from the kingdom of northern Kurus, दिव्योपभोगवत् with all heavenly delights, वनम् forest, बहुभिः by innumerable, तीरजैः trees growing on the banks, कृता surrounded, दिव्या divine, नदी river, आजगाम came into existence.
data.md: From the north Kuru had spread a wood capable of conferring every enjoyment; and a beautiful river coursed through bordered by many a tree.

data.v: चतुःशालानि शुभ्राणि शालाश्च गजवाजिनाम् । हर्म्यप्रासादसंघातास्तोरणानि शुभानि च ।।
data.es: Bright quadrangles, stables for elephants and horses, auspicious arch ways for palaces and mansions sprang up.
data.anv: शुभ्राणि bright, चतुश्शालानि quadrangles, गजवाजिनाम् for horses and elephants, शालाश्च stables, शुभानि auspicious, हर्म्यप्रासादसम्बाधास्तोरणानि consisting of archways for palaces and mansions sprang up.

data.v: सितमेघनिभं चापि राजवेश्म सुतोरणम् । शुक्लमाल्यकृताकारं दिव्यगन्धसमुक्षितम् ।।
चतुरस्रमसंबाधं शयनासनयानवत् । दिव्यैः सर्वरसैर्युक्तं दिव्यभोजनवस्त्रवत् ।।
उपकल्पित सर्वान्नं धौतनिर्मलभाजनम् । कॢप्तसर्वासनं श्रीमत्स्वास्तीर्णशयनोत्तमम् ।।
प्रविवेश महाबाहुरनुज्ञातो महर्षिणा । वेश्म तद्रत्नसंपूर्णं भरतः कैकयीसुतः ।।
data.es: Longarmed Bharata, son of Kaikeyi entered that palace full of jewels with the permission of the great sage.
data.anv: महाबाहुः longarmed, कैकयीसुतः son of Kaikeyi, भरतः Bharata, महर्षिणा by the great sage, अनुज्ञातः having been permitted, रत्नसम्पूर्णम् full of jewels, तत् that, वेश्म house, प्रविवेश entered.

data.v: अनुजग्मुश्च तं सर्वे मन्त्रिणः सपुरोहिताः । बभूवुश्च मुदा युक्ता तं दृष्ट्वा वेश्म संविधिम् ।।
data.es: All the ministers, priests followed him and were glad to see the arrangement in that mansion.
data.anv: सपुरोहिताः along with priests, सर्वे all, मन्त्रिणः ministers, तम् that Bharata, अनुजग्मुश्च followed, तम् संविधिम् that arrangement, दृष्ट्वा having seen all over, मुदा full of joy, युक्ताः filled with  बभूवुश्च became.
data.md: Permitted by the Maharsi, Kaikeyi's son, Bharata, entered that mansion abounding in gems. And he was followed by the counsellors and the priests; and the latter beholding the arrangements of the palace, were filled with delight.

data.v: तत्र राजासनं दिव्यं व्यजनं छत्रमेव च । भरतो मन्त्रिभिः सार्धमभ्यवर्तत राजवत् ।।
data.es: There where stood an exquisite throne, a fan and a parasol Bharata stayed in the company of ministers.
data.anv: भरतः Bharata, मन्त्रिभिः सार्धं in the company of ministers, तत्र there, दिव्यम् exquisite, राजासनम् throne, व्यजनम् a fan (of yak's tail), छत्रमेव च parasol, राजवत् like a king, अभ्यवर्तत stayed.
data.md: And Bharata in company with the counsellors there went round the august royal seat, the chowri, and the umbrella, worthy of a king. And having bowed down to Rāma, he worshipped that seat.

data.v: आसनं पूजयामास रामायाभिप्रणम्य च । वालव्यजनमादाय न्यषीदत्सचिवासने ।।
data.es: He bowed in reverence and worshipped the throne (as though Rama were seated there). Taking hold of a fan made of yak's tail he sat in a minister's seat.
data.anv: रामाय to Rama, अभिप्रणम्य च having bowed in reverence, आसनम् that throne, पूजयामास worshipped, वालव्यजनम् fan made of yak's tail, आदाय taking hold of,  सचिवासने in a minister's seat, न्यषीदत् sat down
data.md: And then holding the chowri of hair, he sat down on the seat of a minister.

data.v: आनुपूर्व्यान्निषेदुश्च सर्वे मन्त्रपुरोहिताः । ततः सेनापतिः पश्चात्प्रशास्ता च निषेदतुः ।।
data.es: First the ministers and priests took their respective seats in accordance with their rank, and then the army chief and finally the supervisor of the camp.
data.anv: सर्वे all, मन्त्रिपुरोहिताः ministers and priests, आनुपूर्व्यात् in order, निषेदुः sat, ततः सेनापति after that the army chief, पश्चात् later, प्रशास्ता च and the supervisor of the camp, निषेदतुः sat.
data.md: Then the counsellors and priests seated themselves according to rank. And thereafter the general and the protector of the encampment (got themselves seated).

data.v: ततस्तत्र मुहूर्तेन नद्यः पायसकर्दमाः । उपातिष्ठन्त भरतं भरद्वाजस्य शासनत् ।।
data.es: Rivers filled with payasam (rice cooked in milk and sugar) in the shape of mud flowed towards Bharata at the command of Bharadwaja.
data.anv: ततः then, भरद्वाजस्य by Bharadwaja, शासनात् order, मुहूर्तेन instantly, तत्र there, पायसकर्दमाः payasam (rice cooked in milk with sugar) as mud, नद्यः rivers, भरतम् Bharata, उपातिष्ठन्त approached.
data.md: Then at Bharadvāja's command, came into being near Bharata streams having Pāyasa for their slime.

data.v: तासामुभयतः कूलं पाण्डुमृत्तिकलेपनाः । रम्याश्चावसथा दिव्या ब्रह्मणस्तु प्रसादजाः ।।
data.es: On both the banks of those rivers, charming, celestial houses plastered with white clay appeared by the grace of Brahma.
data.anv: तासाम् those rivers, उभयतः कूलम् on both the banks, पाण्डुमृत्तिलेपनाः plastered with white clay, ब्रह्मणः Brahma, प्रसादजाः produced by the grace, दिव्याः celestial, रम्याः charming, आवसधाश्च houses appeared.
data.md: And at the pleasure of the Brāhmaṇa, on both their banks arose charming dwellings, covered with pale clay.

data.v: तेनैव च मुहूर्तेन दिव्याभरणभूषिताः । आगुर्विंशतिसाहस्रा ब्रह्मणा प्रहिताः स्त्रियः ।।
data.es: At that very moment twenty thousand women adorned with beautiful ornaments sent by Brahma presented themselves.
data.anv: तेन at that, मुहूर्तेन च moment, दिव्याभरणभूषिताः adorned with beautiful ornaments, ब्रह्मणा by Brahma, प्रहिताः sent, विंशतिसाहस्राः twenty thousand, स्त्रियः women, आगुः came.
data.md: And at that very moment there came twenty thousand women commissioned by Brahma, adorned with divine ornaments.

data.v: सुवर्णमणिमुक्तेन प्रवालेन च शोभिताः । आगुर्विंशतिसाहस्राः कुबेरप्रहिताः स्त्रियः ।।
data.es: At that very moment twenty thousand women adorned with beautiful ornaments sent by Brahma presented themselves.
data.anv: सुवर्णमणिमुक्तेन wearing golden ornaments and gems, प्रवालेन with corals, शोभिता shining, कुबेरप्रहिताः sent by Kubera, विंशतिसाहस्राः twenty thousand, स्त्रियः आगुः women came.
data.md: And at that very moment there came twenty thousand women commissioned by Brahma, adorned with divine ornaments.

data.v: याभिर्गृहीतः पुरुषः सोन्माद इव लक्ष्यते । आगुर्विंशतिसाहस्रा नन्दनादप्सरोगणाः ।।
data.es: Troops of twenty thousand apsaras by whom any man when taken hold of in their arms could be intoxicated with intense passion, came from Nandana gardens.
data.anv: याभिः by whom, गृहीतः when taken hold of (in their arms), पुरुषः man, सोन्माद इव filled with intense passion, लक्ष्यते is observed, such, विंशतिसाहस्राः twenty thousand, अप्सरोगणाः troops of apsaras, नन्दनात् from Nandana, आगुः came.

data.v: नारदस्तुम्बुरुर्गोपः पर्वतः सूर्यवर्चसः । एते गन्धर्वराजानो भरतस्याग्रतो जगुः ।।
data.es: There along with Narada, Tumburu and Gopa, distinguished kings of the gandharvas, looking bright like the Sun, began to sing in the presence of Bharata.
data.anv: नारदः Narada, तुम्भुरुः Tumburu, गोपः Gopa, प्रवराः distinguished ones, सूर्यवर्चसः resembling the brightness of the Sun, एते these, गन्धर्वराजानः kings among gandharvas, भरतस्य  Bharata's, अग्रतः presence, जगुः began to sing.
data.md: And there came from Nandana twenty thousand damsels; and Nārada and Tumburů and Gopa, resembling the sun in splendour. The Gandharba kings began to sing before Bharata.

data.v: अलम्बुसा मिश्रकेशी पुण्डरीकाथ वामना । उपानृत्यंस्तु भरतं भरद्वाजस्य शासनात् ।।
data.es: Thereafter, the apsaras, Alambusa, Misrakesi, Pundarika and Vamana danced near Bharata at the command of Bharadwaja.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, भरद्वाजस्य Bharadwaja's, शासनात् command, अलम्बुसा Alambusa, मिश्रकेशी Misrakese, पुण्डरीका Pundarika, वामना Vamana, भरतम् Bharata, उपानृत्यन् तु danced near.
data.md: And Alambusa, and Misrakesi, and Puņdarīka, and Vāmana danced before Bharata, at the command of Bharadvāja.

data.v: यानि माल्यानि देवेषु यानि चैत्ररथे वने । प्रयागे तान्यदृश्यन्त भरद्वाजस्य शासनात् ।।
data.es: The garlands of the gods available in Chitraratha's (Kubera's) garden could not match those obtained under the orders of Bharadwaja.
data.anv: यानि those, माल्यानि garlands, देवेषु among the gods, यानि those garlands, चैत्ररथे of Chaitraratha, वने in the garden, तानि all those, भरद्वाजस्य Bharadwaja's, शासनात् at the command, प्रयागे Prayaga, अदृश्यन्त were found.
data.md: And those blossoms that are in the celestial regions, and that bloom in the forest of Caitraratha, became visible in Prayāga at the energy of Bharadvāja.

data.v: बिल्वा मार्दङ्गिका आसञ्शम्या ग्राहा बिभीतकाः । अश्वत्था नर्तकाश्चासन्भरद्वाजस्य तेजसा ।।
data.es: At the command of Bharadwaja, bilva trees acted as drummers, vibhitaka trees as cymbalists and the pipal trees as dancers.
data.anv: भरद्वाजस्य at Bharadwaja's, शासनात् command, बिल्वाः bilva trees, मार्दङ्गिकाः as drummers,  आसन् became, विभीतकाः vibhitaka (palm) trees, शम्याग्राहा as cymbalists, अश्वत्था pipal trees, नर्तकाश्च as dancers, आसन् became.
data.md: And Vilwas did the office of players of the Mặdanga, and Bibhitakas, that of keepers of Soma, and Asvatthas became dancers, at the energy of Bharadvāja.

data.v: ततः सरलतालाश्च तिलका नक्तमालकाः । प्रहृष्टास्तत्र संपेतुः कुब्जाभूताथ वामनाः ।।
data.es: Thereafter pine, palmyra, tilaka, and naktamala trees were transformed into hunchbacks and dwarfs and moved about in great delight.
data.anv: ततः then, सरलतालाश्च pine and palmyra trees, तिलकाः tilaka trees, नक्तमालकाः naktamala (that bear flowers at night), प्रहृष्टाः out of great joy, कुब्जाः hunchbacked, अथ also, वामनाः dwarfs, भूत्वा तत्र सम्पेतुः taking the form moved about there.
data.md: And Saralas, Tālas, Tilakas, and Tamālas, being delighted, became hump-backed ones and dwarfs.

data.v: शिंशपामलकी जम्बूर्याश्चान्याः कानने लताः । प्रमदा विग्रहं कृत्वा भरद्वाजाश्रमेऽवसन् ।।
data.es: Asohka, emblic myrobalan and all other trees found in the forest malati, mallika and jati creepers assumed the form of women, came over to the hermitage of Bharadwaja and said:
data.anv: शिंशुपामलकीजम्ब्वः ashoka and emblic myrobalan trees, काननेषु in the forest, अन्याः and other, याः those, ताः they, मालती jasmine creeper, मल्लिका mallika creeper, जातिः jati creeper, कानने in the forest, अन्याः other, याः लताः all those creepers, प्रमदाविग्रहम् taking the form of women, कृत्वा having made, भरद्वाजाश्रमे in the hermitage of Bharadwaja, अवदन् said.
data.md: And Sinsapās, Āmalakīs, Jambūs and other plants of the forest, wearing the forms of females, stood at the mansion of Bharadvāja.

data.v: सुरां सुरापाः पिबत पायसं च बुभुक्शिताः । मांसनि च सुमेध्यानि भक्ष्यन्तां यावदिच्छथ ।।
data.es: 'O wine drinkers, drink as much as you can those who are hungry partake payasam and sacred meat'.
data.anv: सुरापाः O those of you who drink liquor, यावत् until, इच्छथ you desire, सुराः liquor, पिबत drink, बुभुक्षिताः those who are hungry to eat, पायसं च payasam (made of milk and rice), सुमेध्यानि sacred, मांसानि च meat, भक्ष्यन्ताम् let them eat.
data.md: Let wine-drinkers drink wine, the hungry eat Pāyasa, and those that are inclined to it, feed on clean meat.

data.v: उत्साद्य स्नापयन्ति स्म नदीतीरेषु वल्गुषु । अप्येकमेकं पुरुषं प्रमदाः सत्प चाष्ट च ।।
