data.es: Every single warrior was attended by seven or eight women who applied oil and massaged his body and bathed him on the lovely banks of the river.
data.anv: सप्त च seven or, अष्ट च eight, प्रमदाः women, एकम् one by one, पुरुषम् man, उच्छाद्य applied  oil and massaged the body, वल्गुषु in the lovely, नदीतीरेषु on the banks of the river, स्नापयन्ति bathed them, स्म अपि also.
data.md: And every seven or eight females taking a man, bathed him on the lovely banks of the rivers.

data.v: संवहन्त्यः समापेतुर्नार्यो रुचिरलोचनाः । परिमृज्य तथान्योन्यं पाययन्ति वराङ्गनाः ।।
data.es: Some women with beautiful eyes quickly approached them for massaging. The best of ladies wiped their bodies dry and gave each other wine to drink.
data.anv: रुचिरलोचनाः with beautiful eyes, नार्यः women, संवाहन्त्यः massaging, समापेतुः quickly approached, वराङ्गनाः best of ladies, तथा like that, परिमृज्य wiped the water, अन्योन्यम् to each other, पाययन्ति made them drink.
data.md: And damsels furnished with expansive eyes, having wiped the persons (of the bathers), pressed their legs, and those magnificent women made them drink (wine).

data.v: हयान्गजान्खरानुष्ट्रांस्तथैव सुरभेः सुतान् । इक्षूंश्च मधुजालांश्च भोजयन्ति स्म वाहनान् । इक्ष्वाकुवरयोधानां चोदयन्तो महाबलाः ।।
data.es: The attendants of draughtanimals fed the horses, elephants, donkeys, camels and oxen their appropriate food.
data.anv: वाहनपाः attendants of draughtanimals, हयान् horses, गजान् elephants, खरान् donkeys, उष्ट्रान् camels, तथैव similarly, सुरभेः the Surabhi's, सुतान offsprings, यथाविधि duly, तेषाम् for them, भोज्यम् food, अभोजयन् fed.
data.md: And some persons possessed of mighty strength, being directed thereto, fed the bearers of the foremost Ikşvāku warriors with sugercanes, honey, and fried paddy.

data.v: नाश्वबन्धोऽश्वमाजानान्न गजं कुञ्जरग्रहः । मत्तप्रमत्तमुदिता चमूः सा तत्र संबभौ ।।
data.es: The horserider no longer recognised the horse or the mahout the elephant and the whole army was inebriated with drinking and pleasure.
data.anv: अश्वबन्धः horserider, अश्वम् horse, न अजानात् no longer recognised, कुञ्जरग्रहः mahout, गजम् elephant, न not recognised, तत्र there, सा that, चमूः whole army, मत्तप्रमत्तमुदिता fully drunk had forgotten in their joy, सम्बभौ shone.
data.md: And the groom forgot his horse, and the elephant-keeper his elephant: that army there became transported with wine and exhilaration.

data.v: तर्पिता सर्वकामैस्ते रक्तचन्दनरूषिताः । अप्सरोगणसंयुक्ताः सैन्या वाचमुदैरयन् ।।
data.es: All the armymen with their desires gratified and anointing their bodies with red sandal paste surrounded by apsaras exclaimed.
data.anv: सर्वकामैः by all horseriders, तर्पिताः gratified, रक्तचन्दनरूषिताः smeared with red sandal paste, अप्सरोगणसम्युक्ताः surrounded by apsaras, ते सैन्याः those soldiers, वाचम् these words, उदैरयन् exclaimed.
data.md: And sumptuously entertained with every enjoyment, with their bodies decked with red sandal, the soldiery in the company of bevies of Apsaras, exclaimed.

data.v: नैवायोध्यां गमिष्यामो न गमिष्याम दण्डकान् । कुशलं भरतस्यास्तु रामस्यास्तु तथा सुखम् ।।
data.es: We will neither return to Ayodhya, nor enter Dandaka (forest). May Bharata and Rama be happy.
data.anv: अयोध्याम् to Ayodhya, न गमिष्यामः will not return, दण्डकान् to Danadaka forest, न गमिष्यामः will not go, भरतस्य to Bharata, कुशलम् welfare, अस्तु तथा be like this, रामस्य Rama, सुखम् happy, अस्तु will be.
data.md: To Ayodhyā will we not go, nor yet to Dandaka. Peace be to Bharata, and may Rāma reap happiness!

data.v: इति पादातयोधाश्च हस्त्यश्वारोहबन्धकाः । अनाथास्तं विधिं लब्ध्वा वाचमेतामुदैरयन् ।।
data.es: Having enjoyed the hospitality of Bharadwaja the foot soldiers, horse and elephant riders made utterances ignoring their leaders.
data.anv: पादातयोधाश्च foot soldiers, हस्त्यश्वरोहबन्धकाः horse and elephant riders, तम् विधिम् that hospitality, लब्धवा having received, अनाथाः इति no longer recognising their leaders, एताम् such, वाचम् utterances, उदीरयन् made.
data.md: Thus did footmen and the riders and keepers of elephants and horses, as well as others, having experienced such a state, utter words.

data.v: संप्रहृष्टा विनेदुस्ते नरास्तत्र सहस्रशः । भरतस्यानुयातारः स्वर्गेऽयमिति चाब्रुवन् ।।
data.es: The exceedingly delighted soldiers of Bharata's retinue in their thousands cried out with excitement This is the very heaven.
data.anv: भरतस्य Bharata's, अनुयातारः followers, ते नराः those men, तत्र there, सहस्रशः in their thousands, सम्प्रहृष्टाः highly exited with delight, विनेदुः shouted, अयम् this is, स्वर्गः heaven, इति thus, अब्रुवन् च started uttering.
data.md: And men by thousand, exceedinly delighted, sent up shouts. And saying. “This is heaven,” the retiune of Bharata, the soldiers, began to dance and laugh and sing; and bearing garlands, they on all sides rushed by thousands.

data.v: ततो भुक्तवतां तेषां तदन्नममृतोपमम् । दिव्यानुद्वीक्ष्य भक्ष्यांस्तानभवद्भक्षणे मतिः ।।
data.es: Glancing at the ambrosial food, a desire arose in the minds of those soldiers to eat once again although they had already partaken it.
data.anv: ततः then, अमृतोपमम् like nectar, तत् अन्नम् that food, भुक्तवताम् of those who had partaken, तेषाम् for them, दिव्यान् heavenly, तान् भक्ष्यान् those eatables, उद्वीक्षय glancing, भक्षणे to partake, मतिः in their minds, अभवत् desire arose.
data.md: And beholding the inviting viands resembling ambrosia, they although already fed, became desirous of eating once again.

data.v: प्रेष्याश्चेट्यश्च वध्वश्च बलस्थाश्चापि सर्वशः । बभूवुस्ते भृशं तृप्ताः सर्वे चाहतवाससः ।।
data.es: Messengers, maidservants, female attendants, and soldiers -- all of them in their thousands dressed in fresh garments felt exceedingly proud of themselves.
data.anv: सहश्रसः in their thousands, प्रेष्याः messengers, चेट्यश्च maidservants, वध्वश्च female attendants, बलस्थाः army attendants, ते they, सर्वे च all of them, अहतवाससः dressed in unworn (new) garments, भृशम् exceedingly, दृप्ताः बभूवुः felt proud of themselves.
data.md: And wearing new clothes, all the servants, and maids, and females of the household, became exceedingly well pleased.

data.v: कुञ्जराश्च खरोष्ट्रश्च गोश्वाश्च मृगपक्षिणः । बभूवुः सुभृतास्तत्र नान्यो ह्यन्यमकल्पयत् ।।
data.es: There the elephants, donkeys and camels, cows and horses and also beasts and birds were wellnourished. No one troubled the other.
data.anv: तत्र there, कुञ्जराश्च elephants, खरोष्ट्राश्च donkeys and camels, गोऽश्वाश्च cows and horses, मृगपक्षिणः beasts and birds, सुभृताः बभूवु were wellnourished, अन्यः अन्यम् one to the other, न अकल्पयत् हि did not trouble.
data.md: And elephants, and asses, camels, kine and horses, and beats and birds, being fed their fill, did not hunger after anything else.

data.v: नाशुक्लवासास्तत्रासीत्क्षुधितो मलिनोऽपि वा । रजसा ध्वस्तकेशो वा नरः कश्चिददृश्यत ।।
data.es: In that army there was none who could be seen without wearing garments of sparkling white, who was hungry or dirty or with decayed hair.
data.anv: तत्र there, अशुक्लवासाः wearing nonwhite (dirty) dress, क्षुधितः hungry, मलिनोऽपि dirty, न आसीत् none was there, कश्चित् नरः anybody, रजसा with dust, ध्वस्तकेशो वा with decayed hair, नादृश्यत could not be seen.
data.md: And there appeared no one who wore a soiled habit, or who was hungry, or melancholy, or whose hair was covered with dust.

data.v: आजैश्चापि च वाराहैर्निष्ठानवरसंचयैः । फलनिर्यूहसंसिद्धैः सूपैर्गन्धरसान्वितैः ।।
data.es: There the soldiers beheld in amazement thousands of iron containers decked with flags and flowers and filled with white rice, mutton, pork, choicest condiments, fruit juice, fragrant and tasty soup.
data.anv: तत्र there, नराः men, आजैश्चापि with mutton, वाराहैश्च pork, निष्ठानवरसञ्चयैः with choicest condiments, फलनिर्यूह संसिद्दैः with various fruit juices, गन्धरसान्वितैः with fragrant and tasteful, सूपैः with soups, पूर्णाः filled with, शुक्लस्य white, अन्नस्य rice, लौहीः best of iron containers, अभितः on all sides, विस्मिताः were amazed, ददृशुः beheld.

data.v: पुष्पध्वजवतीः पूर्णाः शुक्लस्यान्नस्य चाभितः । ददृशुर्विस्मितास्तत्र नरा लौहीः सहस्रशः ।।
data.es: There the soldiers beheld in amazement thousands of iron containers decked with flags and flowers and filled with white rice, mutton, pork, choicest condiments, fruit juice, fragrant and tasty soup.
data.anv: तत्र there, नराः men, आजैश्चापि with mutton, वाराहैश्च pork, निष्ठानवरसञ्चयैः with choicest condiments, फलनिर्यूह संसिद्दैः with various fruit juices, गन्धरसान्वितैः with fragrant and tasteful, सूपैः with soups, पूर्णाः filled with, शुक्लस्य white, अन्नस्य rice, लौहीः best of iron containers, अभितः on all sides, विस्मिताः were amazed, ददृशुः beheld.
data.md: And the people with wonder beheld before them vessels of precious metals by thousands graceful with chaplets of flowers, filled with essences of fruits and fragrant soups and curries and the flesh of goats and bears, and white rice.

data.v: बभूवुर्वनपार्श्वेषु कूपाः पायसकर्दमाः । ताश्च कामदुघा गावो द्रुमाश्चासन्मधुश्च्युतः ।।
data.es: Along the edge of the forest, wells were filled with thick payasam. There were wishfulfilling cows and honeydripping trees.
data.anv: वनपार्श्वेषु along the edge of the forest, पायसकर्दमाः drink of milk and rice, कूपाः wells, बभूवुः were formed, गाव: cows, ताः those, कामदुघाः wishfulfilling, द्रुमाश्च trees, मधुश्च्युतः dripping honey, आसन् became.
data.md: And there were on the skirts of the wood wells having Pāyasa for their slime; and the kine yeilded whatever was asked and all the trees dropped honey.

data.v: वाप्यो मैरेयपूर्णाश्च मृष्टमांसचयैर्वृताः । प्रतप्तपिठरैश्चापि मार्गमायूरकौक्कुटैः ।।
data.es: The wells were found filled with datepalm liquor and surrounded by pots of well cooked meat of peacocks, chicken and other animals.
data.anv: वाप्यः wells, मैरेयपूर्णाश्च filled with datepalm liquor, प्रतप्तपिठरैः with hot pots (filled with cooked meat), मार्गमायूरकौक्कुटैः meat of peacock, chicken and deer, मृष्णमांसचयैः meat of other animals, वृताः surrounded by.
data.md: And the tanks were filled with Maireya as well as with clean hot meat of dear, peacocks, and cocks, dressed in pans.

data.v: पात्रीणां च सहस्राणि शातकुम्भमयानि च । स्थाल्यः कुम्भ्यः करम्भ्यश्च दधिपूर्णाः सुसंस्कृताः । यौवनस्थस्य गौरस्य कपित्थस्य सुगन्धिनः ।।
ह्रदाः पूर्णा रसालस्य दध्नः श्वेतस्य चापरे । बभूवुः पायसस्यान्ते शर्करायाश्च संचयाः ।।
कल्कांश्चूर्णकषायांश्च स्नानानि विविधानि च । ददृशुर्भाजनस्थानि तीर्थेषु सरितां नराः ।।
data.es: The soldiers saw on the river banks at landing places levigated powder, fragrant powder and extracts and other bathing requisites of different kinds stored in receptacles.
data.anv: नराः men (soldiers), सरिताम् rivers, तीर्थेषु landing places, कल्कान् levigated powder, चूर्णकषायांश्च powder and extract, भाजनस्थानि in receptacles, विविधानि of different kinds,  स्नानानि च bathing requisites, ददृशुः were seen.

data.v: शुक्लानंशुमतश्चापि दन्तधावनसंचयान् । शुक्लांश्चन्दनकल्कांश्च समुद्गेष्ववतिष्ठतः ।।
दर्पणान्परिमृष्टांश्च वाससां चापि संचयान् । पादुकोपानहां चैव युग्मान्यत्र सहस्रशः ।।
आञ्जनीः कङ्कतान्कूर्चांश्छत्राणि च धनूंषि च । मर्मत्राणानि चित्राणि शयनान्यासनानि च ।।
प्रतिपानह्रदान्पूर्णान्खरोष्ट्रगजवाजिनाम् । अवगाह्य सुतीर्थांश्च ह्रदान्सोत्पल पुष्करान् ।।
नीलवैदूर्यवर्णांश्च मृदून्यवससंचयान् । निर्वापार्थं पशूनां ते ददृशुस्तत्र सर्वशः ।।
व्यस्मयन्त मनुष्यास्ते स्वप्नकल्पं तदद्भुतम् । दृष्ट्वातिथ्यं कृतं तादृग्भरतस्य महर्षिणा ।।
data.es: The men were amazed when they beheld the wonderful hospitality extended by maharshi Bharadwaja to Bharata, as if all this happened in a dream world.
data.anv: ते मनुष्याः those men, महर्षिणा by the sage, भरतस्य to Bharata, कृतम् provided, तादृक् such, स्वप्नकल्पम् like a dream, अद्भुतम् wonderful, तत् that, आतिथ्यम् hospitality, दृष्ट्वा beholding, व्यस्मयन्त were amazed.
data.md: Witnessing the wonderful hospitality provided by the Maharşi Bharadvāja, like to a vision, the men marvelled.

data.v: इत्येवं रममाणानां देवानामिव नन्दने । भरद्वाजाश्रमे रम्ये सा रात्रिर्व्यत्यवर्तत ।।
data.es: As they were enjoying themselves in Bharadwaja's hermitage like the gods in the garden of Indra the night wore off.
data.anv: इत्येवम् like this, नन्दने in the garden of Indra, देवानामिव as for gods, रम्ये in the lovely, भरद्वाजाश्रमे in Bharadwaja's hermitage, रममाणानाम् enjoying so, सा रात्रिः that night, व्यत्यवर्तत passed off.
data.md: Thus entertained like to celestials in Nandana, they passed the night at the hermitage of Bharadvāja.

data.v: प्रतिजग्मुश्च ता नद्यो गन्धर्वाश्च यथागतम् । भरद्वाजमनुज्ञाप्य ताश्च सर्वा वराङ्गनाः ।।
data.es: Those rivers, the gandharvas and all those lovely women took leave of sage Bharadwaja and returned to where they had come from.
data.anv: ताः नद्यः those rivers, गन्धर्वाश्च and the gandharvas, सर्वाः all, ताः of them, वराङ्गनाश्च lovely women too, भरद्वाजम् Bharadwaja's, अनुज्ञाप्य obtaining permission, यथागतम् from whereever they had come, प्रतिजग्मुश्च returned.
data.md: Then taking the permission of Bharadvāja, all the Gandharvas as well as the superb damsels went away as they had come.

data.v: तथैव मत्ता मदिरोत्कटा नरा;स्तथैव दिव्यागुरुचन्दनोक्षिताः । तथैव दिव्या विविधाः स्रगुत्तमाः; पृथक्प्रकीर्णा मनुजैः प्रमर्दिताः ।।
data.md: And the men remained intoxicated and highly inebriate with the liquor, their persons daubed with goodly aguru and sandal; and the various elegant garlands beautiful to behold, lay by themselves all around, crushed by the people.

data.v: ततस्तां रजनीमुष्य भरतः सपरिच्छदः । कृतातिथ्यो भरद्वाजं कामादभिजगाम ह ।।
data.es: Bharata with his retinue received the hospitality and spent the night at Bharadwaja's ashram. Then he approached Bharadwaja on his own.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, कृतातिथ्यः having received the hospitality, सपरिच्छदः with his retinue, भरतः Bharata, तां रजनीम् that night, उष्य having spent, कामात् intention of, भरद्वाजम् Bharadwaja, अभिजगाम ह approached.
data.md: Having passed that night, Bharata having been entertained along with his family, appeared before Bharadvāja, desirous (of seeing Rāma).

data.v: तमृषिः पुरुषव्याघ्रं प्रेक्ष्य प्राञ्जलिमागतम् । हुताग्निहोत्रो भरतं भरद्वाजोऽभ्यभाषत ।।
data.es: Seeing Bharata, the best among men, who stood with folded palms, sage Bharadwaja, who had just completed his firesacrifice, said to him:
data.anv: हुताग्निहोत्रः who had completed his firesacrifice, भरद्वाजः ऋषिः sage Bharadwaja, पुरुषव्याघ्रम् tiger among men, प्राञ्जलिम् with folded palms, आगतम् arrived, तं भरतम् to Bharata, प्रेक्ष्य having seen, अभ्यभाषत spoke.
data.md: Seeing that foremost of men (standing) with joined hands, Bharadvāja, who had just finished his fire-sacrifice, said.

data.v: कच्चिदत्र सुखा रात्रिस्तवास्मद्विषये गता । समग्रस्ते जनः कच्चिदातिथ्ये शंस मेऽनघ ।।
data.es: O sinless one hope, you spent the night at our hermitage well? Tell me whether all your people enjoyed the hospitality?
data.anv: अत्र here, अस्मद्विषये at our place, तव to you, रात्रिः night, सुखम् happily, गता कच्चित् hope you spent, हे अनघ O sinless one, आतिथ्ये in the matter of hospitality, ते जनः your people, समग्रः कच्चित् all well, मे शंस tell me.
data.md: Have you passed the night pleasantly at our place? And have all your men been pleased with our hospitality? Do you tell me this O sinless one. we

data.v: तमुवाचाञ्जलिं कृत्वा भरतोऽभिप्रणम्य च । आश्रमादभिनिष्क्रन्तमृषिमुत्तम तेजसम् ।।
data.es: Bharata saluted with folded palms the sage of great powers. And emerging from the hermitage, replied:
data.anv: भरतः Bharata, आश्रमात् from the hermitage, अभिनिष्क्रान्तम् emerging, उत्तमतेजसम् great power, तम् ऋषिम् that sage, अञ्जलिं कृत्वा with palms joined together, अभिप्रणम्य च and saluting him, उवाच said:
data.md: Thereupon, Bharata bowing down, with joined hands said to that ascetic of excellent energy, as he had issued out of his hermitage.

data.v: सुखोषितोऽस्मि भगवन्समग्रबलवाहनः । तर्पितः सर्वकामैश्च सामात्यो बलवत्त्वया ।।
data.es: O holy one, I with my ministers and the entire army of men and animals passed the night happily. All our desires have been gratified by you.
data.anv: भगवन् O holy one, सामात्यः with my ministers, समग्रबलवाहनः with the entire army and animals, त्वया by you, बलवत् exceedingly, सर्वकामैः with all desires, तर्पितः gratified, सुखोषितः अस्मि passed pleasantly.

data.v: अपेतक्लमसंतापाः सुभक्ष्याः सुप्रतिश्रयाः । अपि प्रेष्यानुपादाय सर्वे स्म सुसुखोषिताः ।।
data.es: All of us including the messengers were released from fatigue and heat. We were wellfed and wellhoused and the night was wellspent.
data.anv: प्रेष्यान् अपि even the messengers, उपादाय including, सर्वे all of us, अपेतक्लमसन्तापाः freed from fatigue and heat, सुभिक्षाः wellnourished, सुप्रतिश्रयाः wellhoused, सुसुखोषिताः स्मः we passed (the night) happily
data.md: O reverend Sire, I along with all my forces and vehicles have passed (the night) happily. I have been full well entertained by you, o worshipful one possessed of power. And with our languor and heat removed, all sumptuously feasted and comfortably quartered, have passed (the night) agreeably along with our servants.

data.v: आमन्त्रयेऽहं भगवन्कामं त्वामृषिसत्तम । समीपं प्रस्थितं भ्रातुर्मैरेणेक्षस्व चक्षुषा ।।
data.es: O venerable one O excellent of the ascetics I seek your leave. As I am proceeding to see my brother, bless me with a kindly look.
data.anv: भगवन् O venerable one, ऋषिसत्तमः O excellent of the ascetics, अहम् I, त्वाम् you, कामम् greatly, आमन्त्रये I take leave of you, भ्रातुः brother's, समीपम् to, प्रस्थितम् set out, मैत्रेण friendly, चक्षुषा with eye, ईक्षस्व you may consider.
data.md: Now, O best of ascetics, I beseech you to look with a propitious eye on me who am bound for my brother's place.

data.v: आश्रमं तस्य धर्मज्ञ धार्मिकस्य महात्मनः । आचक्ष्व कतमो मार्गः कियानिति च शंस मे ।।
data.es: O knower of righteousness Tell me which path leads to the hermitage of that righteous and magnanimous one (Rama)? And how far is it (from here)?
data.anv: धर्मज्ञ O knower of righteous ways, धार्मिकस्य of the righteous, तस्य महात्मनः of that magnanimous one, आश्रमम् hermitage, आचक्ष्व tell me, कतमः which, मार्गः is the path  कियान् how far, इति च that one also, मे to me, शंस tell.
data.md: And tell me, O you cognizant of morality, how far is it to that high-souled righteous one's asylm, and by what way (shall I reach there)?

data.v: इति पृष्टस्तु भरतं भ्रातृदर्शनलालसम् । प्रत्युवाच महातेजा भरद्वाजो महातपाः ।।
data.es: Thus questioned, the great sage, brilliant Bharadwaja replied to Bharata who was yearning to see his brother:
data.anv: महातेजाः brilliant, महातपाः a great sage, भरद्वाजः Bharadwaja, इति thus, पृष्टः questioned, भ्रातृदर्शनलालसम् yearning to see his brother, भरतम् to Bharata, प्रत्युवाच replied.
data.md: When Bharata eager to see his brother had asked thus, the highly energetic Bharadvāja of rigid austerities answered.

data.v: भरतार्धतृतीयेषु योजनेष्वजने वने । चित्रकूटो गिरिस्तत्र रम्यनिर्दरकाननः ।।
data.es: O Bharata, three and a half yojanas from here in the lonely forest stands mount Chitrakuta, with its charming streams and woodlands
data.anv: भरत O Bharata, अर्धतृतीयेषु three and a half, योजनेषु yojanas (one yojana is equivalent to eight miles), तत्र there, अजने lonely, वने forest, रम्यनिर्झरकाननः with charming streams and woodlands, चित्रकूटः Chitrakuta, गिरिः mountain (is there).
data.md: O Bharata, two and a half Yojanas hence, embossed in a tenantless wood is the mountain Citrakuta, charming with rocks and woods.

data.v: उत्तरं पार्श्वमासाद्य तस्य मन्दाकिनी नदी । पुष्पितद्रुमसंछन्ना रम्यपुष्पितकानना ।।
data.es: On its northern side flows the river Mandakini which is densely covered with flowering trees and lovely blossoming woods (on its banks).
data.anv: तस्य its, उत्तरं पार्श्वम् northern side, आसाद्य having reached, पुष्पितद्रुमसञ्चन्ना covered with flowering trees, रम्यपुष्पितकानना with lovely, blossoming woods, मन्दाकिनी नदी there is river Mandakini.
data.md: On its northern border flows the river Mandākinſ, covered with flowering trees and with blossoming woods. Beyond the stream is the mountain Citrakuta. There is their thatched cottage, my child; there they abide for certain.

data.v: अनन्तरं तत्सरितश्चित्रकूटश्च पर्वतः । ततो पर्णकुटी तात तत्र तौ वसतो ध्रुवम् ।।
data.es: O dear child, beyond that river lies mount Chitrakuta on which there is a hut made of leaves where, for sure, they both dwell.
data.anv: तत्सरितः that river, अनन्तरम् beyond, चित्रकूटः Chitrkuta, पर्वतः mountain, तयोः their, पर्णकुटी leafy hut, तात O dear child, तौ both of them, तत्र there, वसतः are living, ध्रुवम् this is certain.

data.v: दक्षिणेनैव मार्गेण सव्यदक्षिणमेव च । गजवाजिरथाकीर्णां वाहिनीं वाहिनीपते । वाहयस्व महाभाग ततो द्रक्ष्यसि राघवम् ।।
data.es: O distinguished lord of the army, if you lead your army full of elephants, horses and chariots through the southern path or towards the southwest, you will come across Rama there.
data.anv: वाहिनीपते lord of the army, महाभाग O distinguished one, गजवाजिरथाकीर्णाम् consisting of elephants, horses and chariots, वाहिनीम् army, दक्षिणेनैव to its south, मार्गेण through the  path, सव्यदक्षिणमेव वा or towards southwest, वाहयस्व lead, ततः thereafter, राघवम् Rama, द्रक्षयसि you will see.
data.md: Proceeding by the southern way, do you with your forces composed of elephants and horses, O master of the army, turn to the left, O exalted one, and go southwards. By doing so, you will be able to see Rāghava.

data.v: प्रयाणमिति च श्रुत्वा राजराजस्य योषितः । हित्वा यानानि यानार्हा ब्राह्मणं पर्यवारयन् ।।
data.es: When they heard about the journey, the wives of Dasaratha descended from their chariots worthy of them and stood around the brahmin, Bharadwaja.
data.anv: इति thus, प्रयाणम् about journey, श्रुत्वा having heard, यानार्हाः chariots worthy of them, राजराजस्य king of kings, Dasaratha's, योषितः wives, यानानि carriages, हित्वा leaving, ब्राह्मणम् that brahmin, पर्यवारयन् stood around.
data.md: Hearing of their departure, the wives of that king of kings, leaving their cars, albeit worthy of them, gathered round the Brāhmaṇa.

data.v: वेपमाना कृशा दीना सह देव्या सुमन्त्रिया । कौसल्या तत्र जग्राह कराभ्यां चरणौ मुनेः ।।
data.es: Among them was Kausalya, trembling, emaciated and desolate, along with Sumitra. They grasped the feet of sage Bharadwaja with their hands.
data.anv: तत्र among them, कृशा emaciated, दीना desolate, कौसल्या Kausalya, वेपमाना trembling, मुनेः sage's, चरणौ feet, सुमित्रया देव्या सह along with Sumitra, जग्राह grasped.
data.md: Lean and trembling and in woeful guise, Kausalyā along with the noble Sumitrā, with her hands took the feet of the ascetic.

data.v: असमृद्धेन कामेन सर्वलोकस्य गर्हिता । कैकेयी तस्य जग्राह चरणौ सव्यपत्रपा ।।
data.es: Kaikeyi with her unfulfilled desire and despised in all the worlds overcome with shame, also grasped his feet.
data.anv: असमृद्धेन with unfulfilled, कामेन with desire, सर्वलोकस्य for all the worlds, गर्हिता despised, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, सव्यपत्रपा overcome with shame, तस्य his, चरणौ feet, जग्राह grasped.
data.md: Depised universally because of her unrighteous desire, Kaikeyi also bashfully took hold of his feet and, having circumambulated the mighty and venerable anchoret, stood near Bharata in dejection of spirits.

data.v: तं प्रदक्षिणमागम्य भगवन्तं महामुनिम् । अदूराद्भरतस्यैव तस्थौ दीनमनास्तदा ।।
data.es: She reverently circumambulated that great and divine ascetic and stood not far away from Bharata with a sad heart.
data.anv: तदा then, भगवन्तम् divine, तं महामुनिम् that great ascetic, प्रदक्षिणं आगम्य reverently circumambulated, दीनमनाः with a sad heart, भरतस्य from Bharata, अदूरादेव not far away, तस्थौ stood.
data.md: Depised universally because of her unrighteous desire, Kaikeyi also bashfully took hold of his feet and, having circumambulated the mighty and venerable anchoret, stood near Bharata in dejection of spirits.

data.v: ततः पप्रच्छ भरतं भरद्वाजो दृढव्रतः । विशेषं ज्ञातुमिच्छामि मातॄणां तव राघव ।।
data.es: Then Bharadwaja, firm in his vows, said to Bharata, I want to know about your mothers individually.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, दृढव्रतः firm in vows, भरद्वाजः Bharadwaja, भरतम् Bharata, पप्रच्छ enquired, राघव O Bharata, तव your, मात्रूणाम् mothers, विशेषम् individually, ज्ञातुम् to know, इच्छामि want desiring.
data.md: Then the mighty ascetic Bharadvāja asked Bharata, “O descendant of Raghu, I wish to know particularly about your mothers."

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु भरतो भरद्वाजेन धार्मिकः । उवाच प्राञ्जलिर्भूत्वा वाक्यं वचनकोविदः ।।
data.es: Thus spoken to by the king, Rama, skilled in speech and upholder of righteousness, replied to his father with folded palms:
data.anv: धीमता by the sagacious, भरद्वाजेन by Bharadwaja, एवम् thus, उक्तः asked, वचनकोविदः proficient in speech, भरतः Bharata, प्राञ्जलि: भूत्वा with palms joined together in reverence, वाक्यम् words, उवाच said.
data.md: Thus accosted by Bharadvāja, the pious Bharata deft in speech said with joined hands.

data.v: यामिमां भगवन्दीनां शोकानशनकर्शिताम् । पितुर्हि महिषीं देवीं देवतामिव पश्यसि ।।
data.es: O venerable sage, this queen you are looking at, forlorn and emaciated due to grief and fasting, and who resembles a goddess is Kausalya, the principal queen of my father. As Aditi bore Dhata, she bore Rama, the best among men who walks with the powerful stride of a lion.
data.anv: भगवन् O venerable one, दीनाम् desolate, शोकानशनकर्शिताम् emaciated due to grief and fasting, पितुः father's, महिषीम् principal queen, देवतामिव resembling a goddess, याम् इमाम्   देवीम् that this queen, पश्यसि you are seeing, एषा she, कौसल्या is Kausalya, अदितिः Aditi,  धातारं यथा like Dhata, सिंहविक्रान्तगामिनम् walking with the powerful stride of a lion, पुरुषव्याघ्रम् tiger among men, तं रामम् that Rama, सुषुवे gave birth.
data.md: O reverend sir, she whom you behold depressed and emaciated through grief and fasting, resembling a very goddess, is the noble Queen of my father. This one, Kausalyā, it is that gave birth to that chief of men, having the powerful gait of a lion, Rāma, even as Aditi gave birth to Dhātā.

data.v: एषा तं पुरुषव्याघ्रं सिंहविक्रान्तगामिनम् । कौसल्या सुषुवे रामं धातारमदितिर्यथा ।।
data.es: O venerable sage, this queen you are looking at, forlorn and emaciated due to grief and fasting, and who resembles a goddess is Kausalya, the principal queen of my father. As Aditi bore Dhata, she bore Rama, the best among men who walks with the powerful stride of a lion.
data.anv: भगवन् O venerable one, दीनाम् desolate, शोकानशनकर्शिताम् emaciated due to grief and fasting, पितुः father's, महिषीम् principal queen, देवतामिव resembling a goddess, याम् इमाम्   देवीम् that this queen, पश्यसि you are seeing, एषा she, कौसल्या is Kausalya, अदितिः Aditi,  धातारं यथा like Dhata, सिंहविक्रान्तगामिनम् walking with the powerful stride of a lion, पुरुषव्याघ्रम् tiger among men, तं रामम् that Rama, सुषुवे gave birth.
data.md: O reverend sir, she whom you behold depressed and emaciated through grief and fasting, resembling a very goddess, is the noble Queen of my father. This one, Kausalyā, it is that gave birth to that chief of men, having the powerful gait of a lion, Rāma, even as Aditi gave birth to Dhātā.

data.v: अस्या वामभुजं श्लिष्टा यैषा तिष्ठति दुर्मनाः । कर्णिकारस्य शाखेव शीर्णपुष्पा वनान्तरे ।।
data.es: This lady plunged in grief, resembling the branch of a karnikara tree in the midst of the forest with blossoms withered and leaning on the left arm of Kausalya, is queen Sumitra, mother of two heroes, comparable to gods in beauty and possessing true prowess -- Lakshmana and Satrughna.
data.anv: या एषा this woman, दुर्मनाः plunged in grief, वनान्तरे in the midst of the forest, शीर्णपुष्पा with blossoms withered, कर्णिकारस्य of the karnikara tree, शाखेव like a branch, अस्याः this Kausalya's, वामभुजम् left arm, श्लिष्टा leaning, तिष्ठति standing, कुमारौ two princes, देववर्णिनौ equal to gods in beauty, वीरौ heroes, सत्यपराक्रमौ possessing no vain prowess, लक्षणशत्रुघ्नौ  Lakshmana and Satrughna, उभौ both, एतस्या देव्या: this queen's, सुतौ sons.

data.v: एतस्यास्तौ सुतौ देव्याः कुमारौ देववर्णिनौ । उभौ लक्ष्मणशत्रुघ्नौ वीरौ सत्यपराक्रमौ ।।
data.es: This lady plunged in grief, resembling the branch of a karnikara tree in the midst of the forest with blossoms withered and leaning on the left arm of Kausalya, is queen Sumitra, mother of two heroes, comparable to gods in beauty and possessing true prowess -- Lakshmana and Satrughna.
data.anv: या एषा this woman, दुर्मनाः plunged in grief, वनान्तरे in the midst of the forest, शीर्णपुष्पा with blossoms withered, कर्णिकारस्य of the karnikara tree, शाखेव like a branch, अस्याः this Kausalya's, वामभुजम् left arm, श्लिष्टा leaning, तिष्ठति standing, कुमारौ two princes, देववर्णिनौ equal to gods in beauty, वीरौ heroes, सत्यपराक्रमौ possessing no vain prowess, लक्षणशत्रुघ्नौ  Lakshmana and Satrughna, उभौ both, एतस्या देव्या: this queen's, सुतौ sons.

data.v: यस्याः कृते नरव्याघ्रौ जीवनाशमितो गतौ । राजा पुत्रविहीनश्च स्वर्गं दशरथो गतः ।।
ऐश्वर्यकामां कैकेयीमनार्यामार्यरूपिणीम् । ममैतां मातरं विद्धि नृशंसां पापनिश्चयाम् । यतोमूलं हि पश्यामि व्यसनं महदात्मनः ।।
data.es: She is my mother Kaikeyi who is irascible, lacks the power of discrimination, proud, boastful of her beauty, ambitious of wealth, ignoble in the guise of a noble woman, wicked and intent on sinful acts. Behold her. You may know that because of her, Rama and Lakshmana the best of men entered the forest which may cause their destruction and king Dasaratha attained heaven. She alone is the root of this great calamity that I am presently confronting.
data.anv: यस्याः कृते on whose account, नरव्याघ्रौ best of men (Rama and Lakshmana), इतः from here, जीवनाशम् destruction of life, गतौ obtained, राजा दशरथः king Dasaratha, पुत्रविहीनश्च deprived of his son, स्वर्गम् heaven, गतः attained, आत्मन: mine, महत् great, व्यसनम्  calamity, यतोमूलम् the root cause of, पश्यामि I see, क्रोधानाम् irascible, अकृतप्रज्ञाम् is not discerning, दृप्ताम् proud, सुभगमानिनीम् considers herself beautiful, ऐश्वर्यकामाम् ambitious of wealth, अनार्याम् ignoble, आर्यरूपिणीम् in the guise of a noble woman, एताम् she, नृशंसाम् wicked, पापनिश्चयाम् intent on sinful acts, मम my, मातरम् mother, कैकेयीम् Kaikeyi, विद्धि you may know.
data.md: And her in consequence of whose act those foremost of men have come by crushing misfortune, and the king Dasaratha has gone to heaven, deprived of his son, wrathful and proud of her good fortune, setting her heart of wealth, Kaikeyi, dishonourable, although endowed with the semblance of honour, do you know this wicked one intent on sin as my mother. In her do I perceive the root of my mighty misfortune.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा नरशार्दूलो बाष्पगद्गदया गिरा । स निशश्वास ताम्राक्षो क्रुद्धो नाग इवासकृत् ।।
data.es: Thus spoke Bharata, the best of men, with his eyes reddened and voice choked with sobs and hissing like a king cobra.
data.anv: ताम्राक्षः with reddened eyes, नरशार्दूलः tiger among men, सः that Bharata, बाष्पगद्गदया in a voice choked with tears, गिरा with words, इति thus,उक्त्वा having said, कृद्धः angry, श्वसन् sighing, नागः इव like a king cobra, निश्स्वास heaved sighs.
data.md: Having said this, with his words choked with emotion, that best of men with his eyes reddened, sighed like an enraged serpent.

data.v: भरद्वाजो महर्षिस्तं ब्रुवन्तं भरतं तदा । प्रत्युवाच महाबुद्धिरिदं वचनमर्थवत् ।।
data.es: Hearing the words of Bharata, the great sage, wise Bharadwaja replied with meaningful words:
data.anv: महाबुद्धि: wise, महर्षिः great sage Maharshi, भरद्वाजः Bharadwaja, तथा thus, ब्रुवन्तम्      speaking, तं भरतम् to that Bharata, अर्थवत् significant, इदं वचनम् these words, प्रत्युवाच replied.
data.md: As Bharata was speaking thus, the great ascetic Bharadvāja gifted with high understanding and knowing interest, answered Bharata, saying.

data.v: न दोषेणावगन्तव्या कैकेयी भरत त्वया । रामप्रव्राजनं ह्येतत्सुखोदर्कं भविष्यति ।।
data.es: O Bharata, you should not find fault with Kaikeyi. Rama's banishment will prove a great source of happiness in future (for mankind).
data.anv: भरत O Bharata, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, त्वया by you, दोषेण with any fault, न अवगन्तव्या should not be imputed, एतत् this, रामप्रव्राजनम् banishment of Rama, सुखोदर्कम् of great felicity, भविष्यति हि will become.
data.md: O Bharata, you ought not to cast any blame on Kaikeyī. This banishment of the king (Rāma), shall be for the good (of all).

data.v: अभिवाद्य तु संसिद्धः कृत्वा चैनं प्रदक्षिणम् । आमन्त्र्य भरतः सैन्यं युज्यतामित्यचोदयत् ।।
data.es: All of them paid their homage by circumambulating the highsouled Rama. Crying bitterly, they stood here and there.
data.anv: भरतः Bharata, एनम् him, अभिवाद्य having paid obeisance, संसिद्धः getting ready for the journey, प्रदक्षिणं च कृत्वा having circumambulated, आमन्त्र्य having taken leave of him, युज्यताम् इति Be harnessed, सैन्यम् the army, अचोदयत् urged.
data.md: Thus blest, Bharata saluted the ascetic and went round him, and then summoning the soldiery, said, “Yoke,"

data.v: ततो वाजिरथान्युक्त्वा दिव्यान्हेमपरिष्क्रितान् । अध्यारोहत्प्रयाणार्थी बहून्बहुविधो जनः ।।
data.es: Different groups of people intending to depart harnessed excellent horsechariots decorated with gold.
data.anv: ततः then, बहुविधः different types, जनः people, प्रयाणार्थी wishing to proceed, दिव्यान् excellent, हेमपरिष्कृतान् decorated with gold, युक्तान् harnessed, वाजिरथान् horsechariots, अध्यारोहत् mounted.
data.md: Thereupon, getting ready excellent steeds and cars decked with gold, many people mounted, with the intention of departing.

data.v: गजकन्यागजाश्चैव हेमकक्ष्याः पताकिनः । जीमूता इव घर्मान्ते सघोषाः संप्रतस्थिरे ।।
data.es: The male and female elephants wearing golden girths and decorated with pennants, set forth with their bells sounding like thunderclouds at the end of summer.
data.anv: हेमकक्ष्याः with golden girths, पताकिनः with pennants, गजकन्याः female elephants, गजाश्चैव also male elephants, घर्मान्ते at the close of summer, जीमूताः इव like thunderclouds, सघोषाः with sounds, सम्प्रतस्थिरे set forth.
data.md: And male and female elephants with golden chains round their necks, and furnished with banners, with the sounds (of bells), proceeded, like clouds at the end of the summer season.

data.v: विविधान्यपि यानानि महानि च लघूनि च । प्रययुः सुमहार्हाणि पादैरेव पदातयः ।।
data.es: Various types of costly carriages, large and small, set forth, while the infantry marched on.
data.anv: महन्ति च large ones, लघूनि च small ones, विविधानि of various kinds, सुमहार्हाणि costly, यानानि had carriages, प्रययुः set forth, पदातयः footsoldiers, पादैरेव set out on foot it self.
data.md: And then proceeded various kinds of cars great and light of movement and of high value; and the infantry went on foot.

data.v: अथ यानप्रवेकैस्तु कौसल्याप्रमुखाः स्त्रियः । रामदर्शनकाङ्क्षिण्यः प्रययुर्मुदितास्तदा ।।
data.es: The women headed by Kausalya, eager to see Rama, proceeded delightfully in distinguished carriages.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, कौसल्याप्रमुखाः headed by Kausalya, स्त्रियः women, रामदर्शनकाङ्क्षिण्यः eager to see Rama, मुदिताः delightfully, तदा then, यानप्रवेकैः in distinguished carriages, प्रययुः went.
data.md: And on a magnificent car went the ladies headed by Kausalyā, with delighted hearts, eager to see Rāghava.

data.v: स चार्कतरुणाभासां नियुक्तां शिबिकां शुभाम् । आस्थाय प्रययौ श्रीमान्भरतः सपरिच्छदः ।।
data.es: Magnanimous Bharata got into an auspicious palanquin of the splendour of the Sun and the Moon kept ready and proceeded amidst escorts.
data.anv: श्रीमान् majestic, भरतः Bharata, चन्द्रार्कतरुणाभासाम् with the splendour of the Sun and the Moon, निर्युक्ताम् kept ready, शुभाम् auspicious, शिबिकाम् palanquin, आस्थाय having got in, सपरिच्छदः with retinue, प्रययौ proceeded.
data.md: And ascending an elegant car resembling the infant sun or moon, driven by charioteers, went the graceful Bharata well attired.

data.v: सा प्रयाता महासेना गजवाजिरथाकुला । दक्षिणां दिशमावृत्य महामेघ इवोत्थितः । वनानि तु व्यतिक्रम्य जुष्टानि मृगपक्षिभिः ।।
data.es: That vast army teeming with elephants, horses and chariots proceeded southward spreading like a lofty cloud that had risen in the sky, traversing through the forests full of birds and beasts, passing through the mountains and streams on the other side of the river Ganga.
data.anv: गजवाजिरथाकुला teeming with elephants, horses and chariots, सा महासेना that vast army, उत्थितः that has arisen, महामेघ इव like a lofty cloud, दक्षिणां दिशम् southward, आवृत्य  having spread, मृगपक्षिभिः with birds and beasts, जुष्टानि visited, वनानि forests, व्यतिक्रम्य traversing, गङ्गाया: river Ganga's, परवेलायाम् on the other side, गिरिष्वपि through mountains also, नदीषु च and streams, प्रयाता proceeded.
data.md: And that mighty host abounding with horses and elephants proceeded, blocking up the southern quarter, like a colossal cloud arisen (in the sky), leaving behind on the other bank of the Gangā woods inhabited by birds and beasts, and coursing by rivers mountains.

data.v: सा संप्रहृष्टद्विपवाजियोधा; वित्रासयन्ती मृगपक्षिसंघान् । महद्वनं तत्प्रविगाहमाना; रराज सेना भरतस्य तत्र ।।
data.es: Bharata's army of soldiers, elephants and horses, all in high spirits, looked splendid while entering the forest full of frightening flocks of birds and beasts.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे द्विनवतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the ninetysecond sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: सम्प्रहृष्टद्विपवाजियोधा with soldiers, elephants and horses in high spirits, मृगपक्षिसङ्घान् flocks of birds and beasts, वित्रासयन्ती frightening, भरतस्य Bharata's, सा सेना that army, तत्र there, तत् that, महत् great, वनम् forest, प्रतिगाहमाना while entering, रराज looked splendid.
data.md: And composed of numbers of elephants and horses in high spirits, that army of Bharata, frightening multitudes of beasts and birds, dived into that mighty forest.

data.v: तया महत्या यायिन्या ध्वजिन्या वनवासिनः । अर्दिता यूथपा मत्ताः सयूथाः संप्रदुद्रुवुः ।।
data.es: On seeing the great army marching, the exited leaders of herds of elephants inhabiting the forest were frightened and ran off with their herds.
data.anv: यायिन्या while on the march, महत्या by the great, तया that, ध्वजिन्या by the army, वनवासिनः  foresters, मत्ताः exited, यूथपाः the leaders of herds, अर्दिताः were frightened, सयूथाः with herds, सम्प्रदुद्रुवुः ran off.
data.md: Afflicted by the mighty force on its way with banners (displayed), those inhabitants of the woods, leaders of elephant-herds, took to their heels in company with the herds themselves.

data.v: ऋक्षाः पृषतसंघाश्च रुरवश्च समन्ततः । दृश्यन्ते वनराजीषु गिरिष्वपि नदीषु च ।।
data.es: Bears, herds of dappled gazelle and antelopes could be seen everywhere in the stretches of the forest, also on the mountains and on the river banks.
data.anv: वनराजीषु in the stretches of the forest, गिरिष्वपि also on the mountains, नदीषु च at the river banks, समन्ततः on all sides, ऋक्षाः bears, पृषतसङ्घाश्च herds of dappled gazelle, रुरवश्च antelopes, दृश्यन्ते could be seen
data.md: And bears and Prsatas and Rurus were on all sides seen in the forest-ways, and on hills and rivers.

data.v: स संप्रतस्थे धर्मात्मा प्रीतो दशरथात्मजः । वृतो महत्या नादिन्या सेनया चतुरङ्गया ।।
data.es: Bharata the righteous son of Dasaratha, proceeded with great delight in the company of the clamouring army of four divisions.
data.anv: धर्मत्मा the righteous, सः दशरथात्मजः that son of Dasaratha (Bharata), प्रीतः was delighted,  नादिन्या clamouring, महत्या great, चतुरङ्गया of four divisions, सेनया with army, वृतः surrounded by, सम्प्रतस्थे proceeded.
data.md: And that virtuous son of Dasaratha with a glad heart held on this way, surrounded by that vast army consisting of fourfold forces, raising a tremendous uproar.

data.v: सागरौघनिभा सेना भरतस्य महात्मनः । महीं संछादयामास प्रावृषि द्यामिवाम्बुदः ।।
data.es: The army of the magnanimous Bharata, resembling the waves of the ocean, covered the earth as the clouds cover the sky during the rainy season.
data.anv: महात्मनः of the magnanimous one, भरतस्य Bharata's, सागरौघनिभा resembling the waves of ocean, सेना the army, प्रावृषि during the rainy season, अम्बुदः cloud, द्यामिव like the sky, महीम् the earth, सञ्छादयामास covered.
data.md: And that army of the high-souled Bharata resembling the waves of the ocean, covered the earth quite, as clouds in the rainy season cover the welkin.

data.v: तुरंगौघैरवतता वारणैश्च महाजवैः । अनालक्ष्या चिरं कालं तस्मिन्काले बभूव भूः ।।
data.es: At that moment, a multiutde of swift horses and elephants spread out with great speed and the surface of the earth became invisible for a long time.
data.anv: तस्मिन्काले at that moment, महाजवैः with great speed, तुरङ्गौघैः with multitude of horses, वारणैश्च with elephants, अवतता overspread, भूः the earth, चिरकालम् for a long time, अनालक्ष्या  बभूव became invisible.
data.md: And filled with steeds and mighty elephants, the earth at that time for a long while remained invisible.

data.v: स यात्वा दूरमध्वानं सुपरिश्रान्त वाहनः । उवाच भरतः श्रीमान्वसिष्ठं मन्त्रिणां वरम् ।।
data.es: With his draught animals extremely wearied by covering a great distance, the majestic Bharata said to Vasistha, the best of counsellors:
data.anv: श्रीमान् the majestic one, सः भरतः that Bharata, दूरम् great, अध्वानम् distance, यात्वा having travelled, सुपरिश्रान्तवाहनः with draught animals extremely wearied, मन्त्रिणाम् among counsellors, वरम् the best, वसिष्ठम् addressing Vasistha, उवाच said.
data.md: And having proceeded a long way, the graceful Bharata, with his bearers extremely tired, said these words to that foremost of counsellors, Vasistha.

data.v: यादृशं लक्ष्यते रूपं यथा चैव श्रुतं मया । व्यक्तं प्राप्ताः स्म तं देशं भरद्वाजो यमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Looking at these surroundings and from what I had heard, it is clear that we have reached the region indicated by Bharadwaja.
data.anv: यादृशम् whichever, रूपम् the appearance, लक्ष्यते is being observed, मया by me, यथा as, श्रुतं चैव has been heard, यम् about which region, भरद्वाजः Bharadwaja, अब्रवीत् spoke, तं देशम् that region, प्राप्ताः स्म we have reached, व्यक्तम् this is clear.
data.md: From appearances, and from what I had heard, it is evident that we have arrived at that region which Bharadvāja had told us of.

data.v: अयं गिरिश्चित्रकूटस्तथा मन्दाकिनी नदी । एतत्प्रकाशते दूरान्नीलमेघनिभं वनम् ।।
data.es: This mountain is Chitrakuta and this river, Mandakini. The forest shines from a distance like a blue cloud.
data.anv: अयम् गिरिः this is the mountain, चित्रकूटः is Chitrakuta, इयं नदी this is the river, मन्दाकिनी Mandakini, दूरात् from a distance, एतत् this, नीलमेघनिभम् like a blue cloud, वनम् forest, प्रकाशते is shining.
data.md: This is the mountain Citrakuta and that the river Mandakinī. And from a distance this forest appears like dark clouds.

data.v: गिरेः सानूनि रम्याणि चित्रकूटस्य संप्रति । वारणैरवमृद्यन्ते मामकैः पर्वतोपमैः ।।
data.es: The enchanting ridges of mount Chitrakuta are now trampled by my mountainlike elephants.
data.anv: सम्प्रति now, मामकैः relating to me, पर्वतोपमैः resembling mountains, वारणैः with elephants, चित्रकूटस्य गिरेः Chitrkuta mountain's, रम्याणि enchanting, सानूनि ridges, अवमृद्यन्ते are being trampled.
data.md: And now our elephants resembling hills afflict the romantic sides of Citrakuta.

data.v: मुञ्चन्ति कुसुमान्येते नगाः पर्वतसानुषु । नीला इवातपापाये तोयं तोयधरा घनाः ।।
data.es: The trees on the mountain ridges are shedding flowers, like dense blue rainclouds showering water at the end of summer.
data.anv: पर्वतसानुषु on the mountain ridges, एते नगाः these trees, आतपापाये at the end of summer, नीलाः blue, घनाः dense, तोयधराः rainclouds, तोयम् इव like showers, कुसुमानि flowers, मुञ्चन्ति are shedding.
data.md: And the trees scatter blossoms over the sides of the mountain, even as after summer sable clouds pour down showers.

data.v: किन्नराचरितोद्देशं पश्य शत्रुघ्न पर्वतम् । हयैः समन्तादाकीर्णं मकरैरिव सागरम् ।।
data.es: O Satrughna, behold this mountain frequented by kinneras and abounding in animals like great crocodiles in the ocean.
data.anv: शत्रुघ्न O Satrughna, मकरैः with great crocodiles, सागरम् इव like ocean, समन्तात् everywhere, मृगैः with animals, आकीर्णम् abounding, किन्नराचरितम् frequented by kinneras, देशम् region, पर्वतम् mountain, पश्य behold.
data.md: O Śatrughna, behold the realms inhabited by Kinnaras, scattered with steeds, like the main with makaras.

data.v: एते मृगगणा भान्ति शीघ्रवेगाः प्रचोदिताः । वायुप्रविद्धाः शरदि मेघराज्य इवाम्बरे ।।
data.es: Incited by the clamour of the army, these swiftrunning herds of deer expelled from their retreats resemble mass of clouds in the autumnal sky shattered by the wind.
data.anv: प्रचोदिताः incited, शीघ्रवेगाः swiftfooted, एते these, मृगगणाः herds of deer, शरदि autumnal, अम्बरे sky, वायुप्रविद्धा expelled, मेघराजिरिव like mass of clouds, भान्ति are appearing.
data.md: And these herds of deer furnished with celerity, being urged on, roam about like masses of clouds in the sky in autumn, propelled by the winds.

data.v: कुर्वन्ति कुसुमापीडाञ्शिरःसु सुरभीनमी । मेघप्रकाशैः फलकैर्दाक्षिणात्या यथा नराः ।।
data.es: Like the people of the south, the trees on the mountain ridges with branches, brilliant like clouds, are crowned with fragrant flowers as adornments.
data.anv: अमी these mountain ridges, मेघप्रकाशैः looking brilliant like clouds, फलकैः shields, दाक्षिणात्याः belonging to southern region, नराः यथा like people, शिरस्सु on their heads, सुरभीन् fragrant, कुसुमापीडान् flower adornments, कुर्वन्ति are making.
data.md: And like the people of the south, these warriors bearing shields resembling clouds, are adorning their heads with ornaments of perfumed blossoms.

data.v: निष्कूजमिव भूत्वेदं वनं घोरप्रदर्शनम् । अयोध्येव जनाकीर्णा संप्रति प्रतिभाति मा ।।
data.es: This forest, dreadful in appearance was devoid of twittering of birds. But now it appears to me like Ayodhya thronged with people.
data.anv: घोरप्रदर्शनम् dreadful in appearance, इदं वनम् this forest, निष्कूजमिव भूत्वा devoid of any twittering of birds, सम्प्रति now, जनाकीर्णा thronged with people, अयोध्येव like Ayodhya, मा to me, प्रतिभाति it appears.
data.md: And this forest, although void of men and dreadful in appearance, at present appears to me like Ayodhyā teeming with people.

data.v: खुरैरुदीरितो रेणुर्दिवं प्रच्छाद्य तिष्ठति । तं वहत्यनिलः शीघ्रं कुर्वन्निव मम प्रियम् ।।
data.es: While the dust kicked by the hooves of the horses enveloped the forest, the wind, as if to please me, is quickly blowing them away.
data.anv: खुरैः by the hooves, उदीरितः kicked, रेणुः dust, दावम् the forest, प्रच्छाद्य having enveloped, तिष्ठति is set, अनिलः wind, मम to me, प्रियम् pleasure, कुर्वन् इव as if to give, शीघ्रम् quickly, तम् that dust, वहति transporting it.
data.md: The dust raised by the hoofs (of horses) stands covering the sky: anon the wind bearing it away, compasses my pleasure.

data.v: स्यन्दनांस्तुरगोपेतान्सूतमुख्यैरधिष्ठितान् । एतान्संपततः शीघ्रं पश्य शत्रुघ्न कानने ।।
data.es: Behold, O Satrughna, these chariots, commanded by excellent charioteers, harnessed with horses are flying through the forest.
data.anv: शत्रुघ्न O Satrughna, कानने in the forest, शीघ्रम् quickly, सम्पततः flying, सूतमुख्यैः by excellent charioteers, अधिष्ठितान् commanded by, तुरगोपेतान् drawn by horses, एतान् these, स्यन्दनान् chariots, पश्य behold.
data.md: And, O Satrughna, see how fast these cars yoked with steeds and driven by skilful charioteers, are proceeding in the forest.

data.v: एतान्वित्रासितान्पश्य बर्हिणः प्रियदर्शनान् । एतमाविशतः शैलमधिवासं पतत्रिणाम् ।।
data.es: Behold, these lovely frightened peacocks and other birds hurriedly entering their nests.
data.anv: प्रियदर्शनान् pleasant to look, वित्रासितान् frightened, एतम् अधिवासम् their nests, शीघ्रम् hurriedly, आविशतः entering, एतान् these, बर्हिणः peacocks, पतत्रिणः birds, पश्य behold.
data.md: And behold these beauteous peacocks, which, being frightened, take refuge in the mountain, the home of feathered tribes.

data.v: अतिमात्रमयं देशो मनोज्ञः प्रतिभाति मा । तापसानां निवासोऽयं व्यक्तं स्वर्गपथो यथा ।।
data.es: Being the abode of ascetics, this region looks very charming like the pathway to heaven.
data.anv: अयं देशः this region, अतिमात्रम् very, मनोज्ञः charming, मे to me, प्रतिभाति appears, स्वर्गपथो यथा like pathway to heaven, अयम् this one, व्यक्तम् clearly, तापसानाम् ascetics', निवासः abode.
data.md: This country appears to me exceedingly lovely. This abode of the ascetics is like to the way to heaven itself.

data.v: मृगा मृगीभिः सहिता बहवः पृषता वने । मनोज्ञ रूपा लक्ष्यन्ते कुसुमैरिव चित्रितः ।।
data.es: In this forest many a dappled deer with their mates looking as if painted with flowers are seen wandering about with a charming appearance.
data.anv: वने in this forest, बहवः many, पृषताः मृगाः spotted deer, कुसुमैः with flowers, चित्रिता इव as if painted, मनोज्ञरूपाः of charming appearance, मृगीभिः does, सहिताः in the company of, दृश्यन्ते are seen.
data.md: Male and female deer and Prşatas in the forest, beautiful to look at, appear as if variegated with flowers.

data.v: साधु सैन्याः प्रतिष्ठन्तां विचिन्वन्तु च काननम् । यथा तौ पुरुषव्याघ्रौ दृश्येते रामलक्ष्मणौ ।।
data.es: Let the soldiers set out and properly search the forest till such time the best of men, Rama and Lakshmana, are found.
data.anv: पुरुषव्याघ्रौ best of men, तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ those Rama and Lakshmana, यथा how, दृश्येते they could be seen, सैन्याः soldiers, साधु properly, प्रतिष्ठन्ताम् let them proceed, कानने in the forest, विचिन्वन्तु च be searched.
data.md: Now let the soldiers go advisedly and search this forest, so that they light upon those chiefs of men, Rāma and Lakşmaņa.

data.v: भरतस्य वचः श्रुत्वा पुरुषाः शस्त्रपाणयः । विविशुस्तद्वनं शूरा धूमं च ददृशुस्ततः ।।
data.es: Hearing the words of Bharata, those valiant warriors with weapons in their hands entered the forest. Therafter, they observed a spiral of smoke rising.
data.anv: भरतस्य Bharata's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा having heard, शस्त्रपाणयः with weapons in their hands, शूराः valiant, पुरुषाः men, तत् that, वनम् forest, विविशुः entered, ततः then, धूमम् smoke, ददृशुश्च observed.
data.md: Hearing Bharata's speech, persons with weapons in their hands, plunged into the forest, and those heroes presently discovered the top of a (column of) smoke.

data.v: ते समालोक्य धूमाग्रमूचुर्भरतमागताः । नामनुष्ये भवत्यग्निर्व्यक्तमत्रैव राघवौ ।।
data.es: Having seen the column of smoke, they returned and informed Bharata, saying, 'In a place bereft of men, fire cannot exist. Clearly Rama and Lakshmana must be here only.'
data.anv: ते they, धूमाग्रम् column of smoke, समालोक्य having seen, भरतम् to Bharata, आगताः returned, ऊचुः communicated, अमनुष्ये in a place bereft of men, अग्नि: fire, न भवति  cannot exist, व्यक्तम् clearly, राघवौ Rama and Lakshmana, अत्रैव are here only.
data.md: Having seen the top of the (column of) smoke, they came before Bharata and said, "Fire cannot exist where there is no man present. Therefore it is evident that even here are those descendants of Raghu.”

data.v: अथ नात्र नरव्याघ्रौ राजपुत्रौ परंतपौ । अन्ये रामोपमाः सन्ति व्यक्तमत्र तपस्विनः ।।
data.es: In case the two princes, Rama and Lakshmana, the best of men, and subduers of enemies are not residing here then evidently it must be some other ascetics like Rama.
data.anv: अथ otherwise, नरव्याघ्रौ tigers among men, परन्तपौ subduers of enemies, राजपुत्रौ princes, अत्र न if they are not here, अत्र here, रामोपमाः resembling Rama, अन्ये other, तपस्विनः सन्ति ascetics are there, व्यक्तम् evident.
data.md: But if those foremost of men, those subduers of their enemies, the princes, be not here, there are others, being ascetics, resembling Rāma.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा भरतस्तेषां वचनं साधु संमतम् । सैन्यानुवाच सर्वांस्तानमित्रबलमर्दनः ।।
data.es: Having heard these words acceptable to the pious, Bharata, the crusher of enemy forces, addressed the entire army:
data.anv: अमित्रबलमर्दनः who crushes the hostile armies, भरतः Bharata, तेषाम् their, साधुसम्मतम् acceptable to the pious, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, सर्वान् entire, तान् सैन्यान् to that entire army, उवाच said.
data.md: Hearing their words acceptable to the pious, that afflicter of hostile ranks, Bharata, said to the entire army.

data.v: यत्ता भवन्तस्तिष्ठन्तु नेतो गन्तव्यमग्रतः । अहमेव गमिष्यामि सुमन्त्रो गुरुरेव च ।।
data.es: All of you carefully watch here. Do not proceed any further. Sumantra, the preceptor and myself shall go forward.
data.anv: भवन्तः all of you, यत्ताः alertly, तिष्ठन्तु stay, इतः from here, अग्रतः forward, न गन्तव्यम् you should not proceed, अहमेव myself alone, गमिष्यामि I shall go, सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, गुरुरेव च  preceptor Vasistha also.
data.md: Do you carefully stay here: do not proceed further. I myself will go, and Sumantra and Dhrti.

data.v: एवमुक्तास्ततः सर्वे तत्र तस्थुः समन्ततः । भरतो यत्र धूमाग्रं तत्र दृष्टिं समादधत् ।।
data.es: At this command, all of them halted. Then Bharata fixed his gaze on the source of the smoke.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, एवम् thus, उक्ताः spoken, सर्वे all of them, समन्ततः everyside, तत्र there, तस्थुः  halted, भरतः Bharata, धूमाग्रम् column of smoke, यत्र where it is seen, तत्र there, दृष्टिम् gaze, समादधात् fixed.
data.md: Thus desired, the troops remained all about that place. Bharata went away, keeping his gaze fixed in the direction of the top of the column of) smoke.

data.v: व्यवस्थिता या भरतेन सा चमू;र्निरीक्षमाणापि च धूममग्रतः । बभूव हृष्टा नचिरेण जानती; प्रियस्य रामस्य समागमं तदा ।।
data.es: The army thus halted by Bharata, gazing at the space before them rejoiced at the thought that not long before they would rejoin their beloved Rama.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे त्रिनवतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the ninetythird sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: या the army, भरतेन by Bharata, व्यवस्थिता has been halted, चमूः army, अग्रतः in the forefront, भूमिम् the space, निरीक्षमाणाऽपि च even though gazing at, न चिरेण not long before, तदा then, प्रियस्य of the beloved, रामस्य Rama's, समागमम् union, जानती knowing, हृष्टा बभूव rejoiced.
data.md: Desired by Bharata to halt, that army, looking in the direction of the smoke, rejoiced soon on learning that the beloved Rāma had arrived (at that place).

data.v: दीर्घकालोषितस्तस्मिन्गिरौ गिरिवनप्रियः । विदेह्याः प्रियमाकाङ्क्षन्स्वं च चित्तं विलोभयन् ।।
data.es: Rama, resembling the gods, who had been living there for long developed a liking for the mountains and forests. With a desire to please Sita and his own mind, he showed her the wonderful Chitrakuta mountain as Indra did to his wife Sachi.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, अमरसङ्काशः one who resembles the gods, गिरिवनप्रियः one fond of mountains and forests, तस्मिन् in that, गिरौ on the mountain, दीर्घकालोषितः who had been living for a long time, दाशरथिः Rama, वैदेह्याः Sita's, प्रियम् pleasure, आकाङ्क्षन् desiring, स्वम् own, चित्तम् mind, विलोभयन् to please, चित्रम् wonderful, चित्रकूटम् Chitrakuta mountain, भार्याम् to his consort, पुरन्दरः Indra (breaker of fortresses), शचीमिव like Sachi, अदर्शयत् showed.
data.md: Having spent a long time in that mountain, that lover of hills and woods, Dasaratha's son resembling an immortal, anxious to pleasure Vaidehī as well as to please his own mind, showed the variegated Citrakuța to his wife, like Purandara to Sacī.

data.v: अथ दाशरथिश्चित्रं चित्रकूटमदर्शयत् । भार्याममरसंकाशः शचीमिव पुरंदरः ।।
data.es: Rama, resembling the gods, who had been living there for long developed a liking for the mountains and forests. With a desire to please Sita and his own mind, he showed her the wonderful Chitrakuta mountain as Indra did to his wife Sachi.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, अमरसङ्काशः one who resembles the gods, गिरिवनप्रियः one fond of mountains and forests, तस्मिन् in that, गिरौ on the mountain, दीर्घकालोषितः who had been living for a long time, दाशरथिः Rama, वैदेह्याः Sita's, प्रियम् pleasure, आकाङ्क्षन् desiring, स्वम् own, चित्तम् mind, विलोभयन् to please, चित्रम् wonderful, चित्रकूटम् Chitrakuta mountain, भार्याम् to his consort, पुरन्दरः Indra (breaker of fortresses), शचीमिव like Sachi, अदर्शयत् showed.

data.v: न राज्याद्भ्रंशनं भद्रे न सुहृद्भिर्विनाभवः । मनो मे बाधते दृष्ट्वा रमणीयमिमं गिरिम् ।।
data.es: O gentle one, when I behold this lovely mountain, neither the expulsion from the kingdom nor being away from friends pains my mind.
data.anv: हे भद्रे O gentle one, इमम् this, रमणीयम् lovely, गिरिम् mountain, दृष्ट्वा beholding, राज्यात् from the kingdom, भ्रंशनम् expulsion, मे मनः my mind, न बाधते does not pain, सुहृद्भिर्विनाभवः separation from friends, न does not pain.
data.md: O gentle one, neither deprivation of the kingdom nor separation from friends afflicts my mind on beholding this romantic mountain.

data.v: पश्येममचलं भद्रे नानाद्विजगणायुतम् । शिखरैः खमिवोद्विद्धैर्धातुमद्भिर्विभूषितम् ।।
data.es: O auspicious one, you may behold this mountin abounding in flocks of birds of every kind and its peaks adorned wtih minerals and as if piercing the sky.
data.anv: भद्रे O auspicious one, नानाद्विजगणायुतम् abounding in flocks of birds of every kind, खम् the sky, उद्विद्धैरिव as if piercing, धातुमद्भि: with minerals, शिखरैः peaks, विभूषितम् adorned, इमम् this, अचलम् mountain, पश्य you may see.
data.md: My gentle one, look but at the hill abounding with flocks of various birds, adorned with summits cleaving the welkin and teeming with mineral substances,

data.v: केचिद्रजतसंकाशाः केचित्क्षतजसंनिभाः । पीतमाञ्जिष्ठवर्णाश्च केचिन्मणिवरप्रभाः ।।
data.es: This mountain with its peaks is adorned with various minerals. Some of the regions have the radiance of silver and bronze, some look bloodred or maddercrimson, some sparkle like the rarest of gems while others shine like topaz or crystal or a flower of ketaka plant or shimmer like stars and quicksilver.
data.anv: धातुविभूषिताः adorned with minerals, अचलेन्द्रस्य of this lord of the mountains, केचित् some, देशाः regions, रजतसङ्काशाः similar to (the radiance of) silver, केचित् some regions, क्षतजसंनिभाः are having bloodred colour, पीतमाञ्जिष्टवर्णाश्च (some) colour of maddercrimson, केचित् some, मणिवरप्रभाः sparkle like the best of gems, पुष्यार्ककेतकाभाश्च shining like topaz, or crystal or a flower of ketaka plant, केचित् some, ज्योतीरसप्रभाः shimmering like stars or quicksilver, विराजन्ते shining.
data.md: And some pares of this monarch of mountains are like silver, and some are blood-red, and some yellow like the hue of Mañjiștha, and some lustrous like sapphires, and some shining like blossoms or crystal or Ketakas, and some blazing like stars or mercury, and some digit in mineral substances.

data.v: पुष्यार्ककेतुकाभाश्च केचिज्ज्योती रसप्रभाः । विराजन्तेऽचलेन्द्रस्य देशा धातुविभूषिताः ।।
data.es: This mountain with its peaks is adorned with various minerals. Some of the regions have the radiance of silver and bronze, some look bloodred or maddercrimson, some sparkle like the rarest of gems while others shine like topaz or crystal or a flower of ketaka plant or shimmer like stars and quicksilver.
data.anv: धातुविभूषिताः adorned with minerals, अचलेन्द्रस्य of this lord of the mountains, केचित् some, देशाः regions, रजतसङ्काशाः similar to (the radiance of) silver, केचित् some regions, क्षतजसंनिभाः are having bloodred colour, पीतमाञ्जिष्टवर्णाश्च (some) colour of maddercrimson, केचित् some, मणिवरप्रभाः sparkle like the best of gems, पुष्यार्ककेतकाभाश्च shining like topaz, or crystal or a flower of ketaka plant, केचित् some, ज्योतीरसप्रभाः shimmering like stars or quicksilver, विराजन्ते shining.
data.md: And some pares of this monarch of mountains are like silver, and some are blood-red, and some yellow like the hue of Mañjiștha, and some lustrous like sapphires, and some shining like blossoms or crystal or Ketakas, and some blazing like stars or mercury, and some digit in mineral substances.

data.v: नानामृगगणद्वीपितरक्ष्वृक्षगणैर्वृतः । अदुष्टैर्भात्ययं शैलो बहुपक्षिसमाकुलः ।।
data.es: This mount Chitrakuta is swarmed by flocks of birds and herds of several kinds of animals like tigers, panthers and bears of every kind giving up their cruel nature.
data.anv: अयं शैलः this mountain, अदुष्टैः without being cruel, नानामृगगणद्वीपितरर्क्ष्वृक्षगणैः with herds of several kinds of animals like tigers, panthers and bears, वृतः surrounded by, बहुपक्षिसमायुतः united with flocks of birds, भाति is shining.
data.md: And the mountain shines, being filled with divers beasts and multitudes of innocuous tigers, hyenas and bears, and thronged with innumerable birds.

data.v: आम्रजम्ब्वसनैर्लोध्रैः प्रियालैः पनसैर्धवैः । अङ्कोलैर्भव्यतिनिशैर्बिल्वतिन्दुकवेणुभिः ।।
काश्मर्यरिष्टवरणैर्मधूकैस्तिलकैस्तथा । बदर्यामलकैर्नीपैर्वेत्रधन्वनबीजकैः ।।
पुष्पवद्भिः फलोपेतैश्छायावद्भिर्मनोरमैः । एवमादिभिराकीर्णः श्रियं पुष्यत्ययं गिरिः ।।
शैलप्रस्थेषु रम्येषु पश्येमान्कामहर्षणान् । किन्नरान्द्वंद्वशो भद्रे रममाणान्मनस्विनः ।।
data.es: O auspiciouslooking one, behold these highspirited kinneras in pairs who are sporting on the picturesque hill plateaus causing thrills.
data.anv: भद्रे O auspicious one, रम्येषु in the beautiful, शैलप्रस्थेषु on the plateau, द्वन्द्वशः in pair, रममाणान् sporting, रोमहर्षणान् thrilling, मनस्विनः highspirited, इमान् these, किन्नरान् kinneras, पश्य behold.
data.md: And, you gentle one, on the picturesque plateou of the hill behold these intelligent couples of Kinnaras engaged in sport at spots yeilding every enjoyment and look at their swords hung up on the boughs. And see the gorgeous apparel of Vidyadharis, as well as the charming regions in which they sport.

data.v: शाखावसक्तान्खड्गांश्च प्रवराण्यम्बराणि च । पश्य विद्याधरस्त्रीणां क्रीडेद्देशान्मनोरमान् ।।
data.es: Behold the captivating sporting retreats of Vidyadharis, with their swords and best garments hung on the branches of the trees.
data.anv: विद्याधरस्त्रीणाम् by Vidyadhara women, शाखावसक्तान् hanging from the branches, खड्गांश्च  swords, प्रवराणि best, अम्बराणि च garments, मनोरमान् captivating, क्रीडोद्धेशान् sporting retreats, पश्य behold.
data.md: And, you gentle one, on the picturesque plateou of the hill behold these intelligent couples of Kinnaras engaged in sport at spots yeilding every enjoyment and look at their swords hung up on the boughs. And see the gorgeous apparel of Vidyadharis, as well as the charming regions in which they sport.

data.v: जलप्रपातैरुद्भेदैर्निष्यन्दैश्च क्वचित्क्वचित् । स्रवद्भिर्भात्ययं शैलः स्रवन्मद इव द्विपः ।।
data.es: Behold a waterfall here and a fountain there gushing from the earth and in other places, the mountain looks like an elephant rutting ichor.
data.anv: अयम् this, शैलः mountain, क्वचित् क्वचित् here and there, स्रवद्भिः by the flowing, जलप्रपातैः  waterfalls, उद्भेदैः sprouting from the earth, निष्यन्दैश्च fountains, स्रवन्मदः emitting the ichor, द्विपः इव like the elephant, भाति shining.
data.md: And like an elephant dropping the temporal juice, this hill appears beautiful with cascades, fountains and riles, flowing here and there.

data.v: गुहासमीरणो गन्धान्नानापुष्पभवान्वहन् । घ्राणतर्पणमभ्येत्य कं नरं न प्रहर्षयेत् ।।
data.es: The breeze from the caves carrying the fragrance of many flowers is satisfying the sense of smell. Who will not find it delightful?
data.anv: नानापुष्पभवान् produced from many flowers, गन्धान् fragrance, वहन् carrying, गुहासमीरणः breeze from the caves, घ्राणतर्पणम् satisfying the sense of smell, अभ्येत्य going towards, कं नरम् which man, न प्रहर्षयेत् would not delight?
data.md: Whom does not the breeze laden with the perfumes of many a flower, soothing the sense of smell, fill with delight?

data.v: यदीह शरदोऽनेकास्त्वया सार्धमनिन्दिते । लक्ष्मणेन च वत्स्यामि न मां शोकः प्रधक्ष्यति ।।
data.es: O flawless one, if I am to live here for many years to come with you and Lakshmana, no grief will consume me.
data.anv: अनिन्दिते O flawless one, त्वया with you, लक्ष्मणेन च सार्धम् and in the company Lakshmana, इह here, अनेकाः many, शरदः autumns, वत्स्यामि यदि if I am to live, माम् me, शोकः grief, न प्रधक्ष्यति will not consume.
data.md: If, O blameless one, I dwell (here) for many years with you as well as Lakşmaņa, grief cannot overcome me.

data.v: बहुपुष्पफले रम्ये नानाद्विजगणायुते । विचित्रशिखरे ह्यस्मिन्रतवानस्मि भामिनि ।।
data.es: O lovely Sita, I am enamoured of this delightful mountain with its enchanting peaks laden with abundance of flowers and fruits and flocked by different kinds of birds.
data.anv: भामिनि O lovely Sita, बहुपुष्पफले laden with abundance of flowers and fruits, नानाद्विजगणायुते flocked by different kinds of birds, विचित्रशिखरे on enchanting mountain peaks, रम्ये delightful, अस्मिन् on this mountain, रतवान् अस्मि हि I am fond of.
data.md: O damsel, I take delight in this picturesque peak abounding in flowers and fruits, and frequented by various birds.

data.v: अनेन वनवासेन मया प्राप्तं फलद्वयम् । पितुश्चानृणता धर्मे भरतस्य प्रियं तथा ।।
data.es: By living in the forest I have achieved a twofold benefitdischarge of debt of my father with regard to righteousness and causing happiness to Bharata.
data.anv: अनेन by this, वनवासेन staying in the forest, धर्मे with regard to righteousness, पितुः to father, अनृणता discharge of debt, तथा also, भरतस्य Bharata's, प्रियम् pleasure, फलद्वयम् twofold benefit, मया by me, प्राप्तम् have been obtained.
data.md: By this banishment of mine, I have gained two things, my father has maintained his truth in religion, and Bharata has obtained his dear interest.

data.v: वैदेहि रमसे कच्चिच्चित्रकूटे मया सह । पश्यन्ती विविधान्भावान्मनोवाक्कायसंयतान् ।।
data.es: O Sita, are you enjoying by being with me here on this Chitrakuta and observing various objects gratifying to the body, mind and speech?
data.anv: हे वैदेहि O Sita, मनोवाक्कायसम्मतान् gratifying to body, speech and mind, विविधान् various, भावान् objects, पश्यन्ती observing, चित्रकूटे on Chitrakuta, मया सह along with me, रमसे कच्चित् are you enjoying?
data.md: O daughter of Videha, are you being pleased on viewing along with me on Citrakuța, various objects grateful to mind, speech and body?

data.v: इदमेवामृतं प्राहू राज्ञां राजर्षयः परे । वनवासं भवार्थाय प्रेत्य मे प्रपितामहाः ।।
data.es: My greatgrandfathers and ancient royal sages used to say that living in the forest is like enjoying nectar for a king for the best existence after death.
data.anv: मे my, प्रपितामहाः greatgrandfathers, परे ancestors, राजर्षयः royal sages, प्रेत्य after death, भवार्थाय for best existence, इदम् this, वनवासमेव living in the forest, राज्ञि for the king, अमृतम्  like nectar, प्राहुः said.
data.md: O queen, this abode in the forest like to ambrosia has been declared by those royal saints, my ancestors, as working out one's emancipation after death.

data.v: शिलाः शैलस्य शोभन्ते विशालाः शतशोऽभितः । बहुला बहुलैर्वर्णैर्नीलपीतसितारुणैः ।।
data.es: Several hundreds of massive rocks of the mountain look splendid all around, in blueblack, yellow, white and red colours.
data.anv: बहुलैः several, नीलपीतसितारुणैः blueblack, yellow, white and red, वर्णैः colours, बहुलाः many, विशालाः massive, शैलस्य mountain's, शिलाः rocks, शतशः in hundreds, अभितः on all sides, शोभन्ते are looking splendid.
data.md: The giant crags of the mountain grace the place all round by hundreds; many and varioushued, blue and yellow and pale and red.

data.v: निशि भान्त्यचलेन्द्रस्य हुताशनशिखा इव । ओषध्यः स्वप्रभा लक्ष्म्या भ्राजमानाः सहस्रशः ।।
data.es: Herbs in thousands on this king of the hills shine in the night with the splendour of their own lustre, like flames of fire.
data.anv: स्वप्रभालक्ष्म्या with the splendour of their own lustre, भ्राजमानाः illuminating, सहस्रशः in thousands, अचलेन्द्रस्य of this lord of the hills (Chitrakuta's), ओषध्यः herbs, निशि in the night, हुताशनशिखा इव like flames of fire, भान्ति shine.
data.md: In the night, the annual herbs by thousands growing on this foremost of hills, shine and become visible by their own lustre, like flames of fire.

data.v: केचित्क्षयनिभा देशाः केचिदुद्यानसंनिभाः । केचिदेकशिला भान्ति पर्वतस्यास्य भामिनि ।।
data.es: O lovely Sita Some regions of the mountain look like dwellingplaces, some others are like flowergardens and some are shining like a single rock.
data.anv: भामिनि O lovely Sita, अस्य this, पर्वतस्य mountain's, केचित् some, देशाः regions, क्षयनिभाः like dwellings, केचित् some, उद्यानसन्निभाः like flower gardens, केचित् some, एकशिलाः in the  form of a single rock, भान्ति are shining.
data.md: And, O lady, some parts of the mountain appear like dwellings, and some like gardens, and some, again, consist of single rocks (capable of accommodating numbers of men).

data.v: भित्त्वेव वसुधां भाति चित्रकूटः समुत्थितः । चित्रकूटस्य कूटोऽसौ दृश्यते सर्वतः शिवः ।।
data.es: This Chitrakuta mountain stands erect as if it has arisen by splitting open the earth and its peak looks graceful from every side.
data.anv: चित्रकूटः Chitrakuta mountain, वसुधाम् this earth, भित्त्वा splitting open, समुत्थितः इव as if rising from, भाति shining, चित्रकूटस्य Chitrakuta's, असौ this, कूटः peak, सर्वतः on every side, शुभः gracious, दृश्यते is seen.
data.md: And Citrakuța looks as if it had arisen, riving the earth; and the fair front of Citrakuța can be perceived from every point.

data.v: कुष्ठपुंनागतगरभूर्जपत्रोत्तरच्छदान् । कामिनां स्वास्तरान्पश्य कुशेशयदलायुतान् ।।
data.es: Behold those excellent couches of lovers spread with leaves of kustha, sthagara, punnaga and bhurja and covered with lotus petals.
data.anv: कुष्ठस्थगरपुन्नाग भूर्जपत्रोत्तरच्छदान् covered with leaves of kustha, sthagara, punnaga and bhurja, कुशेशयदलायुतान् covered with lotus petals, कामिनाम् lovers, स्वास्तरान् excellent couches, पश्य behold.
data.md: behold the beds of pleasure-seekers, consisting of the petals of lotuses, with Sthagaras, Punāgas and Bhūrjapatras for their coverlets.

data.v: मृदिताश्चापविद्धाश्च दृश्यन्ते कमलस्रजः । कामिभिर्वनिते पश्य फलानि विविधानि च ।।
data.es: O Lady, behold those lotus garlands crushed and cast aside by lovers and also many fruits (tasted by them and) lying there.
data.anv: वनिते O lady, कामिभिः by lovers, मृदिताश्च crushed, अपविद्धाश्च cast aside, कमलस्रजः lotus garlands, विविधानि many, फलानि च fruits, दृश्यन्ते can be seen, पश्य behold.
data.md: And, my wife, behold these lotus-garlands have been crushed and scattered; and the various fruits have been partaken of.

data.v: वस्वौकसारां नलिनीमत्येतीवोत्तरान्कुरून् । पर्वतश्चित्रकूटोऽसौ बहुमूलफलोदकः ।।
data.es: This Chitrakuta mountain, with abundance of roots, fruits and water surpasses in beauty Vasvaukasara, the capital city of Kubera or Nalini, his celestial garden or the land of Uttarakuru.
data.anv: बहुमूलफलोदकः with abundance of roots, fruits and water, असौ this, चित्रकूट: पर्वत: Chitrakuta mountain, वस्वौकसाराम् Vasvaukasara, the capital city of Kubera, नलिनीम्  Nalini, the celestial lake of Kubera, उत्तरान् कुरून् the land of Uttarakuru, अत्येतीव surpasses.
data.md: The mountain Citrakuța abounding in fruits and roots and waters, surpasses Kuvera's capital Śakra's city or the north Kurus.

data.v: इमं तु कालं वनिते विजह्रिवां;स्त्वया च सीते सह लक्ष्मणेन च । रतिं प्रपत्स्ये कुलधर्मवर्धिनीं; सतां पथि स्वैर्नियमैः परैः स्थितः ।।
data.es: O my beloved Sita, by spending time with you and Lakshmana following the path of the virtuous with utmost restraint and by enhancing the righteousness of my race, I shall obtain great felicity.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे चतुर्नवतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the ninetyfourth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: वनिते सीते O my beloved Sita, इमं कालम् this time, त्वया च with you, लक्ष्मणेन सह and also with Lakshmana, विजह्रिवान् wandering about, स्वैः by my own, परैः utmost, नियमैः  restraint, सताम् virtuous men's, पथि path, स्थितः following, कुलधर्मवर्धनीम् as enhancing the righteousness of my race, रतिम् felicity, प्रपत्स्ये I shall obtain.
data.md: My wife, O Sītā, if in consonance with my own excellent rules, I can, remaining in the path of the pious, pleasantly pass this time along with yourself and Lakşmaņa, then I shall attain the happiness resulting from observing the duties of one's race. or

data.v: अथ शैलाद्विनिष्क्रम्य मैथिलीं कोसलेश्वरः । अदर्शयच्छुभजलां रम्यां मन्दाकिनीं नदीम् ।।
data.es: Then Rama, the lord of Kosala, descended from the mountain and showed Sita the charming river Mandakini of sacred waters.
data.anv: अथ then, कोसलेश्वरः lord of Kosala (Rama), शैलात् from the mountain, विनिष्क्रम्य having descended, शुभजलाम् of sacred water, रम्याम् charming, मन्दाकिनीं नदीम् river Mandakini, मैथिलीम् to Sita, अदर्शयत् showed.
data.md: Then going out of the mountain, the Lord of Kosala showed to Mithila's daughter the charming stream Mandākini of excellent waters.

data.v: अब्रवीच्च वरारोहां चारुचन्द्रनिभाननाम् । विदेहराजस्य सुतां रामो राजीवलोचनः ।।
data.es: Lotuseyed Rama said to the heavyhipped daughter of the king of Videha, whose face resembled the beauitiful Moon.
data.anv: राजीवलोचनः lotus-eyed, रामः Rama, वरारोहाम् to the heavy-hipped, चारुचन्द्रनिभाननाम् to her whose face resembled the beautiful Moon, विदेहराजस्य of the king of Videha, सुताम् daughter, अब्रवीच्च said.
data.md: And Rāma, furnished with eyes resembling lotuses, addressed the daughter of king Videha, transcendentally beautiful, with a countenance like the fair moon, saying.

data.v: विचित्रपुलिनां रम्यां हंससारससेविताम् । कुसुमैरुपसंपन्नां पश्य मन्दाकिनीं नदीम् ।।
data.es: Look at this enchanting river Mandakini with its variegated sandbanks frequented by geese and swans and adorned with lotuses.
data.anv: विचित्रपुलिनाम् of variagated sandbanks, रम्याम् enchanting, हंससारससेविताम् frequented by geese and swans, कमलैः with lotus, उपसम्पन्नाम् adorned with, मन्दाकिनीं नदीम् river Mandakini, पश्य look.
data.md: Behold the river Mandākini, having variegated islets; beautiful; frequented by ducks and cranes; and filled with flowers; covered with diverse trees bearing fruits and flowers; and looking graceful all round like Saughandhikā herself of Kuvera.

data.v: नानाविधैस्तीररुहैर्वृतां पुष्पफलद्रुमैः । राजन्तीं राजराजस्य नलिनीमिव सर्वतः ।।
data.es: See this river sparkling with trees of every kind laden with fruits and flowers growing on its banks. Everywhere it resembles the lake Nalini of Kubera.
data.anv: सर्वतः everywhere, नानाविधैः of various kinds, तीररुहैः growing on its banks, पुष्पफलद्रुमैः  trees, laden with fruits and flowers, वृताम् surrounded by, राजराजस्य Kubera's, नलिनीम् इव like fragrant lake Nalini, राजन्तीम् sparkling.
data.md: Behold the river Mandākini, having variegated islets; beautiful; frequented by ducks and cranes; and filled with flowers; covered with diverse trees bearing fruits and flowers; and looking graceful all round like Saughandhikā herself of Kuvera.

data.v: मृगयूथनिपीतानि कलुषाम्भांसि साम्प्रतम् । तीर्थानि रमणीयानि रतिं संजनयन्ति मे ।।
data.es: The herds of deer have just drunk water by descending down the landing places and the waters are still turbid. This sight produces great pleasure in me.
data.anv: साम्प्रतम् just now, मृगयूथनिपीतानि drunk by herds of deer, कलुषाम्भांसि of turbid waters, रमणीयानि lovely, तीर्थानि landing places, मे to me, रतिम् pleasure, सञ्जनयन्ति is producing.
data.md: And the waters rendered muddy in consequence of herds of deer drinking of them, as well as the graceful descents to the river, fill me with pleasure.

data.v: जटाजिनधराः काले वल्कलोत्तरवाससः । ऋषयस्त्ववगाहन्ते नदीं मन्दाकिनीं प्रिये ।।
data.es: O my beloved rishis with matted locks and wearing deer skins and bark of trees as upper cloth bathe in the river Mandakini for performing morning ablutions in time.
data.anv: प्रिये O my beloved, जटाजिनधराः with matted locks and wearing deer skins, वल्कलोत्तरवाससः bark as upper cloth, ऋषयः rishis, काले at the appointed hour, मन्दाकिनीं नदीम् the river Mandakini, अवगाहन्ते are immersing.
data.md: And, my beloved sages wearing matted locks and deer-skins, with barks for their sheets, are in season performing their ablutions in the river Mandakini.

data.v: आदित्यमुपतिष्ठन्ते नियमादूर्ध्वबाहवः । एतेऽपरे विशालाक्षि मुनयः संशितव्रताः ।।
data.es: O largeeyed Sita, some other ascetics of rigid austerities worship the sungod according to tradition, lifting up their arms and invoking the Sun.
data.anv: विशालाक्षि O largeeyed Sita, संशितव्रताः of rigid austerities, एते परे some other, मुनयः ascetics, नियमात् according to tradition, ऊर्ध्वबाहवः lifting up their arms, आदित्यम्  Sungod, उपतिष्ठन्ते are worhipping.
data.md: And observing rules, persons raising up their arms, are worshipping the sun, and, O you of expansive eyes, after these appear ascetics following vows, (engaged if Tapa)

data.v: मारुतोद्धूत शिखरैः प्रनृत्त इव पर्वतः । पादपैः पत्रपुष्पाणि सृजद्भिरभितो नदीम् ।।
data.es: With the trees whose tops are swayed by the wind, the mountain was as if dancing, shedding leaves and flowers all around the river.
data.anv: मारुतोद्धूतशिखरैः tree tops swayed by the wind, नदीमभितः around the river, पत्रपुष्पाणि leaves and flowers, सृजद्भिः shedding, पादपैः with trees, पर्वतः mountain, प्रनृत्त इव seems dancing.
data.md: And the hill seems to dance on the wind swaying the tops of tree; and on both sides of the river, the trees are crowned with flowers and leaves.

data.v: कच्चिन्मणिनिकाशोदां कच्चित्पुलिनशालिनीम् । कच्चित्सिद्धजनाकीर्णां पश्य मन्दाकिनीं नदीम् ।।
data.es: Behold this river Mandakini whose waters here are transparent like crystals, there sparkling with sand dunes and elsewhere crowded with siddhas.
data.anv: क्वचित् at some places, मणिनिकाशोदाम् with water transparent as crystals, क्वचित् at some other places, पुलिनशालिनीम् sparkling with sand dunes, क्वचित् at some places, सिद्धजनाकीर्णाम् filled with siddhas (those acomplished in spiritual pursuits), मन्दाकिनीं नदीम् river Mandakini, पश्य see.
data.md: And behold the river Mandakini, somewhere with its waters resembling pearls, and somewhere with islets, and somewhere filled with persons who have attained emancipation.

data.v: निर्धूतान्वायुना पश्य विततान्पुष्पसंचयान् । पोप्लूयमानानपरान्पश्य त्वं जलमध्यगान् ।।
data.es: Look at the scattered heaps of flowers shaken off by the wind and large quantities of flowers floating on the waters.
data.anv: वायुना by the wind, निर्धूतान् shaken off, विततान् scattered, पुष्पसञ्चयान् heaps of flowers, पश्य see, जलमध्यगान् in the midst of waters, पोप्लूयमानान् floating, अपरान् other masses of flowers, त्वम् you, पश्य see.
data.md: O you of slender waist, behold these hosts of flowers spreading along, and others dipping themselves (in the stream).

data.v: तांश्चातिवल्गु वचसो रथाङ्गाह्वयना द्विजाः । अधिरोहन्ति कल्याणि निष्कूजन्तः शुभा गिरः ।।
data.es: O my auspicious Sita, sweetvoiced Chakravaka birds singing in most pleasant tones are alighting on those heaps of flowers.
data.anv: कल्याणि O my auspicious Sita, वल्गुवचसः of sweetvoiced, रथाङ्गाह्वयनाः birds named Chakravaka, द्विजाः birds, शुभाः most pleasant, गिरः tones, निष्कूजन्तः uttering, तान् on those (heaps of flowers), अधिरोहन्ति alighting.
data.md: And, O auspicious one, behold these sweetthroated birds, the Chakravākas, getting upon the islets, uttering pleasant notes.

data.v: दर्शनं चित्रकूटस्य मन्दाकिन्याश्च शोभने । अधिकं पुरवासाच्च मन्ये च तव दर्शनात् ।।
data.es: My lovely Sita, I consider watching this mount Chitrakuta and river Mandakini in your presence more delightful than living in Ayodhya.
data.anv: शोभने my lovely Sita, तव your, दर्शनात् in presence, चित्रकूटस्य Chitrakuta's, मन्दाकिन्याश्च  Mandakini's, दर्शनम् viewing, पुरवासाच्छ compared to living in Ayodhya, अधिकम् is  greater, मन्ये I consider.
data.md: Methinks, O beauteous one, the sight of Citrakuta and of Mandakini is even more delightful than life in the metropolis, or the sight of your own self.

data.v: विधूतकलुषैः सिद्धैस्तपोदमशमान्वितैः । नित्यविक्षोभित जलां विहाहस्व मया सह ।।
data.es: The waters of river Mandakini is perpetually agitated by siddhas who are endowed with asceticism, selfrestraint and tranquillity and who are cleansed of sins by taking bath in the river. Plunge with me into this river.
