data.anv: विधूतकलुषैः cleansed of sins, तपोदमशमान्वितैः endowed with asceticism, selfrestraint and  tranquillity, सिद्धैः with siddhas, नित्यविक्षोभितजलाम् with perpetually agitated waters, मया सह with me, विगाहस्व enter.
data.md: Do you like to her companion perform your bath with me in this stream, whose waters are perpetually stirred by emancipated ones, furnished with asceticism, self-restraint, and control over the senses, who have had their sins removed.

data.v: सखीवच्च विगाहस्व सीते मन्दकिनीमिमाम् । कमलान्यवमज्जन्ती पुष्कराणि च भामिनि ।।
data.es: O lovely Sita, like a companion plunge into this river Mandakini, submerging the red and white lotuses, and enjoy sporting.
data.anv: भामिनि O lovely, सीते Sita, कमलानि red lotuses, पुष्कराणि च white lotuses, अवमज्जन्ती  submerging, सखीवत् like a friend, मन्दाकिनीं नदीम् Mandakini river, विगाहस्व you may enter.
data.md: Do you, O Sītā, perform your ablutions in the Mandākinī, scattering at the sometime, O girl, red and white lotuses.

data.v: त्वं पौरजनवद्व्यालानयोध्यामिव पर्वतम् । मन्यस्व वनिते नित्यं सरयूवदिमां नदीम् ।।
data.es: O my lovely lady Always think this river Mandakini as Sarayu and this mount Chitrakuta as Ayodhya and these wild animals as its inhabitants.
data.anv: वनिते O my lovely lady, त्वम् you, व्यालान् wild animals, पौरजनवत् as inhabitants of Ayodhya, पर्वतम् mountain, अयोध्यामिव as Ayodhya, इमाम् this, नदीम् river, सरयूवत् as Sarayu, नित्यम् always, मन्यस्व think of.
data.md: Do you, my wife, always consider the wild animals as citizens, the mountain as Ayodhyā, and this stream as the Sarayū.

data.v: लक्ष्मणश्चैव धर्मात्मा मन्निदेशे व्यवस्थितः । त्वं चानुकूला वैदेहि प्रीतिं जनयथो मम ।।
data.es: With righteous Lakshmana obedient and you, O Sita, agreeable to me, you both bring me great pleasure.
data.anv: वैदेहि O Sita, धर्मात्मा righteous, लक्ष्मणश्चापि Lakshmana also, मन्निदेशे at my command, व्यवस्थितः obedient, त्वं च you also, अनुकूला agreeable, मम to me, प्रीतिम् pleasure, जनयथः are causing.
data.md: The virtuous Lakşmaņa is ever obedient to my commands; and, O Videha's daughter, you also are favourable to me.

data.v: उपस्पृशंस्त्रिषवणं मधुमूलफलाशनः । नायोध्यायै न राज्याय स्पृहयेऽद्य त्वया सह ।।
data.es: Bathing thrice in your company at the time of prayers and partaking honey, roots and fruits, I do not yearn either for Ayodhya or for the kingdom.
data.anv: त्रिषवणम् thrice at the time of prayers, उपस्पृशन् bathing, मधुमूलफलाशनः honey, roots and fruits, त्वया सह in your company, अद्य now, अयोध्यायै for Ayodhya, न स्पृहये I do not yearn for, राज्याय न nor even the kingdom.
data.md: This causes delight in my heart. Bathing thrice (in this river), and living on tasteful fruits and roots, I in your company do not today wish either for Ayodhyā or royalty.

data.v: इमां हि रम्यां गजयूथलोलितां; निपीततोयां गजसिंहवानरैः । सुपुष्पितैः पुष्पधरैरलंकृतां; न सोऽस्ति यः स्यान्न गतक्रमः सुखी ।।
data.es: With this enchanting Mandakini teeming with herds of deer, whose waters are drunk by elephants, lions and monkeys, decorated with heaps of flowers fallen from the trees in full bloom, who will not feel happy and free from fatigue.
data.anv: रम्याम् enchanting, मृगयूथशालिनीम् teeming with herds of deer, गजसिंहवानरैः with elephants, lions and monkeys, निपीततोयाम् its waters being drunk by, सुपुष्पिताम् in full  bloom, पुष्पभरैः with multitude of flowers, अलङ्कृताम् decorated, इमाम् this (river Mandakini), यः who, गतक्लमः with fatigue gone, सुखी happy, न स्यात् will not find himself, सः that one, नास्ति does not exist.
data.md: Bathing in this beauteous stream agitated by herds of elephants, whose waters are drunk by elephants, lions and monkeys, which is graced with flowers, and which is decked with multitudes of blossoms, there is not one who has not his fatigue removed, and who does not feel exhilarated.

data.v: इतीव रामो बहुसंगतं वचः; प्रिया सहायः सरितं प्रति ब्रुवन् । चचार रम्यं नयनाञ्जनप्रभं; स चित्रकूटं रघुवंशवर्धनः ।।
data.es: Rama, the perpetuator of the Raghu dynasty, describing the river Mandakini at length appropriately in this manner, wandered in the company of his beloved consort on mount Chitrakuta looking black like collyrium.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे पञ्चनवतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the ninetyfifth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: रघुवंशवर्धनः perpetuator of Raghu dynasty, सः रामः that Rama, इतीव in this manner, सरितं प्रति about Mandakini river, बहु at length, सङ्गतम् appropriate, वचः words, ब्रुवन् speaking,  प्रियासहायः in the company of his beloved, नयनाञ्जनप्रभम् resembling collyrium in hue, रम्यम् delightful, चित्रकूटम् Chitrakuta, चचार wandered about.
data.md: Having thus along with his beloved one, spoken variously regarding the stream, that perpetuator of the Raghu race, began to range the charming Citrakuța, resembling the collyrium in hue.

data.v: तथा तत्रासतस्तस्य भरतस्योपयायिनः । सैन्य रेणुश्च शब्दश्च प्रादुरास्तां नभः स्पृशौ ।।
data.es: Now as Rama was sitting there, the tumult and the dust raised by the approaching army of Bharata reached the sky.
data.anv: तथा thus, तस्य that Rama, तत्र there, आसतः while sitting, उपयायिनः approaching, भरतस्य Bharata's, सैन्यरेणुश्च dust raised by the army, शब्दश्च and tumult, नभस्पृशौ both reaching   the sky, प्रादुरास्ताम् was generated.
data.md: This clean meat tastes sweet, having been roasted in fire. The righteous Rāghava was thus seated in company with Sītā, when Bharata's followers came there. And filling the heavens, there arose clouds of dust raised by the army as well as an uproar.

data.v: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे त्रस्ताः शब्देन महता ततः । अर्दिता यूथपा मत्ताः सयूथा दुद्रुवुर्दिशः ।।
data.es: On seeing the great army marching, the exited leaders of herds of elephants inhabiting the forest were frightened and ran off with their herds.
data.anv: एकस्मिन् अन्तरे meanwhile, मत्ताः mighty, यूथपाः leaders of elephantherds, महता with a loud, शब्देन noise, त्रस्ताः were frightened, अर्दिताः agitated सयूथाः with herds, ततः from there, दिशः in different directions, दुद्रुवुः fled away.
data.md: And at this time mad leaders of elephant-herds accompanied by the latter, scared by the terrible tumult, scudded on all sides.

data.v: स तं सैन्यसमुद्भूतं शब्दं शुश्रव राघवः । तांश्च विप्रद्रुतान्सर्वान्यूथपानन्ववैक्षत ।।
data.es: Rama heard the sound generated by the army and saw those leaders of herds fleeing away.
data.anv: सः राघवः that Rama, सैन्यसमुद्बूतम् generated by the army, तं शब्दम् that sound, शुश्राव heard, विप्रद्रुतान् fleeing, तान् those, सर्वान् all, यूथपान् च leaders of herds, अन्ववैक्षत saw.
data.md: And Rāghava heard the noise raised by the army; and also saw all those leaders of elephantherds scampering away.

data.v: तांश्च विद्रवतो दृष्ट्वा तं च श्रुत्वा स निःस्वनम् । उवाच रामः सौमित्रिं लक्ष्मणं दीप्ततेजसम् ।।
data.es: Seeing those animals fleeing and hearing the clamour, Rama addressed Lakshmana, son of Sumitra, who was blazing with energy.
data.anv: रामः Rama, विद्रुवतः running, तान् them, दृष्ट्वा having seen, तम् them, निस्वनं also sound, श्रुत्वा having heard, दीप्ततेजसम् blazing with energy, सौमित्रिम् son of Sumitra, लक्ष्मणम् addressing Lakshmana, उवाच said.
data.md: And having seen them running away and heard that hubbub, Rāma spoke to Sumitrā's son, Lakşmaņa of flaming energy.

data.v: हन्त लक्ष्मण पश्येह सुमित्रा सुप्रजास्त्वया । भीमस्तनितगम्भीरस्तुमुलः श्रूयते स्वनः ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana, the worthy son of Sumitra, fearful and tumultuous clamour like rumbling sound of clouds is heard. What a wonder Go and see.
data.anv: हन्त Oh what a wonder, लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, सुमित्रा Sumitra, त्वया by you, सुप्रजाः has a worthy son, इह here, भीमस्तनितगम्भीरः fearful rumbling of clouds, तुमुलः tumultous, स्वनः sound, इह here, श्रूयते is being heard, पश्य see.

data.v: राजा वा राजमात्रो वा मृगयामटते वने । अन्यद्वा श्वापदं किंचित्सौमित्रे ज्ञातुमर्हसि । सर्वमेतद्यथातत्त्वमचिराज्ज्ञातुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana, do ascertain if any king or prince has come for hunting or whether any ferocious animal has entered this forest, shouldn't you?
data.anv: सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, राजा वा king or, राजपुत्रो वा or prince, वने in the forest, मृगयाम् अटते  is hunting, वा or, किञ्चित् any, अन्यत् other, श्वापदम् ferocious animal, ज्ञातुम् to know, अर्हसि ought to

data.v: स लक्ष्मणः संत्वरितः सालमारुह्य पुष्पितम् । प्रेक्षमाणो दिशः सर्वाः पूर्वां दिशमवैक्षत ।।
data.es: Lakshmana hurriedly climbed a flowering sala tree, surveyed in all directions and fixed his gaze on the east.
data.anv: सः लक्ष्मणः that Lakshmana, सन्त्वरितः hurriedly, पुष्पितम् flowering, सालम् Sala tree, आरुह्य  climbing, सर्वाः all, दिशः directions, प्रेक्षमाणः seeing, पूर्वं दिशम् the eastern direction, उदैक्षत looked.
data.md: Thereat, hurriedly ascending a flowering Säla tree, Laksmana surveying all sides, fixed his gaze on the east. to

data.v: उदङ्मुखः प्रेक्षमाणो ददर्श महतीं चमूम् । रथाश्वगजसंबाधां यत्तैर्युक्तां पदातिभिः ।।
data.es: Turning his face to the north, he beheld a vast army consisting of chariots, elephants and horses and a wellequipped infantry.
data.anv: उदङ्मुखः facing the north, प्रेक्षमाणः seeing, रथाश्वगजसम्बाधाम् with chariots, elephants and horses, यत्तै: wellequipped, पदातिभिः with infantry, युक्ताम् consisting of, महतीम् vast, चमूम् army, ददर्श beheld.
data.md: And viewing the east, he discovered a mighty army, abounding with elephants, horses and cars, and consisting of equipped infantry.

data.v: तामश्वगजसंपूर्णां रथध्वजविभूषिताम् । शशंस सेनां रामाय वचनं चेदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: He (Lakshmana) informed Rama about the army full of horses and elephants and decorated with chariotbanners and said these words:
data.anv: अश्वगजसम्पूर्णाम् full of horses and elephants, रथध्वजविभूषिताम् decorated with chariotbannars, तां सेनाम् of the army, रामाय to Rama, शशंस informed, इदम् these, वचनं च words also, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Thereupon, Lakşmaņa communicated Rāma tidings concerning that army filled with elephants and steeds, and decked with cars and streamers; and spoke to Rāma, saying.

data.v: अग्निं संशमयत्वार्यः सीता च भजतां गुहाम् । सज्यं कुरुष्व चापं च शरांश्च कवचं तथा ।।
data.es: O noble one, put out the sacred fire (Agnihotra) and let Sita take refuge in the cave. String your bow and keep the arrows ready. Put on your armour.
data.anv: आर्यः O noble one, अग्निम् sacredfires (Agnihotra), संशमयतु put off, सीता च Sita also, गुहाम् cave, भजताम् let take refuge, चापम् bow, सज्यम् with string, कुरुष्व make ready, तथा so also, शरांश्च arrows also, कवचम् armour (put on).
data.md: O noble one, do you put out the fire; and let Sītā go into the cave. And do you string your bow and make ready the arrows and don on your mail.

data.v: तं रामः पुरुषव्याघ्रो लक्ष्मणं प्रत्युवाच ह । अङ्गावेक्षस्व सौमित्रे कस्यैतां मन्यसे चमूम् ।।
data.es: Rama the best among men replied to Lakshamana, Oh, Lakshmana, look properly and tell me to whom do you think this army might belong
data.anv: पुरुषव्याघ्रः best among men, रामः Rama, तं लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, प्रत्युवाच ह replied so, अङ्ग Oh, सौमित्रे Lakshmana, अवेक्षस्व look, इमाम् this, चमूम् army, कस्य of whom, मन्यसे do you think.
data.md: Thereat, Rāma-chief of men, answered Lakş mana, saying O son of Sumitra, do you (first) ascertain whom this host belongs to.

data.v: एवमुक्क्तस्तु रामेण लक्ष्माणो वाक्यमब्रवीत् । दिधक्षन्निव तां सेनां रुषितः पावको यथा ।।
data.es: Hearing the words of Rama, enraged Lakshmana, like a flaming fire as if he would reduce the army to ashes, replied:
data.anv: रामेण by Rama, एवं in that manner, उक्तः having been said, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, पावको यथा like a fire, रुषितः was wrathful, तां सेनाम् that army, दिधक्षन्निव as if he wanted to burn down, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Thus accosted by Rama, Laksmana, as if consuming that army by his wrath resembling fire, said.

data.v: संपन्नं राज्यमिच्छंस्तु व्यक्तं प्राप्याभिषेचनम् । आवां हन्तुं समभ्येति कैकेय्या भरतः सुतः ।।
data.es: It is evident that Kaikeyi's son Bharata, who has been consecrated, is coming to slay both of us desiring the prosperous kingdom (to be without obstacles).
data.anv: कैकेय्याः Kaikeyi's, सुतः son, भरतः Bharata, अभिषेचनम् प्राप्य having been consecrated, राज्यम् kingdom, सम्पन्नम् endowed with prosperity (without obstacles), इच्छन् desiring, आवाम् both of us, हन्तुम् to slay, समभ्येति is coming, व्यक्तम् this is evident.
data.md: Having got himself installed, Kaikeyi's son, Bharata, anxious to render his royalty perfectly safe, is coming hither for the purpose of slaying us both.

data.v: एष वै सुमहाञ्श्रीमान्विटपी संप्रकाशते । विराजत्युद्गतस्कन्धः कोविदार ध्वजो रथे ।।
data.es: There on that chariot, is a banner shining brilliantly with the emblem of a lofty majestic Kovidara tree with a large trunk.
data.anv: एषः this, सुमहान् lofty, श्रीमान् majestic, उद्गतस्कन्धः atop with large trunk, विटपी tree, सम्प्रकाशते रथे on chariot, कोविदारध्वजः with his standard bearing the emblem of Kovidara tree, विराजति shining brilliantly.
data.md: Yonder is seen the graceful tree. By the same apr-ars on the car the Kovidāra standard, having a shining top.

data.v: भजन्त्येते यथाकाममश्वानारुह्य शीघ्रगान् । एते भ्राजन्ति संहृष्टा गजानारुह्य सादिनः ।।
data.es: These men mounted on swiftlymoving horses are following the post. The riders of elephants mounted on the elephants look cheerful.
data.anv: एते these, यथाकामम् at their will, शीघ्रगान् swiftlymoving, अश्वान् horses, आरुह्य having mounted, भजन्ति are following, एते these, सादिनः riders of elephants, गजान् elephants, आरुह्य having mounted, संहृष्टाः cheerfully, भ्राजन्ति are shining.
data.md: And men riding swift coursers are at their riders, riding on elephants, are also cheerfully directing their course hither.

data.v: गृहीतधनुषौ चावां गिरिं वीर श्रयावहे । अथ वेहैव तिष्ठावः संनद्धावुद्यतायुधौ । अपि नौ वशमागच्छेत्कोविदारध्वजो रणे ।।
data.es: O mighty warrior, let both of us take up the bows and station ourselves on this mountain or we shall stay here itself armed with weapons fully prepared for the battle.
data.anv: वीर O mighty warrior, आवाम् both of us, गृहीतधनुषौ by taking up the bows, गिरिम् on this  mountain, श्रयावहै take refuge, अथवा or, सन्नद्धौ fully prepared (for battle), उद्यतायुधौ with weapons in readiness, इहैव here itself, तिष्ठावः stay here.

data.v: अपि द्रक्ष्यामि भरतं यत्कृते व्यसनं महत् । त्वया राघव संप्राप्तं सीतया च मया तथा ।।
data.es: O Rama, will this Kovidara emblem come into our possession in the battle? Can I see Bharata, the cause of the calamity that has befallen you, Sita and me?
data.anv: राघव O Rama, रणे in battle, कोविदारध्वजः Kovidara banner, नौ our, वशम् possession, अप्यागच्छेत् will it come, यत्कृते on whose account, त्वया by you, सीतया by Sita, तथा also, मया च by me, महत् great, व्यसनम् calamity, सम्प्राप्तम् has befallen, such, भरतम् Bharata, अपि द्रक्ष्यामि can I see.

data.v: यन्निमित्तं भवान्राज्याच्च्युतो राघव शाश्वतीम् । संप्राप्तोऽयमरिर्वीर भरतो वध्य एव मे ।।
data.es: O that mighty warrior Bharata, on whose account you have been banished from the perpetual kingdom, comes here as a foe and as for me, he deserves to be slain.
data.anv: हे वीर O mighty warrior, राघव Rama, भवान् you, यन्निमित्तम् on whose account, शाश्वतात्   from the perpetual, राज्यात् from kingdom, च्युतः deprived, अयम् such, सम्प्राप्तः has come here, अरिः foe, भरतः Bharata, मे to me, वध्य एव deserves to be slain.

data.v: भरतस्य वधे दोषं नाहं पश्यामि राघव । पूर्वापकारिणां त्यागे न ह्यधर्मो विधीयते । एतस्मिन्निहते कृत्स्नामनुशाधि वसुंधराम् ।।
data.es: O Rama, I do not see anything wrong in slaying Bharata. In killing one who had done harm is not an act of unrighteousness.
data.anv: राघव O Rama, भरतस्य Bharta's, वधे in slaying, अहम् I, दोषम्  wrong, न पश्यामि do not see, पूर्वापकारिणम् one who has done harmful act earlier, हत्वा in slaying, अधर्मेण with unrighteousness, न युज्यते is not attached.

data.v: अद्य पुत्रं हतं संख्ये कैकेयी राज्यकामुका । मया पश्येत्सुदुःखार्ता हस्तिभग्नमिव द्रुमम् ।।
data.es: Let that Kaikeyi, greedy for the kingdom, see in great anguish her son who shall be slain by me today in a battle like a tree felled by an elephant.
data.anv: राज्यकामुका greedy for the kingdom, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, अद्य today, संख्ये in a battle, मया by me, हतम् slain, पुत्रम् son, हस्तिभग्नम् felled by an elephant, द्रुमम् इव like a tree, सुदुःखार्ता extremely afflicted, पश्येत् let her see.
data.md: On this one being slain, you will rule the entire earth. To day shall Kaikeyi lusting after the kingdom, with grief behold her son slain in battle by me, like a tree riven by an elephants.

data.v: कैकेयीं च वधिष्यामि सानुबन्धां सबान्धवाम् । कलुषेणाद्य महता मेदिनी परिमुच्यताम् ।।
data.es: I shall also slay Kaikeyi with her attendants and relations. Let the earth be cleansed of the great sin today.
data.anv: सानुबन्धाम् with her attendants, सबान्धवाम् with her relations, कैकेयीं च also Kaikeyi, वधिष्यामि will slay, अद्य today, मेदिनी the earth, महता by a great, कलुषेण of the sin, परिमुच्यताम् let it  be cleansed.
data.md: I will also kill Kaikeyi along (with the humpbacked one, and her friends. Let the earth today be freed from foul sins.

data.v: अद्येमं संयतं क्रोधमसत्कारं च मानद । मोक्ष्यामि शत्रुसैन्येषु कक्षेष्विव हुताशनम् ।।
data.es: O protector of honour, today I shall vent my suppressed anger and dishonour on the enemy's army like a fire on the thicket.
data.anv: मानद O protector of honour (Rama), संयतम् suppressed, इमम् this, क्रोधम् anger, असत्कारं च dishonour, हुताशनम् fire, कक्षेष्विव like a thicket, अद्य today, शत्रुसैन्येषु in the army of enemies, मोक्ष्यामि I shall release.
data.md: To day will I, O bestower of honour, vent my restrained ire and bad blood upon the hostile hosts, like fire set to a heap of hay.

data.v: अद्यैतच्चित्रकूटस्य काननं निशितैः शरैः । भिन्दञ्शत्रुशरीराणि करिष्ये शोणितोक्षितम् ।।
data.es: Today I shall rend the bodies of enemies with my sharpened arrows and spatter the forest of Chitrakuta mountain with their blood.
data.anv: अद्य today, निशितैः by the sharpened, शरैः with arrows, शत्रुशरीराणि bodies of enemies, छिन्दन् rending, चित्रकूटस्य Chitrakuta's, एतत् काननम् this forest, शोणितोक्षितम् spattered with blood, करिष्ये I shall do.
data.md: To day with sharpened shafts will I cut the bodies of the hostile hosts and drench the woods of Citrakuta with their blood.

data.v: शरैर्निर्भिन्नहृदयान्कुञ्जरांस्तुरगांस्तथा । श्वापदाः परिकर्षन्तु नराश्च निहतान्मया ।।
data.es: Let the wild beasts drag away the elephants, horses and men to be killed by me with their hearts transfixed with my arrows.
data.anv: शरैः with arrows, निर्भिन्नहृदयान् with hearts transfixed, कुञ्जरान् elephants, तथा and, तुरगान् horses, मया by me, निहतान् killed, नरांश्च also men, श्वापदाः also wild beasts, परिकर्षन्तु let them drag off.
data.md: The ferocious beasts shall drag away elephants and steeds and men slaughtered by me with arrows penetrating into their hearts.

data.v: शराणां धनुषश्चाहमनृणोऽस्मि महावने । ससैन्यं भरतं हत्वा भविष्यामि न संशयः ।।
data.es: Having slain Bharata and his army in this great forest, I shall doubtless discharge my debt to my arrows and bow. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे षण्णवतितमस्सर्गः।Thus ends the ninetysixth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: अस्मिन् in this, महावने great forest, अहम् I, ससैन्यम् with army, भरतम् Bharata, हत्वा having slain, शराणाम् of the arrows, धनुषश्च of the bow, अनृणः discharging my debt, भविष्यामि shall become, संशंयः doubt, न not.
data.md: I will, without doubt, in this forest pay the debt I owe to my bow and arrows, by slaying Bharata together with all his forces.

data.v: सुसंरब्धं तु सौमित्रिं लक्ष्मणं क्रोधमूर्छितम् । रामस्तु परिसान्त्व्याथ वचनं चेदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Thereafter, Rama pacified Lakshmana, son of Sumitra who was violently agitated. He said to him who had swooned with rage:
data.anv: अथ thereafter, रामस्तु as for Rama, सुसंरब्धम् violently agitated, क्रोधमूर्छितम् swooned with rage, सौमित्रिम् to Sumitra's son, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, परिसान्त्व्य having pacified, इदम् this, वचनं च word, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Pacifying Sumitrā's son, Laksmana, transported with rage and eager for encounter, Rama addressed him, saying.

data.v: किमत्र धनुषा कार्यमसिना वा सचर्मणा । महेष्वासे महाप्राज्ञे भरते स्वयमागते ।।
data.es: When sagacious Bharata of great strength has come here, where is the need for a bow or a sword or a shield.
data.anv: महेष्वासे of great strength, महाप्राज्ञे sagacious, भरते Bharata, स्वयम् himself, अत्र here, आगते has come, धनुषा with bow, सचर्मणा with shield, असिना वा or with sword, किं कार्यम् where is the need?
data.md: When the mighty Bharata possessed of high spirits has himself come here, what is the use of the bow or the sword or the shield?

data.v: प्राप्तकालं यदेषोऽस्मान्भरतो द्रष्टुमिच्छति । अस्मासु मनसाप्येष नाहितं किंचिदाचरेत् ।।
data.es: Finding the time appropriate, Bharata has come to see us. Even in his mind he would have never thought of causing any harm to us in any way.
data.anv: एषः भरतः this Bharata, अस्मान् us, यत् द्रष्टुम् इच्छति should he desire to see, प्राप्तकालम् this is appropriate time, एषः he, अस्मासु in us, मनसा अपि even by thought, किंचित् even a little, अप्रियम् harm, नाचरेत् will not do.
data.md: And the season being fit. meet it is that Bharata should see us. He does not even in thought act against us.

data.v: विप्रियं कृतपूर्वं ते भरतेन कदा न किम् । ईदृशं वा भयं तेऽद्य भरतं योऽत्र शङ्कसे ।।
data.es: Why are you suspicious of Bharata? Has he done anything disagreeable to you any time in the past?
data.anv: अत्र here, यः such you, अद्य now, भरतम् about Bharata, शङ्कसे you suspect, ते to you, भरतेन by Bharata, कदा नु at any time anything, किम् विप्रियम् anything disagreeable, ईदृशम् such, भयं वा or fear, कृतपूर्वम् has been done in the past.
data.md: Has ere this Bharata done you any bad turn? Or did he tell you any thing so alarming that today you stand in fear of him?

data.v: न हि ते निष्ठुरं वाच्यो भरतो नाप्रियं वचः । अहं ह्यप्रियमुक्तः स्यां भरतस्याप्रिये कृते ।।
data.es: You must not speak any harsh or unpleasant words against Bharata. If you do, they will be deemed to be directed against me.
data.anv: भरतः Bharata, ते to you, निष्ठुरम् harsh word, न वाच्यः must not speak, अप्रियम् harsh, वचः words, न not, भरतस्य to Bharata, अप्रिये unpleasant act, कृते if it has been done, अहम् I, अप्रियम् harsh words, उक्तः स्यां हि has been told.
data.md: Certainly you ought not to say cruel or unpleasant words in relation to Bharata, if wrong be done to Bharata, I shall consider myself as wornged.

data.v: कथं नु पुत्राः पितरं हन्युः कस्यांचिदापदि । भ्राता वा भ्रातरं हन्यात्सौमित्रे प्राणमात्मनः ।।
data.es: Whatever be the calamity, O Lakshmana, how will sons slay their father, or a brother kill his own brother who is as dear to him as his own life?
data.anv: सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, कस्यां चित् आपदि in whatever calamity, पुत्र: son, पितरम् father, कथं नु how, हन्युः can slay, भ्राता वा or a brother, आत्मनः as his own, प्राणम् life, भ्रातरम् his own brother, हन्यात् will kill?
data.md: Do sons, in times of peril, ever slay their father, or brothers their brother like to their life, O son of Sumitrā?

data.v: यदि राज्यस्य हेतोस्त्वमिमां वाचं प्रभाषसे । वक्ष्यामि भरतं दृष्ट्वा राज्यमस्मै प्रदीयताम् ।।
data.es: If you are saying all these words only for the sake of the kingdom, then I shall ask Bharata when I see him to offer this kingdom to you.
data.anv: राज्यस्य हेतोः for the sake of a  kingdom, त्वम् you, इमां वाचम् these words, प्रभाषसे यदि if you are saying  भरतम् Bharata, दृष्टवा seeing, अस्मै for him, राज्यम् kingdom, प्रदीयताम् be given, वक्ष्यामि I shall tell.
data.md: If you speak thus for the sake of the monarchy, on seeing Bharata, I will say to him, "Make over the kingdom to this one/"

data.v: उच्यमानो हि भरतो मया लक्ष्मण तत्त्वतः । राज्यमस्मै प्रयच्छेति बाढमित्येव वक्ष्यति ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana if I earnestly exhort Bharata to offer this kingdom to you, then on hearing those words, he would say, 'Certainly so'.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, भरतोऽपि Bharata also, अस्मै to him, राज्यम् kingdom, प्रयच्छ give, इति  thus, उच्यमानः having been told, तद्वच: that word, बाढम् इत्येव certainly so, वक्ष्यति will say.
data.md: Earnestly exhorted by me, saying, “Do you place the kingdom in his hands', he will say, "Very well'."

data.v: तथोक्तो धर्मशीलेन भ्रात्रा तस्य हिते रतः । लक्ष्मणः प्रविवेशेव स्वानि गात्राणि लज्जया ।।
data.es: Having heard the words uttered by his brother, Rama of virtuous disposition, Lakshmana who was devoted to his brother's welfare, shrank.
data.anv: धर्मशीलेन by a man of virtuous disposition, भ्रात्रा by brother, तथा thus, उक्तः uttered, तस्य  his brother's, हिते in welfare, रतः devoted, लक्ष्मणः Lakshamana, लज्जया with a sense of shame, स्वानि his own, गात्राणि limbs, प्रविवेशेव entered.
data.md: Thus addressed by his brother of a virtuous disposition, Laksmana ever engaged in Rama's good, from shame seemed to enter into his body.

data.v: व्रीडितं लक्ष्मणं दृष्ट्वा राघवः प्रत्युवाच ह । एष मन्ये महाबाहुरिहास्मान्द्रष्टुमागतः ।।
data.es: Hearing the words of Rama, Lakshmana was abashed and said I think it is our father, king Dasaratha who has come here personally to see you.
data.anv: लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, तद्वाक्यम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, व्रीलितः abashed, प्रत्युवाच ह replied, पिता father, दशरथः Dasaratha, त्वां you, द्रष्टुम् to see, स्वयम् personally, आयातः has come, मन्ये I think.
data.md: And finding Lakşmaņa overcome with shame, Rāghava replied, I think that mighty-armed one has come hither to see us; or I take it for certain that, considering that we are fit for ease only, and taking our banishment to heart, he will take us home.

data.v: वनवासमनुध्याय गृहाय प्रतिनेष्यति । इमां वाप्येश वैदेहीमत्यन्तसुखसेविनीम् ।।
एतौ तौ संप्रकाशेते गोत्रवन्तौ मनोरमौ । वायुवेगसमौ वीर जवनौ तुरगोत्तमौ ।।
data.es: O valiant warrior, you can see those two splendid horses of high pedigree, charming, swift and equal to wind in speed are shining (in the army).
data.anv: वीर O valiant one, गोत्रवन्तौ both of them of high pedigree, मनोरमौ charming, वायुवेगसमो windswift, जवनौ both swift, तौ those, एतौ these two, तुरगोत्तमौ splendid horses, सम्प्रकाशेते are shining.
data.md: There are seen these graceful and well-bred steeds, courageous, swift, and furnished with the speed of the wind, the best of horses.

data.v: स एष सुमहाकायः कम्पते वाहिनीमुखे । नागः शत्रुंजयो नाम वृद्धस्तातस्य धीमतः ।।
data.es: There is that huge and aged elephant named Satrunjaya which belogns to our sagacious father proceeding at the head of the army.
data.anv: सुमहाकायः huge, शत्रुञ्जयः named Satrunjaya, धीमतः of the sagacious, तातस्य father's, सः that, वृद्धः aged, नागः elephant, एषः here it is, वाहिनीमुखे at the head of the army, कम्पते moving about.
data.md: And this huge elephant belonging to our aged sire, named Satrunjaya, proceeds in the van of the army.

data.v: अवतीर्य तु सालाग्रात्तस्मात्स समितिंजयः । लक्ष्मणः प्राञ्जलिर्भूत्वा तस्थौ रामस्य पार्श्वतः ।।
data.es: Lakshmana, the conqueror of foes, descended from the top of the sala tree and stood by the side of Rama with folded palms.
data.anv: समितिञ्जयः conqueror of the enemy, सः लक्ष्मणः that Lakshmana, तस्मात् सालाग्रात् from the top of that sala tree, अवतीर्य having descended, प्राञ्जलिः भूत्वा with folded palms, रामस्य Rama's, पार्श्वतः by the side of, तस्थौ stood.
data.md: Do you descend from the top of the tree, O Laksmana. Do my bidding. Thus did the righteous Rāma accosts Sumitra's Descending from the top of the Sāla tree, that conqueror in battles, Lakşmaņa, stood by Rāma with joined hands. son.

data.v: भरतेनाथ संदिष्टा संमर्दो न भवेदिति । समन्तात्तस्य शैलस्य सेनावासमकल्पयत् ।।
data.es: Let not the hermitage be crowded commanded Bharata, and the army encamped around the mountain.
data.anv: सम्मर्दः crowding, न भवेत् let it not happen, इति thus, भरतेनापि by Bharata also, सन्दिष्टा instructed, सेना army, तस्य शैलस्य that mountain's, समन्तात् around, आवासम् encampment, अकल्पयत् made.
data.md: Commanded by Bharata, Let not (Rāma's asylum) by trampled by the forces, the army took up its quarters at a distance from the hill.

data.v: अध्यर्धमिक्ष्वाकुचमूर्योजनं पर्वतस्य सा । पार्श्वे न्यविशदावृत्य गजवाजिरथाकुला ।।
data.es: Bharata's army full of horses, elephants and chariots covering a distance of more than one and a half yojanas encamped by the side of the mountain.
data.anv: गजवाजिरथाकुला with throngs of horses, elephants and chariots, सा that, इक्ष्वाकुचमूः the army of the descendant of Ikshvaku, अध्यर्धयोजनम् a distance more than one and a half yojanas, पर्वतस्य mountain's, पार्श्वे by the side of, आवृत्य having surrounded, न्यविशत् encamped.
data.md: And the Ikşvāku host filled with elephants and steeds covering half a Yojana, encamped at the side of the mountain.

data.v: सा चित्रकूटे भरतेन सेना; धर्मं पुरस्कृत्य विधूय दर्पम् । प्रसादनार्थं रघुनन्दनस्य; विरोचते नीतिमता प्रणीता ।।
data.es: The army brought by Bharata, the great moralist, was shining around Chitrakuta mountain following dharma, and casting off all pride, in order to please Rama.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे सप्तनवतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the ninetyseventh sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: धर्मम् righteousness, पुरस्कृत्य adopting, दर्पम् pride, विधूय casting aside, रघुनन्दनस्य Rama's, प्रसादनार्थम् to propitiate, नीतिमता by a moralist, भरतेन by Bharata, प्रणीता having been brought, सा that, सेना army, चित्रकूटे on Chitrakuta, विराजते was shining.
data.md: And keeping morality in their fore-front, and renouncing pride, the disciplined forces schooled by Bharata in view of pleasing that descendant of Raghu (Rāma), stayed in Citrakuța.

data.v: निवेश्य सेनां तु विभुः पद्भ्यां पादवतां वरः । अभिगन्तुं स काकुत्स्थमियेष गुरुवर्तकम् ।।
data.es: On encamping the army, lord Bharata, the best among men, wished to approach on foot Rama who was devoted to his father.
data.anv: विभुः the lord, पादवताम् among the bipeds, वरः best, सः that Bharata, सेनाम् army, निवेश्य after encamping, गुरुवर्तकम् devoted the preceptor (father), काकुत्थ्सम् Rama, पद्भ्याम् on foot, अभिगन्तुम् to approach, इयेष wished.
data.md: Having stationed his troops, that best of men, the master, became anxious to go on foot to the Käkutstha honouring his superiors. And the forces having with humility took up the quarters assigned, Bharata addressed his brother, Satrughna, saying.

data.v: निविष्ट मात्रे सैन्ये तु यथोद्देशं विनीतवत् । भरतो भ्रातरं वाक्यं शत्रुघ्नमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: After the army encamped in the assigned places, Bharata said to his brother Satrughna thus:
data.anv: सैन्ये army, यथोद्देशम् in assigned places, निविष्टमात्रे after encamping, भरतः Bharata, भ्रातरम् brother, शत्रुघ्नम् to Satrughna, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Having stationed his troops, that best of men, the master, became anxious to go on foot to the Käkutstha honouring his superiors. And the forces having with humility took up the quarters assigned, Bharata addressed his brother, Satrughna, saying.

data.v: क्षिप्रं वनमिदं सौम्य नरसंघैः समन्ततः । लुब्धैश्च सहितैरेभिस्त्वमन्वेषितुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: O dear Satrughna, you should explore this forest quickly along with groups of our people and hunters as well.
data.anv: सौम्य O dear Satrughna, नरसङ्घै: with groups of people, सहितैः accompanied by, लुब्धैश्च  in the company of hunters as well, त्वम् you, क्षिप्रम् quickly, इदं वनम् this forest, समन्ततः all over, अन्वेषितुम् to explore, अर्हसि should.
data.md: O mild one, it behoves you at once to search this forest all round in company with a large body of men as well as these Nişadas.

data.v: यावन्न रामं द्रक्ष्यामि लक्ष्मणं वा महाबलम् । वैदेहीं वा महाभागां न मे शान्तिर्भविष्यति ।।
data.es: 'I shall not rest in peace until I see Rama, powerful Lakshmana and illustrious princess of Videha (Sita).
data.anv: रामम् Rama, महाबलम् powerful, लक्ष्मणं वा Lakshmana, महाभागां illustrious, वैदेहीं च Sita, यावत्  till such time, न द्रक्ष्यामि I do not see, मे to me, शान्ति peace, न भविष्यति shall not come.
data.md: So long as I do not see Răma, or the mighty Lakṣmaṇa, or the highly exalted daughter of Videha, I shall not attain peace of mind.

data.v: यावन्न चन्द्रसंकाशं द्रक्ष्यामि शुभमाननम् । भ्रातुः पद्मपलाशाक्षं न मे शान्तिर्भविष्यति ।।
data.es: 'I shall not rest in peace until I see Rama, powerful Lakshmana and illustrious princess of Videha (Sita).
data.anv: चन्द्रसङ्काशम् radiant as the Moon, पद्मपलाशाक्षम् eyes resembling lotuspetals, भ्रातुः brother Rama, शुभम् auspicious, आननम् face, यावत् till such time, न द्रक्ष्यामि I do not see, मे to me, शान्तिः peace, न भविष्यति shall not come.
data.md: And so long as I do not see that face of his fair as the moon, with eyes expansive like lotuses, I shall not attain peace of mind.

data.v: यावन्न चरणौ भ्रातुः पार्थिव व्यञ्जनान्वितौ । शिरसा धारयिष्यामि न मे शान्तिर्भविष्यति ।।
data.es: Peace shall not come to me until I hold on my head the feet of my brother, the insignia of royalty.
data.anv: भ्रातुः brother's, पार्थिवव्यञ्जनान्वितौ bearing the signs of royalty, चरणौ feet, यावत् till such time, शिरसा with the head, न धारयिष्यामि I will not carry, मे to me, शान्ति: peace, न भविष्यति  shall not come.
data.md: So long as I do not take on my head those feet of my brother bearing royal marks, I shall not attain peace of mind.

data.v: यावन्न राज्ये राज्यार्हः पितृपैतामहे स्थितः । अभिषेकजलक्लिन्नो न मे शान्तिर्भविष्यति ।।
data.es: I shall not attain peace until Rama, who is worthy of this kingdom, is sprinkled with the holy water of coronation and assumes the ancestral kingdom.
data.anv: राज्यार्हः one who is worthy of this kingdom, अभिषेकजलक्लिन्नः wet with the holy waters of consecration, पितृपैतामहे pertaining to our father and forefathers, राज्ये in the kingdom, यावत् till such time, न स्थितः is not established, मे my, शान्तिः peace, न भविष्यति shall not attain.
data.md: So long as established in the kingdom of his father and grandfather, that one worthy of the monarchy is not sprinkled with the water on installation, I shall not attain peace of mind.

data.v: कृतकृत्या महाभागा वैदेही जनकात्मजा । भर्तारं सागरान्तायाः पृथिव्या यानुगच्छति ।।
data.es: Sita, the illustrious daughter of Janaka and princess of Videha, has accomplished her purpose by following Rama, the lord of this earth bounded by the ocean.
data.anv: या that Sita, सागरान्तायाः bounded by the ocean, पृथिव्याः of the earth, भर्तारम् Rama as lord, अनुगच्छति who is following, महाभागा illustrious lady, जनकात्मजा daughter of Janaka, वैदेही princess of Videha (Sita), कृतकृत्या has accomplished her purpose.
data.md: Blessed is Vaidehī, the eminently virtuous daughter of Janaka, who follows the lord of this Earth bounded by the seas.

data.v: सुभगश्चित्रकूटोऽसौ गिरिराजोपमो गिरिः । यस्मिन्वसति काकुत्स्थः कुबेर इवनन्दने ।।
data.es: Like Kubera in the Nandana garden, Rama lives here on mount Chitrakuta which is indeed blessed like the Himalaya, king of the mountains.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ: Rama, यस्मिन् on which, कुबेरः Kubera, the lord of wealth, नन्दने इव like in the Nandana garden, वसति staying, असौ such, गिरिराजोपमः comparable to the king of the mountains, Himavan, चित्रकूटः गिरिः Chitrakuta mountain, सुभगः is fortunate.
data.md: This Citrakuța is fortunate, this hill like to the monarch of mountains, in which resides Kākutstha, like Kuvera in Nandana.

data.v: कृतकार्यमिदं दुर्गं वनं व्यालनिषेवितम् । यदध्यास्ते महातेजा रामः शस्त्रभृतां वरः ।।
data.es: Fortunate is this inaccessible forest which is inhabited by wild animals to have become the dwelling place of the most radiant Rama, the foremost among the wielders of weapons.
data.anv: शस्त्रभृताम् among those who wield weapons, वरः the foremost, महातेजाः most radiant, रामः Rama, यत् that, अध्यास्ते is dwelling, व्यालनिषेवितम् inhabited by wild animals, दुर्गम् inaccessible, इदं वनम् this forest, कृतकार्यम् accomplished its task.
data.md: And blessed is this deep forest inhabited by ferocious animals, where abide the great king Rāma, the foremost of those bearing arms.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा महातेजा भरतः पुरुषर्षभः । पद्भ्यामेव महातेजाः प्रविवेश महद्वनम् ।।
data.es: Having said thus, the best of men, mightyarmed and highly energetic Bharata entered the great forest on foot.
data.anv: महातेजा: a man of great radiance, पुरुषर्षभः best of men, महाबाहुः mightyarmed, भरतः Bharata, एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having said, महत् great, वनम् forest, पद्भ्यामेव on foot alone, प्रविवेश entered.
data.md: Having said this, that best of men, the mightyarmed and highly energetic Bharata, on foot entered the vast forest.

data.v: स तानि द्रुमजालानि जातानि गिरिसानुषु । पुष्पिताग्राणि मध्येन जगाम वदतां वरः ।।
data.es: Bharata, the best among the eloquent, made his way amidst multitude of trees grown on mountain slopes with their tops in full bloom.
data.anv: वदताम् among the eloquent, वर: best, सः that, गिरिसानुषु on mountain slopes, जातानि growing, पुष्पिताग्राणि tops of trees in bloom, तानि those, द्रुमजालानि मध्येन through the midst of multitude of trees, जगाम went.
data.md: And that best of speakers went over the mountain-side through ranks of blossoming trees.

data.v: स गिरेश्चित्रकूटस्य सालमासाद्य पुष्पितम् । रामाश्रमगतस्याग्नेर्ददर्श ध्वजमुच्छ्रितम् ।।
data.es: Having reached a flowering sala tree atop Chitrakuta mountain, he beheld a lofty banner of smoke rising from the fire burning in Rama's hermitage.
data.anv: सः that, चित्रकूटस्य गिरेः atop Chitrakuta mountain, पुष्पितम् flowering, सालम् sala trees, असाद्य having reached, रामाश्रमगतस्य in Rama's hermitage, अग्नेः of the burning fire, उच्छ्रितं lofty, ध्वजम् banner of smoke, ददर्श beheld.
data.md: Then swiftly ascending a Sāla on Citrakuta, he descried the high column of smoke belonging to Răma's asylum.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा भरतः श्रीमान्मुमोद सहबान्धवः । अत्र राम इति ज्ञात्वा गतः पारमिवाम्भसः ।।
data.es: On seeing the smoke, majestic Bharata in the company of relatives concluded that Rama was staying there and rejoiced like a man who had reached the other bank of the river.
data.anv: श्रीमान् the majestic, सह बान्धवः with relatives, भरतः Bharata, तम् that smoke, दृष्ट्वा having seen, रामः Rama, अत्र इति here he is, ज्ञात्वा having known, अम्भसः of waters, पारम् the other bank, गतः इव having reached, मुमोद rejoiced.
data.md: Having seen this, like one that has crossed over the ocean, the graceful Bharata, concluding that Rāma was there, rejoiced exceedingly along with his friends.

data.v: स चित्रकूटे तु गिरौ निशाम्य; रामाश्रमं पुण्यजनोपपन्नम् । गुहेन सार्धं त्वरितो जगाम; पुनर्निवेश्यैव चमूं महात्मा ।।
data.es: Having heard of Rama's hermitage on the Chitrakuta mountain inhabited by pious men, magnanimous Bharata, commanded his army to stay at a distance, and quickly proceeded with Guha.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे अष्टनवतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the ninetyeighth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: महात्मा the magnanimous one, सः that Bharata, चित्रकूटे गिरौ on Chitrakuta mountain, पुण्यजनोपपन्नम् inhabited by pious men, रामाश्रमम् Rama's hermitage, निशम्य having heard about, चमूम् the army, निवेश्यैव having camped at a distance, पुनः again, गुहेन सार्धम् with Guha, त्वरितः quickly, जगाम went.
data.md: Having heard that Rama's asylum containing pious people lay in Citrakuta, that high-souled one again stationing his forces, speedily went (in that direction), accompanied by Guha.

data.v: निविष्टायां तु सेनायामुत्सुको भरतस्तदा । जगाम भ्रातरं द्रष्टुं शत्रुघ्नमनुदर्शयन् ।।
data.es: After the army encamped in the assigned places, Bharata said to his brother Satrughna thus:
data.anv: तदा then, सेनायाम् when the army, निविष्टायाम्  encamped, भरतः Bharata, उत्सुकः with eagerness, शत्रुघ्नम् Satrughna, अनुदर्शयन् showing, भ्रातरम् brother, द्रष्टुम् to see, जगाम went.
data.md: Having quartered his forces, Bharata eager (to go to Rāma's place), went to see his brother, showing to Satrughna the signs of Rāma's abode being in the vicinity.

data.v: ऋषिं वसिष्ठं संदिश्य मातॄर्मे शीघ्रमानय । इति तरितमग्रे स जागम गुरुवत्सलः ।।
data.es: Bharata, deeply devoted towards elders, indicated to sage Vasistha to bring along the mothers, and proceeded ahead quickly.
data.anv: गुरुवत्सलः devoted towards elders, सः Bharata, मे my, मातृ़ः mothers, शीघ्रम् quickly, आनय bring, इति thus, ऋषिम् rishi, वसिष्ठम् Vasistha, सन्दिश्य having conveyed, त्वरितम् quickly, अग्रे ahead, जगाम proceeded.
data.md: And having desired Vasistha, saying, “Bring my mothers without delay," that one attached to his superiors went before.

data.v: सुमन्त्रस्त्वपि शतुघ्नमदूरादन्वपद्यत । रामदार्शनजस्तर्षो भरतस्येव तस्य च ।।
data.es: Sumantra, who was overeager, like Bharata, to see Rama, followed Satrughna who was not far from him.
data.anv: सुमन्त्रस्त्वपि Sumantra on his part, शत्रुघ्नम् to Satrughna, अदूरात् not far from, अन्वपद्यत  followed, रामदर्शनजः arising from seeing Rama, तर्षः overeager, तस्य च for him also, भरतस्येव is like that of Bharata.
data.md: And eager to see Rāma even like Bharata himself, Sumantra followed Bharata at a short distance.

data.v: गच्छन्नेवाथ भरतस्तापसालयसंस्थिताम् । भ्रातुः पर्णकुटीं श्रीमानुटजं च ददर्श ह ।।
data.es: While walking, Bharata beheld a hut made of leaves looking like a hermit's cottage.
data.anv: अथ thereafter, श्रीमान् the majestic one, भरतः Bharata, गच्छन्नेव while walking, तापसालयसंस्थिताम् situated like huts of hermits, भ्रातुः brother's, पर्णकुटीम् hut made of leaves, उटजं च thatched cottage, ददर्श ह beheld.
data.md: As Bharata passed on, he observed a neat cottage of leaves stationed among the asylums of anchorets, furnished with a portion having a wall with a door.

data.v: शालायास्त्वग्रतस्तस्या ददर्श भरतस्तदा । काष्टानि चावभग्नानि पुष्पाण्यवचितानि च ।।
data.es: In front of that hut Bharata beheld shattered logs of wood and also flowers plucked.
data.anv: तदा then, भरतः Bharata, तस्याः शालायाः that leafy hut's, अग्रतः in front of, अवभग्नानि shattered, काष्ठानि logs of wood, उपचितानि plucked, पुष्पाणि च also flowers, ददर्श beheld.
data.md: Before the cottage, Bharata saw fuel broken up, and flowers gathered. And he saw at places signs of Kuśa and bark set up on trees when Rāma and Lakşmaņa (first) arrived at their asylum.

data.v: ददर्श च वने तस्मिन्महतः संचयान्कृतान् । मृगाणां महिषाणां च करीषैः शीतकारणात् ।।
data.es: He also beheld large heaps of dried cakes of dung of buffaloes and deer for use against cold in the forest.
data.anv: सः that Bharata, तस्मिन् वने in that forest, शीतकारणात् due to cold, मृगाणाम् deer's, महिषाणां च also of buffaloes, करीषैः dried cakes of dung, कृतान् prepared, महतः large, सञ्चयान् heaps, ददर्श beheld.
data.md: And in that habitation, Bharata saw great heaps of dry dung of deer and buffaloes, gathered for preventing cold.

data.v: गच्छनेव महाबाहुर्द्युतिमान्भरतस्तदा । शत्रुघ्नं चाब्रवीद्धृष्टस्तानमात्यांश्च सर्वशः ।।
data.es: Walking on, the longarmed, effulgent and delighted Bharata said to Satrughna and the ministers surrounding him:
data.anv: महाबाहुः longarmed, द्युतिमान् effulgent, भरतः Bharata, तदा then, गच्छन्नेव while going, हृष्टः rejoiced, शत्रुघ्नं च to Satrughna, सर्वशः all around, तान् those, अमात्यांश्च to the ministers, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: As he proceeded, the intelligent and mightyarmed Bharata with a cheerful heart remarked to Śatrughna and all the courtiers.

data.v: मन्ये प्राप्ताः स्म तं देशं भरद्वाजो यमब्रवीत् । नातिदूरे हि मन्येऽहं नदीं मन्दाकिनीमितः ।।
data.es: We must have reached the region about which Bharadwaja had spoken. I think river Mandakini is not far from here.
data.anv: यम् about which, भरद्वाजः Bharadwaja, अब्रवीत् had spoken, तं देशम् that region, प्राप्ताः स्म  we must have reached, मन्ये I think, मन्दाकिनीं नदीं Mandakini river, इतः from here, नातिदूरे not far, अहम् I, मन्ये think.
data.md: I conceive, we have reached the tract that was mentioned by Bharadvāja. Hard by this spot, I fancy, is the river Mandākini.

data.v: उच्चैर्बद्धानि चीराणि लक्ष्मणेन भवेदयम् । अभिज्ञानकृतः पन्था विकाले गन्तुमिच्छता ।।
data.es: Here are long bark garments fastened on lofty places as marks of identification left by Lakshmana, to locate the path at odd times which may be needed while going out.
data.anv: चीराणि long bark garments, उच्चैः on lofty places (trees), बद्धानि have been fastened, अयम् this, अकाले at odd times, गन्तुम् to move out, इच्छता wishing, लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, अभिज्ञानकृतः marks of identification, पन्थाः भवेत् it must have been the path.
data.md: On high are barks set up by Lakşmaņa. Having to pass by the way at unusual hours, (Laksmana) has marked it with signs.

data.v: इदं चोदात्तदन्तानां कुञ्जराणां तरस्विनाम् । शैलपार्श्वे परिक्रान्तमन्योन्यमभिगर्जताम् ।।
data.es: This must be the place on the hillside on which mighty tuskers wander about trumpeting and charging at one another.
data.anv: शैलपार्श्वे on the hillside, इदम् this, उदात्तदन्तानाम् of the largetusked, तरस्विनाम् swift अन्योन्यम् charging at one another, अभिगर्जताम् trumpeting, कुञ्जराणाम् elephants', परिक्रान्तम् place.
data.md: On the side of the hill is the way by which long-tusked elephants pass to and fro with vehemence, roaring at each other.

data.v: यमेवाधातुमिच्छन्ति तापसाः सततं वने । तस्यासौ दृश्यते धूमः संकुलः कृष्टवर्त्मनः ।।
data.es: Here is the thick smoke emanating from the blacktrailed fire maintained perpetually by the ascetics living in the forest.
data.anv: वने in the forest, तापसाः ascetics, सततम् always, यमेव only whom, आधातुम् to maintain, इच्छन्ति wishing, तस्य that, कृष्णवर्त्मनः of blacktrailed fires, असौ this, सङ्कुलः thick, धूमः smoke, दृश्यते is seen.
data.md: Here is seen the dense and dark smoke of that which the anchorets are ever anxious to preserve in the forest, fire.

data.v: अत्राहं पुरुषव्याघ्रं गुरुसत्कारकारिणम् । आर्यं द्रक्ष्यामि संहृष्टो महर्षिमिव राघवम् ।।
data.es: I shall see here with a delighted heart the venerable Rama, the best of men, who renders great hospitality (to elders) and who resembles a maharshi.
data.anv: अहम् I, पुरुषव्याघ्रम् the best of men, Rama, गुरुसत्कारकारिणम् rendering great hospitality, आर्यम् venerable, महर्षिमिव like a great sage, राघवम् to Rama, संहृष्टः with a delighted heart, अत्र here, द्रक्ष्यामि I shall see.
data.md: Even here shall I with a delighted heart see that foremost of men, the noble Rāghava resembling a Maharși, ever engaged in serving his superiors.

data.v: अथ गत्वा मुहूर्तं तु चित्रकूटं स राघवः । मन्दाकिनीमनुप्राप्तस्तं जनं चेदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Bharata walked for a short distance towards mount Chitrkuta when he reached river Mandakini. And then said to his ministers:
data.anv: अथ thereafter, सः राघवः that Bharata, चित्रकूटम् towards Chitrakuta (mountain), मुहूर्तम् for a moment, गत्वा having gone, मन्दाकिनीम् river Mandakini, अनुप्राप्तः having reached, तं जनम्  to those people, इदम् those words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Then going to Citrakuta, that descendant of Raghu, coming to the Mandakini, said to the men.

data.v: जगत्यां पुरुषव्याघ्र आस्ते वीरासने रतः । जनेन्द्रो निर्जनं प्राप्य धिन्मे जन्म सजीवितम् ।।
data.es: Rama, the lord of men, a tiger among men, is sitting on the ground in a 'heroic' (yogic) posture in this secluded forest. O fie upon my birth and my life
data.anv: जनेन्द्रः the lord of men, पुरषव्याघ्रः a tiger among men, निर्जनम् a place devoid of people, प्राप्य having reached, वीरासने in 'heroic' posture, रतः remaining, जगत्याम् on the ground, आस्ते is sitting, मे my, सजीवितम् life, जन्म birth, धिक् fie upon.
data.md: That foremost of men in all the world, the lord of all, coming into seclusion, is in his yoga posture. O fie upon my birth and my life!

data.v: मत्कृते व्यसनं प्राप्तो लोकनाथो महाद्युतिः । सरान्कामान्परित्यज्य वने वसति राघवः ।।
data.es: Effulgent Rama, the lord of the world, had to renounce all desires and undergo this calamity of living in the forest on my account.
data.anv: लोकनाथः lord of the world, महाद्युतिः effulgent, राघवः Rama, मत्कृते on my account, व्यसनम्  calamity, प्राप्त: has faced, सर्वान् all, कामान् desires, परित्यज्य renouncing, वने in the forest, वसति is living.
data.md: For me, having come by misfortune, and renounced every comfort, the effulgent lord of men, Rāghava, is dwelling in the woods.

data.v: इति लोकसमाक्रुष्टः पादेष्वद्य प्रसादयन् । रामस्य निपतिष्यामि सीतायाश्च पुनः पुनः ।।
data.es: Reviled by the world, I shall now fall at the feet of Sita, Rama and Lakshmana seeking their grace.
data.anv: इति thus, लोकसमाक्रुष्टः reviled by the world, अद्य now, प्रसादयन् seeking the grace, रामस्य Rama's, सीतायाः Sita's, लक्ष्मणस्य च and Lakshmana's, पादेषु at the feet, निपतिष्यामि shall fall down.
data.md: I shall be taxed of men on the score. To-day (first) pacifying him, I will fall at the feet of Rāma as well as of Sitã and Lakşmaņa.

data.v: एवं स विलपंस्तस्मिन्वने दशरथात्मजः । ददर्श महतीं पुण्यां पर्णशालां मनोरमाम् ।।
data.md: Having thus bewailed, Dasaratha's son saw a splendid, charming, and holy dwelling in that forest, composed of leaves.

data.v: सालतालाश्वकर्णानां पर्णैर्बहुभिरावृताम् । विशालां मृदुभिस्तीर्णां कुशैर्वेदिमिवाध्वरे ।।
शक्रायुध निकाशैश्च कार्मुकैर्भारसाधनैः । रुक्मपृष्ठैर्महासारैः शोभितां शत्रुबाधकैः ।।
अर्करश्मिप्रतीकाशैर्घोरैस्तूणीगतैः शरैः । शोभितां दीप्तवदनैः सर्पैर्भोगवतीमिव ।।
महारजतवासोभ्यामसिभ्यां च विराजिताम् । रुक्मबिन्दुविचित्राभ्यां चर्मभ्यां चापि शोभिताम् ।।
गोधाङ्गुलित्रैरासाक्तैश्चित्रैः काञ्चनभूषितैः । अरिसंघैरनाधृष्यां मृगैः सिंहगुहामिव ।।
प्रागुदक्स्रवणां वेदिं विशालां दीप्तपावकाम् । ददर्श भरतस्तत्र पुण्यां रामनिवेशने ।।
data.es: Bharata beheld at Rama's residence a sacred and spacious altar sloping to the northeast, with a burning fire upon it.
data.anv: भरतः Bharata, तत्र there, रामनिवेशने at Rama's residence, प्रागुदक्प्रवणाम् sloping to the  northeast, विशालाम् spacious, दीप्तपावकाम् having flaming fire, पुण्याम् sacred, वेदिम् altar, ददर्श beheld.

data.v: निरीक्ष्य स मुहूर्तं तु ददर्श भरतो गुरुम् । उटजे राममासीनां जटामण्डलधारिणम् ।।
data.es: Bharata looked around for a moment and saw his esteemed brother Rama seated in that thatched cottage wearing matted locks of hair.
data.anv: सः भरतः that Bharata, मुहूर्तम् for a moment, निरीक्ष्य looking around, उटजे in the cottage, आसीनम् seated, जटामण्डलधारिणम् wearing matted locks of hair, गुरुम् esteemed brother, रामम् Rama, ददर्श saw.

data.v: तं तु कृष्णाजिनधरं चीरवल्कलवाससं । ददर्श राममासीनमभितः पावकोपमम् ।।
सिंहस्कन्धं महाबाहुं पुण्डरीकनिभेक्षणम् । पृथिव्याः सगरान्ताया भर्तारं धर्मचारिणम् ।।
उपविष्टं महाबाहुं ब्रह्माणमिव शाश्वतम् । स्थण्डिले दर्भसस्म्तीर्णे सीतया लक्ष्मणेन च ।।
तं दृष्ट्वा भरतः श्रीमान्दुःखमोहपरिप्लुतः । अभ्यधावत धर्मात्मा भरतः कैकयीसुतः ।।
data.es: Beholding Rama, Bharata the majestic and righteous son of Kaikeyi overwhelmed with grief and distress rushed towards him.
data.anv: श्रीमान् majestic, भरतः Bharata, तम् that Rama, दृष्ट्वा having seen, दुःखशोकपरिप्लुतः  overwhelmed with grief and distress, धर्मात्मा righteous, कैकयीसुतः son of Kaikeyi, भरतः Bharata, अभ्यधावत ran towards him.
data.md: And seeing him, overwhelmed with grief and affliction, the righteous and graceful son of Kaikeyi, Bharata, rushed (towards him).

data.v: दृष्ट्वा च विललापार्तो बाष्पसंदिग्धया गिरा । अशक्नुवन्धारयितुं धैर्याद्वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: On seeing Rama, Bharata could not control his grief with patience and lamented in great anguish and with words choked with tears said:
data.anv: दृष्ट्वैव as soon as he saw, आर्तः anguished, बाष्पसन्दिग्धया choked with tears, गिरा with words, विललाप lamented, धैर्यात् with courage, धारयितुम् to restrain, अशक्नुवन् being unable, वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: And soon as Bharata saw Rāma, he, exceedingly distressed, broke out into lamentations in words choked with sorrow. And incapable of holding himself in patience, he said.

data.v: यः संसदि प्रकृतिभिर्भवेद्युक्त उपासितुम् । वन्यैर्मृगैरुपासीनः सोऽयमास्ते ममाग्रजः ।।
data.es: My elder brother who deserves to be attended by ministers and other subjects in the royal assembly sits here today in the forest surrounded by wild beasts.
data.anv: यः he who, संसदि in the royal assembly, प्रकृतिभिः by ministers and other subjects, उपासितुम् to be attended upon, युक्तः one who deserves, भवेत् becomes, सः he, अयम् this, man, मम my, अग्रजः elder brother, वन्यैः wild, मृगैः by the beasts, उपासीनः आस्ते is being attended.
data.md: That elder brother of mine, who (seated) in court should be surrounded by the subjects intent upon paying him homage, is now surrounded by wild deer.

data.v: वासोभिर्बहुसाहस्रैर्यो महात्मा पुरोचितः । मृगाजिने सोऽयमिह प्रवस्ते धर्ममाचरन् ।।
data.es: Such magnanimous Rama, a follower of dharma, accustomed to be attired in thousands of dresses in the past now clad in two deer skins, is practising righteousness.
data.anv: यः महात्मा that magnanimous (Rama), पुरा formerly, बहुसाहस्रैः with many thousands, वासोभिः with clothes, उचितः was accustomed, सः such, अयम् now, धर्मम् righteousness, आचरन् practising, मृगाजिने two deer kins, प्रवस्ते is wearing.
data.md: He that used to adorn his person with attire worth many thousands (of things), engaged in observing morality, is clad in deer-skin.

data.v: अधारयद्यो विविधाश्चित्राः सुमनसस्तदा । सोऽयं जटाभारमिमं सहते राघवः कथम् ।।
data.es: How is it that Rama who used to wear variegated flowers formerly, now bears these heavy matted locks?
data.anv: यः that Rama, तदा then, विविधाः various, चित्राः colours, सुमनसः flowers, आधारयत् wore, सः such a man, अयं राघवः this Rama, इमं जटाभारम् the weight of matted hair, कथम् how, वहते is able to bear?
data.md: Why does he that always wore variegated blossoms, Rāghava, bears this burthen of matted locks?

data.v: यस्य यज्ञैर्यथादिष्टैर्युक्तो धर्मस्य संचयः । शरीर क्लेशसंभूतं स धर्मं परिमार्गते ।।
data.es: That Rama, who in accordance with tradition deserves accredition of religious merit through sacrifices now seeks it through mortification of body.
data.anv: यथोद्विष्टैः in accordance with desire, यज्ञैः with sacrifices, यस्य to whom, धर्मस्य righteousness, सञ्चयः accumulation, युक्तः was quite possible, सः such Rama, शरीरक्लेशसंभूतम् rising due to mortification of body, धर्मम् righteouness, परिमार्गते is seeking.
data.md: He who is worthy of acquiring religious merit by celebrating sacrifices according to the ordinance, is now following morality by afflicting his person.

data.v: चन्दनेन महार्हेण यस्याङ्गमुपसेवितम् । मलेन तस्याङ्गमिदं कथमार्यस्य सेव्यते ।।
data.es: How is it that the body of my venerable brother which was once smeared with expensive, fragrant sandal paste is now covered with dust?
data.anv: यस्य whose, अङ्गम् body, महार्हेण by highly valuable, चन्दनेन with sandal paste, उपसेवितम्  smeared, तस्य his, आर्यस्य esteemed brother's, इदम् अङ्गम् this body, मलेन with dirt, कथम् how, सेव्यते is being served?
data.md: How is the person of that one whose body used to be daubed with costly sandal, covered with dust.

data.v: मन्निमित्तमिदं दुःखं प्राप्तो रामः सुखोचितः । धिग्जीवितं नृशंसस्य मम लोकविगर्हितम् ।।
data.es: It is on my account that Rama who was accustomed to all comforts has fallen into this misfortune. Fie on my life of cruelty which is condemned by the world.
data.anv: सुखोचितः accustomed to comforts, रामः Rama, मन्निमित्तम् on my account, इदं दुःखम् this misfortune, प्राप्तः has obtained, नृशंसस्य of a cruel one, मम my, लोकविगर्हितम् condemned by the world, जीवितम् धिक् fie on my life.
data.md: It is for me that Rama, although deserving of comfort, has come by this misfortune. Wicked that I am, fie upon my life despised of men!

data.v: इत्येवं विलपन्दीनः प्रस्विन्नमुखपङ्कजः । पादावप्राप्य रामस्य पपात भरतो रुदन् ।।
data.es: Thus Bharata lamented in misery and with his lotuslike countenanace sweating before reaching Rama's feet fell down, crying in distress.
data.anv: भरतः Bharata, दीनः miserable, प्रस्विन्नमुखपङ्कजः lotuslike countenance full of sweat, इत्येवम् thus, विलपन् lamenting, रामस्य Rama's, पादौ feet, अप्राप्य before reaching, रुदन् crying in distress, पपात fell down.
data.md: Thus lamenting in woeful guise, with the lotus of his countenance covered with sweat, Bharata coming at Rāma's feet, fell at them bewailing.

data.v: दुःखाभितप्तो भरतो राजपुत्रो महाबलः । उक्त्वार्येति सकृद्दीनं पुनर्नोवाच किंचन ।।
data.es: Mighty prince Bharata, oppressed with grief, could only say, O Arya (venerable one) And in distress could not speak any more.
data.anv: महाबलः mighty, राजपुत्रः prince, भरतः Bharata, दुःखाभितप्तः oppressed with grief, आर्य इति saying o Arya (venerable one), सकृत् once, दीनम् in distress, उक्त्वा having said, पुनः again, किञ्चन anything, नोवाच could not speak.
data.md: And inflamed with grief, the exceedingly powerful prince Bharata, having in distress of spirit uttered, O noble one, again said nothing.

data.v: बाष्पापिहित कण्ठश्च प्रेक्ष्य रामं यशस्विनम् । आर्येत्येवाभिसंक्रुश्य व्याहर्तुं नाशकत्ततः ।।
data.es: As he beheld the glorious Rama, with his throat choken with tears, he cried out, O Arya (venerable one) and thereafter, was unable to speak any more.
data.anv: यशस्विनम् glorious, रामम् Rama, प्रेक्ष्य on seeing, बाष्पाभिहतकण्ठश्च with choked throat, अथ then, आर्येत्येव O Arya, सङ्क्रुश्य crying out, तदा thereafter, व्याहर्तुम् to talk further, नाशकत् was not able.
data.md: And beholding the illustrious Rāma, Bharata with his utterance choked with emotion, exclaimed, O noble one, and was unable to say anything further.

data.v: शत्रुघ्नश्चापि रामस्य ववन्दे चरणौ रुदन् । तावुभौ स समालिङ्ग्य रामोऽप्यश्रूण्यवर्तयत् ।।
data.es: Satrughna also prostrated himself at the feet of tearful Rama who embraced both of them.
data.anv: शत्रुघ्नश्चापि Satrughna too, रुदन् weeping, रामस्य Rama's, चरणौ feet, ववन्दे prostrated, सः रामश्च that Rama also, तौ उभौ the two of them, समालिङ्ग्य having embraced, अश्रूणि  tears, अवर्तयत् shed.

data.v: ततः सुमन्त्रेण गुहेन चैव; समीयतू राजसुतावरण्ये । दिवाकरश्चैव निशाकरश्च; यथाम्बरे शुक्रबृहस्पतिभ्याम् ।।
data.es: Thereafter, princes Rama and Lakshmana joined Sumantra and Guha in the forest like the Sun and the Moon meeting the planets Sukra and Brihaspati in the sky.
data.anv: ततः therafter, अरण्ये in the forest, राजसुतौ the princes (Rama and Lakshmana), अम्बरे in the sky, दिवाकरश्चैव Sun, निशाकरश्च Moon, शुक्रबृहस्पतिभ्याम् with Sukra and Brihaspathi, यथा similarly, सुमन्त्रेण with Sumantra, गुहेन चैव with Guha, समीयतुः met.
data.md: Then Śatrughna also weeping paid homage unto the feet of Rāma. And shedding tears, Rāma embraced them both. Then as in the sky, the Sun and the Moon meet with śukra and Brhaspati, those two princes (Rāma and Laks mana) met with Sumantra and Guha in the forest.

data.v: तान्पार्थिवान्वारणयूथपाभा;न्समागतांस्तत्र महत्यरण्ये । वनौकसस्तेऽपि समीक्ष्य सर्वे;ऽप्यश्रूण्यमुञ्चन्प्रविहाय हर्षम् ।।
data.es: On seeing the princes now assembled in the great forest like mighty leaders of elephant herds, inhabitants of the forest had nothing but tears of grief, not joy, to shed.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकोनशततमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the ninetyninth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: ते सर्वे they all, वनौकसः inhabitants of the forest, तत्र there, महति in great, अरण्ये in the forest, समागतान् united, वारणयूथपाभान् with the effulgence of mighty leaders of elephant herds, तान् पार्थिवान् those kings, समीक्ष्य on seeing, हर्षम् delight, प्रविहाय having forsaken, अश्रूणि tears, अमुञ्चन् shed.
data.md: And beholding those kings resembling leaders of elephant-herds met together in that mighty forest, the dwellers in the woods, resigning their cheerfulness, began to shed tears. forest, the dwellers in the woods, resigning their cheerfulness, began to shed tears.

data.v: आघ्राय रामस्तं मूर्ध्नि परिष्वज्य च राघवः । अङ्के भरतमारोप्य पर्यपृच्छत्समाहितः ।।
data.es: Kaikeyi, gave her illustrious son Bharata a hug, kissed him on his forehead, made him rest on her lap and began her query.
data.anv: राघवः born in the race of Raghu, रामः Rama, तं भरतम् to that Bharata, मूर्ध्नि on the forehead, आघ्राय having kissed, परिष्वज्य च and also embracing, अङ्के on his lap, आरोप्य making him sit, समाहितः with composed mind, पर्यपृच्छत् enquired.

data.v: क्व नु तेऽभूत्पिता तात यदरण्यं त्वमागतः । न हि त्वं जीवतस्तस्य वनमागन्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: O dear, now that you have come to the forest, where is our father king Dasaratha? You ought not come to the forest while he is living.
data.anv: तात O dear, त्वम् you, आरण्यम् to the forest, यत् आगतः now that you have come, ते पिता our father, क्व नु where, अभूत् was he, तस्य he, जीवतः while living, त्वम् you, वनम् to the forest, आगन्तुम् to come, न अर्हसि हि does not behove you.
data.md: Where was your father, child, that you have come to the forest? It certainly behoves you not to come to the forest while he is living.

data.v: चिरस्य बत पश्यामि दूराद्भरतमागतम् । दुष्प्रतीकमरण्येऽस्मिन्किं तात वनमागतः ।।
data.es: You have come a long distance (from Ayodhya) to this forest, O Bharata It is a pity, dear brother, to see you after a long time, so emaciated. What brings you to the forest?
data.anv: अस्मिन् अरण्ये to this forest, दूरात् from a distance, आगतम् have come, दुष्प्रतीकं of emaciated limbs, भरतम् Bharata, चिरस्य after a long time, पश्यामि I see, बत it is a pity, तात dear brother, वनम् to the forest, किम् why, आगतः did you come?
data.md: Ah! I see you come from far after a long time. Why, my child, have you come to this gloomy forest?

data.v: कच्चिद्दशरथो राजा कुशली सत्यसंगरः । राजसूयाश्वमेधानामाहर्ता धर्मनिश्चयः ।।
data.es: I trust king Dasaratha, who is true to his promise, a performer of Rajasuya and Ashwamedha sacrifices and a firm adherent of righteousness is in good health.
data.anv: सत्यसंङ्गरः who is true to his promise, राजसूयाश्वमेधानाम् Rajasuya and Ashwamedha sacrifices, आहर्ता performer, धर्मनिश्चयः firm adherent of righteousness, राजा दशरथः king Dasaratha, कच्चित् कुशली I trust he is in good health.
data.md: Is that truthful one, that performer of Rajasüya and Aśvamedha, ever devoted to righteousness, king Dasaratha, well?

data.v: स कच्चिद्ब्राह्मणो विद्वान्धर्मनित्यो महाद्युतिः । इक्ष्वाकूणामुपाध्यायो यथावत्तात पूज्यते ।।
data.es: O dear child I trust, the family preceptor of the Ikshvakus, Vasistha, the brahmin (versed in the Vedas), who is learned, ever fixed in virtues and effulgent is being honoured as usual.
data.anv: तात dear child, ब्राह्मणः brahmin (versed in the Vedas), विद्वान् learned, धर्मनित्यः ever fixed in virtues, महाद्युतिः effulgent, सः that, इक्ष्वाकूणाम् Ikshvaku's, उपाध्यायः preceptor, यथावत् as usual, पूज्यते कच्चित् I trust he is being honoured.
data.md: My child, is that exceedingly effulgent and learned Brāhmaṇa ever steady in morality, the priest of the Iksvākus, duly honoured?

data.v: तात कच्चिच्च कौसल्या सुमित्रा च प्रजावती । सुखिनी कच्चिदार्या च देवी नन्दति कैकयी ।।
data.es: Dear child I trust, Kausalya and Sumitra, mothers of an excellent progeny are happy. I trust, the noble queen Kaikeyi is happy too.
data.anv: तात dear child, सा कौसल्या that Kausalya, सुखिनी कच्चित् trust she is happy, प्रजावती mother of excellent progeny, सुमित्रा च Sumitra too, आर्या noble, देवी queen, कैकयी Kaikeyi, नन्दति कच्चित् I trust she is delightful.
data.md: And, my child, are Kausalyā, and Sumitrā having a son, in happiness? And is the noble Kaikeyi in spirits?

data.v: कच्चिद्विनय संपन्नः कुलपुत्रो बहुश्रुतः । अनसूयुरनुद्रष्टा सत्कृतस्ते पुरोहितः ।।
data.es: I trust, you continue to honour the family priest (Suyajna, son of Vasistha) who is endowed with modesty, born of high family, conversant in scriptures, free from envy and who can give you directions with regard to your duties.
data.anv: विनयसम्पन्नः one who is endowed with modesty, कुलपुत्रः born of high family, बहुश्रुतः conversant in scriptures, अनसूयुः free from envy, अनुद्रष्टा one who can give directions, पुरोहितः priest, ते to (by) you, सत्कृतः कच्चित् I trust, you honour.
data.md: And is that one, sprung from a mighty line, humble and versed in various lore, your priest, who performs every ceremony, who bears no ill will, and whose gaze is ever fixed upon our welfare, honoured?

data.v: कच्चिदग्निषु ते युक्तो विधिज्ञो मतिमानृजुः । हुतं च होष्यमाणं च काले वेदयते सदा ।।
data.es: I trust, the sagacious priest who knows ritual precepts, who is upright and is employed to take care of your sacred fires, informs you always regarding what was offered and what is to be offered as oblation at appropriate time.
data.anv: ते your, अग्निषु sacred fires, युक्तः employed, विधिज्ञः knower of ritual precepts, मतिमान्  sagacious, ऋजुः upright, सदा always, हुतं च what was offered as oblation, होष्यमाणं च what is going to be offered as oblation, काले at an appropriate time, वेदयते कच्चित् I trust he informs.
data.md: Do intelligent and sincere people cognizant of the rules, look after the sacrificial fire? And do they regularly inform you of the proper seasons for performing the fire-sacrifice?

data.v: इष्वस्त्रवरसंपन्नमर्थशास्त्रविशारदम् । सुधन्वानमुपाध्यायं कच्चित्त्वं तात मन्यसे ।।
data.es: I hope you treat with respect Sudhanva who is equipped with the most formidable arrows and other weapons propelled by mantras and a master in the science of statecraft.
data.anv: तात dear child, इष्वस्त्रवरसम्पन्नम् he who is furnished with excellent arrows and other weapons, अर्थशास्त्रविशारदम् master in state craft, उपाध्यायम् teacher, सुधन्वानम् Sudhanva, त्वम् you, मन्यसे कच्चित् I hope you pay respect.
data.md: And do not disregard the preceptor Sudhanvā versed in excellent arms whether inspired with mantras or not, and accomplished in the knowledge of polity?

data.v: कच्चिदात्म समाः शूराः श्रुतवन्तो जितेन्द्रियाः । कुलीनाश्चेङ्गितज्ञाश्च कृतास्ते तात मन्त्रिणः ।।
data.es: I hope, dear brother, you have appointed men who are brave, learned, selfcontrolled, of noble birth and skilled in guessing from hints.
data.anv: तात O dear, आत्मसमाः men equal to you, शूराः brave men, श्रुतवन्तः learned men, जितेन्द्रियाः men with selfcontrol, कुलीनाश्च men of noble birth, इङ्गितज्ञाश्च men skilled in guessing from hints, ते to you, मन्त्रिणः as ministers, कृताः कच्चित् I hope you have appointed.
data.md: And, my child, have you employed as your controlled, well-born, and understanding signs, who are like your own self?

data.v: मन्त्रो विजयमूलं हि राज्ञां भवति राघव । सुसंवृतो मन्त्रधरैरमात्यैः शास्त्रकोविदैः ।।
data.es: O Bharata the wellguarded advice of ministers, learned in scriptures and capable of proper counselling, is the root of victory for kings, specially when the advice is kept in confidence.
data.anv: राघव O Bharata, शास्त्रकोविदैः by men learned in scriptures, मन्त्रधरैः by those who can withhold proper counselling, अमात्यैः by ministers, सुसंवृतः wellguarded, मन्त्रः advice, राज्ञाम् to the king, विजयमूलम् root of victory, भवति हि will become.
data.md: O descendant of Raghu, counsel well kept by clever councillors versed in lore, is the root of victory with kings.

data.v: कच्चिन्निद्रावशं नैषि कच्चित्काले विबुध्यसे । कच्चिंश्चापररात्रिषु चिन्तयस्यर्थनैपुणम् ।।
data.es: I trust you are not under the grip of sleep but wake up at appropriate times, I hope you always think of the means of judicious statecraft during the last part of the night.
data.anv: निद्रावशम् controlled by sleep, नैषीः कच्चित् are you not, I trust, काले at appropriate time, प्रबुध्यसे कच्चित् are awake, I hope, अपररात्रेषु in the early hours, अर्थनैपुणम् about judicious statecraft, चिन्तयसि कच्चित् are you thinking, I trust.
data.md: You have not come under the sway of sleep? and you awake at the proper hour? And do you during the short hours revolve the means of acquiring wealth?

data.v: कच्चिन्मन्त्रयसे नैकः कच्चिन्न बहुभिः सह । कच्चित्ते मन्त्रितो मन्त्रो राष्ट्रं न परिधावति ।।
data.es: I hope you neither decide alone nor discuss with many. I trust a decision once made by you is not leaked in the kingdom.
data.anv: एकः alone, न मन्त्रयसे कच्चित् you are not planning, I hope, बहुभिस्सह with many, न कच्चित्  hope you are not discussing, मन्त्रितः when decided, ते मन्त्रः that decision, राष्ट्रम् about the kingdom, न परिधावति कच्चित् does not run through, I trust.
data.md: And you did not take counsel either with yourself alone, or (on the other hand) with a multiplicity of counsellors? and your counsel does not range the kingdom (i.e. does not take air)?

data.v: कच्चिदर्थं विनिश्चित्य लघुमूलं महोदयम् । क्षिप्रमारभसे कर्तुं न दीर्घयसि राघव ।।
data.es: O Bharata, having determined on an endeavour involving a little effort and yielding great results, I trust you commence to execute it quickly without procrastination?
data.anv: राघव O Bharata, लघुमूलम् with a little effort, महोदयम् yielding great result, अर्थम् an endeavour, विनिश्चित्य having determined, क्षिप्रम् quickly, कर्तुम् to execute, आरभसे कच्चित्  are commencing, न दीर्घयसि are not postponing unduly.
data.md: O descendant of Raghu, having determined upon a course costing small effort but fraught with a mighty result, you set about it sharply and delay not?

data.v: कच्चित्तु सुकृतान्येव कृतरूपाणि वा पुनः । विदुस्ते सर्वकार्याणि न कर्तव्यानि पार्थिवाः ।।
data.es: I trust, other kings come to know of your endeavours only when your endeavours suceed or about to succeed. I hope, efforts intended to be made in future are not revealed to them beforehand.
data.anv: पार्थिवाः other kings, सुकृतान्येव wellaccomplished acts only, पुनः again, कृतरूपाणि वा or almost accomplished, ते your, सर्वकार्याणि all those endeavours, विदुः कच्चित् are informed,  कर्तव्यानि endeavours intended to be performed in future, न are not revealed.
data.md: Do the (auxiliary) kings know only those acts of yours that have been accomplished or those that are well nigh so, and not those that you intend to set yours hand to?

data.v: कच्चिन्न तर्कैर्युक्त्वा वा ये चाप्यपरिकीर्तिताः । त्वया वा तव वामात्यैर्बुध्यते तात मन्त्रितम् ।।
data.es: Dear brother, I hope others are not able to understand your determination or those of your ministers, either by conjecture or by inference or through other means without being revealed either by you or by your ministers.
data.anv: तातः dear, त्वया वा by you, तव your, अमात्यैर्वा or by ministers, मन्त्रितम् determination, तर्कैः  by conjecture, युक्त्या वा or by inference, ये चापि other means, अपरिकीर्तिताः so far not  been revealed, (with those means or by others), कच्चिन्न बुध्यते I hope are not known.
data.md: Do others through inference or appearances come at a knowledge of your counsels, although undivulged to others by yourself or your counsellors; and (do you and your ministers) attain to a knowledge of others' counsels?

data.v: कच्चित्सहस्रान्मूर्खाणामेकमिच्छसि पण्डितम् । पण्डितो ह्यर्थकृच्छ्रेषु कुर्यान्निःश्रेयसं महत् ।।
data.es: I hope by setting aside a thousand fools, you prefer a single wise man. A wise man will be of immense help in difficult situations.
data.anv: मूर्खाणाम् among fools, सहस्रात् in preferance to a thousand, एकम् single, पण्डितम् wise man, इच्चसि कच्चित् I hope are preferring, अर्थकृच्छेषु in difficult situations, पण्डितः a wise man, महत् immense, निश्रेयसम् help, कुर्यात् will render.
data.md: And passing by a thousand dunces, do you set your heart on having a single wise man? In times of pecuniary stress, a wise man stands in excellent stead.

data.v: सहस्राण्यपि मूर्खाणां यद्युपास्ते महीपतिः । अथ वाप्ययुतान्येव नास्ति तेषु सहायता ।।
data.es: Even if the king seeks the assistance from thousands or tens of thousands of fools, they cannot render any help to him.
data.anv: महीपतिः king, मूर्खाणाम् fools, सहस्राणि in thousands, अथवा or else, अयुतान्येव or tens of thousands, उपास्ते यद्यपि even if he seeks assistance, तेषु among them, सहायता help, नास्ति not there.
data.md: And although a king might be surrounded by a thousand or ten thousand fools, yet he can count upon no assistance (at their hands).

data.v: एकोऽप्यमात्यो मेधावी शूरो दक्षो विचक्षणः । राजानं राजमात्रं वा प्रापयेन्महतीं श्रियम् ।।
data.es: A single clearsighted minister who is prudent, brave and skilful can bring about great prosperity to a king or a prince.
data.anv: मेधावी prudent, शूरः brave, दक्षः skilful, विचक्षणः clearsighted man, एकः a single one, अमात्यः अपि even minister, राजानम् the king, राजपुत्रं वा or a prince, श्रियम् prosperity, प्रापयेत् can bring.
data.md: And a single able counsellor, intelligent, heroic, and sagacious, bring great prosperity upon a king or a prince.

data.v: कच्चिन्मुख्या महत्स्वेव मध्यमेषु च मध्यमाः । जघन्याश्च जघन्येषु भृत्याः कर्मसु योजिताः ।।
data.es: I hope you have employed highly competent servants for important tasks, mediocre servants in mediocre tasks and low people in inferior tasks.
data.anv: मुख्याः important, भृत्याः servants, महत्सु in important, कर्मसु एव in tasks, योजिताः कच्चित् have been employed, I hope, मध्यमाः mediocre men, मध्यमेषु to the mediocre tasks, जघन्याः तु low people, जघन्येषु in the lower tasks, योजिता कच्चित् are employed, I hope.
data.md: And, my child, do you employ the best servants upon the best offices, the middling upon middling, and the worst upon the worst?

data.v: अमात्यानुपधातीतान्पितृपैतामहाञ्शुचीन् । श्रेष्ठाञ्श्रेष्ठेषु कच्चित्त्वं नियोजयसि कर्मसु ।।
data.es: I hope you are assigning ministers, who are unyielding to bribery and other temptations, holding positions hereditarily and who are full of integrity and eminence, with superior tasks.
data.anv: उपधातीतान् unyielding to bribery and other temptations, पितृपैतामहान् men who hold hereditary positions, शुचीन् full of integrity, श्रेष्ठान् eminent, अमात्यान् ministers, त्वम् you, श्रेष्ठेषु for superior, कर्मसु for tasks, नियोजयसि कच्चित् I hope you are assigning.
data.md: And did you employ upon the most worthy offices counsellors who are above bribery, who have served your father and grand-father, and who are pure?

data.v: कच्चित्त्वां नावजानन्ति याजकाः पतितं यथा । उग्रप्रतिग्रहीतारं कामयानमिव स्त्रियः ।।
data.es: Just like a performer of sacrifice scorns at an outcaste or a woman scorns at a lustful lover, do the subjects not scorn you for collecting taxes more than what is due?
data.anv: याजकाः performers of sacrifice, उग्रप्रतिग्रहीतारम् accepting unmerited charity, पतितं यथा like an outcaste, स्त्रियः women, कामयानम् इव to a lustful one, त्वाम् you, नावजानन्ति कच्चित् hope they are not insulting you.
data.md: Do the priests scorn you like a fallen one, even as females do those lascivious folks who use force towards the former?

data.v: उपायकुशलं वैद्यं भृत्यसंदूषणे रतम् । शूरमैश्वर्यकामं च यो न हन्ति स वध्यते ।।
data.es: A learned person but skilled in contrivances, a warrior with passion for wealth and a man ever engaged in corrupting the minds of servants must be slain. A king who does not kill them is himself killed in due course.
data.anv: उपायकुशलम् skilled in contrivances, वैद्यम् learned person, शूरम् warrior, ऐश्वर्यकामं च passionate for wealth, भृत्यसंदूषणे in corrupting the minds of servants and making them revolt against their master, रतम् one who is engaged, यः such man, न हन्ति will not kill, सः that man, हन्यते will be killed.
data.md: He that does not slay a physician skilled in ways and means, a servant given to enlisting the sympathies of his fellow-servants against his master, or a hero that covets riches, is slain (by them).

data.v: कच्चिद्धृष्टश्च शूरश्च धृतिमान्मतिमाञ्शुचिः । कुलीनश्चानुरक्तश्च दक्षः सेनापतिः कृतः ।।
data.es: I trust you have appointed a man who is cheerful, brave, sagacious, steadfast, honest, of a good family, loyal and efficient as the army chief.
data.anv: हृष्टश्च cheerful, शूरश्च brave, मतिमान् sagacious,  धृतिमान् steadfast, शुचिः honest, कुलीनश्च born of good family, अनुरक्तश्च also loyal, दक्षः efficient, सेनापतिः chief of army,  कृतः कच्चित् I hope has been appointed.
data.md: And had you chosen for your general one that is confident, is endowed with intelligence and fortitude, sprung in a respectable race, and attached and able?

data.v: बलवन्तश्च कच्चित्ते मुख्या युद्धविशारदाः । दृष्टापदाना विक्रान्तास्त्वया सत्कृत्य मानिताः ।।
data.es: I trust you honour and respect those prominent soldiers who are courageous, powerful, skilled in war and who have proven heroic exploits.
data.anv: बलवन्तः powerful, युध्दविशारदाः skilled in war, दृष्टापदानाः men with proven  herioc exploits, विक्रान्ताः courageous men, ते मुख्याः those prominent soldiers, त्वया by you, सत्कृत्य having honoured, मानिताः कच्चित् I hope they are respected.
data.md: And do you practically honour your foremost warriors possessed of prowess, who have already given evidence of their manliness?

data.v: कचिद्बलस्य भक्तं च वेतनं च यथोचितम् । संप्राप्तकालं दातव्यं ददासि न विलम्बसे ।।
data.es: I trust you distribute rations and wages to your army in due time without making delay.
data.anv: बलस्य of the army, दातव्यम् to be given, भक्तं च food (rations), यथोचितम् suitable, वेतनं च wages, सम्प्राप्तकालम् in due time, ददासि कच्चित् I trust you are paying, न विलम्बसे not delaying.
data.md: And do you at the proper time grant your soldiers what you should, provision and pay; and do not delay in doing this?

data.v: कालातिक्रमणे ह्येव भक्त वेतनयोर्भृताः । भर्तुः कुप्यन्ति दुष्यन्ति सोऽनर्थः सुमहान्स्मृतः ।।
data.es: It has been mentioned in the scriptures that if provisions and wages are not paid in stipulated time, the dependent attendants will be incensed with their masters and will turn hostile and become corrupt, leading to great calamity.
data.anv: भृताः (dependent) attendants, भक्तवेतनयोः regarding food materials and wages, कालातिक्रमणात् beyond stipulated time, भर्तुः about the masters, कुप्यन्ति will be incensed, दुष्यन्ति will become corrupted, सः that one, सुमहान् very great, अनर्थः calamity, स्मृतः has been stated in the scriptures.
data.md: If the proper time for granting provision and pay be passed, the servants get wroth with their master and tax him; and great is the evil that springs herefrom.

data.v: कच्चित्सर्वेऽनुरक्तास्त्वां कुलपुत्राः प्रधानतः । कच्चित्प्राणांस्तवार्थेषु संत्यजन्ति समाहिताः ।।
data.es: I hope all men of a good family, especially those who belong to our race, are loyal to you and are ready to sacrifice their lives for your cause.
data.anv: सर्वे all men, प्रधानतः especially, कुलपुत्राः men of our family, त्वाम् to you, अनुरक्ताः कच्चित् I hope they are loyal, समाहिताः men with steady mind, तव अर्थेषु for your cause, प्राणान् life, कच्चित् सन्त्यजन्ति I hope are ready to sacrifice.
data.md: And are the principal descendants of our race attached to you; and are they, when enlisted on your side with concentrated minds, ready to lay down their lives?

data.v: कच्चिज्जानपदो विद्वान्दक्षिणः प्रतिभानवान् । यथोक्तवादी दूतस्ते कृतो भरत पण्डितः ।।
data.es: O Bharata, I hope you have chosen as your envoy an expert born in your own country, wellinformed, skilful and quick to understand one who repeats and reports (exactly) what has been told.
data.anv: भरत O Bharata, जानपदः one who is born in your country, विद्वान् wellinformed, दक्षिणः favourable, प्रतिभानवान् one with quick understanding, यथोक्तवादी one who repeats, पण्डितः expert man, ते to (by) you, दूत: as envoy, कृतः कच्चित् I hope has been chosen.
data.md: O Bharata, are your spies persons coming from the provinces, and learned, upright, endowed with presence of mind, representing the truth, and possessed of wisdon?

data.v: कच्चिदष्टादशान्येषु स्वपक्षे दश पञ्च च । त्रिभिस्त्रिभिरविज्ञातैर्वेत्सि तीर्थानि चारकैः ।।
data.es: I hope you collect information (of their secret efforts) intelligently through unrecognisable spies with three of them closely watching each of the eighteen officials (there are eighteen categories of officials in a kingdom) of the enemy's side and fifteen (officials) on your side.
