data.anv: अन्येषु on enemy's side, अष्टादश eighteen, तीर्थानि officials by close watch, स्वपक्षे on your side, दश पञ्च च ten plus five (fifteen), अविज्ञातैः by those unrecognisable by others, त्रिभिः त्रिभिः three for each official, चारकैः spies, वेत्सि कच्चित् I hope you acquire information.
data.md: And do you acquire intelligence of the expedients, eighteen* in respect of others, and fifteen in respect of the own self, by means of every three spies appointed in connection with each of these expedients, men quite ignorant of each other's counsels? *1. Minister. 2. Priest. 3. Heir-apparent. 4. General. 5. Warder. 6. Gatekeeper of the inner-apartment. 7. Jailer. 8. Treasurer. 9. Conveyer of the royal orders. 10. Pleaders. 11. Judges. 12. Members of the council. 13. Distributor of pay and provision to the army. 14. Journeymen. 15. Justice of the peace. 16. Protector of the frontiers of the kingdom. 17. Magistrate. 18. Guards of rivers, hills, and fortresses.

data.v: कच्चिद्व्यपास्तानहितान्प्रतियातांश्च सर्वदा । दुर्बलाननवज्ञाय वर्तसे रिपुसूदन ।।
data.es: O slayer of foes, I hope you are always alert about your foes who were defeated by you and have come back. You should not ignore your enemies thinking they are weak.
data.anv: रिपुसूदन O slayer of foes, व्यपास्तान् defeated, प्रतियातांश्च having gone back, दुर्बलान् weak, अहितान् foes, सर्वदा at all times, अनवज्ञाय without neglecting, वर्तसे कच्चित् I hope you remain alert.
data.md: And do you not contemn those. weak ones that, O destroyer of your. foes, having been expelled, have come again (to you)?

data.v: कच्चिन्न लोकायतिकान्ब्राह्मणांस्तात सेवसे । अनर्थ कुशला ह्येते बालाः पण्डितमानिनः ।।
data.es: Dear brother, I hope you do not serve those brahmins who are atheists, who foolishly think of this world alone and fancy themselves as learned. They only bring disasters.
data.anv: तात O dear child, लौकायतिकान् thinking of this world only, those atheists, ब्राह्मणान्  brahmins, न सेवसे कच्चित् I hope you are not keeping company, पण्डितमानिनः fancying         them as learned, बालाः foolish, एते these people, अनर्थकुशलाः हि adept in bringing disaster indeed.
data.md: And, my child, you did not minister to atheistical Brāhmaṇas? These childish persons proud of their learning are only fit for bringing evils upon others. While there are excellent scriptures, these people of subtle intellects, having acquired a knowledge of dialectics, speak vanities.

data.v: धर्मशास्त्रेषु मुख्येषु विद्यमानेषु दुर्बुधाः । बुद्धिमान्वीक्षिकीं प्राप्य निरर्थं प्रवदन्ति ते ।।
data.es: While principal scriptures do exist, these superficial fellows take resort to the science of logic based on abstract reasoning, and indulge in futile talks.
data.anv: दुर्बुधाः these superficial fellows, मुख्येषु among the principal, धर्मशास्त्रेषु in scriptures, विद्यमानेषु while existing, आन्वीक्षिकीम् relating to the science of logic, बुद्धिम् intelligence, प्राप्य having obtained, निरर्थम् futile, प्रवदन्ति argue.
data.md: And, my child, you did not minister to atheistical Brāhmaṇas? These childish persons proud of their learning are only fit for bringing evils upon others. While there are excellent scriptures, these people of subtle intellects, having acquired a knowledge of dialectics, speak vanities.

data.v: वीरैरध्युषितां पूर्वमस्माकं तात पूर्वकैः । सत्यनामां दृढद्वारां हस्त्यश्वरथसंकुलाम् ।।
ब्राह्मणैः क्षत्रियैर्वैश्यैः स्वकर्मनिरतैः सदा । जितेन्द्रियैर्महोत्साहैर्वृतामात्यैः सहस्रशः ।।
प्रासादैर्विविधाकारैर्वृतां वैद्यजनाकुलाम् । कच्चित्समुदितां स्फीतामयोध्यां परिरक्षसि ।।
कच्चिच्चैत्यशतैर्जुष्टः सुनिविष्टजनाकुलः । देवस्थानैः प्रपाभिश्च तडागैश्चोपशोभितः ।।
प्रहृष्टनरनारीकः समाजोत्सवशोभितः । सुकृष्टसीमा पशुमान्हिंसाभिरभिवर्जितः ।।
अदेवमातृको रम्यः श्वापदैः परिवर्जितः । कच्चिज्जनपदः स्फीतः सुखं वसति राघव ।।
कच्चित्ते दयिताः सर्वे कृषिगोरक्षजीविनः । वार्तायां संश्रितस्तात लोको हि सुखमेधते ।।
data.es: I trust all those men who live on agriculture and cattlerearing are favourable to you. The world's prosperity, dear brother, grows on the profession of cattle rearing.
data.anv: तात dear child, सर्वे all men, कृषिगोरक्षजीविनः those who live on agriculture and cattlerearing, ते to you, दयिता कच्चित् I trust are favourable, वार्तायाम् in profession (of cattle raising), संश्रितः depending on, लोकः world, सुखम् happily, एधते हि grows.
data.md: And do agriculturists and cow herds find favour in your sight? And remaining in their respective vocations, do they enjoy happiness?

data.v: तेषां गुप्तिपरीहारैः कच्चित्ते भरणं कृतम् । रक्ष्या हि राज्ञा धर्मेण सर्वे विषयवासिनः ।।
data.es: I trust you nourish them and also afford portection and prevent adversities. A king must protect all those people living in his country in accordanc with righteousness.
data.anv: गुप्तिपरीहारैः by affording protection and through prevention of adversities, तेषाम् their, भरणम् maintenance, ते to you (by you), कृतं कच्चित् has been done, I hope, राज्ञा by the king, विषयवासिनः those living in the country, सर्वे all, धर्मेण with righteousness, रक्ष्याः हि are  required to be protected.
data.md: And do you maintain them by securing to them what they wish for and removing from them what they wish away? All the dwellers in his dominions should be protected by the king.

data.v: कच्चित्स्त्रियः सान्त्वयसि कच्चित्ताश्च सुरक्षिताः । कच्चिन्न श्रद्दधास्यासां कच्चिद्गुह्यं न भाषसे ।।
data.es: I trust, you keep the women pacified and wellprotected, you do not believe their words and do not divulge any secrets to them.
data.anv: स्त्रियः women, सान्त्वयसि कच्चित् I hope you are pacifying, ताः they, ते to (by) you, सुरक्षिताः कच्चित् I trust they are  guarded well, आसाम् words of the women, न श्रद्धास्यासां कच्चित् I trust you believe not, गुह्यम् secret, न भाषसे कच्चित् I trust you do not divulge.
data.md: And do you conciliate the females; and are they well protected by you? And do you not regard them; and do you not open to them your mind?

data.v: कच्चिन्नागवनं गुप्तं कुञ्जराणां च तृप्यसि । कच्चिद्दर्शयसे नित्यं मनुष्याणां विभूषितम् । उत्थायोत्थाय पूर्वाह्णे राजपुत्रो महापथे ।।
data.es: O prince, I trust, you rise early daily and present yourself welladomed to the people on the thoroughfare.
data.anv: राजपुत्र O prince नित्यम् daily, पूर्वाह्णे early in the morning, उत्थायोत्थाय rising early, महापथे on the thoroughfare, मानुष्याणाम् to the people, विभूषितम् welladorned, दर्शयसे कच्चित् I trust you are presenting yourself.
data.md: And do you show yourself daily in the court, well robed? And rising in the morning, do you show yourself in the high-ways?

data.v: कच्चित्सर्वाणि दुर्गाणि धनधान्यायुधोदकैः । यन्त्रैश्च परिपूर्णानि तथा शिल्पिधनुर्धरैः ।।
data.es: Hope all the forts are adequately provided with wealth, foodgrains, weapons and water, with machines of war and craftsmen and archers.
data.anv: सर्वाणि all, दुर्गाणि the forts, धनधान्यायुधोदकैः with wealth, grains, weapons and water, यन्त्रैश्च with ammunitions or machines of war, तथा similarly, शिल्पिधनुर्धरैः with craftsmen and archers, परिपूर्णानि कच्चित् are adequately provided, I trust.
data.md: Are all the forts furnished with wealth, corn, arms water, machines, artisans, and bowmen?

data.v: आयस्ते विपुलः कच्चित्कच्चिदल्पतरो व्ययः । अपात्रेषु न ते कच्चित्कोशो गच्छति राघव ।।
data.es: O Bharata, I trust, your revenues are abundant and expenditure much less. I trust you do not give away your treasure to undeserving persons.
data.anv: राघव O Bharata, ते your, आयः revenues, विपुलः कच्चित् are abundant, I trust, व्ययः expenditure, अल्पतरः कच्चित् is much less, I hope, ते your, कोशः treasury, अपात्रेषु to  undeserving people, न गच्छति कच्चित् does not pass, I trust.
data.md: And are your incomings great and outgoings slender? And, O Raghu's descendant, you do not give away your coffers to the undeserving?

data.v: देवतार्थे च पित्रर्थे ब्राह्मणाभ्यागतेषु च । योधेषु मित्रवर्गेषु कच्चिद्गच्छति ते व्ययः ।।
data.es: I trust, you are spending only on gods, ancestors, brahmins, guests, warriors and hosts of friends.
data.anv: ते your, व्ययः expenditure, देवतार्थे च for the sake of the gods, पित्रर्थे for the sake of ancestors, ब्राह्मणाभ्यागतेषु for brahmins and guests, योधेषु on warriors, मित्रवर्गेषु on hordes of friends, गच्छति कच्चित् is being spent I hope.
data.md: And did you spend your wealth in the interests of the deities, or the pitris, or the Brāhmaṇas who have come to you, or warriors, or friends?

data.v: कच्चिदार्यो विशुद्धात्मा क्षारितश्चोरकर्मणा । अपृष्टः शास्त्रकुशलैर्न लोभाद्बध्यते शुचिः ।।
data.es: I trust a man who is honest, purehearted and venerable, falsely accused of adultery is not slain out of avarice without consulting experts in scriptures.
data.anv: विशुद्धात्मा of purehearted man, आर्यः venerable one, शुचिः honest, अपकर्मणा with  unworthy act, क्षारितः falsely accused of adultery, शास्त्रकुशलैः by those wellversed in scriptures, अपृष्टः without consulting, लोभात् out of avarice, न वध्यते कच्चित् I trust is not slain.
data.md: If any respectable, pure-spirited and clean person happen to be accused by some one of theft or other crimes, do you from covetousness punish him without first having him tried by persons versed in scripture?

data.v: गृहीतश्चैव पृष्टश्च काले दृष्टः सकारणः । कच्चिन्न मुच्यते चोरो धनलोभान्नरर्षभ ।।
data.es: O best among men I trust that a thief, caught redhanded and interrogated and has sufficient proof is not set free, out of greed for money.
data.anv: नरर्षभ O best among men, काले at the time of committing theft, दृष्टः who has been caught redhanded, गृहीतश्चैव one who is arrested, पृष्टश्च one who has been interrogated, सकारणः one who has sufficient evidence, चोरः thief, धनलोभात् out of greed for money, न मुच्यते  कच्चित् I hope is not set free.
data.md: And, O best of men, is a thief, that has been caught, interrogated (as to his guilt), and found with the stolen property on his person, set free (by your men) from motives of gain.

data.v: व्यसने कच्चिदाढ्यस्य दुगतस्य च राघव । अर्थं विरागाः पश्यन्ति तवामात्या बहुश्रुताः ।।
data.es: O Bharata, I trust that your ministers are wellinformed and look into all matters in times of hardship pertaining to whether a man is rich or poor without any bias to either.
data.anv: राघव O Bharata, बहुश्रुताः wellinformed, तव अमात्याः your ministers, आढ्यस्य of a rich man, दुर्गतस्य च to a poorman, व्यसने in times of hardship, अर्थम् any matter, विरागाः impartially, पश्यन्ति कच्चित् I trust they look at impartially.
data.md: And do your counsellors, o descendant of Raghu, accomplished in various lore, uninfluenced by greed, consider the conduct of both the rich and the poor involved in peril?

data.v: यानि मिथ्याभिशस्तानां पतन्त्यस्राणि राघव । तानि पुत्रपशून्घ्नन्ति प्रीत्यर्थमनुशासतः ।।
data.es: O Bharata, the tears falling from the eyes of persons, who are falsely accused and punished for the pleasure of the king will destroy his progeny and cattle as well.
data.anv: राघव Bharata, मिथ्याभिशस्तानाम् of those who are falsely accused, यानि अश्रूणि those tears, पतन्ति fall, तानि they, प्रीत्यर्थम् for the sake of pleasure, अनुशासतः one who commands,  पुत्रान्पशून् his sons and cattle, घ्नन्ति they will destroy.
data.md: O son of the Raghu race, the tears of those who have been falsely charged with any offence, (and who have failed to obtain justice), dropping, destroy the sons as well as the beasts of the ruler that minds his own comfort only.

data.v: कच्चिद्वृधांश्च बालांश्च वैद्यमुख्यांश्च राघव । दानेन मनसा वाचा त्रिभिरेतैर्बुभूषसे ।।
data.es: O Bharata, I trust you wish to thrive by treating the old, children and foremost of learned people with the three expedients namely gifts, affection and kind words.
data.anv: राघव Bharata, वृद्धांश्च the old, बालांश्च the children, वैद्यमुख्यांश्च foremost of learned people, दानेन with gifts, मनसा with affection, वाचा with kind words, एतैः these, त्रिभिः with  three,  बुभूषसे कच्चित् I trust you thrive.
data.md: And do you with these three, gifts, mind and word, try to win over aged people, boys, physicians, and the principal ones?

data.v: कच्चिद्गुरूंश्च वृद्धांश्च तापसान्देवतातिथीन् । चैत्यांश्च सर्वान्सिद्धार्थान्ब्राह्मणांश्च नमस्यसि ।।
data.es: I trust you pay homage to the preceptors, the aged ones, ascetics, gods and guests, to shrines and to accomplished brahmins.
data.anv: गुरूंश्च prceptors, वृद्धांश्च the old, तापसान् the ascetics, देवतातिथीन् gods and guests, चैत्यांश्च shrines, सिध्दार्थान् acomplished men, ब्राह्मणांश्च brahmins, सर्वान् all, नमस्यसि कच्चित् I trust you are paying homage.
data.md: And do you salute spiritual preceptors, aged persons, ascetics, gods, guests, Caityas, emancipated one, and Brāhmaṇās?

data.v: कच्चिदर्थेन वा धर्मं धर्मं धर्मेण वा पुनः । उभौ वा प्रीतिलोभेन कामेन न विबाधसे ।।
data.es: I trust, righteousness for the sake of prosperity or prosperity for the sake of righteousness or both for the sake of sensual pleasure are not thwarted by you.
data.anv: अर्थेन with prosperity, धर्मं वा or righteousness, धर्मेण with righteousness, अर्थं वा prosperity, पुनः again, प्रीतिलोभेन longing for pleasure, कामेन with desire for sensual enjoyment, उभौ both, न बाधसे कच्चित् I trust you are not thwarting.
data.md: And you do not oppose righteousness by interest, or interest by virtue, or both by desire, intent on gratifying the senses?

data.v: कच्चिदर्थं च धर्मं च कामं च जयतां वर । विभज्य काले कालज्ञ सर्वान्भरत सेवसे ।।
data.es: O Bharata, the best among the victorious, conversant with timely actions and a bestower of boons you are the best of men. I trust, you allocate adequate time for attending to all the three expedients of life like dharma, artha and kama.
data.anv: जयताम् among the victorious, वर best, कालज्ञ one having the knowledge of time, वरद granter of boons (best of men), धर्मंच righteousness, कामंच legitimate pleasure, सर्वान् all of them, काले proper time, विभज्य dividing time for each, सेवसे कच्चित् I trust you are attending.
data.md: And, O foremost of conquerors, do you, O you cognisant of time, in season resorting to interest, desire, and virtue respectively, attain them, O bestower of boons?

data.v: कच्चित्ते ब्राह्मणाः शर्म सर्वशास्त्रार्थकोविदः । आशंसन्ते महाप्राज्ञ पौरजानपदैः सह ।।
data.es: O highly sagacious Bharata, those brahmins who can comprehend the meaning of all scriptures along with the inhabitants of the city and country, I trust, are seeking your happiness.
data.anv: महाप्राज्ञ O highly sagacious one, सर्वशास्त्रार्थ कोविदाः those who can comprehend the meaning of all scriptures, ब्राह्मणाः brahmins, पौरजानपदैस्सह along with the inhabitants of the city and country too, ते your, शर्म happiness, आशंसन्ते कच्चित् I trust they are seeking.
data.md: And do Brāhmaṇas versed in all religious lore and knowing interest, together with the citizens and the inhabitants of the provinces wish for your happiness, O highly wise one?

data.v: नास्तिक्यमनृतं क्रोधं प्रमादं दीर्घसूत्रताम् । अदर्शनं ज्ञानवतामालस्यं पञ्चवृत्तिताम् ।।
एकचिन्तनमर्थानामनर्थज्ञैश्च मन्त्रणम् । निश्चितानामनारम्भं मन्त्रस्यापरिलक्षणम् ।।
मङ्गलस्याप्रयोगं च प्रत्युत्थानं च सर्वशः । कच्चित्त्वं वर्जयस्येतान्राजदोषांश्चतुर्दश ।।
कच्चित्स्वादुकृतं भोज्यमेको नाश्नासि राघव । कच्चिदाशंसमानेभ्यो मित्रेभ्यः संप्रयच्छसि ।।
data.es: O Bharata, I trust you do not partake delicious food all by yourself, and you share it with your friends when they want it.
data.anv: राघव Bharata, स्वादुकृतम् prepared deliciously, भोज्यम् food, एकः alone, नाश्नासि कच्चित् I  trust you are not partaking, अशंसमानेभ्यः to those who desire them, मित्रेभ्यः to friends, सम्प्रयच्छसि कच्चित् I trust you are giving it.
data.md: And, O son of Raghu, you do not alone partake of sapid meats yourself alone? And do you share them with those friends who expect it?

data.v: रामस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा भरतः प्रत्युवाच ह । किं मे धर्माद्विहीनस्य राजधर्मः करिष्यति ।।
data.es: Rama, ever devoted to the wellbeing of every one, heard Bharadwaja and replied to him with these auspicious words:
data.anv: रामस्य Rama's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा on listening, भरतः Bharata, प्रत्युवाच ह replied, धर्मात् from righteousness, विहीनस्य devoid of, मे to me, राजधर्मः royal duties, किं करिष्यति of what use  to me.
data.md: Hearing Rāma's words, Bharata answered, Deprived of the kingdom in consequence of my posteriority in point of birth, what does regard for morality avail me?

data.v: शाश्वतोऽयं सदा धर्मः स्थितोऽस्मासु नरर्षभ । ज्येष्ठ पुत्रे स्थिते राजन्न कनीयान्भवेन्नृपः ।।
data.es: O best of men there is an ancient tradition in our race that the younger son cannot become king when the eldest is there.
data.anv: नरर्षभ best of men, अयम् this one, शाश्वतः ancient, धर्मः righteousness, अस्मासु in our race, सदा always, स्थितः exists, राजन् O king, ज्येष्ठपुत्रे the eldest son, स्थिते is there, कनीयान् younger one, नृपः king, न भवेत् can never become.
data.md: O best of men, even this morality has ever been established with reference to us, viz., that the eldest son of the king existing, a younger one cannot be the king.

data.v: स समृद्धां मया सार्धमयोध्यां गच्छ राघव । अभिषेचय चात्मानं कुलस्यास्य भवाय नः ।।
data.es: Therefore, O scion of the Raghu race, return along with me to prosperous Ayodhya and for the good of our race get your self coronated.
data.anv: राघव Rama, सः he, मया सार्धम् with me, समृद्धाम् prosperous, अयोध्याम् to Ayodhya, गच्छ return, नः for us, अस्य कुलस्य for this race, भवाय for the good of, आत्मानम् yourself, अभिषेचय  coronated.
data.md: Do you, therefore, O Rāghava go along with me to the prosperous Ayodhya; and get yourself ir stalled there for the behoof of our race.

data.v: राजानं मानुषं प्राहुर्देवत्वे संमतो मम । यस्य धर्मार्थसहितं वृत्तमाहुरमानुषम् ।।
data.es: Other think the king to be a human, but to me, he is divine since his conduct and the statecraft are superhuman as they are in conformity with righteousness.
data.anv: राजानम् king, मानुषम् to be a man, प्राहुः is said (by the wise), यस्य whose, धर्मार्धसहितम् in conformity with righteousness and state craft, वृत्तम् conduct, अमानुषम् beyond human capacity, आहुः they say, मम my, देवत्वे godly, सम्मतः has been claimed.
data.md: Although a king observing interest and virtue, and who towers above average humanity, has been called a mortal, yet to me he is a very deity.

data.v: केकयस्थे च मयि तु त्वयि चारण्यमाश्रिते । दिवमार्य गतो राजा यायजूकः सतां मतः ।।
data.es: While I was in Kekaya and you took refuge in the forest, venerable king (Dasaratha), who was always engaged in sacrifices and was held in high esteem by the virtuous, ascended to heaven.
data.anv: मयि me, केकयस्थे while I was in Kekaya, त्वयि च when you, अरण्यम् to the forest, आश्रिते having taken refuge, आर्यः revered, यायजूकः ever performing sacrifices, सताम् by the virtuous, मतः esteemed, राजा king, दिवम् to heaven, गतः went.
data.md: While I was in Kekaya and you was in the forest that intelligent monarch honoured of the good, given to celebrating sacrifices, ascended heaven.

data.v: उत्तिष्ठ पुरुषव्याघ्र क्रियतामुदकं पितुः । अहं चायं च शत्रुघ्नः पूर्वमेव कृतोदकौ ।।
data.es: Arise, O best of men and offer libations to our father. I and Satrughna have already done so.
data.anv: पुरुषव्याघ्रः O best of men, उत्तिष्ठ arise, पितुः to father, उदकम् traditional libation of water, क्रियताम् offer, अहं च I also, अयम् this, शत्रुघ्नश्च Satrughna also, पूर्वमेव already, कृतोदकौ  offered libations of water.
data.md: O foremost of men, do you arise, and offer water to the spirit of our sire. Śatrughna and I have ere this offered water to (the departed).

data.v: प्रियेण किल दत्तं हि पितृलोकेषु राघव । अक्षय्यं भवतीत्याहुर्भवांश्चैव पितुः प्रियः ।।
data.es: O son of Raghu's race, it is said that whatever is offered by a dear son becomes eternal in the world of manes. You alone are the beloved son of our father.
data.anv: राघव O Rama, प्रियेण by a dear one, दत्तम् offered, पितृलोकेषु in the world of manes, अक्षय्यम् भवति becomes eternal, इति thus, आहुः खलु people say indeed, भवांश्चैव you alone, पितुः to father, प्रियः is beloved.
data.md: O Rāghava, anything offered to the (manes of the) ancestors by a beloved descendant, conduces to their eternal behoof; and you the favourite of our father.

data.v: तां श्रुत्वा करुणां वाचं पितुर्मरणसंहिताम् । राघवो भरतेनोक्तां बभूव गतचेतनः ।।
data.es: Having heard the words of Bharata regarding the death of his father, Rama became unconscious.
data.anv: राघवः one born in the race of the Raghus (Rama), भरतेन by Bharata, उक्ताम् uttered, पितुः father's, मरणसंहिताम्  union with death, करुणाम् pitiable, तां those, वाचम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, गत चेतनः unconscious, बभूव became.
data.md: Hearing those piteous words uttered by Bharata in connection with the demise of their father, Rāghava was deprived of his senses.

data.v: वाग्वज्रं भरतेनोक्तममनोज्ञं परंतपः । प्रगृह्य बाहू रामो वै पुष्पिताग्रो यथा द्रुमः । वने परशुना कृत्तस्तथा भुवि पपात ह ।।
data.es: On hearing the thunderlike words spoken by Bharata afflicting the mind, like the thunderbolt hurled by Indra (enemy of demons) in a battle, Rama, the scorcher of enemies, stretching forth both his arms, fell down on the ground like a tree with flowering tops severed by an axe in the forest.
data.anv: परन्तपः destroyer of enemies, रामः Rama, आहवे in the battle, दानवारिणा by the enemy of demons (Indra), उत्सृष्टम् hurled, वज्रमिव like thunderbolt, अमनोज्ञम् unpleasant, भरतेन by Bharata, उक्तम् spoken, तम् that, वाग्वज्रम् thunderlike words, बाहू both arms, प्रगृह्य stretching forth, वने in the forest, परशुना by an axe, कृत्तः severed, पुष्पिताग्रः with flowering tops, द्रुमः tree, यथा as, तथा like that, भुवि on the ground, पपात ह fell down.
data.md: On that thunder-bolt of a speech being uttered by Bharata, like to a (real) thunder-bolt hurled in battle by the enemy of the Dānavas (Indra), that subduer of foes, Rāma, stretching his arms, fell down to the earth, like a blossoming tree that has been hewn by an axe.

data.v: तथा हि पतितं रामं जगत्यां जगतीपतिम् । कूलघातपरिश्रान्तं प्रसुप्तमिव कुञ्जरम् ।।
data.es: Those brothers on all sides, with Sita lamenting, sprinkled water on Rama, the great archer and lord of the earth who, afflicted with grief, had fallen down on the ground, and was lying like an elephant exhausted from repeatedly striking a river bank.
data.anv: तथा that way, जगत्याम् on the earth, निपतितम् fallen, जगतीपतिम् lord of the world, कूलघातपरिश्रान्तम् exhausted from striking a river bank, प्रसुप्तम् asleep, कुञ्जरम् इव like an elephant, महेष्वासम् a great archer, शोककर्शितम् afflicted with grief, रामम् Rama, सर्वतः on all sides, वैदेह्या सह along with Sita, ते those, भ्रातरः brothers, रुदन्तः lamenting, सलिलेन with waters, सिषिचुः वै sprinkled.
data.md: Seeing that lord of the world and mighty bowman, Rāma, fallen, like a sleeping elephant fatigued with turning up earth with its tusks, his brothers exercised with sorrow, broke out into lamentations, and along with Videha's daughter began to sprinkle water (on his face).

data.v: भ्रातरस्ते महेष्वासं सर्वतः शोककर्शितम् । रुदन्तः सह वैदेह्या सिषिचुः सलिलेन वै ।।
data.es: Those brothers on all sides, with Sita lamenting, sprinkled water on Rama, the great archer and lord of the earth who, afflicted with grief, had fallen down on the ground, and was lying like an elephant exhausted from repeatedly striking a river bank.
data.anv: तथा that way, जगत्याम् on the earth, निपतितम् fallen, जगतीपतिम् lord of the world, कूलघातपरिश्रान्तम् exhausted from striking a river bank, प्रसुप्तम् asleep, कुञ्जरम् इव like an elephant, महेष्वासम् a great archer, शोककर्शितम् afflicted with grief, रामम् Rama, सर्वतः on all sides, वैदेह्या सह along with Sita, ते those, भ्रातरः brothers, रुदन्तः lamenting, सलिलेन with waters, सिषिचुः वै sprinkled.
data.md: Seeing that lord of the world and mighty bowman, Rāma, fallen, like a sleeping elephant fatigued with turning up earth with its tusks, his brothers exercised with sorrow, broke out into lamentations, and along with Videha's daughter began to sprinkle water (on his face).

data.v: स तु संज्ञां पुनर्लब्ध्वा नेत्राभ्यामास्रमुत्सृजन् । उपाक्रामत काकुत्स्थः कृपणं बहुभाषितुम् ।।
data.es: On regaining consciousness, shedding tears profusely, Rama again started speaking piteously.
data.anv: सः काकुत्स्थ that Rama, पुनः again, संज्ञाम् consciousness, लब्ध्वा regaining, नेत्राभ्याम् from eyes, अस्रम् tears, उत्सृजन् shedding, कृपणम् piteously, बहु excessively, भाषितुम् to speak, उपाक्रामत started.
data.md: Then regaining his consciousness, Kākutstha shedding tears from his eyes, distressfully addressed himself to speech.

data.v: किं नु तस्य मया कार्यं दुर्जातेन महात्मना । यो मृतो मम शोकेन न मया चापि संस्कृतः ।।
data.es: I could not even perform the last rites of that magnanimous one who died of grief on account of me. What use is my life with an unlucky birth?
data.anv: यः that king Dasaratha, मम शोकेन of grief on account of me, मृतः died, मया by me, न संस्कृतश्चापि the last rites could not be performed, तस्य for him, महात्मनः for that  magnanimous one, दूर्जातेन of unlucky birth, मया by me, किं नु कार्यम् of what use?

data.v: अहो भरत सिद्धार्थो येन राजा त्वयानघ । शत्रुघेण च सर्वेषु प्रेतकृत्येषु सत्कृतः ।।
data.es: O irreproachable Bharata, it is gratifying that you and Satrughna are indeed fortunate to have fulfilled your cherished desire since the king was wellhonoured by you with all the obsequial rites.
data.anv: अनघ O irreproachable one, भरत Bharata, येन त्वया by you, शत्रुघ्नेन by Satrughna, राजा king, सर्वेषु in all, प्रेतकृत्येषु in last rites, सत्कृतः wellhonoured, सिद्धार्थः you have fulfilled  your duty, अहो fortunate indeed.
data.md: Ah! Bharata, you, O sinless one, are blessed, since by you as well as by Satrughna have been performed all the funeral rites of the king.

data.v: निष्प्रधानामनेकाग्रं नरेन्द्रेण विनाकृताम् । निवृत्तवनवासोऽपि नायोध्यां गन्तुमुत्सहे ।।
data.es: Even after the completion of my exile I do not wish to return to Ayodhya which is directionless, bereft of its chief, the king.
data.anv: निवृत्तवनवासोऽपि even after completion of the exile, निष्प्रधानाम् bereft of chief, अनेकाग्रम् directionless, नरेन्द्रेण by the king, विनाकृताम् deprived, अयोध्याम् Ayodhya, गन्तुम् to return, न उत्सहे I do not desire.
data.md: To Ayodhyā, bereft of the monarch, having none to preside over her destinies, and many rulers, will I not return even when the term of my abode in the woods has been passed.

data.v: समाप्तवनवासं मामयोध्यायां परंतप । को नु शासिष्यति पुनस्ताते लोकान्तरं गते ।।
data.es: O subduer of enemies, when father has gone to the other world, who will guide me in Ayodhya after I complete my term of exile?
data.anv: परन्तप O subduer of enemies, Bharata, ताते with father, लोकान्तरम् to the other world, गते having gone to, समाप्तवनवासम् on completion the exile, माम् me, पुनः again, अयोध्याम् in Ayodhya, कः who, अनुशासिष्यति guide.
data.md: My father having gone to the other world, who, O subduer of enemies, will again counsel me when, my stay in the forest being over, I shall have returned to Ayodhyā?

data.v: पुरा प्रेक्ष्य सुवृत्तं मां पिता यान्याह सान्त्वयन् । वाक्यानि तानि श्रोष्यामि कुतः कर्णसुखान्यहम् ।।
data.es: On seeing my good conduct our father used to say comforting words to me. Now from whom can I hear such words pleasing to the ears?
data.anv: पुरा in the past, पिता father, माम् me, सुवृत्तम् good conduct, प्रेक्ष्य on seeing, सान्त्वयन्  comforting, यानि वाक्यानि such words, आह used to say, श्रोत्र सुखा pleasant to the ears, तानि those words, कुतः from whom, श्रोष्यामि I can hear.
data.md: And from whom shall I hear those words grateful to the ear, which my father gratifying me used to speak to me when I happened to do something well?

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा स भरतं भार्यामभ्येत्य राघवः । उवाच शोकसंतप्तः पूर्णचन्द्रनिभाननाम् ।।
data.es: Having thus spoken to Bharata, Rama, overwhelmed with grief, approached his wife Sita whose face looked like the full Moon, and said to her.
data.anv: सः राघवः that Rama, भरतम् to Bharata, एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having said, पूर्णचन्द्रनिभाननाम् her face looking like the full Moon, भार्याम् wife, अभ्येत्य having approached, शोकसन्तप्तः  overhelmed with grief, उवाच said.
data.md: Having thus addressed Bharata, Rāghava burning in grief spoke to his wife, with her countenance resembling the full moon, saying.

data.v: सीते मृतस्ते श्वशुरः पित्रा हीनोऽसि लक्ष्मण । भरतो दुःखमाचष्टे स्वर्गतं पृथिवीपतिम् ।।
data.es: O Sita, your fatherinlaw is dead. O Lakshmana, you are deprived of your father. Bharata is relating to me the sad news that king Dasaratha has attained his heavenly abode.
data.anv: सीते O Sita, ते श्वशुरः your fatherinlaw, मृतः is dead, लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, पित्रा father, हीनः असि are deprived of, भरतः Bharata, पृथिवीपतिम् lord of the world, king Dasaratha, स्वर्गतम् as having gone to heaven, दुःखम् sad news, आचष्टे is relating.
data.md: O Sītā, your father-in-law is dead and, O Laks inana, you are fatherless. Bharata has communicated to me that sad intelligence that our father has ascended heaven.

data.v: सान्त्वयित्वा तु तां रामो रुदन्तीं जनकात्मजाम् । उवाच लक्ष्मणं तत्र दुःखितो दुःखितं वचः ।।
data.es: Having consoled Sita, daughter of Janaka, griefstricken Rama said to Lakshmana who was also distressed with grief.
data.anv: रामः Rama, रुदन्तीम् weeping, तां जनकात्मजाम् that Sita, सान्त्वयित्वा having consoled, दुःखितः  overcome with grief, दुःखितम् distressed, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, तत्र then, वचः words, उवाच said.
data.md: Thereupon, pacifying the weeping daughter of Janaka, Rama moved with grief, spoke to the distressed Laksmana, saying.

data.v: आनयेङ्गुदिपिण्याकं चीरमाहर चोत्तरम् । जलक्रियार्थं तातस्य गमिष्यामि महात्मनः ।।
data.es: I shall go and offer libations to my magnanimous father. Go and fetch the dried pulp of ingudi fruit and an upper garment made of bark.
data.anv: इङ्गुदिपिण्याकम् oil cake of Ingudi fruit, आनय bring, उत्तरम् upper, चीरं च bark garment, आहर fetch, महात्मनः of the magnanimous, तातस्य father's, जलक्रियार्थम् to offer libations of water, गमिष्यामि I shall go.
data.md: Do you bring Ingudi fruits as well as a piece of new bark. I will go to perform the watery rites of our high-souled sire.

data.v: सीता पुरस्ताद्व्रजतु त्वमेनामभितो व्रज । अहं पश्चाद्गमिष्यामि गतिर्ह्येषा सुदारुणा ।।
data.es: Let us proceed in this order -- you first, Sita second and I last. This procession in mourning is terrible indeed.
data.anv: सीता Sita, पुरस्तात् in front, व्रजतु let her proceed, एनाम् अभितः ahead of her, त्वम् you, व्रज go, अहम् I, पश्चात् behind, गमिष्यामि shall go, एषा this, गतिः procession in mourning, सुदारुणा हि is terrible indeed.
data.md: Let Sītā go first. do you follow her. I shall go last. Even this is the course of those in mourning.

data.v: ततो नित्यानुगस्तेषां विदितात्मा महामतिः । मृदुर्दान्तश्च शान्तश्च रामे च दृढ भक्तिमान् ।।
data.es: Thereafter, their constant follower Sumantra who was conversant in spiritual knowledge, a highminded person, softnatured, selfcontrolled, tranquilminded and staunchly devoted to Rama consoled him. Holding the hands of the princes, Sumantra helped their descent into the auspicious river Mandakini for taking bath.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, तेषाम् them, नित्यानुगः constant follower, विदितात्मा knowledgeable in spiritual sciences, महामतिः endowed with great intelligence, मृदुः softnatured, दान्तश्च selfcontrolled, शान्तश्च tranquilminded, रामे च in Rama, दृढभक्तिमान् staunchly devoted, सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, तैः नृपसुतैः सार्धम् along with those princes, राघवम् Rama, आश्वास्य having consoled him, आलम्ब्य taking hold of his hand, शिवाम् auspicious, मन्दाकिनीं नदीम् (into) the river Mandakini, अवातारयत् helped their descent.
data.md: Then that magnanimous one, having a knowledge of the soul, mild, graceful, capable of controlling his senses, steady in his regard for Rāma, and ever following him, Sumantra, in company with those sons of the auspicious river, Mandakini.

data.v: सुमन्त्रस्तैर्नृपसुतैः सार्धमाश्वास्य राघवम् । अवातारयदालम्ब्य नदीं मन्दाकिनीं शिवाम् ।।
data.es: Thereafter, their constant follower Sumantra who was conversant in spiritual knowledge, a highminded person, softnatured, selfcontrolled, tranquilminded and staunchly devoted to Rama consoled him. Holding the hands of the princes, Sumantra helped their descent into the auspicious river Mandakini for taking bath.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, तेषाम् them, नित्यानुगः constant follower, विदितात्मा knowledgeable in spiritual sciences, महामतिः endowed with great intelligence, मृदुः softnatured, दान्तश्च selfcontrolled, शान्तश्च tranquilminded, रामे च in Rama, दृढभक्तिमान् staunchly devoted,  सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, तैः नृपसुतैः सार्धम् along with those princes, राघवम् Rama, आश्वास्य having consoled him, आलम्ब्य taking hold of his hand, शिवाम् auspicious, मन्दाकिनीं नदीम् (into) the river Mandakini, अवातारयत् helped their descent.
data.md: Then that magnanimous one, having a knowledge of the soul, mild, graceful, capable of controlling his senses, steady in his regard for Rāma, and ever following him, Sumantra, in company with those sons of the auspicious river, Mandakini.

data.v: ते सुतीर्थां ततः कृच्छ्रादुपागम्य यशस्विनः । नदीं मन्दाकिनीं रम्यां सदा पुष्पितकाननाम् ।।
data.es: The illustrious brothers approached with great difficulty the swiftflowing and enchanting river Mandakini which had convenient descent and endowed with forests always in bloom. They descended at an auspicious place that was not slushy and offered libations of water saying 'O father, let these offerings be yours'.
data.anv: ततः then, यशस्विनः illustrious, ते they, सुतीर्थां of convenient descent, रम्याम् enchanting, सदापुष्पितकाननाम् with forests always in blossom, शीघ्रस्रोतसम् swiftly flowing, मन्दाकिनीं नदीम् river Mandakini, कृच्छ्रात् with great difficulty, उपागम्य having approached, अकर्दमम् at a place that is not slushy, शिवम् auspicious, तीर्थम् descent, आसाद्य having reached, तात O father, एतत् these, ते to you, भवतु let this be, इति thus, राज्ञे for the king, उदकम् waters, सिषिचुः sprinkled. (offered libation).
data.md: Then those illustrious ones, having in distress arrived at the river Mandākini, Mandākini, having convenient descents, charming, ever furnished with blossomag woods, and of rapid currents; and approached it descents, goodly and void of mud, offered water to the monarch, uttering, “May this be so!"

data.v: शीघ्रस्रोतसमासाद्य तीर्थं शिवमकर्दमम् । सिषिचुस्तूदकं राज्ञे तत एतद्भवत्विति ।।
data.es: The illustrious brothers approached with great difficulty the swiftflowing and enchanting river Mandakini which had convenient descent and endowed with forests always in bloom. They descended at an auspicious place that was not slushy and offered libations of water saying 'O father, let these offerings be yours'.
data.anv: ततः then, यशस्विनः illustrious, ते they, सुतीर्थां of convenient descent, रम्याम् enchanting, सदापुष्पितकाननाम् with forests always in blossom, शीघ्रस्रोतसम् swiftly flowing, मन्दाकिनीं नदीम् river Mandakini, कृच्छ्रात् with great difficulty, उपागम्य having approached, अकर्दमम् at a place that is not slushy, शिवम् auspicious, तीर्थम् descent, आसाद्य having reached, तात O father, एतत् these, ते to you, भवतु let this be, इति thus, राज्ञे for the king, उदकम् waters, सिषिचुः sprinkled. (offered libation).
data.md: Then those illustrious ones, having in distress arrived at the river Mandākini, Mandākini, having convenient descents, charming, ever furnished with blossomag woods, and of rapid currents; and approached it descents, goodly and void of mud, offered water to the monarch, uttering, “May this be so!"

data.v: प्रगृह्य च महीपालो जलपूरितमञ्जलिम् । दिशं याम्यामभिमुखो रुदन्वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Rama, the ruler of the earth, held water with both palms cupped and, facing the south, the direction of Yama (the god of death) said these words, sobbing:
data.anv: महीपालः ruler of the earth, जलपूरितम् filled with water, अञ्जलिम् both palms cupped, प्रगृह्य holding, याम्यां दिशम् relating to direction of Yama, the southern direction, अभिमुखः facing, रुदन् with sobs, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: The protector of the earth (Rama), holding water with his joined hands, facing the south, said weeping, “O foremost of monarchs, may this clear water knowing no deterioration, reach you, who have gone to the world of the ancestral manes.!"

data.v: एतत्ते राजशार्दूल विमलं तोयमक्षयम् । पितृलोकगतस्याद्य मद्दत्तमुपतिष्ठतु ।।
data.es: 'O best of kings, you are gone to the world of the manes, and let this inexhaustible libation of pure water reach you'.
data.anv: राजशार्दूल O best of kings, पितृलोकगतस्य one who has attained the world of the ancestors, ते to you, अद्य now, मद्दत्तम् offered by me, एतत् this, विमलम् pure, तोयम् water, अक्षयम्  inexhaustible, उपतिष्ठतु let it reach you.
data.md: The protector of the earth (Rama), holding water with his joined hands, facing the south, said weeping, “O foremost of monarchs, may this clear water knowing no deterioration, reach you, who have gone to the world of the ancestral manes.!"

data.v: ततो मन्दाकिनी तीरात्प्रत्युत्तीर्य स राघवः । पितुश्चकार तेजस्वी निवापं भ्रातृभिः सह ।।
data.es: Then, the powerful scion of the Raghu race reached bank, from the bathing spot of the river Mandakini along with his brothers and offered pinda (an offering of rice flour to the departed) to his late lamented father.
data.anv: ततः then, तेजस्वी powerful, राघवः scion of the Raghu race (Rama), मन्दाकिनीतीरात् from the bank the river Mandakini, प्रत्युत्तीर्य climbing up, भ्रातृभि: सह with his brothers, पितुः for the departed father, निवापम् offerings of pinda ( balls of rice or flour), चकार made.
data.md: Then drawing nigh to the marge of the Mandākinī, the energetic Rāghava along with his brothers, offered the Pinda to his father.

data.v: ऐङ्गुदं बदरीमिश्रं पिण्याकं दर्भसंस्तरे । न्यस्य रामः सुदुःखार्तो रुदन्वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Placing the balls of ingudi pulp mixed with badari fruit on a spread of darbha grass, Rama, was overcome with grief and weeping, said:
data.anv: सः रामः that Rama, बदरीमिश्रम् mixed with badari fruits, ऐङ्गुदम् pertaining to the ingudi tree, पिण्याकम् pulp made into balls, दर्भसंस्तरे on a spread of darbha grass, न्यस्य after placing, दुःखार्तः overcome with distress, रुदन् weeping, वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: And placing the Ingudi Pinda mixed with jujube on a bed of darbha, Rāma crying in distress, said.

data.v: इदं भुङ्क्ष्व महाराजप्रीतो यदशना वयम् । यदन्नः पुरुषो भवति तदन्नास्तस्य देवताः ।।
data.es: O great king, we offer you such food as we partake now. Be pleased to accept it. For, his gods are offered the food a man takes.
data.anv: महाराज O great king, वयम् we, यदशनाः whatever is food, इदम् such food, प्रीतः wellpleased, भुङ्क्ष्व  partake, पुरुषः man, यदन्नः whichever food, भवति takes, तस्य देवताः his gods, तदन्नाः have the same food.
data.md: O mighty monarch! do you well pleased feed on this, which we also live upon. That which is the fare of an individual, is also the fare of his divinities.

data.v: ततस्तेनैव मार्गेण प्रत्युत्तीर्य नदीतटात् । आरुरोह नरव्याघ्रो रम्यसानुं महीधरम् ।।
data.es: Rama, the tiger among men, ascending the riverbank and proceeding on the same path (he had come), climbed the (Chitrakuta) mountain of charming slopes.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, नरव्याघ्रः best among men (Rama), तेन that, मार्गेणैव by the same path itself, नदीतटात् from the river bank, प्रत्युत्तीर्य having ascended, रम्यसानुम् having charming slopes, महीधरम् mountain, आरुरोह climbed.
data.md: Then that forernost of men ascending the bank of the stream by the self-same way, got up on the charming side of the hill. And having arrived at the gate of the cottage of leaves, that lord of the earth held both Bharata and Laksmana with his hands.

data.v: ततः पर्णकुटीद्वारमासाद्य जगतीपतिः । परिजग्राह पाणिभ्यामुभौ भरतलक्ष्मणौ ।।
data.es: Rama, lord of the earth, reached the door of the leafhut and took Bharata and Lakshmana in his arms.
data.anv: ततः then, जगतीपतिः lord of the earth (Rama), पर्णकुटीद्वारम् the door of leafhut, आसाद्य  having reached, बाहुभ्याम् with his arms, भरतलक्ष्मणौ Bharata and Lakshmana, उभौ both, परिजग्राह took hold of.
data.md: Then that forernost of men ascending the bank of the stream by the self-same way, got up on the charming side of the hill. And having arrived at the gate of the cottage of leaves, that lord of the earth held both Bharata and Laksmana with his hands.

data.v: तेषां तु रुदतां शब्दात्प्रतिश्रुत्काभवद्गिरौ । भ्रातॄणां सह वैदेह्या सिंहानां नर्दतामिव ।।
data.es: The mountain echoed with the sound of lamentations of all the brothers along with Sita which resembled the roar of lions.
data.anv: वैदेह्या सह with Sita, रुदताम् of those lamenting people, तेषां भ्रात्रूणाम् all the brothers', शब्दात् with the sound, नर्दताम् roaring, सिंहानामिव like the lions, शब्दात् with sound, गिरौ in the mountain, प्रतिशब्दः अभवत् was echoed.
data.md: And there the hill reverberated at the sounds raised by the brothers wailing along with Vaidehi; like to lions roaring.

data.v: विज्ञाय तुमुलं शब्दं त्रस्ता भरतसैनिकाः । अब्रुवंश्चापि रामेण भरतः संगतो ध्रुवम् । तेषामेव महाञ्शब्दः शोचतां पितरं मृतम् ।।
data.es: They said, 'Bharata must have joined Rama. That loud noise must be their wailing over their deceased father'.
data.anv: भरतः Bharata, रामेण with Rama, सङ्गतः joined, घृवम् this is certain, मृतम् deceased, पितरम् about father, शोचताम् lamenting, तेषामेव their only, महान् loud, शब्दः noise, अब्रुवन् च अपि they said.
data.md: And perceiving the loud uproar of those mighty ones engaged in offering water to their sire, indulging in lamentations, the army of Bharata became agitated. And they said, “For certain Bharata has met with Rāma; and this mighty noise proceeds from them, as they are bitterly mourning their deceased sire.”

data.v: अथ वासान्परित्यज्य तं सर्वेऽभिमुखाः स्वनम् । अप्येक मनसो जग्मुर्यथास्थानं प्रधाविताः ।।
data.es: Then all of them left their camps with one single thought (of seeing Rama) in their minds and ran in the direction from where that sound emanated.
data.anv: सर्वे all of them, अथ thereafter, वासान् their camps, परित्यज्य leaving, तं स्वनम् that sound, अभिमुखाः towards, एकमनसः अपि with only one thought in their minds, यथास्थानम् from their respective places, प्रधाविताः ran, जग्मुः went.
data.md: Thereat leaving aside their vehicles, they with one mind, rushed towards the spot wherefrom proceeded the uproar.

data.v: हयैरन्ये गजैरन्ये रथैरन्ये स्वलंकृतैः । सुकुमारास्तथैवान्ये पद्भिरेव नरा ययुः ।।
data.es: Some rode horses, some, elephants, while others mounted welldecorated chariots, while the young went on foot.
data.anv: अन्ये some, हयैः on horses, अन्ये गजैः some on elephants, सुकुमाराः delicate men, अन्ये others, स्वलङ्कृतैः welldecorated, रथैः on chariots, तथैव similarly, अन्ये other, नराः men, पद्भिरेव on foot, ययुः went.
data.md: And of those that were tender, some went on horses, and some on elephants, and some on ornamented chariots, while others went on foot.

data.v: अचिरप्रोषितं रामं चिरविप्रोषितं यथा । द्रष्टुकामो जनः सर्वो जगाम सहसाश्रमम् ।।
data.es: The whole multitude of people at once rushed towards the hermitage wishing to see Rama as if he had left long ago though he had gone on exile very recently.
data.anv: सर्वः all, जनः people, अचिरप्रोषितम् exiled recently, रामम् Rama, चिरविप्रोषितं यथा as if he had left long ago, द्रष्टुकामः with a desire to see him, सहसा quickly, आश्रमम् towards the hermitage, जगाम went.
data.md: And eager to behold Rāma staying away for a short time though seeming to do so for a long period, all the men at once went to the hermitage.

data.v: भ्रातॄणां त्वरितास्ते तु द्रष्टुकामाः समागमम् । ययुर्बहुविधैर्यानैः खुरनेमिसमाकुलैः ।।
data.es: Eager to see the union of brothers, all those people went by every sort of vehicle filled with the sounds of hooves and wheels.
data.anv: तत्र there, भ्रातृ़णाम् of brothers, समागमम् union of, द्रष्टुकामाः people wishing to see, त्वरिताः hastily, खुरनेमिस्वनाकुलैः filled with the sounds of the hooves and wheels, बहुविधैः by every sort of, यानै: on vehicle, ययुः went.
data.md: And desirous of witnessing the meeting of the brothers (with Rāma), they with all despatch proceeded by means of various vehicles consisting of beasts and cars.

data.v: सा भूमिर्बहुभिर्यानैः खुरनेमिसमाहता । मुमोच तुमुलं शब्दं द्यौरिवाभ्रसमागमे ।।
data.es: The earth crushed by several vehicles, hooves (of horses) and wheels (of chariots) emitted tumultuous sounds like the sky in the gathering stormclouds.
data.anv: बहुभि: by several, यानैः by vehicles, खुरनेमि समाहता crushed with hooves and wheels, सा भूमिः the earth, अभ्रसमागमे at the gathering of stormclouds, द्यौरिव like the sky, तुमुलम् tumultous, शब्दम् sound, मुमोच emitted.
data.md: And the ground trodden by the wheels of innumerable cars, emitted loud sounds, like those emitted by the sky on clouds gathering.

data.v: तेन वित्रासिता नागाः करेणुपरिवारिताः । आवासयन्तो गन्धेन जग्मुरन्यद्वनं ततः ।।
data.es: Frightened by the sound, the elephants followed by their females, spreading all the way the odour of the ichor, moved to other forests.
data.anv: तेन by that (sound), वित्रासिताः frightened, करेणुपरिवारिताः followed by the female elephants, नागाः elephants, गन्धेन with the odour of ichor, आवासयन्तः odorising, ततः from there, अन्यत् वनम् to another forest, जग्मुः went.
data.md: And frightened by the uproar, elephants accompanied by female ones, perfuming all sides (by the fragrance of temporal juice), went to another forest.

data.v: वराहमृगसिंहाश्च महिषाः सर्क्षवानराः । व्याघ्र गोकर्णगवया वित्रेषुः पृषतैः सह ।।
data.es: Hearing that sound, hosts of boars and deer, buffaloes, serpents and apes, tigers, antelopes with ears like the cows', gavayas as well as dappled antelopes were all frightened.
data.anv: वराहवृकसङ्घाश्च with host of boars and wolves, महिषाः buffaloes, सर्पवानराः serpents and apes, व्याघ्रगोकर्णगवयाः tigers, antelopes with ears like cows', gavayas, पृषतैः सह along with spotted deer, वित्रेसुः were frightened.
data.md: And boars, and deer, and lions, and buffaloes, and Srmaras, and tigers, and Gokarnas, Gavayas and Prşatas were stricken with panic.

data.v: रथाङ्गसाह्वा नत्यूहा हंसाः कारण्डवाः प्लवाः । तथा पुंस्कोकिलाः क्रौञ्चा विसंज्ञा भेजिरे दिशः ।।
data.es: Ducks, watercranes, geese, karandavas, cranes, male cuckoos and kraunchas fled senselessly in different directions.
data.anv: रथाङ्गसाह्वाः ducks, नत्यूहा watercranes, हंसाः geese, कारण्डवाः karandavas, प्लवाः cranes, तथा similarly, पुंस्कोकिलाः male cuckoos, क्रौञ्चाः kraunchas, विसंज्ञाः senselessly, दिशः diffrent directions, भेजिरे fled.
data.md: And wild with alarm, Chakravakas, and swans, and Natyuhas, and Plavas, and Karandavas, and male coels, and Kraunchas, fled away in all directions.

data.v: तेन शब्देन वित्रस्तैराकाशं पक्षिभिर्वृतम् । मनुष्यैरावृता भूमिरुभयं प्रबभौ तदा ।।
data.es: The sky was filled with birds frightened by the sound and the earth covered with people. Both looked extremely beautiful.
data.anv: तेन शब्देन by that sound, वित्रस्तैः frightened, पक्षिभिः by birds also, वृतम् filled with, आकाशम् the sky, मनुष्यैः by people, आवृता covered, भूमिः the earth, उभयम् both, तदा प्रबभौ greatly shone.
data.md: And the welkin was enveloped by birds frightened by the noise, as the earth was covered by men, and both the sky and the land then gave out great effulgence.

data.v: तान्नरान्बाष्पपूर्णाक्षान्समीक्ष्याथ सुदुःखितान् । पर्यष्वजत धर्मज्ञः पितृवन्मातृवच्च सः ।।
data.es: Thereafter, beholding those people deeply afflicted, their eyes full of tears, Rama embraced them as if they were his own father and mother.
data.anv: धर्मज्ञः knower of righteousness, सः that Rama, अथ thereafter, बाष्पपूर्णाक्षान् eyes filled with tears, सुदुःखितान् deeply afflicted, तान्नरान् those people, समीक्ष्य having seen, पितृवत् like a father, मातृवच्च like a mother, पर्यष्वजत embraced.
data.md: Seeing those men oppressed with grief with their eyes filled with tears, that one cognizant of virtue like fathers and mothers, embraced those that deserved it.

data.v: स तत्र कांश्चित्परिषस्वजे नरा;न्नराश्च केचित्तु तमभ्यवादयन् । चकार सर्वान्सवयस्यबान्धवा;न्यथार्हमासाद्य तदा नृपात्मजः ।।
data.es: Rama embraced some, while others paid him obeisance. Therafter, he honoured his erstwhile companions and relations in accordance with their status.
data.anv: सः Rama, तत्र there, कांश्चित् some, नरान् men, परिषस्वजे embraced, केचित्तु as for some, नराश्च men, तम् that Rama, अभ्यवादयन् paid obeisance, तदा then, सः that, नृपात्मजः king's son, सर्वान् all of them, आसाद्य having reached, वयस्यबान्धवान् friends and relations, यथार्हम् as deserved, चकार made.
data.md: And he embraced some persons; and some offered him salutations. And the king's son, as each deserved, properly received them along with their friends and equals in age.

data.v: ततः स तेषां रुदतां महात्मनां; भुवं च खं चानुविनादयन्स्वनः । गुहा गिरीणां च दिशश्च संततं; मृदङ्गघोषप्रतिमो विशुश्रुवे ।।
data.es: The weeping and the tumult of those magnanimous people made the earth, sky, mountaincaves and all quarters reverberate incessantly like the beating of drums.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे द्व्युत्तरशततमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the hundred and second sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: तत्र there, रुदताम् weeping, तेषां महात्मनाम् those magnanimous persons, स्वनः that tumult,  भुवं च the earth, खं च the sky, गिरीणाम् of mountains, गुहाश्च caves, दिशश्च the directions, अनुनिनादयन् reverberating, मृदङ्गघोषप्रतिमः like beating of drums, सन्ततम् incessantly, प्रशुश्रुवे was heard.
data.md: And the sounds, produced by those high souled persons lamenting, resounding the earth and the sky, and the mountain-caverns, and all the cardinal points, were heard like peals of Mrdangas. And the sounds, produced by those high souled persons lamenting, resounding the earth and the sky, and the mountain-caverns, and all the cardinal points, were heard like peals of Mrdangas.

data.v: वसिष्ठः पुरतः कृत्वा दारान्दशरथस्य च । अभिचक्राम तं देशं रामदर्शनतर्षितः ।।
data.es: Longing to see Rama, Vasistha, headed by the wives of Dasaratha, set out on foot (where Rama was offering libations).
data.anv: वसिष्ठः Vasistha, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, दारान् wives, पुरतः in front of, कृत्वा having placed,  रामदर्शनतर्षितः longing to see Rama, तं देशम् that place, अभिचक्राम set out on foot.
data.md: Desirous of seeing Rama, Vasistha, taking before him the wives of Dasaratha, proceeded towards the hermitage.

data.v: राजपत्न्यश्च गच्छन्त्यो मन्दं मन्दाकिनीं प्रति । ददृशुस्तत्र तत्तीर्थं रामलक्ष्मणसेवितम् ।।
data.es: The wives of the king while proceeding slowly towards the river Mandakini beheld the bathing place frequented by Rama and Lakshmana.
data.anv: राजपत्न्यश्च king's wives also, मन्दाकिनीं प्रति towards the river Mandakini, मन्दम् slowly, गच्छन्त्यः while proceeding, तत्र there, रामलक्ष्मणसेवितम् frequented by Rama and  Lakshmana, तत् तीर्थम् that bathing place, ददृशुः beheld.
data.md: And as the wives of the king were going slowly by the Mandākinī, they discovered the landing-place which was used by Rāma and Laksmana.

data.v: कौसल्या बाष्पपूर्णेन मुखेन परिशुष्यता । सुमित्रामब्रवीद्दीना याश्चान्या राजयोषितः ।।
data.es: Kausalya, with eyes filled with tears and her face emaciated, addressing Sumitra and the other wives of the king sadly said:
data.anv: कौसल्या Kausalya, बाष्पपूर्णेन filled with tears, परिशुष्यता emaciated, मुखेन with her countenance, दीना in desolation, सुमित्राम् to Sumitra, याः अन्याः the other, राजयोषितः to wives of the king, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Thereupon Kausalyä, with her eyes filled with tears and her countenance rendered pale, observed to the forlorn Sumitra as well as the other wives of the king, sacred like to a first wife, in this forest this is the landing-place of those unfortunate ones of untiring energy, who had been deprived of the kingdom.

data.v: इदं तेषामनाथानां क्लिष्टमक्लिष्ट कर्मणाम् । वने प्राक्केवलं तीर्थं ये ते निर्विषयी कृताः ।।
data.es: This is a sacred place to the east of the forest used by the unfortunate Rama, and Lakshmana of untiring energy and Sita expelled from the country and undergoing suffering.
data.anv: इदम् this one, ये ते those, निर्विषयीकृताः expelled from the country, तेषाम् their, आक्लिष्टकर्मणाम् men performing deeds with untiring energy, अनाथानाम् unfortunate ones, क्लिष्टम् sufferings, प्राक्कलनम् to the east of, वने in the forest, तीर्थम् sacred place.
data.md: Thereupon Kausalyä, with her eyes filled with tears and her countenance rendered pale, observed to the forlorn Sumitra as well as the other wives of the king, sacred like to a first wife, in this forest this is the landing-place of those unfortunate ones of untiring energy, who had been deprived of the kingdom.

data.v: इतः सुमित्रे पुत्रस्ते सदा जलमतन्द्रितः । स्वयं हरति सौमित्रिर्मम पुत्रस्य कारणात् ।।
data.es: O Sumitra, your son Lakshmana, free from laziness, always carries water from here for the sake of my son.
data.anv: सुमित्रे O Sumitra, ते पुत्रः your son, सौमित्रिः Lakshmana, मम पुत्रस्य my son's, कारणात् on account, सदा always, अतन्द्रितः without indolence, इतः from  this place, जलम् water, स्वयम् himself, हरति carries.
data.md: From here, O Sumitrā, does your son, Saumitri, ever vigilant, personally procure water for my son.

data.v: दक्षिणाग्रेषु दर्भेषु सा ददर्श महीतले । पितुरिङ्गुदिपिण्याकं न्यस्तमायतलोचना ।।
data.es: That largeeyed Kausalya beheld the cakes of ingudi pulp placed by Rama for his father on a spread of darbha grass whose blades pointed toward the south.
data.anv: आयतलोचना largeeyed, सा that Kausalya, दक्षिणाग्रेषु pointed towards south, दर्भेषु blades of darbha grass, महीतले on the ground, पितुः father's, न्यस्तम् placed, इङ्गुदिपिण्याकम् cakes of ingudi pulp, ददर्श beheld.
data.md: That lady of expansive eyes happened to see on the earth the Ingudī piņņa, which had been placed by Rāma for his sire on the darbha with their tops pointing south-wards.

data.v: तं भूमौ पितुरार्तेन न्यस्तं रामेण वीक्ष्य सा । उवाच देवी कौसल्या सर्वा दशरथस्त्रियः ।।
data.es: Seeing the pinda (edible offering made to the departed soul) placed on the ground for his father by the distressed Rama, queen Kausalya, addressing all the wives of Dasaratha, said:
data.anv: देवी queen, सा कौसल्या that Kausalya, आर्तेन distressed, रामेण by Rama, पितुः to father, न्यस्तम् placed, तम् that pinda (pindaofferings made to the departed soul), भूमौ on the ground, वीक्ष्य seeing, सर्वाः all, दशरथस्त्रियः to wives of Dasaratha, उवाच said.
data.md: Seeing this, which had been placed on the ground by Rāma disconsolate for his sire, the noble Kausaly, addressed all the wives of Dasaratha.

data.v: इदमिक्ष्वाकुनाथस्य राघवस्य महात्मनः । राघवेण पितुर्दत्तं पश्यतैतद्यथाविधि ।।
data.es: Have darsan of this pinda offered by Rama according to tradition to his magnanimous father, Dasaratha, lord of the Ikshvaku race.
data.anv: राघवेण by Rama, इक्ष्वाकुनाथस्य for the sake of lord of the Ikshvaku race, महात्मनः of the magnanimous, पितुः father, राघवस्य for Dasaratha, यथाविधि according to tradition, दत्तम् given, इदम् this pinda, पश्यत look at.
data.md: Do you behold this that has been duly offered to the high-souled descendant of Raghu, lord of the Ikşvāku race, by Rāghava.

data.v: तस्य देवसमानस्य पार्थिवस्य महात्मनः । नैतदौपयिकं मन्ये भुक्तभोगस्य भोजनम् ।।
data.es: I do not think that this is an appropriate food for that godlike and great lord of the earth who enjoyed all luxury.
data.anv: देवसमानस्य of a man equal to god, भुक्तभोगस्य of one who enjoyed every luxury, महात्मनः of the magnaniouous, तस्य पार्थिवस्य of that lord of the earth, एतत् this, भोजनम् food, औपयिकम् is appropriate, न मन्ये I don't think.
data.md: Do not deem this as fit fare for that magnanimous monarch resembling a celestial, who had enjoyed every luxury (in life).

data.v: चतुरन्तां महीं भुक्त्वा महेन्द्र सदृशो भुवि । कथमिङ्गुदिपिण्याकं स भुङ्क्ते वसुधाधिपः ।।
data.es: How can Indralike Dasaratha, having ruled the earth bounded by four oceans, eat a cake of ingudi pulp?
data.anv: महेन्द्रसदृशः resembling Indra, विभुः king, सः वसुधाधिपः that lord of the earth, चतुरन्ताम् with four corners, महीम् the earth, भुक्त्वा having enjoyed, इङ्गुदिपिण्याकम् the cake of pulp of ingudi, कथम् how, भुक्ते can he eat?
data.md: Having enjoyed this earth bounded by the four seas, how can that. lord of the world, resembling on earth the mighty Indra, feed on this Ingudī pinda?

data.v: अतो दुःखतरं लोके न किंचित्प्रतिभाति मा । यत्र रामः पितुर्दद्यादिङ्गुदीक्षोदमृद्धिमान् ।।
data.es: Rama (who was once) highly prosperous, had to offer the cake of ingudi pulp to his father. Nothing appears more painful to me than this in this world.
data.anv: यत्र at a point, ऋद्धिमान् (formerly) prosperous, रामः Rama, पितुः to father, इङ्गुदिक्षोदम् cake of ingudi nuts, दद्यात् may offer, अतः more than this, लोके in this world, दुःखतरम् more painful, किञ्चित् anything, मा to me, न प्रतिभाति does not appear.
data.md: Nothing appears to me more deplorable in this world than this that the auspicious Rāma has offered an Ingudi cake to his father.

data.v: रामेणेङ्गुदिपिण्याकं पितुर्दत्तं समीक्ष्य मे । कथं दुःखेन हृदयं न स्फोटति सहस्रधा ।।
data.es: Seeing the offering of cake of ingudi pulp by Rama to his father, how is it that my heart does not break into a thousand pieces in sorrow?
data.anv: रामेण by Rama, पितुः to father, दत्तम् offered, इङ्गुदिपिण्याकम् cake of ingudi pulp, समीक्ष्य  on seeing, मे हृदयम् my heart, दुःखेन out of sorrow, सहस्रधा into a thousand pieces, कथम् how, न स्फोटति not breaking?
data.md: Seeing the Ingudi pinda offered by Rāma to his father, why does not my heart break into a thousand shivers?

data.v: एवमार्तां सपत्न्यस्ता जग्मुराश्वास्य तां तदा । ददृशुश्चाश्रमे रामं स्वर्गाच्च्युतमिवामरम् ।।
data.es: The cowives, having thus consoled the distressed Kausalya, went to the hermitage. There they beheld Rama who looked like a god dislodged from heaven.
data.anv: तदा then, ताः those, सपत्न्यः cowives, एवम् in this way, आर्ताम् distressed, ताम् her, आश्वास्य having consoled, जग्मुः went, आश्रमे in the hermitage, स्वर्गच्युतम् fallen from heaven, अमरमिव like a god, रामम् Rama, ददृशुश्च beheld.
data.md: Then those that were co-wives with her, consoled the distressed Kausalyā; and, (entering the asylum), beheld Rāma like an immortal dropped from the celestial regions.

data.v: सर्वभोगैः परित्यक्तं राम संप्रेक्ष्य मातरः । आर्ता मुमुचुरश्रूणि सस्वरं शोककर्शिताः ।।
data.es: Beholding Rama devoid of all luxury, his mothers afflicted with grief, and overcome with sorrow, cried aloud, tears streaming down.
data.anv: शोककर्शिताः emaciated due to  grief, मातरः mothers, सर्वभोगैः with all luxuries, परित्यक्तम्  devoid of, रामम् Rama, सम्प्रेक्ष्य having seen, आर्ताः overcome with sorrow, सस्वरम् in loud voice, अश्रूणि tears, मुमुचुः shed.
data.md: Seeing Rāma, who had been deprived of every comfort, his mothers, overwhelmed with grief and distress, began to shed tears, lamenting.

data.v: तासां रामः समुत्थाय जग्राह चरणाञ्शुभान् । मातॄणां मनुजव्याघ्रः सर्वासां सत्यसंगरः ।।
data.es: Rama, the best among men and true to his promise, rose and touched the auspicious feet of all his mothers (in reverence).
data.anv: मनुजव्याघ्रः best among men, सत्यसङ्गरः true to his promise, रामः Rama, समुत्थाय having risen, सर्वासाम् to all, तासां मात्रूणाम् of those mothers, शुभान् auspicious, चरणान् feet, जग्राह clasped.
data.md: Raising his mothers, that foremost of men, Rāma, true to his promise, took hold of those lotus feet of theirs.

data.v: ताः पाणिभिः सुखस्पर्शैर्मृद्वङ्गुलितलैः शुभैः । प्रममार्जू रजः पृष्ठाद्रामस्यायतलोचनाः ।।
data.es: Those largeeyed queens, their palms with delicate fingers and with auspicious hands with a pleasant touch, wiped the dust from the back of his body.
data.anv: आयतलोचनाः largeeyed ones, ताः they, सुखस्पर्शैः with pleasant touch, मृद्वङ्गुलितलैः with palms having delicate fingers, शुभैः by auspicious, पाणिभिः with hands, रामस्य Rama's, पृष्ठात् from the back of the body, रजः the dust, प्रममार्जुः wiped.
data.md: And those ones furnished with expansive eyes, (on their turn) by means of their fair hands of delicious feed furnished with soft fingers and palms, fell to rubbing the dust off Rāma's back.

data.v: सौमित्रिरपि ताः सर्वा मातॄः संप्रेक्ष्य दुःखितः । अभ्यवादयतासक्तं शनै रामादनन्तरम् ।।
data.es: On seeing his mothers, Lakshmana, too, was overcome with grief and with devotion followed Rama and slowly bowed to them with reverence.
data.anv: सौमित्रिरपि Lakshmana also, सर्वाः all, ताः मात्रृ़ः those mothers, सम्प्रेक्ष्य after seeing, दुःखितः  overcome with grief, रामात् अनन्तरम् following Rama, शनैः slowly, आसक्तम् with devotion, अभ्यवादयत् bowed with reverence.
data.md: After Rāma had done, Sumitrā's son also, seeing all his mothers, with sorrow gently paid his reverence to them with affection.

data.v: यथा रामे तथा तस्मिन्सर्वा ववृतिरे स्त्रियः । वृत्तिं दशरथाज्जाते लक्ष्मणे शुभलक्षणे ।।
data.es: All the queens treated Lakshmana, born of Dasaratha and endowed with auspicious qualities, with the same love as they did to Rama.
data.anv: सर्वाः all, स्त्रियः wives, दशरथात् of Dasaratha, जाते born, शुभलक्षणे possessing auspicious qualities, तस्मिन् लक्ष्मणे in the matter of Lakshmana, रामे यथा just as in the case of Rama, तथा similarly, वृत्तिम् conduct, ववृतिरे treated.
data.md: Thereat, as they had treated Rāma, all the ladies treated that one sprung from Daśaratha, Laksmana, graced with auspicious marks.

data.v: सीतापि चरणांस्तासामुपसंगृह्य दुःखिता । श्वश्रूणामश्रुपूर्णाक्षी सा बभूवाग्रतः स्थिता ।।
data.es: Sita, too, overcome with grief, grasped the feet of her mothersinlaw and stood before them, her eyes full of tears.
data.anv: सा सीतापि that Sita too, दुःखिता overcome with sorrow, तासाम् by those, श्वश्रूणाम् of mothersinlaw, चरणान् feet, उपसङ्गृह्य grasping, अश्रुपूर्णाक्षी eyes suffused with tears, अग्रतः before them, स्थिता बभूव stood.

data.v: तां परिष्वज्य दुःखार्तां माता दुहितरं यथा । वनवासकृशां दीनां कौसल्या वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Like a mother to her daughter, Kausalya embraced the wretched Sita, who was afflicted with sorrow, and emaciated due to her stay in the forest, and said to her:
data.anv: कौसल्या Kausalya, दुःखार्ताम् anguished, वनवासकृशाम् emaciated due to her stay in the forest, दीनाम् poor, ताम् her, माता mother, दुहितरं यथा like a daughter, परिष्वज्य having embraced, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

data.v: विदेहराजस्य सुता स्नुषा दशरथस्य च । रामपत्नी कथं दुःखं संप्राप्ता निर्जने वने ।।
data.es: How is it that Sita, daughter of Janaka, king of Videha, daughterinlaw of Dasaratha and wife of Rama, has to undergo such hardships in the lonely forest.
data.anv: विदेहराजस्य of the king of Videha, सुता daughter, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, स्नुषा daughterinlaw, रामपत्नी Rama's wife, निर्जने in desolation, वने  in the forest, कथम् how, दुःखम्  grief, सम्प्राप्ता had undergone.

data.v: पद्ममातपसंतप्तं परिक्लिष्टमिवोत्पलम् । काञ्चनं रजसा ध्वस्तं क्लिष्टं चन्द्रमिवाम्बुदैः ।।
data.es: O Sita, after looking at your countenance, which is like a lotus, scorched by the sunshine, or like a withered waterlily or gold defiled by dust or the Moon obscured by the clouds, the fire of sorrow is burning my mind. The grief in my mind is like fire kindled from the arani (sacrificial faggots) that consumes its own souree. (On a circular wood piece, a wooden stick is placed and churned to produce fire specially in sacrifices is called arani.)
data.anv: वैदेहि O Sita, आतपसन्तप्तम् scorched by sunshine, पद्मम् इव like lotus, परिक्लिष्टम् withered, उत्पलमिव like waterlily, रजसा by dust, ध्वस्तम् defiled, काञ्चनम् इव like gold, अम्बुदैः with clouds, क्लिष्टम् obscured, चन्द्रम् इव like the Moon, ते मुखम् your countenance, प्रेक्ष्य on seeing, व्यसनारणिसम्भवः kindled from the faggots of calamities, शोकः grief, अग्निः fire, आश्रयमिव like the stick, its refuge, माम् me, मनसि in the mind, भृशम् greatly, दहति burning.

data.v: मुखं ते प्रेक्ष्य मां शोको दहत्यग्निरिवाश्रयम् । भृशं मनसि वैदेहि व्यसनारणिसंभवः ।।
data.es: O Sita, after looking at your countenance, which is like a lotus, scorched by the sunshine, or like a withered waterlily or gold defiled by dust or the Moon obscured by the clouds, the fire of sorrow is burning my mind. The grief in my mind is like fire kindled from the arani (sacrificial faggots) that consumes its own souree. (On a circular wood piece, a wooden stick is placed and churned to produce fire specially in sacrifices is called arani.)
data.anv: वैदेहि O Sita, आतपसन्तप्तम् scorched by sunshine, पद्मम् इव like lotus, परिक्लिष्टम् withered, उत्पलमिव like waterlily, रजसा by dust, ध्वस्तम् defiled, काञ्चनम् इव like gold, अम्बुदैः with clouds, क्लिष्टम् obscured, चन्द्रम् इव like the Moon, ते मुखम् your countenance, प्रेक्ष्य on seeing, व्यसनारणिसम्भवः kindled from the faggots of calamities, शोकः grief, अग्निः fire, आश्रयमिव like the stick, its refuge, माम् me, मनसि in the mind, भृशम् greatly, दहति burning.

data.v: ब्रुवन्त्यामेवमार्तायां जनन्यां भरताग्रजः । पादावासाद्य जग्राह वसिष्ठस्य स राघवः ।।
data.es: While Rama's mother was uttering such words in anguish, Rama reached Vasistha and clasped his feet with reverence.
data.anv: आर्तायां while in anguish, जनन्याम् mother, एवम् in this way, ब्रुवन्त्याम् while speaking, भरताग्रजः Bharata's elder brother, राघवः Rama, आसाद्य having approached, वसिष्ठस्य Vasistha, पादौ feet, जग्राह clasped.

data.v: पुरोहितस्याग्निसमस्य तस्य वै; बृहस्पतेरिन्द्र इवामराधिपः । प्रगृह्य पादौ सुसमृद्धतेजसः; सहैव तेनोपविवेश राघवः ।।
data.es: Rama touched the feet of the family priest Vasistha, a man equivalent to effulgent fire like Indra, the lord of the gods, does to Brihaspati and sat down along with him.
data.anv: तदा then, राघवः Rama, अग्निसमस्य of a man equivalent to fire, सुसमृद्ध तेजसः of exceeding brilliance, पुरोहितस्य family priest's, पादौ feet, अमराधिपः king of the gods, इन्द्रः Indra, बृहस्पतेरिव like Brihaspati's feet, प्रगृह्य clasping, तेन सहैव with him, उपविवेश sat down.

data.v: ततो जघन्यं सहितैः स मन्त्रिभिः; पुरप्रधानैश्च सहैव सैनिकैः । जनेन धर्मज्ञतमेन धर्मवा;नुपोपविष्टो भरतस्तदाग्रजम् ।।
data.es: After Vasistha and Rama sat down, righteous Bharata sat close to his elder brother. Behind him sat his companions, leading citizens, soldiers and righteous men.
data.anv: तदा then, ततः जघन्यम् then behind them, धर्मवान् righteous, सः भरतः सहितैः along with Bharata, मन्त्रिभिः with counsellors पुरप्रधानैश्च with leading citizens, सैनिकैस्सहैव along with soldiers as well, धर्मज्ञतमेन most knowledgeble one in the ways of righteousness, जनेन by men, अग्रजम् elder brother, Rama, उपोपविष्टः sat down near him.

data.v: उपोपविष्टस्तु तदा स वीर्यवां;स्तपस्विवेषेण समीक्ष्य राघवम् । श्रिया ज्वलन्तं भरतः कृताञ्जलि;र्यथा महेन्द्रः प्रयतः प्रजापतिम् ।।
data.es: Beholding Rama attired like an ascetic but radiant with a majestic glow, the extremely valiant Bharata sat near him with folded palms like the great Indra purified by religious austerities sits near Brahma, the creator.
data.anv: वीर्यवान् extremely powerful, सः that, भरतः Bharata, तपस्विवेषेण dressed as an ascetic, श्रिया with majesty, ज्वलन्तम् radiating, राघवम् Rama, प्रयतः purified by religious austerities, महेन्द्रः great Indra, प्रजापतिं यथा like Brahma, the creator, समीक्ष्य having looked at, कृताञ्जलिः with folded palms, तदा then, उपोपविष्टः तु sat next to him.

data.v: किमेष वाक्यं भरतोऽद्य राघवं; प्रणम्य सत्कृत्य च साधु वक्ष्यति । इतीव तस्यार्यजनस्य तत्त्वतो; बभूव कौतूहलमुत्तमं तदा ।।
data.es: All noble people were truly filled with great curiosity as to what Bharata was going to speak, after paying his homage and honouring Rama.
data.anv: एषः this, भरतः Bharata, अद्य now, राघवम् to Rama, प्रणम्य having paid his homage, सत्कृत्य च also honouring him, साधु of good, किं वाक्यम् what words, वक्ष्यति will speak, इतीव thus as if, तदा of that, तस्य those, आर्यजनस्य of nobility, तत्त्वतः truly, उत्तमम् great, कौतूहलम्   curiosity, बभूव arose.

data.v: स राघवः सत्यधृतिश्च लक्ष्मणो; महानुभावो भरतश्च धार्मिकः । वृताः सुहृद्भिश्च विरेजुरध्वरे; यथा सदस्यैः सहितास्त्रयोऽग्नयः ।।
data.es: Rama who was steadfast in truth, Lakshmana of great dignity and righteous Bharata surrounded by their friends were as resplendent as three sacrificial fires encircled by officiating priests.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे त्य्रुत्तरशततमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the one hundredthird sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: सत्यधृतिः steadfast in truth, सः राघवश्च that Rama, महानुभावः a man of great dignity, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, धार्मिकः practising righteouness, भरतश्च Bharata as well, सुहृद्भिः by their friends, वृताः surrounded by, अध्वरे in the sacrifice, सदस्यैः with the officiating priests  सहिताः along with, त्रयः the three, अग्नयः यथा like fires, विरेजुः were resplendent.

data.v: तं तु रामः समाश्वास्य भ्रातरं गुरुवत्सलम् । लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा प्रष्टुं समुपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: Rama with his brother Lakshmana having consoled Bharata who is ever devoted to elders began to question:
data.anv: भ्रात्रा brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह along with Lakshmana, रामः Rama, गुरुवत्सलम् to one devoted to elders, भ्रातरम् to brother, तम् that Bharata, समाश्वास्य having consoled, प्रष्टुम् to question,  समुपचक्रमे commenced.
data.md: Knowing Bharata as devoted to his superior Răma along with his brother Lakşmaņa, asked him.

data.v: किमेतदिच्छेयमहं श्रोतुं प्रव्याहृतं त्वया । यस्मात्त्वमागतो देशमिमं चीरजटाजिनी ।।
data.es: I want to hear what brought you to this region with your barkrobes, matted locks and antelope skin.
data.anv: त्वम् you, चीरजटाजिन: wearing barkrobes, matted locks and antelope skin, यस्मात् for what reason, इमं देशम् to this region, आगतः have come, एतत् किम् what is it, त्वया by you, प्रव्याहृतम् being related, अहम् I, श्रोतुम् to hear, इच्छेयम् I desire.
data.md: What for is this (visit of yours to the woods)? I wish to hear as clearly related by you the reason why clad in blackdeerskin and wearing matted locks, you, leaving your kingdom, have come to these regions. It behoves you to tell me all this.

data.v: यन्निमित्तमिमं देशं कृष्णाजिनजटाधरः । हित्वा राज्यं प्रविष्टस्त्वं तत्सर्वं वक्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: What made you come to this region, leaving the kingdom and wearing deer skin and matted hair? You should tell me everything.
data.anv: त्वम् you, राज्यम् kingdom, हित्वा leaving, कृष्णाजिनजटाधरः wearing deer skin and matted hair, किन्निमित्तम् for what reason, इमं देशम् this region, प्रविष्टः have entered, तत् that, सर्वम् everything, वक्तुम् to tell, अर्हसि behoves you.
data.md: What for is this (visit of yours to the woods)? I wish to hear as clearly related by you the reason why clad in blackdeerskin and wearing matted locks, you, leaving your kingdom, have come to these regions. It behoves you to tell me all this.

data.v: इत्युक्तः केकयीपुत्रः काकुत्स्थेन महात्मना । प्रगृह्य बलवद्भूयः प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Thus enquired by the magnanimous Rama, Bharata, joining his palms tightly, replied:
data.anv: महात्मना by the magnanimous, काकुत्स्थेन by Rama, इति thus, उक्तः uttered, कैकयीपुत्रः son of Kaikeyi, Bharata, प्राञ्जलिः joining the palms in reverence, भूयः again, बलवत् strongly, प्रगृह्य holding, वाक्यम् this statement, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Thus accosted by the high-souled Kākutstha, Kaikeyi's son, suppressing his grief by a strong effort, with joined hands said.

data.v: आर्यं तातः परित्यज्य कृत्वा कर्म सुदुष्करम् । गतः स्वर्गं महाबाहुः पुत्रशोकाभिपीडितः ।।
data.es: O my revered sire our mighty father, having performed an impossible task of banishing you to the forest, and tortured by grief due to separation from his son, went to heaven.
data.anv: महाबाहुः mightyarmed, तातः father, आर्यं my esteemed brother, परित्यज्य having abandoned, सुदुष्करम् impossible to perform, कर्म task, कृत्वा having done, पुत्रशोकाभिपीडितः tortured by the grief due to separation from his son, स्वर्गम् heaven, गतः went.
data.md: O noble one, forsaking us all, our father possessed of mighty arms, having performed this terrible task, in consequence of being urged by a woman, my mother Kaikeyi, has gone to heaven afflicted with grief on account of his son, O repressor of foes.

data.v: स्त्रिया नियुक्तः कैकेय्या मम मात्रा परंतप । चकार सुमहत्पापमिदमात्मयशोहरम् ।।
data.es: O Rama, tormentor of enemies having been instigated by a woman, my mother Kaikeyi, committed this great sin of destroying his (Dasaratha's) reputation.
data.anv: परन्तप O tormentor of enemies, Rama, मम my, मात्रा mother, स्त्रिया woman, कैकेय्या by Kaikeyi, नियुक्तः instigated, आत्मयशोहरम् destroying his reputation, सुमहत् great, इदं पापम् this sin, चकार commited.
data.md: O noble one, forsaking us all, our father possessed of mighty arms, having performed this terrible task, in consequence of being urged by a woman, my mother Kaikeyi, has gone to heaven afflicted with grief on account of his son, O repressor of foes.

data.v: सा राज्यफलमप्राप्य विधवा शोककर्शिता । पतिष्यति महाघोरे निरये जननी मम ।।
data.es: My mother, formented with grief and with the fruit of the kingdom forfeited, and cursed with widowhood, will fall into the dreadful hell.
data.anv: मम my, जननी mother, सा that lady, राज्यफलम् fruit of kingodm, अप्राप्य without acquiring, विधवा widow, शोककर्शिता formented with grief, महाघोरे dreadful, निरये hell, पतिष्यति will fall.
data.md: And she has committed a signal sin capable of destroying her fame. And without obtaining the kingdom which she had coveted as the fruit of her action, a widow tried with grief, my mother will fall into a terrible hell.

data.v: तस्य मे दासभूतस्य प्रसादं कर्तुमर्हसि । अभिषिञ्चस्व चाद्यैव राज्येन मघवानिव ।।
data.es: It behoves you to grant me a favour. I am like your servant. Now get yourself coronated in the kingdom like Indra.
data.anv: तस्य such, दासभूतस्य servant I am, मे to me, प्रसादम् favour, कर्तुम् to do, अर्हसि behoves you, अद्येव now itself, मघवानिव like Indra, राज्येन in the kingdom, अभिषिञ्चस्व be coronated.
data.md: Now it behoves you to extend your favour to me who have become your slave. Do you this very day get yourself installed in the kingdom, like to Indra himself.

data.v: इमाः प्रकृतयः सर्वा विधवा मातुरश्च याः । त्वत्सकाशमनुप्राप्ताः प्रसादं कर्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: All these subjects and your widowed mothers have come to you. It behoves you to grant them this favour.
data.anv: इमाः these, सर्वाः all, प्रकृतयः subjects, विधवाः widows, मातरश्च those mothers, त्वत्सकाशम्   to your proximity, अनुप्राप्ताः have reached, प्रसादम् favour, कर्तुम् to do, अर्हसि behoves you.
data.md: All these subjects and our widowed mothers have come to you. It behoves you to show your favour to them.

data.v: तदानुपूर्व्या युक्तं च युक्तं चात्मनि मानद । राज्यं प्राप्नुहि धर्मेण सकामान्सुहृदः कुरु ।।
data.es: O bestower of honour by the law of primogeniture and as a worthy successor it is appropriate that you should accept the kingdom righteously and fulfil the desire of your friends.
data.anv: मानद O bestower of honour, तत् for that reason, आनुपूर्व्या by succession, युक्तम् appropriate, आत्मनि in you, युक्तं च is appropriate, राज्यम् kingdom, धर्मेण righteously, प्राप्नुहि you may obtain, सुहृदः friends, सकामान् having fulfilled their desire, कुरु make them.
data.md: You are the first-born; and meet it is that you should get yourself installed, O bestower of honour. Therefore do you receive the kingdom righteously and fulfil the desire of your friends.

data.v: भवत्वविधवा भूमिः समग्रा पतिना त्वया । शशिना विमलेनेव शारदी रजनी यथा ।।
data.es: Like an autumnal night with the immaculate Moon, let this entire earth cease to be a widow by securing you as her lord.
data.anv: समग्रा this entire, भूमिः earth, शारदी relating to autumn, रजनी यथा like night, पतिना as lord, त्वया by you, विमलेन by the immaculate, शशिना इव like the Moon, अविधवा भवतु let it be a widow no more.

data.v: एभिश्च सचिवैः सार्धं शिरसा याचितो मया । भ्रातुः शिष्यस्य दासस्य प्रसादं कर्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: With my head bowed down, I beseech you along with all these ministers to show favour to me who is your brother, disciple and slave.
data.anv: एभिः by these, सचिवैः सार्धम् with ministers, मया by me, शिरसा with head bowed down, याचितः has been besought, भ्रातुः of a brother, शिष्यस्य of a disciple, दासस्य of a slave, प्रसादम् favour, कर्तुम् to do, अर्हसि it behoves you.
data.md: And like the autumnal Night on having the unclouded moon, let the entire Earth cease to be a widow on having you counsellors. It behoves you to show your favour to your brother, disciple, and slave.

data.v: तदिदं शाश्वतं पित्र्यं सर्वं सचिवमण्डलम् । पूजितं पुरुषव्याघ्र नातिक्रमितुमुत्सहे ।।
data.es: O best among men, it does not behove you to transgress the prayers of the whole order of subjects and ministers to assume this hereditary and perpetual order.
data.anv: पुरुषव्याघ्रः O best among men, तत् for that reason, शाश्वतम् eternal, पित्र्यम् hereditary, पूजितम् venerable, सर्वम् entire, इदम् this order, प्रकृतिमण्डलम् the whole order of subjects, अतिक्रमितुम् to transgress, न अर्हति it does not behove you.
data.md: Therefore, O chief of men, you ought not to pass by this honoured band of ancestral ministers, who have always been serving this race.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा महाबाहुः सबाष्पः केकयीसुतः । रामस्य शिरसा पादौ जग्राह भरतः पुनः ।।
data.es: Having said thus, the mightyarmed Bharata, in accordance with tradition, grasped with tearful eyes the feet of Rama again with his head.
data.anv: महाबाहुः mightyarmed, कैकयीसुतः Kaikeyi's son, Bharata, एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having said, सबाष्पः with tearful eyes, रामस्य Rama's, पादौ feet, पुनः again, विधिवत् in accordance with tradition, शिरसा with his head, जग्राह grasped.
data.md: Having said this, with tears flooding his eyes, the mighty-armed son of Kaikeyi, Bharata, again took Rāma's feet on this head.

data.v: तं मत्तमिव मातङ्गं निःश्वसन्तं पुनः पुनः । भ्रातरं भरतं रामः परिष्वज्येदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Rama embraced his brother Bharata who repeatedly heaved sighs and resembled an elephant in rut, and said:
data.anv: रामः Rama, पुनः पुनः repeatedly, निःश्वसन्तम् heaving sighs, मत्तम् in rut, मातङ्गम् इव  resembling an elephant, भ्रातरम् brother, तं भरतम् that Bharata, परिष्वज्य embracing, इदम् this word, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Thereupon Rāma embracing his brother Bharata resembling a mad elephant, and sighing again and again, said.

data.v: कुलीनः सत्त्वसंपन्नस्तेजस्वी चरितव्रतः । राज्यहेतोः कथं पापमाचरेत्त्वद्विधो जनः ।।
data.es: How can a man like you, born of a noble race, endowed with energy, powerful and adherent to vows, commit a sin for the sake of a kingdom?
data.anv: कुलीनः a man of noble birth, सत्वसम्पन्नः endowed with energy, तेजस्वी powerful, चरितव्रतः adherent to one's vows, त्वद्विधः like you, जनः a man, राज्यहेतोः for the sake of kingdom, पापम् sin, कथम् how, आचरेत् will commit?
data.md: Of a high race, possessed of strength, endowed with energy, and vowed to sterling worth of character, how can one like me commit sin for the sake of dominion?

data.v: न दोषं त्वयि पश्यामि सूक्ष्ममप्यरि सूदन । न चापि जननीं बाल्यात्त्वं विगर्हितुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: O destroyer of enemies, I do not find even slightest fault with you. Like a child, it does not behove you to reproach your mother.
data.anv: अरिसूदन O destroyer of enemies, त्वयि in you, सूक्ष्ममपि slightest, दोषम् fault, न पश्यामि I do not find, त्वम् you, बाल्यात् out of childishness, जननीं your mother, विगर्हितुम् to reproach, नार्हसि चापि does not behove you.
data.md: Fault find I none ever so small in you, you destroyer of foes. Nor does it become you from puerility to tax your mother.

data.v: यावत्पितरि धर्मज्ञ गौरवं लोकसत्कृते । तावद्धर्मभृतां श्रेष्ठ जनन्यामपि गौरवम् ।।
data.es: O best among the protectors of righteousness the honour shown to our father who is conversant with the ways of righteousness and much revered by the world ought to be shown towards our mother also.
